reviews.review: MAGNIFICENT. Situated on an island close to the city centre, this was our last destination on our two day tour of St Petersburg. It almost qualified as having saved the best to the end!The large and pedestrianized area included a helicopter landing pad nearby and some interesting monuments but the church was the central attraction and proved to be beautiful and inspiring - from the bells high in the tower to the lovely interior. It is very much a Russian church with spectacular ornaments in brick, tile and mosaics - especially those inside that portayed large biblical scenes and the gorgeous marble floors. Named because of Tsar Alexander being mortally wounded nearby in 1881. It is a must see destination!
Picturesque. Splendid architectural character, interesting and picturesque makes this church a must see for every tourist.
Iconic Site. One of the most Iconic sites to visit in St Petersburg. Absolutely stunning inside and out. A must see.
Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant. Absolutely not to be missed. One of the best sites in St Petersburg. I don't know how many tiles have been used, i don't know the history.......it's fabulous

Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral is so ornate and detailed. Just beautiful. Compared to Saint Basil's it's more detailed and being set next to a canal makes even more breathtaking. I suggested walking the entire perimeter. It's beautiful from so many angles. Make sure to get a picture with its reflection from the waterway. Also, as per my usual suggestion...go within the first hour of sunrise for views without people, vendors, and buses. It will be worth it.

Beautiful Easter Egg. Spent maybe half an hour looking round and through the church. Building is spectacular inside with the mosaics on all the walls. Colours stunning. It's just a very impressive shell as nothing in it but very much worth a look. TIP*** buy tickets at all venues in SPB - NOT ONLINE via TripAdvisor, Expedia etc as you are ripped off via their sites. I paid 1000 roubles online and when swapped my evoucher for our tickets they were only 250 roubles each. I had spotted this when looking at other places so just bought all other tickets at venues and much cheaper. Only downside to SPB is their trying to rip tourists off.
Breathtaking. One of the most amazing places I have ever visited Definitely not to be missed. The mosaic artworks are unbelievable
Beautiful. This church has been beautifully restored .All the mosaics are fabulous .This is weeworth a visit .
Amasing.. just amasing... The best mosaiс church not just in St.Petersburg, but in all Russia. you will stop breathing, seeing this beauty

exterior is the significant experience. Just riding past this on the bus is a magical experience. I was fascinated enough to return, but in truth, it is the totality of the exterior which is the worthwhile experience. Walk around, enjoy the colorfulness of the whole building. You can easily give the interior a miss and miss little. Even the exterior is better enjoyed as a totality, not scrutinized minutely. And, here is two cents more: forget the picture-taking. Everyone else is doing it for you. Simply marvel at the creativity and exuberance. I would not consider this a masterpiece by any means, nor do I find it even beautiful, but it does have an exceptional, rather awe-inspiring quality, well-enhanced by its location. It is so much fun to look at, I think children would be entertained.

Beautiful inside and out. Of all the Russian churches that we visited, this was the most impressive. Great story of how the Czar was defiant in the face of a growing and insisted on spending a fortune on his memorial to his assassinated predecessor.
Assassination of Nicholas II. This was built to mark the spot where Nicholas II was assassinated. Has audio information. Very interesting. Don't miss this off your sight-seeing list.

Colourful both outside and in. The church is colourful enough on the outside but inside it is fantastic, with frescoes everywhere. That also means lots of people and a queue to get in but it is worth it.
impressive. do not miss this church and do get in, it is Worth visiting, with impressive mosaics on every inch of the interior

Highly Recommended. Very impressive to see "live" the symbol of St Petersburg. Such a fantastic place, beautiful to take pictures during the day or at night. I loved it and I couldn't take my eyes off of it.
ODIFICE OF MAGNIFISCENCE. The interior of this monument is equally impressive, with artwork that depicts various biblical scenes, beautifully preserved.

Spectacular. The Church of the Spilled Blood is a short walk off Nevsky Prospekt and a MUST SEE in St. Petersburg. While dating back to only the 1800's the interior of the church, now a museum is spectacular for it's architecture and the artwork contained inside. It is truly a masterpiece!
Dramatic Exterior. The classic domes and its canal-side location make this a prime tourist attraction. Inside is a little on the drab side but heavily decorated with the usual religious themes.

Must see stop. The colors come alive in person...and you will stand in awe of its beauty,. There are lots of tourists trying to get a good shot, and there is a lot of obstruction so be patient...lots of cars going by...but well worth it.

One of my favorite places in Russia. Amazing place inside and outside. The mosaic work is beyond words in beauty. No need for a guide. You can read about the history before going in. I promise you will not be disappointed by the intricate detail and color of the walls, etc.
A must see. A must see and worth seeing with a guide to get a good understanding of everything. Also, October is a great month to visit

What fairytales are made of. My favourite of all Russian architecture- the onion dome! Combined with the spectacular colour scheme, seeing this church was surreal. If it wasn't for the long line and hundreds of tourists to give me a reality check I would've thought I had stepped into a fairytale. And when you think the outside is spectacular the mosaic walls inside is unbelievable. This is the most visited attraction in Saint Petersburg so be sure not to miss it.

Beautiful Exterior . We were here as part of a shore excursion with our Viking Star ocean cruise. Unfortunately there was enough time to go inside. The history and the neighborhood are still worth a visit.

Worth a visit for good photo's. I would recommend a trip to this lovely hotel. Great photo opportunity and right next to the canal. Be careful with your camera and belongings as there are pick pockets in the area.

St Petersburg. Our visits was part of our 2 day Alla Tours Faberge Museum excursion ex Cruise terminal. It's a bit different to some other European churches and worth seeing. Our guide explained its history, etc. Without a guide, or some decent info of some sort, it might be a bit meaningless. Sorry, can't compare to other St Petersburg churches as we saw the Faberge museum (excellent) rather than more churches. Believe this is the best one to see.

Beautiful and historical. Go.. We've seen many churches but this is worth visiting. Our tour guide Alona from Red October knew everything we asked her and, if you go to St. P, this is one of the places you should see.

Beautiful both outside and inside. The church is one of the architectural/touristical highlights in St. Petersburg and was killed on the grounds where Tsar Alexander III was killed with a small chapel built on the actual killing area.Beautiful at day and at night.

Old Potato farm. No one would believe they grew Potatoes after the WW2 inside the church, but it is the truth according to Russians. This is a master piece in lighter colors of shades when compared to St Basil's in Moscow. Easily accessible on foot this is the place the Emperor was stabbed initially but later died in the palace.
Most Amazing Church Ever!!!!. This was my second visit to this church. It is amazing - the entire interior is covered with mosaics, and the exterior is exquisite. It is a must do in St. Petersburg!!

A must for St Petersburg. One of the more popular sites in St Petersburg. Of course a visit without seeing it is like going to Paris and missing the Eiffel Tower. Amazing architecture and full of tourist photo ops.
Worth to see it inside out!. Very unique! Worth to see through it. And spend some time inside and outside of the church.also study the architecture and the history about it.
This is a beautiful place to visit. Beautiful inside this is one of the must sees in ST Petersburg, spend time just marvelling at the exquisite architecture,

Eye Appealing Structure & a History Lesson. This attraction started construction in 1883 completed in 1907. The church grounds is where Tsar Alexander III was fatally wounded. He was mortally wounded on March 1, 1881. By a couple of bombs thrown his way. Severally bleeding he was taken the Winter Palace where he died a few hours later. You will find extremely detailed inside amenities. During WW II when many people in Russia were starving due to the Siege of Leningrad by Nazi German military forces, the church was used as a temporary morgue for those who died in combat and from starvation and illness. The church was heavily damaged during the war. After the war, it was used as a warehouse for vegetables, leading to the sardonic name of 'Saviour of Potatoes". The church contains over 7,500 square meters of mosaics alone. Russian Orthodox is the affiliation.

Reminder of St Basil's Church in Red Square. The Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood was built on the same spot where Emperor Alexander the Second was killed. It is located near the Griboedov canal.The dome of the church resembles that of St Basil’s church in Red Square, Moscow. The domes have many semi-precious stones.The church has a collection of mosaic icons which incorporate Byzantine paintings. There is a large icon of Alexander Nevsky, as well as icons of Mother of God with child. There is a mosaic showing Jesus Christ doing a blessing with his right hand and holding the gospels with his left hand. It is a very nice church and worth visiting.
amazing church. impressive! you can't miss this church if you're here! by day or by night it's always so impressive for us europeans it's something special we are not use to this style

A Bloodless Visit. The church built on the site of the murder of one of the Czars. Typical Russian church, very dark inside, features the area, where the attack took place. The ceilings are beautiful and worth photographing.

Iconic Russian Church. I am not religious nor Russian Orthodox but this is such a cool church from the outside as well as the inside. You don't need much time but worth the few bucks to go inside and check out all the paintings inside.
Colorful Church. It is very beautiful. The location is just the opposite of the Kazan Cathedral. You can visit both of them at the same time.
magnificent - must see. this is as beautiful as St basils cathedral in Moscow, I don't know why we never hear about it ?? don't just drive past, interior is stunning

one of the highlights of the ciry. This incredibly beautiful church is easy to find due to its colorful domes and imposing architecture - located near to the another landmark, the church to St Kazan, as well as the Neva river embankment and the Trinity Bridge - be sure to check the opening hours, when we arrived the hours were from 10h30 to 17h30 (18h00 actually, but after 17h30 if you have not already purchased a ticket you won't enter).I'll leave the historical significance to your local guide, needless to say the church is a major landmark in this gorgeous city, and a must see site. Have a stroll in the adjacent park before going inside. Get there late - 17h00 or so, to avoid the cues and also see it lit after sundown. The unique exterior decorations are also reflected inside, so well worth going in.
Stunning. Thoroughly enjoyed seeing the beautiful mosaics and place that Alexander 11 was murdered. An exquisite sanctuary door and a shrine. A guide books helps to spot the highlights

Rare Russian Architecture in St Petersburg, this church. We found out on our tour that the young city of St Petersburg (Leningrad) was built to western civilisation architecture design on orders of Alexander 1, much to our dismay. Was so looking forward to the onion styled turrets on all the mosques, churches only to find one, "The Church of the Spilt Blood" which most tourists call it, improperly. What a feast for your eyes, amazing is not adequate. The inside just as ornate and jammed full of visual treasures. One forgets that most European cities first had canals to transport merchandise/people and this is no different, the church being built beside/on a canal. Definitely worth a visit and how lucky one gets to wind your way through all the touristy souvenir stalls, different animals being paraded around, owls, ferrets, cockatoos, plus the obligatory stand still person on a box. Not quite a circus, but close to.
Extraordinary Experience. Do not miss this! It is like walking in a comic while at the same time, it is about real Imperalist history and religious devotion.

Great from the outside but beware pickpockets. we stopped for 30 mins on a tour to take photos of this amazing building by the canal side and were warned about pickpockets, but one of our group was distracted by one of the many street sellers and lost her purse from inside her bag. there are people with birds they put on your head or try to show their wares. Stay clear, keep passports separate in zipped or buttoned pockets and handbags under your arm.
Only saw the outside. For some reason not advertised on the web the inside tours were cancelled on two days I tried to visit. The outside is spectacular.

unmissable. An absolute must-see - not only beautiful outside, from every direction, but stunning inside - every wall and ceiling highly decorated, lots of gold, and blue - and lit by candlelight. Unique.
Incredible Building.. What an amazing place both internally and externally.The wall paintings have to be seen.Renovated exceptionally well.
Amazing. Our visit to this church was one of the highlights of our tour. The building has so much atmosphere and is very special.

Amazing. Certainly a must to visit whilst in St Petersburg. The outside is a truly breathtaking building and it was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated The inside is stunning and full of the most beautiful mosaics.

One of must-see attractions in St Petersburg. It is so beautiful exterior-ally from different angles. Inside the church is a stunning view of the grand hall from the floor to the ceiling with beautiful mosaics. make sure to spend enough time and capture the beautiful views.
Interesting. It's a place where you will get an interesting tour avery30 minutes. It's worth visiting if you're interested in history.
A work of art. It is one of the most beautiful churches to see. Grant it that I did not go inside, but the spectacular view from outside is worth every second of your time.

Excellent photo opportunity even if you don't go inside. We just visited the outside. This is the archetypical view of St Petersburg. Although it is very crowded and (as when we were there) the weather can be dreary, if you pick the right spot you will get some great photographs. Well worth a visit.

What a church!. This cathedral is amazing, its colors, shape inside and outside is an absolute show to your eyes. Of course the visit inside with a guide will provide you with all information about its history ... i like Orthodox Church but this one is for sure one of the most attractive
stunning. fully rebuilt church is a must see, just steps off the nevsky prospect on griboedov canal... go inside with a tour guide or read up on the history before going inside
The History Amazing. If you go with SPB tours you'll get fast tracked into the church, make sure you have plenty charge in your camera it's lovely with all the mosaics.

Breathtaking. This church may be one of the most beautiful places in Europe, the floor to ceiling mosaics, the gilded orbs, the floor. It is a marvel to behold inside and outside. A dream come true to visit here

historic church in city center. i have visited the church on a beautiful sunny afternoon in june. the church is right on a canal paralel to nevsky boulevard. the road leading to it is full with cafes , street vendors , and performers.the church is not huge but of historic nature since the czar alexander was mudered inside at 1881 , and the spot where it happened is clearly marked .inside its very beautifull , but it was very crowded all and all 30 minutes visit is fine for this site . when done i continued to the russian museum which is on the same embankment about 5 min from there.its worth a visit and i definetely recommend it 111

13 Day Baltic Cruise . One of our stops on our Baltic Cruise was 3 days in Saint Petersburg, Russia. On our second day we went a river boat tour, Peter and Paul Fortress and to the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. This is a beautiful church and a must see when in St Petersburg.

Shorts not allowed for men. We were not allowed in to this cathedral because my partner was wearing shorts and apparently men need to wear trousers, even though women can wear short skirts. Unfortunately he did not have a short skirt in his bag on this occasion so we did not go in! There were several other men in shorts sitting outside and as we had seen several churches and cathedrals during our visit to Moscow, we were not particularly worried to miss this one.My advice is to make sure you are wearing the appropriate clothes if you want to visit this cathedral.

Don't miss. My fellow travellers were all complaining of being "churched out" after two weeks in Russia with its amazing centuries old churches, but all agreed upon seeing this one that it was one no visitor to St Petersburg would ever want to miss. An incredible work of art everywhere you look.

Church of a dozen domes☺. Is there any doubt why this sentence-long church name is the Number One TripAdvisor review-rated site in Petersburg? More than 13,000 reviews! While in St. Pete for a week, I visited three times. Rain on the first ‘dampened’ the experience. The second visit was on Wednesday, and access to the interior was not allowed. Third time the charm, and what charm there is. What I thought was ornate blue painted walls is actually gold gilt, mosaics of lapis lazuli tiles, topaz, lazurite, and other semiprecious stones, none larger than a small fingernail—and that on Trump’s tiny hands☺ This phenomenal church [make that temple] was constructed between 1883 and 1907 on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881. Construction was funded by the imperial family. The canal alongside the road on which Emperor Alexander rode when he was wounded by an anarchist’s grenade was narrowed, so that the site where he bled out would be inside the temple. That’s why this building juts onto a spit of land into the canal. The church encompasses the original cobblestone street where Alexander was mortally wounded, which comprises the floor, and is in sharp contrast to the mosaic walls. The Soviets closed the church in 1932, later using it to store potatoes and other goods. Nazis bombed a quarter of Petersburg during WWII, including this iconic building. The cost of reconstruction exceeded a hundred fold of original construction. When in Russia’s original capital city—Venice of the north—this is a must-see site. Though impossible from one side, I counted a dozen domes when walking around the building. That number is significant, possibly representing disciples of Jesus.
Amazing from the outside and from the inside. Must see. The decoration is just fabulous. Don't miss the inside, even if there are lines. Amazing from the outside and from the inside

Must see.. Incredible mosaics covering the whole interior of this church. It is very unique the way that Byzantine and Art Nouveau styles are combined to create one of the most extensive mosaics in the world.
overwhelming. Beautiful. . The outside is fantastic but the inside is so much more than you expect. All that glitters is GOLD well gilt.
fantastic!!!!. So beautiful, this is a MUST seen in St.petersburg. In the Sovjet time it was a potato storage! Unbelivable!

Nice, Not Great!. This was a nice little church on our stop with SPB. It was interesting, but takes just like 15 minutes to explore. Kind of overrated in my opinion and it is overcrowded. The only reason why this church is so popular was because it was built where an important person got shot. Rather spend the time I spent here at the State Hermitage Museum.
Amazing inside and out. One of the popular tourist spots in St Petersburg. It is very close to a lot of the tourist spots. A lot of souvenir vendors outside the Church.

Fantastic intricate detail, great history. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is one of the main sights of St. Petersburg. The Church was built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in 1881. The exterior of the church is exquisite and rivals St. Basil's in Moscow. The amount of jewellers' enamel used to cover the five onion domes is mind boggling and hard to believe. Detailing of the church's interior is fantastically intricate and well worth the price of admission. I visited as part of a group and was given a guided tour via an audio system which I found hugely beneficial.

Great holiday. This church was amazing from the outside and we were not disappointed when we went inside, truly a fabulous building with a very interesting history. I would definitely recommend a visit.

Out of a dream. Despite having seen this church with my own eyes, it still felt unreal to me. It was like being in some sort of a fairy tale or dream. It is absolutely beautiful, both inside and outside. I could have spend a day marvelling at the beauty of this church. Of course, there are a lot of tourists and pickpockets are at work.

Spectacular and beautiful both Internally and Externally:). It's one of the most beautiful church in St. Petersburg. The architecture at it's best. A must to visit for every tourist. It's very near to Nevsky Prospect. But honestly if you compare St. Basil's Cathedral of Moscow to Spilled Blood church, to my opinion St. Basil of Moscow is more colorful and beautiful.The entrance fees per person is 250 Rub. At the back side of the church is St. Micheal garden which is good place to rest and spend some time. The best view of this magnificent church is from Nevsky prospect.
Amazing. What a great church nearly the whole inside is covered with very intricate mosaics, a definite place to visit
Mosaik church . What a wonderful and colorful experience. We've seen a lot of nice churches out there but this one is one of the few you may not miss if you ask me.
Nice place In spb. Very nice place and i enjoyed alot but beware of pick pocket which can make you stuck in big problem.

Not a church, but a museum. It is not a church, but simply a building now...it's heart has been taken away. The people no longer come here to celebrate and pray.The entire inside of this building (floors, walls, columns and ceiling) is covered with intricate and exquisite mosaics.It's glorious and wild .....but does capture the essence of celebratory orthodoxy.But here is the scoop:The Communist did all they could to eliminate religion and used this building for storing potatoes. Only four churches in St Petersburg (out of 300) were allowed to continue to function during Soviet times. Currently, the State, once again, is using religion to promote their governance of the people.
Sights . Amazing & so beautiful. Great area for buying souvenirs as several outside stalls are in the area. Look for George from Georgia who recommended a great area restaurant.

Beautiful . This church is beautiful inside and outside. The inside is decorated in mosaic tile from floor to ceiling. The entire inside. It is always crowded so come early. Cost is 600 rubles. Tickets are available onsite.

Impressive mosaic works inside. Well worth a visit! The entrance fee is 250 rubles. The interior is all made with mosaics and it is quite amazing. You get also nice pictures from outside. Close to Nevski Prospekt and Hermitage.

Beautiful church. THe Spilled Blood is a beautiful church. Compared to others, as for instance the churches in the Kremlin, it is better preserved, with great figures and amazing architecture. Worth a visit.

Amazing church . One of the most important thing to do in saint Petersburg. Very beautiful church from the outside to the inside. Fees are 600 rub and you can buyit from the ticket iffice near the church. In the church there are some guidelines for you to know all the headlines you need to know about the church and the reconstruction. The memorial of the area where Alexander the second where shot.. Don't miss this opportunity. Amazing place to visit and see.
Amazing. This church is amazing on the outside and also absolutely beautiful inside as well. Very busy, but a must during a visit to St Petersburg
Beautiful church and architecture. if you are in St.Petersburg this is a must see place, you can go inside just take a look and then walk around

Colourful church!. This church is a must see in St Petersburg. It is very pretty and ornate. Entrance is relatively cheap and can give a feel for Russian churches, especially if you don't have a chance to make it to Moscow.
Most interesting. No need to spent that much time here but a must visit while in St Petersburg. Suggest you include in a day tour.
Great church, must see. Very nice church. Great mosaics inside the church and the exterior has a unique Russian appearance and is a must when in St. Petersburg.

Most Beautiful and Ornate Church in the World. Different guidebooks often have slightly different translations of the name of this church. This is by far the most beautiful church you will ever see. With a mix of brightly colored domes and gold gilt spires there is nothing like it elsewhere. In 1881 Tsar Alexander II was assassinated on this site by a team of 2 terrorists working together. After a spontaneous memorial sprang up and as a memorial to his father Tsar Alexander lll began construction directly over the spilled blood. The church was largely funded by the royal family. The inside of the church is just as spectacular as the outside with extensive religious mosaics as detailed as any painting and extensive use of gold gilt. Built as a memorial, the church never had a congregation or held regular services and in the 1930's was secularized as a state museum. This is the most must see attraction in St Petersburg.
Check box for St Petersburg. Historical church, now a museum. Build by a son to remember his assassinated father, a emperor. Similar in appearance to St Basil church in Moscow.

AMAZING. This church built over the spot where Czar Alexander was assassinated is truly a marvel of Russian Orthodox Churches....as exotic the outside is, is as amazing and overwhelming the inside is....a must see.....

Impressive church. Really recommended place to visit in Saint Petersburg. From outside is amazing, but inside I could say that even more. Also, the price of the ticket is very reasonable, so don't miss this place.

STP CITY TOUR. Nice interior with lot's of history. A lot's of group and make sure take care your belongings. During my trip STP was rainy and outside of the church - a young man is singing with good voices.
Worth the visit inside. Beautiful mosaics throughout. Not too crowded when we went(late September). Close to shopping restaurants and other attractions
Spectacular - A must see. This is an absolute must if you travel to St.petersburg. Very interesting story, beautiful building and definitely go inside. It is spectacular

Beautiful Mosaic. The church is a beautiful sight to behold. All the figures inside and outside are mosaic creations and not paintings. It is a real work of art and a sight not to be missed in St. Petersburg

Beautiful Church. Just off Nevsky Prospect next to a canal and near a park this beautiful church is well worth a visit. The interior is stunning and you are free to walk around and take non flash photos. I loved it.

Wring city for this traditional church. I don't like this church in traditional Russian style. What looks good in Moscow doesn't fit modest streets of St.Petersburg. It is great example of Russian style also insider, looks expensive and colorful, if you have time, I highly recommend to see its decorations.

a MUST even for a quick visit. This is an absolutely beautiful Cathedral, totally worth a visit, the lovely sight form the outside is nothing compared to the incredibly awesome mosaic art you can see inside. And you can also take pics inside. Even if it is crowded, or even if you have a short time only....The story behind the name and construction of the site is great too, but even if you dont go with a guide or plenty of time, just a quick look inside the church is totally worth it and a mst while in this city.

Must see!. Amazing and beautiful church - so inspirational I almost felt magical spiritual touch! Beautiful icons and wall paintings - very impressive and must see. Linger in this inspirational and magnificent construction, watch and listen - I hope you will feel something too!

Stunning. With its huge golden dome this is a stunning example of Russian architecture. This probably isn't a place you will linger too long, but the view of the church is certainly worth a photo stop.

Beautiful and unique!. From the outside is incredible how this cathedral is in the middle of a street with normal buildings around it, making it even more beautiful! From the inside is entirely more beautiful and amazing! the paintings on the walls and rooftop is impressive! The technique of filling up the paintings with little pieces of painted ceramic is incredible! I highly recommend this place during your visit in Saint Petersburg!

Wowzer. Spectacular from the outside, spectacular from the inside. Should not be missed if in Saint Petersburg for any length of time. Can be very crowded but worth waiting for. Interior photography allowed. Reduced admission after 18:00.

Impressive....inside and out.. This is one of those iconic buildings that immediately says you're in St Petersburg....it is just as impressive as the photos..... both inside and out. Recommend you take a photo from down the canal, back up or alternatively, if you have the time, walk along to the Griffin Statues and take what I consider the BEST shot ever, with the lion statues in the foreground, then the Bank Bridge and the Church in the background....wow!
Tremendous Russian history. You have to visit this attraction, simply to learn why it has it's name. Beautiful on the inside, and the history was worth the visit.

Beautiful. Yet another stunning building, beautiful. Like so many of the sights in Russia, sad history. Beware of the actors in fancy dress, they will try to con tourists in paying them if you take a photo of them!
Amazing. As soon as you step in to the church your breath is taken away. The variety of mosaics and the depth of colours are awe inspiring. We loved this place. The highlight of the trip. Wow.
Loved loved 😀. Enjoyed our entrance to Savior on Spilled Blood. 7000 square metres mosaic tile. We tried to figure out how they did it. The Onions domes were superb

Don't just look at the exterior!. Our third visit to the city and unbelievably, the first time we've stepped inside this glorious building. Don't be as foolish as we were - go inside right away, as soon as you can, for however short a time you have. You won't regret it!
Wonderful Experience. This was a very beautiful chapel. Our guide explained much to our group and was very helpful in sharing the history of this church.
Magnificent onion domes. Awesome building when seen for the first time. Beautiful interior with outstanding art on walls and ceiling. Tip: Ask your hotel to book taxis instead of using outside rank.

Spilled Blood St Petersburgh. This is a must see..... from the outside in its colorful splendor and as you enter - a small fee payable from the kiosk outside (cards accepted), you will find guided tours available, I would recommend you take one as they have a lot of information to share about the various stones and defaced murals..... as you exit you will find at the rear a selection of market stalls, and local produce to purchase.
riggers and the white rabbit visit russia. all churches were amazing this one was too the colourful onion domes and the gold leaf makes them stand out
Overwhelming. A must see. The mosaics and icons are unbelievable. Well worth a visit. Stpetersburg is easy to get around
Ancient. Very beautiful structure in the center of the city. And has lost of history to read about it. Need more time to see the place.
Beautiful Church. Just a gorgeous church outside. Beautiful from all sides. Watch for pick-Pockets working the crowd with their fake souvenirs to distract you.

Yes, Yes, Yes. This is one fo the top three must sees in St Petersburg.
I just cannot say enough about the amazing art, architecture or history that this Church represents.
You must visit here or you will regret it forever.

Wow!. Outstanding tour. Excellent guide. So knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Helena loves the city and eagerly shared her knowledge with our group from the Regal Princess cruise ship. It was just wonderful and highly recommend
Nice. It is a must see in st petersburg. You will find every thing in nevsky street.it is also located there.with special architectural design
Amazing interior and exterior. A must see attraction 1 hour is enough for inside and outside all walls are mosaic decorated including the pictures.

Catch the sparkles of the beautiful church. One of the most unusual Churches, you could almost feel the reverence as you entered. The entire church was done in small mosaic titles, even the Russian icons were in tiles.One must see as the sun catches the tiles.

Absolutely beautiful cathedral inside and out. The architecture and grandeur of this church are fabulous. Very ornate and mesmerizing. A very busy place for sure but you can get up close to things inside if you are patient enough.
Surprisingly beautiful - must see . Amazing church with a display of mosaic that cannot be seen anywhere else. The altar is magnificent and the photo opportunity is unique.. As mentioned a must see.
A+. Just amazing and impressive, plus inspirational and thought provoking experience. This is a must see in Saint Petersburg.

Unbelievably beautiful. Being built at the place of murder of Alexander II and almost ruined during the soviet period, it combines the Russian traditional architecture with Italian style, connects the past and the present of Russian history. The mosaics are unbelievably beautiful and the story of the cathedral is amazing.

Visually overwhelming. A place to see...at least once in a persons life.
There was a stark reverence and reminder of historical events that were brought into the present as I stood looking at the very spot where blood was spilt.
The architecture and the paintings gave life and light to this most impressive church.

A wonderful experience - Not to be missed. This was our first heritage site that we visited in St Petersburg. This was a wonderful place with an abundance of sumptuous art and icons adorning the complete inside. Well worth getting the audio guide and wandering through at your own pace.

Magnificent inside and outside. The exterior of the building rivals St. Basil's in Moscow. But when you enter the doors and see the floor to ceiling glass mosaics, it is jaw-dropping. Every surface is decorated in the most beautiful way. Must see to really appreciate.
Church of the Savior spilled Blood. This is a must see when visiting St Petersburg, Russia. When taking a tour with SPB tours, they get you in to see with a lot of explanation about this church.
Breath taking. Very beautiful church, no. 1 in St. Petersburg. Saved it for the last day. If you dont want to see all churches, this one is a must.

Beautiful. This enchanting building looks magical in all seasons and is a photographic must on any visit to st Petersburg .
Try pictures in both daylight and night time

Amazing both on the outside and the inside. After seeing St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, you may find Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood in St. Petersburg less colorful, but seeing it by the river was still a breathtaking view.And the interior was magnificent, all decorated by mosaic paintings with details and vivid colors. This is by far my favorite interior decoration of church. You will be definitely awed by what you see inside!!
A must visit. This place is a must visit when in St. Petersberg. Lovely and beautiful architecture and a place to buy souvenirs. Dont miss this place while in St. Petersburg

Beautiful inside and out. On my bucket list to visit this landmark place in St. Petersburg.
The exterior colorful architecture was totally worth it.
I recommend going inside with a tour guide for a better historical context.
Absolutely Amazing. This was my favorite location in St. Petersburg! I wish I could have spent hours here. The interior is amazing!

Iconic. One of the most famous images of St Petersberg so must be visited. Really enjoyed the visit especially learning about the history. Can get very busy so would recommend doing as part of a day tour. Be careful outside as there are many pickpockets and one of our party had his wallet stolen.

Unique cathedral. I must say this the most unique cathedral I've visited. We called this cathedral "lollipop" church because of it's look from outside, but how amazed we all were then we entered it! The whole inside is made of mosaic. Small pieces formed into pictures. Amazing! This is something I've never seen before.

A good visit and one of the highlights for our short visit. To be honest... the exterior is more impressive than the interior. Great for picture taking for the unique building. Definitely worth a visit.
Amazing inside and outside. The building inside and outside is beyond description. The mosaics, art, and general extravagance must be seen to be believed. It is "jaw-dropping". A must see!

Amazing from the outside and inside. The church of the Saviour of the spilled blood you can spot from all avenues in st. Petersburg.It is a unique monument to Alexandrer 11. Its highly decorated domes are enchanting. We bought the St. Petersburg pass which meant we did not have to pay entrance. It has the largest collection of mosaics in Russia . Apparently the Tsar's blood was spilled on the gates in front of the church. This is a must see whilst in St.Peterssburg

Oh wow. Loved the history of the place - loved the icons and the paintings. The church is FULL of vendors and was warned about pickpockets. If you're interested in iconography then this is for you. The church looks enormous from outside but surprisingly small inside. Absolutely beautiful. Be aware that you're not allowed bottles of water with you.

Quite astonishing - take a guide. The history of the location, creation (and recreation) and various lives of this beautiful church is astonishing. It will send shivers up your spine. We had a guide who really enabled us to understand it all - highly recommended.

Magnificent. Magnificent saw it many times outside only.
Most tours stop here.
Brides even have their photos taken with it in the background.

Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood Has a Love Story. The day we visited the Church on spilled Blood it was closed. The design is incredibly beautiful. It is famous for the assassination of Emperor (Tsar) Alexander II in March 1881. Our guide told us an incredible love story. “Tsar Alexander II was in love with a teenage Russian Aristocratic woman,” she said. “He had two children with her. Tsar Alexander II was planning to marry her. But, he was assassinated suddenly.”The royal family and private donors raised funds to build a church on the spot of the assassination. This love story inspired me to read more of the great love of Tsar Alexander II with his young mistress Catherine ‘Katya’ Dolgorukaya . Seeing this incredibly beautiful cathedral is a must see tourist attraction

Beautiful inside and out but crowded. We visited on our last day in St. Petersburg, right before heading to catch our train to Helsinki. The church is located on the banks of one of the canals, about two blocks in from Nevsky Prospekt, and is really a stunning sight to see as you walk toward it. It's also beautifully decorated on the outside, the usual onion domes and colorful motifs, but beautifully done. We purchased the entry ticket from a machine on site and it could not have been easier. The church is imposing inside, much more so than St. Basil's in Moscow, as it is basically one big room rather than smaller chapels that are in St. Basil's. The iconography is wonderful and it was interesting to see the spot where Tsar Alexander II was shot. The church is a great visit to St. Petersburg and is visually gorgeous with its river setting. That said, try to go at off times. We went at 11 a.m. and it was so full that we didn't get to fully immerse ourselves in all the church has to offer.

Spectacular outside and inside. It's worth paying for entry after viewing for free from the outside. The guidebook I was using explained all the external features but no pictures of the interior. This could give the impression that it's not worth the entry price. I found it more grand than St Basil's in Moscow and certainly more accessible. Amazing frescoes, rich building and extravagant use of different natural stone with great natural light even on an overcast day.
Excellent. Second only to St. Peter's. One of the best in the world. The entire interior is covered in mosaics. Watch for pickpockets. Lots of tourist souvenir stands nearby.

A Must see and feature of the City. Get there before 4pm as the entrance fee increases after that but a must to view inside. Its mainly icons and historical pictures of Saints if you like that sort of thing. Built over the spot were Alexander 2nd assasinated
Amazing mosaics. Poignant place with lots to enjoy. Going on your own is easy and you can walk round at your own pace.

An other church with history. Our guide Elena from SPB was a font of knowledge and guided us through the history. The history and the pamphlets that she provided set the ground of knowledge to put anything in place.
beautiful mosaics. a must visit It is beautiful inside and outside with an interesting history. a Photographic site. ***
Another jaw dropping event. Over 200 mosaics to make you neck ache once again. Built in 1907 but in a traditional style it is another must see. Only 250R.

Definitely a must-see. Inside and out, this is the essence of St. Petersburg. Architecturally fascinating, from every vantage point. Inexpensive to enter, but worth it. The colorful mosaics are impressive. I don't know if I would feel the same if I had to stand in line...

Impressive, inside and out. On our last visit to St Petersburg we just saw this church from the outside, and were keen to go inside this time. I'm very pleased that we did.It is an impressive church to view from the outside, but if anything it is better inside. There are an incredible amount of mosaics in there, and if you have a good guide then they should be able to give you some interesting stories about the church's past during the communist years.A must see, and you really should go in if you can.

AWESOME. This is a must see place, it gets really really busy but the paintings on the walls and ceilings just covers the whole building, the history is interesting as well but definitely go if in the area

Most beautiful "Cathedral". Ability of mankind to create beauty is on display in it full glory. Mosaic work not to be missed at any cost. Try and get a guide to go to this place as there is too much history attached to it, and it will not be possible to know all without the help of a guide.

Must see. Unfortunately we did not have the opportunity to go inside this amazing church but it did not matter.This must be added to your itinerary if you are in St Petersburg, it is an amazing sight.The colours are brighter than I thought they would be The glazed tiles and incredibly detailed mosaics have to be seen to be believed, this is well worth a visit and I would recommend it to everyone.No wonder it's one of St Petersburg's top tourist attractions.

A treasure. This church is impressive, first of all from the outside. It cannot envy the St Basilius church in the Kremlin. Then the interior is all covered by painting you really don`t know where to look first. You don`t need to read the Bible you have the whole biblic story there on the walls.
Stunning. This 5 domed stunning church is very elaborate with the interior decorated in mosaics no wonder it took 24 yrs to build.

Remarkable church, outstanding architecture. Check out the stalls before the church, and you will see many bargains for souvenirs at prices well below those of the many souvenir shops, and don't forget to bargain
amazing!!. absolutely no words to describe this place,stunning!! very well maintained.must visit.very crowded,its the most popular sight.
Second only to St. Basil in Moscow.. It is a wonderful site to behold. Beautiful from all the angles. The inside of St. Isaac though is more beautiful.
A Must See. I've seen a lot of churches over the years, but this is one not to be missed. The exterior is awe-inspiring.

Mosaics are incredible. Entrance fees are relatively inexpensive compared to western standards. The mosaics throughout the church are incredible, and the location of where Peter the Great was assinated is well preserved and easily depicted. The outside of the church is spectacular, especially on a clear sunny day, which isnt often in St Petersburg

Fantastic Church in Traditional Russian Style. Jaw dropping architecture, beautiful frescos and a historic setting. Built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881, the channel by the church was shortened so the church could sit there, hence the name

Lives up to its reputation. And then some!. I only viewed this church from the outside and WOW! Pictures do not do it justice. The sun managed to come out which only enhanced my viewing pleasure. There is a reason it is the #1 sight in St.Petersburg. Don't miss it.
Amazing mosaic. This is certainly an amazing building, both inside and out. Inevitably it is very popular with tourists and therefore not so easy to admire all the detail of the wonderful mosaics.

This church will blow you away ... figuratively (as opposed to Alexander II). A must see landmark in St. Petersburg! Take your time to walk around the church before going inside and admire the immense mosaics, the art, ... I recommend taking the audio tour, which will provide you with interesting background information and detailed info on the different mosaics, the meaning of specific paintings and pieces of art, ...It's a huge part of St Petersburg and Russian history, so don't miss out on this!

Out of a fairy tale!. The outside architecture of the Church alone is worth a visit. The interior will leave you breathless. The interior is covered in what I can only describe as a magnificent and grandiose use of tiles. This is a must in your visit to Saint Petersburg.
Amazing..!. I really love you live..! The most beautiful place in Church of the Savior on Blood, Saint Petersburg..! Thanks..!
Speechless 😶 . Beautiful from outside and small from inside but must see really nice u stand up speechless next to it...
Fantastic. An amazing sight & to think it was almost destroyed because it was headed toward a state of disrepair.

Magnificent. This Orthodox Church was built on the site where Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881. The section of pavement he died on is actually preserved in place, inside the church. The church is a stunning architectural masterpiece both inside and out. The beautiful exterior is topped by several ornate colorful domes and the interior is a splash of magnificent color with all kinds of iconography, carvings and paintings. even the floor is a masterpiece. This is one of several must see locations in and around this wonderful city, and is a fine contrast to the equally magnificent St Isaacs.

Gourgeous building!. This was a fantastic building. I would have liked to learn a bit more about how it was constructed. Fantastical colors throughout. Only wish we had more time to linger and explore.

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful churches I've visited. When in St. Petersburg be sure to visit this wonderful beautiful building. Although it's no longer used as a church, there are special event held a couple of times a year.
Beautiful Mosaics inside - A must see. Beautiful church with exceptional Mosaics walls and ceiling. Can be a bit crowded best to see early in the morning.
Outstanding Architecture. Excellent architecture outside and in. Mosaics are excellent with a focused religious shrine with gold highlights and vaulted ceilings.
Beutiful Church. What a glorious monument built on the side of a canal with its fabulous turrets and colourful domes. Terrific interior, with gilt and an abundance stunning statues and paintings.

Worth the sight! Both the interior & exterior.. Built for commemoration. No church rituals inside therefore there's an entrance fee of adults 250. But it is worth every cent. Bazaar opens around 9-930am. Pretty gd souvenirs.. All four sides of the church were spectacular especially when the sky is clear.. The interior made out of tiny multicoloured mosaic tiles forming pictures of Jesus saints and Angels. What a sight leaves u staring up and around. Gotta keep ur excitement to urself as its a church afterall so volume are to be kept as Low as possible:)Enjoy the sight!

Amazing Architecture. A must see in St Petersburg. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is an absolutely stunning piece of architecture. The colorful domes and intricate masonry are simply amazing. Take time to look at all of the details. I stopped by to see the church in the morning, the afternoon and the evening, because it looks so different in different light. No cost to view the church from the exterior. The inside is beautiful and worth the admission. Tickets for the interior can be purchased at the ticket booth in front of the church. I recommend the night tour, as the interior of the church is beautifully illuminated. This is a must see in St. Petersburg.
Stunning place. Worth the visit even if the exterior is in my opinion better than the inside, perhaps try to go when it is not too busy
absolutely amazing. a must see in st Petersburg,the history of the place is fascinating.the detail in the building and mosaics etc is awesome.beware though it is a very busy place!

A must see in St Petersburg. This church is a must see in St Petersburg. It's beautiful both inside and out. Cost of entry is 250 rubles and an audio tour is available at 200 rubels. Make sure you take your Camara for some great pictures.

Beautiful church inside and out. This is definitely worth a visit - for the beautiful architecture, wonderful interior and fascinating history. In a very central part of St Petersburg, just of Nevsky Prospekt.

Church to Remember the Tsar. The son of the assassinated Tsar built this church in memory of him and it does him justice. This is one of the iconic churches in St. Petersburg that you cannot miss. If you aren't interested in Russian history or Christianity, then go to experience the art and architectural grandeur of this place. Please do your homework ahead of time at the very least because I ran into so many ignorant tourists who were mocking the name "on Spilled Blood," and didn't know why it was called that. Don't be that tourist. I'm embarrassed they were even on Russian soil.

Spectacular. This is a must see when you are visiting St Petersburg.The whole church is covered in beautiful mosaics and you need to take the time to appreciate the works of art surrounding you. Our tour guide was exceptional in explaining the amazing history of this church.Be warned, it can get very crowded at times with people.We totally enjoyed our tour and the sites of the church.

Pretty but we didn't go in. The best photos of the church is probably a block away. I thought about going in to see what it looks like inside, but the line-up was crazy. I believe that the tour guide said that it wasn't an active church, but a museum

The most insteresting place in St. Petersburg. This is a Cathedral that is stunningly beatiful when seen from the outside, and it is worth going around it - each different viewpoint will reveal something else.But it is after you get inside that your knees shake and you jaw drops. Rich mosaics and icons capture the visitor eye, and the dominant gold and blue colors provide an unforgetable experience. The iconostasis is quite different from what I have seen in other orthodox churches - what it lacks in number of icons it makes up by the sheer richess of the door.Make sure to visit during the day because the sunlight filtering through the windows is an essential part of the visuals. And go back at night to see the exterior of the church illuminated against the night sky.

Absolutely Gorgeous Inside and Outside. An iconic structure with detailed and ornate spires visible from all around St. Petersburg. The only thing more impressive than these spires is the design and architecture inside. This could be the most beautiful church I have ever seen.Plan to spend at least 1 hour enjoying this magnificent structure. WARNING: The souvenir stands outside the church are hangouts for bands of pick-pockets and thieves. I was attacked by 4 men trying to pick my wallet and cut the strap on my DSLR camera. Fortunately, my pockets are buttoned closed and I was holding my camera at the time. I was able to swing the camera and hit one of them and then a women behind me started screaming so they took off. On our way out of the church, another man in our tour was attacked but they did not get anything from him either. The church is superb but be careful when inside and outside.

Coolest church I've ever seen and probably ever will see. The church is a work of art. I was speechless. I sent photos to my kids who were impressed which is not easy to do. A photo of the interior is now my phone background because it is the most beautiful thing I have ever seen, and I've seen a lot of great things.

Wonderful architecture. This cathedral is situated in the heart of the city and overlooks a canal so is reflected in the water and at night is stunning. Although it is a popular tourist location it is generally not too crowded.

Amazing place. Must see . Its one of the amazing cathedrals. You have to visit it once you are in saint Petersburg . There is an amazing park next to it. To spend 30 minutes walking in it. Peautuful long trees

Unique architecture and must see. One of the icon of the city with very distinct architecture and great for photographs. I went in the afternoon without the need to line up for ticket. Beautifully crafted and restored inner environment. Relative distance from the main waterfront if anyone thinking of walking the 20 minutes.
A wonderful photo op. This is a must on your list to St Petersburg, have been three times and never tire of the beauty of the building and the history behind it.
Breathtaking. Don't miss a visit to this incredible Church. Allow time to explore from all sides, the onion domes vary depending on aspect. Big queues to go inside to book ahead online.

Wow. I was really impressed by the beauty of the mozaics in the church. It was stunning. We hired audio guides in the church for 200 rubles & contended with the tour groups to see the main features The great thing with the audio guide is that you can skip points when they are too busy & come back to them later when groups have moved on. If you see only one church in St Petersburg this has to be it! Go see it.

beautiful historical architectural facade. One of our stops on our second daySPB tour. could't get enough of taking photos infront of the structure. Once inside, you can again see the opulence and grandeur of the place. marbled walls, gold altars. Our guide even pointed the exact place where Alexander II was fatally wounded. you can skip going inside if you don't have much time.

Simply Spectacular. Don't leave St. Petersburg without seeing this Church, you will be in the presence greatness. The whole church is covered in beautiful mosaics. Look up close and really take the time to appreciate the magnificent works of art surrounding you. Don't forget to look up, the cupolas (or domes) are impressive.

Classic Russian architecture. We enjoyed this cathedral immensely. Beautiful interior. Russian Orthodox so no pews or benches. Beautiful icons. Protected area inside the church of the exact site where man was killed (spilled blood). Very photogenic. Adjacent to a canal or river. Street vendors outside. Read history before going.
Probably the best place in St. Petersburg. You have different ways to reach this place. But all of these ways are beautiful. Of course best time to visit is evening, when the lights on.

Stunning. This church is absolutely breathtaking, inside and out. The inside is made up of almost all mosaics. They're gorgeous! Of course the "onion" towers on the outside are beautiful and so iconic. Loved this place.

Wow. So....for all of you that are not interested in churches (like me) this one you got to see it. Only for the beauty of how it's been built. It looks great and it's a real eye caching especially in the sunset
Amazing to view. My wife and I saw this on a trip to St Petersburg from the outside, very impressive, we were told it is a museum inside and just as impressive

The reason I went to St Petersburg. This was the most amazing experience, the Church on the Spilled Blood is a must see in St Petersburg and the main reason we chose to stay for 3 nights. It has amazing history and if you have the chance for a guided tour you will truly enjoy al lit has to offer. I loved every second of it

Simply Impressive. This church is already impressive from the outside by his colorful cupolas and decoration, but as soon as you get inside you are completely captured from the beautiful mosaics which are covering every centimeter of his interior. Wherever you are lying your eyes you can only just be astonished from the beauty of his decoration and you cannot avoid an exclamation of wonder every time you are turning your gaze towards another prospective. The only thing which was a bit annoying was the amount of people, too many in a such limited space.

Stunning!. The church is centrally located and is very near to the Nevsky Prospekt area. This place looks straight out of some disney movie. A great place to click those perfect photo shots. The church has now been converted into a museum and entry is charged at 600 rubles. The museum inside is also pretty good
Well worht the wait. Amazing . Even when crowded. The painted walls are breathtaking. Close by are excellent restaurants and a lovey park to walk in.

Amazing Mosaic work. Resembles St. Basil but with blue domes. Exterior is beautiful. Interior mosaic work is inexplicable. I was just looking up for hours with an open mouth.. Lot of history. Our guide was so good in explaining . Do not miss this attraction.

Beautiful Church. We were limited to 30 minutes at the church but we did get an eye full during that time. It had those marvelous Orthodox Steeples that one thinks of in Russia. The mosaics were exquisite on the interior. A must see when in St. Petersburg.
What a Picture. Such a beautiful church right by a canal. Its stunning from all angles and when we caught glimpses of it from the bus tour we were on it made the view more beautiful.

Wonderful, inside and out.. When you see the incredible architecture of the outside, you may be forgiven if you expect be disappointed by the interior. You won't be. The inside is decorated throughout by wonderful mosaics, and the door to the alter is incredible.
Amazing mosaics . A must see because of the amazing mosaics. It is incredible to see the work that has gone into this church.We went late in the afternoon and no big queues.

Amazing!!!. Already from far away you can see the beauty of this church, but the inside is even more impressive...
Must see attraction

Just wow - both inside and out. What an amazing church with a fascinating (and relatively modern) history! A real gem both inside and out, with stunning murals and mosaics as well as quintessential onion dome architecture. A must see in St Petersburg, along with the Hermitage.

Mosaics impressive. We went for a quick look as we were staying quite close. The church is impressive and the mosiaics on the inside were the highlite. We stayed only 15-20 minutes so it is suitable for those people who have limited time. To stay longer you probably need a guide or perhaps audio guide to get a better perspective of the history. There is a ticket vending machine on left side of ticket office that we used which shortened queue for some reason.

Stunningly beautiful . It was a beautiful day and we took in the amazing view of church from far to near and all the way inside, every moment was just stunning. No pictures can share what we saw, you have to be there to see the details and whole view with your own eyes.

The exterior of the church is only exceeded by the interior. The church of the Savior on Spilled Blood has an exterior highlighted by its colorful domes which which are quite striking. The interior of the church possesses numerous mosaics depicting biblical and other events. The church has a unique niche in the rear covering the location where Tsar Alexander was wounded (spilled his blood). In any visit, it would be helpful to have the church's history explained by a knowledgeable guide.
Wonderful tourist attraction. We traveled to St Petersburg Russia in August 2016 and did the audio tour of the church. It was crowded but the audio tour was just fine for learning about the church.

MAJESTIC PLACE OF WORSHIP. Majestic church. Unique but traditional Russian architecture. Beautiful interior. A bit crowded since it is a popular tourist spot so one should be extra careful with his belongings. Nice souvenir shop inside the church. Several stalls right outside.

Don't Miss It!. The story about this church is one of the all-time greats in Russian history, and the building is magnificent in and out. Don't miss this attraction. It's a reasonable entry fee, and the audioguide takes about 45 minutes. One of the prettiest sites in all of St. Petersburg!

Awe inspriring beauty, eloquence, and history all in one place. When planning our extended family's trip to St. Petersburg, I asked everyone what they wanted to see. To my surprise my step-father said, "The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood." And so after looking into it I added it to our itinerary.But nothing prepared me for how beautiful, moving, and truly awe inspiring the experience would be. It was a little difficult with all the crowds, but I encourage you to find a place next to a pillar outside the traffic flow and allow yourself a quiet moment to look up and about and take it all in. Monumental doesn't begin to cover it. But there is a reason this is the #1 attraction in St. Petersburg and one of the few around the world to have over 10,000 reviews and a solid 5 star rating.

Don't miss the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. Perhaps the most stunningly beautiful church in all of Russia with an amazing history. The interior mosaics and unmatched and the exterior beauty is exceptional!

Cathedrals of St. Petersburg Russia. This is the perfect way of seeing the most prestigious and probably the most unique cathedral of st. Petersburg. Spilled blood cathedral, Peter & Paul Cathedrals and fortress & St. Issac cathedral these churches is around the Nevsky prospect and city center views of the hermitage from the outside

Watch your pockets here !!!!. This area is the worst I have seen for pickpockets. We saw three gangs at work and not a policeman or security man anywhere !! I wonder why !!! When you go for a ticket beware as you take your cash out and then put it back in your pocket. They are on to you in this area. BEWARE YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !!!

Just what you image Russian palace/churches to be like. Picture perfect, with those onion type domes on the exterior, what a photo op. Inside again just picture ops everywhere, and the mosaics-amazing!
A Gem.. Beautiful place with long and difficult history. Good excursions inside. Please be calm and silent inside, it's a church.

I cried. from the outside, the Church is beautiful.Once inside , it goes to a completely different level.I was impressed with the carved jade and mosaics to the point of sobbing because of the beauty, detail , workmanship,and diverse patterning. I cried.
Amazing Cathedral . Wonderful Cathedral well worth a visit for its history, amazing mosaics, stone work and architecture.
Must see!. Awesome building inside and out. This was my wife's favourite attraction in St. Petersburg.Interesting history in and around it too.

Stunning!!. Part of the couchsurfing walking tour, this is a church with a lot of interesting history. Behind the church you'll see a long line of souvenir shops which have the best priced souvenirs I ever found in St. Petersburg.
Wonderful place. It's amazing from outside... It's like mosaic... From inside it's all colored with pictures... Overall you have to visit.
Fantastic!. Really impressive, fantastic job, very much worth the visit, ticket really inexpensive. Hard to imagine the work.

Favourite Russian Church. If I could only visit one church in the St Petersburg area it would be this one. It is built in the Russian Orthodox Style with the big onion domes . It is so beautifully decorated inside and out and has a wonderful story to go with it. The Tsar was killed here and his son built the church in his memory. It's not filled with all the gold leaf you see so much of in other tourist stops. We did it as part of a two day tour, but it is really not to be miss. I loved it

Visually stunning but spiritually empty. The 'church' is visually breathtaking, inside and outside. I prefer the outside because it has less gold and is a little more diverse. The inside is fascinating in it different depictions of saints and biblical stories but unfortunately the audio guide is very useless. The audioguide points out that yes, Tsar Alexander II was murdered here, so his son, Alexander III built him this memorial church which was never actually used for services. And then it continues with 'We took these materials from Finland/Ukraine/elswhere and we built this part of the church with them.' which I find highly uninteresting. I would have loved to hear either more about the two tsars OR maybe have better explanations of the wall mosaics. Yes, the guide tells you that the decorations show the life of Christ from his nativity to his death and it mentions that somewhere the tsar's story is told, too. I can spot the nativity scene, of course, and other biblical illustrations. But I couldn't see the tsar anywhere unless he was depicted with a halo?! It would have been so interesting to be able to find out more about who is depicted where and why they are depicted like this. Opposed to what the materials are with which they are depicted...Also, as I mentioned the church felt very spiritually empty to me. It had all this grandeur and all this gold and religious icons but in the end it felt very meaningless to be, very unspiritual. I usually like to withdraw in churches and say a little prayer but this church was very uninspiring...so go inside to take photographs but save money on the audioguide!You are allowed to take photos inside but not while using a tripod.
Stunning. I only looked at the outside as I won't enter a church. As it happens I could have gone inside as it has never been consecrated. The history is interesting if you have a good guide.

Beautiful mosaics.. It is a church full of mosaics which simply has to be seen. There is also the piece of sidewalk where the Zar Alexander ( I hope not to confuse the name) was killed.If you are in SP don't miss it.

Beautiful Historical Building!. This is one of the most beautiful examples of Bizantine churches. Its exterior is typical Russian architecture with onion domes and awesome mosaics outside and inside depicting various religious scenes. If you only have one day in St Petersburg, this is a place not to be missed.

Eye Popping Opulence. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is eye popping, both inside and out. It's very colorful onion domes have tourists lined up in the sidewalk taking pictures. Inside, the total coverage of the walls and ceiling of colorful mosaics is jaw dropping. This is a must see within a list of other must sees in Saint Petersburg.

The most Russian Church of Saint Petersburg. Very nice Russian church, because it's not a Cathedral, I think. The inside is quite spectacular because of the heights of the walls and also the mosaics, very well placed and done. If you look for a typical church in Saint Pete, this one is the correct one. Very nice and well preserved. It's very amazing the fence of the Park close to it, very beautiful.
Baltic holiday. Amazing to see the entire Church inside covered in mosaic Italian glass!Try to get a canal view/ pic before going inside.
Must see. Classic Iconic Orthodox Church. Beautiful Mosaics. Beware of pick pockets and enormous crowds. We did not use a translator and did not feel we needed more guidance.
Spectacular!. This was high on the list of attractions in St Petersburg and it was amazing. The architecture, attention to detail and materials used in its construction are mind-blowing.

A church with a history linked with the Tsars. Beautiful church both outside and inside. As a photographer you need to be there before the tourist arrive at around 9.30am to get uncluttered shots. The street wires make it difficult to get great photos but from any angle it is a very photogenic sight.

Beautiful exterior . We did not enter the church, but found the history of the church and how it got its name intriguing. The Russo-style is like magic and this site should not be missed. With caution, you can avoid the pick pockets in this area and enjoy the site. It's so very unique.

amazing building inside and outs. This is our second visit and we still found the experience amazing. Walking round we found parts we did not remember from last time. It was very busy but we still managed to enjoy the visit enhanced by the commentary of our tour guide
Spectacular church. A big wow for this church. If you go to any church in Russia, visit this one. The mosaic work is mind blowing. Everything is in pristine condition.

A very popular church.....great photo opportunity.. This is St. Petersburg's answer to Moscow's St. Basil's Cathedral. It is built an the banks of a canal and on the site of the assassination of one of the Tsars hence its name. Very popular with coach parties. I just marvelled at the architecture and took many photos.
Nice Russian church. After visiting St Basil's in Moscow I had high expectations however I was slightly disappointed. The church is still very beautiful but not as nice as the one in Moscow.

A Beautiful Gem. This a must see in St Petersburg. The exterior decoration is sublime, but the interior will take your breath away. All the walls are adorned with the most exquisite mosaics depicting various saints and scenes from the bible. We visited during the late evening slot when the church was quiet. During the day may be busy. Church was closed on Wednesdays.
Beautiful building. Amidst all of the plain communist style buildings, the churches and opera houses impress. I would go again to spend more time.

Amazingly beauitful. We enjoyed our visit to the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. The décor is stunning and the exterior...you can't take your eyes off of it. The top looks like a little ice cream cone but the whole building is beautiful and intricately designed. What a pleasure it was to have seen this in person!

Mosaic all over. Beautifully restored mosaics covering every square meter of wall and vaulted ceiling... This church is well worth seeing both inside and out. It's a popular stop for tour busses, but there was no queue when we arrived.
Great photo opportunities. One of the most interesting churches to see in Saint Petersburg. It's a must too see. We highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

Very pretty. Exceptionally pretty church. Although we learned it had never been an active church. Enjoyed al the mosaics. I am not particularly religious but I found Thai place very peaceful and beautiful.

This was certainly on my list! . It reminded me of a mini Kremlin so I knew people looking at my photos would know this was definitely Russian. The area has lots of vendors selling souvenirs and people dressed up in historical garb to take a picture with you.. for a price.

Beautiful russian architecture. When you think about getting an impression of the russian religion and culture this place is one you must visit.
Outstanding mosaic!

You will never forget it. If you thought the Vatican was good, this place will blow you away.The shape of the exterior looks like it’s from a storybook, and it gets even more exciting inside, where it’s lined from top to bottom with thousands of hand-set mosaic pieces –- some of them made of gold. Your panoramic photos won’t be able to capture the beauty of the never-ending murals. This church will spoil you for churches elsewhere, and you will never forget it. Make sure you learn about the history behind the name --- the assassination of Tsar Alexander II that happened on this site. Watch your wallet because it’s more crowded than you imagine, and apparently pickpockets hang around
Incredible. The exterior is very famous as part of the St. Petersburg skyline, but the interior, which is covered in gorgeous mosaics, is also very impressive.
The most stunning building in St. Petersburg. Be sure to visit the inside as well. Don't worry about the crowds, it's worth it! The Church is best viewed at sunset.

One of the highlights of St. Petersburg. This is one of the icons of St. Petersburg, and approaching it from Nevsky Prospekt will give you the postcard view with the canal in the foreground. The interior is quite simply stunning - seeing this is well worth the entrance fee! Given that every tourist who visits SPB will want to see this church, you won't be able to marvel at the paintings in quiet contemplation... ;-) I was there when a whole shipload of cruise tourists swarmed into the church, but perhaps there are also some quieter moments during the day?
Impressive!!. The outside is gorgeous, especially with sunlight hitting the towers. Inside the attention to detail while making the decorations is stunning. Very impressive.
Well worth a visit. We only had a brief visit to this Church on a panoramic St Petersburg tour, but it is absolutely stunning architecture and well worth a visit.

Very colorful. We were on a tour group, and unfortunately only got to see this church from the outside. It is an amazing building, quite unique. This is a place teeming with pickpockets we were warned, and indeed, someone from our tour group was victimized by a group of 4 men working together. They ran towards him, bumping into him, grabbed his wallet from a back pocket, and the wallet was handed off to another who ran away. One of the guys stayed behind for a while to block him from running after. Beware!

One of the most tragic and beautiful places in St Pete. amazing church, a true architecture masterpiece (many find the resemblance with the iconic St Basil's Cathedral on the Red Square in Moscow) is a must-visit place in St Pete. The church was built on the spot where the Emperor Alexander II was assassinated.

Stunning!. Incredible piece of architecture and art. An example of the extravagance of the Tzars resulting in the Bolshevik Revolution.Worth seeing on a guided tour to get the history and detail.A must see in St Petersburg.

Finally!. This church has been on my bucket list for years so to finally see it for first hand and to go inside was overwhelming. The ceiling and walls are covered in beautiful golden mosaics - simply breathtaking! Built on the site where Tsar Alexander was killed by a bomb thrown at him by a terrorist, don't miss the actual spot it happened as the cobblestones are not covered over. It would be easy to miss this when the church is full.

Gorgeous cathedral with intriguing history. This cathedral is absolutely stunning and the story behind the "Spilled Blood" name in quite intriguing. The interior art is pretty much all mosaics and the mosaic of Christ Pantocrator in the central dome is beautiful. This cathedral is the most interesting of any in St Petersburg.
Charming. We just had a short visit of outside in the night time and it was really nice i think u should see in in night and day time both.
Worth a visit. Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is definately worth a visit. It will take only 30 minutes to ho through the whole church

Beautiful but overcrowed. A must see to everybody who visits St. Peterburg.The small mosaic designs that cover all the church interior are a must see. The only con of this place is the quantity of people inside... the place is overcrowed on the inside and on the outside.So be patient because this church deserves a visit.

Beauty spoilt. A wonderful example of Russian church architecture. Can be viewed from all four sides if you walk round to the other side of the canal. Plenty of stalls but also plenty of pick-pockets who seem able to carry out their "trade" with impunity despite several police being close by. Keep tight hold of everything.

Part of St. Petersburg 2-day tour with SPB. Fantastic! Both outside and inside. A must see if you are in St. Petersburg. Recommend 2-days St. Petersburg tour with SPB which they had included this tour.

Fantastic! Mind-Blasting!. I've seen this Church four times in all my St. Petersburg visits starting in 2009 and the design and style of the exterior never ceases to amaze me. Actually I never made the effort to join the line to see the inside, but maybe one day I'll get to do that. I usually just enjoy the view while I'm checking out the markets across the street or walking around with coffee in hand. It's really incredible!

Such a beautiful mosaic church. It was raining in St. Petersburg and we thought that the line to get in was going to be short, but we were wrong, there was a huge line, except that for some reason people do not take advantage of a kiosk right by the main ticketing booth where you can buy the tickets using cash rubles where the machine even gives you change and the best part, no line, no waiting, so we used it and got inside right away.This is one of a kind church, I would say "A most visit" the very elaborate pieces of art made of mosaics so perfect and beautiful and the architecture not only outside but inside. We took our time to enjoy this uniqueness but was not enough, at least we have the pictures and the good memories, please visit, you won't regret it.
