WOW!!!!!!. You will be blown away wit the architecture and colors and history of this church. Make sure to go inside to see some of the most fabulous mosaics in the world. I recommend this as one of the must do's in St. Petersburg.

What more can you say?. The previous reviews have just about covered it all. It's a stunningly beautiful church on the outside, and the inside is even better. Mosaics on just about every surface. That, along with the history of it being placed on the location where Alexander II was bombed (there is a shrine inside on the spot of the assassination), makes it an attraction that should not be missed.

Exceptional, but a bit spoilt. The exterior is quite a sight, the interior takes an acquired tast. Unfortunately it is surrounded by the degraded side of mass tourism: souvenir tents, living statues (when will they ever get out of fashion?), tens of busses, and sadly, even monkeys on a leash doing tricks for people who still pay for such things.
Good to walk around. This is a small church but has historical significance. It can get busy with lots of tour groups, less busy during the evening and night.
The outside is just the start. Don't miss this favorite attraction in St Petersburg. The outside is a wow and the interior is mind-blowing. Bone up first so you know what you're looking at.
history staring you in the face.. I never thought I would see this place in my life time. So worth it. Wear good walking shoes. Lots of cobble stones.

Russia!!!. It's always been my dream to visit Russia, so I was very excited to see this place that I'd read so much about. It's amazingly beautiful. I can't imagine anyone coming to St Petersburg and not visiting this church. It's only a small walk from St Isaac's and the Hermitage

Distinctive mosaic church. Beautiful church on the canal built at the spot where Alexander was assinated by a bomb (the carriage he was in is at the Amourary in Moscow). It is uniquely decorated inside and out in mosaics. A must picture taking place.
Remarkable Church. This church is the one you see in all the photos of St. Petersburg. It is unbelievably beautiful in its uniqueness.
Must sight to visit . This is a must visit in your trip to SP with its onion shaped domes and see the place where Alex 2 was killed in 1881 among other things.
The most amazing display of mosaics ever!. The outside of this church is so beautiful that you can't believe the inside would be even more thrilling but it is.

mesmerizing. must visit. Best attraction of st petersburg. Iconic architecture with muti-coloured domes. Selfi or photos must. Entry fee 400 . timings to be checked for entry since the church is closed for sometimes in afternoon

Mesmerizing. This is the most beautiful church anyone can visit. The murals inside are master pieces. This ortodox church also has an amazing architectural design. A must see for any visitor in St. Petesburg

Crowds, crowds, crowds!. This church is beautiful and distinctive from the outside where there are not so many people. But on the inside, though beautiful, it was difficult to be comfortable because of the volume of people. We were told to be on the lookout for pickpockets and this church would be a prime place for this to happen.
Unforgettable!. The mosaics in this majestic cathedral are awesome and the exterior is magnificent. Our visit was enhanced by the information on the cathedral's history provided by our guide.

One of most impressive of St Petersburg's churches. Traveling with OAT adventure tours on visit to Baltic countries and Russia. Great trip with small number of travelers making it easier to move from place to place and see a lot.

Magnificent. This is better than the pictures you have seen. Just off Nevsky Prospect, Hermitage end. 250 R entry. I went at lunch time and there wasn't a queue. I loved the outside and the inside also. Woth going to St. Petersburg just for this.
Very Pretty . On the grand tour of St Petersburg very busy , the artwork is fantastic and gives you a Russian Orthodox feel.

Beautiful Church to be Photographed. Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood stand out from the other structures from afar. By approaching from the Nevsky Avenue along the canal, there are numerous occasions to photograph the church. The walk toward the church is best on the left side of the canal where the different of the footpath and road allow photograph your partner can be done with ease. There are several sweet spots to do it. Do spend time to walk around the church and enter to observe the interior, the church has the most beautiful mosaic to be seen.

it is a must see - don't miss it. We have been to many buildings around the world but this one is one of the few that you have to see. It is amazing architecture. Inside is even more beautiful. Not to be missed in St petersburg

Impressive church. The view from outside is amazing, the church looks beautiful and there are many photo opportunities. We went inside, it's so much different from the churches in my country, mosaics everywhere. The tickets are not too expensive, so one should go check it out.

Not a church, a memorial and museum. Colorful outside is no compare to the mosaic inside. Ceilings, arches, and walls were like no others. Monument was finished with semiprecious stones. We were lucky to get in...there was no line on a Monday. Cost $4 per person. Watch out for pick pockets. Memorial to Alexander II who was blown apart by a terrorist bomb in 1881. Yes it was a terrorist act...been around along time. I just walked around with my camera on selfie mode to get pic if ceilings.
Iconic St Petersburg. Such a beautiful church both inside and out. The story of the history of the church is also compelling.

Fascinating. This place is just amazing - both inside and out! Great architecture, design and colours on the outside (and a great back story!), and just incredible decor, paintings and design on the inside. A must see!

It's not just another church, must see.. We were a little surprised at the number of churches we saw in Moscow and St P's, all had an interesting history and all very beautiful in either a grand way or in a simple way.What makes this church different is firstly the unusual and grand exterior and interior, but more so that the church was built around the area were its patron saint was killed.This is one chapel you have to see.

The most impressive mosaics I have ever seen.... Having visited St. Petersburg for more than 10 times I decided while passing by this wonderful church to also enter and take a look inside (was not aware it is open like a museum and you can also have guided tour). I was simply AMAZED.

How could anyonenot visit this place if they have the chance. One of the most Iconic Russian landmarks. Absolutely breathtaking though a little busy as you would expect.A must see on anyone's itinerary of St Petersburg.
Amazing mosaics. Worth a visit and not too crowded. A visual feast of colour and craftwork floor to ceiling.definitely worth the entrance fee which is not expensive
Amazing. This is a true testament to the clergymen who barricaded themselves into the church during the revolution and allowed its beauty to be shown to future generations.

So beautifull. You just shouldn't miss this once you visit St Petersburg. Very beautiful as is the whole area. One of the postcard churches of St Petersburg. The only thing I really didn't like was the roped animals like hawks and birds they showed outsine and you could take a picture with them, not nice at all.

Another must see. Inside and out this cathedral is what I think about when I think about Russian churches. It just looks like it belongs here. We were instructed to watch for people who pick pockets. I guess it is a problem around here.
Visist to see Church of First Blood. Interesting place and outside the best place to buy souvenirs. Visit early as it gets very busy. Buy your tickets before you go to avoid the lines.
Beautiful and unique inside and out!. Gorgeous church with incredible mosaics inside! It is smaller than I expected inside, but very unique because of the floor to ceiling mosaics.

WOW. My family & I are not in to visiting churches, temples, cathedrals, etc but this is a must visit. It is really spectacular and not huge. The walls are all decorated with incredible mosaic art. I definitely would recommend this as a stop!

A Must See in St Petersburg. The saying "words can't describe" is frequently overused but certainly applies here. A totally amazing building with a remarkable history. If you get the chance...don't miss it!

A must to see. So many mosaic tiles that cover the entire inside of this beautiful old church. Hard to believe that it was used for storing potatoes and at another time theatre props after WWII. Even harder to imagine that one 'not so clever' official wanted to demolish it to make way for a metro station! To those who said 'No' to that idea... Our heartfelt thanks... A must see for anyone.. So beautiful!

Impressive church. The shrine of Alexander ll was such an emotional place. The actual cobbles where he was assassinated, preserved and cherished. The incredible paintings which covered the walls and the magnificence of the building leaves such an impression

Must see!. Beautiful onion building and there are not too many examples in St Petersburg so recommend a visit. It gets busy so go early if wanting to avoid crowds in tourist season but having said that it is stunning at sunset. Prices are more expensive after 6pm (I think it was 6pm) but definitely more expensive in the evening. Worth a visit even if you just take a walk around the area and admire the building.

Breathtaking Mosaics. A must- see church covered in the most incredible mosaics from floor to ceiling. Beautiful. Take plenty of photos yourself as the postcards available are mainly of the building exterior.
Go Later in the Day. Lines of people from tour groups and others flood the outdoor ticket office before it opens at 10:30 butwhen we passed in the afternoon, there was barelya sole in line.

Dazzling, Iconic symbol of St Petersburg . Gilded gold everywhere, mosaics, pillars and history. This is the most dreamy, memorable, impressive church of St Petersburg. I recommend that you pass by several times of day because the atmosphere changes with various kinds of lighting, plus you never get tired of seeing perfection.  I Would add this church to world sights as iconic as the Eiffel Tower, the Statue of Liberty and the Coliseum. A must see....again and again.

Don't miss this stop. As with most of the churches in this city, both the exterior and the interior are spectacular. We were there on a sunny day and were able to take a lot of pictures of the exterior. This is a museum and now longer a functioning church so you can take pictures inside as well. Note that the crypt was built on an extension of the church that caused a shift in the canal just outside. Recommend that you allow time, weather permitting to walk in the adjacent park taking in Michael's Palace, now the State Museum.
Incredible tour. A must see when in St Petersburg. So much history. The Church is beautiful inside as well as the outside

Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. It was slightly raining as walking to this marvelous work of arts/building walked all the way round it & it was busy so didn't go in but liked what I saw & the surrounds.
Amazing mosaics!. This church is extraordinary, both from the outside and also on the inside. The colours are stunning.

Afternoon walk worth for it. Afternoon walk is perfect for hot summer. Especially in the river just in the side of the church. Some souvenir shop is worth to try too. Make sure you bargain when make the transaction

Amazing mosaics. This is a must-see stop in St Petersburg. The mosaics cover nearly every inch of the inside of the cathedral and the exterior is also stunning. The cathedral was built on the spot where Alexander II was killed.

Impressive!. This church is one of the most beautiful churches in St Petersburg, The Tzar Alexander the third ordered to build it where his former, Alexander the second was killed. It was renovated for decades and really worth a visit inside.
Beautiful Church. The church is an architectural masterpiece with colourful mosaic designs. Looks stunning under sunlight!

No the first thing to see in st. Petersburg. This place looks amazing from outside. It is near everything, so definitely visit, inside there is nothing but walls of mosaic. Its all over from floor to ceiling. Nice, but no more than 15 min and you are put. Nothing else to see or do. Matbe cristians will appreciate more....

fee to enter a church. They charge a fee to enter a church, That alone tells you how cheap they are. Plus they refuse to tell how that money is spent, so I assume it does not goes towards renovations/upgrades.

Church of teh Savior. Beautiful church, only costs £3 to enter, audio guides can be purchased in English. Well worth a visit, always popular and busy. Get your tickets from the automated machines beside the ticket office, saves you standing in a queue and the machine works in multiple languages!!

A beautiful building with sad origins. Because the rest of St. Petersburg is so beautiful in its 18th century European style, this Russian Orthodox church stands out even more as a unique vision of loveliness and it is even prettier than St. Basil’s in Moscow, in my opinion. The spot where the Tsar was mortally wounded is preserved and covered by a shrine. Apparently his blood can still be seen but it is all roped off and you can’t get that close to it. But, like the spot where Franz Ferdinand was shot, it has its own poignancy.

Wow. Wow. Wow. Truly stunning. A MUST see.. The interior of the church has been completely covered in mosaics in beautiful designs. It has been restored over the past 50 years and is just incredible. A real treasure of the earth.
A must see. One of the most beautiful churches I ever visited. You should also see it from the channels. Impressive pictures can be taken from there.
TJTravel 2 Day Tour. Part of two day excursion off ship. This was interesting but not the highlight of visiting St Petersburg. All msaic art inside of church
Tourist . Astonishing. I was amazed and surprised with details inside. I liked the outside view, my girlfriend and I took a few great pictures.
Visually stunning. See a few places like this and you'll understand why they had a revolution. They spent several fortunes to build this. Lives up to its reviews.

Wow...worth going inside. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood looks beautiful from any angle from the outside. I even made a special visit at 7am so I could take photos from the outside while there was not a lot of people around. Can get quite busy later in the day as it is a popular place to visit.Returned later in the day to go inside, is as beautiful inside as it is from the outside.

Magnificent. I was never one for going into churches and feeling excited or taken back by one and its architecture until I came here! The minute you see the structure, the architecture and art of this building and what it stands for, you will be completely mesmerised! Its something you have to visit when in St petersbourg!

Highly decorative church with interesting history. IF you only visit one church in St Petersburg make it this one.Crowed with a long line to get in but worth it. Short walk off of Nevskiy Prospekt (the main shopping street) with lots of cheap souvenir booths along the way. But don't miss Beluga Deluxe shop on the same side of the Canal Embankment 1 blk to the right( best shopping in St Petersburg).

Iconic Russian church. This magnificent church was built on the site of Peter II's death. It is built off center so that the spot where he was killed can be centered in the building. This is an iconic Russian onion domed church and it is absolutely breathtaking.
WONDERFUL. Loved the Church Magnificent. Seeing the final resting place of the last tsar of Russia was amazing. All of the majesty of a forever gone era.
The most beautiful church ever. No words...just go and enter this church... it's walls are entirely decorated with mosaics...really, just stunning!

Both the exterior and interior are jaw dropping beautiful.. A must see on tour visit, the exterior is so striking it amazing when you go inside that it could get better. Words cannot describe it go and see it i will load some pictures.
Amazing - best memory of St Petersburgh. This church is totally made of glass mosaics. It is amazing and was used during the communist times as a cattle market! This is a must see.
Stunning church!. From outside is beautiful but inside is a marvel church full of mosaics and details. To see the full live of Christ represented there is impressive. Nice colors!

Incredible. This is an incredible place and it is especially good with a guide who can explain the history including what happened during the war and the Soviet period. It can get crowded but it is well worth a visit.
Ameer. Beautiful place ,beautiful architecture with an intresting history . Located near a channel and aside a beautiful park . Also you can buy sovenier inside the church

Beautiful Mosaic. Explored the church during a free afternoon from the tour. Even in a rainy day, the outside is still beautiful. The Mosaics inside are fantastic. It is a relatively small church, so it didn't take long.
Church of the Spilled Blood. Fabulous place to visit, such wonderful architecture, and painting. Leaves you in awe of such a magnificent building.

Just looks nice. There is no historical background and it's quite in comparison with thousands of places you can find in any corner of Saint Petersburg. It worth to be visited cause it tempts you, but when you get close you see it was not that tempting. Just spend 15 mins around this place and walk by the canal near by around sunset makes it romantic even and by the sunset time when you look towards the West you'll see a dreamy view.

Awesome!. This cathedral is very beautiful. Unfortunately, we didn’t have time to visit inside the cathedral & we just outside. But visiting outside of this awesome cathedral was also interesting. I think this cathedral is like fairy places.

Spectacular . Absolutely love this church, so much colour and history. Located on a canal and near wonderful market stalls for soveniers . It's near to a lot of popular sights and gets very busy.very colourful and magnificent .

Mosiac like you've never seen it!. Although this building is no longer used as a church it really is awesome. Every, and I mean every, surface, pillar, ceiling is covered in the most vibrant mosaics imaginable. The detail and colours really are breath-taking. Add to this that it was created at a time when the rich were seriously rich and the poor extremely so, and you begin to understand why there was a revolution in the country.These days the church is packed with visitors every minute that it is open, but beware it's also a pickpockets' paradise as well; one member of our group had her passport nicked as she was entering the church. Be careful and enjoy.

Russian architecture at it's best. This is what you think of when you think of Russian architecture. The onion domes laden with gold. Built on the spot where Alexander was killed this church (now a museum) is a tribute to him and his sacrifice. Very crowded place with lots of people taking pictures.
Take your breath away. Absolutely love this church! every inch of the building is a piece of art leaving you only speechless.

WOW !!. This incredible cathedral is a must see in St. Petersburg. The ornate exterior and beautiful interior are outstanding. It can get very busy, but if you're patient you will be able to see all the amazing aspects of this incredible building. Originally, this building was to have been destroyed. Thank goodness, it didn't happen.
Mind blowing. brilliant church. the next time i would take a tour guide who speaks your language and go when its not very crowded

An amazing work of art!. It is difficult to describe how amazing this Church is. Every inch is covered with stunning mosaics. Very worth a stop. You don't need a lot of time here (likely less than an hour), but definitely worth it.

Amazing building. We had a brief stop at the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood while touring St Petersburg. This building is so ornate, covered with mosaics and gilding and has multi coloured domes and tiles - so beautiful!

Incredible Cathedral on the banks of St Petersburg. I can understand why people believe this cathedral is more beautiful that St Basil's in Moscow. Incredible on the outside, utterly amazing on the inside.

Visual overload. We walked here after. Lunch, it was very busy, from the moment you walk though the door you are bombarded with religous mosaics on every surface, walls, ceiling and they are all different. Where the assasination took place is a monument which has been restored. Is a fascinating place to look through and it is on the canal with markets along the canal, with the usual souveniers
Very Crowded but well worth the visit. A remarkable building with large crowds both inside and outside the Church. Wonderful mosaics of massive sizes. Well worth the visit
Beautiful Church. Great history lesson as you travel through the inside of the church. It was so different on the outside, but beautiful.

Magnificent!. Oh my god!!!! such an architectural triumph and to think that this building was almost demolished during the darker days of the Communist regime!! Almost fairy-tail like in appearance it left me speechless!! 10/10!
Very Interesting. Although packed and presume this place is packed with people all year round, it was very interesting place.

One of the highlights of my trip. This is the most amazing building. Doesn't matter how religious you are, surely nobody could fail to be impressed. The photos don't do it justice. Inside are totally covered walls & ceiling in mosaic pictures created over 7 years. How they did it so quick is beyond me! The golden alter is breathtaking. Don't miss the faces looking down at you from the 4 corners. They can only be seen if you are directly underneath them. So much to see.....and miss if your not careful.And that's just the inside. The outside is fabulous too. So pleased I got to see this. Definitely worth the cost of a visit, preferably with a guide if you are interested in the history.

Tip for photographers. This is a fabulous example of Russian architecture and not surprisingly everyone wants a photograph. The front therefore is teeming with people posing. Walk to the left and around the corner and you will come to the river. You can get some lovely angles here without the people. And the view of the river is good too.

Just WOW!. Have seen some of the world's most spectacular buildings, but will certainly be rating this one in our Top 3. It is absolutely stunning especially the inside which is decorated from top to bottom in colouful mosaics. Surprisingly there wasn't much of a line when we were there.
Beautiful church - very moving.. Excellent place to understand Russian history. Accompanied by wonderful tour guide called Christina.

Guady. Stopped here on a bus tour of St.Petersburg. The church is large and impressive but I think that the Eastern European architecture style is just a bit much. Its grandness is lost in the bedazzlement. Also as a Westener I am not use to to paying admission to go into a church (yes make a donation if yo so choose - but not pay admission).However, very popular with tourists. There are line ups at the ticket booth.

Simply amazing. As beautiful inside as it is outside. I'd definitely recommend a visit, it's well worth the 250 ruble admission price. Pictures don't capture the beauty of the interior, it's something you have to see in person.

A beautiful church!. We didn't get a chance to see the gardens - but the church was absolutely amazing. The restoration of the mosaics - both inside and out are stunning. We were only able to stay for a short time - we were part of a guided tour - but we really enjoyed what we did see.
Artistic . Very triumph full we visited it at 9 pm and there was nobody else I recommend that go there very late
Stunning. The outside is stunning and the inside is even better. Great history, fantastic mosaics, beautiful architecture. This is a site not to miss. Fantastic place. Absolutely DO NOT MISS.

You have to see it in person - inside and out - don't just walk by. The Spilled Blood Cathedral is a must see in St. Petersburg inside and out!! The exterior is just gorgeous! Gem-encrusted cupolas. The interior - more beautiful - 83,000 square feet of stunning mosaics and altars carved from semiprecious-stones. We were on a tour so not sure how much it was to get inside but there was a charge and security. The place was packed!!! They kept telling us over and over - watch your belongings - watch your pockets - watch your purse! Almost took away from the experience of seeing the church - kept looking around to make sure I wasn't being pick pocketed. I wouldn't have missed it though.

Love the mosaics. Amazing that this church still exists after being used as a garbage dump post revolution and suffering great damage in WW2.But truly amazing renovation and a must visit.The pick of St.Petersburg churches.

the best church of the city. First hermitage, second this one.
One of the most important attraction in the city. you haave to visit also the garden in front of it

THE PLACE to visit in St Petersburg. Extremely beautiful church in typical Russian architecture. Interiors are equally stunning with intricate mosaic work all over the walls and ceilings. Will be crowded, expect a queue at the entrance.. so try avoiding weekdays.
Definitely a must do!
Stunning !. This church is amazing - full of the most beautiful gold and mosaics - not like anything I have ever seen before, both inside and out - definitely worth a visit !
Must see. We have all heard of the revolution, but thankfully they saved Churches such as this for us to wonder at.

Terrible. Another very unpleasent side of the global mass group tourism. I do not understand how they can let enter group after group, until the church is completely full. Even worse, they have a souvenir shop at the exit. You have formally struggle, push away the people around you to be able to leave the church.

If you do one thing in St.Petersburg, go here. I'm one of those non-religious people who has seen so many churches while travelling that I couldn't care less if I didn't see another church for the rest of my life, priceless art or stunning architecture included.Saying that, I was glad I visited this particular church (Even though it's not really a church etc etc) The mosaics are absolutely stunning and dominate the interior of the church that you can't help but be awestruck, never mind the exterior. I won't go into any further detail about them other than to say go see it yourself. Now. It can be busy and involve some queueing and/or large crowds but bear with it. It's well worth any hassle.
Impressive outside. but inside ... The St Isaac's cathedral is more impressive. Be aware of con artists and pickpockets in that area.

oh my god. if u wnt to describe perfection, this is the place,,, the perfect view, inside ,outside, gardennothing can be more complete than this, make sure to have 4 hours for this place to see everythingand make sure to visit it by the end of each day at different times of the day, as it has different magical views depends on the light
A must.!!!!. An astonishing collection of mosaics! It's an overwhelming experience. It's a good example of the Russian church with it's typical altar.Be aware of pickpockets!

Classic Russian Architectural wonder. Incredible detail both inside and out. Try to avoid the crowds in order to fully experience the interior mosaics. This is a must see when visiting St. Petersburg. Close to one of the main streets, Nevsky Prospect which has numerous shops and restaurants. Lots of other highlights nearby.

Stunning...Must See. Truly a bucket list experience...the mosaics, the architecture, the history, the tragedy, the preservation efforts...all combine for high drama, beautiful pictures and an art history lecture brought to life.

Lots of "stone". Millions of little stone pieces decorate the internal walls of this cathedral. That it is to memory of the dead (killing) of Alexander II Is interesting, but it is now more the art works what pull the attention. Nice.

The second beautiful cathedral of St.Petersburg. This beautiful and unique Church in Nevsky street near Griboyedov Canal (the former Russian ambassador in Iran) and stone museum with stunning and eye-catching paintings. In memory of the assassinated reformist king his son built this cathedral where he found his fathers dead body

number one. Trip advisor shows this a the number one attraction, and indeed it is great. Really impressive inside and outside, the canal that runs close by, and the park add to its attractiveness. Fantastic.

Another of the great churches of the world. Although this is now a museum it is still a remarkable church. It has a real sense of history about it and I felt for Alexander who was killed here. The mosaics are magnificent and the floor design exquisite. The interior design is grand without being overwhelming and the outside is fascinating when you examine it. I just loved this place! If you are in Saint Petersburg don't miss it.
One of the must visit places in Saint Petersburg. It is very close to the Hermitage and other prominent tourist places in St. Petersburg. Very beautiful church and architecture is amazing.

Winter visit. We got in just before it closed. Purchased the headphones to translate from Russian. Good investment because the tour is very interesting. Notable things I remember are the mosaics, and the fact that the eyes of Christ in the dome look straight at you wherever you stand.

Gorgeous Artwork. Packed with Tourists . We were there on a Friday. About 1pm. Costs 700 Roubles ($11) to enter. You can see it from far but the closer you get, the prettier it is. They have removed all pews to accommodate the crowds including the large tour groups. It is beautiful inside too. Wish I could lie down on the floor for 15' to enjoy the ceiling!Excellent photo-op.

One of popular place to visit . I was taking Siteseeng tour and stop there,it is also nice historical place in sankt Petersburg, recently after restoration, recommended to anyone who like historical monuments, by travel advisor Valentina
Pretty onion domes. A must see beautiful church. The interior is exquisite but the outside is magnificent. Watch your bags - it is very busy.

Beautiful Experience. Quick stop on a private tour of St Petersburg, with skip the line privilege. Outside view was breathtaking but inside the church was better. Watch out for pickpockets, as you raise your camera to capture the ornate domes.

Fantastic mosaics and tragic historical site. It was unbelievable to see the actual piece of footpath where Alexander II was killed. Made me a little sad. But the gorgeous mosaics made me happy. Wonderful experience.

Stunning. quite spectacular but just saw from outside - but very busy -
we are not church goers and often look only from the outside but well worth a visit

Magnificent. This is a must see church whilst in St Petersburg. The building is typical Russian style and internally is magnificent. Because it is an iconic building it is very popular with tourists so make a point of visiting early

Amazing...inside and out!. This is a one of a kind place and should not be missed. The exterior is simply amazing to observe and the interior is as majestic as well.We paid 400RR plus the 200RR for the audio guide (guide not that worth it if you ask me). Make sure to really explore the inside (ceiling)...it is simply amazing and it takes about 1 hour.Be advised that there are not many places to sit down on the inside.

Beautiful!. While this church is not used today as a church, but as a museum, it is everything that I expected and wanted it to be! It is absolutely beautiful and fulfilled my expectations of what a Russian Orthodox Church should look like. It is nothing short of stunning!

Beautiful building. Beautiful place, my experience was only from the exterior,; I do not pay to enter churches, and the line for this "attraction" was long.Beautiful church and the adjacent street with it's vendors and attractions and restaurants was great.
Extremely Beautiful. Stopped by this tourist stop briefly. Wonderful looking building, with lovely atmosphere in the surrounding area.

Russian Tour. Such a wonderful trip this church is amazing the colours are so beautiful and all are different according to the weather and time of day. There is a lovely market around the outside of it although it is worth haggling with the stall holders.

Interesting and worthwhile experience. We were staying across the street at the W Hotel, and our direct view was of this church. I would recommend taking the stairs to the top of the dome and walking around. Views of the city are incredible. The church interior is quite beautiful as well.

Amazing mosaic interior!. The church, which was built as a memorial to Tsar Alexander the second on the site of his assassination is an amazing place to visit. The walls are covered in mosaics and the exterior is a riot of domes and colours. There is a souvenir market close by.
Like nothing you've ever seen!. Mind boggling! Totally blown away by the artistic design and architecture of this magnificent church.
Nice place. It is a very beautiful peace of architecture. if u go during the day the ticket will be 250 rub. it is opened till late in the evening (10pm) but after 6 the ticket is 400 rub.
Majestic!. An obviously iconic Church in St. Petersburg. I do believe it's a little more beautiful on the outside but it's still worth seeing inside.
A Masterpiece in Mosaic. One of the great sights of the city that cannot be missed as the quality of the restoration work is breathtaking
Simply beautiful church - now a museum. The stunning interior takes your breath away. We didn't climb to the colloidal but those who did said it was worth it for the views.

Not to miss. You can't miss this church. Just being around it makes you feel like you're in a storybook. Both the inside and outside are beautiful. Outside, you can visit the souvenir stands, enjoy the street artists, or visit the adjoining park.
So grand. One of the most beautiful structures in the world. It was a dream come true for me to be able to visit this place. Awesome and spiritually inspired.

Iconic church in St Petersburg. On a recent visit via cruise ship to St Petersburg, our organised tour visited this significant site where Czar Alexander II was assassinated, and the church subsequently constructed. This is a very popular tourist attraction, and although relatively new by church standards, is well worth a visit. The mosaic floors are excellent, and cover most of the floors of this medium sized church. If you can avoid the tourists, you can get some nice exterior photos on sunny days (rare in St Petersburg).

Amazing!. That's for sure one of the most beautiful and dramatic cathedrals in the world, an absolute must-see. Ans we got a great free-of-charge tour with a great guide around the cathedral, learned so many interesting details about it. The best experience in SPB.

Very interesting... A must-see sight in St.Petersburg. Very interesting and well preserved. Well worth the entrance ticket (which is not much).
The streets leading to this Church are full of life, Young couples walking hand in hand, - very romantic. The street is full of cafes (mostly tourist traps - better avoided!)
Amazing. Our guide, Raisa Shillna recommended we visit there if time permitted. We made sure to take the time and are so pleased that we did. Beautiful inside - amazing workmanship.

Do Not Miss! . This gorgeous church features floor-to-ceiling mosaics and a stunning domed ceiling. You will not see the likes of this work anywhere else in the world, I reckon. The Acoustiguide is well worth the rubles to learn the history of the building and its decoration. Briefly a warehouse during Soviet times, it is now a must-see destination.

Most Pretty Church of All Time. If you go here, you will be blown away with the amount of detail on the walls and on he thin tiles on the floor. You must go here with a guide to fully appreciate the place.

Stunning!. It was just great inside and outside! love the paintings, and the outside view, visited two times and enjoyed every second of it. outside of the church there are so many street bands and arts. full of attraction!
Very rich and impressive. The church is extremely impressive, the Russian baroque exceeds everything in the west. The after communist era invests a lot to restore the past's luxury.

WOW Beautiful Inside. The inside is stunning. So beautiful and the architecture is just incredible. What a great experience. The entry fee is well worth the money. Was able to take so many great photos inside!

Do not miss this amazing site.. Right in the middle of town, this church looks like something out of a fairy tale. Built in the style of much older cathedrals, it was completed fairly recently (in the 1880's) to commemorate the spot where a Tsar was fatally wounded. The architecture is astounding and the mosaic interior will take your breath away. Fortunately, photos are allowed, as this is not as much a functioning church as some other cathedrals in St. Petersburg.

Unbelieveable. Impossible to rate as it was so over the top decadent. It was hard to believe the opulence. There were people who were impressed, it just made me sad to know this church was built while people were starving to death.

Historic church - Must see. we had a nice tour of this church. amazing story and history. inside is all mosaic, I believe the largest in existence at this time. one of the Stones on the outside wall was left in the condition after the war, and the rest of the church was refurbished. sad to see what war does, but nice to know it was fixed up!.

Really worth a visit. Unlike anything you can enjoy in Western Europe, definitely worth a visit. The church's walls are filled with carefully and artistically crafted mosaics, and the entrance fee is not too high. Better to go before 6 p.m. though, as prices 6-10 p.m. are higher and student cards are not admitted.

Beautiful artistic church. I have seen many churches around the world but never one that was so saturated in beautiful art. Every inch of the walls are coveted inn beautiful mosaics. Highly recommend.
My native town. I live here. I love it. Come to see its beauties. There are a lot of sites where you can find hotels, prices, restaurants/. I can only show you places which a are worth seeing

Extraordinary building. This magnificent building is highly decorated on every square inch of every interior surface and the exterior is amazing too.The church is now a museum with a fascinating history.Only a short walk from the Hermitage and the Nevsky Prospect . A visit is a must if you
get the chance to see St Petersburg .

impressive from the outside, but inside... unbelievable. My visit is a while ago so I dont actually know anymore what the sacred thing about this church is - someone got killed and you can stand at that place. But what totally got me is the tiling inside the church. I have never seen anything similar (and I have seen quite a bit). Totally worth a visit - wont take you long but worth every second.

Incredible. We visited this church as part of a tour with SPb (Brilliant tour) this is the most incredible church covered wall to ceiling in mosaics. Words cant express how impressive it was as you first walk in

Must-see, a definite highlight. Not open Wednesdays. This was the one place I wanted to see in St. Petersburg and it didn't disappoint. I had a pinch me moment on seeing it for the first time. Looks fantastic in photos from a distance and doesn't disappoint up close either. It is so lavishly decorated. We were outside around 4pm and it was busy, there are alot of tour groups. Saying that we were in the ticket queue for no more than 5 minutes and then inside. We paid 250 rubles, the ticket office closes at 6pm. Inside was very crowded but you could move around and there were numerous tours in different languages. The mosaics are something else. we stayed about 30 minutes, by the time you get to take a few photos without someone walking in front of you.My photos don't do it justice. Worth checking out the exterior at night time too.
Real wonder. It is a real wonder both of its outside appearance and inside wall paintings,a most beautiful church in St.Pertersburg!

Dramatic. The history of this Church is well worth investigating but the building itself is superb. It is a not to missed visit in St Petersburg. It is both regal calming at the same time. Do not miss this treat.
A must see. Beautiful Cathedral, close to our accommodation. Easy walking with a beautiful park next door. A must see.

Amazing . Just like you can't go to Moscow without visiting the Red Square the same thing goes for the Church Of the saviour on blood. It's very amazing and breathtaking. You should at least visit it once in the morning and one other time at night, it's very weird how it's effect changes from morning to night, you must see it in both times.

Exterior, Beautiful. Interior, Emotional.. Just the sight of this church takes your breath away. And that is just the outside. I actually have no words to describe the interior except the overwhelming feeling of awe and emotionalism at it's beauty. Then the stories of it's history.....oh! Have your guide tell you (with their Russian pride beaming) of this beautiful church's history and you will be amazed. Do not think you can just view this magnificent piece of architecture from the outside! You will have missed everything.....

Don't miss this gorgeous church.. Seeing the outside of this church I felt like I was in Moscow, even though I have never visited Moscow. It has the exterior architecture of what we see in pictures of Moscow. The vibrant colors inside the church are a sight. What I thought were paintings are actually mosaics. I am glad to have had at least a brief visit here on a tour.

A stunning church. This is certainly one of the most magnificent churches I have ever seen and a highlight of our visit to St. Petersburg. There are long lines, but they are comprised mostly of tour groups. We were able to purchase tickets via the kiosk in front of the church and were in the building in about 10 minutes.

Amazing interior. The church is unusual for St Petersburg, in not being built in a classical style. We were very pleased we decided to go inside, despite the crowds, as the mosaics which cover all the walls are really worth seeing. There's also an interesting small display at the back, describing the restoration work.

Obligatory selfie outside will do. It's a unique looking building with the extravagant interior decorations you'd expect to find in a palace. It's full of religious artefacts and Russian history. Inside, there wasn't a great deal of explanations in English and the audio guide was flat and boring. It'd be better if narrated by someone more animated and the translation given more thought so to keep people's interest. Or may be its the Russian way and I should just accept it?Otherwise a few photos from outside the church will have been enough for me.
Most beautiful exterior in St Petrsburg. Amazing edifice, amazing story of ruin and rebuilding, amazing interior, do NOT miss this church. Go with a guide so you do not miss any details.
Unbelievable!!. What a fantastic place!! A MUST see in St. Petersburg!! It is very busy but worth the pushing to get around it. It is gorgeous inside and outside. I would highly recommend!!

Fantastic church. . We visited the church of the saviour on spilled blood in August and its got to be one of the most amazing churches I have ever seen. The out side architecture is truly amazing, but once inside be prepared for the thousands of pictures created in mosaic form , from floor to all over the ceiling to take your breath away. To imagine someone creating pictures out of millions of tiny fragments of tiles is unbelievable. Your allowed to video in the church, and I would really recommend you do this as its great to look back on this incredible church. St Petersburg is full of amazing buildings but this one is a definite must see.

Speechless. This is such an amazing place...a not-to-be-missed. It is difficult to describe. It took my breath away. And the thought of just how old it is, gives one pause. Yes, I was in awe of this place.

Surprised by the evening opening hours. We walked around in the evening, and found surprisingly that the church is open. However the price was higher, it was a good alternative against crowded places. The interior and the exterior of the church was amazing a good cross-section of the tzarian splendor.

Impressive!. An absolute must see in St. Petersburg. Inside the mosaics and gold work are impressive; I recommend having a guide to explain the history. The church is now a museum so there is a fee to enter.

Only saw it from the outside!!. We were brought here during a cruise ship tour but we only got to take photos of the outside of it and we didn't get a chance to go inside. It was very impressive and I enjoyed taking photos of it but wish we could have looked inside!!

5 star truly..... I have travelled every continent (except Antarctica), over 100 countries, many many cities. This church, as both a spiritual testament and an ode to architecture and the decorative arts, is unmatched. St Petersburg has almost too much to offer - we were here 7 days and only scratched the surface, but this is not to be missed, and can be visited multiple times to assimilate its glory.

Beautiful mosaic church!!. This is the most beautiful church I have been in. It is truly remarkable! It is my favorite that I have seen (compared to St. Peter's in the Vatican, St. Mark's in Venice, or Peter and Paul fortress and St. Iassac's in St. Petersburg) Do watch pick pockets in the area!!

Hugely Impressive. Stunning piece of architecture this 'onion style' topped church is what many peoples vision of Russian churches is. The area is very crowded as you would expect as on most tour intinaries and one of the 'must see' sights. Only downside of the area is that it can a be a pickpockets nirvana!

A must see when in St Petersburg. Despite queuing in the rain and shoulder to shoulder with fellow tourists, the exterior and more so the interior of this churchis very much worth the wait. Be patient and visit inside, the most stunning mosaic you will ever see. A sad story behind its construction but a very key piece of Russian culture.

Classic Russian Cathedral . A must see on a visit to St Petersburg. A short walk from the Hermitage. There are regular tours as it is a state museum rather than a active church. A tour of the church I recommend.

This sight is beautiful. I do not have enough words to explain. You just must experience it. One of the most fascinating buildings I've visited during my trip to Russia. It is located in the heart of the city in a beautiful area. Be prepared to be amazed!

Beautiful church - can be crowded. Humbling in its sheer size and with beautiful decorum. Well worth the visit, but was one of the more crowded sites in St Petersburg I visited and the only one where I overheard a touring group member had unfortunately been pickpocketed - within the church.

Beautiful on the inside and outside. This church is now a museum so you do pay to go inside.About 250R.The exterior is wonderful so walk around to see it from the different sides. Try wandering into the Mikhaylovski Gardens next door for some of the best views. The best views are as you walk down next to the canal that runs from Nevsky Prospekt to the church.Inside it is very ornate with lots of mosaics and gold. Each wall tells a bible message.Whatever your beliefs this is a must in St Petersburg

Beautiful day & night. As this was near our hotel, we were able to visit several times during our stay. It is amazing. We went later in the day, and the queue was small. They appeared to have electronic ticketing machines also. Amazing inside and out. The area outside offered vendors with inexpensive souvenirs, and handcrafts. We were fortunate to find two different artists selling their original works (not mass produced paintings) near the church. Easy access; though queues were long during the day. I recommend going in the afternoon if possible.
Stunning!. Wow! The mosaics and atmosphere! An absolute must see in St Petersburg! Useful to have a guide to explain the history and organise the tickets.

Incredible mosaic church . We have seen several special churches in Europe but this was the first one that was completely covered in mosaics and it was breathtaking. Definitely see this church if you are in St Petersburg.

Breathtaking tiles. I was surprised by how moved I was by my experience in this church. The images on the walls, the quality of light and the history was humbling. Russia has so many stories to tell and this church captures a small chapter.
Incredibly decorated, amazing architecture. Very colourful and highly decorated cathedral. Definitely worth a visit. Watch out for pickpockets - very active in this area.
Amazing Inside and Out.. St Petersburg is full of surprises. The history of this church is well worth reading. The interior mozaic decorations covering over 7000 sqm are just inpiring.

Impressive architecture and decoration. Having seen this one before seeing Saint Basil's in Moscow I actually preferred this one. Every inch of the walls inside are decorated and it really is quite impressive!

A Gem. The outside is beautiful with the soaring gold dome tops. I was not aware that there are no pews or seats in Russian churches. The entire service is attended with the congregation standing. The sanctuary is very ornate with magnificent mosaics. This church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated.This is not a good choice for anyone with mobility issues. There is a a series of steps outside and no handicapped access. This is also a HUGE site for pickpockets. Keep your passports and large bills under your clothes.

Mosaics of the highest calibre!. The highlight of this Church are the mosaics. They made it through WWII and Communism, which in itself is quite a story. The church is quite crowded, so be prepared to take your time and keep your cool as it can get a bit close at times.

Beautiful Cathedral built for a sad reason. Reminded us a bit of St. Basil's Cathedral in Red Square with its colorful onion domes. Interesting story about an unexploded world war II shell lodged in one of the domes for several years. Must see in SPB.

Most decorated Church... Breathtaking views inside. This church boasts a dramatic Russian style exterior & is built on the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander II the church is decorated with colourful ceramic tiles from outside & an amazing display of arts & huge paintings from floor-to-celling. Not an inch of space is left inside not decorated... Just out of this world so far that I have seen... Breathtaking indeed...
Saw exterior only. Very pretty!. Was on a Princess cruise and had only a little time on 2nd day there, so we wandered the shopping kiosks along the canal and walked around the outside of this church.

Stunning interior. From the outside, you know it's going to be quite something but inside is more than you'd expect. Every inch is covered in decoration. My little girl thought it was beautiful too. There are lots of people inside but you can still get to see everything. There were several visitors with mobility issues, so I presume it's accessible. Certainly it was ok with kids. The little market outside has some lovely souvenirs to buy afterwards.
Copy of Moscow cathederal. A beautiful building similar to Saint Basil's cathedral Moscow. At night in lights it looks enchanting. The history behind it is also interesting.

Very beautiful. On the outside this church has multicolored domes. On the inside the walls are covered with mosaic pictures. There are several chandeliers hanging from the ceiling which is also covered with mosaics.
Amazing building!. A soon as you turn the corner, there it is. The building is so stunning with magnificent domes and lathered in gold.

Stunning church from the outside with an even bigger surprise inside. I thought this church was one of the prettiest churches I've ever seen. Then inside blew me away. The mosaics were stunning and very detailed. The colors were bright and sending a clear story.

Eye catching . Although I never ventured inside the Church, it is relatively inexpensive at around 300r. The views from outside are amazing, take a walk around the outside and the views just get better and better. The mixture of shapes and colour work so well together. Just be aware that it can be very busy which can bring along some pickpockets although I never saw any. Well worth a visit.
Stunning. While our group did not have a chance to see the interior, the spectacular, colorful architecture was so impressive. There is no question that this is an attraction not to be missed.
Beautiful church. Beautiful church -- did not see the inside. Great place for photos. The history of the place (built on the spot where Alexander Ii was assassinated) is interesting.

Best site in St. Petersburg . We really enjoyed the Church!
It's something unique and really worth seeing: the queue is not too long and once inside you will be amazed by the fantastic interior.
A must go

OK, it's dramatic, but the crowds are suffocating. I'm not sure what we expected, but once you get beyond the initial wow of the exterior, it can appear almost gaudy up close. The interior is extremely busy. Sort of like the rest of St. Petersburg, crowded and not a particularly safe place.
Rich mosaics that look like vivid paintings!. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is an absolute must see! The fantastic exterior is only matched by the painting-like mosaics inside.

BEAUTIFUL! It takes your breath away.. This is so breathtaking. The crowds can be large so either get there early our try to book Guide Guru (Anna) like we did. No waiting in line with them. The Gold the walls the tombs, the feeling you get are goose bumpy.

Beautiful. Amazing place - make sure you go inside and try to read about the history of the place as its kind of interesting.I'd recommend going early for photos outside before the crowds arrive (9am should be fine) then go for a walk and a coffee and come back around midday. You shouldn't need to wait in line for a ticket to go inside that way.

Not as impressive as the pictures. The church is nice but not as impressive or colourful as the pictures depict. The streets along the river near the church have vendors selling a variety of cool items. Also, the church has lot of buildings surrounding it so it's hard to get nice clean pictures of the monument. I didn't go inside so not sure how the interiors are.

Beautiful. We really loved this church inside and out. The outside is so interesting and so "Russian" looking. The inside was simply stunning. Colorful mosaics covering the walls and ceilings. The church contains a shrine to Alexander II who was assassinated on that site.

Wonderful example of truly Russian architecture. We didn't have time to visit the interior but the exterior is fantastic and well worth travelling to see it. Also gives you a chance to wander along the canals and/or visit the huge park adjacent to the cathedral

Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. The church is not used as a church any longer. It is strictly a tourist attraction. Beautiful on the inside, but very crowded. Groups are let in before the general public.
Wow what a place to visit!. Went to visit this during an organised tour. Well kept and wonderful to see. You must see this in St P.

Similar with St. Basil's Cathedral Moscow. This church building reminds us to St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.
Beautiful church near the canal. Couldn't take a good photo of me because too many people.

Not a typical Orthodox church, but absolutely impressive. You need to see this while in St. Petersburg. Inside and outside - outstanding architecture, materials and engineering. We were amazed. Well preserved (during WWII was used as an orientation point, so not bombed at all) - it's #1 in St. Petersburg (after Hermitage) on our list.
Amazing church. A truly great historical church with character, charm and great architecture. Strongly recommended for a tour.

Historic Church - Must be Seen. Interesting visit to this historic church with spectacular interiors. Alexander II died of wounds inflicted in an attack by a terrorist group and his heir, Alexander III, declared his intention to erect a church on the site in his father's memory. This church is built in "traditional Russian" style.
Breathe taking. One of the most beautiful churches in Europe. Well worth the time to spend going inside and viewing the cathedral.

Most decorated church . This is amazing just on the outside but make the effort and go inside it is well worth it. Don't go in the long queue just beside the ticket office you can purchase tickets from the machine and very few people seem to use these, not sure why it saved us lots of time
stunning view. Visit it during night time..the reflections on the canal are just amazing and the overall view remarkable.

A Splendid Place ... though locals think it's kitschy. This is a splendid church--multi-colored, fabulous tile work, domes and other variations on roofs on the outside Inside is splendid and colorful as well. Our guide said locals find this church kitschy -- but we loved it, and it is a must-see.

What a sight!. I stumbled onto this amazing building when I was simply walking around in the city. I didn't even need to go in, it is simply amazing! Go there if you are in town, even if you only have a few hours.
Beautiful church. The most beautiful Ortodox temple I ever saw, better than St. Basil's at Moscow. Must arrive early because of the waiting lines in high season.

Stunning and a MUST in Saint Petersburg! . Amazing to see!!!
They have free guides starting regularly the excursions when you get in (in Russian).
You can ask questions. Really informative and fascinating!!!

Beautiful Church. All of the churches throughout Europe are beginning to run together in my mind, but this church was gorgeous. In fact, in St. Petersburg, one church seemed to be more beautiful than the next.

Very Russian, stands out beautiful. If something good did follow the assassination of tsar Alexander II it will be this church. Very Russian, which does stand out in the furthermore western air that the city breathes. Beautiful structure from the outside, symetric, walk around it on your way to the restaurants around, like Jamie's, or as a detour after gaping at DLT, the city's poche department store.
Charming church. A lot of history is there. Church itself is more beautiful from outside rather than from inside. But worth visiting to feel the spirit of 20th century
Spectacular in and out!. Well worth a visit, colourful domes on the outside and rich mosaics cover the inside, souvenir stalls along the canal are interesting too.
If you only do one thing, do this. This church is just astounding. The architect outside makes you keep looking but the inside is even better. I got neck ache from looking up. Wow wow wow

Grandiose. We visited with T J travel and were amazed that the 'paintings' are in facet mosaics.Very Russian feel to the inside which is wonderful. The cupolas outside remind you of the Kremilin.Well worth a visit but watch out for pickpockets.Highly recommended.

Worth getting headset. Only takes a little time yo loot round so worth getting headset and stopping to hear the history of the church. We paid for one audio guide but they give you two sets of ear plugs ( it takes both sets ) as you can listen together. Also nice little stalls and bars run along the walkway of the canal. Relaxing few hours.

Worth the visit for the colors. Outside, stunning at every angle. Inside stunning at every turn with amazing, hand crafted mosaics. Not your average church. Walk in and around to see the artwork in mosaic. Plenty of observers and small groups, but you will be distracted but the handiwork. Entrance is 500 rubles/pp, book the ticket from the electronic kiosk (english available) get your ticket and avoid a line. Worth the quick visit for the visual drama.
Gorgeous church. Truly an outstanding structure and wonderful icons and paintings inside the church .The jewel of St.Petersburg.The view of the church from the bridges too are good .

Must see inside and out!. If at all possible, (1) tour this church with a knowledgeable guide, and (2) learn the history behind the church before you visit so you can appreciate it better. There is way more to this church than beautiful pictures, so do yourself a favor, and wait to see this until you've had a chance to learn a little Russian (and St. Petersburg) history. We were lucky enough to meet a newly married couple celebrating and taking pictures across the street; was a great reminder that this isn't just a tourist attraction but a house of worship.

Remarkable Inside and Outside. As you approach from the outside you know you are in for a treat as you see the different colored domes stand out on a bright sunny day. Going inside it is quite crowded due to all the tour groups but you will usually be looking up at the walls and ceilings looking at mosaic scenes from the new testament. The interior will leave you just standing there in amazement.
OH LA LA. The building is amazing, but once you'receive inside... Wow! I won't say anything else, you have to see it by yourself!
Don't miss it!. A very colourfuf exterior and stunning mosaics inside. And one discovers a piece of history about Alexander The Liberator...
Breathtaking building. So beautiful both on the outside and the inside. The history of the the church is also very interesting. One of "must see" in St. Petersburg.

Under construction limits experience. The building is currently under construction so it is usually only possible to see the outside which of course limits the enjoyment substantially given that the interior is what is very unique about this particular church.

Buy the tickets in the automatic machine.. Avoid the lines buy in the machine but you must have smaller bank notes. I would say that the church is more beautiful from the outside but the price of entrance is cheap. You can see the place where the czar was murdered and nothing much.
Three days in St Petersburg. Not to be missed. It is truly an amazing place and an amazing story. SPB tours was the best guide possible.

Very intereting. We visited when many cruise ships were in, so there was overcrowding. Amazing architecture and history. Included as part of a 2 day tour so not sure what the price was. We only spent 10 minutes inside.

Amazing Architecture. The site of Czar Alexander's assassination, now surrounded by an Orthodox Church. Amazing frescos (icons) and arches.
Top tip: watch out for pick pockets. They're everywhere.
Amazing historical site

Beautiful church converted to museum. This is beautiful church with remarkable mozaic surrounding the church interior. This is no longer being used as a church but it becomes state museum. Location isn't far from busy street Nevsky Prospekt. A must visit for SPB tourist.
Beautiful and interesting. So beautiful both on the outside and the inside. The history of the the church was also very interesting. A must see.

A beautiful building. We visited this building on Russia Day so besides the occupants from 7 cruise ships docked, lots of Russians were taking the opportunity of having a day out. It was really crowded so we didn't spend a great deal of time inside. It is quite magnificent to see both the interior and the exterior and a must place to visit.

Beautiful inside and out, a quick shot of culture!. Like an esspresso this 'Church' (its actually a memorial) is quick, intense and delightful. I highly recommend the audio tour (read by a Russle Crow wannabe) to take you round. Theres only a few rooms, but the tour really helps to make sense of what the building is about and how it is laid out. It is also really informative. Without it you'll miss lots (like the fact it was a vegetable warehouse during Soviet times).

Amazing ... not to be missed!. We were brought here by our guide from TJ Travel and we are all overwhelmed by the beauty and extravagant colors and architecture of this building.The exterior is gorgeous, but the interior is even more breath taking.Words can not describe how intricate and detailed everything is.You have to see it for yourself.
Amazing church. The church is all coverd with the mosaic inside, forming alot of graphics releted to the Christ and Christian as well.

Very crowded but worth it. This is a very popular place but extremely crowded. They do limit the numbers on entry but not exit so is very squashy inside. Worth a look. The outside is a haven for pick pockets and hawkers with animals , getting photos then asking for money.
Multi-colours and onion shaped spires. Don't miss this church. Imposing presence outside and so much history attached to it. Fascinating to see.

Favorite Stop in St. Petersburg. This was the final stop on our trip to St. Petersburg and I couldn't have thought of a better experience than our tour of the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. The outside is amazing. The inside is just as beautiful. It's smaller than you think, but beautiful none the less. One interesting note, you can find a rare painting of a 10-12 year old Jesus Christ inside the Church. Take your time walking around inside, soak it in because it's absolutely beautiful.

Stunning Cathedral - Highlight of Saint Petersburg. Seeing this cathedral is a very powerful experience. Not only is the intricacy of the mosaic-work impressive, but the images themselves are very beautiful. The artwork is laid out so that certain scenes mirror or relate to nearby ones, or juxtapose those opposite them. We were floored by the design, the images, the light, and the beauty. The history of the cathedral itself is interesting with regard to the assassination of the Tsar, the destruction during WWII, the restoration, etc. In a city of over-the-top sights, this is both impressive and overwhelming, but still powerful and in a way, personal.
Must see. We have visited this museum and were amazed by the mosaic work inside and how it looked from outside. It's similar to the church in Moscow. Very beautiful design.

No visit to St. Petersburg without it. This church is one of St. Petersburg's most beautiful und stunning places to visit in St. Petersburg. The mosaics inside the church are fantastic. Whether to take a first look in 20 minutes or spend one ore two hours for more details, both is worth going there.The admission is more expensive in the evenings, still there are smaller lines at this time of the day.

Lovely church. So this Church is lovely from the outside. It also is a great area to wonder round with a open street market behind with souvenirs.The question to pay for tickets were long. So we did not go in.Well worth a look at though

Beautiful, certainly inside. One of the most visited chuches in St.Petersburg. Maybe from the outside not the most impressive one but inside is another story. You cannot compare it with any other church, you have to see it yourself. Hard to describe the mosaics (from top to bottom) which are so colourfull. Go and see it (only a few euro's or dollars entrance) 250 rubles and be amazed. Walk along the canal and end up on the Nevsky Prospekt
Amazing. Blown away by the amazing building and colours of the Church. Not busy when we went, but can be very busy. A must see

Nice architecture but a bit commercial . We went to this church on a rainy day. The queue was acceptable. We waited for less than 10 minutes to get our tickets which costs 250 rubles. Inside the church is beautiful but what i didn't appreciate was the commercial side to see religious people selling all sorts of souvenir and books all over the church. I recommend to relocate those selling areas to one single spot on the side. Hope that my message will reach the decision makers in order to act accordingly.

Great Example of Russian Cathedral. Exterior is really fantastic! It is a must visit site....be ready with your camera but be advised that it is tall so positioning for a good photo is important. Lots of people milling about so hard to find a shot!

Gorgeous mosaics. I was so excited to visit this church. The interior and exterior is stunning. Mosaics from floor to ceiling. I am so impressed with how the Russians have brought these national treasures back to their glory. We were told that during the Cold War the communists stored potatoes in this gorgeous church. It is absolutely lovely. Although the interior is the showstopper, spend time looking at the exterior and the surrounding fence. Hold your belongings close to you for it is also well known as a site for pickpockets.

St. Basil's all over. Interesting to see the differences in the two churches, the mosaics being phenomenal. Learning the architecture interesting. As all churches in Russia, overwhelmingly beautiful on the inside.

A feast for the eyes. Exquisite architecture with a feast for the eyes inside this church. Everywhere you gaze there is beauty. The only downside were the hoards of people. Difficult to take photos. I would recommend getting there very early or late.
Great place. Great place to visit the history was amazing the art even better well worth a visit. Very busy all the time watch out for pickpockets they are very adept
Church of Savior on Spilled Blood. Awe inspiring church completely designed with mosaics. The history of this church is quite unbelievable.
Beautiful Church!! . So rich in history and details!!! The Bible in wall mosaics!! Go early morning, it is always very crowed, but is a place to see!!

Crowded but very beautifully restored.. Plan your visit with patience in mind. There may be long queues, especially if a cruise ship in nearby. But worth the wait to squeeze inside and see how they've magificently restored this beautiful church.

So beautiful, its a definite must see. You can see the beautiful onion tops from miles around. It is only 250 roubles to enter but it does get very busy in there when the coaches arrive. The paintings inside are amazing!

This is a must see church from top to bottom. This is not your usual church , there are no weddings or funerals held here, the party of Russian army cadets in front were there to see the spot where a Tsar was assassinated hence the soiled blood. Inside extravagant mosaics from floor to roof with great skill and telling in chips of stone what is elsewhere painted.
Amazing sight. One of the most beautiful churches I have seen and is located centrally. Visited the sight several times as it is hard to get sick of the view.
Beautiful church. Very beautiful church, but definitely not the number one destination in Saint Petersburg. Nice area though.
A great place. A great place to visit. The interiors are excellent and the art work is also great. I found it crowded but a great place to visit.
This is stunning dear. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is the iconic church of this great city. Somewhere you just have to visit when in town.I'll let the photo's speak for themselves
The most beautiful church I've ever seen. This experience was such a great moment in my life. The beauty and the mosaics inside make you amazed. By far, the most beautiful for me

Beautiful Church Beautifully Renovated. If you believe the story, the assassination of tsar Alexander II on this spot in 1881 changed world history. The tsar, so the story goes, was prepared to steer Russia to a constitutional monarchy and actually had a copy of the new constitution in his pocket. We'll never know what would have happened as he was killed by a group of assassins, who also killed several other people along with him.Alexander's grieving royal family built this magnificent church on the spot where the attack occurred.The church is situated along several sight lines, so it's very dramatic and hard to miss. If you don't like a particular view due to wires or vendor stalls (which can often be the case), either walk around for a different view or come at an earlier time as it is dramatic in many directions.One thing you may note is that the church is in a more Russian Byzantine style than in the western style that typifies much of the architecture in this city. Tsar Alexander III, the son of the slain ruler, was trying to get back more to Russia's roots.The interior of the church was looted during the revolution and largely ruined. With the collapse of the Soviet Union, however, the church has been extensively and beautifully renovated.Please note that most of the artwork is not painted, but, rather, consists of fine mosaics. It is one of the contenders for the largest collections of mosaics in the world.This is now a popular attraction. Although crowded, most of the art is in the form of mosaics in the walls and ceilings, so the crowds won't obscure your views. The area around the church is also very popular, but if you want a nice empty view, just come in the early morning before all the tourists and vendors arrive.This is one of those must-see attractions in St. Petersburg and one you should enjoy.
Beautiful . Very beautiful interior, with intricate mosaics. Too many people did negatively affevt our visit, but still it is a must see
Spectacular interior. We viewed this church from outside on our last trip - 16 years ago - what a surprise on entering. It was magnificent

Very Ornate but Beautiful. A beautiful church. Careful of pickpockets. The interior design and colours are fascinating and all the photos you see show you just what you will see for yourself and seeing it for yourself is what you need to do. This is one of the top attractions in St Petersburg and deservedly so.

How can you not go?. No way you can visit St Petersburg and not go see this church. You can see it in the distance from all around the city. Up close and personal it will take your breath away (especially if you're agoraphobic; there's so many people inside that you'll be shoulder to shoulder).

pleasant experience. There was almost no queue for the tickets and for the entrance, which I liked very much after previous experience. You can access the church from both sides and you can visit when taking a walk around the city centre. Athough you will not have a guided visit without a group ticket, you can always listen to the guide next to you, as there are many people inside, mostly groups. Your neck will hurt, because you have to look constantly upwards, but it is worth it. There is a souvenir shop inside if you want a souvenir. The exit is on the side near Nevsky prospekt.

Amazing from the outside as well as inside. The view of the Church is gorgeous. Once inside it's very crowded, and while there are things to see (the spot where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded), Icons, altars, I wouldn't spend too much time inside.

Very busy, popular attraction but worth a visit.. The official name of this church is the Church of the Resurrection of Christ but it is known as the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood as it is built on the spot that Tsar Alexander II was mortally wounded in an assassination attempt in 1881. The beautiful 7000 sq m of mosaics in this five domed, Russian Orthodox exterior Church are stunning. It took 24 years to build the elaborate Church and a further 27 years to complete the restoration after years of Soviet abuse. A MUST VISIT.

Interesting. An interesting place to visit, it is very beautiful and the reason it is built where it is, is the interesting thing. Certainly worth the money. If there are long queues it is worth noting you can get tickets from a machine outside of the church!

Wow. This is a fine example of Russian Architecture. This is simply superb.
This detailing in the cathedral is beyond imagination.

Wow! Both inside and out. Must see!. You don't need to be religious to enjoy this architecture masterpiece. It reminded me inside a little of St. Sophia in Instanbul. It's a great photo opportunity outside the cathedral down the street along the canal. As our tour guide shared with us, please be careful of pickpockets; you will be distracted with the crowds and the beauty of the church.

Beautiful church. One of the main sights of St Petersburg built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881.The church was built between 1883 and 1907. The construction was funded by the imperial family.

Ok. Ok, the Church of the savior on the spilled Blood was ok, but a little bit disappoitment. Of course it is beautiful, but there is no ceremonies in the church. So it is "only" really beautiful walls, windows, roofs. And lot of turists. You can buy tickets outside the church, by the "kacca".

Gorgeous. Did not realise how beautiful the interior was going to be. The mosaics depicting biblical scenes were arresting. A small tip for photography: facing the church from Nevsky Prospect, the rig side of the canal is busier with souvenir stalls and pedestrians. Approach the church from the left side, you'll have more room to take photos and the most gorgeous view is from the bridge half way up the canal.

Exceptional!. As you approach this church, you are struck by the brightly colored onion domes, intricate detail work and glittering spires. This church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in 1881by terrorists. When you step inside, you will be amazed at the interior. The church only reopened in 1997 after having been closed for over 30 years. The church contains over 80,000 square feet of mosaics - according to its restorers, more than any other church in the world. The intricately detailed mosaics depict biblical scenes and figures, with fine patterned borders setting off each picture. These mosaics were designed and created by the most prominent Russian artists of that time. An elaborate shrine was constructed on the exact place of Alexander's death, garnished with topaz, lazurite and other semi-precious stones. When you stand on Nevsky Prospekt, the views of this church are absolutely breathtaking. Admission Fee – Wheelchair accessible

Absolutely stunning!. An incredible place to visit. It was packed with tourists inside when we visited, but as you're mostly looking up at the beautiful mosaic and ceiling, it didn't bother us! Cost around 350 roubles per person I think, to get in. Quite hard to get a nice clear shot from a distance due to all the electric wiring overhead - but worth a trip to see all the detail up close, and a nice stroll along the canal. Some souvenir shops to browse along the way, and a few restaurants as well.
Beautiful both inside and out. Whilst not as old as some of the churches, this one certainly rates for its stunning beauty. The interior is steeped with gold, the opulence is breathtaking.
