Pick pockets. Amazing church and markets. Unfortunately, although forewarned had purse, usually in bra nicked from bag while buying ice cream. Beware they work in pairs and quickly fleeced $600 AU before I cancelled card
Beatiful Russian church. One of the most touristy churches in the center, typical Russian architecture, a must visit in Pieter's. A fee is charged at the entrance.
tour. An absolutely fascinating place. Not to be missed. Never seen anything like it before. has such an interesting history
Beautiful church. The most beautiful, most colorful Orthodox church on this Russian tour yet (only Moscow and St Petersburg, mind you). Did not go inside, as son was bored.
Beautifull. Great place probably best church I ve ever visited ..the place has its own aura and o really great place

Inspiring Orthodox Church . Church of the spilled blood has a fascinating history. The story and the way the assassination site was tied into Christian ideas through art makes it a must see. The rest of the church is covered in artwork depicting people and scenes from the bible. I never knew mosaics could be so beautiful. Some of the mosaics made me tear up. I would recommend this church to anyone interested who loves mosaics, architecture or Christian art.
Amazing. Photos don't do it justice. If you only have time for 1 interior visit, this has to be it! The exterior is so iconic, I was not prepared for how stunning the interior is.

Grand!. Alexander III built the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood in 1883 on the site where his father, Alexander II was fatally wounded in 1881. The church was completed in 1907. It locates along the Griboedov Canal with paved roads run along either side. Tsar Alexander was a reformer/liberator who abolishes Russia's serfs system in 1861-liberated peasants bound to their landlords. This reform and others substantially offended landlords and nobility hurting their wallets and privilege. 20 years later, onMarch 13, 1881, as Tsar Alexander's carriage passed along the bank, two concessive grenades thrown by anarchist conspirators exploded and kill the Tsar. An impressive church and a respectable person worthy of commemoration.

Breathtaking . Breathtaking church on the inside and out. All the pictures I had seen were of the outside but then when we went inside we were amazed again! The detail is amazing. We visited twice and took so many photos. It was great to have a knowledgeable guide!Definitely must visit!!
Beautiful Church!. Great Mosaics! It seems quite busy at first but once inside everyone moves around so it is not bad at all.

Beautiful Church that Rivals St. Basil's. We did not have time to go in to the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood, but you have to take time to at least stroll around the exterior. It is a BEAUTIFUL church with architecture and artistry that rivals St. Basil's.

Lacked atmosphere. We visited this church as part of a tour which also included St Isaac's and Kazan cathedral. My husband and I had been looking forward to it, having seen some photos that showed the magnificent mosaics, apparently more than any other church in the world, but when we got in we were underwhelmed. Somehow the place lacked atmosphere and felt somehow sterile. Perhaps that is because it has been a museum rather than a place of worship for so long, and has undergone extensive restoration. The outside, and the roof in particular, is spectacular.
Amazing. This is one beautifull and historical site ,the range of mosaic pictures is breathtaking.Make sure you have plenty of time to look around.
Wonderful!. Just don't miss it.Also visit insisde of the church. Keep your way to Mikhail park and Petro and Paul fortress.

nice view with old style building. ST PETERSBURG Is a very nice city, all my friends say that is fantastic in may/ June period , i hope to came back in this period because is a fabulous place i want to recommending at all

Jewel on the river. What a beautiful church.It reminded me of Ghaudi. From any angle its a complete different picture.A atmosphere of tranquillity surrounded the church.One of the most picturesque places in St Petersburg to visit.
Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. A must to see outside and absolutely stunning inside, easy to findvery busy place , nothing in English only books to buy.
Marvellous church made from marble. Very unusual style for Russian church. Made of marble it is marvellous inside and outside. Must to see

Breathtaking mosaics.. This church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was mortally wounded in March 1881, in spite of his reforms or maybe because of them. He freed the serfs from their virtual enslavement which perhaps explains why this church could be built almost entirely from donations by the people. The irony is that after it was finished, only the nobility were allowed to worship inside, the masses had to stand outside. It was never a church in the usual sense, the only services held were to commemorate Alexander.The gold, green, blue and yellow colours on the domes are what attract the eye but there are colours elsewhere on the building too. Our guide Xenia described the architectural style as Orthodox fused with Art Nouveau, and told us it was damaged after the Revolution in 1919. It was shut down in the 1930's when the Bolsheviks destroyed many churches throughout Russia and instead was used firstly for storing vegetables and then, during the Siege of Leningrad, as a morgue. After the war it was closed for many years due to extensive renovations and was opened again in 1997.This is a very popular tourist attraction and both inside and outside it was a scrum. It was difficult to fully appreciate anything very much inside because of the number of people. I found it impossible to think of it as a church at all, but could admire the over 7000 square meters of mosaics that completely cover the walls and ceiling. There is a small exhibition of some atrefacts and details of the renovation. It does seem a little gloomy inside as it is lit from natural light.

Stunning - inside & out. What a stunning Church! I'd seen plenty of photos but it was still wonderful to see the Church in person. The building is clearly beautiful from the outside and it is equally amazing inside. Clearly it is heaving with tourists so be prepared to fight your way through them, inside and outside.

Stunning. This is the church with multicoloured onion domes that is often portrayed in advertising for St. Petersburg. The building is stunning, the interior being completely covered with mosaics. The history is also interesting, visit and you will learn how it came to be situated in this location and tagged with such an unusual name.
Super nice. This is the place that we have to visit in St.Petersburg. The location is in the city center. Great place ever.
see outside. There is no need to go in just view the outside,Great but not as great as St Basil in Moscow.Beware of pickpockets who workmen teams.Your back pockets belong to them.

Amazing inside and out.. While I am not one for religion. But when I seen pictures of this chapel online I had to go. It costs 250 RUB about £2.5 before 5.30. Which it then closes until 6-10 and then costs 400 RUB which is near £5. While no longer an active Church. It is amazing inside with tiled pictures of various Orthodox saints.It was built over the place where Tsar Alexander I was assassinated in 1881. While the views are amazing, there Is too many people allowed in at once which can be annoying and little room to move, plus nothing extra to see. so spend about 10-15mins inside.
Amazing..well worth a visit. The inside of this church has to be seen! The mosaics are incredible. It's very busy though but worth it.

Beatiful church, recommended. It was a bit too crowded but it is wasn't nothing too bad.I would recommend to rent an audio guide. It reveals some interesting facts about the history and architecture of the place.

Worth the visit. Very similar to Saint Basil in Moscow (Building many years later), yet the interior is more like the Vatican. The amazing artwork and icons located through the body of the church is amazing and photos (no flashes) are allowed. The church is very crowded and there are significant tourist activities around the church - our guide advised us the area was well know for pick pocket - so keep you bag/purse safe!Well worth the visit.
Great photo op but inside visits restricted. There is a good angle off the bridge for a great shot of this church. Very moving historical storyInside visits are restricted based on construction

beautiful church. travel to Russia feel like do pilgrim. most of recommendation tourist place is church. And all Church is beautiful. i do see all unique architect/design/art did by best person. reading history how they make and build, its can't imagine how they talented. only an advice take attention to give more sign/information in english not only Russian....love to visit again and thank you google maps an app helps us find way to go anywhere while not easy to find guidance/someone in english. ps : we do self tour
Church of Spilled blood. Very interesting. Wonderful architecture and mosaics. This was a very unusual piece of history and graphically appalling.

Must see while in Russia. Yes this was part of a tour group with SAP tours and it was one of the highlights. Would not miss it and yes it was crowed in June but everywhere in St. Petersburg is crowded.

Overwhelmingly beautiful. You really can not absorb all the beautiful mosaics and artwork here even with the icons missing the walls, ceiling and floors are overwhelming. The gold gilding is unsurpassed anywhere else in the world. The history and story of the end of Russian imperialism is fascinating and the details of the soviet occupation of the church is captivating. The outside is fairytale like building. It is in a park frequented by brides and wedding parties and a horse drawn carriages with ponies and lent even more atmosphere to the cathedral. When we were there they were riding ski jets down the canal. So weird, but so Russian apparently.
beautiful. This was the best example of Russian mosaics out of most of the other churches I went to. The place was very crowded, but I can see why.
A brilliant design and restoration. . One of the many outrageously beautiful cathedrals this city has to offer. The fantastic memorial to a murdered monarch. A must see.
Interesting art work. This is not a huge place so you can do it quickly. It includes very impressive art work. Paintings on the walls and ceiling is stunning. Church itself from outside is great.

Short & Beautiful. The tour itself is very short but the interior is beautiful. You can take a lot of pictures inside, but the sanctity of the place is lost with so many tourist groups and no place to sit and absorb the beautiful interior. We also took a lot of pictures outside which are very beautiful with the church on the background.
Ok. The outside of the church is pretty to look at .it has the history and a place marked inside with where the tsar was killed. however if you're not into churches this is not the place for you

not to be missed. The architecture is a historical monument & work of art. Its mosaic, ceramic & enamel ornaments are unique as decorating this church took 24 years.. The church is 81 meters high & dome has mostly the mosaic work.

very beautiful. htis church is a must-see in my opinion, the inside decor is breathtaking, so beaufitly done, i liked it much more than the saint isaac cathedreal.the outside design is also very pretty, the russian museum is close by and the summer garden, so you can combine all three in one day.

Has to be seen to be believed!. As you drive round St Petersberg you keep getting tempting sights of the multi-coloured domes of the church but its still a shock when you arrive and see the building in its glory. And inside takes your breath away. All mosaic; colourful in every last corner. used as a warehouse at one point in its history but now restored to its full glory - WOW! I havenever seen anything like it and understand why some guidebooks have it in no 1 position in popularity.
Wonderful Mosaics. Mosaics inside are very. very good. But hard to understand without a guide or some pre-reading. The outside is still the better view

Every nook and cranny covered!. This church is visually stunning, both inside and out! This church is a must see. We visited the outside with a guide, and returned the next day by ourselves to explore the inside.
There is a beautiful canal next to the church.
Close to Nevsky Prospect.
Beautiful church. Inspired to St Basil's cathedral in Moskow, it is colourful and twice as high. You cannot miss it if you are in St Petersburg

Fantastic Church. The Church of the Savior on the Spilled Blood Cathedral- built over 100 years ago on the site of assassination of Emperor Alexander II. It is absolutely gorgeous and serves as both a Museum and a Russian Orthodox cathedral. Inside there are beautiful mosaics, 308 in total, interestingly there are no paintings! We learned that Russian Orthodox churches are laid out in a specific way with icons to the west and the alter to the east., here it is just the opposite. The alter is marble and looks like wood and is adorned with gold. Outside it is massive with large, classic Russian looking spires.
Spectacular!. The inside is as amazing as the outside! Make sure you find the spot where Alexander II, was assassinated. A can't miss!!
Another Wonder of St Petersburg. This is a magnificent church that now serves as a museum. It is wonderfully restored and must be seen. Don't miss it.
Evening light made the church glow. Amazingly beautiful, inside and out. No queues in the evening, highly recommended visiting time. Church is closed on Wednesdays.

What you imagine a Russian cathedral looks like. Insanely beautiful. Bursting with color and over the top design. Each onion dome has a unique, and enchanting form. Truly spectacular and not to be missed.

Amazing iconostasis. This is a fascinating church both in history and art work. Much is a reconstruction but it is exceedingly painstaking. I can see this being used as a church once again. The reconstructed iconostasis is extraordinary.
Extraordinary and beautiful. The mosaics inside are stunning and I have never seen anything to compare... well worth a visit and highly recommended.
beautiful church. this church is worth the visit for sure ! We loved the beautiful decorations inside and would recommend to all !

Just amazing. One if the tourists places in St.Petersburg, but by far one of the MUST to see once you are here! Some pictures cannot captivate the feeling you have while arriving there and standing in front of this beatiful work of art with so much history and pain behind it! Just amaizing!

Amazingly beautiful. It's glorious, you totally can not miss this in Petersburg. It's very beautiful from the outside so if you don't have the time to go inside - don't worry. But still, going in is very cheap and you don't have to cue (at least I didn't have to). The small souvenir stalls outside the church are quite alright - not any pricier than anywhere else.

Gorgeous! But Too Crowded to Move. The church is incredibly gorgeous! The entire interior is covered in mosaics. The exterior, with its richly-decorated onion domes is a photographer's dream - except for all those people. Wow! Huge crowds standing outside waiting to get in. Then a line to get in. Then packed shoulder to shoulder once you are in. Watch your valuables!

Majestic. Walking distance from the Winter Palace and only a few blocks from a Metro stop, this church ranks among the "must see" sights of St. Petersburg. Take numerous photos outside from various angles, but it's also worth standing in the ticket line to gain entry inside. Many more beautiful views there.Note: any church in Russia that charges admission and allows photos inside is now much more a museum and tourist site than an actual practicing church now.
Historically noteworthy. Not actually a church, lots of local artists around the grounds, Lots of young couples taking wedding portraits with this as a background
Beautiful experience.. Amazing experience with a fantastic guide Enena from SPB tours. So worth the visit and not to be missed in St Petersburg.

An essential part of a trip to St Petersburg. Beautiful and very unique church with an interesting history, which makes it a must-see. It can be seen for free from the outside but you have to pay and jostle with many other tourists to see the interior (it is a pretty spectacular though).
Another essential visit. It was also an unbelievable experience, the restoration work the general atmosphere and the fact that the revolution did not cause any damage. Thoroughly enjoyed.

Unbelievable. The facade and domes of this church are so beautiful that words cannot adequately describe them. Even professional photos cannot do justice to the glitter and colors that you willl see. We were on a tour, so were unable to go inside to see the mosiacs, much to our disappointment. However, just seeing the outside was mind boggling.
Interesting place if you like mosaics. A beautiful place with wonderful mosaics. Kind of crowded on the ground but you need to look up and see the wonders of the place
Must See. Church of the Savior of the Spilled Blood is definately worth the visit the Architecture and Mosaics are amazing.
Highlight of my trip. this is a must see, it is short but impressive, so dont go to St Peter without going inside. You will miss a magnificent place.

Awesome church. This is a stunning spectacle both inside and out. It has some similarities to St Basils (colourful domes) but is perhaps more spectacular. The mosaics inside are really impressive as is the intensity of colour and the high ceilings. Relatively cheap to go inside and definitely worth it.

Must see in St. Petersburgh.. Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood was an amazing experience. The outside is very interesting with all the twists and turns of the domes but you mouth just drops open when you enter to this large expanse of huge mosaic paintings that just take your breath away at the mere size of them and the workmanship that must have been involved in creating them. Definitely a must see on any trip.

Stunning architectural masterpiece. This church is one of the top must-see attractions in St Petersburg. One has to spend some time studying it from the outside but equally amazing from the inside. Very close to a number of nice canalside restaurants and cafes.

It Will Take Your Breath Away. Keeping with Russian tradition this religious building was constructed to honor a historic event. The church is built on the site of the Assassination of Alexander II. He was fatally injured when a radical threw a bomb under the emperor’s carriage in March 1881.The onion domes of the church are colorful and intriguing. It is an artistic masterpiece. The Russian churches are built with onion-shaped domes because of the heavy snows. When the weather is at its worst, the snow melts down the sphere of the dome rather than collecting on the roofs of the churches. Be prepared to be awed when you enter the church. Walls completely adorned with mosaics and icons will surround you. The intricate artisanship and dazzling colors will mesmerize you.

Worth visiting the inside. Having visited hundreds of churches in Europe and other parts of the world, sometimes they tend to look all the same and you get the hang of it. But this one is quite special with the mosaic arts that adorn the walls and ceiling. Very impressive

Wonderful historical place. This place is very different if compare to St. Isaac church. It is very Russian and has historical value. The place where the imperor Alexander II has been wounded. It is inside the church. Must see
Amazing. A piece of art, with very interesting details. Its close to a very nice park. It worths a visit. Very good
Guide needed. If travelling by yourself you really need a guide as it gets crowded and there is so much to see. We were lucky that our guide had an arts/history degree
Amazing . Probably the most beautiful church ice been in in my life. I was overcome and overwhelmed. The mosaics were amazing. We didn't know what to expect and were shocked at the beauty.

One of the best!!. I have seen many churches/cathedrals in my travels and this is one of the most beautiful. The interior is covered with 7000 sq meters of mosaics in beautiful colors. It is truly stunning. It is open until 10:30PM in the summer and it is well worth it to go after the tour groups have left. It means no entrance line and plenty of room to walk around and enjoy its beauty. The exterior is lovely too. It has a nice audioguide in English.
It has an incredible view!. It is something unbelievable, the beauty of this church, it is worth watching the inside as well as the outside.

Wow. This church is increddibly beautifull! I recommend everyone to go inside. It is not very expensive. We played the game 'search the painting where you see the Story of...' because almost every Story from the bible is painted on the Walls.

Wonderful interior. The exterior should make you want to stop in for a visit but the awe is really inside. Not much in the way of signage so read about before you enter. Like a lot of attractions here the restoration was beautifully done.
Beautiful and a must see. One of the highlights of 2 days in St Petersburg . Stunning mosaics and definitely should be on any itinerary

In my top 5 of places to visit in St Petersburg !. An amazing place! The pictures you see with the "onion" top church is Church of the Savior on spilled Blood. Although it small, it is a not to be missed church.
Beautiful cathedral in scenic setting. An example of fine Russian cathedral architecture set in one of the most captivating central areas of the city.

Classic Imperial Russia. The cathedral was erected on the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander II in 1881. While comparable in size to St Isaac’s is a different experience inside. All of the interior decoration is done in mosaics, some times so fine that you have to get within two feet of the mosaic to recognize the stones. The Cathedral also includes the tomb of Alexander II. It is within walking distance of the Cathedral of St. Isaac’s so it would make sense to do both in the same afternoon.
Great place. I myself am a history fan so I really enjoyed both the place , architecture and story behind it , really a place to visit

Stunning place - do not miss!. This is one of the top places to visit in St Petersburg. The entire interior is decorated with mosaics. Built as a shrine over the exact site of the assassination of Russian Emperor Alexander II.

Expected a bit more. Finally got a chance to visit the inside of the church. I was a bit disappointed, maybe because I expected it to be more like a church than museum.
I was still amazed about the architecture of the church and I don't regret going there.

Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful - one enormous space. The walls & all the 'paintings' are all made from mosaic. So much colour & gold & just left me breathless. Do visit - preferably out of season as it's on everyone's excursion programmes.
Amazing. Amazing church. The history is interesting. Beautiful church but go early. Gets crowded quickly. Make sure to take photo from bridge across the street!

All the decorations are mosaics. Entrance is around the back. 250 ₽ each to get in. Another stunning building, and not a single painting in it !! All 6,560 m², comprising 308 illustrations are mosaics. It took 24 years to build, only being consecrated in 1907 under Nicholas 2. The Bell Tower is built over the actual spot that Alexander 2 had his legs blown off in an assassination attempt. Naturally, he died soon after. The irony is that he was alighting from his carriage to thank members of his Cossack Guard who had earlier saved him from an assassination attempt. However, as he was driving along the edge of the Catherine Canal, it has meant that to put the Bell Tower over the actual spot, the Church juts out into the Canal itself so you cannot walk around it.Next to the Church are the Mikhailovskiy Gardens, a beautiful oasis in the middle of the city, and also the loveliest way to get to the Russian Museum.Most people approach the church from Nevsky Prospekt, past the souvenir sellers, mostly selling the same stuff, but you can also buy original artworks here at reasonable prices.Around the church you'll also find buskers, people wandering around with animals you can pose with for a price - when I was there, these includes pigeons, owls, and a gorgeous raccoon - and portrait makers. Walk around all of them and see what work they are currently doing, as the artwork they sit behind is not always theirs. We found one artist that we had to queue for but he was well worth the wait.On a sunny day, with live music playing, and this singularly gorgeous building above you, there are few places on the planet more pleasant to just chill out at.
Breathtaking . This was absolutely fantastic it was like a museum inside with all the mosaics on the walls and seeking. Wonderful from the outside a must to go inside a see.
Amazing. The architectural design of the historical and famous old church is awesome with colorful round shape on top.
Beautiful . Should be on each program of a SPB visit. Lovely from inside and outside, colorful exterior and rich interior. Just respect it is a church, and not a fairground!

Great Russian architecture. you must visit. You will never see a similar church again. Easy to find in the city center. Built on the place Tsar Alexander II was murdered. I have visited the church many times. I am impressed every time.
VERY CROWDED . We were on a tour from the usual cruise ship , so limited time , very crowded , no air , due the amount of candles , + people , would have liked more time ,

good architecture. it is a very touristy place , a lot of crowd.it is in the tour itinenary of almost all tour operators.
but it is a nice place.good ambience.
Beautiful outside and mosaics inside. Be sure to go inside. Tickets can be purchased at individual kiosks to skip the line. Again, a very busy place, but not to be missed.
Absolutely beautiful. We really loved both the exterior and interior of this church. The decoration on the inside is very beautiful and unlike anything we have seen elsewhere.

Mmmagnificent Site. I think I took close to 100 photos. Very impressive. What made this site even more special was the guide from DenRus, Lana gave us so much information. Anyways bring a camera and perhaps an extra memory card.
beautifull. I went to see this church , and is amaising , lovely architecture , and inside is even more impresing , without a doubt worthy the visit

magnificent tour. We visited this church on our tour of St Petersburg on the 12th July, and we found it truly breathtaking. The beauty and richness of this building is truly outstanding and we were very lucky to see this on our first day in St Petersburg, as the next we would have missed it as it was closed. It was extremely interesting and our guide made it even more appealing and brought things to our notice which we would have missed. Each building and Church, and places were breathtaking, and are so delighted we made the trip. Highly recommended.

On the outside, what a nightmare of design and colours. Inside - sublime iconic religious art work in every dimension.. If there is a queue, then use the ticket machines. It costs 250 Rubels pp but only takes 50, 100 and 500 Rubel notes. Once inside, get an audio guide ticket from the machine (100 Rubles, and again only takes 500 or less notes.) Then take the ticket to the booth next door to get the Audio guide. We didn’t have any 500 Rubel notes, so had to do without.This cathedral is amazing on the inside. Absolutely beautiful frescos and paintings on the walls and ceiling, a wonderful alter door at the front, making anything that Liberace might have owned look positively tasteful but cheap. This altar door is the King of Bling!At the back of the church is a gazebo marking the spot where Alex II was assassinated.When we were outside the church, I heard an American tourist exclaim how this church was the most beautiful thing she had ever see. As they say, beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Yes, it is fantastic, but beautiful? For me, no way.It is ugly – looks like an acid eating architect designed a series of fantasy flavoured ice cream cones piled on top of a red brick industrial complex, with some brightly coloured mosaics glued on the side, and sprinkled liberally with confetti or hundreds and thousands – ok ok, I am exaggerating. But I think you get the idea – it is, in my opinion, the height of gaudy bad taste.Still, worth seeing? Yes. You wont see anything like this anywhere in the world - it even shames St. Basel's in Red Sq. And 4 bux to enter - it is 100% worth the money.

Stunning, inside and out.. Don't be mistaken by thinking that the interior of the church can't be any better than the exterior - because it is. The mosaics, icons and flooring are all exquisite. Just look up in wonder at the spectacle that beholds you, the colours and beauty are difficult to do it justice - hey you just got to see it for yourself.
Wonderful church with stunning mosaics. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this church whilst on a 3 day tour of St Petersburg. It was really beautiful and the mosaics were absolutely stunning'
Wessam Mohamed . very nice church on the river bank. Beautiful from inside and outside. Centrally located and lots of restaurants and shoping areas around.
Unbelievable. Not so much a church as an art object. Everything is decorated! Jewel box inside & out. Buy ticket at machine & skip the line.

A most extraordinary sight of a church covered with mosiacs. Saw this church on an organized 2-day tour with Best Guides. The church is amazing and you will not have seen anything like it. The whole interior is covered with absolutely beautiful mosaics. Not to be missed.
Amazing architecture . It is one of a kind, we did not enter the church, we only visited the church from outside. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to enter. Still it is a must see.

Multi-domed beauty. This church is stunning from the outside with it's many gilded domes and impressive architecture. It looks like something out of a fairy tale. It is named 'Church on Spilled Blood' because it was built on the spot where Czar Alexander II was assassinated. In fact, inside the church they have left exposed the bit of street where the czar fell. The interior of the church is pretty amazing with fabulous mosaics, gilding, and opulent fittings. Definitely worth a visit. I recommend taking a tour.

Mosaics Everywhere . The exterior of this church is very colorful. However the inside is the most amazing. It is floor to ceiling glorious mosaics. It was very crowded when we were there but we were still able to appreciate the very colorful decoration. I recommend that you ask your guide to stop a bit down the river to get the best photographs. When you are right in front of the church you can't get a good overall view, or photo, of the architecture.
Beautifully tiled church. This was our favorite church in St. Petersburg. I'll keep it short and simple, the mosaic tile throughout the inside was breathtaking. A must see.

Impressive . This church is astonishing, all the art , the small details and the beauty can't be compared and it is hard to describe. One of the most beautiful places I have ever been. Worth every minute spent in there.

WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. There are no words to explain this masterpiece. The outside is iconic and beautiful, but the inside IS UNBELEVEABLE.!! Every inch inside is a mosaic. EVER INCH. Masterfully done and preserved. The surrounding grounds/park is lovely as well.
Beautiful church. A tribute to an assassinated Tsar. In a beautiful location, with beautiful mosaics throughout. Worth an afternoon. But be careful - you might convert.

Spectacular mosaics. This church is definitely one on the list to see while you are in St. Petersburg. The mosaics that cover the complete inside of the church are really quite stunning. It is worth the small price of admission to come in and take a look around. It really is a stunner and you won't be disappointed. There are often decent size crowds there but it doesn't take that long to get in.

Left me breathless. The experience in this church is hard to describe, it's incredibly magical inside as it's outside, so don't miss the visit, even if it's payed. I hope to go back there one day, there were so many details to see, but the church was really full.
Don't miss this huge work of art.
Worth seeing. Basically it's another church. Truthfully, you go because it's one of the sites you see when you go to Saint Petersburg. It pretty, it's opulent, it's a church.

Amazing but sterile. The neo-medieval architecture leaves one wanting something more genuine in this style. Compared to St Basil's in Moscow for instance this building is too pompous and quite heavy from the outside. Inside the renovation is amazing with every square inch covered in mosaics. Yet none of those mosaics offer much expressiveness. It reminded me of Disney-style - everything perfect but lacking in soul. An incongruous building to find amongst the classic beauty of St Petersburg. Worth a visit but left me cold.

Superb. Both outside and in this is not to be missed. It is very distinctive on the sky line with its enamelled domes and inside, the mosaics are just breath taking. One could spend hours playing find the Bible story. Only one word of warning. Watch your personal property outside, as many hawkers and buskers congregate in the vicinity and dipping is not unknown
Magnificent!. Such an extraordinarily beautiful building. Saw it on a raining day and it must be mesmering to see on a sunny day.
Spectacular sight. I visited this Church in July 2012 and even thought I observed it only from outside, because of restoration I enjoyed the view! it was incredible!

Pretty mosaics. Very pretty from the outside, though due to the war it's not as old as you might think! It's about £3 to go inside. If it was any more it wouldn't be worth it as it's just one big room but it is covered in impressive religious mosaics, used to tell bible stories to those who couldn't read once upon a time. Lovely musicians outside. Watch your belongings though! Very very busy
Stunning. This is another beautiful must-see location in St. Petersburg, Russia. It was so breathtaking, I didn't bother to try taking pictures inside.
GO THERE! Get the audioguide, worth it!. What a beautiful place. Make sure you take the time to go. Get the audioguide and take your time to enjoy this wonderful masterpiece.
Closed Wednesday May to September.. Missed out seeing interior of this Church. as it didn't occur it would be closed mid-week. Highlights importance of checking opening hours when managing own travel

Monument to a Fallen Czar. Travelling in Russia is a great history lesson. This church was built to honor Alexander the second who was assassinated in 1881. The domes are not painted but made from enamel. The Russian Orthodox Church with government support is restoring functioning churches. We were unable to go inside due to our schedule, but photos were spectacular.
My favorite church in Russia!. Beautiful piece of neoclassical architecture! Full of mosaics and colour, this was the most impressive church we visited in Russia.
Outstanding Church. Travelling by coach, we were able to see the domes from some distance away, fantastic Architecture and outstanding history. This is something everyone should experience.

Gorgeous. . Absolutely gorgeous church with the iconostasis. It is one of the most sacred churches in Saint Petersburg. It has gorgeous golden icons and is located on a cultural street filled with art and music.

As good as it seems. I'm not much for well travelled tourist destinations but when you are in st Petersburg it is hard to avoid it. Our tour guide (she was awesome BTW, Tatiana from Russian Adventure) took us here late in the day so it was just us a couple other smaller groups. This place is crazy beautiful. The entire inside is mosaics and just gleams. The visit at dusk just add to the surreal nature. Don't miss it.
Stunning artwork. Visited here as part of a cruise of Baltic. Amazing mosaics make up the entire interior of the building. The history behind this place is also fascinating.

Beautiful but overcrowded. It is really beautiful, I definitely think a guide is a must if you are not an expert in christian iconography, symbolism, otherwise its just pretty pictures on the wall. They let tooooo much people at a time inside.
A must for your bucket list. Stunning church with wonderful mosaics and icons, beautifully restored and one of the world's best sites. Wonderful

Just spectacular. This church is just unbelievable. Difficult to get good photographs as sightseers are dropped off by there coach drivers just in front, the church also stands on a busy main road, but is still a wonderful sight.
Post Card location. Do NOT forget your camera. You will want pictures from every angle to capture the beauty inside and out of this amazing location.
Churches. Historic and interesting, more for the mosiacs than much else. Be aware of bus after bus of boat tourists - timing is everything

IMPRESSIVE CRAZY MONUMENT. This amazing church combine dreams ,fairytells',and religion,and reflect the dark time of last Tzars.I still dont know if i love it,but i think that every visitor should and must see it,igal

To be seen to be believed.. This church in the centre of SPB marks the spot of the attempted assassination of Emperor Alexander II, the wounds of which he died later. Seen from Nevsky Prospekt the multi-coloured domes will draw you past all of the souvenir stalls until you look up in awe at the amazing architecture.To visit this museum (and that is what it now is) the tickets can be bought from the other side of the building. Beware, it is shut on Wednesdays like many other SPB sights. Once inside you will be stunned by the gold and blueness of the walls with nearly every inch covered in mosaics, over 7500 square metres of them. While you will find the space usually crowded with other visitors it should not spoil your enjoyment because most of the mosaics are above head hight and therefore easily viewed.
The most beautiful church of St. Peterburg. Beautiful church in the place of Alexander II assasination. Very nice interiers. Popular tourists place

Beautiful!. A highlight of St. Petersburg, for sure. It's crowded, but don't let that stop you. The church is breathtaking and the history behind it is extremely interesting. Don't miss the beautiful mosaic work.

Fascinating. Fascinating backstory that goes with a fascinating church. The antithesis of the simple Lutheran churches of Helsinki this church is complex in design and exterior detail and equally crowded with fascinating interior artwork depicting the life of Jesus and other biblical scenes. For the casual enjoyer of art and architecture such as we the hour we spent with a guide was perfect. For the more serious devotee of art or religion days may not be enough time to appreciate all that is there. Hard to imagine that visiting this church without a good guide or good guidebook will allow appreciation of what went into the creation of this edifice.
Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. The exterior was amazing enough.. just wait until you go inside !.. a must see in St Petersburg, next to a canal and close to the Hermitage Museum.

Impressive mosaic decorations inside. We visited the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood as a part of the walking tour organized by St Pete Private tours. Absolutely worth visiting and spending the time and money to see the inside and the impressive mosaic art & decorations.

Captivating architecture and story. The mosaics and color enamel work are stunning, and the story of this church's construction is so interesting to hear. It doesn't require a lengthy visit, but I wouldn't miss seeing it from the inside or out.

Best of st. Petersburg. This was my favorite site. Loved the beauty and the history behind this. A must see!It was beauty that was manageable to take in vs. the other sites that were too grandeous and hard to internalize.

Amazing, Inside and Out!. Here is an onion dome you must see. The colors of the domes on the outside are matched by the mosaics on the inside. We were able to enter with our small group after normal hours but there were still a lot of people inside. Another must see when in St Petersburg.

St Petersburg. Another amazing building,lots of history This was included as part of our 2 day tour of St Petersburg, whilst on our Celebrity Baltic Cruise from Southampton. We used Alla Tours, who were excellent

beautiful by day, charming by night. I first visited the church by night. We were so lucky as there was a band performing outside. The atmosphere was so nice with the beautiful colored church and the band that gathered quite some public. The day after we visited the church during day light. We also went inside. I was sorry I did not book some sort of a guide as i went inside and did not know much about the wonderful things i was seeing. I tried to follow some groups but i had the feeling the guides were not so happy to see me in their group (as i was an outsider). So either do some reading before or take a guide. It make the experience more worthwhile i think.

Glorious Church.. I had read about Church on Spilled Blood and knew the exterior was amazing but was not prepared for the interior. Stunning. A smaller cousin of St. Mark's in Venice with the gold mosaics, but much newer. All of the art is mosaic, as is St. Peter's. Floor to ceiling, it is awesome and one of my favorite spots in St. Petersburg. We had an great tie in later when visiting Catherine's Palace and the carriages. There you can see the damaged carriage where the bomb exploded that mortally wounded Alexander II, hence the spilled blood.
Steeped in history. Fantastic display of everything opulent, with a story steeped in history. Well worth a visit. Take your time looking around and take it all in.

Stunning. We were the first group into the church so had a bit of time to take in the absolutely stunning sight that greets you as you walk in. It did get busy very quickly but this is a must visit location and was our favourite location on our two,days in the city. Do it, you will love it and remember it.

Stunning church.. This was the very highlight of my visit to St Petersburg and I have never seen anything like it . It is an imposing, beautiful building but when you get inside.....well....it blows you away !! Knowing the history of this Church makes it more amazing. The stunning mosaics and fabulous colours all over just takes your breath away. Inside, there are photos of how it was renovated after damage during the war and I cannot begin to convey how much work has been put in to bringing it back to its original state. I could have stayed for hours looking at the detail of every part of the church and I will never forget how impressive it is. Do not miss a visit here.
Beautiful russian church. The church is functioning as a museum, with entrance fee. Unfortunately both cashier desks make 30 minutes break from 17,30 to 18,00 with no regard of the waiting people.
An incredible church.. This was one of the most memorable parts of our tour of St. Petersburg. The architecture was beautiful and so unusual.
One of the highlights of our St Petersburg visit. A lot of Russian history is captured in this site - well worth the visit and I highly recommend it to anyone who is visiting St Petersburg
Amazing Place. Another must place to see on your visit to St. Petersburg - Stunning - whilst you don't ned too much time - You must see
Wonderful architect and Colour combination. The church building is so charming that you would continuously stare at it.It appears to one of the most attractive monument of Russia.
Don't Miss. This historic church is amazing. Great staff. It's worth the cue out front. St. Issac's is bigger by far but the history of this place is worth the trip.

Beautiful restoration. Damaged during Second World War ,then allowed to deteriorate,was eventually restored to its original condition.beautifully restored using mosaics. Built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in 1881.Restoration began in 1970s and took27 years.Closed on Wednesdays .Open 10.30-6.No longer used as a place of worship-now classified as a museum.
Beutiful church. I think that this church is even prettier than Cathedral in Moscow but you can see it is newer. It is hidden in between buidlings and canals. A most see in St. Petersburg.
Must to visit.. Inside ask for a guided tour. It is free of charge and done by highly professional guide. Nice souvenir shops outside.

Beautiful church with a bloody violence will take your breathe away. We went there as part of a tour and are very pleased to stop by this church after visiting the State Hermitage Museum nearby. We took so much pictures just from the outside of the church as the architecture is simply stunning. If the line is too long or if you simply don't have time, just looking around the outside is worth the visit. Beautiful colors and well maintained facility is a must see to St. Petersburg. Love all the mosaics artwork, if I ever go back, I will definitely visit again.
Amazing and crowded. Unique place. One you'll never forget. Walking around in the evening without crowds is pleasant. Going inside means fighting rude crowds

Stunning!. If you think the outside is beautiful your breath is taken away when you enter the church - the mosaics are magnificent and there is so much to look at. The church was absolutely packed with tourists and it was very difficult to move around. Don't try and do this attraction in a hurry as you need to allow enough time to look round at all sides of the church properly by waiting for tourist groups to move away so you can see things too!
Thisis a magnificent edifice which must be seen. The interior of this church is truly beautiful and worth the visit. You won't see these colors in many places
A highlight of the trip. Went there at the end of a rainy day and was surprised by the beauty of the place. The history and the artwork were amazing.
Art and Hisstory. Another opportunity to savior the rich history and the beautiful art that St Petersburg has to offer

Unique church. Unique church a must to visit while being in saint Petersburg. Tour guide sold on the door, and you can enjoy a 45 min of history and building process of the church. It opens as church 8-10 for those who want to pray or just see the real church ( not as historical icon) after 10 it works as an historical icon with tours on the door.

Don't compare with St Basil's!. From the outside not as impressive as St Basil's in Moscow but a definite wow factor with the interior.Absolutely stunning inside and a must see. As with all these places you have to pay an admission and the queues can be horrendous - the organised cruise line day trippers are a nightmare!!!

Must-see. In a city with so many things to see Its almost on every must-see list and rightfully so. Incredibly detailed mosaics inside, colorful onion dome from outside makes it the iconic building of St. Petersburg. Awe inspiring! Be forewarned though - its always crowded during the tourist season.

Fun for a visit, impressive exterior. Exterior views are great, the architecture is worth making time to see up close. Interior is nice but underwhelms. Ticket access is simple and not to pricey, minimal queue on a Saturday in July which is a plus

Landmark in orthodox architecture!. An excellent approach to orthodox churches and religion. Being a catholic, it is a great experience to see the difference between these two religions. It is very well mantained! Very advisable to pay for the audioguide inside the church!

Interesting mosaic art work. Regardless of your religious leanings, this is worth a visit to appreciate the art work. We were there on a Saturday, so there were huge lines of people queuing for entry.
Impressive church with magnificent murals. Well worth seeing, the exterior is in typical Russian Orthodox , the interior is covered in murals of biblical scenes in vivid colours.

Beautiful inside and out. This is well worth a visit. It's really stunning inside and out. You can do it on the hop on hop off bus. It's not expensive to enter so worth going in to see the incredible interior. It's packed with tourists but then that's par for the course in st Petersburg.

A catthedral not to be missed - Spilled Blood Cathedral. When I was so carried away by the amazing mosaic works inside out. I did not understand though why the church was built to commemorate a Tsar being assassinated.
Great sight to visit. This is a beautiful church with unique architecture, but it was very crowded so it was difficult to get near some important parts of the church.

Incredible. I don't believe there will be anything else that hasn't been said already from the current reviews on TripAdvisor. This church is an absolute must see while in St. Petersburg. The architecture is / was absolutely amazing and is in my top 5 things to see and do in St. Petersburg. Inside and out,, Church of the Savior is drop dead gorgeous. Photography is allowed inside the church and there are no fire codes in Russia....many people can fit inside the church. If you have time to wait, the crowds pass. Highly recommended! Non-rainy days would be recommended, but go inside if it's wet outside.

"Wow". "Wow" is the first word that came to my mind when I saw the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. Both the inside and outside impress. Ornately decorated multi-colored onion domes, the Church intentionally looks like St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. The moment you walk in , the sheer beauty of the place overwhelms you. Words simply cannot describe the magnificence. Every square inch is covered in painting, the vast majority incredibly detailed mosaics, or gold. Over 24,600 feet of mosaic. The blood refers to Tsar Alexander 11, who was killed on the site in 1881. The extravagant shrine was constructed on the actual spot where Alexander was fatally wounded. In a city where Western architecture predominates, this distinctly Russian-style church stands out, yet blends in. I love it!
Interior detail was spectacular. Popular with locals and travellers. Historic. Beautifully maintained. Keep an eye out for pick pockets, the same is true for all major sights in St. Petersburg.
Absolutely stunning!. I have been in many churches, but this one is definitely unique! The architecture is amazing, and the interior is simply beautiful. A must see in St Pete
Beautiful!. Go and see it even just for the mosaics! Very interesting and worth a visit if you are in St Petersburg.

Church of Savior on Spilled Blood. My favorite St. Petersburg building. Fantastic art work. A lot of people visiting. Wish I could just sit there and admire the art work. I could visit many times and I hope I can do so.

Beautiful!. We visited the church for just a short time, but inside was beautiful! The mosaic tiles are extremely impressive, and we had a guide from Anastasia Tours that gave us the history of the church. Worth the stop.
Loved the church. A bit crowded inside. Peak of the season. Beautiful mosaics covering the walls. The exterior looks like a fairy tale castle. Definitely worth visiting.

Stupendous. This is one of the most beautiful churches which I have ever seen.Erected on the site where Tsar Alexander the second was fatally wounded, the church is incredibly gorgeous both on the outside and the inside. It is hard to believe that the floor to ceiling graphics in the interior are mosaics. The audioguide is pretty informative and worth a rent. If one has to choose between Issacs and this one, I recommend that you do this.

Spectacular Church!. The Church on Spilled Blood was the last place that we visited on our 2 day tour in St. Petersburg with SPB tours. It was unbelievable.Built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in 1881 the church has the most amazing mosaics that you will encounter anywhere in your travels throughout the world. I have never seen anything as beautiful as the interior of this church. The enormous pillars holding up the church's interior are absolutely mindboggling.This is a definite must see on any trip to St. Petersburg.
Not to be missed!. If you are going to St. Petersburg, you MUST visit this incredible church! The architecture and art are outstanding!
Beautiful. This is a must see historical site in St. Petersburg! The beauty and the historical importance of this church is a must see event.

If you only have time to see one church in St Petersburg...... ....make sure it is this one. From the outside the building is stunning, but the mosaics inside were just beautiful. It wasn't as busy as some of the other attractions we visited, so we had plenty of time to look around. It was also easy to walk to. We were advised to beware of pick-pockets there though, but did not have a problem. There are a few nice places to have a coffee nearby, and there is also a street market which sells traditional wares.
Beauty. Beautiful church and a must see during your visit! Church is over crowded and expect a long time to get all photos since there are cues for some areas

Nicely restored and very interesting (but crowded). This church has been beautifully restored. Its story (including the history of its name) is a fascinating one. My one warning is that it can be quite crowded during peak visitor times, and it is a known location for pickpockets, so be on guard!

Beautiful Church. Sad story, but a beautiful church. The mosaic work is truly incredible. Also interesting that there are no pews or chairs since worship is normally done standing. It really highlights all the details that went into building the church.
wonderful. So much to look at ,guided tour recommended, if possible early in the day as does get very busy and crowded

One of the most beautiful buildings in St Petersburg. A great landmark to visit and take a selfie with. The inside of the church is very different to other Russian churches, with mosaics featuring prominently. The area surrounding the church is very touristy but great if you want to pick up some souvenirs, have your portrait sketched or have your photo taken with some doves or other animals.
A must see in St. Petersburg. Absolutely beautiful. Make sure you see this spectacular building from both sides and try and catch it with the sunlight on it in the afternoon if possible.

Best choice of hardcore sight seeing. The church is beautiful from the outside, but from the inside it is even more amazing.
Usually there is not much queue outside, which makes it really easy to get in. When inside, you can easily stand around an enjoy the enormous mosaics.

What a beautiful Building. What an amazingly beautiful cathedral but it is sad that it is not actually used as a Church due to the communists converting it and many other church's to other functions. We walked on our own and not part of a tour. We were ok at this venue but then we got lost trying to find another location and people were not friendly and even the Police did not want to help. At one point there were two men that followed up for several blocks and only stopped when we got to our bus. Did not like the oppressive feeling of Russia as a whole and we all agreed that we would not go back.

Beautiful Church. The church is beautiful on the outside, especially when the sun is shining on it. Inside it is even better, it is stunning. There is art work everywhere, walls, doors and don't forget to look up because there is beautiful art work on the ceilings and in the domes.But due to its beauty there is a downside, when I visited it was very, very crowded. So to see things properly you have to be patient and let people move on so you can see the things clearly and get some great photos.

Marvelous. If you walk along Nevsky Prospect, passing Gribiyedov Canal or exit the subway station next to the same canal, immediately this magnificent cathedral it will attract attention by its shape, its colors, particularly stunning beauty. The cathedral has varied collection of mosaic icons, completed in the traditions of academic painting, modernist style and Byzantine icon painting. There is also a large icon of Alexander Nevsky which was created according to a design by Nesterov. Very impresive

Amazing artwork and mosaics. Words cannot describe the beauty of the craft exhibited in this church. A must see in St. Petersburg. The church is designed in the more traditional Russian style, thus stands out from the rest of St. Petersburg, and it is truly beautiful.

Amazing architecture. Saw the beautiful domes on my first day in St Petrrsburg. It was a striking view from distance. Was excited to go there when the weather is so good. A great history of this church as well.
AMAZING. Both the exterior and interior of this church is decorated with incredibly detailed mosaics of breathtaking beauty and elegance. A must visit
Gorgeous!. Worth going and watching. It is beautiful. It is very much within walking distance from the Nevsky Prospekt.

Stunning. Delightful mosaics throughout, as with most of St Petersburg much restoration work was required after "The Great Patriotic War"- what the west calls WW II. Exceptional evidence of the Byzantine orthodoxy connection to Russia's past.

Stunning Church. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is the crowning example of an Orthodox church. Every interior surface is covered with art and iconography, gold everywhere. It is simply stunning. If you see no other church in St. Petersburg, see this one.
amazing. we visit from outside, since very near from our hotel, place is amazing, strong character, worth to visit

Beautiful interior, spectacular exterior.. Busy, but an absolute must as part of your St Petersburg guided tour. Unless you speak Russian you definitely need a guide to share the history etc.Our guide warned us that tourists are targeted there by pickpockets. We were specifically told to hold the lenses of our SLR cameras which they have the habit of twisting off.We had no problems to mar a great experience.A feast for the eyes and unlike anything we had seen before.
just saw from outside. We only visited the outside of this magnificent building, amazing, worth a visit. beware of pick pockets.
Fantastic Church. All the churches in this city are well worth seeing, so much has gone into the construction of them. But please always be careful of pickpockets around the tourist attractions.

Stunning Cathedral in memory of Alexander II. This iconic church is one of the must-sees when visiting the historic centre of St. Petersburg. Its location is significant because it is built over the site where Alexander II was assassinated in 1881, and its design draws from elements of celebrated Russian architecture like St. Basil’s Cathedral in Moscow. It functions as a museum today, though I’m not quite sure about the entrance fees since it’s closed on Wednesdays, and hence, I did not get a chance to visit. It’s extremely beautiful and I highly recommend dropping to admire the grandiose architecture and ornate designs in any case.
Most Amazing Church. A must-see in St Petersburg. Visit and marvel at the detail and work that went into building this incredible church. One of the most memorable sights in our visit.
Definitely go if you're in Petersburg. Lovely place - interesting even if you don't appreciate the history or don't like churches. Well worth a visit if you are in the area - not very pricey.
Awesome. First stop on trip.Beautiful place.Wonderfully restored.Go round the church to see its glory from all sides.Exquisite interiors.

Trip to a fairly-tale. Beautiful in every detail it's hard to believe that this church has a dark history. It was built to commemorate a place where Tzar Alexander the second was fatally shot. Resembles St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. Must-see
Savior on Spilled Blood Church. This church was amazing, the detail and mosaics are so beautiful. Definitely a place to go see when you visit St. Petersburg.

Lovely Cathedral. Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is an iconic landmark in St. Petersburg. It is a must see even if only you have time for a quick outside photo stop. If you have more time, then it is worth the your time and ticket price to visit inside too. The area around and inside can be crowded, so watch your belongings.

stunning. Even on a windy wet day the exterior was impressive. The interior was stunning - beautiful, intricate mosaics everywhere .Crowded, yes , but you can see and appreciate it all. Don't miss it!
beautiful!!!. a beautiful orthodox church...a must -see in St Petersburg..we went crazy taking pictures..the domes which one sees in all the pictures of the city belong to this church

The best of St Petersburg. The Church of the spilled blood was awe inspiring. I was speechless as soon as I saw not only the outside but the spectacular interior. I am not a religious person and have seen too many churches but this one surpassed any I have seen.

Amazingly beautiful church. We had the opportunity to visit this beautiful church while on a 3 day tour with SPB tours. No words can describe the beauty of the wall art and architecture. You must be patient and take the time to view all the amazing art in all its forms that is a part of the interior of the building. Of course, the exterior of this church is also iconic in its beauty and magnitude. Some advice...get there early, try to get tickets in advance, and of course, if you want to truly appreciate this church, have a knowledgeable tour guide. Admission is facilitated if you are part of a recognized tour group.
Despite the crowding, very interesting and beautiful. Not one of the biggest and spectacular. but very interesting, with stunning mosaics and with unique history

Beautiful cathedral. Really impressive cathedral, the interior was filled with beautiful mosaics. we didn't spend longer than around 15 minutes inside, so the ticket price did feel a bit dear, but it is worth doing if you have a spare hour

amazing mosaic's. Be prepared for the amount of people visiting this church. Only 250 rubles to get in and it's money well spent. The whole interior is covered in the most amazing mosaic's in fantastic colour's make sure you get a guide leaflet/book to tell you about them and don't forget to look at the assassination spot.

A must see. Bed use it is there. Beautiful outside and inside. A unique architecture and history. Less than 30 min to visit. Very crowded area with shops and people. You need to be aware of your belongings though I think crime is unlikely with all the police presence every where you look.

Beautiful Church. We went here as part of a tour and it was unreal to see all the mosaic art work and hear the story of the church, why it was built, and the many changes it went through with the wars, etc. Worth a visit!

Beautiful! but watch your bag.... This is a stunning example of what you expect to see when you visit Russia. The colorful and golden domes are gorgeous! Inside is just as amazing - the entire place is done in mosaic and leaves one speechless. Highly recommend having a tour guide to explain history and the symbolism. A WORD OF WARNING - this place is one of the favorites of pickpockets and they are quite good at what they do...

Amazing, detailed mosaics!. Amazing interior, iconic exterior- worth the visit! If you go in the evening, there are no lines and you can take in the ornate alters without the crowds. I had never seen some of the stones that were used to construct parts of the alters. Beautiful and inspiring!
One of better stops. More color than some of other churches we visited. Less congestion than others. Easy access. Some of tours only do drive by - worth the stop

Just a photo stop. Came here by coach we only visited the outside Becouse there wasn't enough time. Just walking around here is spectacular fantastic building, the tour guide told us to beCareful Becouse of pickpockets.

One of the Great Sights of Russia and Europe.. Opened in the reign of the last Tsar, this cathedral in Moscow gothic style, unlike most of St Petersburg's 18th century European style, is stunning. The exterior is grandiose but compelling; like St Basil's in Moscow's Red Square, it is impossible not to take photos from every angle. Inside the mosaics are almost overwhelming. Don't let the crowds deter you. They are there for a reason. This is a fantastic experience. Inside, it will be very crowded but most of the glorious colour and atmosphere is above you so just join the queue, go in and gaze upwards at the columns and the dome.Before you leave, pay your respects to Alexander ll, Russia's last reforming Emperor. The pavement on which his blood was spilt is carefully preserved under a canopy inside the cathedral, on the spot where he fell, victim of revolutionary terrorists on 1 March 1881.

Must visit place in St. Petersburg. The church self is really amazing, we went during summer time, so they do open even after 6pm for evening tour. You can purchase the auto guide with your preferred language to know the story behind. Just be aware there are thief group right outside of the church, normally people is attracted by the building once they reach and start taking pictures, that's time the group will make crowd and opening your bags, be careful about your belongs!

Wonderful but packed. The interior of the church is wonderful and well worth a visit. Buy your ticket with a credit card from the machines outside rather than wait in the long queues. Go early as we we're just finishing our visit when a cruise trip group arrived. St Petersburg is a big cruise destination and once a group arrived It was impossible to move...

Busy busy. This is a place that everyone seems to visit and so it is very busy. A local guide is essential to explain what is there. The religious icons etc are an acquired taste but this is very much an iconic example of what local churches are about. It is almost impossible to take a good interior photograph because of the crowds.

Church was beautiful but was confronted by thieves! . The inside of the church & the history was absolutely Beautiful! But was still bothered by the actions of the thieves that tried to pick pocket us just couple of feet from the entrance. Their were 3 of them, & we were warned about this happening quite often. Which is such a shame because the Church is something that should be visited by everyone that visits to St. Petersburg.
Add on to our 2-day tour.. Well worth the added time and entry fee. Don't miss! The history of the church and the fabulous mosaics and breath taking!

An exciting story at a beautiful venue. Although very busy there was still plenty of room to see this magnificent church. It is vital that you go round this venue with a good guide who has extensive knowledge of the history, tragic as it may be, of this church.The decor in the church has to be seen to be believed. I have never seen some much gold decoration in any one place.The history of all the various memorials must be followed to understand the history of Russia. Clearly this is a place not to be missed but be aware that like most places in St Petersburg it is very busy.

Private Tour 4 couples with Tailored Tours. Architecture and history of the church given by Ivan our private tour guide from Tailored Tours was very impressive and he gave every opportunity for great photo stops.

Stunning mosaics. More of a museum-piece than a church, although also known as the Cathedral of the Resurrection. It is absolutely filled from floor to ceiling with amazing mosaics, coloured tiles, and marble, all in a myriad of bright colours and representing Old and New Testamant stories and subjects.

Must, but must see!!. Wow, sometimes when you see something more than extraordinary, you fail to find words that describe how marvellous what you are looking at is. Church of the Savior is a must see when you are in SPB... Incredibly beautiful art, very well preserved and displayed... No matter how many photos you've seen about that church/monument, your still need to see it by the baked eye to see the majesty of what humans can do when they are artist. Marvellous!!!!

Simply stunning inside out. The name is officially “Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ”, but it is better known as the “Church of the Spilled Blood” on where Alexander II was fatally wounded and his blood spilled. There is a shrine inside the church covers the exact spot. It was built in the neo-Russian style (16th and 17th Century Russian) contrasting to surrounding Baroque, Classical architecture. It took 24 years to build (1883 – 1907, started from Alexander III) and 27 years to restore (1970 – 1997) after being badly damaged and looted by 1917 Russian Revolution and WWII. Hard to believe, it was one time used as food storage and morgue. There is no painting in the church but all made of tiny mosaics (> 6500 square meters). There is couple more symbolic facts, (1) the highest point is 81 meter (commemorate year of death, 1881) (2) the second highest cupola is 63 m (age of death). To be able to see the church as it is today, it is truly amazing. This is one of the most iconic recognizable structures in St. Petersburg if not in the world. Everyone must come.

Magnificent!. After 20 years of restoration this church reopened again in 1998 and what a magnificent place it is! It was worth every cent of admission and just filled with one beautiful thing after another! The mosaics are incredible. The walls, canopy and floors are breath-taking. Do not miss this church, even if you do not like churches!
This place... Stunning. Amazing inside and out. Tickets a bit of a zoo but worth the hassle. Visited it everyday while in town- though just inside once. Lovely.

Beautiful Exterior. From the outside, this is what you would expect a Russian church to look like. Great photo opportunities. Just a few steps from the Hermitage, so walk a block or so and check this off your list.

Such a beauty. In my opinion a more beautiful church than the one at the red square in Moscow. You need to buy a ticket for entering, but also the inside is heavily decoraded and worth a visit. Both gold and mosaic artwork all over.
Amazing view at night. It has an amazing view at night you can enjoy.it has a very beautiful architecture and the story behind it that why the church had biult
Stunning church. Amazingly picturesque church but very busy and long waits to be expected during the season. Sits alongside a very pleasant park and one of the many canals running through the city.

Nice, especially inside. Though it's a monument built at the end of the 19th century, the mosaics and marbles inside are beautiful.
Also the exterior is very original.
exterior, and interior mosaics. interior mosaics are just mindblowing. could spend hours inside looking at these pictures and marvelling at the work that has gone into them.

Fantastic - In peak periods consider evening visit. The church has been restored beautifully - entirely mosaics inside so unusual. Well worth visiting. We went (in May) just after the pricing went from the RUB 250 to RUB 400 (USD 6) - the difference being there were very few people inside - which was a great way to see the church.

Church of spilled blood. This is an amazing church. It is really beautiful with a different facade on each side and the inside is made up of absolutely stunning mosaics
All the mosaic work has been done by local art students based on pictures - definitely worth a visit
A real treat. This is a must-visit, everything about it was brilliant. Cafes nearby not too pricey and the canal-side setting gives a picture-postcard finish.

Exquisite!. This is a great place to be while in St. Petersburg.
With a great history behind it and a uniquename, the outisde and the inside will not disapoint you. Beautifully ornamentated on the outside, the inside left us mouth open. Never before I have seen such an amazing church!
A must see in St-Petersburg. Very colourful, beautiful, impressive. You cannot go to St-Petersburg without visiting this church. We truly enjoyed our visit.

A unique sensory experience. Despite the large crowds found inside the Church at any time, the painstaking restoration has certainly paid off in the overall experience. The extraordinary floors with multi colored marbles create the perfect support for the astonishing mosaics that deck most of the walls. The gilded altar is of a seldom seen richness in craftsmanship end design. You will be transported by the overall encompassing feelings of admiration for the artistry that created this important monument. Definitely worth the trip.

Something special to behold.A very very special place.... What a stunning piece of history to behold. The story about the creation of the church in memorial to the great Tsar Alexander the 2nd after his assassination is a love story in itself between the leader and his people.The building itself is one of the highlights of my trip to Russia and it is a deeply spiritual place crossing many cultures and ethnicities tingling the emotions of ones soul.The depictions of Christ and Mary are heart warming in a time of so much unrest in the world and once can get lost in the beauty and tranquility of these paintings, frescos.A must to see , more than once....
Stunning. The mosaics which completely cover the interior of the Church on Spilled Blood are spectacular; reminiscent of the (much older) ones in Ravenna. Allow plenty of time to take it all in.

Very impressive, very crowded. Fascinating, beautiful monument all decorated in lovely mosaics. The first minute inside is breathtaking.It is, however, very crowded with very little places to sit.Note there are two blue ticket-selling machines to the left of the ticket booths. Avoid the ques by using them!
Iconic, must go. I am not that into visiting churches, but this one is iconic & spectacular. It's an easy walk in central st P. Interesting history, but spectacular spot .

Interesting and worthwhile. This one is smaller and quite packed when we visited. You do need a private or small group guide to appreciate. It's history and interior is a part of Russian history that is intriguing as it represents the beginning of the end of Russian royalty.

Beautiful. Not to be missed. One of the nicest and most interesting places to visit. Everybody from our party fall in love with fabulous mosaics. The only advise is to be aware of thieves that operate around as somebody from our group got robbed.
Amazing . If you visit St. Petersburg you must visit this church. It is unbelievable, I'm so glad the Communists didn't dismantle it.
Beautiful Church. Historically very interesting. After the abuse of the Nazis, and the neglect of the communists, the restoration is magnificent, well worth your time.

Most ornate and intricate church. Built to memorialize Tsar Nicolas who was assassinated at this spot. Bright color of blue and gold. Very interesting architecture in the style of medieval Russian style, in major contrast to St. Petersburg's predominantly Baroque and Neoclassical styles. Inside, the church is covered in intricately detailed mosaics.

Best with a guide to explain the history . Beautiful inside and out. The history re: the assassination on the spot is something to study ahead of time or go with a guide. On the south side, walk over to the canal and look for the up-stretched hand down in the water next to the bank.
Amazing Must-See in St. Ptersburg. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is gorgeous - inside and out. The mosaics inside the Church are amazing.

The Face of St. Petersburg. When I found that I was going to be able to visit St. Petersburg, I started anticipating my visit to this church. My husband cautioned that I would be disappointed as I was getting my expectations too high, but it did not disappoint. Glorious architecture with the onion tops and multi colors. Definitely a must see. There is a small admission fee, but it is worth the cost of entry.
Stunning. Inside was a bit much for my taste but the outside was so unique, loved it. A must see on any visit to St Petersburg.
A Must See. As you learn the history of St Petersburg and the Church being built on the sight of Spilled Blood its a must see.

Spectacular Architecture. We were able to spend some time in and around this amazing building whilst in St. Petersburg. Very impressive but be aware that pickpockets operate in the area so keep your valuables safe.

Virtual geocache here.. If you are a geocacher, this place has a virtual geocache with 444+ favorite points (as of July 2016.). Amazing interiors but can get shoulder to shoulder crowded with tour groups. The exterior is equally amazing.
Don't Miss This!. Go early to avoid crowds and long lines. Well worth the wait! photo ops from bridge...gorgeous interior!
Amazing mosaics full of colours and recently renovated.. It's an amazing place, probably on of the most beautiful churches to visit in the world. The work necessary to do it is impossible today

Russian architecture at its best. The Church is absolutely stunning and in the centre of St Petersburg. Don't forget to go there during the night as it looks even more stunning in photos!For more pictures and St Petersburg tipps, check out my blogpost :) http://franie-travels.com/2016/03/04/church-hopping-in-st-petersburg-russia-franie-travels

Chic church . It's located near Nevskiy Avenue and is visible from even far places.Very colorful, chic, unique church, with museum inside. Also go to the Mikhailovsky park near the church, it's romantic and calm place.
As amazing inside as it is outside. The iconic appearance draws you to the building but don't walk past, taking a photo and moving on without going in. You'll miss out.

Gorgeous inside and out!. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is gorgeous; I liked it much better than the famous St, Basel's in Moscow. Our guide showed us the outside of this church and in talking with her I learned that she thought the inside was the best but it wasn't on our tour. We decided to walk over to it (not too far from our hotel) on our free time. The inside is absolutely stunning - the mosaics cover the walls and ceiling and the floor design is outstanding. I spent a long time leaning against a pillar so I could more easily relish the ceiling and higher parts of the walls. It is a non-operating church and was closed in 1932 during the "Soviet Era"; it was used for storage and eventually for the sets of an opera company. It was painstakingly restored over a period of 27 years and there is an interesting exhibit showing before and after pictures towards the exit. I highly recommend visiting this church - it was the best - inside and out - of all the many ones I saw throughout Russia.

Beautiful church and a must-see in St. Petersburg. If you visit St. Petersburg this is one of the must-see places you should not miss. It's awesome from the outside and from the inside as well. Quick tip: The ticket counter is sometimes pretty crowded, directly left to it there are two machines where you can buy tickets (available in English language as well).
