I had about 50 people standing in the queue and nobody using the machines.In the inside it's beautiful but crowded, too. You should go there directly after opening or shortly before it closes to avoid the masses. Otherwise it is hard to walk through it.

Too Crowded to really enjoy. Russia is a unique environment. We had a private guide, but it was not peaceful in this Church. It was overrun with tourist and pushy folks, but it was a magnificent Church and has a lot of interesting history. It is worth seeing just know that every square inch will be covered with people. Additionally, the American and British culture of waiting your turn and then getting to see something is not always how things work there with numerous Asian and Russian visitors.
must go place. I visit this place every day during the whole stay in this wonderful city. I usually walk around, where you can find the spirit of the city.
Church of the Saviour. Incredible both outside and in and well worth a visit. You will just have to put up with the crowds and guided tours but not to be missed.

Fascinating story and beautiful church. The story behind the church is so interesting and the gold and mosaics make it very special. It truly is beautiful inside and out and a must see in St Petersburgh
An amazing edifice. Truly spectacular exterior complemented by a fascinating interior. Not to be missed as one of your sightseeing highlights
Fantastic Church. Since the church is closed on Wednesdays we could not get in, nevertheless seeing it from otside is more than enough.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful but we were not able to go in because it's closed on certain days. Double check before you go that it's open to viewers.

Magnificent Church. This Church was built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881.The church was built between 1883 and 1907. The construction was funded by the imperial family. When I saw it, I was so grateful that Stalin or Khrushchev had not torn it down as they did with other places of worship. We were told that for many years, under the Soviet government, the building was not used as a Church - at one point, potatoes were stored inside the building! It also suffered tremendous damage during the 900 Day Siege of Leningrad during WWII. The painstaking reconstruction of this remarkable edifice was impressive to say the least. Both the outside and the interior are jaw dropping. The mosaics inside the Church are some of the most intricate and beautiful that I have even seen. This is definitely a "must see" if you are ever in St. Petersburg.

Took My Breath Away!. This church was amazing. Our tour guide was able to get us in in the evening when there were no crowds and we were able to see and really appreciate the amazingly beautiful mosaics that cover every inch of the walls. I'd never seen anything like it. My kids were equally amazed.

A magnificent building. We visited on Russian Day so besides being packed with holidaymakers, tourists, it was also full of Russians. It was very crowded but well worth seeing as part of the history of Russia.
Magnificence. Spectacular inside and out. Like all tourist attractions in this city it is jam packed with tourists! To think the soviets almost destroyed this magnificent place. A real highlight
Marvelous. Although our tour did not give us enough time to enter the building, domes and spires were magnificent. The fence around the church is wonderful.

History before your eyes.. We took a guided tour of this church. What great history and dedication to preserving it. You almost feel like you are going back in time when you stand here amongst the crowd. Imagine standing there 200 years ago and you might see the same things. The designers really loved using gold for decoration and effect!
amazing...just amazing. This church is so beautiful to behold. There is so much to see, and every side has a different view. Also, the bridge right by it provides for a great photo opportunity.

A must see location at Saint Petersueg. Been their with our family including 1 year old baby. Very beautiful church and it has a wide history, i recomend to rent a "guide phone" which is telling the whole history about the church or to join a guided tour.

You know you're not in Kansas..... jThis is the paradigmatic Russian Orthodox Church. Altogh not that old, commemorating the 19th c. assassination of a czar, it is over the top with golden icons, onion domes etc. It is a must-see.

Simply stunning both outside and in.. It's little wonder this is top of everyone's list of things to do. With virtually no queues, it's one of the simpler places to visit. There's a shrine for the Emperor who was mortally wounded on the spot, hence the church was built to remember him and his sacrifice. It's amazing to look at from the outside but the mosaics depicting Christ's lift are probably the most amazing thing I've seen in a church. One word of caution, our guide advised us that pick pockets target the ticket area and the exit, so beware. Definitely well worth a visit.

Click pictures from the opposite bank. Definitely the best sight at St. Petersburg, it is easy to reach in city centre. Inside is not so exciting and the big attraction is to gaze at the multi hued cupolas meant to resemble the flame from a candle.
Beautiful church. The exterior of the church is amazing and the interior just as breathtaking. We are not 'churchy' people but this is really something to see.
Amazing. Rainy day in Russia so we visited this! History was interesting and truly beautiful, story attached was also great. Also walkable within the city so good spot
Just amazing. Fascinating place, worth to visit. When you stand in one corner and look at the ceiling you will stand breathless when you see the Christ watching you.
Fascinating place to visit.. A real must if in St Petersberg. We were fortunate to have a very knowledgeable guide so had lots of interesting stories to enlighten us.
Not bad. Amazing outside, not so much inside. Is nice but not what can you expect watching the outside. Expensive ticket, for me dont worth the price.

Beautiful church. This church is well worth the visit. It is beautiful on the inside and outside. The inside of the church is beautiful and is a different feel than St. Isaac's. I would recommend seeing them both.

Unimaginable Beauty. The outside is impressive, but the inside literally made my jaw drop. The gorgeous mosaics are stunning; you can see the many people and stories from the Gospel and church history depicted in them. Notre Dame in Paris, St. Peter's at the Vatican, Westminster Abbey in London, and the Duomo in Milan are monochrome bores compared to this feast for the eyes and the soul.

"Impressive". The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood‬ is a must. The area is very pleasant, nice cafes, restaurants, bars. You should find the time during the trip to St Petersburg to spend half day visiting the church. You must get inside the Church is a must!!!July, 2016
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church. The decoration is exquisite the one drawback is of corse the crowds, but get a private guide. It is worth the money
Stunning!. I have travelled the world and this is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. Don't miss it!
Amazing. Most beautiful church I have ever seen, the mosaic ceilings are breathtaking. Highly recommended, we went around 9pm and had the church almost to ourselves.

The most charming sight St. Petersburg. I saw this great building at least 10 times, during all possible times of day and night, and I still couldn't get enough of it. Amazing craftsmanship, intricate details, massive yet delicate. There's an entrance fee (like all sights in St. Petersburg, except for the Kazan Cathedral) and you can easily avoid the queues if you buy your tickets from the automatic machines (on the left of the ticket office) - English menu, cash and cards accepted.Also, the audio guide is well worth the additional fee - a good way to learn about the very special history of this place.
Wow. All i can say about this place is wow the amount of work in the place is breathtaking.While the place is not old the colours were worth a look.Lots of people so very very busy
Impressive building. Very impressive to look at from the outside. The interiors does not disappoint either. Plenty of crowds but not a problem inside.

Beautiful . ‪The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood‬ is a must.The area is very pleasant, nice cafes, restaurants, bars.You should find the time during the trip to St Petersburg to spend half day visiting the church and the serounding.

A real spectacle, inside and out.. We had seen the outside of this church on a previous occasion, but were unable to get inside it at the time. The outside is stunning, decorated in what is broadly seen as a typically Russian style. There are several religious representations in mosaics around the outside of the church. And the inside of the church continues with this; virtually every surface is completely covered in mosaics depicting religious scenes or figures. The colours are rich and vibrant, and the overall impression is very strong. Its Christian heritage is very clear. And the spot where the Emperor was assassinated while at prayer, and his blood spilled, is clearly marked. It is worth reading up about this church before you visit it.
Beautiful church with so much history. Arrived on a tour and the church was closed to the public. Toured the outside and viewed the stain glass and the architecture. Would have liked to see inside.
One of the most Russian things in St.Petersburg.. The church is beautiful and one of the most typical slavic buildings in St.Petersburg. There are not that many. More worse from outside than inside.

Awe-inspiring building. This church is unique, beautiful, and awe-inspiring--a must see when visiting St. Petersburg. We were fortunate enough to have a knowledgeable guide who skillfully navigated through this busy site.

WRODS CANNOT DESCRIBE IT. My percentage of "excellent" ratings as opposed to those lower down the scale is getting a bit out of kilter, but what can one say when faced with a structure such as this. Would we build something so grand in this day and age with our so-called technological advances - I sincerely doubt it! The exterior with all its ornately decorated domes - WOW! And then there is the inside - heavily decorated with murals made of the tiniest mosaics - it just takes the breath away.The place is tourist heaven so it will be busy most times - more so I believe in August when St Petersburg is even busier than it was during our June visitYou really need an informed guide to get the most from your visit here. We had an amazing guide from Alla Tours who informed us i.a. that the Church is still used for services. There are no traditional pews though as the Russian custom is to stand for the entire service so getting around the cavernous interior isn't as bad as it might otherwise be. If you aren't part of a tour group, just attach yourself to one of the numerous groups visiting the Church - no-one would notice or probably mind if they did!

Perhaps the most beautiful church I've ever seen. Part of our tour, but not to be missed by anyone traveling to St Petersburg. Beautiful inside and out, unbelievable mosaics cover the entire interior.

A spectacular church. I do not know if I have seen anything more beautiful. The craftsmanship is unbelievable. Sadly the crowds in the summer are awful. We thought going when it was really raining would help but then you just get umbrellas poked in your eyes. It is still worth it though. And I actually enjoyed the tourist booths on the outside. Funny mugs to bring homes to friends. A couple of good restaurants around also so you can take a breath after the crowds.

Cheap and Amazing. The Church is one of the few places that is affordable to see in the St. Petersburg area compared to the other palaces and museums. The outside itself is a magnificent structure and you will be more amazed inside. The place is crowded, there were even some couples dressed in their wedding dresses taking pictures outside the area. Around the area are a lot of souvenir stalls and even cheap entertainments. Cost to get inside was 250 Rubles which is like roughly $4.00. Its it worth more than that in my opinion.

Incredible sight, inside and out. This is a don't miss visit in St. Petersburg. The outside is gorgeous, from every direction and angle. The inside is just as amazing, so don't miss it. It's worth the wait and crowds. Every inch is covered with beautiful mosaics. We didn't have a guide, but thanks to the crowds, it was easy to find some to eavesdrop on. Do be careful of your belongings in the vicinity of the church, as this is prime pickpocket turf.

Some memorial!. Built by Alexander the third as a memorial to his father after his assassination, the church is absolutely stunning inside and out. The mosaics inside the church are incredible and do not disappoint after the magnificence of the exterior.

You have to sed it.. The outside of this building is stunning and the inside doesn't disappoint either. This is a major attraction so very busy so try and avoid peak times. There are lots of street performers around the perimeter so thus is an added bonus.

Well worth the visit. Although it was very crowded with tour groups, we had a very knowledge private guide who able to explain in great detail the history of the Church and the background of all those entombed there. Needless to say the interior of the church was also very impressive and worth viewing.
Incredible Church. If you’re a fan of visiting churches (or even not), then the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is worth seeing. It’s great from the outside. It’s even better inside.

Amazed. The detail of the mosaic in this church is amazing, the manhours that must have gone in to do it!. Some very unique scenes are depicted. Automated ticket machines work faster but have no option for children discounts. There were so many guided tours inside, it was easy to overhear enough.

Miracle of incredible beauty . I think this pearl of art and architecture in world wide heritage.
All the walls are decorated with mosaic icons . . Splendid altar is in the heart of the church wich is both church and museum.
This is must to be place in Sankt Petersburg
Magnificent!. This was my favorite building in all St. Petersburg. It is best photographed on a sunny day but was beautiful even with clouds.
Impressive . Iconic. The interior is completely covered with mosaics which shimmered in the light. Very impressive

Do not miss this!. You will only need an hour to visit this magnificent church if you can avoid the lines.We had a guide from TJ Travel who was excellent and we were able to go straight it. Both the interior and exterior are incredible and so different to many other churches in Europe.
Beautiful Church. Had an opportunity to spend a day in SP and this was a highlight. Seeing this type of Russian church was a great opportunity. Very, very pretty
Fascinating Church. Such an interesting place. The mosaics and details in the church are fascinating. It was very crowded but so worth a visit!

Like Something Out of a Story Book. We also took the 2-day SPB tour, which we cannot recommend enough. The tour allowed 2 opportunities to see the Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood, one from the excellent canal tour (another highly-recommended thing to do) and in the church. The story of the church recanted by our guide was absolutely fascinating. This is a must-see when visiting St. Petersburg.

Unbeleivable architecture.. The historic monument in memorial of death of the most progressive and "democratic" russian tsar Alexander II. Was founded by his last will at the place where he was fatally wounded.

Unbelievablea place not to miss. Such places exist only in movies or Disney land. This literally takes your breath way, the exterior is spectacular with the colorful spires and domes, but only when you get inside do you fully grasp the grandeur . The walls are covered with colorful mosaics, the area of the altar is fascinating, the marble floors everything amazing.

A Must See. This is a remarkable testament of the love of a son for his father Alexander 11. The church was built and dedicated as a memorial to his father on the spot where he was assassinated. A must see when in St. Petersburg.
Just in awe..... Both inside and out, this place is beautiful. Stunning. Thought provoking. A must visit place - go there! Try and get there early to avoid the crowds...

Colors and legends. Tsar Alexander II was murdered here. Thus the name. It's a museum today, not a church anymore. Crowded, touristy, and not necessarily worth the entrance fee. Yet, quite impressive and colorful interiors.
Church of spilled blood. Breath taking inside. A must see. Please don't miss the opportunity to go inside. Just looking outside isn't enough,

Gorgeous church !. Rich in history, arts and construction, inside and out. Fantastic colors for your eyes to behold. Amazing !!! Love, love, love !!!
Words can not describe !!! Must see for yourself !!! Photos can't do justice to it !!!
Best church ever. This unlike anything i have seen in the USA AND the roof topps look like candy balls it is well worth the visit.

Don't miss , Must see. We visited this church while on a cruise to St Petersburg at end of June.If you has visa to Russia you can visit by your own.use the local transportation which is very cheap in the metro the station apears in english too.The entrance to the church cost about 4 $ and you can take an audio tour in several language.inside and outside its amazing.my recomandation -before the visit learn about the site in the internet.Wednesday is closed
amazing. this was a beautiful Church - take time to visit this beautiful place - it is a must see - the painting and sculptures are amazing

Beautiful. This was an organised tour from our ship. The cathedral really is something to see and experience - the miracles of christ are depicted all around the walls inside. Beware of pick-pockets around the city.

Most beautiful place in the world.... We visited the church as part of a choral concert we were attending with local friends. I can easily say that this is the most beautiful place I've ever been. As if the colorful exterior isn't impressive enough, the interior is simply stunning- extensive mosaic tilework covers nearly every wall and ceiling of the large interior, and it's awe inspiring. Please be sure to make this part of your visit to Saint Petersburg, you'll be glad that you did!

This is said to be the most photographed location in all of USSR.. Exceptional visit via SPB tours while cruise ship was docked for 2 nights in St. Petersburg. The SPB "deluxe 2 day tour" was everything and more that we had dreamed of. Visited late May 2016 and the weather was nearly perfect. The Church is very historic and a sight you will never forget.
Different than other European churches. Russian cathedrals are very different than what most have seen in the rest of Europe. You must visit it is on the top of the list of must sees
Incredible, inside and out!. One of the most iconic symbols of St. Petersburg, for a reason! A must see, inside and out. The mosaics are spectacular!
Must See Interior. Beautiful architecture and the interior is spectacular, very colorful. You must see the church at night and during the day because it's beautiful site.

Number #1 Sight to See. This is one of the most magnificent churches in the world. The mosaics defy description. I wished for fewer people to be inside. We had a good tour guide but St Petersburg is all about seeing the sights and being amazed!

Beautiful Church. Very beautiful church to visit.
The only issue was the rain non-stop.
I recommend it definitely. There is nearby also a bazar with souvenirs.
Magnificent. From the canal and from a bus or working tour, the church is magnificent. The colors, even on a gray day, are splendid. The icons tell so many stories--thanks to our guide.

Most beautiful church I saw in Russia. Exquisite, complicated mosaics depicting many bible scenes make this church interior more beautiful and more interesting than the static portraits of bearded men generally seen in other Russian churches. Multi-colored onion domes are extravagant and gorgeous.
Better than moskow. This church is ornate, colorfull, awe inspiring, and that is just the outside. The interior really requires more time than we had.
Beautiful inside and out.. Very impressive art work on the walls and ceiling. Lots of history in this building. Highly recommend it.
Amazing!. This place outdoes it's Moscow counterpart, St. Basil's Cathedral. It is beyond ornate and almost out of a Dr. Seuss book. Absolutely gorgeous and you must see it.

Stunning Church - a must see. After seeing the queue at the Hermitage this morning, we decided that the best option was to go visit the church, little did we know that this would have been the most breathtaking and beautiful church we have so far seen in St Petersburg. The queues to enter can be long but they do not last too long and there are ticket machines on the inside to avoid having to queue for longer just to get the tickets. I would definitely recommend visiting the Church on Spilled Blood as we enjoyed it very much. There is also an option to take an audioguide,but the audioguide that we took at St Isaac's cathedral was of a very poor quality so we read some information on wikipedia in order to fully appreciate the history and the architecture of the church. Overall, a must see in St Petersburg!!
Amazing site. Awe struck. Amazing mosaics. A must see when in St Petersburg. So glad this was on our itinary. Suitable for my mobility scooter.

St Petersburg. Whatever you do in St Petersburg you must visit this Church. Inside and out it is absolutely magnificent. The tour guides are very good. Ours provided us with headsets to hear her commentary which meant everyone could hear what was being said.
Beautiful. This is an iconic stop not to be missed, but be prepared that it's busy! Worth the time to get some photos, you only need an hour.
Amazing monument. Too beautiful to describe in words. Magnificent mosaics and altar. Very crowded but the historical society has done a marvelous job at restoring this Orthodox Church

Great mosaic art museum. I'm stunned by how beautiful this magnificent church is, architecturally, history, art and vibration. This is one place you don't want to miss if you love arts, architecture and history. Best mosaic artwork of all.

So beautiful I wept . This outstanding piece of history is simply breathtaking. The restoration was intense and beautifully done. The cost to get in was a bargain. Interior is breathtaking. Simply breathtaking. A MUST for any traveller to St Petersburg.

Impressive. Great outside - the pictures tell it all but good to see by yourself. Interior is very nice too if you're not scare by the crowd. Some very fine mosaic. Not my kind of stuff usually but the framed ones are superb.

So beautiful. We visited the Church of the Spilled Blood as part of the SPB tour of Saint Petersburg. The church is very impressive from the outside with its Russian domes and the beautiful mosaics in the inside. Besides the history behind its construction is very interesting.
Fabulous: go!. Alex 2 was virtually assassinated, but died a few days later. His son Alex III built this incredible thing to him. Fabulous!

Nice place. Beautiful Church, ful of frescos (maybe even too much of them).As I am not so crazy about that types of art, for me wisiting that place had only the historical value because it was built on the place where the emperor Akeksandra II was finaly murderd, after six unsuccessful attempts.It's looks much more interesting from outside (those who like that sort of art please do not be insult because of my observations).
my favourite church in St Petersburg. Picture-postcard beautiful from the outside - especially at night and interesting walls full of icons inside.
Must see. Beautiful church with much history. Breathtaking on the outside as well as the inside. A must see when in St. Petersburg, Russia. Best done with a tour group such as SPB Tours.

Simply amazing!. First impression is overwhelming! To see all the mosaics used inside the church really makes you appreciate the hard work put down. Some of these mosaics looks just like paintings and you forget that it is all just tiny tiny pieces. If you are a photographer be prepared to spend hours in here, searching for that one perfect image. Tickets can be bought on a machine outside the ticket office. To be reccommended!

A marvel!. This is one of the most beautiful churches we have ever seen. We just love visiting worthwhile places for their beauty and this is up there with the best. Absolutely amazing paintings/icons, mosaics, and incredibly beautiful architecture. Worth the visit.
Scenic. So many ways to look at it if you stand on the opposite side of canel you get the best view to take a photo. You have all different angle to look you have to pay to go in but it's worth it.

outstanding typical russian style church. Beautiful russian church built on the spot where one on the tzars was shot .The church is especially remarkable from the outside .The rest of the churches in st petersburg are not russian style but more western looking

A place to remember forever!. This church is not as old as the Basili church in Moscow but is more decorated. The mosaics inside are absolutly amazing!. I strongly recomend to get an audio-guide for a better understanding of the history of the church

Colourful confectionary of a shrine. A Russian style church with colourful domes and walls outside and lots of mosaics of saints on the inside. It was built as a shrine to tsar Alexander II who was murdered on the road now enclosed by the church. A museum and memorial.

Amazing building both outside and inside!!. This building is an absolute must for any visitor to St. Petersburg. The outside is a delightful example of the Eastern onion dome architecture. Inside, I was amazed to find, the walls and high, arches ceiling totally covered in the finest mosaics. Make sure you go with a guide to point out all fine details.
Breathtaking!!. Had no idea how beautiful this church was. A must see!! This was my 16 year olds highlight of our Baltic Sea trip. So much history here too.
Awesome. A beautiful excursion, and very moving. We loved it. Our guide was so knowledgeable. She moved us through the throngs of crowds and we didn't miss anything.
Wow. Must see in side as well as outside the mosaics are amazing go late in the day the lines are shorter

Absolutely enchanting. What a masterpiece, what a richness, what a beautiful place.
Loved the altar, the ceiling and the icons.
Superb
Stunning. This church is absolutely stunning. The entire inside is made of mosaics, the artwork, floors, etc. are absolutely gorgeous. Could have spent all day there!

Nice beautifull church. That was so beautiful inside and outside!
Dont miss it!
We were there for wedding photography of my friends and it was really nice for doing so.
Breathtaking . Don't miss this. It's a photographer's dream and it's just so beautiful inside no less, if not more, than outside. Worth reading about the history. Wikipedia!!

Just awesome.. Such an iconic sight from outside, it's truly stunning and it's different depending which side you look from. I would have been happy with that, but inside is spectacular too, the art work and colours is outstanding. Great story of its name and origin too, an absolute must see.
So unbelievably beautiful . So unbelievably beautiful. Best part of saint Petersburg. I was overwhelmed. Ever inch of this church didn't disappoint.

Most Immaculately Overdone Building Inside and Out - MUST SEE!!. This building captivates you when you first see it and then you have to see it! It is so "over the top" ornate and uniquely Russian looking on the outside the interior lacks no space with spectacular mosaics depicting Biblical history. Even the color palettes are fresh and unique. Of all of the buildings / attractions in St. Petersburg, this one and the Hermitage are MUST SEES! ENJOY!!

Impressive. We viewed the Church from the outside as the lines for entrance were far too long. This is the issue with most great attractions here. You can get to one attraction early in the morning and not have a large queue but after that you need to join the masses.The exterior of the church is amazing, the shapes, colors and textures.

Breathtaking Church. An intriguing history built on the site of Alexander 2's assassination. A magnificent building both inside and out. A canopy inside is built over the site of the actual assassination. But there is a remarkable use of semi-precious stones, marbles, jasper, carnelian etc, both on the floor and for screens, then there are the incredibly delicate mosaics. A visit is a must if in St Petersburg.
Magnificent Mosaics. Absolutely spectacular interior, all in mosaic. Only problem was that we had to share it with mobs of people.

Unique and Interesting Church. Wonderful example of a Russian Orthodox church. Very interesting and very ornately decorated inside. A little crowded but certainly worth the crowds to see this wonderful church.

An impressive sight. Centrally located on Nevsky Prospekt, it offers a stunning inside where the walls are covered in mosaic. No need to book in advance, despite we being there in high-season, we easily bought tickets from the machine.

Very Pretty. This church is beautiful on the inside and out. The artwork on the inside of the building is so beautiful. Every inch is covered in something wonderful. I would recommend anyone come to visit here.

Awe Inspiring..... Wow, what more can be said that has not already. Its like something out of a fairytale. The outside is so ornate, nothing like it, and the inside takes your breath away, , virtually every square inch covered in paintings, or mossaic, or GOLD.... We visited on a tour, so got to know about the history of the church, and all the important thing to see in it. Make sure you take your camera.....

Excellent visit and exhibit. The fascade of the building is beautiful the inside is stunning if you look up at the dome there is paintings and scenes everywhere.. We were on a two day guided tour with TJ travel lovely camels in the area

Amazing Church. In its own way, this Church can compete with Saint Chapelle of Paris, if not for stained glass then for gorgeous tile and exquisite preservation, both on its exterior and interior. A must see, for whatever reason even after we visited the inside, we found ourselves continually walking past this central location during our St. Petersburg stay.
you will go here, end of.. Everyone who visits St Petersburg will come and visit this church. Best place to photograph it is from the field of Mars. get an audio guide.enough said.
Beautiful Church. This church is beautiful inside and out. Completely different from churches in other countries. It is a must see in St. Petersburg.

Wonderfull. One of the most beautiful churches I have visited in Russia. Bright and amazing.
I recomend. Usually crowded.

Must see! Bucket list location!. The mosaics inside this church are amazing. Words cannot describe the magnificence. We pre-purchased vouchers for admission, and we are glad we did, as entrance is limited if it gets too crowded. There is also a shorter line for groups and vouchers. The outside of the church is a sight to see also, be sure to walk all the way around it and enjoy the street performers.
Spectacular from outside and rich inside. The cathedral is very impressive from outside. The mosaic inside in very rich but it is very small and could be visited within 15 min.
beautiful church. this is a truly amazing building.It looks like a picture postcard(which it often is) It gets really busy so early is good
church. Quick stop but interesting.Always good to enjoy the history of the city and the older buildings constructed long ago.

Mind blowing. Words alone cannot describe this place. From the views of the outside to the stunning interior, this place is mind blowing'.the moment you walk in the door the sheer beauty of the place is overwellming. A MUST to see

Simply breathtaking and amazing. worth the entrance fee, remember to bring your camera to get as many shots of this master piece. Full of history and so much amazing mosaic tiles which line the whole interior

Cruise Excursion. Visiting the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood was the finale to an excursion from my cruise ship M/V Magellan, The lead up to the visit was a trip on the waterways around parts of this "Venice of the North".There is so much to see in St Petersburg and trying to see everything in the two days we would be impossible, so I made the executive decision that seeing as much as possible from the outside would be the way to go for me.The trip on the waterways gave me an amazing view of the architecture that lined the route taken by the boat, enabling me to take many pictures.I did find afterwards, a book in English in one of the two souvenir shop (ship side of Immigration) that showed by map and pictures with description what the waterway traveller was seeing, so that supplements my photographs.As I said earlier, the visit to the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood was the last spot on this excursion and access was very strictly controlled. The Church was a beautiful example of Russian Architecture and once inside you are overwhelmed by the painting adorning almost every surface of the walls and ceilings.Unfortunately our visit was on a Sunday, so the church was packed. We were guided around the inside walls, but the best place to see and appreciate was the middle of the floor space.Our guide had issued our coach with headset receivers so we were able to hear her description (as long as you could see the identifying paddle you knew where to look).The guide called the paintings "icons", though in my simple view they were "murals" - but they were amazing.There are no stairways or steep slopes to hinder those with mobility problems, though the crush of people experienced on this Sunday visit could cause some a problem.Entry to the Church was by the front of the building, but the Exit was around the back. There was a walk around 3/4 of the Church to get back to where the coaches parked.Was it worth visiting? A resounding yes.If you travel independently, you will need to obtain a Visa before you arrive in Russia. As part of an organised excursion (whether organised through the Cruise Ship or via an Approved Excursion), you are covered by a Group Visa.
Must see!. Beautiful and very special, unique church! Entrance tickets cheaper before 6pm (can't remember how much they cost but not much J).

Amazing mosaic interior. Truly unusual eastern style architectural monument in a city heavily influenced by western style. The mosaic interior is the main impact together with the elaborate screen to the altar. Queues not as bad as expected to get in.

Wonderful Display of Orthodox Art. One of the must see sights of St Petersburg. Stunning on the outside and equally impressive inside. Lots of colourful orthodox artwork throughout. Even the railing by which the Emperor died is inside to mark the significance of the church. The visit can be less than an hour and you will see enough - particularly as it can be quite busy inside.
Overwhelming. 4000 m2 icons is overwhelming. A must see! Outside and inside are impressive! Also the Place where Alexander II tsar was killed.
history and architecture. When you there you feel History and architecture on the place ,extraordinary location that you mast to visit .
Church in a beautiful place. The Church is beautiful itself but the street leading to it from Nevsky is fantastic. So have a rest beside the river with fascinating scenery.

A curious building. Part of the Slavic architectural revival, the asymmetric domes are visible along the neighbouring canal and shimmer in the sunlight. Look closely and you can see features familiar from very different buildings in the Victirian gothic style eg Londons St Pancras or V&A. Inside the Pre Raphalite parallels continue with stunning mosaics and floral boarders

Breathtaking . A beautiful experience. The mosaics are amazing. The architecture is in a class by itself.one could spends hours admiring the beauty. it is now a museum and not functioning as a church.
Beautiful cathedral . Beautiful church, make sure to enter and see the amazing mosaics on the walls and ceiling! An absolute must see when visiting St Petersburg

Amazing . A must see! Such a beautiful location, not to be missed!If you want to avoid the chaos of having a tonne of tourists there, go before 7am in the summertime as the sun is up and there is barely anyone around as all the major tourgroups are still in their hotels, you can get amazing photos without people spoiling it!

Spectacular inside and out. Each time I visit Saviour on the Blood the experience improves. Now they have audio guides available, new facts emerge. The church was abandoned during Soviet times and used as a warehouse and store. Ongoing restoration is correcting much of the damage, although sadly, the icons are lost for ever.
Beautiful ! . Incredible work of art! I love to see the beauty we have in this world ! An incredible work with mosaics! The entrance ticket cost around 7 USD.
Striking Russian architecture. One of the main Russian churches to see. The work that has gone into design, paintings, mosaics etc is mind blowing.

Absolutely FAB-U-LOUS!!. What can i say about this church that hasn't already been said by others. Not only is it a building of many colours.. its theatrical. The exterior is stunning to the point I didn't know where to look first. Usually I find I'm quite disappointed with interior of churches or that i find them OK. I purposely did not look on TA to see what people had put although i did read the reviews stating its a "must See". Going into the church we were told no photos but they actually meant no flash ;-) What a joy. I've never seen a church like it... it's beautiful. Definitely definitely try and visit if you have the time - it's well worth it.

Should definitely visit it with the excursion. This place should be visited as it is a big part of the history of Saint-Petersburg! Take a guide with you, because otherwise you are definitely missing out.
Beautiful Church. Must visit. One of the best church I've seen. Full of historical background. Russian orthodox church that is beautifully built. A little too crowded but.

Stunning mosaics!. This church is not as attractive on the outside as St Basil's in Moscow but once inside you will be impressed. The entire interior design is made of beautiful mosaics. It's breathtaking. Get your tickets from the automatic ticket booth next to the ticket desk. Don't wait in line.
A bit of Mystery amd Magic. Simply must place to see in St. Petersburg. Centuries of history really overwhelming. Genius of mosaics all over the place

Incredible architecture. The tile work inside is incredible. Beautiful painstaking detail. Colors and patterns are awe-inspiring. Because it was so crowded we were glad we took a guided tour. I think the best place to take a picture is from the bridge facing the cathedral. We had gorgeous weather in May allowing for some great photos. However, we were advised they only average about 60 sunny days a year. Amazing story regarding Alexander the Great and how the cathedral came to be. Once in a lifetime experience.

Gorgeous!. Going into this church was exactly what I was expecting to see in Russia. We weren't able to stay long, but it did not disappoint! The architecture outside is blown away by the mosaics inside. SO BEAUTIFUL! Well worth a visit.
Toy Castle!. SO big and beautiful! The mosaics inside were breathtaking. I was in awe. The exterior was everything I wanted it to be. The colours were just phenomenal.

An absolute must visit. What a spectacular church both inside and out. The classic Russian church architecture is unique in St Petersburg and the interior can only be described as mind blowing. One of the best sights in St Petersburg
Beautifull. Not much to review. We went there at the end of the day hurry a bit, so it's definitely place to come back armored with historical facts and legends to try to imagine everything alive)

Amazing to see. This is really worth seeing inside and out! The price is really reasonable only about 400 rubles which is great compared to tourist prices in britain! The inside is gorgeous and stands out against the backdrop of st Petersburg. The ticket place is quite good as they are loads of booths but also ticket machines which translate into English so you don't have to worry about the language barrier, something that is far less a problem in st Petersburg than in Moscow where no one speaks English. Definitely one of the best places to visit in Petersburg!
OMG GORGEOUS . We went to The Church of the Spilled Blood and what a Gorgeous Church. Every part of the inside is covered with paintings and other Artworks Gorgeous.
Beautiful Church. A very beautiful church, both outside and in. The interior is fully made up of mosaics and is very intricate and extremely beautiful. Well worth a visit, and the small entrance fee.

Surprising detail. This church is no longer active and is now a museum but the glorious interior still has you amazed. It is a very Russian architecture with the traditional onion domes which can be seen from the Nevsky Prospekt. You don't needa lot of time to visit, maybe a half hour will cover it for you but it is unusual in its interior style and design and is surely worth visiting.
St. Petersburg Icon. If only 1 church, this is a good contender to view. It is not overly big inside or out, but plan to spend an hour to view inside and walk around the outside. Great photo opp.

Camera at the ready. This church is so photogenic ,all coloured onion domes is different sizes outside.The inside is pretty amazing too,the mosaics are so pretty and colourful.This church has a sad history but despite this it is a tourist magnet so best to get there early or late when coaches have left.

Incredible!. If you think this place is amazing on the outside wait until you get in! This place is breathtaking! The story behind it is very interesting so take some time to read about it before you visit! The entrance is 400RUB and worth every penny! This place is definitely a must!!!

The Rock Star Of St Petersburg. The most magnificent cathedral in St Petersburg. It is breathtakingly beautiful. When I visualized Russia this iconic church is what came to mind. The architecture is stunning and so are the colors used in the tile work on the spires/domes. The doors on the interior are a sight to behold. The restoration of this church has been done with much attention to detail, which was much appreciated. Make sure to visit!

Top church. If you only go into one church then make it this one. It is superb both outside and in.
The mosaics inside are incredible and well worth seeing.

My favorite . Beautiful outside and inside and from all angles and sides it was built in recognition of the murder of Alexander the second
It is a must see

Unbelievable beauty at day and night. One of the unique masterpieces in the heart of the city. Looks great both from the water while having an excursion on rivers and canals of St. -Petersburg and from the ground. If you are not in a hurry - take your time and get inside - mosaics are fascinating.
Spectacular . Elegant architecture and fine arts. Historical significance and religious importance. Adolescent friendly and tourist guidance.

Amazing church in St Petersburg. Another 'wow' church and must-see in St Petersburg. Must see! Read and see the pictures inside also about the bomb that was stuck in the roof and undiscovered for years!

This must be seen even just from the outside. This is a place of great historical importance and not see it would be foolish. Especially the beautiful mistake work from outside are just absolutely stunningly beautiful.
Absolutely stunning. The exterior of the church is nothing short of spectacular. The intricate mosaics in the interior are stunning. Don't miss this church when you visit Saint Petersburg.

Very nice church. Looks at first very much like the church on the red square in Moscow, inside, although small, is very pretty and rich decorated ! ! Decorations are vomplicated and appreciated well with a guide really !
Wonderful architecture. It is a must see of St. Petersburg. The architecture is extraordinary and it is even more beautiful from inside.

Iconic. Opens 10:30 am. Beautiful interior and exterior. The intricate mosaics inside look like exquisite paintings from afar. We got there when it opened, and the inside wasn't crowded. We were able to get in to see the mosaics, take pictures, and leave in about a half hour. When you exit out the back, there are souvenir stands outside along the canal.

What a land mark. We stopped on a cruise tour. This must be one of the most photographed buildings in St Petersburg. It dominates the skyline and which ever angle you choose it is amazingly spectacular. One one side there is a small covered market and that is also a good photo stop as you get a shot of colour in the stalls with the church dominating the horizon above. This is a must see site.

Pictures perfect for a postcard!. The church with its picture perfect location is a must when visiting St. Petersburg! Entrance fee was very reasonable. Suggesting to visit on a nice day to take photos like ours!

Church of the Spilled Blood.. Big queues but our TJ Travel guide bought tickets and managed to gain admission with any delay.As magnificent inside as outside. The mosaics are unbelievable. A must visit. Building of the Church only completed in 1907 but looks much older.
Amazing. Seeing is believing! This was a highlight of our St. Petersburg tour.This is a must see. Absolutely spectacular inside and out.

Interesting piece of architecture. The architecture is quite different to any of the other churches we see around in Moscow and St Peterburg. That makes the building a must see. Spend some time in the park/ garden across the road.
Absolutely fabulous. The outside is stunning but the inside is unbelievable..The mosaics and icons are a sight to see. Must be one of the sights to see in this city

A mut see attraction in St.Petersburg. This is definitely one of main sightseeings of the citycentre. Don't miss a chance to go inside. It's totally worth it! It's beautiful from the outside and inside at the same time. Amazing mosaic interior just will make you stand and stare there speechless.
Right out of a Disney Movie!. Beautiful church looks exactly picked out from an old fable. Lovely craftsmanship and architecture and also makes a great backdrop for some cool pictures.
Great mosaics. Wonderful mosaics, all the church is built from that, so it's completely unique in such a manner - must see.
Loved the mosaics!. Beautiful church with lovely mosaics inside. A must see landmark of St Peter. The interiors are just beautiful!

Gorgeous exterior, stunning interior. Incredibly beautiful cathedral in the heart of St. Petersburg. You see the onion domes from a distance as you walk down a canal toward it. The only thing more gorgeous than the exterior is the interior---rich beautiful images floor to ceiling. Great street scene outside too, with lots of visitors and vendors. A must-do in St. Petersburg IMO.

A beautiful church!. We came here on a tour with TJ Travel from St. Petersburg. It was great to have a guide that was connected to us with our own earpieces. This is a pretty place and you will take lots of pictures in and around the Cathedral. The outside architecture is outstanding!
Looks like a fairy tale castle.. We didn't go inside because a service was going on, but just being able to see the outside was a treat.

Amazing Church. When we go to Russia, we've normally seen a lot of pictures of the Red Square and St. Basil Church. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is impressive, beautiful and not that much talked about. It was built on the exact place where Tsar Alexander II suffered an attack which led to his death hours later. It is beautiful from the outside and inside it has a lot of granite, wonderful paintings and awesome mosaics.

Pure luxury. This church is just... WOW! So much beauty, so many mosaics, such a beautiful Iconostasis. Every visitor to St. Petersburg MUST visit this place!Besides its beauty, it is also a perfect explanation for the Russian revolution. At this location, the Tsar was killed, because of the repression of the imperial regime of the poor peasants. And as a reaction the imperial family build this church full of riches to show the population how much better off the ruling class was.

Stand and stare!. What a building! We stumbled upon it by accident, glowing in the early evening sun. The exterior held us spellbound for ages. Inside, the walls are richly covered with mosaic scenes from the Bible, set around the sombre black marble tomb of Alexander II. Highly recommend!

Iconic landmark . Everyone will be familiar with this church which is frequently used in tourist information. It is a must see as the inside is just as stunning as the outside. Being situated beside the river it is very photogenic. An hour is enough unless you are very interested in religious art.

Highlight of St Petersburg. This was the site I was most keen to visit and I wasn't disappointed, stunning inside and out. We visited in May before the peak of tourist season, while still busy, easy to move around inside.

Millions of pieces of mosaic . One of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited..the closer you get the better you can see the brilliant work outside and inside then....breathtaking. Can't say more..
Wonderfull mosaics. That was very nice constraction and awesome mosaics its stand behind the canals you can walk easily from the nevisky street i think must see in st petersburg

Beautiful . This church is just beautiful with columns of granite cut in one piece...and the inside has colorful ceramic tiles. The Tsar, Alexander II was assassinated on this site on March 1, 1981, thus the name of the church.
Amazing, but hard to get a good picture of. We spent a lot of time walking inside and out and our necks hurt from staring up at the ceiling. Easily one of the best parts of SPB.
Stunning church.. Well worth the visit. 100% mosaic interior. Stunning. Not much of a q and v central. Probably my favourite church in saint p.

Stunning church. This is an amazing church, both exterior and interior. A definite must if you visit Saint Petersburg. The interior is very different from all the other churches in that it is very "Russian" as distinct from most of the others, which are beautiful but more European.

Can never cease to be amazed by Russian Church Architecture l). It's much more awesome than any picture one has seen. Amazingly different along with the story of the Tsar who was assassinated on the location it was built. It's as impressive from within as it is from the outside. The artwork , decor and the sheer opulence of being overcome by its golden interior is enough to ensure a memorable experience.

Gorgeous heart of St. Petersburg. Once you see this extraordinary building you will feel that you are truly in Russia, but don't just settle for the outside, spend a few Rubles and go in....it's worth it. The brilliantly painted interior is a celebration of religious art that can be appreciated by everyone, not just those of a religious persuasion. There is also a nearby souvenir market which was one of the best I came across.

Hard to Believe - seriously - check the math and the dates in history. 100% of the wall coverings and art are mosaic tile works. In all, they estimate 70,000 square feet of mosaic work. It's hard to even believe. My son and I did some quick math to conclude roughly 600 mosaic tiles per square foot - for a total of 42,000,000 in the building. More amazingly, they accidentally found an unexploded bomb lodged in the cupola of the structure during restoration - IN 1961! It sat for almost two decades before being discovered. Even more amazing is the Bolshevik's were due to destroy the church because it represented faith at a time where that was punished. They even announced the date it was due to be destroyed to break the will of the "believers." It was June 22, 1941. You guessed it, Germany invaded Russia early that morning.How many times can the Church of Spilled Blood avoid annihilation? Miracles?
Amazing. From the outside this large church is amazing but the main the reason for a visit is to view the wonderful mosaics that decorate the walls. A definite "must".
Amazing! Must see!. Must see! Astonishing...worth every minute you spend here...I couldn't believe what my eyes were seen...the mosaics are unique.

Spectacular Insight and Out. One of the highlights of our trip to St. Petersburg. As beautiful as it is on the outside, it is even more amazing on the inside. A visit to this beautiful city is not complete without see it. There is also a great local souvenir market just next to the church.
A must see. Wonderful building you cannot go without visiting this one. It's easy to get to and the queues are not too long as it's only small inside so people don't linger too long
God is Busy on the Weekends. Try not to go on a weekend, it's just too crowded, especially in the afternoons, but definitely worth a visit for more of the opulent splendor of St. Petersburg
Riviera Travel tour in June 2016. Must see experience in St. Petersberg both externally and internally. Lots of tourist stalls in the area of mixed quality and also be careful of pickpockets.

A must see. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is an absolute must see in St P! Amazing from the outside and even better from the inside! Tip: use your Credit Card and use the machines to avoid the queues when buying tickets.

A must if your 'in town'. It gets very busy - we were on an organised tour and were 'swept in' as the doors were opened - during the bad old days used as a warehouse - before renovation. Originally built in an earlier style, but actually completed in the early 20th century. Very intricate mosaics - a 'must visit' !

Beauty both day and night. As photographers, we went several times of day to get this beautiful cathedral in the varied light...you will want to see it during the day and lit up at night. Simply stunning.

Sui Generis. I have seen thousands of churches and cathedrals in my day, but this one is breathtaking even though it is largely a reconstruction after the Germans bombed Leningrad back to the Stone Age ( to borrow a familiar phrase.). It almost defies belief how ( not to mention why) they Soviets accomplished this feat and not surprising that it took 25-30 years. I'm not going to ruin it for you by droning on about the details, but this place left us with the same impression I had after an afternoon at Our Lady of the Rocks in the Bay of Kotor. If you visit St. Petersburg and see only three places, it would be here, the Hermitage and Peterhof. Happy Trails.
A Must See. Very interesting and educational. Our tour guide Nadya was extremely knowledgeable and informative. Highly recommend St. Petersburg tour company and Nadya as the guide

A must see. This was something that was on our 2 day guided tour of St. Petersburg. It is very different from the other churches and cathedrals in St. Petersburg and should not be missed. To say it is iconic would be an understatement.

Beautiful yet not special. Beautiful paintings on every wall inside. Early in the mornings there are painters on the bridge who are painting the outside view of the church, which is located on the riverside.

Amazing internal decoration . An iconic building with wonderful Russian orthodox architecture including beautiful coloured domes. The inside is just as stunning and well worth a visit. Wheelchair access is via a steep ramp and it's difficult to move around inside due to the sheer number of visitors but with patience you can see it all. Don't forget look up at the ceiling as well as taking in the painted walls.

Amazing. Different from many Russian churches, this church has none of the traditional icons. Everything inside is executed in mosaic. It must have been a feat for the artisans of the time. Absolutely breathtaking!

The St. Basil's of St. Petersburg . It looks a lot in design like St. Basil's. It is really beautiful to see. We didn't go inside because, let's be frank, after you've seen the inside of 20 churches in Russia... You've seen them all. Gorgeous exterior though, lots of food and cheap vendors of matryoshka dolls. Of course! Haha
Must see. This church is built on the land where a royal was killed. The spot is fenced off. It is a nice church to see.

Glorious Inside and Out. This is a spectacular work of art! The mosaic scenes are like no other place we've been to in the world (including St. Mark's in Venice, Italy). It is a must-see in St. Petersburg. Go with an official tour guide. You'll get the most out of what you experience.

Amazing church..... We recently did a walking tour of the area around the Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood which ended with a tour of the church. What an amazing building this is. I found both the outside and inside fascinating. We were told to dress conservatively and that no photos would be taken inside. This was not the case.... people were wearing anything, shorts, short skirts....and the majority of the men did not remove their hats! The real downside for me was the crowds and how incredibly rude people can be....this is a church and a little respect wouldn't go a miss.

Breath taking Church. This is a breathtaking church built many centuries ago. The work inside and outside the church is jaw dropping.The work on the exterior is done well and not like other churches you would see elsewhere.The interiors is done by ceramic glass tiles, and it's just an extraordinary piece of art work.The overall experience was amazing.

Magnificent architecture. A beautiful building, but because I was in a wheel chair, we could not get very close to the buildings because the cobbled pavements made it painful to negotiate the distance from tour bus.

Wow!. This Church, now a Museum is like a Disney fairy tale. On arrival in St Petersburgh we went for a walk and spied the Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood. It is hard to take in the spectacle of the whole Church and all the different onion domes, from a distance due to the surrounding constructions. The light was not at its best due to drizzle, but is was still amazing. It was just closing so we went back later to go inside. The best view we had of the Church was from the war memorial park with the eternal flame.We did not spend long inside the Church as it was very crowded, the mosaics are wonderful. You can get a really good picture of the central roof by laying your camera on the ground on timer, you can be in the shot yourself. After my husband did this there were groups using his technique to get a shot of the roof with themselves looking down.

Beautiful inside and out. Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood was built on the site of the assassination of Czar Alexander II. It has a stunning architecture and is beautiful inside as well. This is a very popular site, so visitors should expect crowds. Consequently, an early morning visit would alleviate the problem. Certainly one of the places to see when visiting St. Petersburg.

Over-rated and definitely overdone. I made my way from Nevsky Prospect past the four-block gauntlet of stands selling cheap (but not inexpensive) souvenirs along the Griboedova Canal to get a look at the Church of the Savior on the Spilled Blood, erected on the site where Czar Alexander II, who was something of a progressive (for example, he ended serfdom), was shot in his carriage. This was the third attempt on his life, and it was successful; although he didn’t die immediately, he later succumbed to his wounds. The usual young couple in 18th Century costumes posed for photos with tourists. A young man walked around with a baby raccoon on his shoulder. A fairly good musician played an electric guitar and sang rock and roll. But the closer I got, the worse the church looked. Except for the one that was gilded, the domes appeared to have been constructed of cheap materials, almost like a stage set; and the entire façade, with its Gothic Revival arches, Romanesque columns and faux Byzantine icons, was an ostentatious hodge-podge. I didn’t bother buying a ticket to see the interior. Given the herded hoards exiting tour buses, I figured I could see all I wanted (and perhaps more) online.

outside is better, than inside. Best view is from outside. I wasn't excited from what I saw inside. All walls are painted, but for me it wasn't something for what to pay entrance fee. Inside was full of groups of children.

Must see for St. Peterseburg. This is a must see for St. Petersburg, it's reminiscent of St. Basils Cathedral in Moscow. Great souvenir shopping on the riverfront behind the church. Don't miss this one!
Wonderful mosaics. This church is of course very beautiful from the outside, but if you pay the (quite reasonable) 250 roubles entry, you can see some quite amazing mosaics.

Beautiful but crazy. This is one gorgeous, over the top cathedral. But the sheer number of tourists inside make the experience once there so crazy. Depending on your level of comfort with crowds, it may be best to just stick with the photos of the outside.
Mosaic Madness . Expect crowds in the summer but once inside you'll understand why. The mosaic art work just left me speechless. I marvel at the patience of the artists who created this.

Absolutely packed with tourists. Considered (by some) to be one of the highlights of a visit to St Petersburg, this church (now museum) was absolutely packed with tourists, with long queues to get in. Inside it was difficult to move around and hard to keep track of where our group were going. Because of the crowds it was very difficult to fully absorb this amazing building. We had high hopes for this place but were disappointed by the experience because of the crowds.

Australian Travellers. An amazing structure in the Russian style and the most famous landmark in St Petersburg. The mosaics, the onion domes in gold and mosaic are stunning. Walk around the church to see it from a different angle. The story behind the name is well known and a visit is a must.

Amazing structure and history. The history of this Church is quite interesting and the complex structure/architecture is amazing. The location lends to the effect, next to a public park, and in a public square..... fascinating!

Beautiful with interesting history. This church is very interesting if not that old. It was built in the late 1800's to early 1900's on the assassination site of Czar Alexander II. It is quite ornate and has wonderful mosaics outside and inside.
Amazing. This cathedral is by all means one of the most impressive churches I've ever visited. No description can do justice to the mosaics of interior: you have to see it for yourself.

Architectural wonder. Un-Paralleled mosaic work by Italians! Otherwise very impressive architecture also!
Good audio guides provide relevant information inside.
iconic. see this, if you decide not to see any of the other churches or cathedrals. beautiful and amazing mosaics.
Highlight of a great trip.. Great highlight of our fantastic visit to St Petersburg, lovely, scenic area with lots to see and do.

plan if coming from a ship - hints. we visited as part of a two day cruise, the ship excursions varied from £650.00 per person for a day trip which was almost the price we paid for the cruise. It would have been cheaper to get a visa a month in advance and then get off the ship two days running. Can I also add that the cruise line does not inform you that there is a red hop on and off bus which takes you to all of the tourist sites and is a fraction of the cost of the ship tours, If we had been more savy and organised our visa we could have got off the ship for the two days, however due to the expense remained on board for one of the days as you can not get through customs.However onto the church, magnificent place, but the single ticket at the kiosk or you end up paying entry to all of the churches, not much difference in price and we retained the ticket as a souvenir. Beautifully decorated, lots of azure blue/gold. Very touristy outside, beware people with baby racoons trying to take photos and charging high prices, cute racoons but sure as soon as they get big enough they will be made into the fur hats been sold opposite the photographers,
Spilled blood. I have never been in anywhere so amazing in my life it just takes your breath away. It is just filled with mosaic after mosaic wonderful.
Beautiful and splendid. Typical russian architecture and colourful domes. Most attractive church and typical landmark. People interested in photography would go berserk.
Inspiring church!. This is the most popular place and symbol of St petersburg. You should definitely visit this church. You have to pay access fee to see inside.
Lovely from the outside. A must see in St. Petersburg. The exterior is fabulously exotic, but could happily have missed the interior. Wall to wall painted saints on every surface a bit overpowering.

Notable Church, Better from Outside. I visited the Church of the Resurrection of Christ (Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood) in early May 2016. The weather was delightful and clear. The church is built alongside the Catherine Canal. The "spilled blood" referenced in the name of the church is that of Tsar Alexander II who was critically injured when, on March 1, 1881, a bomb went off near him and he fell at the exact spot where the church was later built. He was taken to a hospital where he died within a matter of hours. In his honor, this church was built on the spot where he fell. The outside of the church is magnificent with its multi-colored onion domes and gold gilded onion domes, with a mural on the outside of the church. The multi-color domes are enameled paint with many different shapes of wood on the domes. Inside the Russian Orthodox church there is a canopy of the site of the mortal wounding of Emperor Alexander II. Inside there are also numerous murals on the walls, in the domes and on the ceilings of the church. The outside is more impressive than the inside but the inside is worth seeing. The cost to go inside the church is 250 rubles.

Beautiful. A must see, you will not believe the work that went into this church. Go early as it gets busy. The history is awesome. Look out for the resident church cat, he was sleeping on a chair, so funny as it was very busy.
Amazing tour. Astounding Church, mosaic work was breathtaking and the atmosphere awesome! Best seen on a tour as there is a lot of interesting detail to absorb
Church of spilled blood. Simply amazing! Lots of people inside at one time but our Alla guide managed to keep us together and moving along without any difficulties

Amazing building. This amazing building is not a church, but a shrine. The exterior is truly exotic with the numerous domes etc. Inside, all the walls are covered with mosaics which are quite extraordinary. It would take several visits to fully appreciate everything there is to see in and around this building. Our only criticism was that it was difficult to move around the interior because of the sheer number of tourists.
Mosaic. Must see and must visit for everyone. It's one of the best places in Saint-Petersburg. Mosaic art, culture, history, all of it you can find at this place.

SIMPLY AMAZING. Wow what an awesome attraction Even more amazing in real life .. The photos don't do it justiceA City full of great architecture and history and this is undoubtedly the number 1Don't miss it

2 day cruise stop in st. petersburg, russia. the church of spilled blood was definitely a highlight of our tour. It's architecture and story are such a part of Russian history. all the palaces, gardens, museums, etc. make St.. Petersburg an incredible place to visit. if you are planning a visit I would highly recommend TJ Travels. We booked a two day tour with them and it was great. They take care of everything so there is no worry about a visa or anything. Just walk off the boat and be ready for a full day of fun and amazing sights.

Amazing. We went here with our guide as part of a two day tour. We were lucky as we didn't have to queue. It looks just as stunning as the pictures. I was so impressed with the mosaics. Beautiful both inside and out. It has to be on your list to visit when in St Petersburg
I've never seen anything like this. Inside and out, this is a magnificent place to see. The ornate style and exquisite details are beyond description.
Crowded, but not to be missed. Absolutely stunningly beautiful. Crowded, at least in June, but worth dealing with the people because of the amazing craftsmanship.
Outstanding mosaics and Icons. Part of the typical tour but an amazing location. The mosaics were unbelievable. Amazing. Can't imagine anything like it. Always crowded.

Definitely Worth a Look. You don't have to make this a tour, just pay the ticket price and take a look inside. As beautiful as it is outside, the mosaics inside are breathtaking - floor to ceiling. Pictures cannot depict the beauty.
Beautiful but crowded. Most original church in SPb. It's a must but there's too much people, which doesn't allow to enjoy the visit completely.

As beautiful as the pictures. Not to be missed. The exterior of this church is stunning and the interior breathtaking. Situated alongside a canal and is the site of the assassination of Alexander. The church was extended to include the place of the assassination.
Great story, great stop. Included in most tours, it's a great stop and make sure you know the whole story behind the name. Take pictures, no flash.

Awesome. Not really a religious guy, but im into art and this is really great. Its a bit crowded but its worth it. You pay to enter and see everything, but the outside is gorgeous. They sell souvenirs inside. You can see everything in an hour and a half, its not that big.
Beautiful. One of the highlights of our trip. The mosaics were spectacular all the way to the ceiling. Definitely a must see if you are in St Petersburg!

Outstand Even in St.P. A beautiful place. Ticket line probably not long though it will be crowed inside. Well worth your time even if you have seen many religious sites. Note that entry door is just to the right as you face the ticket booth. Don't follow the crowds to the left...they are going to the garden or shopping street behind. As for the many shopping booths the guidebook says are behind the Church...yes there are many. But each has pretty much the same tourist stuff. Not likely to be worth your time. Though a walk down this street/canal is pleasant. Easy to see on your own. No tour needed.
A stunning visual experience. If in St Petersburg make sure you get to this fabulous church and see the amazing coloured onion spires.

Colorful Church. This church is very similar to St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. It was built between 1883 and 1907 to honor Alexander ll who died on March 1, 1881. You must visit the interior as this church has more mosaics than any other church in Russia, over 7,000 square meters. So don't be discouraged by a long line, wait it out to get inside to see the marvelous mosaics.

Beautiful active cathedral. More modest, by Russian Orthodox standards, than St. Nicholas Cathedral but for some reason I loved it more. Perhaps because it is an active cathedral which means be respectful: no shorts, scarves for women, and no camera flashes. Enjoy the live music if your timing is right.
Amazing mosaics. A must see, stunning mosaics. This marvelous Russian-style church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881
Go. Just take a look at the photos on this site. A beautiful example of an Orthodox church. The decoration is as stunning as the history sad. Half an hour here is time well spent.

One of the most photographed buildings in St Petersburg. As the season here is short, generally May to October, be prepared for queues. Wherever there are crowds there will be pickpockets so be careful. We were fine as we had an excellent guide with us. Please note, do not take large backpacks with you. Not because of the pickpockets but because you will not be allowed to take them in with you. This means lost time in checking bags and coats in and out. If on a mini no is secure, leave it there.
Amazing church and Iconic St. Petersburg.. Well worth going inside to see it. Only takes 20 minutes or a half hour to walk around but so stunning inside and out.

where Alexander II was fatally wounded in an assassination attempt. Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ is known locally as the Church on the Blood - this is the spot where Alexander II was fatally wounded in an assassination attempt on March 1, 1881. Do visit.
Awesome!!!!. Wonderful and fantastic weather in St. Petersburg with beautiful churches .......... and places .......to see for everyone loves Highly recommended......
A must see sight. As with all the attractions in St Petersburg, this is a must see building with it's unique design and unfortunate history attached.

Stunning sight. Although the outside of this beautiful building is spectacular to behold - I had no intention of going inside and being "herded" around. These days, I find online resources beneficial and the need to see fist hand - not so much!
Iconic and beautiful. There might be a long queue to get in (lots of tour groups from cruise boats!) but be patient - the interior paintings are jaw dropping and well worth the long wait.

Amazing! You MUST go inside. Don't cheat yourself by only having a look at the outside of this magnificent church, which is beautiful in its own right. You MUST go inside. The entire inside is covered in the most glorious mosaics. You will cheating yourself out of one of St. Petersburg's most wonderful sites if you miss it.

Beautiful. The outside is incredibly beautiful, the inside is stunning - full of gold and mosaics. The Russians stand for church services, so no seating. Very crowded, but a must see whilst in the city.

Amazing Work of Art, Inside and Out. This church is like no other building on the face of the Earth. It is a work of art on the scale of a world wonder. To learn its history - the depth of feeling that inspired it, subsequent neglect and heroic restoration - makes it that much more amazing to behold.

A must visit in st.petersburg. Great place to visit , even better the moscow catheral
Best visiting in summer
Nearby park is worth visiting too
Best attarction in sp
History . The history behind the making of the place is full of architecture and amazing painting that goes back in history and has the biggest works of mosaics
A must. Go see it . You can not miss it. Wonderful outside and inside. Get an audioguide .Bellissima Stupenda

Wondrous. MUST visit if you're in St Petersburg, unbelievable craftsmenship showcased, not a single piece of wall isn't covered in mosaic. The art is so high quality, it's the best quality, technique and design wise, that I've ever seen. So rich of color, stories, characters, patterns, playing with perception and shapes... I effortlessly took amazing pics. Wow. I went in the evening, got a hunge that it's more quiet than during the day. They offer evening-tickets during the summer only. The cathedral is small, which is perfect, because you can easily make sure that you saw everything. I absolutely loved it.
Breathtaking. If you have the opportunity to go , take it! One of the most breathtaking places I've ever seen. Absolutely beautiful. Make sure when you're inside to look up!

Stunnning. This church was magnificent from the outside, but the inside was even more so. All of the walls were covered with brilliant mosaics and the altar was gold. Amazing! Not to be missed. It has significant history because Emperor Alexander II was killed on the spot.

Go inside. We went on a tour of the city and saw the outside of this beautiful church. We did not get a chance to actually go inside.We returned and actually went inside. The mosaics are just amazing.
What I came to St. petersburg for. Beautiful, awesome, wonderful! Huge crowds, but such is life. A little on the expensive side. I thought it said after 6p.m. Was cheaper, but lady said no.
A must do. But costs more after 6 pm, useful small display about restoration ....a few steps away from Russian museum (which is free for students and has a great cafe)and the the Main Street.

One of it's kind of Tiled Mosaics. This is the church that is unique in it's own way. Firstly, it has the trademark of Onion (Russian trademark), then inside the church, there are full of drawing done using Mosaics. Look, all churches have drawings but this one, the drawing is done by tiled Mosaics.
Go inside. Obviously the outside is fantastic. But pay the 300 rubles and get the whole experience. The entire interior is mosaics and gold. Read the history of the church to appreciate it even more.

Church . Hey guys what a church mind blowing . It's too important part in st.petersburg . I should visit this . It's something which can't be missed . U can experience lot new things . Do visit
Thanks
Astounding Tiled Mosaics. Nothing quite prepared us for the experience of a church interior completely covered in mosaic tiles. Greatly worth a visit.
Must See. Wow over the top. You can see everything in 30 minutes or spend two hours. Happy to see Russia restoring things..
Mosaic Beauty. This church built at the site of the assassination of Alexander is an amazing mosaic offering of the biblical stories and an exceptional example of an Orthodox Church.

Such a beautiful church. Some Russian friends insisted we see this church -- and I thought, oh, another one. Wrong! This was a spectacular and beautiful church, inside and out. It also holds special significance for the city.

Amazing historical place to see!. You should definitely visit that church and take a tour around.
You can buy a ticket online in order to skip the queue.

Amazing church!!! Must see if in St Petersburg.. The outside is amazing to look at! But wait till you get inside!!! It's so incredible to see the mosaic covered walls and ceilings. You will not be disappointed! Costs about 300 rubles to get in and if you want an audio guide it costs another 100 rubles.
A must see. Brave the queues, suffer them, and just get yourself inside to glory in the mosaics! There are 7,500 square meters of them, from top to bottom, on every wall!
Interior is spectacular . The Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood is well worth a visit, especially the interior which is covered in mosaic artwork.

Unexpected. We did not expect a church this impressive in St. Petersburg. We first saw the church from a distance on a tour when we stopped for photos a few blocks away - the church has a great skyline view. Later that day we had the chance to go inside and loved it. While not as large as a lot of European churches, the detail reminded us of St. Peter's Basically at the Vatican. Definitely worth your time!
