Красиво очень. Surprise - it was open until 10pm!!!! No line - inexpensive ticket that includes a tour with a professional guide. Must go!
lovely. classic russian Christian hurch architecture and great for taking a picture outside in daytime. it's beautiful!

Church on Spilled Blood. Could be the most beautiful building I saw in St. Petersburg. It is so unique and gorgeous. We went inside to see the mosaics and it was super crowded. Hard to see the art with so many people. Glad we went as it was a truly beautiful place.
Outstanding . Amazing exteriors and awesome mosaic filled interior. Probably the largest and best mosaic work I have seen. Very central and easy to get to.
A Stunning Church. Both the exterior and the interior will take your breath away. Outside the towers and domes and inside the beautiful mosaics that cover the entire church

Beautiful exterior and interior. Very moving history.. The outside of this church was very crowded, with tour buses and pedestrians; the inside a little less crowded. Definitely worth a visit, doesn't take a ton of time to see.

Must See. Our guided walking tour ended with the church. This is a spectacular church topped with colorful spires and spheres. The entire surface is covered with mosaic tiles inside and out. Twenty foot apostles and saints from the floor to the ceiling. A little crowded but well worth the visit.

Very special. We visited this church...one of a kind very interesting.
Only deception is there is nothing written in english.

sad history. the mosaics are truly great and well worth visiting and spending some time remembering the history of the site. When you see the cobble stones that still have the blood of the tsar that was killed here and wonder what would have happened if he hadn't been killed

Magnificent - Do not Miss!!!. We visited the Church of the Savior and expected merely another beautiful church. I must say I was stunned. The architecture and art on the walls of this church are among the most spectacular I have ever seen. We have traveled a great deal and this topped almost any architectural/art we have visited. Every aspect of this Church is breathtaking from the moment you see it.... Do not miss visiting! It is crowded, but no matter, Inside and out it is unforgettable and you will not want to leave....Check the times for tickets and beware of pick pockets in all crowded tourist spots.

great. one of the best museum of mosaic art, ask for a guided tour and will spend a wonderful hour listening to the very bloody and cruel life of the churchlocated in the very heart of saint petersburg
Beautifil Architecture. This was a beautiful church. The craftsmanship was lovely. The interior was beautiful and of course the exterior is quite striking.

Spectacular. We visited as part of a guided tour through TJ Tours. We could've spent hours looking at the beautiful building and were so pleased it was part of the itinerary. This church exceeded our expectations and was well worth a visit. Do be wary of the grounds around the sight for pick pockets though. You can see them in action. Don't let it put you off its not dangerous just keep your hands on your valuables.

Magnificent Inside and Out. This church is amazing. It is incredibly beautiful on the outside. It towers over St Petersburg and worked as a landmark for us as we walked all over the city. You must tour the interior. It is fantastic in its artistry and it is filled with history. Be sure to check opening times and days. The ticket office "opens" at 10, but does not start "selling tickets" tickets until 10:30!

Superb! A must see. As an iconic building, it would be considered unwise to miss the opportunity to visit the Church. The building doesn't disappoint, but the interior is absolutely phenomemal. Pay the small entry fee - it will be the best money you spend.
Part of 2 day tour with TJ travel. Very pretty church with a lot of history. The mosaics are amazing on the walls and the paintings on theceilingsare beautiful. Watch out for pickpocketers.

Stunning architecture. When I first thought about going to visit St. Petersburg the first thing that came to my mind was the Hermitage Museum, the Neva river, the city canals and .. Matryoshkas :) However, I was caught speechless when I was left speechless for a good couple of minutes after I first saw this church. It got even more beautiful as I approached it. It was like a dream. The architecture is something to write home about, the details and its history... WoW.I highly recommend a visit to St. Petersburg and to the Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood.

Amazing, rich and historical. Historical place (asssassination of Alexander 2nd), rich architecture (like Basilius in Moscow), decoration, paintings/mosaics inside. Astonishing mosaic walls. This church is a must-see.
Amazing. Amazing exterior, even more amazing interior, loved it, a must see in St Petersburg. Was very crowded but this did not spoil our visit in any way.

amazingly. It's incredibly beautiful! Color, a huge, impressive! A lot of emotion... really… Inside is very interesting! I never seen anything like this. And water canal here... come here morning, you will get a lot of pleasure!

Amazing.... The Church of Savior on spilled blood is a must see during St petersburg visit. was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated as per our guide. It includes Great mosaic walls, ceiling, columns etc... every inch of this place could tell you a story.There is a souvenir shop inside the church on your way out, displays lots of religious items...
Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. A breath-taking exterior coupled with a lavish and historically important interior combine to make this one of St. Petersburg's top attractions.

Church on Spilled Blood Visit. To be honest, I didn't really know what to expect from this visit. Truly, this is a testament to the skills of the artisans who built it. The interior is a perfect companion to exterior, and is well worth the ticket price.
Beautiful. This is a must see it is amazing and so full of history. Beware though if you want to buy souvenirs inside the church they only take Rubles.

Stunning!!!!!. The church was the first place that I visit and it was like 15 walk from my hotel. When I turn right around the cornor, my jaw is dropped!! The church is so stunning, gorgeous, and majestic. It is exactly like the postcard or the painting that you see. A must visit!!!!
Beautiful. It was amazing to see what it looked like after WWII vs now. The restorations were terrific. Beautiful!

Impressive. Take an audio guide (only 100 rbl) and you will get all informations. The great paintings inside ar in fact made from small tiles - mosaic. The floor is made by 16 types of marble. Do not miss!

Beautiful, but with some misgivings. This is a beautiful church, inside and out. The intricate mosaic artistry of the interior is spectacular and the detailing in the exterior architecture is captivating. For these reasons the church is worth visiting. When we visited, however, the church was extreme overcrowded inside. We could barely move. Our unhappiness over this issue was made more acute by the fact that the entrance fee, in our opinion, was high. Personally, I also didn't like the commercialism of selling cheap trinkets actually inside the church, and I was left wondering if this beautiful church had been reduced to a money-making venture.

Very impressive looking church. We briefly visited this church as part of a tour but unfortunately didn't have time to enter, but it certainly looked impressive from the outside. We were warned that pick-pockets are rife in the area so take care.

Iconic image of St. Petersburg. Nothing says St. Petersburg more than the image of this church. Beautiful Russian Orthodox Church, now a museum. Built in traditional Russian style at the end of the nineteenth century in memory of Emperor Nicholas II, who was fatally shot on the spot. Every inch of the interior is covered with colorful religious icons. Certainly worth a visit and reading up on the history of this church. And of course it is an awesome photo op.

Must see in St Petersburg - amazing tile art!. When you round the corner from the main street and see the onion tops you think - " yea, this is what I hoped to see in St. Petersburg". Pay the reasonable fee to tour inside and to get a self guided audio tour. Look at the amazing detail of the tile work inside - its just incredible.
The highlight of our St Petersburg tour. Truly amazing and not to be missed. We did a 2 day tour with TJ Travel and this was one of the many unique sights in the city.

Stunning And Mesmerizing. Normally I dont like visiting Churches with entrance fee. But this one is exceptional and beautiful in every corner every Dome inside and out. Rich in history and story. Were Emperor Alexander II was brutally wounded and murdered. Was closed for so many years for restoration after the War and was open again for public. This is one of the sought after and a must see when visiting St. Petersburg.

Well worth a visit. Did not go inside but visited the building itself, it is breath taking and stunning. There are some little stalls selling Russian dolls and souvenirs near by. It is spectacular to see this building

One really precious stone of russian religious architecture !. I barely thought that we wouldn't see some churches or cathedrals of typical russian medieval orthodox architecture in St.Petersburg as we had seen in Moscow, when reality pleasantly confuted me. Here,almost at the confluence of the canal Gryboedov in the river Moyka, on the canal right embankment, emerges literally as from the depths of the earth, miraculous edifice, that is, the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. That is one of the main sights of St.Petersburg. It was built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in 1881. From this fact derives the name of this wondrous structure, I may say, the chef d'oeuvre of human craftsmanship. Construction of the church lasted during the reigns of Alexander III and Nicholas II.Completely picturesque creation, either outside or inside. Full of decorated windows with winding lines, little columns on the facade, colourful roofs with the onion domes on the top, arched gilded doors, some little gates and so many other wonderful shapes. And when we entered inside, there awaited us equally magic sights. Especially are distinctive the numerous mosaics and very rich iconostasis.Also are presented some paintings of the most celebrated Russian artists such as Viktor Vasnetsov, Mikhail Nesterov and Mikhail Vrubel.Again, as so many times before in Russia, we were staggered beyond all expectations.

Stunning. Give yourself at least a couple of hours to explore this beautiful church - it's simply stunning.Can be quite crowded in the mornings with tour groups but better later in the day - plus there are some great, good value kiosks outside for souvenir shopping.

Stunning.. Quite simply a beautiful building both inside and out. The Byzantine style architecture is interesting to see, colourful and like a fairytale. The inside is covered - every square inch - by impressive Christian tile mosaics. From a distance as well as up close it is a beautiful building.
Thrillingly beautiful.. This is an iconic church in St. Petersburg. Built on the exact spot where Alexander II was assassinated, it is lavishly decorated both inside and out. Highly photogenic.

Don't miss this one. This church is a must to any traveler to St Petersburg. The beauty of the building outside is amazing. Inside is also a must, it is very small place inside but you will be surprise once you enter the building. You can visit the inside in 30 minutes.

Amazing place!. One of the best attractions in St. Petersburg, beautiful inside and outside. Totally worth visiting. Important tip: don't wait in the line to get your tickets, use a machine to buy them (with cash or credit card)!
beautiful onions. beautiful building and very beautiful mosiac work inside.tickets become expensive after 6 pm,better to see before that.

Tile, Tile, Tile. Most incredible ceramic tile work I have ever seen. Impossible to capture on photo. Every inch covered inside. It is incredible to think that it was used as a vegetable warehouse under communism. Thank God they did not demolish it.
Very beautiful. Must see in St. Petersburg. Interior is very impressive as well as exterior. Take time to see interior.
A unique treasure. Possibly the most unique building I have ever visited, with a truly distinct history. Both the outside and inside are amazing and worth the visit.

Spectacular. Beautiful mosaics inside and outside. An absolute must when visiting St. Petersburg.
Can be quite crowded. Take time to enjoy the souvenir booths and street artists outside as well.

amazing church. arriving to the place you will see the onion shape dome from outside similar to others in Russia and you enter to the church !! wawwww !! you will be amazed and not believe that all the church is made from tiny mosaic tiles and not tapestries and paintings . I even forgot that I have my camera with me and stood astonished by the details and the 3D effect of the Holy Spirit at the top of the church. a must see in St petesburg

Great photo spot. The outside is an amazing photo opportunity! Such detail and color on every surface. Inside was quite detailed as well with an interesting story behind it. This is a must see when visiting St Petersburg. Beware of the people trying to sell you souvenirs outside, they are very annoying. We used a guide from Guide Guru for the day and she was able to get us in quickly.
Must vusit. Marvelous place! Must visit inside. They offer a guide in Russian and Englush.Near the church there is beautiful park.
Breathtaking. Don't miss the highlight of st petersburg- the inside needs to be seen also in order to get the full experience
Like a fairytale. Outside the church is like from fairytale. Inside is very beautiful too. Very interesting story. Definitely worth visiting!

Beautiful. On the approach you see the "onion domes" that everyone is familiar with in Russia, and that in itself is awe inspiring. But when you enter!! At first you think you are admiring beautiful tapestries or oil paintings. But on closer inspection you realize that all these huge works of art are made from tiny mosaic pieces. Talk about dedication and patience. This is a must see attraction.

Must see inside as well as out. I had never heard it's name, but recognized it from having seen pictures of it in relationship to St. Petersburg. Amazing structure with an equally amazing and interesting history. Absolutely a must see for any visitor to St. Petersburg, regardless of your personal religious leanings.

Exquisite. The entire interior of this glorious church is made of mosaic tile. These mosaics include portraits, landscapes, scenes andgorgeous colors. The ceiling heights areat least 5 stories tall and it is all the beautiful tile artwork. Stunning.
Beautiful MOSAIC interiors. The Church is beautiful from outside , but what impressed is that the ENTIRE interiors is made up of mosaic paintings. A must visit

Fantastic cathedral; as stunning inside as outside. An oft-pictured landmark of St. Petersburg, it's absolutely worth a visit. Striking exterior, with so many photo ops for even the most casual photographer. Gorgeous coloration and detail to the exterior. Inside, virtually every wall and ceiling space is decorated with mosaics, with gold and other bright colors. The actual floorspace is not that large (by cathedral standards), emphasizing the vertical feeling within the interior. It was very crowded, with both individuals and tour groups, when we were there. You can spend as much or as little time as you want here, so I can imagine a visit of as little as 20-30 minutes, up to several hours, and any length in-between, so don't hesitate to go even if you don't have that much time.

Stories from the New Testament . This stunning cathedral is tile mosaics inside and out. I was so fascinated by the stories told from the New Testament. Christ's birth, baptism, women at the well, Gethsemane and more. It was hard to leave. It is the first time I ever bought a CD so I can go home and really study the amazing art afterward. My highlight of St Petersburg.
Gorgeous - well worth the visit. This was one of the highlights of our visit - both the inside and outside of the building were beautiful. Our guide did warn us to watch for pickpockets though.

A Christian masterpiece of worship!. I have visited many Christian monuments in Europe but this one is easily one of the best I have seen! My wife and myself were astonished to see master pieces on walls and on roof, depicting various biblical tales! Real masterpiece!
Fascinating place. Found the building amazing. Also thought the realignment of the canal to incorporate the site of the 'spilled blood' amazing.

A must-see in St. Petersburg. Church of the Spilled Blood has very unique architecture compared to other churches I have visited in western Europe. The history behind the "spilled blood" is also fascinating. It is a must-see if you stops by St. Petersburg.
Fabulous Church. First sight we saw in St Petersburg. Wonderful Church both inside and out. The internal paintings are beautiful. We spent a long time in here looking around - well worth a visit
baeutiful place outside&inside. Very beautiful and interesting place. I did an audio tour. on the back there are many stands with nice souvenirs to buy.
Architecturally stunning. Make sure you include this church built on the site where Alexander II was assassinated. Beautiful inside and out.
awesome. very very inspiring, the place has such an aura that you feel as if you've come near heaven itself. just amazing

A beautiful church. The view from the main Nevsky Prospekt does not shows the full facade of the church. As you reach near, you get a glimpse of the richness of the domes and the lovely architecture. The inside is also truly amazing. It is full of colorful mosaics, paintings and murals. The high ceilings and paintings on them are beautiful.

Amazing. We really enjoyed this visit as there is as impressive outside than inside. The painting inside are beautiful and you can spend few hours if you want to enjoy all the details.
Don't miss it if you go to St Petersburg.
Lovely market at the back of it as well.

Great views of the city, but be prepared for many steps!. We saw the cathedral on the morning of our flight from St. Petersburg and were very glad that we did. The interior is amazing, but even more so are the viewed from what they call the "Colonnade." It is accessible after a climb of around 200 steps (which I wish I had been more mentally and physically prepared for). The colonnade goes all around the top level of the church, with 360 degree views of St. Petersburg. Not to be missed if you can manage the climb!

Beautiful, interesting, and historical. A visit to this church is well worth the time and cost. Besides being beautiful, it is historically interesting in that there is a small covered kiosk marking the alleged exact spot where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated. Mosaics are beautiful as is the overall building, inside and out. Lots of vendors on the exit side, which are fun, if you like to haggle over tourist stuff. Overall a "must see" place.

A touch of Russian history. worth seeing if only to hear the story of the assassination of the Czar by terrorists...and visit the exact location on the canal where the church was built to commemorate the spot....

Absolutely astonishing. This church is amazing from the outside, but it's well worth buying a ticket to see the inside. All the walls and ceilings are covered in brightly covered mosaics depicting various important religious events. Definitely must take your camera with you!
Magnificent outside and the magic continues within.. We went in during the evening to make the most of our time as the museums were closing at 6.00. It opens late during the white night season.

Absolutely stunning. I don't have enough words to express how wonderfully beautiful this place is. I had never heard of it before this trip and it was part of a day tour we selected while on a Baltic cruise. It rained that day, but that didn't dampen our enthusiasm. It is not an overly large church and there were tons of tourists. The exterior is breathtakingly beautiful but the interior....even more so. I highly recommend this place as a must-see in St. Petersburg.

just from the outside is worthwhild. We did not have time to go in but we did have time to walk around the outside and take several pictures. This is a top of the list item should we make it back again.

Gorgeous Exterior, Amazing Interior. This is also one that should not be missed when you visit St. Petersburg. The Art inside the church is amazing, all of them are Mosaic. I could not imagine the patience and dedication of the artist who made it. This is something that should be experienced firsthand, it does not matter how good I describe it, seeing it in person is something to behold. I can stare at this place for days.

An Absolute Must See. The St. Basil's of the north, this is one church you want to see inside and out. It is available by car or canal boat. The outside is a photo opt dream, and the inside is fabulous!
ornate and incredibly beautiful. Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is ornate and incredibly beautiful. If you can't tour Moscow, seeing this kind of makes up for not seeing St. Basil's.
Absolutely amaizing church, super beautiful inside. Absolutely amaising church, super beautiful inside. We have joined a guided tour, which was very interesting.

Must see in St. Petersburg. There are many "must see" places in St. Petersburg and this is one of them. It's a beautiful place both inside and out. Do some research on the church before coming here as you will appreciate the art work more. Inside is huge and it can get crowed when cruise people are visiting. Get your camera ready take as many pictures as possible. Take outside pictures from the exit side of the church as there'll be less people. When you exit, look for the entrance to a park. Yes, there is a park next to the church. If you have time, take a stroll in the park as it is nice and cool during the summer. You can buy ice cream or drinks and enjoy them in the park. It is very relaxing. Buy souvenirs from the exit side. You'll run into many souvenir stands. Be prepared to bargain. DO NOT pay the full price. Anywhere between 20% to 40% discount is good.

Inspiring and Worthwhile. Next to Rome and La Segrada Familia in Barcelona - this venue was wonderful. One never ceases to be amazed at the craftsmanship and time invested in these sacrificial works of art and praise. HINT: upon exiting - walk about 100 feet out the door to the water color artist who is basically a resident according to our guide. Our crew literally bought out his works. They are not fakes. He is the artist and will autograph his work for you. They are inexplicably affordable and one of a kind pieces.

Beautiful both inside and out. Anyone researching travel to St. Petersburg would have seen many photos of this wonderful church. I was almost afraid to see it in person in case it didn't live up to my expectations but I need not have worried. The church is even more impressive and beautiful in person. I mean seriously impressive-considering I fell hard on the concrete about 5 minutes from the church, directly on my knees, and could barely walk to it once I could get up. But it was worth every painful step to get there! Don't miss it!

Must See. My wife and I took a tour of STP and they took us here. The bus had a difficult time parking for our short 15 viewing. With the history of this location and the architect of the church, you have to stop here for a photo op. Lots of tourist visiting this place though out the day. TIP: we were warned to be careful of pick pocketing in the area.

It is very beautiful and not like a European cathedral. The art is wonderful and knew. Yes, it is based on religious themes but western eyes will find it new and unique. It can be crowded so allow time.
St. Petersburg Church. Beautiful church, well worth a visit. Super frontage and really takes your breath away inside. The whole interior is covered in wonderful mosaics.

One of the most interesting churches you will visit!. The mosaics in this church are mesmerizing! It helps to have a guide explain the history behind the church which is very interesting. This is one site in St. Petersburg not to be missed!

Beautiful piece of architecture. This is such a beautiful and mesmerising piece of architecture that when you see it for the first time you are almost spell bound. I come from the country of Taj Mahal and lot of other exquisite palaces and forts but this church was something absolutely unique that I have seen till date....the interiors were equally amazing as the exteriors and to realise that all these interiors have been so painstakingly restored is something that leave you thoroughly amazed!

Must visit! Beautiful inside and out!. If you want to see a church built on mosaics from the bottom up, this is the place! Extravagant! It is also the place where one of the Royal Family was murdered, thus they decided to build a church to commemorate his death.

A must-see stop on your touring itinerary. As I'm interested in mosaics this Church was already on my "to do" list from all the reading I had done, but nothing prepared me for walking in and seeing the amazing interior. The sheer quantity, the amazing quality, the colours, the scale, the quality of the work are all truly OMG breathtaking. After seeing the Hermitage and so many other amazing buildings, the outside of the Church on the Spilled Blood is so colourful that part of you thinks the best part must be the exterior...until you go inside and are absolutely overwhelmed with the richness, the colour...it's actually hard to focus on any one thing. Each way you turn there's more and more amazing mosaic work. EVERYTHING is done in mosaics. It's awesome and humbling. Really, even if your time is very limited, make sure you pay a visit.
Wow!. Our first trip to Russia brought joy and amazement to see and witness the spectacular ingenious work of art and history, just WOW..!
Beautiful. Although we didn't go inside, just viewing from afar was an experience not to be missed. The ornamentation is impressive.

One of the most beautiful church in the world. It is real diamond of St. Petersburg. Nice and colourful from outside but you have to simply go inside! The mosaics are great and we were there speachless when we saw it!

Wonderful Russian Church. A beautiful church done in the Russian style but with most intricate mosaic wall coverings inside. Go with a local guide (preferably in a small group) so that they can explain the history of the church. A must see in St Petersburg.
Stunning building. A major St Petersburg icon, this church needs to be viewed in person to truly appreciate it - the size, complexity and colours. Due to time restrictions we didn't see inside.
church. It was such a beautiful church and to find out that a man that was loved by so many was murdered in this church.
Stunningly Beautiful. The mosaic covered walls and ceiling of this church combined with its colourful domes and stonework make it a 'must see' on a trip to Saint Petersburg.
Absolutely gorgeous. This is one place not to miss in St. Petersburg. It is one of the most beautiful churches, both inside and out that I have ever seen.

Church with a wonderful History. The church has a wonderful history. The inside is even better, so lavish with all its Gold leaft painted Saints and murals. This is a tourist attraction and is a must to see.

Really nice building. This is an absolute must see. The building is incredible from the outside but 100% worth paying the small entrance fee to go and see inside. The decor is magnificent. For English visitors, I would say don't go for the audio guide, yes it's only £1 but the guys voice was soooooo boring I actually gave up trying to be interested and just walked around on my own instead. Go early as it does get very busy in here!
Beautiful church. This is a really beautiful and colorful church. Doesn't cost a lot to get inside and doesn't take too much time to see all of it so you have time to do other things aswell.

Beautiful Inside and out. This is a lovely onion domed church with lovely gold accents that glimmer in the sunshine. It is well worth going inside to see the restored mosaics. The church was badly damaged during WW2. It is one large church inside, unlike St Basil's in Moscow which is a series of chapels. The mosaics are beautiful.
Beautiful!. One of a kind church, stunningly beautiful. The colorful spires are amazing. This is a must see for anyone visiting St. Petersburg.

Spectacular memorial church for Alexander ll.. This spectacular memorial church has stunning mosaics covering all the interior walls. The history of the church, from its conception then through the revolution and World War is interesting. Go early - it gets busy. The English audio guide is essential.

Historic place . Super fantastic place very historic... I love it. Even though I feel hard time to talk to the locals because they can't speak English fluently but that was my superb happy experience in st. Peterburg Russia
A Must. One of the musts in St. Petersburg. Packed but must be visited. Try to read the history about the assassination. Very special. Great mosaics. You need 15 to 20 minutes to visit.
Don't leave St Petersburg without seeing this. Just a quick stop to take photos on a guided bus tour. Sad we didn't get to see the inside but the outside is gorgeous.
Wow!. It is a must see in St Petersburg so different from St Basils in Moscow the mosaic work is maginificent

Amazing!. This Orthodox Church catches the eye due to its colourful roofs and outer wall, but once you get inside - before 18:00 for a nice price ticket - your jaw is guaranteed to drop to the floor and remain there for the whole visit. Intricate mosaic covers every inch of the walls, biblical scenes, Saints, prophets and religious symbols watch over you, no matter where you turn. The sheer beauty of the decoration is only matched by the amazement at the quality of the restoration that was done after WWII. One of the definite highlights of St. Petersburg.

Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. One of the most beautiful Russian Orthodox churches. Site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated. His sone built the cathedral on the site and has been restored now to former glory. A must on a visit to St Petersburg
Atmospheric. An interesting place to visit, particularly with its place in Russian history. Beautiful inside and out.

Absolutely beautiful . This is a stunning church and an absolute must see in St Petersburg. The church is lovely inside, but the wow factor is really on the outside.
It isn't too expensive to go in RUB 400 per adult, so about £4 per person which compared to UK prices is pretty good for such an iconic place.

Wow. . No visit to St Petersburg would be complete without a visit to the church.
The artistry and work that has gone in to create this amazing space is unbelievable.
We wondered round for over an hour just looking at the walls and ceilings.
Not expensive and an unforgettable place.

Wonderful. This beautiful church is just as stunning on the inside as it is on it's breathtaking exterior. There has been extensive restoration inside the church ( which is now a museum not a working church) the decoration just takes your breath away. It does get very busy so be prepared for crowds - but well worth the visit.
Incredible. This church is a great masterpiece. Full of mosaics, just mosaics everywhere. It is just perfection. Built a few centuries after St. Basil but I like it more than the Moscow one.

If you love mosaic. Located next to a canal, this church looks great from the outside. Inside, it's even more impressive. I have never seen so much mosaic, especially from a church.
It's a small church, and there's an entrance fee. But it's definitely unique, and definitely worth a visit.

Worth the crowds !!!. A must see if you are in St. Petersburg ! It is worth spending time simply walking around the outside of this Church - well, 3 sides of it, as one side is up against the canal. Architecture, angles, colors ... beautiful. Then head inside - wow ! The Church was built as a memorial to Tsar Alexander II, on the site of his assassination. Inside is decorated with some of the most incredible mosaics you will ever see. Rain or shine, this is a great stop. Spend as much time as you want, but it doesn't require an entire day; depending on your interest (and maybe the crowds) anywhere from one to two or three hours would be plenty.
Beautiful from the outside. A shame a place of worship has been turned into a tourist trap. But interesting to visit although one could skip the inside.
Cannot miss it!. A true benchmark of Russian history and an outstanding piece of art! Amazing colours of an amazing piece of art and architecture. Closed on Wednesdays.

Russian History at Its Best. This church was erected as a memorial to Alexander II by his son Alexander III. Alexander II was killed by a terrorist's bomb on the site of the church in 1881. Both the exterior and interior are very extravagant in design. Inside the church you will be dazzled by glittering floor to ceiling mosaic. The floor are beautiful pink marble and walls are covered with stone carvings and gold leaf.

Unique Russian Experience. This is a very impressive sight and one of the main reasons I came to St Petersburg. I was not disappointed by its majesty and splendor. The vendors and musicians in the vicinity were also worth the trip.
Breathtaking. Such a beautiful building, awesome in daylight but absolutely stunning at night when lit up. It's as beautiful inside as well. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful inside and out. The church is a beautiful building from the outside and it is even more beautiful when you enter. It is breathtaking. There is a lot if history with the church and is helpful if you have a guide or have read about it before a visit. It doesn't take long to view the church and is well worth a quick visit.

Amazing place. This church is a must do in St Petersburg. You can see it from numerous places in the city and inside is definitely as beautiful as out. It does get extremely busy however, I'd hate to see it in summer as in March the whole city was quiet and it was difficult to see everything inside! There are a couple of stools dotted beside the pillars which are good to sit down on to take it all in, hard to believe the whole place is made up of mosaics!!

Awe-inspiring place. The iconic and popular symbol of St. Petersburg to me is this Church. Seeing the colourful spires and breathtaking and imposing Baroque and Neo-classical style gave me the genuine feeling that I am indeed in Russia!! Shame we didn't have the time to go inside but it was enough for me to soak in its awesome presence!
Winter city break. Snow in St Petersburg made it magical. The mosaics here are amazing. It's a great photo spot and a real view of Russian culture

We didn't know where to look first!. Beautiful doesn't not begin to cover it! We didn't know where to focus first! We went at 5pm and at 6pm everybody left. 6pm starts another ticket i guess, but it gave us about 10 minutes of just us inside the church which was amazing. I look back on my photos and see more mosaics that I had missed while there.
beautiful amazing restoration. amazing restoration- the history and photos of the inside after the war are quite amazing. So beautiful and spectacular

Absolutely Mind Blowing. The image of this church is what you think of when you think of Russia. What is crazy is that the outside isn't the best part - inside every single inch is covered in beautiful mosaics. You literally just stand inside with your mouth open in awe of it all. A true gem.

Delightful art. It was a fantastic day and I am definitely pleased with my journey in St.Petersburg. A perfect mixture of a huge town with relaxing atmosphere, I would say. Also, people I met gave a friendly reception!I discovered some cathedrals & monuments during my walk and I passed eight stop-over locations in the following order:(1) St Isaac's Cathedral(2) Admiralty Building(3) State Hermitage(4) Rostral ColumnsThe formation looks as two vertically bars located on each side of the Old Stock Exchange Building. The columns are shaping an integral part of the city's central panorama over the river, Neva River.There are a lot of high-speed boats (Hydrofoils) running on the Neva River. Hydrofoil runs from St. Petersburg to Peterhof and these tour boats are referred as "Meteors". I didn't try them out, unfortunately. However. Next time could be pleasure ride. (5) Zayachy Island (connected via Kronverksky Bridge & Ioannovsky Bridge)I admired the view from Kronverksky Bridge! The bridge brought out some spiritual charm to me and it gave an illusion of being back in time, I would say!(6) Peter and Paul Fortress(7) Savior on the Spilled Blood(8) Kazansky Cathedral

Quintessential Russian Architecture. Beautiful but crowded. We arrived around 1:30 pm and it was packed. The outside of the church was the reason I wanted to visit it - the onion domes do not disappoint. The inside had incredible detail - it is worth going inside and looking around. Expect large crowds with the usual "street performers" outside the building.

A Riot Of Religious Colour. You will probably never have seen so much colour as that provided by the frescos that decorate every inch of this church.There is also the tomb of Nicholas 2nd, a sombre black canopy and casket, in a section strangely overbuilt onto the nearby canal, where he died.There's not much else of original historical significance, as it's a totally C20 restored place, once in ruins, but worth a half-hour visit.
Just as beautiful in person as you see in photos. I kept returning to the church just to gaze at it every day. Not just a photo op, but a place to reflect on why it was built.

Beautiful. Beautiful cathedral, both the outside (very nice and colourful) and the inside. Although I am not a fan of Orthodox cathedrals and their opulence, (lots and lots of saints portraits an Biblical scenes painted on the walls and all those golden shrines and decorations), I must admit this is a beautiful church. Set on one of St. Petersburg many canals (Griboedov) this cathedral is definitely worth a visit.

Highlight of St. Petersburg. There are many breathtaking palaces and museums around St. Petersburg, but this church will simply blow your mind. It is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen (and I have seen a lot)! Even without any knowledge of architecture, any one can easily appreciate the details of the exterior, the colourful mosaic images in the interior, as well as the time and effort it took to complete the entire structure. Definitely a must when you are in St. Petersburg.

The audioguide is very helpful to appreciate this cathedrale. Don't hesitate to get the audio guide. Sometimes the commentary is too long but you may skip. Most of the time, the audio guide was a great help to bring us the details needed for an interesting visit.
Never seen something similar before. I absolutely loved this Church. All interior is made from mosaic, every single detail. I could walking aroud and watch every corner of it for hours.

Another do Not Miss location. A lot of history inside this beautiful church. Need at least two full days in City to properly see & appreciate these historical venues and one should engage a private, local tour guide to appreciate what you are looking at.
Beautiful inside and out. We went here as part of our private tour. The church, like every other church in Russia is gorgeous. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful Church. We visited this church as a part of our tour. It is a beautiful church with a lot of history. They have done a great job restoring it to its original grandeur.

Part of the tour of St. Petersburg through TJ travel. All of the sites on your trip to St.Petersburg are so full of history that your head will be spinning with information. This is the church commemorating where one of the Tsar's was killed. Beautiful architecture.
Breathtaking. Words or pictures can not do justice to the interior of this amazing church. It must be seen to be believed.

Difficult to decide if it's more beautiful in the daylight or illuminated at night . A beautiful monument with a beautiful river flowing right next to it..it's beautiful with its colored domes and intricate designs during the day and equally beautiful when lit up at night.A must visit.

Quick visit. This church is absolutely stunning and well worth the visit. We were crunched for time as it was our last stop before getting back on our cruise ship, but it was a must see. The exterior is beautiful but the real beauty lies on the interior. Our two year old loved the colors and murals on the walls.

amazing. everything everyone else has said it's true. truly amazing inside. the mosaics are great. i took the audio tour and it was ok but it went on a bit to my taste so i fast forwarded a lot.
remember to return it to the lady before passing through the detectors or you will set everything off (my experience).
Amazing!. One could easily spend 1/2 a day wandering around viewing this beautiful church. The mosaic work is beyond belief.
Stunning. Well worth a visit. Interesting exterior architecture and inside very dramatic. Scene of a murder, hence the name

Better than St. Basil's. This cathedral is truly amazing to see. From the outside it is debatable whether it or St. Basil's in Moscow is prettier, but the inside is definitely better. Nice souvenir shops and a park outside as well.

Absolutely Beautiful!. A very colorful, yet beautiful church in St Petersburg that is also known as the Resurrection Church. Inside every bit is done in the most amazing mosaics you can imagine. If you only have time to see 1 thing I. St Petersburg, go see this.
Russia is charming, stoical and majestic! . St. Petersburg's hotspot, this Church is witness of Russian Orthodox churches' magnificence. It's beautiful during the day and ethereal during the night.
Beautiful Building. This is a must visit while in St. Petersburg. There are nice parks just next door for wandering around to find different views of the cathedral.
Incredible architecture . What an amazing tribute to history, unlike any other church I have ever seen. The detail and legend is another must see in St Petersburg.

Fantastic Must See in St Petersburg. With its ornate domes and every inch of the walls and ceiling inside covered in Mosaics this church is really something. As the memorial to the assassination of Alexander II it Incorporates the railing and pavement of the roadway adjacent to the church where the fatal bombing occurred. Lovely park if the city adjacent to the river and across from the Mars Park.

The best place on earth. Heaven on earth! I must confess in my life i've never seen anything like this! This small place tells you a good storry of what Russia was, is like and will always be like. God saved place
Amazing. Such a moving visit. A must in St. Petersburg. On a very special site and such a feeling of meditation.
Amazing architecture - Russian Orthodox. This is a must see location during your visit in Russia. Inside and out it is just an amazing delight to the senses.

Well worth the visit--stunning outside and beautiful mosaics inside. I really found this place stunning. All great churches of this era have great art. But this place is basically ALL mosaics inside---floor to ceiling. Must be seen to be believed. Not far from the hermitage and other touristy sites--drop in here!
Beautifully restored. As with all St P attractions it can get very crowded especially in the early afternoons. Mostly tours groups from the cruise. Go early to avoid the crowd.

Beautiful exterior, stunning interior. A highly visible church with very colourful domes, the interior is even more stunning with mosaics covering the walls, ceilings and pillars with detailed biblical scenes and Saints.Well worth a visit to see all the restored glory (after being used as a storeroom for scenery under the Soviets) and wonder at the artwork.Open into the evening, make sure you go when it is sunny to see the mosaics at their best.Note that the canal bank at the rear of the Church is a popular tourist area with souvenir stalls and buskers, with lots of people around, so be aware of your belongings at this point.
Absolutely amazing.. All the works inside are mosaics, absolutely fantastic lots of gold everywhere. Good thing is you can take photographs without flash.

Stunning and magnificent. First Orthodox church we ever visited. The icons and interior are simply beautiful. Several years after our trip we converted to Orthodoxy and know go to a ROCOR Church. This church has made a huge impression on me.
Beautiful church. Every detailed stone were carefully placed to form such beautiful church.The different colored stones placed together made the church so beautiful from far and near.
Incredible view. This is a must see while visiting St. Petersburg. I would recommend using the Metro blue line or green line to access this location.
Wow. This building was absolutely amazing. Very colourful. Totally different from anything else I seen. Well worth a look.
Worth visiting . Traditional place, a really orthodox church with one of best mosaics I ever seen. I still can't believe the USSR want to blow it. Definitely deverses a visit.

Colorful Plus. This Church was erected on the spot of and to commemorate an assassination. The exterior with the colorful" onion spires" is stunning. The interior is done completely in mosaics! The spot in the road where the murder took place is protected and preserved inside. Since the area, and the church, is very congested remember to beware of pickpockets as it is one of their prime hunting grounds.
Absolutely amazing. This is a MUST SEE while in St Petersburg. There are shops are cafes in the area - go see and the have a cup of coffee/beer/glass of wine and take in the view!
Exquisite. The gem of St. Petersburg. I arrived in the early evening and was excited to see the colors of the domes. It's an incredible church to take in.
can't be missed. Such a beautiful church with interesting history. The inside deserves a visit as well as the outside

History on the cobblestones. This beautiful building is almost completely restored now after years of Soviet neglect.If you like your history tangible as I do, this is for you.Alexander II was blown up by the anarchist group "People'sWill' and his son insisted the Cathedral be extended out into the canal to ensure the actual spot where the bomb blew his father''s legs off was incorporated into the structure.The walls are literally covered in beautiful mosaics of Biblical themes.Tip do hire the audio guide which seems to have been narrated by a Vicar from middle England

Amazing. From our opinion we were not imaging this great church. Is not a museum and you can seethe rel structure from inside. Inside you will see something that you are not imagin the way that is decorated inside.

A most amazing work of art!. The mosaic work of the interior of this church will leave you speechless. The quality and the blue and gold mix of colours is breath-taking. Your eyes will not know where to stop feasting. This is an absolute Must visit!

Truly Amazing -- a must see when in St.Petersburg. The church's exterior and interior is all mosaics and spectacular. A must see for anyone visiting St. Petersburg. Also interesting history, as the church sits on the place where one of the Tzars was murdered.
toy. Touristic popular place. Looks liky normal "kitch" building. Inside much more funny - a lot of horrible pictures on the walls and typically russian trash souvenirs.

Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood. This was a most interesting and thought provoking place to visit. It was really special to hear the history and see all the royal tombs especially the Romanovs.
Incredible. A most magnificent church, easy to access, and one of the finest highlights in the historic district.
amazing site. All tours will take you here. just an unbelievable church. a must see on any tourCannot believe that it took the fall of the Russian government to open this church
Just amazing. You will be awe struck when you walk in - what an amazing interior. Every wall is covered with mosaic work. It has to be seen to be believed. A must must visit.

St. Petersburg's Finest.... ...according to a Geocache located at the spot, maybe 90% of all visitors, and to my personal opinion. While all other churches, museums, and other sights are impressive, this one stands out with its full wall mosaic covers.
Viewed from the outside, just beautiful. Stunning details on the church, make sure you have a guide that can fill you in on the history, lots of street vendors, watch pick pockets.
Just the most beautiful sight. This church is well worth a visit. So beautiful. Get the audio guide so you can hear all the history. Then walk back to the main drag via all the souvenir shops.
beautiful. At the heart of all the buzz. You could buy a painting to the Church from some of the artists who paint on the streets leading up to it.

Awesome. Go see it. You won't be disappointed. The tile work is mind blowing both inside and out, and (as an American) the exchange rate makes the admission fee very affordable. I know churches across Europe are everywhere, but this one is definitely worth your time.
beautiful architecture. Breathtakingly beautiful church, mosaic inside are a must see. Read up on your history before you go!

A romantic fantasy of a cathedral. with it's multicolored onion-topped domes, this has to be one of the most frequently photographed sights in St. Petersburg. Well worth a visit - needing just a half hour or even 20 minutes - perhaps on a break from the Hermitage Museum!

New-Old Russian stule. One of the recent churches in St Petersburg (1907), being so many years in restoration... but now one of the amazing places in the city, and even one of the simbols of St Petersburg. Very beautiful. But don't forgat that it is one of the particulary places for Russians. Please reab about before togo to visit it.
Atypical church full of colours. This church has a unique colorful design. A great place to approach the things of the Russian Orthodox church.

Just excursion. This is the most beautiful cathedral in St. Petersburg, in my opinion. This is truly Russian one, as the others seem more typical of Western Europe. Interieur is also very amazing. It consists of beauty full mosaics all over the whole cathedral.
Great interiors. The only Russian-style church in St Petersburg, so definitely a must-visit. Pay the ticket price to go inside, because the mosaics inside are quite spectacular.

The most Amazing Church you will ever see. Once you have seen one church you have seen them does NOT apply here. This place is ridiculously awesome. The exterior is bar none the best. It sits on the river and next to the park. So bring a picnic if you really want to enjoy this place.

Mosaics Galore. This was our favorite Russian church! We toured the insides using the audio guide (which gave very interesting history of the church, how it was used during WWII/Soviet times, why it was built, and how the mosaics were constructed) and were amazed by the mosaics that decorate the walls of this church. A sight to see!!
must see. Go early to aviod the crowds around the church and get a feeling of the surroundings. Like almost any famous church, there is an entry fee here is well.

Iconic Structure. The rich history of St. Petersburg can be overwhelming as you visit all the beautiful sites of the city. The architecture of this church is a classic example of domed structures and is a must see.

A Must Visit for Photos. Seeing this church in photos, post cards and souvenir magnets is only a glimpse of the effect of seeing the real thing. When we first saw the church, our reaction was WOW! This vivid colorful church is the REAL THING! When you go inside (crowded so be alert of your belongings as this is pickpocket heaven), you'll be more wowed by the murals and wall paintings. This church is a photo enthusiast's dream as every inch of this church is photogenic! Our tour made this the last stop and after seeing sites like the Hermitage Museum and Peterhof Palace, we thought we saw everything but not so. This is definitely the ultimate climax of any tour... A MUST SEE!

Breath-taking mosaic. I was so impressed with the mosaic, which really takes your breath away.The admission fee is RUB250. You need to better pay by card or prepare small change as RUB1000 note was not accepted because it is too large. The shops around the street nearby are also worth watiching.

Superb Mosaics. Church on the Spilled Blood has a fairytale exterior. Consider that most fairytales are terrifying. The wolf eats grandma, the mermaid walks on knives, parents abandon their children in the woods. After Tsar Alexander II was assassinated by a bomb thrown by a revolutionary, this edifice was built to showcase the grief and might of the remaining Imperial family. The exterior this church uses imagery to compare the life of Alexander II to that of Christ. The interior was built around the actual site of the attack. The artistry is remarkable and has mostly endured the depredations of the Bolsheviks intact, including being used as a morgue and a vegetable warehouse. The altar doors have been reconstructed.I appreciated the audio guide, especially for the specifics on how different mosaics were created. To an artist, that’s fascinating.

Fascinating. I was in St.Petersburg last year for a small trip and this is not my first comment about this fascinating church. Facebook reminded me of my memories and I'm her again. Still I can remember the first moment I entered the building. It was like "Oh my God!". Those paintings purely made of mosaics art was fantastic. It's too bad that I am trying to find that feeling in my further trips but it seems impossible. It feels so divine. You must visit this church even if you have only one day in St.Petersburg.

Icon to see . My sister & I went here as one of the highlights of our trip. This church is beautiful and very impressive. I'm glad we had a guide book to read about the church to give us some history since there are limited English tours.

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful churches that I have seen, architecture amazes, beautiful inside and out, very interesting history of the build. One of the most popular places to visit if you are in Saint Petersburg.

incredible, beyond belief. One of the most beautiful church's ever..You do not have to be Christian to enjoy this magnifigant structure..There is too much to describe to put it into word..24 karat gold all over the place..You have to go ..take a deep breath and enjoy every moment
Another beautiful building. We didn't go inside this church, but the outside is beautiful. The history of what happened there is fascinating. Certainly worth a visit.

Spectacular Church in the Style of St. Basil's. The Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood is truly awe-inspiring. It is almost completely covered with beautiful mosaics. No longer functioning as a church, it is an architectural must-see. As others have mentioned, it was the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander III.

Gorgeous!. We knew in advance that we were going to visit this Church. We could see it from our windows in the hotel Nevsky. It is a museum. Built for Alexander 2 by his son, on the spot where he was killed by a terrorist. fabulous architecture and art inside. interesting story behind the onion shaped towers outside. One to keep off the snow. the other, that it is inspired by the shape of a candle flame (for that is what you light in a church in memory or in prayer). A must see!
Grand Beauty. Glad we went... the mosaics were astonishing. We would gladly go again. Near main shopping area on Nevsky Prospekt.
Needs to be seen. Do not miss visiting this church. Surpassed all my expectations. Hire the audio guide to make the best of the visit

I prefer this Church to St. Isaac's. If you have only one church to visit in St. Petersburg, I would say this is the most beautiful and it is quite historic. It was built where Alexander II was killed. His declaration to free the serfs is written on the walls. The church was closed during the USSR and badly damaged but restored to such amazing beauty. The use of stone and mosaics is unusual. You have to buy tickets outside and in summer there can be crowds so try to get there early.
breathtaking!!!!. A truly stunning cathedral, so imposing, I was so amazed when I first set eyes upon it. We went inside and it was simply beautiful inside as well. A must see!

Mind blowingly beautiful. Do try and spend as much time as possible because seeing the actual site of the assassination of the Tsar and the incredibly ornate decorations made me forsake my camera to soak UP it's beauty.Instead I bought an incredibly beautiful 150 page book "St Petersburg and its environs" with better pictures than I could ever take of ALL the major palaces and churches, in the souvenir shop where all the tours take you to, for less than £3.00 sterling, including a brilliant 3D map of St Petersaburg, A REAL BARGAIN!

Church Brimming With History. In our opinion, this church is the second most interesting attraction in St Petersburg. It is well preserved despite going through the the Soviet disrespect for religious buildings. The interior is amazing, with the place of the "spilt blood" is preserved and partitioned off. Admission is free and a very popular tourist destination.We visited their on a Royal Caribbean tour.

very touristic but a must see !. You can't miss it ! At the end of a canal, it's ruling the city like a queen. Temple of kitsch, color, gold... It's look like a wedding cake ! :) You have to visit it at low season and in the morning, so you will be alone without hordes of tourists. Inside, all walls are made of colorful mosaics. It's impressive and looks like a giant comics book.So I repeat : it's a must see ! But visit it on your own trying to avoid tourists groups.
Great!. In a beautiful part of the city it's easy to use add this as you tour the historic downtown area. The inside is just as beautiful as the outside.
If there is Heaven, it must look like this. Amazing Cathedral. Gives you a sense of being in the skies. Really takes your breath away. A must see. Check for opening hours before visiting.

Amazing. Must see! Beautiful church outside and inside! Wonderful mosaics! Very busy at the day time, lots of tourists, we were with friends at 4 pm. Not far from Church on Italianskaya street,11 we found very nice souvenir's shop "Onegin" with very high quality Lacquered boxes and Matryoshkas for very good price))
An Iconic Landmark. After seeing so many photos of this Church, I was a bit disappointed in person. The exterior was a bit drab with the exception of the spires. Very interesting interior.
Impressive. The best of St. Petersburg. You have to visit it and pay to visit the church, because it's amazing! Very beautiful

Must Visit Memorial. No visit to Saint P. would be complete without experiencing this memorial cathedral for tsar Alexander II built by his son. Both the 19th century artistic value and the history of the building make a lasting impression. In addition it is situated near the best central Saint P. park and a beautiful canal.
Amazing inside and out. One of my favourites of our trip! Well worth seeing inside too. Fantastic and awe inspiring! Don't miss it

More beautiful outside than inside. This has been my impression. This church is very beautiful when you're approaching it and it is magnificent outside. When inside, I have been a bit disappointed: the room is rather "empty" and not as rich as you may expect.
Incredible Building. Amazingly beautiful church. Not even built as a church of worship but more of a monument to Alexander who was murdered by terrorists near that spot. Go see it.

Must-see. Beautiful on the inside as well as outside.
There is also a street with several souvenir shops here.

A mosaic dread. Take time to look closely at the wonderful mosaics here, the paintings were all stolen, their places are left with black and white photos, it seems almost more poingnant. Take your outside photos from the middle of the bridge, great view. Plan to spend 40 minutes. You could combine this visit with a river trip close by.

Beautiful little church!. Gorgeous inside/outside. Small in the interior. Nice vitrals; mosaics and paints.
It gets really crowded.
Location is very central, close to Nevsky St.
There is water channel just next to it.
Restaurants around the area, but wouldnt recommend to eat around there.
Go visit early morning

A must see in St Pete. The pictures make it seem incredibly glorious so some might consider it overrated. But honestly the detail and design of this building is stunning. It is centrally located in the rest of the sites so definitely make time to visit and read up on its history.
Church of the Savvior on Spilt Blood. Beautiful mosaics and fascinating history- well worth a visit. It is on the actual site of the 'spilt blood,' which adds to the overall interest.

Ms. Beautiful and unforgettable. Epitomizes Russian religious architecture. Great historical importance. Very interesting and moving. Definitely a must-see in St Petersburg. Be sure to get the audiophone which will tell you about what you are looking at.

Moscow style church. It is similar to St Basil's cathedral in Moscow with the ornate and colourful domes. Locally it is also called the mosaic church because inside you can see so many of the artwork is comprised on tiny pieces of mosaic. Why Spilt Blood? Well it was because the church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was murdered

Impressive exterior and interior . Oooh I simple love this place. It was beautiful externally and on the inside. The biblical stories and characters were depicted using mosaics on the walls. It's. Simply Amazing. Must do.

Pick the day you visit. This is an incredible architectural icon but, sadly we had to be content with viewing it from the outside as it was a Wednesday and the site is closed all day. Oddly enough the ticket booth was manned, however, with an attendant understandably,very sharply, advising enquirers that it was closed. A large sign across the booth to that effect might have saved some of her frustrations. The street vendors are still out in force, even when the church is closed and you can always buy a Putin, Stalin, Obama or Mao doll in true Babushka style instead! Maybe settle for a Putin T shirt if you are still unsure of a suitable souvenir. Notwithstanding all that it is well worth seeing the building from outside even if a storm is brewing and you have to scurry for shelter.
A bit touristy but beautiful. The area is a bit touristy, and the entrance fee is a bit high in my opinion. But a visit is completely worth it. Such a beautiful church inside and outside.

One of the best sights in St.Pete. When in St.Pete, you feel like you must at least take a picture by this church, if not go in. The story behind the place is just as captivating as the design. Take a short detour from Nevsky and walk around this beauty - you won't regret it!
Must see. Beautiful building in St Petersburg. Learn a lot of Russian history and faith with our private guide.

Well worth a visit. This church looks very strange from the outside. Well worth a visit to take some photos. Also very interesting on the inside, filled with mosaic and gold, as most other things in St. Petersburg.

The spilt blood is that of the Tsar, not of Jesus.. Modern but striking. Looks like St Basils in Moscow. Well worth a visit. Hard to see but there are spots of blood. Apparently, a fortune teller said he would die with "red boots".

Opulent and Awe-Inspiring!. What a walk through Russian religious history. The building was almost destroyed in the 1930s but luckily escaped Stalin's wrath. Fantastic icons and a great guided audio tour to boot!
Impressive. The details are incredible of the facade then go inside and sit down and just ponder on all the beauty around.
....a great architectural wonder. . It's was a great visit. Photographs were allowed inside. And how they did all the mosaics was incredible. Although did take 26years to build.

Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood. This church is one of the most beautiful churches I've seen in Europe. This is an absolute must see in Saint Petersburg. It cost 250 rub. to go inside and it's all in mosaics.
Truly a landmark!. Church has adjoining wonderful green spaces which the locals and tourists alike can enjoy. It's an awesome sight and represents outsiders' impression of Russian architecture.
AMAZING architecture!. This is a most amazing church to visit with its magnificent architecture and ornate facade. When visiting it you get a sense of past era full of history.

Don't Skip. Our guide from Dancing Bear Tours made this amazing church, and final resting place of many of Russia's royals, an early-in-the-day stop, and for good reason, it is on everybody's list. Being a small private group, and will a well recognized company, we were able to squeeze in. The exterior is spectacular both during the day and at night.

Well worth the visit!. One of the key sites in St Petersburg. Fabulous interior mosaics and ceilings. Watch out for pickpockets in the side streets nearby. We managed to beat off an attempt by a youth posing as seller of Russian calendars to distract us while two of his mates tried to 'dip' my wife's bag.
a must. we loved particularly the street. we came back few times there as the street during nights offered the music of street artists. great place to stay and just admire.
One of the symbols of Saint-Petersburg. This church is most recognizable symbol of Saint-Petersburg. It is located in the place where Alexander the Second was killed, "blood" means Alexander's blood.
Fabulous but crowded. Inside is beautiful but outside is better. Once it is so crowded that you can't move around, it's hard to maintain a holy atmosphere ;) ;)
Alla-Tours Grand Tour St Petersburg stop. The beautiful pictures are all done in mosaics, and the history of the renovations after WWII is fascinating.
Go there!. You don't have to be religious to appreciate the uniqueness of this building.The inside of the church is beautiful. I could have sat inside there for hours.
City tour. This church as amazing. The site of he assassination of one of the Romanovs. They built the church on the site of his murder. Unbelievable inside and out.
Amazing . The most beautiful place in St Petersburg. Go inside of you can as it is now a museum. Best photos from the pedestrian bridge in front of it.

Beautiful inside and out.. I walked by this church every day since it is near my hotel. It is breathtakingly gorgeous from the outside. The interior is also beautiful. I would recommend going at night so there are fewer people there. It can get quite crowded. I rented the audio guide and it was very helpful.
Amazing. Beautifull place, full of colours and history. Visited during ice hockey world championship and was really pleasently surprised by all the places in Petersburg not even this one.
Open for visits and amazing!. Must see in St. Petersburg. Not only that the exterior of the church is marvelous, but also all the mosaics inside are restaurated and shown in all their splendor.

Beautiful sight. I could not believe the grandeur of this place, it is crowded (we were there on a Sunday) but that doesn't take away from the beauty of this place. So much to see,so much information our tour guide had, now I have to read a book about it to really understand it. Amazing!

Incredible place!. Absolutely outstanding place! The story of the church is not simple: it was built and decorated in 19 century, almost destroyed in 20th and beautifully restored in 21st. The church is decorated with breathtaking mosaic panels. You can find fotos in the museum showing the situation before renovation, look around and then compare. All the restoration of mosaics was performed by students: they picked up all the tiny pieces, washed them and then used for restoration works; they did everything with hands, no machines was used. Definitely, everyone should come and see such gem with theirown eyes.
Beautiful inside and out. This is a must-see when you come to St. Petersburg. A stunning feast for the eyes, both inside and out !
Interesting. Worth a look, some real interesting pieces in there and a nice walk around. Decent little market just outside there also
Amazing place. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen!It is better to take audio guide or excursion, because there is so much history inside!
A must visit. One of the most popular sites in St. Petersburg once must see for the grandeur and history. It is one of the most visited destinations by tourists so tends to get crowded.
After the parade. We visited the church after the May 9 Victory Day Parades - big crowds as a public holiday. Church is amazing
Amazing! Very interesting place and beautiful. I sat in this church and just stared all around at the beautiful mosaics. Interesting history here. Does not take long to see but well worth a visit.

Mosaics incredible. A must see, if possible do it with a guide the interior of the church is jaw droppingly stunning. The mosaics cover some 7000sq metres and it is also home to a stained glass window which you don't see elsewhere in churches in Russia, that's not mentioning the fact that it is built on the spot where the last Tsar was mortally wounded and has the cobbles and railings from that spot as part of its memorial.
Another must see. The mosaics in this church are breath taking. If possible, do this with a guide to learn the history of the church including why it's called Church of the Savior ON spilled Blood.

A great visit to an eye catching church. We had seen the church when we had been a a walking tour of St. Petersburg. Inside the church we saw amazing mosaics. There were quite a few people inside the church, but this was not a problem as there is lots to see. Definitely a good visit which we would recommend.

A must see, fantastic in & out. Dates from the late 1800s, but in the historic style. Russian Orthodox churches have embellishments and painting which are marvelous. Try to visit one that is holding a service as it can be very moving.

Colourful mosaics, special arhitecture, impressive. The church is in a very nice area of the city, witn close-by ship-stop as well. It has around 7000sqm mosaic, that makes the place very unique and colourful. It really worths a visit, we were at sunset, where the altar was exactly lightened by the sunrays, magnificent play of light and colour.

A must for SPB visit. Ticket was not so cheap, but it's one of the most beautiful medieval Russian architecture churches (and the only one in SPB), like St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.A visit is highly recommended.

Very ornate and good English information. Interesting place to go and visit if you've got a spare hour lots of amazing mosaics depicting the story of Jesus. Not bad and your ticket gets you into the museum too.

This is a must-see sight in St. Petersburg, one of those places you've seen in pictures and must see in person.. I was most fascinated by the photographs inside showing the state of disrepair during the time of the USSR and the painstaking renovations to make it gleam again.
Magnificent. We passed by on a tour of St Petersburg. Try to arrange a tour that includes this Church, or get your hotel to organise a special guided tour for you. Not to be missed!
Wau. The wall paintings are really spectacular and the church one of the nicest I have seen , worth the walk and fee.

Breathtaking. My 21 year old daughter and I visited the cathedral on the Spilt Blood and it is simply breathtaking both inside and out....a true architectural gem!It is good value for money and if you are able I advise you buy tickets from the machine rather than the kiosk as the queues are lengthy.For me the only negative was the sheer volume of people inside, so perhaps time your visit either early or late so that you can truly see all of the beauty.

Must see. This is an increadible church that must not be missed. It has the typical shape of Orthodox churches, but the interior is even more amazing. There are no paintings in fact, what you believe are paintings (from a distance) are instead mosaics. This is an incredible and unique church. There is an entrance fee, but you feel it is justifyed as the maintenance costs for this place must be huge.
Walt Disney is nothing compered to this. . Special. Never seen something like this. Audioguide is sufficient to learn more about it. Watch the light and the effect on the mosaics . Genious.

Not to be missef. One of the places you should definitely visit during your stay in Saint Petersburg. Tickets are low priced and it's really easy to get to it (near the main street Nevskiy Prospekt). Church is really pretty on the outside and impressive on the inside. It's incredible how much work and effort people have put on building it. I really liked the fact that they have left the place where the Emperor Alexander was fatally wounded visible, so you can actually see a piece of the street in there. The church is not too big so you dont need a lot of time to go around but there's a lot of mosaic art to look at and a lot of turist groups that might slow you down. You can get an audio guide from the info for only 100rubles if youre interested.

Breathtaking architecture. This church is exceptional. The history of it is also fascinating. The architecture and colors are so vibrant and distinctive. There are some small kiosks outside selling tourist items that are good for gifts. The street this church is down from the main road is some what melancholy and romantic. This is also the perfect photo opp.
Amazing. The outside architecture looks like a fairy tale castle. One should go inside the cathedral and you will be amazed to see its mosaic design. A must see

Possibly the most outstanding mosaic modern iconograhpy in world.. A few years ago this church has been completely restored and has to be considered one of the most spectacular form of iconography in mosaics in the world. The examples of mosaics left in Ravenna, Istanbul and Greece among others from the Byzantine Empire are spectacular but only partial due to damage over the centuries. This church is not only completely finished in the interior but the exterior as well. From the Pantocrator under the central dome and Theotokos (Mother of God) at the apse this church iconography is completely following the Painters manual used throughout the ages. Most spectacular is the Annunciation at the Royal Doors. My suggestion if you take a tour stay after and slowly make a second trip throughout the church.
Well worth the visit.. A tour is very helpful for this church as there is so much rich history. We really enjoyed our Russian tour guide and loved St Petersburg.

A must see! . A must see! The beautiful cathedral of the spilled blood is located in the centre of st Petersburg. Free to walk around the outside, however we bought tickets to go inside. Tickets cost 400 plus 200 for a English audio guide. Well worth it! (That's only about £6 English money). The entire visit will take about an hour to walk around inside and take in the beautiful mosaics. P.s it's closed on Wednesdays!!

It's VERY Russian!. Well, this church is quite unusual for "European" St. Pete! Moreover, it is not typical for "real" Russia. Indeed, other orthodox churches are different. However, you MUST see it if you visit Saint Petersburg. The main reasons are:- it is extremely beautiful, and- it is VERY Russian!
Amazing cathedral. The outside is extraordinary but the interior is a revelation with its stunning mosaics. Well worth a short queue

Visit to the Savior on Split Blood. Beautiful church excellent excursions. We went early in the morning and there were less people. They have selling stands in front of the church where you can buy souvenirs. Excursions are led by highly professional people.. You can learn many historical facts about Russia ..

Beautiful!. No one misses visiting the Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood when they visit St. Petersburg. The vivid colors outside and the amazing mosaics that cover the interior make it one of the most beautiful churches I've ever been in. It has been completely restored. It was used to store potatoes during the Communist years.

Fabulous church, breathtaking interior. This small church has a stunning interior, you must not miss it! The gold leaf everywhere, the wonderful paintings, columns, every inch of the walls and ceiling is decorated. Totally over the top but just fabulous to see. The iconic exterior is even more impressive viewed close up and the photo opportunities are endless.

a special place. This church is simply magical; with hundreds of mosaics and a rich , if not chequered history. having been saved from destruction by two twists of fate. Make sure your camera is charged to the max!
Worth seeing. Really worth seeing, if you don't want to but a ticket, please just look at it from the outside. There is a nice park, some other sights and a metro station nearby.

Rip off . Entrance fee is 250 Rubles and you get no satisfaction by visiting this place
I will avoid this place

Spectacular!. Church of the savior on split blood is spectacular both inside and outside!
The outside architecture is similar to ST basils cathedral at Moscow. This is the main reason along with ST basils to visit Moscow and ST Petersburg. Not to be missed anyhow!!

See it look up. Look for the details
If you don't speak Russian notice what the tour guides are pointing at
Photo exterior and interior details it's impossible to get an overview
Worth admission I did not do audio guide
It's a memorial

Magnificent and unusual. As a person who finds visiting the cathedrals in Europe to be a great draw...invariably accesing churches wherever I can, I've seen more than my fair share. The Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood is amazing: its interior dazzles and seeing it makes one realize the limitless talents of artists and artisans who devote themselves to a singular effort. I'm definitely not an art or church historian but it's a shock to see the depictions of classical and biblical scenes adorning every square inch of the church. To view it at length requires serious dexterity in one's neck! It's interesting to note that it was, of course, closed during the Soviet Era and was used as a storage facility. Just cleaning the mosaics and undoing years of neglect required enormous resources. Notwithstanding any historical details, this Church is stunning and its beauty will leave you breathless.
Picture Postcard Beautiful. Ornate and archetypical Russian Orthodox Church just a short walk from the main drag. The 250 rub to enter is a small price to pay for the riot of opulence you see inside.
