Awesomely beautiful architecture. It does not take long to visit this beautiful attraction but it is highly recommended. The colourful exterior domes are stunning as is the lavishly decorated interior. Very beautiful. There is a small market selling souvenirs along the canal at the back exit.
The best place to see.. Simply magnificent. A must see landmark in Saint Petersburg ✌ I could not resist so I visited it more than once.

Photostop at Church Of the Saviour on Spilled Blood. Stopped by only for a Photostop. Once in a lifetime experience just looking at the detail on the church. Due To lack of time couldn't enter the church though.

You have to see this!. This building is totally incredible.
You're going to be impressed by the outside of it, but wait till you get in there. It's absolutely stunning.
I recommend reading about it or having a guide because this building has an interesting history.
If you visit St Petersburg, this is really one top 3 attractions you have too visit.
Beautiful cathedral!. A must visit in St Petersburg, this cathedral impresses with its proportions and decorations. Great example of the Russian Orthodox style.

Outstanding view and day. Do not miss this great place to visit when in St. Petersburg. This is a must and cannot be explained completely in words. I got great photos of the Church, which I am so pleased that I took the wonderful metro (which was easier to take than the Moscow Metro).

Stunning Cathedral - a must visit attraction. A stunning building both outside and in. Built as a memorial, it serves now as such, rather than a working cathedral. We opted to tour by ourselves using an audio guide rather than joining a specific tour. The total cost. For 2 was 600 rubles - approx £6.Interesting history of the Cathedral and its restoration post war. We visited in the morning when it was less busy. Make sure you see the painted bronze replica of the cathedral. Stunning piece of artisan work.
Is it made by human hands?. Wonderful tileswork, like a book, but inside of building. Very nice colours. Its quiat crowded and to understand its needed guide.

kaunis, linda, beatiful. A igreja do sangue derramado, definitivamente é um ponto que deve ser visto em Peter. Exuberante.Jos olet menossa Pietariin, on pako mennä katsomaan tämä kirkko, se on uskomatonta.If you are in St.Petersburg, please make a favor for yourself and go check out what kind amazing archuitecture have this place, is just amazing! I recommend!
Spilt Blood. It's a place steep in history were the tzar was killed at the alter saying his prayers it is a bit gloomy but adds to the effect but the outside you have to see from all angles.
Hard to miss.. Interesting exterior and not crowded when we were there. The interior was ornate and luckily not crowded when we were there.

The best cathedral I've seen!. Having come from a visit to Moscow, and already seen some stunning architecture, it was a pleasant surprise to see that all of these buildings were surpassed by this cathedral which is simply mind blowing.
Please go and see this wonder of the world!

Simply amazing and beautiful interior. The exterior of this church is magnificent but on entering you are stunned by the beautifully painted walls, ceiling and pillars, in fact every surface. The shrine to the assassinated Tzar is very poinient but best to visit with either a guide or very good guide book to hear the whole story.A must for anyone who loves Arts and Craft movement but be prepared to have a stiff neck from gazing up!
Fabulous. An absolute must. It is quite beautiful outside and inside. The Church was seriously destroyed under Communism and has been wonderfully restored.

Must see. Beautiful church, build for a memory of tsar Alexander II. Take time and enjoy! There are audio guides in many languages (and they don't cost much), with such guide you can get more of your visit. I succest! Mosaics are unbelievable. Tickets are only 250 rubles and the place is easy to find.

Beautiful murals. It's a distinctively decorated church with beautiful murals. It also features a monument to Alexander II, who was killed by a bomb at the site of the cathedral. Worth stopping in for a short visit, and it's right near the must-see Russian Museum.
Must see in St.Petersburg. Fantastic church on Spilt Blood. Historically built on a place where Emperor Alexander was killed. Must go while in the city.

Fascinating architecture and history in one. A true treasure from the intricate and colourful internal mosaics to the history behind its "Spilt Blood" name and how they have preserved this part of the story

Totally overwhelmed this treasure of a building.. We were totally overwhelmed by this treasure of a building. We found the reception staff extremely courteous who went out of their way to assist. A 'not to be missed' place to visit
Beautiful architecture. The architecture is amazing and the colous used on tomb are of one of a kind. The church is amazing from inside too.

Breathtaking!!. Pictures do not do this justice!!! An absolutely beautiful church and inside is even more breathtaking! I am in awe of the time and attention to detail it took to create all the mosaic pieces..def the first thing you should do when visiting!

Always amazes inside and out. This was my 3rd visit to see Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood in as many years. I come here on my annual business trip to SPb, and we inevitably take a walk here and take lots of pictures. It is just plain amazing inside and out. Try catching glimpses of all sides of the outside at different times of the day or year in different weather conditions, and you will notice all sorts of new details each visit. The same can be said about the vast volumes of intricate mosaics inside. It is really hard to capture the majesty of it all in photographs. I think I will capture video next visit to try and outline some of the interior dome and spire mosaics. Like a fine art museum, this place never becomes tiresome. In fact, my appreciation grows with each visit.

Not to be missed when in St Petersburg. Not to be missed when walking from the Kazan Cathedral to the field of Mars. Built in the place where Russian Emperor Alexander II was murdered in 1881, it was forgotten during the Soviet era although not destroyed, but in 1990s totally reconstructed and serves as an inspiration to Russian Orthodox church-goers as well as to curious travellers. I would like to see it again.

a peace of art. if you go to saint peters burg you had to visit it it is one of the fine peace of art i have ever seen,each stone was carefully colored and and the painting on the top about Guess was hand made.it was cold out side but we enjoyed the seen>
FANTASTIC. This is one of the top tourist attractions in St. Petersburg - and it is worth it! St. Petersburg is full of Museums, Palaces and cathedrals. This one is worth it!

Stunning!. This church is really a must see! It is really beautiful outside and inside the mosaics and the decorations are really wonderful! Amazing colours, amazing atmosphere. One of the symbols of the city!
quick visit. we were taken here and told of its importance and history, well worth a visit, as the mosaics on the walls are excellent.
Brilliant for History Lovers !. Like many of the Palaces and Museums, this place is truly fascinating. We enjoyed everything associated with the Russian Royal family and this was no exception.

Unique amazing church. This place is amazing. The domes are what first catch your eye but there is some amazing details on all sides of the exterior. Then when you go in the whole inside is covered in mosaics. The scale of the building is also really manageable and sets it apart from the typical massive cathedrals you see. Make sure you walk down the canal to get some good pictures from a distance.

Beautiful. The details and architecture is amazing. Make sure to listen to audio and purchase some books before or after to also learn about the history of the foundation, evolution of the use and the impact of revolution on this church and others due to struggles of people against the establishments. BuildingS are enjoyable to see. But discovering why and how is a more long term impact.
Fascinating. It is particularly interesting that the church was used first for the storage of food and then of victims in the siege of St. Petersburg
Tsarskoe Selo. A wonderful visit accompanied by a terrific guide whose knowledge was quite formidable. A place I have wanted to visit for a very long time it met and went far beyond my expectations.
Not to be missed. Stunning mosaics, simply beautiful colours floor to ceiling, visit won't take more than 30 minutes or so but well worthwhile a stop.

A jewel box!. Nothing had prepared me for this jewel box of a church! The exterior is exquisite, but the interior is absolutely spectacular! I have visited many churches, cathedrals and palaces in my travels but this is beyond compare. The whole interior is covered in beautiful mosaics and the eye just can't get enough of them! Pictures don't do it justice - it is an absolute gem.
Out of this world. Loved both the outside and the inside. Definitively a must see. If you can wait for the light to be right in the later part of the afternoon, I would recommend to go then.
Resembles the one on the Red Square. Inside is just amazing. Nothing but mosaic from top to toe. A definate must see even if churches are not your bag.
Great to see.. Very similar to St Basils Basilica in Moscow. Great architecture. Well worth a stroll around the canals to see.
Beautiful. Walked here from our hotel. Overwhelmingly beautiful. Didn't feel we needed a tour to visit this church although did see many tours. Would visit again if in St Petersberg.
Must see. Spectacular both inside and out. This site was included in a pre booked tour and we had benefit of local knowledgeable guide. The history of it is so interesting.
Fantasy church. Amazing building with a fascinating history, near aht ehistoric centre and easy to combineiwth The Russian Museum or Hermitage, definitely well worth a visit, in the top 5 must sees

Spectacular art!. The mosaic art is incredible. There must be millions tiny tesserae on these walls. The history of what happened to this church during the Soviet era and the story of the restoration is also fascinating.

Climb the outside for a beautiful view of the city. The outside of the church is absolutely beautiful. We did not go inside, but we did climb to the top and the view provides you a fantastic view of the city of St Petersburg.

Stunning on both the Inside and Outside. I first saw this church from a distance and was immediately impressed by its stature – but close up, it’s even more stunning. Built on the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander II on 1st March 1881 (hence the name), the interior of the church is made up entirely of mosaic frescos. Photos do not do it justice – most visitors were wandering round in silence just taking in the beauty of the building. A special canopy covers the area where the Tsar fell – this was the 12th attempt on his life and he had just minutes before survived the 11th one. Left to fall into disrepair for many years, and threatened with demolition, the church was thankfully restored and reopened to the public in the 1990s. Definately in the Top Five Places to visit in St Petersburg.

beautiful inside and out. This is a must-see for most visitors to St Petersburg, and wih good reason. The exterior of the cathedral is something of the city's "answer", if one were needed, to Moscow's St Basil's, with its onion domes and bright colours.It is probably the interior which wows the visitor more, however, with every interior surface covered in bright biblical scenes. The scale is huge and the craftsmanship impressive. We visited several Orthodox churches on our trip and this was almost certainly our favourite so if you only visit one, this is recommended!When you come out, you are on one of the main canalside streets and there are plenty of nice places to rest weary feet over a coffee or meal.
Beautiful interior. Interesting architecture and beautiful interior to this church. Well worth the visit to view the frescoes.

the interior is the must. the visit inside the church is definitely a must; it was a bit crowded and hence actually a bit noisy; there are a huge number of details to observe and learn the history of what we see
Beautiful landmark . We went there on our first day in st Petersburg to photograph the church in sunset time, but no matter at night or day, sunrise or sunset, this church has always be beautiful..

Go there during the Church Services on a Sunday. Beautiful Church, another must in St. Petersburg. We have visited the Church on a Sunday Morning during a Russian Orthodox sermon. It was beautiful and the live chorals you will enjoy very much. The church itself is unmatched by any of the other churches nearby.

Mesmerizing and gorgeous . You cannot not see it if you're in Saint Petersburg. It's in very downtown and it's a most beautiful church you'll ever see anywhere in the world. Totally mesmerizing and unforgettable.

Jaw dropping . I've seen most of the great churches around the world, but this is still very impressive, and yes, first impression once inside is 'jaw droppingly' magnificent.
Definitely worth the very reasonable entry fee.
gorgeous mosaics. one of the city's landmarks, the church merits a visit, if only to see its mosaics. walk along the canal is worth the trek

Amazing. You walk down a road and turn a corner and BAM you are hit with this majestic splendor.CHEAP to enter and even CHEAPER audio which I insist you buy for 100rbls. There is so much going on inside this Church that its good to have an explanation. Spent wonderful time in side here. Photos are permitted without flash.There are some small stalls outside selling many pretty things. I did not check prices but take a look.
Place to see absolutely. Breathtaking! Super taktile ancient book experience. Taking a guide is a great idea, because otherwise you just see nice images
Must see. An iconic building with considerable history. Looks very dramatic outside but the inside is even more fantastic!
More interesting than average church. Just beautiful. So much to see. I like the interior of this church the best. Must see in St. Petersburg

A must see. Our hotel was just around the corner and this was one of the first sight we "stumbled" into after arriving. The church is just beautiful, day or night. Purchasing a ticket for 250 RUB is well worth it to see the mosaic and beauty inside.
Mesmerising!. My favourite spot in the beautiful city of St Petersburg!! The Church itself looks grand..interiors are brilliant and the area outside has a very lively atmosphere.
Nice to see it definetly. Nice church interesting to see almost the same as in Moscow, I would say very special design. We like it the most during the night walk.

Beautifully ornate. Church with an interesting history. Beautifully ornate inside and out. If holiday trinkets are your thing the the market stalls along the canal at the back of the church will hit the spot.
As good as you hoped. Amazing exterior. The inside does not disappoint. The murals are all made of millions of mosaic tiles. Absolutely beautiful.

closed on wednesdays. This church, as well as the others in the city is closed on wednesdays so plan your visit carefully. The church, its history and all the stories and legends around it is definitely worth visiting- at least from outside and if possible- with a guide (paper or real one) to get a complex picture of this place and its importance.
Hanging on in Charch of Savior. I visited this place with my best friend. We hang on in streets around there , watching many lovers taking photo, and also it was very close to subway metro station.

Must to see at Piter. There may be queues or lot of school groups. But it is unique. It took long time to build, it took a long time to re-bild after soviet era. It gives idea of the Eastern Church style at most colourful.Look up, really up.The images are on the stories of the Holy Bible.Historically assassin place of Tsart Alexander II is visible - and it was one of the events that changes history and caused later on reasons for revolution.

Must see stop on Saint Petersburg. My third visit in the past 18 months and I am still amazed by how they restored this church over many years after the severe damage it sustained during WWII and during the Soviet times. Mosaics cover every interior (and many exterior) walls including one of the few depictions of Christ as a teen. Really a neat place to visit for a couple of hours.

My favourite place in St.Petersburg. This church is everything one imagines in a Russian church. Beautiful colours, many bigger and smaller turrets, every inch of the interior covered in mosaics and icons. Stunning! The church is close to Nevsky Prospect, when you walk alongside the canal you reach it at the point of the Singer building. You need to buy a ticket and I think queues in the main season will be quite long going by the amount of barriers before the ticket office. Nevertheless it's a church not to be missed inside and outside!
Beautiful. Picturesque Russia just as you envisage, Well worth the visit. St Petersburg is fantastic especially in the snow.

If you think the exterior is amazing, which it certainly is.... You have to go inside! We actually laughed when we first stepped inside as the interior is beyond anything we had ever seen before. Don't miss it and you will see what we mean!

Church of Spilt Blood. A wonderful fantasy display of minarets all multi-coloured and fanciful like whipped ice cream cones or perhaps balloons. A MUST SEE when in St Petersburg. Photographers make sure you get the time of day right for the shadows!
Church built on the site of the Tzar's murder. This Church is magnificent since all of the icons are constructed of mosaics. I would recommend that you do not miss this attraction.

Must-See in Piter. Well... I kind of find it hard to rate a church, since there is not a lot to rate.The Spas na Krovi (as the church is called in Russian) is definitely one of the must-sees in St. Petersburg, since this is the place, where emperor Alexander II was hurt so badly, that he then died. Also, you can see a lot of mosaics in there, which is nice. It's built in the very tipical Russian style and doesn't really look like it's in St. Petersburg (for me it always kind of feels like it belongs to Moscow).As usual in orthodox churches on the inside there is so much to see, that you can not really decide where to look first.I recommend everybody to go there, also when not that interested in churches, because a visit of Piter whithout this church is just not complete! ;)
Beautiful. Very pretty church and the similarity to St Basil's in Moscow cannot be denied. Lovely area and place to spend some time and in the sunshine, this looks wonderful
Very nice landmark. Beautiful church. Inside is worth a visit. There were no lines, but during high season, it might be a lot busier.
Spectacular building. Another great building in St Petersburg. The paintings are vast and unbelievable. The history is fascinating well worth a visit

An incredible place. This Cathedral is a combination of history and architecture. It was built on the site where Alexander II was fatally wounded and the mosaics inside the church are a huge and amazing work! Could watch it for hours.
Don't miss this.. Make sure whatever you do you make time to go into this Church. Incredible piece of art and history.
Picture-book Russia!. What a beautiful church, both inside and out. The mosaics inside are exquisite. Go on a sunny day, as the sunlight on the domes brings the exterior to life.

So much detail!. One look at this building, and you know it's Russian. My wife and I visited on Easter Sunday, and were pleasantly surprised to find there were no queues. Admission is extremely cheap too, at the Rouble equivalent of only £2-50 per person. Once inside, it just takes your breath away! The detail all around is stunning. In my humble opinion, it makes the Sistine Chapel look like a kid's playground. No annoying crowds to follow, and nobody getting in the way of your photos either! This really is a must-see place to go.

Small, but perfectly formed...... The best part of the church is the external view, with all the turrets and onion domes. Inside (admission fee) it is quite small and was getting crowded when I visited. Every inch of walls and roof is covered in bright mosaic/paintings, while the actual site where Alexander II was fatally wounded is marked by a large stone canopy near the entrance. 2 alcoves next to main altar have a screen for icons, but when I visited (March 2016) the icons themselves were not present, just B&W photos. Allow 15-20 minutes inside.
The WOW church. Beautiful! Impressive! Mind blowing! It is not a large church, but once in.. It is amazing! All the gold, the arts like paintings. A must see even for culture vandals.
Leisure. Unreal opulent gold design like Moscow ..history and architecture very interesting. Stalls near a bit trashy ...

Stunning turn of the century art; no good tours/explanation. Go to soak in the beauty but unless you bring your own guide, don't count on much insight into the multiple layers of significance of this site.
An obvious must to your trip. Of course this is the most beautiful church inside and out so you can not visit SP without going.. high recommend.
Jewel in Russian Crown. We only saw the outside of this church. It is very impressive with stunning architecture. It is situated on a very busy street so watch out for vehicles (especially coaches).

One of the Most Spectacular Churches in Europe. The Church of the Savior on Split Blood is an awesome church with incredible mosaic interior as well as the walkway where Czar Alexander II was assassinated in 1881. This is one of the most interesting churches I have ever visited.

This is the most beautiful Russian church period!. Im in St. Pete 2-3 times each year, always come to see it. This is the most picture-perfect church you will see in Russia. Going inside is optional- its prettier outside than inside.
Amazing interior. This is a must see if you go to St Petersburg. The interior is amazing. It is definitely worth the admission fee.
Beautiful. the mosaics inside really leaves you speechless. Go with time and be prepared for the crowded. ISIC student discount available.
Very beautiful . A must visit place , nice mosaic paintings and beautiful architecture both inside and outside , you feel the spirit of Russia for a memory of its son .

Finally my dream came true!. It was dream of mine for many years to see Spas na Krovi fully rebuild! It is so amazing and gorgeous you can spend hours there and always still find something new and amazing!
Over the top!. Doesn't take long to view, but then only costs about £2.50. Really interesting exterior but even more amazing interior.

Church of the Spilt Blood.. What a magnificent and beautiful building this is. Incidentally, it is sometimes referred to as the Church of the Resurrection. The church was built on the site where the Russian Tsar Alexander the Second was assassinated. It took 25 years to construct because of the elaborate domes and intricate mosaics. You can take photographs inside and there are many beautiful architectural features and designs to capture with your camera.

SUBLIME. Something to NOT miss in ST. Petersburg. Amazing outside and inside. The ticket to get inside costs (March 2016) 350 rubles, and once inside you can rent an audio-guide in your own language for 100 rubles.
A must see. Simply stunning.. Only stayed for 15 minutes but definitely worth a look. Exquisite paintings/mosaics. We went end of March so not crowded.
Wow!. Cheap entrance fee for an amazing piece of architecture.Visually stunning on the inside with great history.Well worth visiting.
very nice church.... one of the best church I visit, impressive the architectural design one of the tourist attraction you must visit in St Petersburg

Beautiful church. Well worth a visit....highly decorated interior and fascinating history. We went on private tour in English and learnt so much...well worth it. There is a good souvenir market outside as well

Breathtaking Beauty. Simply overwhelming! A whole big church fully in mosaic!! That was just too much to take in at the first glance. We spend 2 hours inside to take several photos of every inch of it. It is definitely a very must see in lovely St. Pete!

Best attraction in whole of Russia - beats Kremlin , winter palace and St basil hands down.. When I first walked towards the monument (it is not a church at all) I literally was awe struck by its immense beauty and balanced architecture. It is such and out worldly structure with all those unique building materials used . Walk from the rear first from the Main Street to get good landscape pictures first before you make your way to the front of the church. As you walk and admire the exterior, be assured that the interior is even more awe inspiring. Entrance is 250 Roubles . Walk inside and enjoy the interior. The paintings are made from mosaics and tiles which are colorful, engaging and meant to make you feel insignificant. A good 30 minutes visit.If feel like buying Russian souvenirs, buy from the vendors outside and do some bargaining . Definitely the first place to visit on the city. Note that it closes on Wednesdays.
One of the most beautiful churches i've ever seen. I suggest visiting i the evening when there are less torist, it's breathtaking inside and out. It's a must see

Refreshingly different. This church is very different from other churches in St. Petersburg. It's as colorful from inside as from outside and the interiot walls and ceilings are covered with tiny mosaics. Worth a visit!

Most eye opening church in SPB!. Having visited a million churches in Europe and many in SPB, this one is by far the most stunning in St Petersburg. The floor to ceiling mosaic will leave your jaw on the floor.

Gorgeous church with a fascinating history . Incredible story about how the church was built on the site of Alexander II's assassination - hence the name. But more interesting is what happened during WWII and thereafter. The restoration job was phenomenal. Fans of Ste. Chappell in Paris will love this jewel box of mosaics. A must-see during any visit to St. Petersburg. Great stalls for souvenir purchases outside. Don't hesitate to bargain.
Fascinating. Gorgeous church. The exterior is strikingly beautiful and the interior breathtaking. Excellent and detailed audio tour available in multiple languages.

Not a typical church. This church is definitely worth a visit. It's not big like cathedral, so it would not take much time to explore it.I think it should be the first one in the list of main attractions of St.Petersburg. Very beautiful and unique inside. Full of mosaic icons. Located in the city center, close to the famous Griboedov canal, Russian museum and field of Mars.

Stunning. This church is just stunning & the inside is absolutely amazing. Luckily we picked a day that wasn't busy so we had the chance to really appreciate the decor & take photos without other visitors in them!
Magnificent site. The artwork on and in this building is mind blowing. You have to at least take a walk around the church even if you don't go in.

Beautiful beyond compare.. Stunning artworks decorate the interior of this beautiful World treasure. The exterior, just as amazing in all the onion tops and plaques. This is a must see for any Tourist. Walking distance to the Hermitage museum and dozens of other wonderful Russian treasures.

The Domes are Magnificent.. If you can, see the domes by day and again by night. This is one of the visual experiences St. Petersburg has to offer that you will always remember. Read up on the history before you go. Knowing why it's the church of the savior on spilt blood will add to your experience as you visit.
Amazing building. Inside and outside this is a rare piece of architecture, lavishly and lovingly decorated to commemorate an assassination. Very different from UK churches and well worth a visit.

speechless. In 2 years living here, I've never been bored by this Church.
From inside to outside, this construction offers you, day and night, a magnificent view and feeling.
One stop is not enough, try to see her at different time during the day, you will be surprised.....

Equally gorgeous inside & outside. This Church was built beside the Griboyedov Canal, which was the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in Mar.1881. The imperial family and some private donors funded the construction of this Russia Church. Both outside and inside are equally gorgeous. Beautiful mosaics on the ceiling, walls and floors. Although filled with tourists shoulder to shoulder, but still worth the hustle to visit this magnificent church.Happy Travelling!
Amazing church inside and out. Really impressive from the outside and even more spectacular inside with painted walls and stained glass windows. Not to be missed in a visit to St Petersburg.

Spectacular Colours and Mosaics . The craftsmanship of this church is astounding. The external is a "mosaic" of different color bricks and the interior of mosaic tiling of various sorts. The sacred atmosphere can be interfered with by obnoxious tourists, but if you go in quiet times it is ver special.

Another St Petersburg jewel. Make use of the audio guide for the history dimension is so important. Excellent efforts have gone into renovation and are ongoing. The use of mosaics rather than painting makes the interior unique and gives it a specially bright appearance that hopefully will last.
Whoa!. Impressive, amazing, stunning, remarkable. Be sure to spend plenty of time inside and out to appreciate the artwork!
What a cathedral!. The tiles on the outside of this church are spectacular! This is a don't miss when touring St. Petersburg. The inside is as fascinating and the tours history is special indeed.

So worth it. If you are in St Petersburg definitely go to see this magnificent piece of architecture. For a student it costs about 50 roubles to get in, which is the equivalent to 50 pence. The interior is virtually covered in mosaics. Even if you do not have time to go inside, still stop by just to appreciate the sheer beauty of this.

Absolutely stunning landmark!. On our last visit to Saint Petersburg, we finally got a chance to see this pearl. We got early to skip the lines (may be crowded between 10:30 am and 11 am due to the organized groups) and take pictures of the inside with the sun light reflection on the beautiful gilded mosaics on the walls. We had previously visited Saint Petersburg (in the early 90-ies) but were never able to get inside. Come to see the building at night, the illumination is gorgeous!
Rich with history. This is a unique church with a rich history. Be sure to rent an audio guide for 150 rubles to learn about the history as you tour the grand but relaying small church interior.
Beautiful. Outstanding . Well worth a visit. The restoration looks fantastic. Easy to access and photograph. Friendly staff.
Human ingenuity and dedication to faith. This is a must-see, from outside to the inside, pay close attention to the mosaic details, truly the result of human ingenuity and dedication to faith
Mosaic marvel. . Really quite stunning. Never seen the like of the mosaics. Stunning to view and historically famous as to where Alexander 2 fell.

Very beautiful and interesting sight. Located in the heart of St.Pete, this is a must-see-attraction in the city. Cathedral was built on a place where Alexander the second was murdered.
The cathedral is very interesting looking on the outside and absolutely stunning in the inside.

Ornate, Colorful and Striking Image, did not disappoint.... When we planned our trip to St Petersburg we penciled in a visit to this iconic church as an absolute must. We spent a few hours admiring the church and admiring its Medieval Russian architecture. It was every bit a colorful as we had hoped it would be. We read up on the history of this place before our trip but greatly enjoyed our local guide telling us of the assignation of Emporer Alexander II on this site and the subsequent construction of the church. We would not have wanted to miss seeing this and we came away with lots of great pictures. Ornate, colorful, striking image...
Must see. This is where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated in 1881, they built a church over it. As beautiful a cathedral as I have ever seen

Prettiest church ever! . This is one of the most beautiful churches I have visited. The building is an iconic site of Saint Petersburg. It is equally stunning from the inside with intricate mosaic masterpieces filling every inch of the church.

Magnificent!. The most beautiful church I have ever seen so far across Eastern and Western Europe, been to many places. Nothing compares to this church in beauty, intricate craftsmanship of mosaics, and semi-precious stone decor. History is a big part of it, and Orthodox faith is presented in its full glory. Entry is only 5 USD / 400 rubles. You will have the best photos made here!

Picture stop in high season unless you love mosaics or icons.. Great story. Beautiful church, but if you have limited time or during busy summer tourist season, I would drive by for a requisite picture, but not spend precious time inside… unless you’re into mosaics or Russian Orthodox icons, as they are exquisite here.

Place you must visit. Excellent example of art - late 19-beg.20 centures. Exterior a la St.Basil's in Moscow , but more fairy-tale style, interiors inside are full of remarkable artists works- mosaics, icons, stone carvings. It should be also observed as a monument of impressive restoration efforts, it was almost ruined during the Soviet era. It takes time- to feel this temple and to look at the details, so two hours at least needed.

just waw. enjoyed the walk thru this church, although my friend almost fell asleep on a chair :-)
Popular place, but worth a visit

First to see. Have visited recently in March with my wife. The interior of the church is outstanding by itself, as well as it will be very interesting to those who wants to get a detailed view on every mosaic icon and text. I really admire the work of the restorers, which did a great job to return this church to what it used to be before October 17, WWII, etc. It's a pity that even now some icons are missing ( quite a few) and are restored with pictures, but it's a good lesson to everebody to think twice, before doing something - even if you think - that's proper. The most promising ruler was murdered by a terrorist. Length of the visit depends of your free time and purpose. 1-2 hours are enough for guided tour for sightseeing. But if you have special purpose as student, etc, even 3 hours won't be enough
Our 2nd Trip and still worth a visit. Toured while on a Viking Star cruise. Beautiful church worth a visit. Watch for pickpockets here as this is a favorite haunt. See attached photos.

Art lovers!. Art lovers....this one is for you! Take your time and walk around inside! Compared to the technology we have to day. It pretty cool. Take in to account when it was built... its pretty #@*/ amazing!

One of the best places of interest in Saint-Petersburg. Excellent Church with unique history. In accordance to order made by Russian Emperor Alexander III it was built on the place where was had been killed his father - Emperor Alexander III. The event took place on Ekaterina's canal embankment end to set the main altar exactly of the place of Alexander II death apart of the canal was swamped. Today the Church possesses one of the world's largest mosaic collection.

Opicture post card church. This was an interesting church from the outset. Wonderful colourful roof and how I imagined genuine Russian churches looked in years gone by. There is a canopied area inside where the blood was allegedly spilt but the thing to go for are the mosaics. They are truly wonderful. Not all completed but there are some examples at ground level so you can look at the technique. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful almost overload church dedicated to... the memory of a man. Two recent visits - crowded in July whereas in February it is possible to appreciate the floors and mosaics without so many other people around. Definitely worth a visit, but keep your valuables well secured especially in high season...

Beautiful Building. Architecture like no other. Breathtaking even just from the outside. The bells of the cathedral wake up the entire district and it is simply empowering to be in its surrounds and cast your eyes on it's beauty
Unmissable!. Honestly, this is breathtaking. Not to be missed!Absolutely stunning inside and out. A highlight of the trip, and the jewel in the crown of St Petersburg.
Beautiful church. One of the must go church in st Petersburg. It look magnificent and the painting inside is historical meaningful. It cost $250 ruble.

Wonderful interior of mosaics. This is very special church as the interior is completely covered in lovely mosaics. It was popular with Russians on the day we visited - obviously enjoying being able to see their heritage. Well worth a visit

A breathtaking monument. St. Petersburg is packed with beautiful buildings but that church is outstanding among them. Inside and outside there are so many things to admire, mostly the art of mosaics and the glittering details. As it is very popular it's advisable to go there by the time of opening.

Lovely inside and out. This iconic church is remarkable not only for its exterior beauty and backdrop for great photos but also the amazing icons inside the church. A must see in St Petersburg for any visitor. Centrally located near other major sites, restaurants and shops.

Must see in St. Petersburg. From the outside this is already a magnificent building, but the inside is amazing.
Everything is made of the smallest mosaic tiles. Breathtaking to realize how much work was put into the creation of this church

Don't Miss This. Apart from the outside being a spectacular example of early Russuan architecture, the inside is covered entirely with stunning mosaics, floor to ceiling.
This site should not be missed!!

Just amazing. The church stands out in St.Petersberg because it's so different from the rest of the city - more Russian and less European. I still can't believe the beauty of the mosaics and the fascinating story of the building.

Beautiful Art inside.. The Church of the Saviour on Spilt Blood is magnanimous and visible from a long distance from the main street.
The road leading to it has a nice canal running parallel to the road. The street is also filled with lot of Street Musicians during Tourist season.
Wonderful wall paintings and art works inside.
Recommended for History and Art lovers.

Interesting to have seen, but not exceptional. This church is a very nice example of Russian architecture with respect to churches. Whereas it's very nice to have seen, it's not something exceptional.

Spectacular, easy access. Spectacular views both outside and inside - 70 000 sq.m (600 000 sq.ft) of mosaics!
Very short line, modern ticket office, free guided tour inside every 5 - 10 minutes (in Russian, not sure about English).

Must see Church. I was very lucky to see the attraction during winter as there are not as many people visiting. An amazingly beautiful church so rich in history and full of color. I highly recommend taking the time to visit this site and take many beautiful photographs. The outside of the church is just as spectacular and the day i visited the outside temperature was -26 and was amazed that many street vendors where selling goods in such cold conditions. The vendors where very friendly and offered lots of good advice regarding what other attractions to visit. I had a great time and highly recommend you visit.

Overpriced must see. As one of the most important cathedrals in Russia you probably will go inside despite the rip off price and you'll find wonderful eye candy. But, my feeling about the Russian churches is pretty much that if you have seen one you've seen them all. Probably ignorant, I know, but they do all seem to have the same decorations and iconography.What makes this stand out is that a tsar was assassinated here so the cathedral was renamed to reflect that. If, by the time you get to here, you have been to the Hermitage you may be sufficiently appalled at the blatant awful excesses of the royalty to think that was not necessarily a bad thing.This cathedral reflects those excesses with an extravaganza of gold, gilt and glass, not to mention frescos and mosaics and a totally incongruous shrine to the dead tsar made, of course, with the finest materials and craftsmanship including, no doubt, the blood of virtual slave labour who built it.

Beautiful, Inside and Out. One of the sights I was most excited about seeing on my trip to Russia. Easily accessible by taking the blue line to Nevsky Prospect and exit by ways of the Griboedov Canal. As you walk down the canal, you will pass plenty of vendors selling miscellaneous goods. The outside is very colorful and beautiful, but I would suggest going around to the back and buy tickets to enter into the church. Reasonably priced, you go inside and see what seems like endless mosaics wonderfully crafted out to scenes throughout the Bible. There is also a stone located inside the church that has some blood of deceased Emperor Alexander II, from which the church derived its name.
Beautiful church. The church is quite beautiful, especially when the sun is out. The towers are very reminiscent of St Basil's in Moscow but have a distinct feel to them.

Beautiful museum. We visited there February 2015 and it was very nice place. I have visited before also other museums but this was the best one. All paintings looked new and beautiful. They sold some small and cute souvenir inside.

Amazing history lesson. Absolutely stunning "must-visit" place! Beautiful architecture inside and outside of the church, but the history behind it is even more interesting and curious. Usually you can ask about the excursions inside the church or you might be given a player with the recorded excursion on it. Strongly recommend visiting it.
Inspiring. This is for sure the best church I ever saw in my life. The architecture is inspiring. You will need time to see every detail of this amazing building.
Magnificent . Wow! Outside of Church is lovely, but inside took my breath away, mural mosaics are stunning. Should be on top of lisit when deciding what to see in St Petersburg.

In my whole life I have never seen such a beautiful church!. Make sure you have a camera with you when you visit this church because your eyes wont believe what they see! This church looks like a fairytale candy palace from the outside, and from the inside it is entirely decorated!

SO MUCH BEAUTIFUL. Architecturally, the Cathedral differs from St. Petersburg's other structures. The city's architecture is predominantly Baroque and Neoclassical, but the Savior on Blood harks back to medieval Russian architecture in the spirit of romantic nationalism. It intentionally resembles the 17th-century Yaroslavl churches and the celebrated St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.
Magical in Winter. Very photogenic place in Winter. Majestic and ornate. Must see when in Saint Petersburg. Get there early to avoid crowds of tourists.

Don't miss!!!. A superb architecture and Russian History that cannot miss if you visit St.Pethersburg inside is a dream come true for the art lovers.... I will add some pictures so you can judge yourself!, also near you have some very nice restaurants and Baars!

Whimsical and enchanting. Start by approaching the church from a distance. The variety of decoration of the domes and minarets are wonderful. Inside are amazing tiled murals that have been beautifully restored. It's almost hard to believe that this was used for potato storage during the famous Seige of Leningrad.

A Must See. A spectacular building with an interesting street market nearby.
Get the audio guide it helps.
The icons and murals are stunning and the mosaics incredible in how they depict details which I thought would have been impossible to do with small tiles.
A must see!!. A wonderful church covered in amazing mosaic from top to bottom, it is a must see in St Petersburg. There is a small charge to enter but well worth it.
pretty. If you visit one church in st peters then make it this one, its the best and most beautiful in my opinion, you might not get too excited about any other church afterwards though.

Beautiful Architecture..... This is another church built by Alexander 3 to honoured his father Alexander 2 which died in this location.
The achitecture of this building if very amazing, also the picture inside the church. You have to visit this church if you visit St Peterburg....

Huge Church with amazing painting and sculpture. This building really amaze me, cause the sculpture from gold and painting of Jesus and Maria very colorful. if go the at June or get at white night you can have lower entrance ticket. How to go there is from Nevsky prospect you can left and can see this building

Mosaics if not history. Both the outside and the inside this church is and adorable art gallery of mosaics. Hard to find your peace as usually crowded. Similarly hard o get a good shot. But still well worth the visit.

The Russian art . One of the best place to visit in Saint Petersburg
It's a real beauty of Russian stone art and don't forgot to visit the Jewel stone museum opposite to the church

Awsome. This church us not only amazing inside but just walking past it everyday took my breath away. A small group of stalls selling souvenirs on street leading to it but just added to the charm. Do not miss!

Beautiful architecture surrounding true historical signicance. The very place where Alexander ii was assassinated. A remarkable shrine to history. This is a significant building to see and the preserved "spilt" blood is quite breathtaking. For anyone remotely interested in how Russia became modern Russia this site is full of history.

Do not leave without seeing!!!. I'm not sure why this wasn't on the plan to begin with for St Petersburg but thank goodness we stumbled upon it. It is definitely the most beautiful church in all of Russia.

A Real Russian Beauty. The interior of this church has to be seen to be believed. Mosaics from floor to ceiling ( some ceilings are 60/70mtr high ) Like everything in St.Petersburg, best seen in the winter when it has snowed and the rivers are iced over. Just beautiful.

A must see when visiting St. Petersburg. The Church of the Saviour on the Spilled Blood is one of the absolute must visit places in St. Petersburg. It is called the church of the spilled blood since this is where Alexander II was assassinated. Inside you will find some extraordinary mosaics, and (as far as I know) the only depiction in the world of Jesus Christ as a young man (seen inside one of the domes).
Stunning. Gorgeous both inside and out. My favorite cathedral in St. Petersburg, have visited many times. Highly recommended.

Beautiful church. This place is really grand to look at from outside. It is also possible to enter the church, and inside one will see some amazing icons etc. Anyway, a given place for photos on a trip to St. Petersburg.
Outstanding!. Going inside is a must-do IN LIFE.It impressed me a lot, one of the most beautiful interiors I saw in a cathedral!

Amazing and wonderful monument . This very important church is at the same time a wonderful monument, reference in orthodox art and architecture. To see it from outside seems like a dream because colours and lines of the monument is incredible. Don't miss it!

One of many places to visit in St. Petersburg. There are many places to visit in St. Petersburg but I would definitely put this beautiful Church on the must see list. It is truly awe-inspiring on the inside and outside.
Gorgeous church. The church is incredible! Take the time to go inside and see all the beautiful artwork. Also there is a nice park next to it that is worth walking through. Beautiful!
Stunning and rare. It is as beautiful as the photos. But seeing it I person is inspiring. The list will be long during summer tourist season so try and get there early.
Interesting Cathedral. Worth visiting if you have time, but #1 thing to see in St. P????? Hermitage, now that's a #1 thing to see.....
Best sight in St Petersburg. Of all the places we visited during our five day stay in St Petersburg, we enjoyed this church the most: both the outside and inside are very impressive!
A must see. Don't miss this beautiful church situated just off of Nevsky Prospect…and do walk through the parks adjacent to the church p

Epitomises Russian art.. This building is iconic, the onion domes epitomise Russian style. This is a magnificent city and the saviour of the spilled blood is one of the jewels in the Crown. Together with the hermitage they are the two must see places but there are plenty of other wonders in this magical city. It is as beautiful as Paris and magical too.
A must visit !!. Great place to visit on tour of SPB with a local friend and could translate the tour guide for me busy place but a must!!!

Many details for finishing.. Just viewed from outside, but pictures whitch i took can not compare with what my eyes saw ! :D outside u can find small shops for souvenirs and the prices are acceptable. I did'nt succed to go inside but anyway, it is very awesome
Stunning Interior. The painted interior is stunning. Well worth the small entrance price, even though you'll be in and out in less than 30 minutes.
Just Beautiful. I recommend trying to visit this church early in the morning to avoid big crowds, especially if you want to get some nice pictures.

Domelicious baby!. I'm not really a church/cathedral fan but this is worth a visit. I think the real deal though is walking in the streets/park nearby and getting views of it from different perspectives.

visit once by day and once by night. A game of forms and colours. Looks like a setting for a fairytale on the outside. Inside it's all bling-bling but in an astonishing way. The mozaïcs read like a comic and are overwhelming. Next to the church off course lots of stalls, but the prices here are cheeper than in most of the shops, and you can haglle...

Do not miss this in St. Petersburg. This is an iconic building in St.Petersburg built on the site of a major event in Russian history.Very cheap entrance fee of around 300 Roubles. Make sure you also get the audio guide. The narrator does not have the most inspiring voice but the history of the building in fascinating.Stunning interiors unlike anything I have seen before.Well worth a visit!

Amazing place!!. It's unbelievably beautiful. From the street, it's possible to see it shining. Vibrant colours, amazing mosaics! It's a piece of jewellery in the middle of St. Petersburg. I thought it would be bigger inside, but it was just because I was amazed by the outside.
Very beautiful. This is well worth the visit, a very beautiful church inside and outside, extremely reasonably priced and at least in February not so busy.
Very beautiful . easy to get in, got tickets when we were there - it is February though, not a peak time. Very beautiful inside, recommend for a stay in St Petersburg.

Better looking than St Basil's. Having seen both This church and the more famous, St Basil's in the Red square I prefer this one.Considering it was used as a potato store during the dark years the restoration work is amazing.A Must for any visit in St Petersburg.
Beautiful. The colours really are as vibrant as you imagine, amazing to see. Very busy as you would imagine. Well worth the trip.

Incredible mosaics. Well worth a visit. The entry fee is minimal (250 ruble I think) and you can spend as long as you want inside. It is not the biggest church you could visit in St. Petersburg but the interiors are phenomenal. The mosaics that cover the walls are beautiful, intricate and completely awe inspiring.
Breathtaking . Absolutely stunning cathedral. Takes about 30 minutes to see. Really cheap (250R). This iconic building is a must see

Gorgeous inside and out. I was taken by the beauty of the outside of this church but I was not prepared for the beauty inside. The entire church was covered in mosaic. The icons were absolutely stunning. It's not a big church and I went about midday so there were quite a few tours there at the same time. Because it's relatively small, you can see everything fairly quickly so it's a definite must!!!!
Must see!. The architecture of this museum is amazing! Both outside and inside. The inside of this church is worth seeing in itself. Unforgettable!

Stunning. I have been to Stp many times. However, if I had to pick one church only to visit, I would pick this one. It is an amazing work of art built in memory of Alexander II. It looks amazing outside and inside with mosaics.

Unusual church. Fantastic church on the edge of a canal which makes for a great setting.
It's fascinating inside, completely covered in mosaics which are incredibly intricate.
This is not a large church and once you have had your fill of mosaics you are done.
Not expensive to enter, it's just a few pounds.
Simply European. It was absolutely amazing, Ate at a cafe on the canal - smoked a hookah, had some kebabs, drank local lite beer.

The Churches of Russia.... I hadn't expected to see as many active churches in Russia as I did when I went from St. Petersburg to Moscow. I either hadn't read the right trip reviews or our media just doesn't report very well on the current culture of Russia. Granted when you travel to Europe ..churches or cathedrals are generally numerous on any given tour but I hadn't expected it in Russia. The Russian Orthodox Church is alive and well in the country and the Church of the Savior of Spilt Blood is impressive. The scenery around the church can be just as interesting as it attracts a number of unique visitors as you will find in other large cities in Europe, perhaps not in as large a numbers as you might find in London or Paris or Madrid. This church has special significance in Russian history and on the day we were on the grounds the crowds were not large but manageable. We were on a fairly tight schedule and were told to be careful about paying to get in and not be able to have enough time but oddly enough the ticket line was not that long and the walk through can take as long or as short an amount of time as you may wish. We didn't go inside but a member of our group that did said it was worth the effort to see the interior.

Astonishing work of art. It is probably the most wonderful church in world. The work of restorers is unbelievable. Just join the numerous tourist groups to listen the guides in any major language for free. Entry fee is quite reasonable.

Absolutely Gorgeous. The Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood is absolutely stunning. However, as a word of caution, if you want to go in, you have to get there by 5:30, otherwise, the church is closed.
Just see. It is the place that you will never forget. The outside decoration is brilliant but the inside visit is more impressive.
Real joyful beauty inside :). Amazing paintings once you get inside the church... and the view on the cuarche from Nevsky Prospect is unforgettable as well
Beautiful. Very special, with the frozen rivier nearby. We only visited the outside. They are selling a lot of cheap souvenirs near the church.

Another one of the must sees. St Petersburg is so full of history and churches but this one should be on your list along with th palaces and museums and of course the ship where the revolution began that ushered in the proleteriats repacement of the tzars.
Church . This is one of the churches we visited on a cruise ship booked guided 2 day tour of St Petersburg. Beautiful outside and inside.
Beautiful Church . The Church as well as the location have really impressed us. We didn't order a guide tour but had an audio guide there. Highly recommend

Amazing building. I didnt managed to get there inside. When i came around 7 pm and it was already closed. But even from outside it was spectacular and something very memorable. At night it is lighted and looks like from other universe.

Beauty in Asymmetry!. This is the site where Emperor Alexander-II was fatally wounded. The exact location was to be considered for building the church by the Imperial Family and hence, the church is build few feet into the canal. The structure also is a combination of Baroque and Neoclassical Architecture with spiral painted domes. The structure is beautifully lit in the evenings and thus is good to have a day and night view planned. For once, I had to say that asymmetry and combination of so many components could not lower the beauty of the structure. A truly marvelous place to visit.

Spectacular place!. We visited this amazing place as part of a 2 day guided tour with a local St. Petersburg travel agency whilst we were cruising the Baltic in June 2015. Both the interior and the exterior of the building are spectacular and worth an hour or so to view properly. The artwork is fantastic and the colours are vibrant. The entire interior has been painted in blues and golds and depict religious characters and typical Russian icons. One of the outstanding parts of our visit St. Petersburg.
Unusual design but beautiful. Built on site where an Emperor was murdered, the spires are different and colourful and inside it is mesmerising
Incredible. By having a really good guide you learn so much more about this incredible building. Close to Nevsky prospekt
Worth a visit. The truth is we did not have too much time to take a look, but of what managed to see, it's worth taking a look, but don't expect anything WOW
Mosaic Art. The detailed mosaic interior was amazing in its colour and detail. Our guide Polina was very knowledgeable about its structure, history and the meaning of the mosaic pictures.

Amazing, a very different Orthodox church to go. All the decorations are made of mosaic, and of course the interior has somewhat been damaged during the war time(not sure what time, sorry), luckily, Russia has got talented artists and craftman who was able to restore them, for example the white marble cross was literally ruined and the artists has rebuilt one according to its original design(this has been introduced in the show case next to the exit). The ticket 450 rubles btw. their are both ticket booth and auto teller machine(English available) to the left of the entrance.
Tourists view. Well worth visiting the art work is exquisite!!. There is a fee to enter but it is well worth it. Take the time to admire the ceiling artworks
The candy church. Beautiful church! The colourful domes are beautiful to look at. Inside, the frescoes are marvellous and all made of mosaic, very impressive. I loved the colors.
The best highlight.. It was the best highlight of our trip. No one photograph can let you have the impression of it as it is. Much better to see it than to imagine.
A mus see.. This is one of the top sights in St. Petersburg. Very different than other churches you will see. Was the private church for the royal family. A somewhat intimate space.
Amazing Church!!! . we were in awe stepping into this place, totally awesome and very well maintained. The ceiling and the view all around us brought us back to all the glory of the past!

Stunning.. This church is absolutely worth a visit. The detail in every square inch is simply amazing. It is also fun to compare this church to others in St. Petersburg and Moscow. To avoid the crowds, visit right around sundown. It might be slightly more expensive (if I remember correctly), but certainly worthwhile.

My favored.. Every time I come to Saint Petersburg I cannot help but visit this church. The first wonder is that the building, somehow, still stands notwithstanding the fact that the Soviets had decided to tear it apart more than once; the first time in 1931, then in 1938 and finally in 1956. The church also survived major damages in World War II. It substantially differs from all other churches in Saint Petersburg, where the architecture is predominantly Baroque and Neoclassical, while the Savior on Blood reminds of the medieval Russian architecture and it intentionally resembles St. Basil’s Cathedral in Moscow.The outside is wonderful, with the side of the church that almost seems to dive into the river as it outline breaks the symmetry of the canal, and the domes, all in different colors, give it a rather unique appearance. The inside is just as nice with tiles in different colors and mosaics. Sure worth a visit.
Stunning. The stain glass designs are beautiful. The wall murals are very realistic, despite the age. well worth the admission

Magnificent. If you are lucky enough to happen upon this building in the sunshine, then the full beauty of the church will present itself. The colours and the intricate detail of the mosaics are really quite breath taking. There is security outside the church, but once you are in, you are not rushed through, giving you plenty of time to admire the splendour.Be careful of pic-pockets outside.
Incredible church. glorious murals inside, The Church,s absolutely beautiful and the marvel of architecture, and craftsmanshipt
Beautiful, both inside and out.. Beautiful, both inside and out. Definitely worth taking a visit. Entry ticket is not expensive. Once in St. Petersburg you should see it for yourself.

A stunning memorial. The church was built in memory of a tsar who was killed by a bomb. It looks like St Basils cathedral on the Red Square, but the interior is really impressive and you can feel that it symbolises the memory of a great Tsar who fell victim to the social changes he made possible.

Savior on Spilt Blood is a Mosaic Galore. On September 4th and September 6th 2015, my wife and I visited the Church on the Spilled Blood, also known as the Church of the Resurrection. On the 4th from the Petro Palace Hotel we strolled along the Nevskiy Prospect and arrived at the Church to mostly tour the outside, to see the souvenir merchants and the park in the back. It was a lovely day to walk and see the attractions, the cafés, the chic boutiques and the flower arrangements. We took numerous photos of the outside of the Church known for its Russian Revival style. On September 6th as part of an SPB Tour we were able to enter Saviour on Spilt Blood to admire the insides. The insides are a mosaic galore. The walls, the window frames, the ceilings are covered with different types of blue, red and gold mosaic. We were told that the mosaic and ceramic used was jasper, porphyry and Italian marble. Also this church was never actually used for church services, funerals or weddings but rather to the memory of Alexander II. This church is a very inspiring building, monument and work of art and as a result is another five stars in my book.
St Pete landmark. When you are in St Petersburg this church should be on your list of things to see and do. It is good.
“A Must See” attraction. The history of this church links to the assassination of Alexander II. The details of the interior are breathtaking.
AMAZING !. The architecture is simply amazing - you think the outside cannot be beaten, but then you go inside and are amazed all over again !

Indescribable. I have always wanted to go and see this and on our first night wandering around we came across it all lit up and quite by chance. It really was a sight to behold. We had already booked our guide for the next day for our tours and knew we were coming back. The building in the daylight was not as spectacular but the inside is indescribable and has to be seen to appreciate. If you can have a look at it at night it is magical but we did that purely by fluke looking for a jazz cafe that had been recommended. I would recommend getting a tour guide as ours gave us so much information than you can get from a guide book.

stunning church!. I visited here several years ago and unfortunately this church was shrouded in scaffolding so I was so pleased to see that this time all the renovations were completed. This is such a beautiful church and a must for any visitor. It can be viewed from a river cruise also as the boats pass by it to the left of the building. So glad I got the chance to see it in its full glory at last!!

January visit. What I find so wonderful about Russian orthodox churches is the magnificent mural decoration which, set in a warm,carpeted surroundings with chanting, is comforting.A complete and reassuring contrast to the plain and austere Presbyterian kirks in Scotland where I was brought up.The church was raised as a memorial in the place of assasination of Tsar Alexander 2nd and the area where the assasination occurred is roped off within the church.In world war 11 when Leningrad(as it was then known)was besieged the church received a direct hit from a bomb that landed cradled in the outstretched hands of Jesus whose picture is painted in the dome itself.The guide told me that the bomb failed to explode.However this story is not recorded in the guide book I received - it is possible the omission is because the guidebook was written during the soviet era when publicity of apparent miracles would not be encouraged but one can't know for sure.I was told at one time in the soviet era the church was a store and the fine mosaic flooring was badly damaged but that has now been restored in all its grandeur.The foundation was laid in 1883.It includes a bell tower which is interesting because a bell tower to join up with an episcopalion church in Inveraray,Loch Fyne <scotland was also designed albeit not until later around 1921.

An absolute must-see in St. Petersburg. One of the greatest sights I have seen on my many travels. Both the inside and outside of the church are something to be seen. For the outside, the views are spectacular, from near and far. On the inside the stunning array are just awe inspiring. Based on everything I had heard/read I had high expectations, but even so, it was an amazing visit. One word of caution, there are numerous pick-pockets around as the awe of the sight, and abundance of tourists, make this a target rich environment.
A must see. Very interesting historical place. Make sure you put this on your list of things to see in St. Petersburg.

One more must-visit in Saint-Pete!. That is a gorgeous and beautiful memorial to assassinated Russian Tzar Alexander the second and it is situated right on the place where that tragedy has happened.It is not a building, it is a piece of admirable art! If you are visiting Saint-Pete, you definitely should go there!

Absolutely stunning . A must see while in Saint Petersburg! The church is absolutely breathtaking, I went back a couple of times to have a look because I could not get enough of it.You're allowed to take photos inside and you can get an audio recording in your language before heading in gives you in depth information about the church.
Beautiful in day and magnificiant at night time. beyond imagination Must absolutely see it and get inside. History is there. Walking is easy around it. Place is clean and well taken care off.

Great to check out. It's really nice inside with a totally decorated inferior and ability to take pics it's well priced for what you get the story behind the building it's an important part of history It's 250 per person and you will get about 10 mins value It's close to the Main Street

Nice but so rammed packed with people. We did this place as part of a shore excursion off a cruise and had very little time here which was the fault of the tour leader. It's a really beautiful Church and stunning inside but I think our view of it was marred a little by the shear amount of people inside and us also getting rushed through it by the guide. Would have preferred to go at our own pace. Really beautiful on the outside too and a definite place for a good photo opportunity!!

Spectacular inside and out. The church is impressive from the outside and amazingly decorated inside. The entrance is cheap and you can take pictures inside. The street vendors outside aren't pushy and have reasonable prices compared to the official souvenir shops.

Fabulous inside and out. Obviously you will need to drop by this famous church for the compulsory Facebook selfie, so while you're still outside grab a ticket and an audio tour in your preferred language and head inside. The audio tour gives extensive background on the design and features that you will completely miss if you don't have this essential companion. It will details the history of the architectural style and loads of info on the place where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated, not to mention the beautiful mosaics which cover every surface!Find some time to look through (and listen) to the presentations on the history of the church after the revolution. It's amazing to hear about the use of the building as a potato warehouse and the undiscovered active bomb that sat in the attic for 20 years! Enjoy!
So beautiful. We arrived late but we wanted to see the church because of its beauty and we were not disappointed at all. Great church, very impressive. A short walk from the main avenue.

Stunning!. Simply stunning, very atmospheric, set by the canal, mosaics of the finest - do not miss
Classic onion turretts

A must see attraction. Right in the center, at the end of one of St. Petersburg's channels (at the other end is another great Cathedral, Kazan Cathedral), this church is so nice and artistic that you cannot stop making photographs of it. It costs and it is open only till 18:00, a bit inconvenient, as St. Petersburg approaches White Nights, when sun sets after 22:00. More light daily would require longer open hours at the monuments. Unfortunately, most of them close at 18:00.
Don't miss this mosaic masterpiece!. This might be by far one the most monumental structures I have visited world wide..Do not miss this masterpiece!

Amazing piece of art. Most of us will recognize the similar church in Moscow but after being to both of them, this one is way more complex and preciosist , with an extra dose of details on the external murals and paintings, a must see in Saint Petersburg
Beautiful Church. A stunning design, brilliantly lit at night and inside just the most amazing mosaics from floor to ceiling. An hour would suffice, though so many mosaic images to see.

Mind Blowing Mosaics and Architecture. Get ready to be overawed as you gaze at the ceilings and walls of the Cathedral built on the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander 11. The site of his assassination, incorporated into the Cathedral, still has the cobbled street stones covered by an elaborate arch. Funded by the imperial family and private donors the Cathedral has been ransacked and looted, a field hospital in WW2, then a potato storage facility and currently a museum. Mosaics on walls and ceilings are just magnificent as are the recently restored Holy Gates

Stunningly beautiful church. A beautiful architecture and true work of art. Has a sad story behind it, but it is undoubtedly one of the best architectural marvels I have seen. The colours are stunning.

MUST SEE!!. This is one place you MUST SEE in St. Petersburg. The colors on the outside as well as the inside are incredible. The pictures definitely do not do this place justice. Be prepared to pay a fee and be respectful of people/space while you are inside. Though most signs are in English and the local language, you should hire a local guide or use the audio tour to get the full history of the church. I could've spent all day in this place. It's amazing!

Stunning, Must Go. It does resemble the St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow but I observe the painting, the vibrant of the colours painted is far more beautiful than St Basil. It is well located in central and is by the river which makes the view stunning both inside and outside.
Amazing place to see!. Fabulous building to visit - the colours of the building are so vivid you could forget the history of the building!! Easy to find off the canal or from Nevsky Prospekt.

Beautiful Church ever i seen in my life.... 10 days i spend my time there in saint peters burg not good enoughthe whole city is too beautiful...Church of the savior one of the beautiful church ever i seen... Very different then others... like you see those architecture in fairy tales movies.if your visiting this place in October till March better keep warm clothes and leather hand gloves must...

Gob smacking. Arrived by train from Helsinki & took a half day tour, they brought me to this Church, it is amazing and awesome. The internal restoration if the mosaics is stunning & amazing, if you visit this great city, make sure you at least drop in to see this amazing structure!
Beautiful!. This chirch is breathtaking and such history. It's survived through many centuries of war and is maintained to it's amazing glory.
Wonderful. One of the most beautiful crhurchrs in world. Looks a little with San Basil Catedral in Moscow, with the colorfull domes. with all the richness of details of all Orthodox churches.

The most stunning building in Saint Petersburg. When this church first comes into view it will take your breath away. While it has been compared to Saint Basil's in Moscow, there is actually nothing else anywhere quite like it. The exterior is spectacular, but the mosaics that completely cover the inside are equally inspiring. Then there is the story of the assassination of the Czar on the location, Stalin's desecration attempt to destroy the building, and it's rebirth as a church again. Don't miss it if you visit Saint Patersburg.
Unforgettable!. I've traveled a lot but I think, so far, this is the prettiest church I've been to. Outside and inside it's marvelous. It's a must see!
Just amazing!. I agree this is the top spot to see, especially inside. Nothing so amazing as the mosaics. Best to have a guide

A must. Awe-inspiring interior decorated entirely with mosaics of Christ's life on Earth as well as more conventional scenes. All topped with a wonderful onion dome. A fascinating story behind the name, too.

Don't think i've seen a church more beautiful. You can spot it from afar, towering over the busy, buzzing marketplace on Nevskiy Prospect nearby. There are certain days you may enter the church, which you'll have to figure out pre-hand. It is absolutely rustic, detailed, glamorous, and beautiful. In fact, i'd rate it higher than the St. Basil's Cathedral in sheer beauty. It is viewable from many different angles nearby and looks just as good during the nighttime too.

Beautiful masterpiece of architecture, the "must too visit" place in St.-Petersburg. The church was built over the place where the Russian imperor Alexander was attacked by the terrorist bomber. The memorial is inside the church. But it is also famous for it's unique old-russian style architecture and beautiful mosaic inside made by famous russian artists. The excursion service was included into our tickets cost. So having entered the church wait a little for a guide. Excursions are interesting, informative and very useful, cause it's not easy to get so full and detailed information from a guidebook.
Beautiful church.. The interior is beautiful and sumptuous, filled with icons and impressive sculptures. The church is a must see on your visit to St. Petersburg.

The temple on the site of the murder of the Russian Tsar-liberator!. The temple on the site of the murder of the Russian Tsar-liberator! Very long time the architect Parland built is collected on the public dime memorial Church.The son of the slain king of great Prince Vladimir supervised the construction. The reconstruction of the Russian architectural tradition,gorgeous!
Beautiful and historical. This cathedral was beautiful from an architechtural perspective and from a historical perspective. We loved the carvings, paintings, and mosaics.

Easily the most beautiful cathedral in Russia. A rare gem - cathedral decorated in art nouveau style, yet still traditionally Orthodox. Amazing, cozy and breathtakingly beautiful. This cathedral is a museum and only used for religious purposes on special occasions, so you can visit and enjoy it as an architectural and cultural masterpiece regardless of your confession

historical and different style. From outside its amazing but when you walk inside its also another world... for me its not about religion , history and stories about this church are amazing you have to visit once in your trip

Highlight of our entire holiday.. Truly breathtaking and exquisite inside and out. Living in Australia and having visited 2 Asian countries and the United Kingdom prior to our Trip to Russia, Finland and Germany I had never in my life seen such an amazing building. I didn't know how incredible the inside was until I was there as I had always been so in awe of the exterior I had never though about what it would look like inside - i guess i assumed it was just like a regular church. Wow was I amazed when we went inside!!! This place in incredible.

Stunning!. Although it was minus 23 ˚C we enjoyed walking around this amazing church. Unfortunately it was not open that day, but the mere sight of the details of decorations kept us ignoring the cold factor
Mosaic is mindblowing. Must see inside the church - the mosaic is amazing, just incredible! Would definitely recommend visiting such a unique place!
Wow!!. Just go; I'm not into visiting churches/castles/cathedrals anymore (seen hundreds around Europe alone) but this is a must.

Inside and out this is spectacular. This lovely church is a spectacle of amazing mosiacs and turrets. It was inexpensive to vist and we spent an hour. It was lovely to see it as we walked towards it with the detail becoming more apparent. We also walked past at night and it was equally lovely.

Mosaics wherever you look.. It is absolutely a beautiful building to go and see. Lots of stunning mosaic from floor to ceiling. You can easily check this out in an hour or less as it is relatively small.

Spectacular inside and out. Hard to add much that hasn't,t been said by others.....it is certainly worth the trip. We benefited from a guide who explained the history and the techniques used to create the amazing mosaics.

Very decorative church. This church is very popular touristic sight and amount of people accessing in can be limited creating lines. The church was built at site where Emperor Alexander II was killed. Original piece of the street where Tsar fell is inside of the church. They had to move the river slightly to be able to build the church around the murder place.History of the church is colourful, as it has not functioned much as a church. During Soviet time it has functioned as morgue, stable and warehouse.The church is full of mosaic, it contains more than any other church in the world. It is also bit hard to enjoy the church, when it is full of tourists.

Beautiful Church. If you love Churches and Mosaics you must visit this church. It is absolutely beautiful. We contacted Viator.com to book this tour and we had a private guide take us through. She explained everything from when it was built, how it came to be to what happened to it when there was no religion during the Soviet era. I recommend a tour.

Lovely but not my favourite.
