I expected this to be my favourite sight due to pictures seen before my visit and while it is lovely there are so many other contenders in this City for beauty and magnificence.The Tsar was killed here so a bit of history adds to the visit - getting a good photo is hard as it's got so many buildings around itInside there is a fair bit to see but you don't need to plan out a long time for the visit - a couple of hours is more than enough
Spectacular. That is about all you can say. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have seen to date. Architecture is impressive and makes it hard to leave. Do not miss this site.

Spectacular mosaics a Victorian excess. Again if this is your first visit to Russia then a trip inside this renovated church will not disappoint excess to the highest level wonderful mosaics, gold leave and color to an extreme and everything you would expect and imagine about Russian orthodox church's Don't leave St Petersburg without looking inside this Victorian Masterpiece You will not be disappointed Try to go first thing or last visit in the afternoon to escape too many visitors
Impression. This church is for sure worth to be seen - very impressive - overwhelming architecture - read the saga in advance
Stunning!. Breathtaking church! Beware of the characters in costume out front, they charge you to take a picture with them, not really worth it. The inside of the church is beautiful!

Equal to St Basil's!. I would argue this church is more spectacular and detailed than St Basil's. It was truly beautiful and so detailed. You can simply walk around it from the outside or pay to enter. There are lots of local market stalls at the church location as well (be prepared to barter!)

Visit first thing to avoid crowds. If you see just one main site in St Petersburg, make it this one. Breathtaking. Gaze to the ceiling. Look at the display of mosaic pieces from which the images are made. Each no larger than the top of a match needing tweezers to put it in place.

Stunning!!. Must visit! You haven't been to St Petersburg if you don't visit this beautiful building ;-) Would advise you take a guide so that you can get the history and understand what you are looking at inside.

Brilliant inside and out. We went past twice without going inside and debated whether we should go back to see inside. We decided to go back and we were so glad we did, it is beautiful inside with mosaic work from floor to ceiling, do not miss this site it was so worth it!

Beautifully restored. Just a short walk from the Nevski protect the stunning outside is spectacular, but in no way prepares you for the inside. The entire interior is covered in the most vibrant mosaics. Util you examine them closely you would swear you are looking a painted murals. Just awe-inspiring.

I Could Stare at It for Hours!. The Church on Spilt Blood was one of my favorite spots in St. Petersburg. I visited it every day for nearly a week just so that I could look at it. I paid to go inside on the first day, but I just admired it from the outside every other day. It's unlike anything that I have ever seen. It's unlike anything that exists in the USA. Please don't miss this site. The church was built on the site where Alexander II was mortally wounded in 1881. There are several souvenir vendors along the canal behind the church. I had fun looking through their wares.

Amazing!! Best viewed at dusk for great photos. We visited around 4.30pm and had amazing views outside the church and then self guided tour inside.Beautiful architecture, well maintained, doesn't take long to look around. Tickets are a very reasonable price.This is a must see if you are in st Petersburg

Stunning . Beautiful and more so at night timeInterior is just amazingThis does not require hours as can be seen in an hour or two We visited at 5pm and by 6.30 had walked to Faberge which is very closeTwo attractions in half a day
Breathtaking. Amazing architecture. Beautiful inside and outside. Outdoor markets all around for great shopping - from furs to tshirts
A wonderful church . It is very adviceable to buy the audio guide - it tells you many interesting details about the church (one is enough for a couple)!

Worth seeing!. Beautiful!! See the outside at night all lit up - absolutely breathtaking! For the inside tour (during the day), it's worth getting an audio guide. You can save some money by attaching two sets of earplugs to it. (They use the same earplugs as the city bus tour.) Teasers: Learn why the church got its unique name and why the artwork stays so fresh despite the Russian weather! I really learned a lot here!
Must See!. This cathedral you can't miss! Is just impressive on the outside as in the inside! In my opinion, the inside of this church is the most beautiful that I have ever seen.

Amazing architecture and good location. Beautiful inside out and it was really accessible through metro trains. Outside you will see vendors selling souvenirs and merchadises which is really affordable as well.

Beautiful inside and outside!. One cannot miss out this famous and outstanding establishment in St Petersburg! Centrally located and back to back with Russian Museum. Highly recommend to rent a audio guide which provides good insights about history and art value of the church - and the length of each chapter is perfect - long enough to give you good level of knowledge and short enough to not bore you with too much information!

perfect fotos. perfect fotos for memoryright near from the place i stayed plus the metro is also nearby,you dntt need to catch a taxi jus walk on the nevisly prospect, you will see the main attractions of the city

AMAZING || BEAUTIFUL || MUST SEE. Without a doubt this is a must see for St Petersburg. My visit to this cathedral is actually a highlight for my entire 30 days in Russia. Entry is 250RUB and it is the best money you will spend to see such amazing beauty. You may take photographs without the flash.

Beautiful. Taking a walk through the city Savior on Spilled Blood is very hard not to notice t. To. Its dome visible from afar.Cathedral me how to think, and more, from a distance resembles St. Basil's Cathedral on Red Square in Moscow.On the way to the cathedral along the promenade, you can admire the works of local artists, which they then sell to tourists, listen to local musicians. buy local souvenirs.I recommend visiting this place is mandatory. listen to the tour and just walk - very nice and interesting

Beautiful. We took a tour, it was a short, but interesting enough. Frozen delighted when went inside, stricken splendor. All the walls, ceilings were decorated with relevant images collected from the smallest pieces, long admired this work. Struck by the splendor of the door to the altar, I do not remember exactly, but when the guide called the sum, which has cost the door, eyes wide, it consists entirely of precious stones. On leaving the cathedral, you can buy a good and cheap souvenirs.
Beutifull. Such a beuty... unbelievible art! Must see this church. But dont go there for pray, it is just for tourism.

Amazing experience... I think visiting the Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood was the most beautiful experience of my short time in St Petersburg. The price of entry is really reasonable, and it's worth it. The beauty of inside the building is astonishing and awe inspiring. Its really a building you must visit just for its beauty! And I'm an atheist, so for both Christians and non-Christians this is an experience you must take while here in the city.
Beautiful. Just a spectacular example of design. The light, color, intricacy of the mosaic work. Lovely space inside and out.
Amazing. No need to describe the outside it s just amazing with the canal on the side. For the insiside it was amazing and you re allowed to take picture without flash. Nice memories
Over rated. If you have just visit Moscow, this wont be something you would want to visit, unless you have free time.
Something special. This is something what is worth visiting and it does not matter which nationality you are or which religion you follow.

Artistic Treasure. The Church locate in the heart of St. Petersburg City, the church is a masterpiece. unbelievable design with lovely colors, architecture of the church is very unique and beautiful. Painting inside the church is amazing and reach with the history of Christianity.Many nice bazars around the church which you can get good traditional Russians souvenirs and you can negotiate the price :)This please must be visited .

Stunning beauty with lots of history. This sightseeing attraction is more than just an old church or a museum. This is a memory of Russian history and Russian craftsmanship. This is the biggest mosaic in the world. It's just breathtaking and when you learn about the history you start respecting this little church even more... a must visit if you are in St.P.P.S.: for Russian speakers guided tour is included into the entrance fee.

Umbelievable. What can one add, it's already the #1 attraction in St Petersburg. Fantastic outside appearance from every angle and likewise inside. Many couples have wedding photos taken outside. It looks great in the distance from Moskovsky Avenue, looking down the canal.
Perfect representation of Russian history. The church is in a great location, because it is around other monuments and land marks. Don't get snuggled into paying for overprice souvenires though.
Amazing mosaics. Well worth a visit with very beautiful mosaics and an interesting history. You do not need a guide to enjoy this experience.

Stunning Church/Museum. This Russian church is visible from almost anywhere in the Heritage district of St. Petersburg. While the outside a beautiful example of an onion dome church, the inside is completely covered in gorgeous mosaic work that should not be missed.
Amazing building. Amazing and awesome building from outside and inside too. The most beautiful place in Saint Petersburg.

Wonderful. Spectacular on the outside and certainly trying to compete with it's more famous cousin in Moscow. It's the interior that really wows. Beautiful and the walls entirely made of mosaics. I couldn't even imagine how long that took to do.
AMAZING!. A must see while in St Petersburg. It's just unbelievable that everything you see is mosaic and not paint.... Everywhere you look!

Must see. It's the kind of landmark you hear or see pictures of before going to Petersburg, it's in all the guide books. It's definitely worth checking it out, and it's very easy to access, close to the metro and right off Nevsky street in the centre. It can get quite crowded with all the tourists going there. There are many souvenir shops around.

Worth a visit. A lovely church with many brightly coloured scenes from the bible. Very central just off Nevsky Prospect. There is a small charge to get in.There were several large tour groups there when we went and they do tend to dominate the space, we had to squeeze past several times. You don't really need a guide unless churches are your special thing.
Not to miss of course. Beautiful mosiac, one of the landmarks in the centre, and absolutely stunning at night. We went in December, with the X-mas atmosphere it is pure magic. Not to miss.

Exquisite - a must see!. This cathedral was tops on our list and it was incredible! By far the most beautiful cathedral I have ever had the pleasure of seeing. You could spend hours upon hours here admiring the beauty of this place.

Worth it for the mosaic artwork. The church is spectacular outside, but the interior is even more amazing, with the most intricate mosaics on the walls and ceilings depicting the life of Christ in a colourful, almost comic-strip like way. Fantastic place to visit even if you're not religious - it's worth it just to marvel at the art and architecture.

Beautiful. The official name of the church is the Resurrection on the Blood as it was built on the place of the bomb assassination of the Russian Tsar Alexander II.It is beautifully decorated by mosaics outside as well as inside.Even the iconstand is mosaic. You can easily buy an entrance ticket outside and almost any time stick to a tour group inside to get more interesting information about the interior and its history.Worth seeing.Won't take much time - maximum half an hour even with a tour inside

Amazingly Beautiful!!!. A dream come true! I guess one will utter that when in front of this very unique & so colorful church. A pride of St.Pettersburg, Russia. Seeing it is an affirmation of how great human beings can create & build. Note:Best chance to see it w/o the difficulty of getting a visa is via a cruise on the Baltic Sea & book the excursion via the cruise line or book it online via local tours. It's a rare experience so if given a chance, go & see it for yourself & the memories of it remains a lifetime!^_^

Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood. Very nice to see and learn the history of the church not only dury the period of the Czars but also throughout WWII and the years that followed. Very grand mosaics.

Stunning. You can only imagine how this church looks like in the inside from the outside. To visit inside you purchase a very affordable tiket outside. I love that you are able to take pictures inside unlike other churches in the area (because it's considered a museum). In the surroundings there are kiosks where you can buy gifts of all sorts although I don't recommend hanging outside the church. It gets crowded and there are a lot of crooks playing the old trick of catching your attention while others get their hands in your belongings. Be alert at all times while you are outside and don't carry anything that can be pulled away from you and if you carry a backpack I recommend to use locks so they can't open it. (I recommend this for every trip everywhere because you never know).These crooks don't seem dangerous but getting you camera or other belongings stolen is not fun. Besides that, this is a "must see" construction.
never seen anything like this place. my utmost respect to the artists and restorers of this gem of human culture. You can spend a day listening the guides inside.

A must see cultural heritage gem in St. Petersburg. This museum cathedral looks amazing on the outside, but on the inside you will be mezmerized to see floor, walls and ceiling covered with mosaics depicting orthodox saints. Beautiful pictures and supreme craftmanship was saved for ages from deterioration and war. Brief historical data and pictures are also displayed for visitors, which is insteresting to see as the building was almost destroyed by a bomb during a war.

Cannot be missed!. From the first glimpse you get of it while strolling along Nevsky Prospect this building is absolutely enchanting. It sits photogenically by the Griboedova Canal and defies you to pass by without being captivated. There is a charge to enter but it's well worth paying to see the interior. In addition to the historical significance of the place where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated you will also discover the glories of the most amazing mosaic images of towering biblical figures - all created from tiny squares of coloured tile which cover the walls and ceiling. Photography is allowed and when we visited there was a small display giving some details of the scale of the restoration task undertaken (the interior was only reopened in the late 90s after some 20 years of painstaking work). An essential sight to see.

The most beautiful church I've ever seen. If you go to St Petersburg, this is the one thing you must see.It is definitely worth paying to go inside, the entire place is covered with 1 cm tile, floor to ceiling. Absolutely breath taking.

Whouw... Early morning visit to the most impressive mosaics I visited inside a church. And not only that... Such a beautiful interior + outside place.... Whenever in St.P ... DO take time to visit ! Would advise... Split visit in two: one for the interior and another ( sunset) for outside... Great light for pics.

Something you have to see. This is one of the most beautiful churches in the World. If you are coming to St. Pete for the first time, it might be sensible to take a guide to hear the history of this church... Be prepared for long queues and expensive entrance tickets (I believe it's expensive for the church). Otherwise, you can always enjoy the appearance from outside for free and take a lot of breathtaking pictures. But be aware of huge amount of tourists around the church, so if you want to make really cool pics, go there in the morning during weekdays ;)

absolutely spectacular and not to be missed. This is a must see, the exterior is iconic and exotic but interior!!! jaw droopingly beautiful. Having visited many churches world wide this is the bast interior I have seen, better than anything in Florence or Rome.

Simply amazing. I was only in St. Petersburg for 72 hours but I made the effort to see this amazing and famous monument. Only a short walk from Nevsky Prospect, this beautiful church is worth the extra fee to go inside. One of the most spectacular displays of mosaic art in the world and very picturesque. Give yourself about an hour all up to walk around the outside and inside for photos.
Amazing!. If you want to visit one church with over-the-top decor that is fascinating in its luxuriousness, make it this one.

A must see. This church is even more impressive on the inside as it is iconic on the outside. We visited the day after visiting the Hermitage and thought nothing in St Petersburg could come close to impressing us but the internal mosaic work is incredible. Definitely 2nd on the St Peterburg do list after the Hermitage, if you're not interested in ballet. 250 roubles to enter & well worth it.

7.500 sq.m. of incredible mosaics. The Church was built between 1883 and 1907 on the site where Emperor Alexander II was killed by the grenade bombs of 2 anarchists in March 1881. The imperial family paid for its construction, the style of which isn't baroque or neoclassical like the majority of St.Petersburg buildings. It resembles the 17th c.Yaroslav churches and the famous St.Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. The main architect was Alfred Alexandrovich Parland. 7.500 square meters of mosaic icons cover completely the walls, more than any other church in the whole world. The mosaics depict scenes from the Bible and figures of Saints. The colourful marble floor is amazing too. Unfortunately such a unique treasure was badly damaged and looted by the communists after the Russian Revolution. In 1930 it was closed for services. It was used afterwards as a morgue, a warehouse for vegetables (hence the name The Saviour on Potatoes!!!), or for the Small Opera House, etc. It's a miracle that it avoided complete demolition. It was opened again in 1997, after 27 years of restoration. In 2005 the new Holy Gates were designed by V.J.Nikolsky and S.G.Kochetova after old lithographs. Enamel artist L.Solomnikova. Rhodonite, jasper & serpentine gemstones cover the spot, where Emperor Alexander II was murdered, under a canopy, that symbolizes the holiness of the memorial. . The Church is now a Museum of Mosaics, open to the public daily, except Wednesdays, from 11.00' to 18.00'.
Amazing. Nice walk along canal, have lots of shop around. Structure and decoration are amazing. Better taking picture point is opposite side of canal.

Fantastic mosaics. This was our group's pick of the major churches we visited during our stay in St Petersburg-if you are pressed for time and can only fit in one church, this should be the one. Don't discount some of the others as unworthy of visits, it's just this is so impressive for both its exterior and interior.The domes are striking as you approach the church and the interior mosaics rise from the floor to the top of of the walls ( which are very high) and it's the ceiling.It contains a shrine to the czarist who was murdered on the eighth and final attempt on his life on the nearby waterside pavement and contains. Sections of the raining and cobblestones from the assassination site.There is also a small pictorial display of the restoration of the church following the ravages of Second World War and soviet era damage ( when it was used as a depositary.

I love this most. I have seen so many churches in Europe, many of magnificent architecture. But this is the one I love most. The mosaics are awesome. One interesting point is they call it a museum at the ticket office, not a church.

so beautiful!. The interior of this building leaves you speechless! It is all mosaic, the sun was shinning and the walls and ceiling just glittered! It is smaller than i expected, just one room, but well worth it!

Best architecture I've ever seen. It doesn't look real it's so spectacularly different to anything you could ever see in a 'real' building. Amazing sight to the eyes from outside and in. A wonder of the world in my opinion, must see to understand.
Must see. Next to the Hermitage, this is a must see on any short visit. The intricate mosaics are indescribable.

Easy to get to and good to see no matter the weather. It happened to be cold and rainy when we went here and that did not affect our experience at all. The pictures of the outside were not what we wanted due to the dark sky, but once you get inside it is comfortable and you forget about the weather.You don't need too much time here (an hour at most should do) and we walked easily from our hotel. The inside is covered in beautiful brilliant mosaics and there is an audio guide available that explains the layout if you choose.One thing to note is that there is not a restroom in the church, you need to go outside and use one near the church. It costs 30 Rubles to use the restroom and it was clean and easy to find.
Stunning.. A must see on your visit. Incredible place and the mosaics are unbelievable. Very cheap to go to also.

Great Interal Art Work. The inside of this building is not at all church like (thankfully as I have little or no time for churches) but the mosaics are really worth seeing. The construction of this building is amazing

Visit if there's time. The exterior of this cathedral is similar to the St.Basil cathedral in Moscow to a certain degree but if course, it does not feel as grand. Every inch of it's interior wall is decorated with mosaics depicting Christianity. Very colourful and impressive. Cost 250rubles for an adult.
Beautiful inside and out. It is worth the little entrance fee to of inside the church and see the walls and the ceiling full of paintings. Remember to be respectful and quiet though...

Our guide made the difference. So much history to enjoy made all the better by our small group and well informed guide. We couldn't spend too much time but enjoyed having someone explain all the history. We had luck because the weather was perfect and the crowd not too heavy. If the time permits should not be missed.

A must do. You just have to go here. Very beautiful church, even if you're not religious it has stunning looks with so many colors that it wouldn't dissapoint you. If the sky is blue it's even more perfect and if not: go anyway, just for the picture!
A must, even if only from outside. Unique,memorial rather than a real church.You can get great pictures next to it.Recently opened, so take your chance if you haven't been inside yet.
Beautiful mosaic tile pictures. A definite must see even if from the outside if you are all cathedralled out. Beautiful setting on the canal.

Jewllery.... Unique church...all of it decorated by mosaics. All icons are mosaics...
The church has great history behind-built at the place where one of the Russian kings was killed...
Unique construction and not comparable beauty...

An icon of the city. Both the inside and out are worth seeing. The surrounding area was nearly deserted when I was there as it was raining and very stormy, inside was busier. The history involved is also worth reading up on. Hard to believe it came very close to being dynamited by Stalin before the Great Patriotic War. Don't miss it if you visit St Petersburg.

A'must visit' feature of St Petersburg. The architecture of this church is phenomenal - awesome in fact. The audio guide was very useful and informative. The mosaic work is breathtaking, looking like paintings. Loved it .....
Beautiful building to see. To bad you need to pay a fee to get in but even just watching it from the outside is worth it. A must see when in St. Petersburg.

The highlight of St. Petersburg for me. I have traveled to all 50 U.S. states and dozens of foreign countries and this is one of the most impressive sights which I have ever seen. Nearly every surface is covered with over 17,000 "nearly photo realistic" murals depicting many christian events. It is impossible to describe or comprehend the amount of labor it took over 14 years to accomplish this masterpiece. It is not to be missed when in St. Petersburg.

Beautiful Church!!!. My family really enjoyed our visit to the Church of the Savior on Split Blood. Although it was a bit crowded, it was not as bad as the Hermitage. The site is a perfect place to take an iconic photo of something Russia due to the iconic architecture. This church is a must stop in St. Petersbug. Thirty minutes to an hour is plenty of time to visit. Be sure to add it to your itinerary!
Gorgeous!. Must seen in St. Petersburg! So beautiful! Also an interesting history. I have visited with a private guide. Perfect!
Beautiful. Personally speaking is one of the most beautiful church in the whole world, outside and inside. In the night St. Petersburg is beautiful and this church is nicely illuminated.
Magical Orthodox Church. the most beautiful church in St.Petersburg...inside and out.the view from the Nevsky Prospect is one we enjoyed many times.
Amazing. Simply amazing!!! The typical russian colorful church which is breathtaking!!! If you get a chance go inside because it is as good as on the outside
Really Beautiful. Colourful Church and beautiful place near nevsky street in st. petersburg. There is also a small street market in front of it and you can buy souvenirs from there.
Beautiful Cathedral. This is a lovely Cathedral. A favourite photo opportunity spot for tourists.Has a historical story behind it's construction. And it is centrally located.Very pleasing to the eye.
Must see. The Greek architecture is awesome and the inside of the church is resplendent in gold and historyChurch is built on the site of the assassination of the Czar.

Incredible architecture. I know a lot of Russians do not like this church because it is "too much". However I personally find the mosaic work to be very impressive. The exterior and interior are worth seeing.

Astonishing!. This curch is a real masterpiece. You will surely understand Russian art better after visiting it.
Lots of street musicians nearby, and a garden excellent for taking a walk.

Absolutely Stunning. We had a tour guide, so we learned a great deal about the history of this church while being awed at the incredible mosaics. This is a not to be missed church - a must see while in St. Petersburg.
Quick visit - worth going inside. Amazing church with wonderful interior. Great History surrounding it. Suggest going to the Hermitage in the morning and this Church in the afternoon.
Amazing. Beautiful from the outside, in the inside is amazing, it is all decorated with mosaics... One of the best I ever seen!!!
A phenomenal sight.. A startling building covered in so many tiles and artwork it was difficult to take it all in. An architectural gem.
A spiritual experience. It was a great spiritual experience due to its history which we were amazed to learn, Don't miss this place , especially if you are Christian !
Amazing Site. One of the most beautiful places in the whole world. See it at night if you can. All of St. Petersburg is beautiful at night.
Beautiful church. A one of a kind church in st Petersburg. A must see. Combine this visit with the Hetmitage and Peterhof Palace
Beautiful!. Beautiful inside and outside, this church is a must-visit in Peter. Nice the park in front of it and the market along the canal in front of the back door.

So many mosaics. The interior of this church is just amazing. Fantastic mosaics cover pillars and walls. The floor is also beautiful. The outside walls of the church are just covered in all sorts of pictures.
Magnificent church. One of the most popular landmark in St Petersburg, a must visit while you were in this city. it's next to a small canal/river and need to pay ticket to enter the church
Rather small. Very small church but beautiful the outside is so colourful lovely stained Windows then there is this gold plated door with carving
Beautiful in the night. Go here at night, it is Beautiful light up from the street, a must see! Great location Close to the river and nice bars.

Distinctly Russian architecture, in the tradition of St. Basil's Cathedral on Red Square. This temple stands as an architectural monument distinct from the Western style of Church architecture that overwhelmingly dominates the St. Petersburg skyline.

Must Do. Another iconic landmark you simply need to see. Make sure you pay the 300 Rubels (I think) to get inside, as it is simply stunning. A guided tour would be a good thing to do, I assume if you are interested in the history, otherwise you have to rely on Wikipedia or an Audio Guide

Museum of Mosaic's and History. Incredible building with an incredible history.Reminds me of St Basil's in Moscow but much more interesting.Alexander 3rd started the construction and incorporated the exact spot where Alexander 2nd was murdered.Right next to the Griboedova canal.There is a shrine constructed over the old cobbles where he died inside the church.Beautiful detailed mosaic's adorn the walls and ceiling's along with mosaic icon's in this medieval Russian style building.It really does take your breath away,the absolute beauty of this church.Used to store vegetables after the war.Thank goodness it was restored to it's former glory and this place should be number one on your list if you are visiting St Petes.
Fantastic!!!. Next to the Griboedova Canal, it is a very romantic place, very nice church. It is like a fairy tale.

Fantastic mosaics. The inside of this church is overwhelming. The light increases the beauty of the mosaics. The walls and the ceiling are full of them and you cannot choose the most beautiful one. A must-see
Amazing. Beautiful architecture both on the inside and outside. Definitely not to be missed when in St Petersburg. Take note that it can be extremely crowded especially inside the church.
Visually Beautiful. Join any tour in St Petersburg and you will see this Church, it is beautiful - make sure you don't miss it

crreepy name. The bricks under the canopy are not original, they were brought there just 25 years ago. Our guide from czar tours happened to be an official expert working for historical society of saint-petersburg and she was so kind to show us workshop where they work with smalt and restoring mosaics of this church and st-isaacs cathedral as well as original cubble stones with blood of Czar Alexander.

Like no other!. One of the most beautiful Orthodox Churches I visited during my stay in Russia. The crafted outside is nothing like I have seen before (a lot more beautiful than the overrated St Basil´s Cathedral in Moscow). On the inside it wins with its walls covered in small colourful pieces of glass (all the others I visited had painted walls), although it is not too big and without audio-guide can easily be visited in 15 minutes. With no doubt, at least worth the visit from the outside!

Breathtaking mosaics!. One of our last stops on our first day in St. Petersburg...and it did not disappoint. Our tour guide from Lentina Travel (highly recommended!) brought us through the church and pointed out all the highlights, but I would have just been satisfied standing there in awe for hours, looking at all of the little individual bits of mosaic! How absolutely incredible. It is something that MUST be seen and experienced when in St. Petersburg! (The outside is pretty incredible, too!)

the most beautiful church with incredible history i have ever seen. its just near my hotel , and we always sit at top of the hotel to watch sunlight twinkling on the church. Everything is so beautiful that i dont even wanna leave this city just because of this Church.its really good for visiting .

The most incredible place I have ever visited. This place will blow your mind. I could have spent hours here. The quality of the craftsmanship is unlike anything I have seen before, and the love and hours of artisan work that went into it are evident. The history of the area is moving and the beauty of the church is a hauntingly poignant contrast to the sadness and suffering this country has endured.
Most amazing place. We visited with SPB Tours on a 2 day deluxe tour. .Beautiful Church. Watch for pickpockets though. My favourite place

An absolute must.... I have to say that this is probably the most stunning Church that I have seen. The walls are decorated top to bottom in marvellous mosaic panels with such rich colours. There are also some wonderful mosaic icons. Please don't miss it - it really is a must.
Fairy-Tale. Amazing, just amazing and nothing to add. When I entered I even didnt realize from the beginning that I am surrounded with mosaics.
Beautiful building. From the outside this eye catcher is the most impressive. The inside is a museum but far less impressive. A lot of activity also outside around the church.
Amazing!. When I entered this church I thought that I'm in a fairytale. All walls are covered with mosaics, even outside!
Jawdropping. Obviously a must see in St.Petersburg. Join one of the numerous groups to listen the guide and admire...
Stunning. . Both inside and outside are just stunning. I can only recommend to go inside and look at it. I don't think anyone will be disappointed!

Awesome exterior and interior. The Church is extremely ornate, beautifully decorated outside and in the interior. It is a must see in Saint Petersburg. Forget the fact that it is a church and think of it as a work of art!!!
Whole new meaning of church!. A+ to architecture. You think you've seen churches until you step foot into this one. Mosaic pieces throughout. Immaculate. My favourite by far!

The outside is only bettered by. There are Churches and there are works of Art with peace still the underlay despite the trongs of fellow Tourist. God has all the best houses and that is true no matter which God you choose

Gorgeous. This Cathedral was my sole goal in getting my Visa to come into Russia during a quick layover. It is SO beautiful, and well worth the trip. The sadness of the history only serves to make the visit that much more poignant.

To make an atheist want to believe in God. After visiting this cathedral, I can never be as impressed as I used to be by Notre Dame de Paris. Every inch of the interior is taken up with gold-leafed structures, marble or mosaics of Biblical scenes. AMAZING!
Leisure. It's a little bit look like Moskow "Kreml". Staying near by It you will feel that you are at fairy tale
Beautiful church. I would get their earlier in the morning, less crowed, beautiful pictures can be taken early in the morning.
Stunning. The church is one of the most striking buildings I have ever seen. It is jaw-droppingly beautiful. It is equally impressive inside and well worth a visit

Another must see. Such an amazing building. The history of the church encompasses another dramatic event and history of Russia. The gold and decoration within the building really are over the top. And then, when you hear how the church was used while the Soviet Union was in full power, it's another jaw dropping historical fact. Be sure to visit and take a tour that gives you the history and background of what you are seeing.
Amazing building. Very brightly colored and complex architectural design.Typical Russian Orthodox inside with beautiful decoration and paintings.

Church to Honor Emperior Alexander II. Wow, what a beauty! The church is one of the main sights of St. Petersburg with beautiful exterior. Baroque and Neoclassical architecture prevail in St. Petersburg, but the Savior on Blood resembles medieval Russian architecture. It also resembles the infamous St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.

Dazzling mosaics. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is a riot of colour, shapes and textures…and that’s just the exterior. The interior is crammed with a dazzling array of mosaics but, like so many of St Petersburg’s building eg. St Isaacs cathedral, the Hermitage etc. etc., the sensory overload makes it almost impossible to take it all in. Pause at the shrine at the back of the church that commemorates the exact location where the blood of Alexander II was spilled.
Great!. Very beautiful and interesting church in the center of the city.You should visit it when you are in Saint Petersburg.
Best church. This has been the best church I have ever seen in my life. Full of colorful paintings on all walls. Much better than the similar church in Moscow.
Lovely building. Possibly St Petersburg's most iconic and 'Russian' building. Floor to ceiling murals are awesome. Well worth going in!

Wow! Inside more impressive then the outside!. If you would believe it, seeing this chruch from the outside is great - but the inside overshadows that. Stunning floor to ceiling decorations. Plenty of people inside so be prepared for crowds. I don't see why people fight to take photos though, they always look silly and blurry - I'd recommend just buying a postcard or googling the image later - just stand and enjoy the view!

Our Favorite Church. This is just the most beautiful church we visited in Russia both inside and out. The entire church has had the mosaics restored and it is amazing. Visit during the day but come back at night to see the outside. Don't miss it!
Incredible building. Great example of extravagant Russian church architecture. Be prepared for huge crowd of people but ticket queues were short when we visited, and it was worth it!
The inside is more beautiful than the stunning outside. The church is great on the inside and out. The icon wall and the the mosaics are beautiful. The classic exterior is wonderful.

Over the top festooned mosaic intro - a sight to behold. You might be sick of seeing churches on a trip to Russia but don't miss this one. Floor to ceiling mosaic murals. It's magnificent. 250RUB to get in. Great to photograph later afternoon and evening. It's lit up at night.

Not to miss!. This is one of the must see sights of St. Petersburg. It is definitely worth going inside (for a small fee). Words cannot describe this wonderful church. Probably the highlight of my visit to St. Petersburg.

Church SAvior on Blood. this church is very interesting, near the river, walk around this important building
On the interior of the church you can see excelent pictures and monuments

Unforgettable image. The church is one of the most recognizable landmarks of St. Petersburg. In the Soviet era it was turned into a dirty warehouse full of rats. It is now fully restored into its original beauty. Its interior has a wonderful collection of mosaics (maiolica). The church is a must on your list of exploration of the city.

FANTASTIC!. As you approach, you are enthralled by the sight of the church with the domes rising above it. Simply beautiful. On the interior there doesn't seem to be a square inch that isn't decorated - paintings, murals, gold.... Downside is that it is very crowded inside to the point of almost having to be rude to navigate. But, it's worth it.

Very interesting / pretty "Onion " domed Church.. This is the church built on the spot where Tsar Alexandra was killed by a bomb. Both the outside and inside are painted in the Russian Style and there is a fee to get in. It is shut on a Wednesday

Need to see. Not that old, the church is famous by its design, picturesque, it looks like the another symbol of Orthodox style. Read a story about the details of the killing of Tsar and previous efforts to kill him

Must see Russian orthodox revival style church. The church is stunningly beautiful both outside and inside and an absolute must see for any trip to St. Petersburg. The inside mosaics and marbles are incredible. Although built in the late 1800s it was constructed in the style of the much older Russian Orthodox churches in Moscow.

Interesting for its insight into Monarchism; also next to a souvenir market. Built by the imperial Romanov family as a memorial on the spot of Czar Alexander II's 1881 assassination, surrounding the perimeter of the Church are new (counterrevolutionary) plaques describing political accomplishments of Alexander II, ie "Czars are not so bad after all". Also next to interesting souvenir market along the canal, where one can buy a Putin doll

Get nearer of your savior. Richness and beauty , vax candles and people deep in prayer
Feel it and decide to become a better person yourself.
awesome inside.. The history and artworks were amazing to behold. Need to get there early on weekend to get tickets for entry.
Beautiful!. This church is so beautiful and interesting. You don't want to miss visiting it. Very popular tourist attraction.
Amazing. Most visit in st petersburg! Amazing inside and out! The colors, tha majesty, the architecture, the location, the mosaique, everything!
Not to be missed.. Just one of the many breath-taking buildings. Something that you must see for yourselves. Take your camera.
Mandatory. The church is very beautiful. Only strange thing that its not working on Wednesdays.Also amazing night view from river bank.
Awesome Church. One of the most beautiful churches we saw in Russia. We were astonished with the interior. Worth a visit

Stunning!. This was THE place I wanted to see when coming to St. Petersburg, and I am SO glad I did! Definitely get the audio guide =) The mosaics inside are absolutely incredible. Do not miss this church!

Stunning MUST-VISIT Russian Iconic Church. Visited this church as part of our 2-day guided tour with Marina
Wilson Tours. Our guide was so informative. The church history is captivating. all of the walls of the church are beautifully done in mosaic. A must visit in St. Petersburg.
Breathtaking. I found this church more beautiful than St. Basil's in Moscow. Maybe it's also the surroundings, but it really is worth visiting.

Incredible. The Church of the Savior on Blood took my breath away. This had me thinking "Sistine Chapel, what?" The church is incredible on the outside - and even more so on the interior.This structure is truly a work of art. A must while in Saint Petersburg!
Amazing. You must visit this cathedral! Is amazing!!! :) if you have time visit at night too! But be careful with you pocket! Its what people said to us.

Stunning. You are blown away by the exterior but just wait until you get inside !!!
A must see when in St. Petersburg.

Un real how pretty. Unreal how pretty and special this place is. It blow us away words can not express how blessed we are for visiting
A must see
Amazing. A must to visit. Outside is amazing but the inside is awesome . The Mosiacs are in the most wonderful condition and of course there is the Gold !The story behind it is remarkable .
amazing colorful historical place. Art and colors every wher, amazing and historical, u must use sound guide for English informations about the church
A church worth seeing. The most famous church... lots of history... amazing mosaic... unforgettable tour. Beautiful both outside and inside.

What an amazing building..... With its stunningly decorated and colourful cupolas this church beckons you to come in and see more and when you do step inside you are simply blown away!!The mosaic images on the walls and ceiling are quite beautiful - even if you have no religious inclinations, one can appreciate the skills of the artists who created the interior of this structure.An absolute must-see on any visit to St Petersburg!!
A must see landmark. The mosaics in the church are unrivaled in my experience. You definitely need a guide to appreciate all that it has to offer.
Absolutely stunning interior - breathtaking!. Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is a "must see" for anyone visiting St. Petersburg! The entire interior is covered in mosaics.

A "must see" in st petersburg. A fascinating church ,its beauty is extraordinary ;its colorful n onion shape domes looks like other Russian church but in a supreme level of skillful n artistry and when you entered this church you will surprise ;very beautiful mosaics that petrify you .
Don't miss it

Stunning Church, Splendid and nearly overwhelming. The Church of the Savior on Blood is just a few blocks away from the perspective Nevski.The exterior is already stunning but it is nothing compared to the interior. You have moisaics everywhere in the golden tones describing moments of the life of Christ and the holy family.It is a spiritual experience just to be in the middle of this church. MUST see!
Great view. A very very beautiful church in day time and in night.Has a great view to it from prospect nievsky street.We heard it's beautiful inside but didn't had the time to go in.

7000sqm of mosaic - impressive. The mosaics in the church are amazing - after going inside, I can understand why it took 24 years to build! The building itself is a lot smaller on the inside than expected after seeing the outside. It's still worth checking out though.As you can see in the pictures, the building looks very impressive on a clear, sunny day!

A must see church. Superb orthodox church. As beautiful as it is from outside, the inside is even more awesome. Even the floor is designed perfectly.Pay attention to the ornate decoration on its wall, got to see it to believe. If you want to take picture, the best place is to do it from the opposite of the river.Inside is full of colorful frescoes. It also has a monument to show where the tsar Alexander III was attacked.

Always something different. One of my favourite places in St Petersburg. The beauty and richness of Tsarist Russia is on display and it is not necessary to go inside to be inspired by the building. It is only about 10 minutes walk from the Nevskiy Prospekt Metro Station and not far from the Summer gardens, the Russian Museum and it is easy to walk past the Church and then across the Neva River to the Fortress of St Peter and Paul. I have been here many times, both summer and winter and was here most recently last month.

Inside also unusual. It ir really worth not only to look at this beautiful cathedral, ut visit it inside. Entrance fee 250 RUR (~3.3 euro) Wealth and bright. Unforgettable memories. One of St. Pete's mustsees
A MUST. You must be there. It's one of the most amazing churches that I've ever been. Really stunning. A lot of St. Maria's images.
Amazing cathedral. Very impressive both outside, With its colorful Towers, and inside it was amazing to see the mosaique paintings covering the walls and ceeling.
A must-see. Beautiful church with an inside that matches the amazing exterior. The mosaics on the walls are absolutely gorgeous. A must-see when in Saint Petersburg.

You must see this !. Very historical and amazingly realized by its architect, this cathedral is probably one of the most iconic Saint Petersburg building and is a must see to all travellers. Offers discount for students.
Awesome. This place is awesome as is most of the sights on the 2 day tour we took with TJ tours. In the end we thought we could not take any more WOW's
Church of the Saviour on Blood. What an amazing place, rich interior with murals and mosaics. It looks just like St Basil's in Red Squar Moscow.

St basil Architect style in Saint Peterberg. It same architect style as Saint Basil cathedral in Moscow. But a bit different in some details. Still stunning and beautiful. Many colorful was choose to embed embroided on these onion dome. The ground floor place itself established half way topped on the city canal. you could see one side of church tower protruding into the waterway.Had no time to visit inside the cathedral but still one of the best church architecture design in Russia.

Spectacular Church. This is the greatest things to see in St. Petersburg Russia. Its free and you just walk in. Its going to be crowded but when you go in then you'll see it was all worth it. Its spectacular. Its holy and religious and art is awesome.

Interesting place. This is built on the site where a Czar was blown up ! Bit macabre. But an amazing piece of architecture. Also there's a useful market behind which is a nice place to buy some souvenirs, everything from military hats to the ubiquitous Matrushka dolls.
Lovely place!. Don't forget to obtain the Gold plated coin for 50 rubles for memory. The park nearby is brilliant and view of the River is mesmerizing. Worth visiting.

Worth a visit. The Church of the Savior on Blood has an interesting history and plenty of well appointed details. I would skip the audio guide unless visiting this church was the goal of your life as it drones on endlessly about minute details.

Don't miss this one!. Fabulous mosaics and marble floor. Grab an audio tour for more insight into the art work, specific areas of interest etc. Lovely park at the back of the church. Souvenir market is now at the front of the museum along the canal. I found the quality and costs of the souvenirs here to be quite good, but if you're u are after something special I recommend one of the many souvenir shops. The furs were good price and ok as well.

Magnificent - must see!. My teenage daughter and I visited this Church and although Russia has many beautiful and ornate gilded churches and cathedrals, this was our favorite. It was all mosaic tiles and just breathtaking! When I think of our time in St.Petersburg, visiting here is one of my fondest memories and one you cannot miss! I love the onion domes as well! I'd recommend the audio guide as it allows you to take it all in at your own pace and take pictures too.

Amazing History. As an American I don't have the perspective of royalty. You must give yourself over to the history of Saint Petersburg so that you can understand the significance of this church. Hire a guide. We had Anastasia hired through Soko Hotel. It is stunning to see the exact place where the Czar was murdered. And then there is the Russian Church itself that commands respect and reverence even if you are not religious. If you cannot give yourself over to this my fear is you will miss the true significance of what you are seeing and you will miss the true beauty behind the images.

Breathtaking. Beautiful church built on the assassination site of Alexander II. From the outside, the colored onion domes are beautiful. But the inside is extremely amazing. Beautiful mosaics cover the walls and ceiling. There is also a tomb where Alexander was killed. You can't go near this spot.Price of entry was very reasonable. I believe less than $5 for two people to enter.
one of the few russian thing in SP. structure is totally russian and nice mosaics, and need a guide definetely and provided in the entrance, audio guide can work too

Story of the church is unappealing.. The reason why this church was built makes it an uninteresting attraction. But apparently it's beautiful inside. The statue of Peter the Great (near St Isaac's cathedral & a garden) was better to look.

Amazing architecture. There are many outstanding buildings in St Petersburg but the Church of the Savior on blood is probably the best. It is not to be missed, and you should walk right around the church and view it from all different angles. It's amazing to stand in front of the church and think of the historical events which have taken place in it's grounds.
Beautiful, Astonishing!. I had low expectations of Saint Petersburg but once you walk into this church your blown away by the history behind it. Grab a tour guide you won't regret this.
Definitely worth a visit.. There's no shortage of spectacular churches and cathedrals in St Peterburg, but this one is certainly the most distinctive and colourful, inside and out, so worth a visit.

Absolutely Stunning Church. This is not the most famous church in Russia, but it is the most beautiful and stunning. It is much larger and ornate than St Basil's. It's location on the canal makes for splendid pictures and viewing day and night. Located within feet of Nevsky Prospect. A must See!

FACINATING! UNIQUE!. Unique building in a great location! We came back several times. Not the religious and holy experience like Kiev, but facinating, colourful, Russian, exotic, Chagall-like and dreamy. Even more facinating than the old Basil on the Red Square in Moscow. Definitely the number one in SP along with walking in Dostoyevsky's and Rashkolnikov's footsteps.....

iconic russuan church. when i think of russia this church comers to mind - the church of the spilled blood is both a museum and a work of art. the outside is decorated w. mosaics and the copulas r covered in in bright enamel and the roofs w/ coloured tiles.together they nake a unique collection unequalled any where else in the world it memorializes the death of alexander II who was bombed on this spot i suggest u go inside. the site of the murder is marked by a chapel in the west under the bell. part of the carraigeway and railing covered in blood can be seen here.rather than a central entrance like most cathedrals the church has an entrance and exit door. there s usually a half hour wait so go early, it costs 250 roubles to enter. the cathedral is closed wednesdays.once inside u can buy a wand in many languages. it is always crowded so this guide is helpful the walls r covered in mosaics. typical of orthodox churches the central dome depicts jesus pantocrator. the centre of the iconostasas depicts the eucharist. the walls have mosaics of the old testament and the new. since orthodox churches do not have pews i suggest u find a corner and drink in the religious beauty of the entire church. the wand will guide u thru the myrisd of images. but i found i got overwhelmed and they began to run togerher a good time to drop the wand and enjpy the pics. the cathedral is well worth a visit. i would allow an hour plus waiting time.

Hermitage a disappointment; THIS CHURCH WAS A WONDERFUL SURPRISE.. This church, which survived WW II with not much damage, made our 2 days in Russia worth the disappointments experienced elsewhere in St. Petersburg. It is a colorful extravaganza of mosaics & flowing lines with domes & roofs simply a riot of bright colors -- in stark contrast to the architecture & streets surrounding it. After our really sad experience at the Hermitage, this church gave us a real boost of enthusiasm & a good memory of St. Petersburg.

Dramatic Landmark. We viewed the cathedral several times from the outside during our 2-day tour in St. Petersburg. It is beautiful, and quite gorgeous when lit up at night. There is a bridge nearby, just across from the cathedral,  that affords a great vantage point and is just far enough away to get the whole building in your photos!We also had a tour of the inside. The interior mosaics overwhelm you -it was too much in my opinion. Every column is mosaic, as well as the walls and ceiling. The designs in mosaic are lovely and detailed to be sure, along with the altars and other iconography; but for us, other Christ Pantocrator mosaics were more moving when in a less 'busily decorated' interior (Cefalu Cathedral, for example).There is a small area in the floor in the Church on Spilled Blood, that has a wrought iron fence surrounding it.  Quite an ornate fence mind you- where you see rocks in the ground, said to be the site of the actual spilled blood. Perhaps the most 'real' spot inside. At least the rocks weren't gilded!It was very crowded when we visited; definitely keep watch on your belongings. Of course there is a gift shop inside too; nothing we really wanted, but if you are looking for souvenirs, it seemed to be a better place to look than the kiosks outside. In addition to various religious mementos they had other items, such as matryoshka dolls.We were with a guide who gave us a lot of narrative, so we were inside for quite a while. We really could have seen enough of it in under half an hour. So, even if you are tight on time, it is worth a short visit to see this famous landmark!

Amazing!. Visited here with a small group. What a stunning building! The coloured domes and gold details are so beautiful. So much amazing architecture and colour you don't know where to look first! The interior is equally beautiful with lots of gold ornate decoration and stunning stained glass windows. So much to see. A must visit while in StPetersburg.
A must see. Be sure to go inside. The architectural detail is amazing. It is centrally located and very close to the main shopping area of the city.
Beautiful. Unbelievable workmanship , over the top grand , worth the visit , a jewel in the middle of the city .
exciting. very nice place..beautiful display of art ..architecture ..history all coming together in a exciting location

Amazing Architecture. This was an amazing sight to see with all of the unusual colors and the massive size. This church is filled with mosaics and the history of the church and its renovation is definitely worth the trip.

Pictures do not do this justice. Must see in person.. Not sure why our tour group went the day it was closed, but we were able to see the outside and it was beautiful. You can tour the inside for a small fee, check ahead the hours of operation.
Amazing Architecture !. This is a must see historical landmark for it's amazing architecture and setting within St. Petersburg which in my opinion surpasses the famous Saint Basil's Church in Moscow.
Stunning. The architecture and the inside of the church is breathtaking ! This is an eye opener , and no , you're not in Rome !
Mosaics are fantastic. It's a very interesting church and doesn't have to take too long to visit. What makes it unique is that the pictorial stuff is all done in mosaics.
Awe inspirong. Great architecture. Incredible 1880s mosaics. Easy admission. Photographs allowed. Good to visit in any weather
awesome restauration. Don't miss this - it glitters everywhere. The mosaics look as the ones in St Marks Venice must have looked originally.
Amasing. Speachless - the mosaik is remarkabel well done, - and the place just keep you bounded for a long time, because it is such a fantastic place.

Any time of day. they charge more for this in the evening, not sure why unless that's when they turn on the chandeliers? At any rate, don't miss this church, and get the audio tour for sure! Gorgeous church, friendly staff. Good to visit a little late in the day- take pics of the outside at sunset, plus you can visit all the friendly souvenir street vendors for end-of-day pricing before they close up shop!

Worth a visit but be VIGILENT.. The church itself is exactly what you expect. Loved the sunlight glistening on the golden domes. We visited in a very quite time which allowed us to look through the church, which is one room. Read up about the hosting before you go. Now the BIG issue is what occurs outside the church. If you are approached by a tall man about 25 years old, holding a plastic bag asking you to go to his shop, move away from him immediately. He will show you two calendars and a large Russian doll. He will harras you for about 5 minutes whilst you are walking. He seems very nice and very engaging. Two other men will walk up behind you and open your backpack. They are quick and concise. They will stand very. Lose to you. When you realise that your bag is opened, they will tell you the 'thieves' went down a side street. At this stage they want you to follow the alleged thieves where they will rob you. If you approached at all........walk the other way. Their modus operandi is to steal as much as they can. I realised what had occurred as soon as my bag was opened by the short older man. We did not go down the street as I knew this is what they were trying to do. They hang around the area on the other side of the bridge. As you head towards the hermitage. Unfortunately their are no police around. Though there were three that were following us, there was another male standing nearby. The church is great, do not trust anyone. This tainted our Russia trip.

Stunning mosaics. This church is very unusual because the entire interior is completely made of colorful mosaics. It is worth taking the time to go into and not just doing a pass-by. It is not as large as some other churches but the detail of the mosaics is quite interesting.
Great Looking Cathedral. Amazing colors, the facade is amazing. You have to know that the interior is historical. Most of St. Petersburg is so bland that these colors are amazing.

Cruise to the Baltic - St. Petersburg . Superb building. The mosaics on view are absolutely stunning both inside and on the outside of the building. You have to look closely as there are more than you could imagine just another fantastic attraction of St. Petersburg.
Stunning piece of history. The church is spectacular, inside and out. Russian architecture is so unique and this is a great example.

Beautiful and Impressive. Although it looks like a pale copy of the well known church in Kremlin, I believe it is more delicate. the tiles and colours are beautiful. People try to take pictures but instead I recommend you to look at the beauty and perfection of the tiles and the harmony of colours. It was constructed on the place where Tzar Alexander II was murdered. It is on the bank of one of the canals. If you have time take sit around and spend some relaxing time looking at the beauty of the exterior decoration.

Amazing -- a Must See. Excellent -- amazing, must see inside and out. This was my favorite in St. Petersburg although the others are great too. A lot to see inside too with wall to wall, floor to ceiling murals.
art travel trip. beautiful bulding with the colorful roofs and the architecture, very well located in the centre of the town.
Put it on the list. Loved this cathedral, got there before it opened but it filled up quickly. The icons are beautiful and quite moving. Well worth a couple of hours.
Awesome all over. Take a guide it is much more meaningful. Great time of year not to busy. Amazing restoration inside and out

History and location makes it worth visiting inside.. Interesting history, so I took an audio guide. It tended to be rather long winded, so some fast forward involved but the details behind the building was fascinating.
A must visit in St Petersburg. Excellent and very well maintained from exterior and inside. A must visit in St Petersburg. Its a typical Russian Architecture.
Memorial to assinated Tsar. Beautiful interior covered with mosaic images...really wonderful to see: It is larger inside than anticipated.really lovely park nearby.

Church on Spilled Blood. The Church of the Saviour on Blood is a feast of the eyes from the outside as well as the inside. Outside it looks very similar to St Basil's in Moscow. Inside the entire interior is covered in mosaics in different stories from the bible. It is an amazing display of craftsmanship

№1 must-see in St. Petersburg. I have been to St. Petersburg multiple times, and this church always has and forever will be my favourite piece of architecture in the city and the suburbs. The palaces are great and all, but both the exterior and the interior of the Church on the Blood are absolutely awe-inspiring. The history of this building is very interesting as well, and I just cannot think of a bigger bummer than someone trying to visit on a Wednesday. Make sure the museum is open and go see all of it -- it is well worth your while.

One of the best attractions!. Must visit church! breathtaking exterior and amazing interior! entrance fee 250 rub/ pers and Photography is allowed inside!This church should not be missed while in St petersburg!
Unmissable place in the center of the city. One of the most beautiful cathedral in Saint-Peterburg.It's kind of typical orthodox church. Lot of beautiful pictures to make day and night.
Gorgeous!. Love both the amazing exterior and the richly decorated interior. Simply gorgeous, not to be missed!

Memorial to the last reforming czar. Built as a memorial to Czar Alexander II who was assassinated on this spot. The Czar was unhurt by the original bomb, but insisted on getting out of his armoured carriage to console the injured when a second bomb resulted in mortal injuries. The adjoining canal was narrowed to enable the exact spot where he died to be incorporated in the building, the design of which harks back to the 17th c.the church was never open for public worship - being used only for memorial services - was looted after the revolution, used as a morgue during the war and as a vegetable store afterwards. In the 1970s a complete restoration was begun and the church reopened as a museum in 1997. With over 7500 square metres of mosaics mostly in semi- precious stones and precious marbles there is nothing quite like it. Note particularly the supposed patch of the original road where Alexander II died.

One of my favorite churches in the world!. I count the Savior on the spilled blood church in SPB among the most memorable churches I have seen in my entire life. In addition to the fact that its towers are so... well... russian (un)orthodox and just what you want and hope to see while visiting, the colourful mix of its fassade also give it a sort of happy, creative and modern feel. I was a bit dissapointed by the level of commercial engagement that is hapenning in the inside of the church, but that doesn't make it any less beautiful... A trip tp Saint Pete isn't complete without a visit here, so make sure you don't forget to put it on the top of your "to see" list...

Do Not Miss This Church!. Get your camera ready to click a hundred times. Both the exterior and interior are unbelievably ornate and breathtakingly beautiful. If you go to St. Petersburg don't miss this inspirational place.

See it.. Very beautiful on the inside. It's worth a visit. I think it's very nice on the outside but I didn't think the colors of the domes as stunning as I thought. Interestingly the same material applied to Faberge eggs was used for the colored domes on the outside.
Beautiful Church, a must see inside & out!. A beautiful church on the outside and inside. Breathtaking. A feast for the eyes. The entrance fee is nominal, the memories are forever.

Church from a faity tale. It's such a beautiful and interesting church, you should never miss visiting it in St.Pete. I also recommend to book the audioguide inside, costs 100 rubels and it definitely adds to the experience.
Mosaic Fantasy. Fantastic structure with beautiful mosaics inside and outside. There is no other place like it in the world.
Amazing museum. This Ortodox Church, now turned into a museum, has unique pictures and gold pieces which deserves to be seen if you are in S. Petersburg.

The outside is breathtaking, inside great too but.... I preferred St. Isaac's, internally. Still, this one should not be missed, there's no excuse! The paintings and so on are different, so worth seeing, for sure. The outside with the onion domes, etc. is awesome.
collection of mosaic art. one of the great landmarks of st.petersburg. ticket price is 250 rub, photography is allowed inside. famous of mosaic art illustrating the life of christ. really a must see

Excellent,Charming,Superb. Breath taking,Magnificent,Incredible experience.
Interior of the church were full of colourfull mosaics and it is really breath taking.

A Gem in the Town. Just walking to this place , 10 minutes from Museum of Soviet arcade machines and Shopping place in the main street .
You can find this beautiful Church and go straight from Church you can find the Mikhailovsky Garden , very nice place to visit in autumn .
Recommend for photo spot in here

A must see in St Petersburg. Absolutely fabulous place to visit. Make sure you have your camera. The interior is extraordinary, every square inch is covered in beautiful mosaics. Just get used to the hordes of tourists from China in particular.
Walking treasure discovered. A most impressive building made more so by the history of it's location and the significance of the patch cobblestone footpath inside it.

A must see Cathedral in St. Petersburg.. This by far was the highlight of my Cathedral experience! ALL stone and tile work-no frescos. I'm not an orthodox religious person but this church gave me a great feeling of peace and serenity! Take the audio, self guide.
Worth seeing, but not a great work of architecture. Building is too large for the site. Palls in comparison with St. Basil's in Moscow. Inside quite beautiful.
Beautiful mosaic. Cute colorful church with mosaics. Interesting story about why it is built. A bit expensive ticket for a short tour.

Highlight of the city. Amazingly beautiful place, this church was build on the spot that one of the Russians Tsars was assassinated. Resembles a bit the church on the Red Square in Moscow. If you have time - get in for a tour, but outside view is really what it is about.

A must see in Saint Petersburg. Stunning Church filled with so much history and stories.
Don't miss this. Guides are readily available in different languages. Absolutely worth it.

Stunning Mosaic Works. We're not into churches, and had rated this ok to miss. Fortunately, our guide did not. The historical story of how Alexander II (the greatest Russian reformer since Peter the Great) was shot here - by an organization known as "People's Will", which may or may not have been by financed by Europe - adds another layer to mysterious Russian Imperial history. The Church was erected by Alexander III in honor of his father, with financial contributions from Russian citizens. Architecturally, the Cathedral differs from St. Petersburg's other structures. The city's architecture is predominantly Baroque and Neoclassical, but the Savior on Blood harks back to medieval Russian architecture in the spirit of romantic nationalism. It intentionally resembles the 17th-century Yaroslavl churches and the celebrated St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.The Church contains over 7500 square meters of mosaics—according to its restorers, more than any other structure. Like other churches in Russia, it was used for storage during the Soviet Regime, and renovated afterwards. A must see.

Historic St Petersburg.. This church is a must see if you visit St Petersburg.We came by ship, the P&O Adonia, what a great way to arrive into such a famous city, but the cruise terminal is a good 30 minute coach trip into the city.The church is a perfect example of how you expect Russia to be, the golden onion domes, and fantastic colours, are so typical of the country, and are absolutely exquisite.The church has a fascinating history, and very closely linked to the royal family, it's well worth reading up on the history, so much has taken place here.One thing about this site, it's amazingly busy, thousands flock here everyday, also be very aware of pickpockets and bag snatchers .. It happens very quickly, and they disappear into the crowds.But without doubt, very worth a visit.
Gorgeous. Words cant describe it. Just something you need to experience. For the 500 rubles cost for two this is a no brainer. Gorgeous outside and in
Grate time. Beutiful churchEverything there is made by mosaic And biblical imagesIt is next to rusian musium and teatere
Great place to visit. Lovely mosaic work. Very informative and interesting work done inside the cathedral. Have not seen better mosaic work elsewhere. Views from canal are even better.

Best tourist attraction in St Petersburg. This church was the reason we were thrilled to be going to St Petersburg. Wasn't expecting to be told that during one revolution, it was used for storing potatoes!!.However, times have changed, and tourism has now allowed visitors to explore this masterpiece. There are long lines to get in, so book ahead. It is in a beautiful location on one of the many canals, with nice markets to browse close by. A highlight of our tour.
Breath taking view. Amazing architecture at this church making you to look at it hours. It has such a beautiful paintings on it. I've recommend to everybody to visit it.
Make sure to visit here. I am pretty tired of cathedrals but this one is pretty amazing. The walls are covered with mosaic tile.

Fascinating Story of Historic Significant. Located on the site where Peter was wounded. Restoration after the revolution and WWII are still underway. The mosaic painting in this church are outstanding.

A Feast for the Eyes.. Simply stunning inside and out. So much history comes to life. The assasination of the Emperor Alexander II resulted in the decision to build this church on the spot where he "spilled his blood". Incredible mosaics both inside and out were designed and created by Russian artists of the times. This is not only a feast for the eyes, it is a lasting memorial to the tragic history from this era of Russian history.

Stunning Mosaic interior. Loved this church. I overheard a tour guide telling her group, that over 7000 Meters of mosaic tile was used on the interior of this church. It is stunning and a must see. I have attached a picture of the interior, but a picture can't do it justice. The history is also interesting and it is worth noting that it was never consecrated.

Beautiful Church with and amazing interior. One of the must see activities on a visit to St Petersburg. The interiors walls are covered with what looks like paintings, but upon a closer look are actually tiny mosaics. Our guide, Tanya, gave us a very excellent narrative of the history of the church. I delightful experience.

A Typical Russian Cathedral. We only visited the outside because our trip was short. The building is amazing and should be seen. This church was a short walk from our hotel, and I wish I had taken the time to visit when they were open. The architecture is very characteristic of St. Petersburg, and very beautiful.

Mist stunning mosaic works. It is most beautiful mosaic mural decoration I have ever seen. The colour, the scale, and more importantly the interior lighting enable one to see them in all their glory. Yes, they are quite new compare to San Marco, or those in Ravenna,but it means they are in better conditions, and more vivid. It it only worthwhile, for me it is a must.

more beautiful than Kremlin. Just watch this shiny great building as you walk to it by the canal from the Nevsky Avenue. I suggest spending some time around it just to sit and listen to some of the great street musicians in St. Petersburg as you watch the crowd flow and the incredible church.
A definite 'Wow' factor.. Well worth a short queue to see inside, the inside is (in my opinion) even more stunning than the exterior. Admission is cheap. Unique!

Beautiful church and the inside is amazing. Enjoyed our visit.. Took a tour with a group and this was one of the stops. The inside of the church is beautiful. Lots of history related to the building.The area around the church is very busy and felt we need to be careful as a tourist
Just beautiful. Surely one of the most beautiful churches in the world, in its very unique style. Very impressive colors.
Awesome. This is a really beautiful church which reminds me a bit of a ginger cookie. Though it has a really sad story behind it still amaze everyone around with it's beauty and power.

Beautiful architecture.. This church is one of the newer additions to the many beautiful churches and cathedrals in Saint Petersburg.
On the plus side: Both the inside and outside is very pretty.
On the down side: It was "only" one room so it was rather quickly done with.
See this. One of the many attractions we visited. If you like churches you will like this - beautifully restored and loads of history.

Colorful, special place to visit. What a colorful place to visit! We could not go inside (not open when we were there), but just to walk around this stunning church was an experience in itself, and with all the stalls outside, this was a good experience. (Just sad that all the entries to churches are so expensive!)
My Favorite Church in St. Petersburg. Both the interior and exterior of this church are wonderful. The inside is almost totally covered with mosaics, so don't just see the outside.
Very beautiful outside. This is a must see and it is in the middle of the city so you can not miss it. I have not been inside but outside is spectacular.
Busy. This is a be ry busy place!! There is no need to spend much time here. The history is interesting, but be prepared to elbow your way to see the main attraction.

Words can not describe.... I am so happy that I have had the experience to view such a beautiful church. This was one of the highlights of our trip. Even my teen, who is hard to impress, expressed that of all the churches I have dragged her to all over the world, this was by far the best :)

Walking Into a Postcard. Walking up to this church is awe-inspiring. It is quintessential Russia. The history is so interesting and the inside is beautiful. It is all restored, however. Looking at what the church was after the revolution and the wars, one realizes what they are seeing is all recreated and not original. That said it is lovely.

The highlight of my trip--MUST GO!. This tour far exceeded my expectations. The mosaic work was AMAZING. Anyone who loves architecture must add this trip to their bucket list. I fell in love with the city. I hope I can some day return.
Full of mosaics. All the walls are decorated with mosaics. Better to go there with a guide, or take an audio guide at the reception.

It is more beautiful inside. This was my second times to visit Church of the Savior on Blood, but the first time that the church was under renovation and I was not able to get in when I visited about 5-6 years ago. I was full of imagination when I read it from different literatures. It was a dram to see it in person. The church is the most photographed place in St. Petersburg. Glorious mosaics covered each inch of the interior walls. Many people visit St. Petersburg as the only city in Russia. If you only have time to visit one Russia Orthodox Church, Church of the Savior on Blood is the one that you should see.
Hours well spent. The opulence is mind boggling and the scale equally stunning. The history is well presented and there is no real need for a guide.

Great example of Russian Orthodox architecture and style. This is one of the best spots in St. Petersburg (if you exclude the surrounding towns like Peterhof). It is fairly central to get to (walking from most other tourist spots). Its is great condition and gives a visitor a good example of the style of the Russian Orthodox variant of Christian architecture. For those who know their history, Peter the Great surveyed the different religions (particularly the different versions of Christianity) and adopted the Greek Orthodox visual approach because of the aesthetic appeal.

Free & easy. The outlook of this Cathedral of the Savior look very similar like theSt Basil Cathedral in Moscow !!Both outlook of the Cathedral are fantastic icon for St Peterburg & Moscow ! Photo shooting at sun setting & view during summer or beginning of Autumn can be wonderful too !

Marvelous church, inside and out.. I have visited this marvelous church twice; once in 1992 and again in 2010.
