During the first visit, i was not able to go inside, but during the second visit the inside wall paintings had been restored and the ambiance was just marvelous. Well worth the time and trouble.

Bring your camera!. Stunningly beautiful church in Russian Style built on the exact spot the Tsar was fatally attacked. We rented the audio tour and found it very informative and easy to follow. This church and St. Isaac's are definite "must see" spots.
Church of the Savior or Blood. Church of the Savior on Blood was excellenteLove it St Petersburgo & MoscuLove itLove it & Love it
A church you must definitely see in St. Petersburg. Architecture was marvelous. If you read its story, you will be more amazed. The Church on Spilt Blood was sumptuous.
Great!. Fascinating, beautiful, informative, all supetlatives, see eith a guide if possible to u derstand the history of the Church. The mosaics are amazing. Entire soace is filled eith mosaics.

Golden Temple. When you first see this church you think you've seen it all, how wrong when you go inside you will be astounded, it is breath taking, the entire inside is one golden mosaic, and when I say gold I mean gold, this as got to be the most spectacular church I have seen, and I've seen a few, if in St Petersburg, it a must not miss of a life time.
A must see. Very beautifull!!! A must see when in St.Petersburg. Incredible outside and inside (painted all over),...
Not just another church!. Absolutely beautiful - words cannot describe this gem. Take time to look up and see the fabulous ceiling art too.
Just breathtaking..... A beautiful church and resembles quite a lot with St. Basil cathedral in Moscow. Beautiful coloured domes and nice soviet architecture.

amazing. Looks as good in real life as it does on the photos. we visited on a Wednesday which unfortunately is the one day of the week it closes to the public, so we couldn't see inside. I think it costs about 100 roubles to visit inside.
Gaudy excess. Worth seeing but overpriced entry fee for what it was, considering most of the interior has been restored at enormous cost in recent years so what you see if fairly new.
A delight. Fascinating church and a delightful break from the Baroque overload of other sites in St. Pete! Picturesque and interesting. and, to think it's all mosaic work!

Great. This church was beautiful from the outside, unfortunately we did not have time to go inside the church. We were on a guided tour and only had a 10 minute stop to get out and take photos, it would have been brilliant if we had enough time to go inside.
a must see. splendor, magnificence, glare.Not to be missed. attention to torticollis!The paradise of the mosaic

Exotic and Beautiful. In a European-style city it was exciting to see a more Russian-style church. It's "over-the-top" fantasy architecture and mosaic icons covering every inch of the inside make it memorable. Definitely not to be missed.

Amazing Architecture. A real highlight of our tour in St Petersburg
Not to be missed. The mosaic work carried out is amazingly intricate

Beautiful place. just amazing place, like from fairly tale, we was really surprise by this monument cathedral, inside is place were the blood from Alexander II drop when he was murdered- you must see it and as well the interior
Most impressive Church inside and outside!. This Church building is very impressive to see, at all angles you can take wonderful images. The mosaics inside are beautiful works of art.

FULL OF THEFTS AROUND THE AREA. THE church itself was good

consider seriously going at night OR EVEN GOING TO RUSSIA

Just amazing. Absolutely amazing - if you find the church beautiful (also a litle bit cheesy) from outside, you´ll be impressed by the interior. Meters and meters of unbeliavable mozaics.....the history of this place is very interesting and also you´ll have to admire the work which was done for real "resurrection" of this place. The beautiful historic building in the city center. Wonderful cathedral decorated with mosaics. Lovely view of the building, if you drive up to it by boat
never miss it. I think this is the most significant place to visit in St. petersburg. The interior of the church is astonishing.

curious. Beautiful mosaics inside the Church. The outside of the Church is amazing but too ornate. The history of everything is the great fascination of St Petersburg and one should try and one should try and see and experience it all.

Couldn't get enough of it. The church was very near our hotel and we passed it probably 5 or 6 times a day. I took photos every time, and saw something new every time...and that was just the exterior. The interior is a treasure trove of the next to best mosaic I've every seen.
Simply beautifull. The interior of this church is astonishing and the history of this church is wel worth knowing. Easy to reach. It is a landmark of the city

Remarkable Mosaics.. This glorious church looks very old but was not finished uni 1907 and like so many churches was closed in the 1930's and used as a warehouse. It sustained a lot of damage which has been very skillfully repaired. It is unique in that there is not one painting in it, but there are over 300 mosaics that cover almost all of the walls of the building. The stories told in the mosaics tell both religious and historical history and it is so amazing that there were still craftsmen capable of making and mending the intricate mosaics. It is one of the most colorful buildings in St. Petersburg and well worth seeking out.

Won't forget this church. This is one of the most memorable places in St Petersburg. The mosaics and the detail and of course the history of why the church was built makes it so real. Do not miss this.
Key Attraction amongst Churches. an attraction worth viewing. There is a fee. Fantastic mosaic art. Truly a special experience amongst all the churches on visits.

Most impressive church we saw. We went in on our own and just gawked at all the mosaics, especially the ones on the ceiling. A guide might give some history and details but might also distract from the overall impressiveness. We visited a lot of churches in Russia but this one was our favorite.

Amazingly beautiful structure.. Beautiful colorful structure. It truly is an amazing sight to be there and witness this kind of building. It is the kind of structure that we seldom see in the modern world. Amazingly beautiful.

Beautiful beyond disbelief. Historical cathedral dedicated to Alexander II who was successfully assassinated at the 7th try. It's beautiful inside and outside. All the icons and paintings are made out of mosaics. What a painstakingly constructed cathedral. Truly the #1 cathedral in St. Pete in my opion

Beautiful onion domes. If you missed the Red Square's St Basil Cathedral,do visit this place .. The onion shaped domes are beautiful. Moreover the crowd is not too much. There are good restaurants in the road parallel to the canal which flows by this church. You can get good souvenirs at verg good prices !

Impressive inside and out. Unless you have a good written guide this church needs an in person guide to catch all the unexpected details like the picture of Christ as a child way up in a domed notch.Rich on history and beauty.
Stunning ceilings. Not much else to say to be honest, a truly stunning church! Ceilings are awesome. Always busy but worth struggling through the tours
Another must-see!. Another must-see in St. Petersburg. Beware of the souvenir market outside - very expensive and nothing special. If you insist on buying here, be sure to bargain!
A feast for the eyes.. There is so much to view in one place! Detailed art work and icons throughout! Not an inch of wall or ceiling was missed. The exterior is amazing.
One of the most beautiful churches in the world!. Really beautiful from the outside and inside. Price to the church is 250rub = 3,3€. I recommend to go inside and look around.
Magnificent church!. Beutiful!! Great from the outside and just as impressive from the inside - it is worthwhile to buy a ticket and go inside.

Stunner. This is the nicest church I have ever seen. Inside and out. We went inside at night because they are open till 10pm (might just be for the summer?) There were hardly any people in there and we spent a long time just taking it alk in. My wife said this church could make her convert. Loved it and highly recommend

The symbol of SPB. Very nice from outside and inside!The outside view is very good and the neighborhood is a very nice park which can give you more opportunity to take beautiful pictures and enjoy the scenery. But please make sure to be there after 10.00 and before 18.00.

Amazing Church. This church is really amazing to see. The outside is unbelievable as is the inside, with colorful mosaics of Bible scenes covering all of the walls and ceiling. As someone who has travelled in Europe a lot but was in Russia for the first time, I have seen many nice churches but this was different from all that I have seen in Europe and was well worth the visit! There is a great view from the road leading from Nevsky Prospect along a canal up to the church.
Colourful chuch. This is a must see church. Truly Russian Orthodox. Beautiful architecture with onion shaped coloured domes on the roof. Very opulent inside.

Stunning. We were absolutely blown away both with the inside and outside of this beautiful church. The mosaics are absolutely breathtaking and a sight not to be missed if you are ever in St. Petersburg

A highlight of our visit to Russia.. This church has a stunning exterior and has a picturesque location close to a waterway. The interior is also very attractive with a beautiful altar. I would rate it higher than St. Basil's in Red Square.

Iconic from the outside, it's the worth the time to see the interior.. Stunningly beautiful inside and out. This is a must see while in St. Petersburg, Russia and is usually on all of the tour Companies list. While pickpockets are an issue here, being diligent in your surroundings is a must in any city. Don't let that deter you - You can see the exterior from many vantage points in the city, but you should spend a t least an hour there to see the interior.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world!. This is the epitome of Russian architecture - just magnificent both inside and out. You can't go to St. Petersburg and not see this spectacular sir.
The peaceful aura of the pictures and paintings.. 2nd day in Russia, beautiful pictures all over and very peaceful. Many tourists so sometimes difficult to get the pictures you wanted.

A must view in St. Petersburg. This magnificient church was built where Tsar Alexander II (?) was assasinated. Grand church with exquisite murals. Amazing place to visit. Right off the Nevsky Prospekt.

One of the world's great churches. The history of this church is fascinating and one of the essential item to visit when in St Petersburg. Strongly suggest you attend with a knowledgable guide to get the full history and happenings there.It is wonderful to see this magnificent church having been brought back to life after the soviet era
Breathtaking interior. Dont miss this when in St Petersburg. Go early or late to avoid crowds. Schedule enough time to enjoy the incredible interior composed of mosaic tiles on almost all surfaces.

A must see in St Petersburg. This church is amazing both inside and outside. Unlike the rest of St Petersburg which is predominantly Baroque and Neoclassical architecture, the Savior on Blood harks back to medieval Russian architecture in the spirit of romantic nationalism style. It has very distinctive and interesting onion shaped domes which are decorated in beautiful colorful mosaics. Inside it is even more richly decorated with intricately detailed mosaics and gold everywhere. It houses the tombs of both Peter the Great and Catherine and is the most opulently decorated church I have ever seen. It was very crowded as most sights in St Petersburg are in the summer tourist season but large enough to be able to move around.

Typicall russian church. You have to visit this church. This is typical russian church in perfect condition, today it is museum only, not used for the worship, so it is little bit touristic... but you can enjoy it during the night - it is not announced in most of guides, but it is open till 22:00 (but you pay more for the visit between 18-22)
A Must See Location. The architecture is incredible. I hired a guide for this one and I was glad I did. So much history in one small place and I was able to get some great photos.

Astonished. This is absolutely astonishing. You enter and your breath is taken away. The whole building is decorated with gold-based mosaics. It is something that cannot be described. It's a must to see!
Unique place. A great place to go when in SP. The interior is crazy beautiful with lots of mosaics and shiny gold figures. Worth a short visit as isn't too big

If you like detailed Mosaics you must visit!. The mosaics were outstanding. There were so many exquisite examples throughout that it was difficult to take them all in at once. The colors and images are so vibrant and clear. There were many other people in the church so moving around was difficult at times. Photos were permitted.

Iconic Russian Church. This Russian Orthodox church epitomizes the essence of Russian style. The colorful and ornate onion domes dominate the skyline and are breathtaking. Inside, be prepared to be "wowed". Beautiful place, although it has a sad history.
A must see. An amazing hotel that is a must see. It is stunning inside but very very crowded. You can take some amazing photos. Get a guide so that you do not miss out on the history.

Stunning. It's difficult to choose which attractions to visit in such a beautiful city when time is limited. We were not disappointed by this stunning building and it's history. The interior is just as breath taking as the exterior.

The shrine of Alexander the second.. Absolutely stunning place to visit , the detail and Beauty of all the mosaic work is amazing. There are gift shops inside the church , where you can purchase keepsakes.

Wow - great from the outside even better inside. Visited on a drab Friday afternoon. As we turned the corner and saw the 'church' for the first time - it is definitely a wow. No queue to get in but crowded inside. Renovations in the 80's have been successfully made and paintings gold is stunning. Another amazing place in SP..

Colourful. Richly decorated inside and out. The inside of the church is entirely filled with mosaics from top to bottom. It is not a very large church but a very intricate one.
Entry fee during day is less than evening time.
The area behind the church has lots of souvenir shops, musicians, sketch artists and restaurants.
Magnificent!. I can only endorse all others who rave about this incredibly beautiful edifice. The mosaics are stunning. Although built as a church, it is now a museum.
Wonderful. Very beautiful church, both outside and inside (is totally covered by mosaics). I definitely recommend it.

The best church to see in SP. Of all the beautiful churches in SP, this one is by far the best to visit, from the traditional colored onion domes, to the exquisite artwork adorning the exterior. When visiting SP, this must be on your list of places to go.
Awesome!. A must place to visit! It was pouring rain and we visited this place, but it was all worth it, everyone enjoyed it nonetheless.

St. Petersburg, Russia. This is the church you see on all the travel ads about St. Petersburg. It is truly an amazing sight. Inside, what looks like paintings are actually mosaics. A must see when travelling through St. Petersburg and I recommend using SPB Tours while touring in Russia.
Fantastic (but overcrowded)!. This is a unique church is size and beauty. The paintings and decorations are unbelievable! Expect a very large crowd!

ICE Cream Church. Its so magnificent and such amazing architecture. I couldn't stop looking at this piece. It is as close to watching Taj Mahal. You just want to admire it for hours. There is a park behind the Church and its wonderful to sit there and play with this monument in the sight.My suggestion is to come in the evening. The color background of this iconic place with the evening hues makes it just too beautiful combination. .

A Mosiac wonder. At first sight from down the canal the whimsical onion shaped tours draw you in. Once entered however the true 'Awe' moments begin. This mosiac wonder deserves your time to view as the detail of the crafstmanship is truly amazing and inspiring. Apparently it took 25 years to build and 27 to restore.

No 1 must see. This must be the no 1 "attraction" in St. P & therefore a MUST SEE Its strange that a place of worship could be allowed to charge an entrance fee, I only paid RUB250, but once inside I was so impressed with it all that I was pleased I had allowed over an hour for my time here.
Stunning, Amazing, beautiful....... This would have to be the most beautiful church I have ever seen and a real highlight of our trip. The beauty inside was jaw dropping. A definite must see.
Postcard building in SPB. IMO coolest looking building in SPB. Famous postcard picture w/ famous russian onion domes. Must see!
Must visit while in SP. Beautiful church, if you are around have to visit, it can be very crowded but really it is worth it. Get your cameras or smartphones with enough space to save,

Architecturally dazzling but made Hermitage crowds seem SMALL.... I gave this church 3 stars only because--architecturally--it is SO quintessentially Russian Orthodox that it fairly screams "Russia!" However, It was bumper to bumper tourists and totally devoid of any church-like feel. 20 minutes in and out was sufficient. Frankly disappointing.
colorfull church. The mozaics at the inside were just as marvelous as the outside. The renovations made the church a highlight of orthodox Russian churches.again.
must see. if you visit St. Petersburg, you must see this church. It is anyway very close to Nevsky Street. It is a sign of Russia. But the same church exists in Moscow as well.
Dazzling cupolas. This church is the epitome of Russian churches.. The cupolas are brilliant and,considering it was al

A Must See in St Petersburg. It does'nt matter if you are a believer or non believer, you wiil be blown away by this church. The sheer scale is fantastic, and considering the sad history behind the church you are sure to some away with a smile on your face.
Go, and say a little prayer for me.

Absolutely worth the money. While slightly more expensive than some of the other churches, this church is incredible.
If the outside is impressive, the internal mosaics are incredible for their artistry.
Definitely add this to your to-do list. Only a couple of minutes walk from metro " Nevskiy Prospekt ".

Stunning church well worth the visit. It's hard to miss this church as you walk or drive around. My favorite was seeing it early in the morning with no one around. It's beautiful steeples and design are very unique, even in St. Petersburg. Entry can get busy so get your tickets early. Inside is equally interesting. Beautiful mosaics of biblical stories adorn the inside. Should be a must on your visit.

Superb mosaics in this extraordinary museum. There are not enough superlatives to describe this church now museum. As with a lot of buildings , it had extensive damage and gas been restored and is ongoing in restoration process. The mosaics are incredible. At first glance they are like paintings. Altar doors have only recently been installed and are amazing. An incredible historic museum as beautiful from outside with wonderful cupolas, as it is inside. It is known as Church of the Spilled Blood and was built on the site where (I think. Not sure) Peter The Great was killed.

Worth the trip. This was the last thing we saw in SPB on a 2 day trip. As it is SPB is overwhelming and after two days we were overloaded with awe. But once inside the Church on Spilled Blood all our fatigue wore off. It was amazing. The outside is attractive and worth every photo we took but the inside was breathtaking. One of those DO NOT MISS items on a trip to SPB.
Stunning. Stunning church, probably one of the most recognisable in the world. The mosaic domes are amazing and such lovely colours

A beautiful church. Stunning mosaics, vibrant colours decorate all the walls. The ornate campy covers the place where the Tsar was assassinated, the "spilled blood" of the name of the church. Stunning exterior from all aspects.

Most amazing place. La Mezquita in Cordoba and the Hagia Sofia in Istanbul have always been my two most favourite buildings, but now I have a very close third, This church with its amazing architecture outside, boasts the most extraordinary interior which is composed entirely of mosaic panels and decoration. The crowds were not too bad, and the experience of being inside a truly memorable building like this is not one to be missed.
Iconic St.Petersburg Church out of this world.. How can you miss this attraction when in St. Petersburg? It's as beautiful inside as outside.The superb mosaic walls is simply breathtaking.
So beautiful both inside and out.. Well worth the struggle through throngs of people. This church is ornate and engaging from outside - then inside the mosaic work is truly magnificent.

Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. A must see on your visit to St. Petersburg. I went with a guide who purchased the tickets and got us in ahead of the waiting crowd. I suggest you do the same. Long lines and very crowded, inside and out.
Awesome piece of architecture. It is some piece of architecture while we did not go inside you must do it, lots of markets around there.
Church of the savior of blood. Stunning church - English audio guide available to explain the history, well worth a visit! I went late in the day when most of the coach loads of tourists had gone!

The magnificent Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is one of St. Petersburg's most memorable landmarks.. The beautiful Russian church was build on the spot where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. The section of the street on which the assassination took place is enclosed within the walls of the church and the site of the murder is marked by a chapel in the building. Both the interior and exterior of the church is decorated with incredibly detailed mosaic. The majority of the mosaics depict biblical scenes and saints though some are just patterns. The colorful onion domes, of which the central one reaches a height of 81 meters (266 ft), to reflect the year 1881 of the assassination are covered with bright enamels. The magnificent Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is one of St. Petersburg's most memorable landmarks.

Amazing. Wow just absolutely amazing from the outside. The church sits right on a canal and you can walk down one side of the canal and across the other side and get some absolutely amazing pictures. The day we visited was a Wednesday and unfortunately it's closed Wednesday's. Can't quite believe they were closed when there were 3 cruise ships docked so we didn't have the opportunity to see inside. Not overly impressed so I have to be satisfied with just seeing the outside.
Highlight of St Petersburg. Visiting this amazing church was the highlight of our tour of St Petersburg with Alla Tours. It has to be seen to be believed both inside and out.

Like a castle. This church is like a castle. We love outdoors so we did not go in. From which ever angle, this church is as beautiful as a castle. If you go to Saint Petersburg, you must see this church. At least pass by it because it is so beautiful.

Must see and no line if you use the kiosk on your left instead of the ticket window!. This is a place NOT TO MISS!Don't stand in line to purchase a ticket at the window...look to your left and you will find 2 kiosks. No wait and you get your ticket. (no we don't speak or read Russian).Inside is breathtaking. You will think the walls are painted but no...it is ALL time mosaic work. You will not be disappointed!
Amazing from the outside Amazing inside. The outside was only the start.So ornate but the inside with all the images done in mosaics.Could not image how long it took.

Superb. What a beautiful Church Breathtaking from the outside but even more so from the inside. Be prepared to be one of a few thousand people visiting but well worth the visit. We did this as part of a two day visit from our cruise. A Must to visit.

it's second amazing cathedral after isaac's cathedral. in my opinion it's second amazing cathedral after isaac's cathedral after visiting this place you have option to go to nearby park or singer library .

Beautiful Church both inside and out.. Beautiful and amazing Church, Make sure you visit the inside, too. The Church sits right on one of the canals and you can take a boat tour of the canals and the river right down the block from the church.

A must visit. One of Saint Petersburg's landmarks. Full of tourists and long queue to enter the cathedral. Much bigger than St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. Uniquely Russian. Covered with mosaics and porcelain. A sight not to be missed.
WOW. The mosaics in the church are breathtaking. The interior is surprisingly small, but EVERY inch is covered with intricate mosaics.
Beautiful!. Beautifully decorated monument. Very colorful, especially in the sunshine. We visited the church with an excellent guide.

Spectacular. Built on the spot where Czar Alexander I was assassinated in 1881 and completed in 1907, it's modeled after St. Basil’s in Moscow and has possibly the most mosaics of any church. So it's breathtaking inside and out. Opposite the altar is a shrine on the exact place of Alexander's death. During World War II, this church was used as a temporary morgue, and as a warehouse for vegetables. Even though it is crowded, it's a feast for the eyes.
Amazing. Amazing to get a good perspective of a fully decked out and royal Russian Orthodox Church. Now a museum, the church has amazing history and interesting points to discover.
History, Art and Architecture. Richly decorated inside and out. Fantastic architecture and art. A must see while visiting St. Petersburg.
A must See.. This is the site where Alexander 111 was killed and he iis buried inside, but it is magnificent inside, and really worth a visit.
Beautiful inside and out. From outside this is stunning and you is an iconic piece of the skyline. It is also lovely inside although as noted can get busy.
Do not miss this. This must not be missed absolutely stunning. Words can not describe the beauty inside and outside. The history is even more amazing.

Pictures do not do justice to this traditional beautiful Russian church: a must see. Built on the site where Alexander II was murdered by anarchists, this church is truly remarkable and should be on the must see list of anyone visiting St. Petersburg. Space restraints to not permit a more thorough review, and pictures do not do justice to this remarkable building.
Nice. Very impressive place to stay most amazingly maintained. Entrance fee is a bit steep. Excluding the cost of the media device 250 rubles entrance and another 100 rubles device.

Impressive, Interesting and unique church. This church is beautiful inside and out. The inside of the church is entirely filled with mosaics from top to bottom. It is not a very large church but a very intricate one. You can stand inside and marvel for a good 20 minutes. Tickets to see the tourist sites are cheap - this one was about $4 but we saw this with a tour group. There are rows of stands of souvenirs outside which seem like it would be fun to peruse and the area around the church is lively with street musicians as well.

Amazing architecture!. You have to go inside! Although it's smaller than St. Isaac's Cathedral (same price), it's more compact and more decorated! You'll also see lots of people with funny poses when they try to capture pictures of its interior.
Very nice place. Very nice place, striking architecture Russian, We could see it from the outside only because at that time closed to the public
most beautiful church. Most beautiful architecture and art work. Photography inside is allowed. It can be crowded and be aware of pickpockets.
More history. A beautiful church with a rich history. You will not have a problem finding the cathedral. It cab be seen from almost any place in St Petersburg
As amazing inside as out!. The mosaics that cover the walls inside this church are incredible. Every inch of space is covered. It is a short visit to go inside but one you will remember forever.

reflections of the sun on the mosaics. the exterior is already breathtaking, especially cause it's so unique with its russian revival style in the city. the interior is so special with the mosaics that cover EVERYTHING.
I like to note that the reflections of the sun on the mosaics create a remarkable atmosphere in the room.
colour blast. the external view was amazing - the colours stand out from the surroundings and, even if you don't go in, it is worth a trip for this alone.

Stunning historical site. Unless one has experienced St. Petersburg before, it's hard to explain the level of opulence you see at many of the places you visit. This church was built over the spot where Alexander II was attacked. Allow at least an hour to fully appreciate its beauty.
Superbly beautiful details. Extraordinary detail inside and out at a historic church. More beautiful and more interesting than St. Basil's in Moscow.

Amazing domes. So grand ..interiors as well as the exteriors..advising people who read this not to waste time taking pictures just watch observe and admire lastly get a few..
The mosaic work in the interior walls... The iconostasis...just amazing..s visit to SP not complete without this visit

A must-visit place in St.Petersburg. This church is one of the key highlights of Petersburg. On the outiside, it is styled similar to the St.Basil cathedral in Moscow. But the exteriors and interiors of this Church are much more intircate and colorful.

A riot of clolour. This was completed in 1883, to commemorate the place where Czar Alexander II was killed by a bomb. The actual cobblestones on which he died, along with his blood have been incorporated into the church and there is a canopy over it, the to mark the spot. It is now a museum of mosaics and they are everywhere. Every surface is covered in them, apart from the marble floor. It is a riot of colour with scenes from the Bible and Biblical characters. There is much gold all around. It's too much to take in. It is very busy with tourists and you are told to be aware of pickpockets, however it is a place that you have to visit.
Spectacular. Spectacular. This is one of the most iconic churches/museums in the world. The beauty of the outside is matched by the amazing mosaics inside. It is simply stunning

Beautiful Church. This Church is beautiful - and when we visited it - there was a service going on so we kept quiet and watched and saw what was happening. The problem was that 2 coach loads of Chinese all arrived and started talking and taking pictures throughout which was not a good thing to do !!! Pity as they ruined the visit !
Picture Worthy. Beautiful structure. Better than the red square in Moscow. The canal is bustling, although a tad touristy. Must see at night as well.
Important historical site. this church is a must-see, both inside and out, both for the history and the work on the walls and the floors.
Iconic. This iconic cathedral is a must see, even if just from the outside. Stroll through the interior and absorb the history, great fun.

A wonderful bit of history. One of the highlights on this trip to St Petersburg was going in the Church on the Spilled Blood. We had seen it from the outside on our last trip but really enjoyed going in and learning the history
Satisfaction for the eye.. It is simply beautiful and the way the russians restore things back to their original grandeour, you dont have to imagne what it was like, you experience it. Enjoy!
icons icons icons. Amazing interior full of icons from bottom to top. worth a visit it should be planned as 30 min to one hour.

GLAMOUR AND HISTORY. Amazing church where the flamboyant architecture and colour, both inside and out, can overpower the significance of this building in the history of Russia. Seems to be always crowded in the tourist season due to limited space inside but well worth the wait. Other tourist attractions around the nearby canal are and added extra

Unique architecture and stunning mosaics. Totally unique style of architecture. The church stood for seventy totally abandoned and neglected. freedom came to Russia and churches opened up again. The government began the restoration process. The mosaics inside the church were never damaged and are bright and shiny as when it was built about one hundred fifty years ago. When looking at them you don't realize that are mosaics but frescoes, they are breath taking!
Very interesting. Amazing church inside and out , visited as part of a cruise ship tour , very interesting and informative
Loved the onion domes..... Very colorful church, busy area with locals selling post cards etc. Love the onion domes. Did not go in. Watch out for pick pocketers!
Marvellous historic church. This church is one of the many highlights of a visit to the city. Is is full of history well worth having a guide to accompany you.
Interesting exterior and interior.. This amazing church is well worth a visit. There was a small queue at 10.00am: the interior is as interesting as the exterior.
Beautiful!. Amazing. A must see during the day and the evening. Worth paying to visit the inside. Definitely a top 5 site to see.

Most memorable site of all travels. Even after one year, we look back on our Princess Cruise covering the Baltics, Berlin and St. Petersburg as a most memorable trip ever. And the Church of the Savior on Blood was the most favorite visit of all. The beautiful exterior and interiors are remarkable works of art. The incredible mosaics from floor to ceiling are magnificent.

A true spectacle in St. Petersburg!. Must see, and go inside!
The outside is a marvel of wild Russian orthodoxy and the inside is one incredible gold mosaic masterpiece.

Stunning Russian church better than St Basil. Wow quite a site. So much going on in the design. Just so elaborate and better than the legendary St Basil near Red Square in Moscow. Tough to get a complete pic from the main aspect but best view is from canal. Impressive and historical interior inside. One of the most important visits in St Petersburg.
Magnificent architecture . This is a must see icon of St. Petersburg. Breath taking art and architecture. Built on the spot of Tsar's assassination in the early 18 century
Spectacular building. Beautiful church with so much history. One of the most unusual buildings in St Petersburg. Don't miss this attraction!!
Quick tour.. Was closed but good to see from outside as iconic view. . History behind the church and use during the war all interesting.
Classic Russian Photo of your vacation!. This is the picture you will look at someday and say, "Whoa, I was in Russia!" It's what we think of when we think Russian.
perfect lighting…. an early sunset illuminated the entire structure in way never imagined. i have captured the most amazing images. wow

Beautiful baroque and neo-classical style church. Beautiful church that has been tastefully restored since the break-up of the Soviet empire. The outside is more colourful than the interior but it is still a must to see if visiting St Pettersburg

A Must See in St. Petersburg. This is a MUST in St. Petersburg....the church was amazing! It's just hard to imagine all the time and effort taken to build such a beautiful church.....and the past history is incredible. Please make sure you see this church while in St. Petersburg!
Best Cathedral in St. Petersburg. Best of all the cathedrals in St. Petersburg. If you can only visit one, this is it! Justice can't be done to the mosaics in a photo. MUst see to believe!

Must see the beautiful detailed of over 7500 mosaics. The church contains over 7500 mosaics, beautiful architecture and it got the name of " Savior on Spilled Blood" because it was there were the Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881.The church was built from 1883 till 1907. If you are in St. Petersburg you must visit the church.
Stunning. A must to visit. Loved the colours and the onion domes. Inside the mosaic work is beautiful too. Beautiful to photograph from a canal bridge about 50m away.
Spilt Blood church - tickets. Buy tickets ( 250 roubles) at ticket machine ( in English and Russian) but buy tickets individually, as I tried for two paid 500 roubles and only got one ticket!
Church of the Savior on Blood. A place not to miss! it gets a little crowded at pick ours. Tickets are about $4. Photos are allowed inside. Avoid buying souvenirs located nearby.

Beautiful Church.. I visited on a rainy grey day but church is still magnificent from the outside. Traffic is so congested during the height of the tourist season it is difficult to get a decent photo. Very early or later visit is recommended. Unfortunately I was unable to get inside but the exterior is spectacular.

Stunning!. A most beautiful church, an absolute must on any visit to St Petersburg!
Even just the outside is awesome, but the mosaic within are worth every part of the 250 rouble entry fee!!

Art of the city. In the middle of the city, easy to go and can see from almost everywhere.
Nice art in architecture.
Also have some cheap souvenir around.
Not open everyday, have to check time first.
sight seeing in st Petersburg. a must visit place! architecture and history gives the authentic experience. take camera and take lots of pictures.
Must-vist. It was a beautiful church. A must-visit for a taste of a traditional Russian church with beautiful paintings and mosaics inside.

Absolutely Awesome!. This church is the epitome of the opulence of the Russian nobility. Built on the site where Alexander II and his family were assassinated by the Bolsheviks, this is a church not to be missed. The inside is covered with beautiful mosaics, and the outside is stunning.

Most unique Church in St Petersburg . The church is small but so beautiful in all angles: from outside you can appreciate the onion shape Towers as well as the cúpulas made out of colored glass. Is so well restored. Inside you can appreciate the site where Alexander II was killed by a bomb, reason why his son built the whole church later on. The "paintings" inside are actually made with small ceramics that made them more resistant to temperature changes and humidity. It is a small church but view inside is beautiful and from outside even better. At night take a picture from Nevsky Prospect at day an another one at night, it is beautifully illuminated.

Quick trip through an interesting Church!. Church built on the site where Czar Alexander II was assasinated supposedly because he was trying to give more rights to the commoners is a must visit if one is in St.Petersburg. It is a crowded tourist attraction but takes only about half an hour for a decent visit. An interesting aspect - the cobbled street where the Czar was murdedred is preserved inside the church in it's original form, thus the name "Church of Savior on Blood".
A must see when in St. Petersburg. Absolutely amazing, both outside an inside! Don't miss to visit it. There is an ATM and some souvenir shops inside.

Small but perfectly formed. I love cathedrals , it's hard to get your head around how these things are constructed and decorated. And this cathedral was all done in mosaics . Absolutely stunning. The skill involved as amazing. Truly beautiful. Don't miss it.

Beautiful monument. Church of the Saviour on Blood or the Church of the Spilled Blood is a unique monument and worth seeing. It resembles the Basel Monument the multi coloured unique building located in Moscow .

Picture postcard. Its a bit cramped inside and throbbing with tourists but once you get yourself in the right head space its worth taking the audio tour to learn why this magical church was built and how it survived until today.

Highlight of our St. Petersburg Visit - Breathtaking!. On any trip to Europe it is easy to "OD" on churches, palaces, etc. Forget all of that and do not miss this Church. We've been to a LOT of churches and this is one of the top 5 we've every seen. Absolutely outstanding. The outside of the Church is beautiful but is nothing compared to the fabulous mosaic work on the interior. It is almost too much to absorb. Try to just stand and take it in - from floor to ceiling. I talked to someone after our trip who had been to St. Petersburg and this was NOT included in their tour - I think that it is simply criminal to not have seen this spectacular place. This was our favorite thing on the entire tour of St. Pete.

A beautiful piece of Russian architecture, tucked away off Nevsky Prospekt.. Very beautiful and colourful building set alongside the canal and some lovely gardens. Tucked away just off Nevsky Prospekt, a great place to relax and admire the architecture with a coffee.
Much more colorful and interesting than most Western European churches. If you are accustomed to visiting Western European churches you will be surprised by teh brightness and beautiful colors here.
Breath-taking!. This takes your breath away. Beautifully coloured domes top tall spires that glisten in the sun fab.

A must for all to see !. Great architecture and well worth taking time to wander around and wonder at the beauty and history of this amazing church.Not on the scale of the Hermitage but still one of the places to put on your must visit list when in town !
Simply beautiful. As so much is in St Petersburg, this is a must see.Sadly some of the priceless artefacts are missing following differing conflicts, however, beautiful nonetheless

visual delight. This is a truly beautiful church which is now a museum and no longer used for services. It is incredibly beautiful with every inch covered paintings and gold relief. Well worth taking time to enter to see it. Take note of the canopy on the right once inside as this marks the spot Tsar Alexander was assassinated. The outside of the church has colourful domes that can be seen from various points in Saint Petersburg, not as colourful as Saint Basils in Red Square but pretty none the less. No visit to Saint Petersburg would be complete without viewing this beautiful landmark.
Do Not Miss this One!. The most gorgeous & colorful building in St.Petersburg! The architecture was just incredible & style was so beautifully Russian Orthodox

Stunning and special church. Amazing, we entered the square from the park, and it was a very nice approach. The building is stunning, a little smaller than it appears in the pictures, but that doesnt matter. We went inside and even if the place was crowded with tourists it was easy to see the amazing mosaics and alter. They have a little display on the work performed from the 1970s to restore the building, simple and interesting.

Yes, you really have to go here. It's worth it.. Yes, there's hype, yes, there are long lines and tacky souvenirs . . . and yes, this is one of the greatest memorials to man's love of the eternal that I've ever seen (and I've been to Florence) . . . with a distinctly Russian twist. Worth seeing with a guide, or after reading /researching because the details are extraordinary. 4 weeks, later, I am still overwhelmed that a place like this could be conceived, much less constructed (and preserved during the Communist regime). .Thank you to all who have made this Church available for everyone to visit.

This Church is huge and Beautiful! Incredible Mosaic Paintings!. The church is huge with many outstanding paintings and murals. One huge stained glass of the Savior is outstanding! Take you time and explore all the interior. Beautiful!
Must see. This should be visited at all cost. If one is photography buff this is good place for it. One should also see it in night time also

My #1 Church...Anywhere!. Have traveled all over ...the Med...Europe...Asia...US...& this is by far the #1 on my favorite list of churches...& we have seen many grand structures. Inside & out...this church is astounding!I was hoping we would be able to view the onion shaped turrets. The colors are spectacular.
Stunning. The internal decoration in this cathedral, all made from tiny mosaic pieces is breathtaking. We could have spent hours in there taking in the beauty of the work.
A Must see. So amazing to see all the details on the outside. Reviewing inside just remarkable and quite majestic
Amazingly Beautiful. Beautiful. We were on a tour and our guide gave us important information. The outside is one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen.
STUNNING!. An absolutely beautiful building. If you like photography, you will love this cathedral. Both inside and out it is beautiful.
A must see in St Petersburg.. Fabulous on the outside, absolutely stunning interior. Unbelievably, it was used as a vegetable store during the early soviet era.
Another wonderful place in St Petersburg. This is an absolutely beautiful building. It is very colourful and it reminded me of the movie Dr. Shiv ago.

One of the most amazing works of art, inside and out. This church will leave you speechless. The artistry, history, richness, is overwhelming and you will feel like in sensory overload. Highly recommended!

The Sistene Chapel of Russia. DO. NOT. MISS. INSIDE. I almost did bcz my guidebook pictured only the exterior.
I don't care for churches but this is majestic, inspiring, and humbling. If you enter only 1 church - make it this one. Makes the Sistene Chapel pale in comparison.

Amazing to see in person. The architecture is amazing, it is that typical picture you see of Russia. There were wedding parties taking photos in front of it, an amazing backdrop. We stopped to take pictures by the river on the backside, but it was still amazing. The gold really shines in the sun, a must see!!
looks good from the out side. Beautiful mosaics,not very big inside,got very busy.I did not think it was value for money.only spent 15 minutes there.

Beautiful; a must see. Opulence at its best. The first time we turned the corner and saw it we gasped. Truly amazing building. Just round the corner from our hotel meant we could pass by it a number of times at different times of the day. Internally there is so much to look at. Make sure you allow time to just stand and look. Not a huge place but every inch painted with images and icons. Must see

Absolutely mindblowing - both inside and out!. No trip to St. Petersburg would be complete without a visit to the Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood. It is an absolute visual feast and if you're blown away by the exterior, the interior is to be seen to be believed. It's name incidentally is derived from the site on which it is built, the place where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated.. Built with monies provided by the imperial family it's quite different to many of St.Petersburg's baroque style buildings. The cathedral's unique appearance is rather medieval in style, adorned with colourful onion domes and visible from points all over the city. The complete interior is a work of art, mosaics totalling 7500 square metres adorning the walls, ceilings & floors, and designed and constructed by the most famous artists and craftspeople of the day. No longer used for services, today it is a museum. We went as part of a full-day guided tour so the cost was absorbed but I believe tickets are available from 250 roubles. It is very crowded, and pickpockets are a problem so take care to protect your valuables.It really is a magnificent structure, very beautiful and quite breathtaking! A must-see part of anyone's itinerary if you're visiting this amazing city.

Church of the Savior on Blood, Russia. The Savior on Blood Church is a sight in St Petersburg, Russia which cannot be missed. I recommend that you change some Russian currency when you visit this area or else you will be unable to buy any food or drinks. If you change 20 Euros into Russian Rubles this will give you more or less a total of 1400 Rubles (which is about £14.00), you will then have enough money to have some delicious Russian pasties which are sold directly opposite this Church on a food wagon and also buy some drinks or souvenirs if you wish.Although in the street markets you will be able to buy souvenirs and pay in Dollars or Euros.
Magnificent Cathedral. Quite breathtaking. If you are very lucky you may catch the singing of the seminarians. Male voice at its most moving
impressive. impressive decoration inside but like many churches in russia it is all a bit exagerated. outside looks like a pie. many many visitors all the time. but worth a visit

Magic, from inside ánd outside!. The characteristic look of this church draws many and rightfully so. It's stunning in the sunlight of sunny St. Petersburg. But the inside is magnificent as well, the walls are completely (!) covered in mosaics and the altar is hidden behind a baroque door. You can't miss this one.

Wooow! Sucg a charming cathedral. "Woow!" is the right word for this cathedral. Although i am not religious at all, inside cathedral is so different and well worth a visit. We decided to visit here although we have limited period in St Petersburg. Such a beautiful building with colory iconas in it.
A different church. A different church. Very colorful domes and reminded me of Gaudi in Barcelona. Very interesting history involved with this church
Stunning Church on Spilled Blood. Do not miss. Amazing mosaics. Another wonderful St petersburgh experience. Beautifully restored. Breathtaking.

Church of the Spilled Blood. Absolutely breathtaking. There is so much history here but it must be done with a tour guide. We had a very knowledgeable guide who made the visit that much more interesting.
beautiful building, but closes on tuesdays!. It's like a fairy tale. Couldn't get in because it closes on tuesdays, but still, it's a beautiful building on the outside.

Nikon Telephoto Lens Stolen near entrance. Upon arrival, we walked straight to the Church of Spilled Blood and not far from the entrance started to photograph. My husband wore a camera waist pack with a Nikon Telephoto lens inside. The two horizontal zippers were closed. He had the camera with a zoom lens cross slung over his shoulder with a Pac Safe camera strap. This is why we still have the camera but not the telephoto lens. It happened really fast while he was photographing he felt someone bump him hard and saw it was a guy in a leather jacket. I was busy taking photos with my i phone and did not notice. He did not think much about it and went on photographing. I finished shooting the angle I wanted and turned to follow him when I saw his waist back pack had been unzipped, both zippers, and was empty. He did not even feel it. I guess we were such an easy hit the guy who had hit him followed us on a ten minute walk to somewhere else. He was wearing a leather jacket on a very warm day so my husband remembered him. We turned on him to confront him and he disappeared. Watch out if you are bumped. It is a set up. I do not think they work alone, So, the church is wonderful inside and out they just need more police protecting the tourists. We did not see any present.
Crazy Russian opulence!. This plce says everything you need to know about the over indulgence of the Russian church but at the same time it is incredible!
Church of the saviour on spilled blood. Fantastic, like St Basil's in Moscow, exterior not quite as nice, but the cupolas are, the interior is fantastic, one of the churches you can take photos in

Stunning interior and exterior. Quick visit worthy. The inside murals are all crafted from mosaic. It's beautiful and incredibly complex. Awesome to look at for a short while. There's not much to see there apart from that. I didn't stay for long.
Awesome architectural building. Awesome architecture and one of the most iconic and pictured images of St. Petersburg, Russia. Best time to visit is in the early morning before the crowds gather.

The Essence of Russia - Beautiful Architecture w Historical Significance. An example of beautiful use of cupolas which you expect and want to see in Russia. This Church was built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was fatally wounded in March 1881.The church was built from 1883 till 1907.
Well worth a look. Pretty with a beautiful mosaic interior. One of my favourite churches we have visited in Russia to date. There's also street food and a small market outside which is nice.

Beautiful Inside and Out. This church is one of the main reasons i wanted to visit Saint Petersburg. I always thought it looked so colourful.The church has a very interesting story. It was built on the site that tsar Alexander III was wounded in an assassination attempt and later died. He was going along the canal in his carriage and a anti-royal family anarchist threw a bomb under his carriage. He was unhurt. When he got out to confront the man, another bomb was thrown at him and he was severely wounded. The church was funded by private donors (the different areas these donors were from in Russia are represented in the tiles on the exterior of the church) and the state. The church is also spectacular from the interior. It is decorated elaborately with colourful, intricate mosaics. The entrance fee is approximately 300 rubles. It is definitely worth going into to revel in its splendour.

A must see in St Petersburg. Before visiting Russia, this was the style of building we were hoping to see and we were not disappointed! Absolutely stunning architecture and craftsmanship both inside and out.

Beautiful Building. Visited the church as part of an organised tour which allowed photo opportunities too. Beautiful architecture and colours, but as with most Russian sites be careful about scammers dressed up wanting photos with you, who will then charge a fortune!

Stunning - add it to your bucket list!. The visual splendour of this church is worth 5 stars, but the traffic and crowds led to a 4-star rating. It is such a beautiful example of Russian architecture that you really must make the trip to see it - however beware pickpockets, nutters and general difficulties as you make your way around St Petersburg.

A Russian Masterpiece. This Church is right on the Canal, and is stunning inside and outside.It was built on the site that Emperor Alexander II was mortally wounded. The Altar was built right on the bloody tiles where he died. There are red carnations inside that mark the spot.The multi-colored Onion Domes outside are icons, and the 308 Mosaics inside are truly extraordinary. You just need to stand still for a few moments, and admire and marvel at the interior. Every square inch is filled with paintings, mosaics, relics, gold leaf statues, precious and semi=precious stone carvings, etc.Very overwhelming and breathtaking.Obviously a "Must Visit" place.

Beautiful and fairytale like :). Once you turn right from Nevsky prospekt metro station exit, you see this beautiful street with the river Neva seeping through the middle and leading up to the end of it...the beautiful church on spilled blood. In my opinion it is the most beautiful street in St.Petersburg. The church has the onion dome style of St.Basil's cathedral in Moscow. It is so very beautiful to look at. I never got tired of looking at it. I also had the opportunity of going inside. It is definitely worth it. Absolutely wonderful. My suggestion: visit StPetersburg.... Absolutely, most definitely visit church on spilled blood.

Exquisite. This church is beautiful on the outside and unlike many other churches we have visited and were a little disappointed with the interiors, this is exquisite on the inside. As you step inside the door your jaw will drop at the sight of the amazing mosaics, In beautiful bright oolours. You spend so much time looking up you don't even notice the gorgeous marble floors. There is a lot of information in photographic form on the restoration of the church which highlights the wonderful job they did. This is suitable for all ages and tickets cost 250R with a reduction for students with an international student card. Well worth the money. Go and visit , you will not be disappointed.
A Fairy tale building. The outside glowing in the sun , the story behind the church and the glimpses from the setting on the canal. Magical!!
A must see--Inside Too. This church is every bit as good AND MORE than it looks in a photo. The inside is also very ornate and should be seen.
Breathtaking. You must visit when in St Petersburg. Get a private tourguide and take your time. You can just sit and look at the mosaic's for hours. try and got when not so busy

Gorgeous and stereotypically Russian. When thinking of Russian architecture, onion-domed churches come to mind for me. This church is one of those prime examples, like St. Basil's in Moscow. Not as old as one might expect, this church is build on the site of Czar Nicholas' assassination. The outside of the building is incredible form any angle, and you'll leave with dozens of incredible photos on a nice day. The inside is gorgeous as well, with amazing mosaics and paintings from floor to domed ceiling. Now a museum and not an operational church, there isa fee to enter.As many other reviews have mentioned and signs inside the building indicate, pickpockets work the area, so keep your valuables under your control at all times. We didn't experience any issues.

A must-see sight in St. Petersburg. This should be on your list of places to visit. The mosaic walls and paintings, and the magnitude of the restoration work that has been done is breathtaking. One of us found it very spiritual as well, similar to the Sagrada Famiglia in Barcelona, but even without that dimension it is well worth seeing.

Something you just HAVE to see!. This is a Must See. It's beautiful both inside and out. With so much to see in St Petersburg, its hard to choose a favorite but this was a favorite for me. The outside with the onion tops and its colors were amazing. Then you go inside and Wow, simply jaw dropping from floor to ceiling. Don't miss it!

The most beautiful church in the world!. If you are amazed just by looking the outside of this church you don't know what is waiting for you inside. In my opinion, this is the most beautiful church I've seen. Even if there lines, bear with me and please go inside, you are not going to regret. The colours, the art, the gold, everything is breathtaking.

Stunning outside and inside. It became our landmark for finding our way around St Petersburg. Its' beautiful domes stand out brilliantly among the low lying buildings of the city. Inside every patch of wall is filled with incredible murals. The 30 minute self guide tour was excellent. We preferred the name Church of Spilled Blood, the more dramatic name suits the dramatic nature of the building.

Amazing sight - iconic church. We visited this wonderful, beautiful church whilst on a coach tour round the sights of St Petersburg.. It is far more beautiful than it appears on photos. The fresco on the front of the church is wonderful. There is a lovely street market in front of the church where we were able to purchase really nice Russian stacking dolls at a very reasonable price (€20 for three with six dolls in each).

An Icon. What is there to say? This place is an icon. You can't possibly visit St. Petersburg without seeing The Cathedral of the Savior Upon Spilled Blood. The view from the canal ride is really gorgeous with really interesting photo angles from beneath the building.It is such an amazing piece of architecture that every time we'd pass through the city, I'd find myself searching for another glimpse.

Church on Spilt Blood. Beautiful church , very different from many of the churches that I have seen. The 'onion domes ' of this church were the first that I had seen.Apparently this church is built on the site that Alexander II was fatally wounded during an assassination attempt.The church looked similar to the St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. The architecture was very different from the other churches in the city - we were told it was more Medieval . There were a very large number of mosaics within the church- all very beautiful.Of course a must visit.

Beware the pickpockets..... The church is worth 5 starsThe Pickpocket 1 starAverage = 3I've never understood why certain governments tolerate this petty but costly crime. Everyone knows there are plenty of pickpockets around St. Petersburg and especially at this Church yet nothing gets done about it.I can't say I enjoy visiting sites when I'm worried about my wallet / passport / etc. There are many more places in the world to visit / hang out / meet the locals that are more enjoyable when you don't have to worry about getting robbed.
Open until 10 pm. This church is spectacular and I was so surprised it was open until 10 pm so not crowded at all. Take the boat tour of the city to get better photos of it.
Wonderfull. The most beautiful attraction of the city! This church is the symbol of Saint Petersburg and is must visit place! Many tourists visit this church every day, now I know the reason!

Beautiful. This is a very beautiful church with classic Russian looks but not that old. It was built in the late 19th century. The exterior the classic gold leaf and enamel domes while the interior has many beautiful and colorful mosaics like St Marks in Venice. No pews in Orthodox church so plan on standing. The church can be very crowded so watch your belongings.

Good place to visit in St. Petersburg. Got to spend about an hour in this church/museum. Loved the architecture and learning about the history of the church. It was crowded, though, so one had to be mindful of pick-pockets but it all turned out ok. I was part of the SPB tour group going here so the tickets and the guide came with us inside - which was a blessing as there was a lot of things to see inside. It really helped to have a guide point out relevant things to me and the rest of our group.

Amazing interior. Now a museum, entrance for a fee, fantastic interior with mosaic paintings or icons from ground to the top, unique and glittering, with a story involving a death (hence on Blood). Just 5-6 minutes on foot from Nevski prospect, one of the must see in St. Petersburg.

Church of the Savior on Blood. Built on the site where Alexander, Tsar of Russia, was assasinated. The church is very well done and reflects the popularity of the slain Tsar who was killed on the 8th attempt on his life.
Church of the Spilled Blood. Beautiful and intricate mosaics. Stunning architecture. If you're a fan of religious ikons and history it's well worth the visit

Great architecture. Beautiful structure and you can gaze at it for long. Situated in a nice part of town close to the metro station you can get there easily. It is closed one day a week and so best is to look it up before you decide to go there.

Amazing!. One of my favorite places in St. Peresburg!
An amazing art of work of venetian mosaic.
After it you could have a great time having lunch around or visiting Mikhailovsky Theater for great ballet classics!

Amazing and a must see!. Do not miss this and definitely go inside. My one thought was that the English audio (cost extra) was good, but too wordy and should have been edited for length. Be aware of the crowds, but don't be put off as there is so much to see you can just stand and let the crowds walk by. Amazing and a must see.

A celebration of the life and death of a Tsar. Another day, another mind boggling experience to what is also known as The Church on the Spilled Blood. There are no paintings of drawings inside this church just 10,000 sq m of mosaics depicting numerous religious icons. Built to celebrate the sacrifice and subsequent death of Emperor Alexander II and inside is the exact location, enshrined, where the assassination took place, Wee worth a visit.
so incredibly beautiful. outside and inside it is a real beauty, all walls from top to bottom are mosaics, soooooo beautiful!!!!!

Incredible Architecture in the old style. For some reason, I expected all of St. Petersburg to look like this...didn't do my research! The exterior is gorgeous...the design...The colors! Can't comment on the interior add the line was so long that wet couldn't get in. This is a favorite stop on the bus tours and very crowded, so olden appropriately.

One of a kind experience. Although I have visited many churches in Europe, this was a one of a kind experience. The interior was really amazing. The mosaics were very impressive. The overall building was equally impressive and set in a nice location by a canal. I will remember the visit for a long time and feel it is a must-see when you are in St. Petersburg.

visit even if you dont want to go in. this was my favourite visit in a host of other very beautiful sights in St Petersburg and even if you dont have the time or inclination to visit inside then give yourself the experience of a walk around the outside it is definately worth the while

Another onion domed interesting sight in St Petersburgh. While the outside is interesting, inside the cathedral it is grand. Wonderful paintings and mosaic. Alongside a canal it is located in a very interesting area of St Petersburgh
Very artistic. Very artistic church with a different style. 3 million pieces of mosaics. A must visit church. It's history of why being built is interesting. The views around are also good.

Don't Forget to Look Down!. An awesome sight and history attached to it. Viewed towards the end of the day we were able to see the full beauty of this church, including the fantastic floors.Well worth a visit!

Clasic russian church architeture. A very beautiful church with amazing architecture both on the outside and inside. Less than a minute walk from Nevsky Avenue. Worth visiting as most of St. Petersburg at day at night.
Fascinating. My favourite church after S.Isaac church in St.Petersburg. Amazing interior, colourful paintings and fantastic mosaics.

Staggering Size with Incredible Mosaics. Our Russian tour guide said this was more accurately known as the "Church of the Spilled Blood" to Russians. The size is staggering by itself, but the mosaics covering almost every surface, including the ceiling, are difficult to fully comprehend. The tiny size of individual mosaic pieces covering hundreds of thousands of square feet of surface seem impossible. The history of why the church was built in this location makes an interesting story. Pictures are allowed inside the church but alone they can not convey the sheer size and scope of the church. Don't miss this one.

Never mind the magnificence feel the crowds!. A magnificent building 'destroyed' by crowds of noisy sight-seers who seemed interested only in the number of photographs that they could take with a family member standing in front of the camera. The magnificence of the place would be far better appreciated if those responsible strictly limited the numbers who could go in at any one time.

Fascinating Back Story. Amazing church with all the coloured domes. A great back story of how it got it's name and interesting details about the different layouts of Western churches and Russian orthodox. How it was extended 8.5 metres over the canal and the story of it's restoration since the end of the soviet era is amazing and the change from an almost derelict condition when used as a warehouse. Entry price is great value and an audio guide also recommended.

BEST CHURCH EVER. Amazing interior, completely worth the entrance fee! The best interior and ceiling church I have ever seen. Fantastic mosaic art on all the walls, perfectly balanced colours, borders, patterns etc. Religious or not, this is a must see in St Petes! If you do visit, please be quiet and respectful.
Mind numbing beauty which can be appreciated whether you are religious or not. Definitely the best church in Russia for me. You are allowed to take photos and the artwork is simply stunning.
Savior of Blood Church. Quite beautiful the way it has been decorated on the outside, quite plain inside - the opposite to other European churches - worth seeing.

Prime photo spot. Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood (spelled several different ways) is one of the city’s prime attraction. If you haven't been to Moscow, this is your opportunity to see Onion Domes up close. Built at the location where Tsar Alexander II, a reformist, was assassinated, this church by the canal is a huge tourist attraction.
Beautiful church. Lovely Eastern Orthodox Church covered from floor to ceiling in religious mosaics. The spot where Alexander II was mortally wounded is marked with a canopy over the floor.

I sure am glad that Alexander III was more conservative than his father!. Absolutely stunning. MUST-SEE! I cannot emphasize enough how worthwhile this is. The mosaics are stunning and it's very different to any other churches I have ever been to. Meaning of my title: Alexander II died in a bomb attack on the exact spot where the church was built and his son, Alexander III, chose an Orthodox church to be there. It was inspired by the one in Moscow, and I'm sure many people are glad that it was!!!

Stunning building!!. This is absolutely spectacular - the detailing on the outside is beautiful you just have to stand back and take it all in. It is a very busy area, our guide made a great job of showing us around!
Exquisite!. Do not miss this. We have seen cathedrals all over the world and this is one of the most memorable. Stunning. Every inch of every wall is a mosaic
Inside and Out. The outside is a picture postcard, but don't miss the interior. Entirely covered in mosaics, it's one beautiful scene upon another.
A site to remember. This is one amazing church with so much artwork. It gets very crowded and you do have to watch for pickpockets here - as in most places in St Petersburg.

Breathtaking. If you are visiting the city, it's a must see and do take a tour guide. The story of the church is heartbreaking and the restorations that have been completed to date are beyond belief. Thank you to all the amazing people who spent decades brings this cathedral back to life. I cry every time when I visit. Our tour guide was phenomenal.
Visit to the Church. Totally worth visiting.Crowds were not too bad. Excellent photos can be taken from behind the church on the canal.

You Won't Forget the Name or the Mosaics. Amazing church! Thousands and thousands of tiny detailed mosaics decorate both the inside and outside of the church. We went with Lentina Tour Company and was able to skip the lines.
Intriguing Cathedral. Definitely worth a visit - but everyone else seems to thing so too. It's pretty busy in there, but our guide managed to show us round efficiently

Stunning colors & detail inside and out!. Another "must see" on a trip to St. Petersburg. This is what you feel Russian architecture is all about. The colors, the detail...both inside and out... are just stunning. You don't have to spend a lot of time there but you do have to see it.

Very interesting and colourful church. We were in town on a cruise ship for two days and toured this establishment with Alla Tours. It is a very interesting church and you must visit it with a guide, to be able to explain things to you. It was very busy as well.

Jaw Dropping Religious Artwork Inside. Super fabulous and ornate inside! Seems like every inch is covered with religious art. Murals tell the story of Jesus in chronological order. Lots of color and gold themed details. TIPS:1. There's a magnificent altar - which is a great picture opportunity.2. The domes are awe-inspiring. Be sure look at the very top of each dome. You'll see Jesus's illuminated face looking down at you.
Amazing architecture!. One of the most beautiful buildings I have seen. The design and colors are brilliant and a must see! Even the iron fence beside is beautiful.
don't miss this!. Besides its historical significance, this gorgeous church is beautiful within and without. make sure you take time to visit this, and you will not be disappointed.
beautiful - do not miss. make sure you visit this cathedral. The mosaic works are the best I've seen. Splendid works of art. Must visit

Just incredible!!. It's very very crowded (in August) but absolutely worth a visit. The outside is just stunning but the inside is even better - you cannot come to terms with the number of mosaics as every wall is plastered with small ceramic tiles. We were warned about pick pockets so be careful but don;t let this put you off.

Impressive inside and out. I wasn't sure whether a visit to the inside was really "necessary" and the lines were long ... but we had some time to spare and queued and I am happy we did it. the mosacis on the inside are so impressive I would not have wanted to miss this.

Amazing . Even if you are not into religious sites this is a must see . We were there for opening time and already a big crowd had gathered to get in but there was not much of a wait. Inside is breathtaking you find yourself walking around with your head tilted up looking at the ceiling . Amazing mosaics , two small gift shops inside but lots of market stalls outside the church. Well worth a look .
Can you believe they used to store potatoes inside during the Soviet era!. This church is amazing...much prettier than the one in Moscow. Inside the walls are covered in mosaic scenes. Truly amazing!

How to Know that you are in Russia:-). We were all around this church for the days that we were in St. Petersburg and finally we stopped to see the exterior and then a walking tour inside as well. I love the "onion" towers on this church and the history behind it. It was one of the best sites in St. Petersburg:-)

Stunning . Another stunning example of Russia's "go big or go home" approach to, well, everything. I got there about a half an hour before closing, which meant that the crowds really started to thin out, leaving more physical (and psychic) space to just marvel at it all. (The mosaics are beautiful). I thought the audio tour was worth the $1.50 (but it was my first hour in Russia, so my emath/exchange rate abilities could be waaay off). Gorgeous--you *have* to go!
Unique place.. Very impressive place in a great neighbourhood.The mosaics in the church are fascinating and make the place very special.

A unique church in St. Petersburg. Church of the Savior on Blood is a cathedral of incredible beauty. She is the only cathedral with a russian classic structure from St Petersburg. It was built on the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander II, which thrills more. I recommend visiting them and inside and outside, and outside is good to come in several times of the day.

Wonderful building well worth the wait. As one of the top tourist attractions in St Petersburg queues can be very long but it's well worth the wait to see this amazing church. The outside is stunning and there are some fabulous areas inside that are just breathtakingly beautiful such as one of the altar decorations shown here. The photo doesn't quite capture how stunning it is

Exterior a 5, interior a 4. This is a beautiful church, but most impressive on the outside. The inside is more beautiful than the churches we saw in the Kremlin in Moscow, but you just can't take enough pictures from the outside. Every view is different. Every change in lighting brings out some other facet that you want to capture.

Wonderful Mosaics in a Beautiful Structure. Amazing mosaics inside. There were some large tour groups going through and this can be intimidating. Don't let it keep you from going in. It is truly amazing!

Architectural Echos of St Vassily the Blessed. The Savior on Blood Church AKA 'Church of the Spilled Blood' takes its origin from the assassination of Tsar Alexander II in 1881 on the spot where the Church is today. When I took in this cathedral I was probably suffering from ABC fatigue ("Another Bloody Church!"), but the exterior is stupendous & reminds one a little of the famous Pokrovskiy Cathedral in Moskva's Red Square with its striped, multi-coloured domes & towers (but a scaled down version). The 16-17th century style building contrasts sharply with the Baroque, classical & more modern surrounding buildings of the area. Some expressive mosaics in the church's interior. Plethora of souvenir stalls at rear of church alongside the canal.

Must visit inside. This church has beautiful outside as well as beautiful inside and interesting history. It may be good to hire a guide head phone to understand the history and displays. It was closed wednesday.

Church of the Savior on spilled Blood. Fabulous! ...not to be missed...Interior all in beautiful mosaics, built on the site of Alexander the Second's assassination.Nice souvenir stands outdoors in back.
A must see. Spectacular sight inside & out, the artistry was a joy to behold, the history was also very interesting

So many names, same great Church. This impressive church goes by a variety of names -- Church of the Savior on Blood, Church of the Spilled Blood (because this is the place Alexander II was murdered), Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ, and many other combinations. But whichever name you use, it is a beautiful place to visit. Admire the architecture with the colorful domes, the nice setting on the canal, and the grand interior. A few hints: Go first thing in the morning or in the evening to avoid the huge crowds. Join a live tour or rent the audio guide to learn about the history and content. Outside the church, there are many trashy tourist vendors, beggars, street entertainers, etc on the crowded sidewalk -- Watch for pick pockets!

Must see!. I really recommend the audiotour if your are not visiting with a guide. You really get to understand the renovation and reparation that has been done and see the details in a different perspective.

What a stunning place. We'd seen pictures of the church in advance but they don't do justice to the colours and beauty of this church. Just be warned that it can get very very busy. And our daughter was quite bored. Once she'd seen the inside for a couple of minutes we did find it hard to keep her entertained. Not the venue's fault - we should have come more prepared with something to keep her occupied.

Magnificent. I imagine that this is what many people who visit Russia will expect to see. Every conceivable surface is either glistening with gold, covered with colourful mosaics or glinting with sunlight through stained glass windows. It's quite a specatacl both inside and out.
Unique and beautiful. This is a beautiful, unique church. We've never seen another one like it. I recommend you visit with a guide to explain all the special things about it.

a truly amazing work of architecture and art. Church of the Savior on Blood was absolutely incredible! The outside architecture is classic Russian and is a sight to see. The inside blew me away. The floor to ceiling mosaics are so beautiful. I can't imagine the man hours it took. It is an absolute must do if you visit St. Petersburg.
Amazing church. This is te most beautify church ever. Easy to find from everywhere. Its free. You can visit until 8pm. Also, can climb to the top/
