Amazing! . Don't miss it! Take the audio guíde to get fully acquainted with the history of this beautiful church

A must see landmark in St. Petersburg. Very busy destination and for good reason, given its historical importance as well as the architecture and craftsmanship inside and out. Be sure to take in the views all around the Church. Inside beyond the temple where the remains are preserved, the magnificent art, glass, and gold are a sight to behold.

Must see in St P. This is a must see in St P! You should see it at least from the outside - though inside is completely decorated in mosaics. Went later on in the day - no queues for tickets and much quieter near to closing time.

Landmark in St Petersburg. The Church was entirely redone in the past ten years or so -- it is a gem. It looks like straight out of a picture book, almost unreal. The interior is breathtaking. This is truly a landmark not to be missed

must see of StPetersburg. Definitely a must see of beautiful StPetersburg! Amazing! Unique!
Truly Russian!
Closed on Wednesday.

If you could only go to one place in ST Petes' this would be it.. This by far is the easiest of the magnificent churches to handle. Czar Alexander was murdered in this church. His family made it a memorial to him. Only family members and invited guests were ever able to go inside until the “revolution of 1917”. Now of course, it is open to the public.
The Spilled Blood (site of a Tsar assassination). Another very elaborate, but not very old, Russian Church. Well worth a visit and a great photo opportunity from the back street vista
Very awesome Mosaic Artwork!!!. Very cool inside!!! The Mosaic artwork was very awesome!!! Go with Visitrussia.com and you can get in before all the tour groups!!!

A spectacular church. Definitely one of the main tourist attractions is this church with
cruel history. The church itself By the canal is beautiful to see
outside with many many details in the construction.
Outside the church there is normally a small market place.

Best church to visit in St petersburg don´t miss it!!!. This Church it is amassing there is nothing like it in the hole world, don´t miss it. There is a lot of people visiting but it can be seen with no problems you can take all the pictures you want.

Beautiful. Brilliant just what you imagine in Russia the mosaics inside were something else. Fabulous.
Was very busy but our Tour Guide bought tickets and we skipped the queues. Great visit.

A must see in Russia!. This church is one of the main attractions in St. Petersburg and was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander the second was assassinated in 1881. The interior and exterior of the church is decorated with intricate mosaics which were designed and created by the most prominent artists of the day. The view of the church from Nevsky Prospekt is absolutely breathtaking.For more information follow me at ForeverChasingWanderlust

fantastic restoration. it's hard to realise how abandoned these places were so recently. Really lovely mosaics. inside and enamel and gold outside. How stupid to assassinate Alexander when he was the most liberal of tsars
Unbelievable sight. Words cannot describe this place. You simply have to see it for yourself. Very crowded, but worth the effort.
Awe Inspiring. This is the Church you imagine when you think of Russia. I still get goose bumps when I think of it. The turrets, the colors - Amazing!!
Visually stunning!. Smaller than I imagined but magnificently decorated wherever you look in beautiful mosaics in rich colours - well worth a visit

Take your camera!. Do not miss this - it is incredible! It is a nice gesture for ladies to cover their heads to visit the churches and cathedrals and men will definitely not be allowed in anywhere wearing shorts.
The heart of Russia. What a lovely church, right at the heart of St. Petersburg & where history is made. We had a guide, so I cannot speak for how effective it would be to wander through untutored.

The History is as Interesting as thE Architecture. The history of the church is as interesting as the Architecture. It is a must see. Our guide took us in & explained what we were looking at & the history behind it.

Remarkable beauty, inside and out. We've seen a lot of churches in our travels and this is definitely unique. The exterior is quite beautiful, more so than most churches in Europe. The interior is all mosaics, which are unbelievable. Don't miss this during your trip!

Most Magnificent Church Interior in the World!. This is one of the most beautiful churches we have ever had the good fortune to visit. From the grand and colourul exterior to the exquisite interior, completely decorated with mosaics, we were awed! We had the extreme good fortune to be taken there to a choral concert by Russian friends...fabulous experience that we will always fondly remember.

Beautiful building. Absolutely amazing we had a tour guide who was very informative. The mosaics were incredible, all the history that goes before you makes one feel so humbled to stand in such an amazingly building.

Exquisite Cathedral a Must See!. This is the quintessential Cathedral which highlights the beauty and magnificence of St. Petersburg. The architecture of the exterior with the iconic colorful cupolas and the thousands of mosaics inside are breathtaking. It must be seen to be believed...take pictures of it from the vantage point of the canal.

Morning we all. I have to say this is a stunning place.
As you would expect there are loads of visitors but take the time to walk around the outside it is amazing. Then get a ticket and go inside , even more delights and savory the history of this monument .
The domes alone are awesome.

Part of our 2 day tour. What a stunning cathedral, mosaics, beautifully decorated ceilings and walls, special icons and lots of history. The back view is wonderful and no cars in the way. Last stop on our 2days with TJ Tours
Cathedrals. Quite a few cathedrals to visit in St Petersburg. However this one is a must. The interior is absolutely amazing.
What crowds!. Really interesting but SO crowded that one could not get near most of the exhibits. Price of success?

What a church!. This is a fabulous church steeped in history. Use a guide and learn so much about it. The mosaics are breath-taking and the vastness of them is hard to take in. The church does get very busy but it is still worth a visit.
Don't Miss This. Magnificent. There were so many beautiful things to see in St Petersburg, but this was among the best.

THE cathedral. If you have to choose one cathedral to visit in St Petersburg, this is the one. Beautiful outside, extraordinary inside, I would go back just to visit again. Opens at 10:30, ticket 250 rubles, but it goes to 400 rubles from 6pm to 10pm.
It has a small market with souvenirs nearby but of course, prices are for tourists...

Just go there. and stand inside - silent, for a minute. You will understand.... Just be there, stay there and think of the wonderful country that was demolished by commies. Its so very beautiful and the story of this church is so touching.

Beautiful, absolutely stunning church!. This was the highlight of my trip to St Petersburg. I'd been looking forward to seeing this church for years and it did not disappoint. Don't expect to be the only person inside. You will be pressed by against many other tourists but don't let this put you off. Just look UP and you'll forget about the amount of people inside. You'll probably have a fair wait to get in so I'd suggest pre-booking tickets. I was with a tour group so I'm not sure how it works, but I'd look into it if I was on my own as the line was huge.
Absolutely Amazing!. This is one of the most impressive churches I've been in in all of Europe! The colors and the mosaics are just absolutely amazing! A must see in St Petersburg!

Historical Place & Impressive Architecture!. Church of the Savior on Blood is a historical place. It was built on the same site, where tsar Alexander II was fatally wounded and died. The church is very beautiful inside and out. The exterior is richly decorated with the spectacular façade and onion domes. The interior walls and ceiling are fully covered in mosaics. The church is a MUST-SEE place in St. Petersburg!

Incredible Impact!. This place is simply amazing! Obviously we had seen some of the guide book pictures before visiting, and had intended to give it just 20 - 30 minutes, but we ended up staying for over an hour! the rather bizarre Disneyish exterior does not do service to the overwhelming impact of the interior. Look out for the exquisite icons either side of the main altar screen.

Simply Awesome. We visited this church towards the end of our two day grand tour of St. Petersburg and even after visiting so many awe inspiring palaces, museums and parks, we were extremely impressed by the beauty of this church.On a side note - beware of pickpockets outside this church. One of the fellow guests on our cruise got her purse snatched away here.

Stunning Church. Unfortunately we had no time to go inside this church, but the outside is stunning and should be seen whilst in St. Petersburg. As with all other attractions in this city, there were crowds, but if you can get inside, based on the outside I would say a must to visit.

Amazing. Beautifully restored. The colour and ornate mosaics make the church an amazing attraction. The outside gives a hint to the style of the building but it's not until you go inside that you can appreciate the building. Photography is permitted.
Stunning. An amazing, stunning attraction. Incredibly well renovated, and good to see the pre pictures to see what an incredible job has been done.

Beautiful and what you are expecting. The church design is more common in Moscow. It is nice to have this style here. The church is gorgeous at any time during the day. I would highly recommend having a guide or reading quite a bit before going. The history is fascinating and the interior gorgeous. You can not miss this church.
Fascinating place. Beautifully restored cathedral. I liked it better from the outside than from the inside, though. Fascinating history - worth your time.

Church of the Savior on Blood. First , we went there with a tour group tne place was closed so we had to view it only from the outside . The structure itself is well maintained , nice to behold . We went bact on our own .theres a fee to enter and additional fee if you wnat to go up to the tower .
amazing!. Most amazing mosaics! I could have spent the whole day there - so much to see. It was very crowded so patience is a must.
Must see!!. This Orthodox Church is made completely by mosaic, inside and out. Its really a must see if you're in St Petersburg.

Classic orthodox architecture. This is the quintessential Russian Orthodox church, with fantastical domes and beautiful colors--and that's just the outside! Inside are classic mosaic portraits in magnificent colors on gold backgrounds. With a bit of reading or a good guide you can learn the meaning of much of the symbolism, which greatly adds to an understanding of the church.The church is in a lovely location by a canal with a lovely park next to it. Going early may help to avoid the crowd because it's a very popular destination.

Exactly how a postcard from Russia should look. There is no single photo that can be taken in St Petersburg that will look closer to the stereotype of what a Russian church should look like.It is nice for a number of rational reasons too - but I believe the above is enough to justify a visit.
A must see. Went here on cruise excursion. Beautiful! Very crowded & watch for pick pockets. Bring your camera. It's a must see in St. Petersburg.

A must see in this Fab City full with contrasts. This is one of the main landmark of the city so expect to have huge lines to get in but as soon as you get in you will know that is totally worth the wait, is imperative for you to have some Russian Rubles to get your tickets because is a bit frustrating if you arrive to the ticket entrance and they don't take credit cards, in the near byes you have a lot of restaurants to choose from and to relax after a day in the line the best time to do the visit is by 10 am because most of the people at that time people is heading towards the Hermitage Museum
Work of art. The art is really amazing and the iconic figures are really everywhere, painted in the most beautiful way. A very spiritual experience.
An amazingly beautiful church. This is the most beautiful church I have ever seen. The inside is completly mosaic. Each wall and ceiling is covered with mosaic icons, even inside each dome.

Amazing colorful building. If you are in Saint Petesburg you can´t miss walking near the Church of the Savior on Blood.It is good to see it, both, during the day when it is plempty of people and during the night when it is more calm.The park near the church is good to relax with good views.You can also visit a museum inside.
Very beutiful. Very beutiful church, full of history, beutiful icons and arts, everything inside is amazing. The floor is also an artpiece.

Imense beauty, filled with history. The Cathedral was built on the spot where emperor Alexander was assassinated. The interior is all in mosaic, but of such beauty that you can hardly say it is not painted. Is' a jewel!
Simply Amazing Interior. Absolutely must see and something you will never forget. We were with a private guide so we got the real story on every detail inside and out.

Breath-taking attraction!. Everything about this iconic church is incredibly beautiful and intricate; to think that this craftsmanship was created thousands of years ago is mind-blowing. The story behind it is fascinating, and we were fortunate enough to have a private Alla tour guide accompanying us, who very capably guided us through, and taught us so much about the history of the church! (I would highly recommend and suggest that tourists book a guide with Alla Tours!) It doesn't take long for your visit; an hour, at a relaxed pace, is more than enough time. Do beware of pickpockets...while we were there, another visitor was "pushed" down the stairs, and soon after, realized that his passport had been stolen. (This warning was relayed to us via our Russian tour guide...it's NOT a nervous tourist speaking....) Overall, this church is a must-see in St. Petersburg.

Semi Precious Stones make for a Most Stunning Church. Easy to see every interior detail and the headphone guide is well worth it to get all the history. There are actually a few places to sit so those that can't stand for long would enjoy.

Iconic Russia. This cathedral is iconic of Russian culture and the inside of the cathedral is even more impressive than the exterior! There is a long row of souvenir salesmen outside where you can actually find some great little gifts for reasonable prices.
wow. i was really impreased by the place' amazing story about the architectors that build the cathedral, liked it!

An amazing work of art. The church can be very crowded, but you are able to get some amazing photos (without flash). What appears to be murals are really mosaics! These ascend up columns and cover the entire interior of the church. The exterior copulas are just as impressive, many covered in gold. If you are part of a tour group, the admission is covered. Be careful around the grounds as pickpockets are known to frequent the area. Well worth the visit!

Beautiful and a must-see. Having been to St Petersburg twice (once on a school trip and again during uni) I have visited this church both times. You can't really afford to come to St Petersburg and not go to this place - it is stunning and displays Russian architecture in its unique form. Even if you just go to get a photo on the bridge (the better viewpoint is from the side with only 1 bridge) then it is worth it!

Definitely worth doing!. The mosaics inside the church are very impressive! Truly a great restoration work. If you go on the morning it will be swamped with tourists, so if you want to avoid that you should stop by in the evening (although its a bit more pricey). Inside you there is a memorial in the place where the tsar Alexander II was mortally wounded.

Lots of history, lots of people.. Visit this year to see the decorative floor before is it covered over again to protect it. The mosaics are amazing, but intense. The church is filled with history that can be shared by a good guide. Both externally and internally this church is beautiful. Be warned, if you don't like pushy crowds, don't go during the summer tourist season.

Takes your breath away!. I first visited 30 years ago and was bowled over then, and always said I wanted to go back... and it was the same this second visit - the exterior is magical to see and the interior literally takes your breath away it is so beautiful and stunning. We went on a tour and didn't have to wait to enter and although there were lots of other tourists there, it wasn't overly crammed inside.... seemed to be a lot less tourists in St Petersburg than on previous visits... so you could easily see everything. It defies belief that it is all mosaic - the craftmanship needed to achieve such outstanding beauty...... it shows how much Alexendar II was loved that they built such a magnificent church in his memory. It's a must to visit on a trip to St Petersburg.
A Must See. I'm a Quick Tour type person - in and out and on to next thing. I really think this Church is worth seeing! Amazing.

Wonderful Church Music Concert. Out family went to a wonderful choral music concert in this incredibly beautiful temple. Sound was superb and we also able to see walk around and see the church after the performance. If you have a chance to go to a concert there, do it.
As beautiful as the st Basil cathedral in Moscow. Don't miss it if you are in Peter, located near a river, this colorful cathedral wil set your mind on russian monument. A must see

Colorful visit. Would like to listen the stories betwee n the mosaic paintings.
It is totally taking you to thw ages ago, somehow a socalled time machine!
Fascinating. Inevitably the place is heaving with tourists and this does detract, however its really worth a look. The mosaic interior is breathtaking.

Absolutely Stunning Cathedral. Breathtakingly beautiful cathedral. Recommend planning for some queueing time if you're planning to go inside. It goes without saying but make sure you gring your camera with charged batteries so you're able to capture the beauty of this architectural marvel.

Moasics. If you like Moasics, you will be enthralled. Personally, I found the hole concept gaudy and very much 'over the top.' We were warned that there were pick pockets around, so were persuaded to leave our possessions on the bus. We were also told there were aggressive sales men in the area. This meant that we didn't buy any souvenirs in the church, but as all prices were in Russian Roubles ( no €/$ accepted) we would have been unable to anyway.
extraordinary place. unbelievable church, a must visit for everybody as an architectonic site, we were amazed!, great mosaic works!

Excellent architecture and paintings. Master piece of architecture .must spend minimum one hour to admire and enjoy the interior structures and paintings .the voice guide helps to understand the real skill and speciality of the paintings & history of the church.
View from the road. It can be easily seen on the other side of the land and the architecture is amazing. The loops and curves really shows its age.
EXTRAORDINAIRE. This church is actually a fantastic work of art. I would consider it the most important piece of arquitecture and décor in all of St. Petersburg. One is left speechless.

Our favourite cathedral, truly amazing !! A true treasure!!. Amazing cathedral both from the outside and inside. Allow time to queue up as always seems to be busy. A definite must see when in St Petersburg!!

One of the most beautiful and iconic St. Petersburg churches. This church is simply breathtaking - both inside and out. We saw this on a tour, and our guide made sure to point out how it was constructed, give us history of the church, as well as describe the WWII destruction and on-going renovations. The mosaics covering the church are simply breathtaking - in some places, I would have thought them paintings if I hadn't known differently, the were so detailed and nuanced! A true gem of St. Petersburg!

Beautifully restored Church. By the canal with its unique roof, inside its a gem every inch of the walls are covered in what at first glance appear to be paintings, but are in fact mosiacs. Don't forget to look down as the floor as this is also something special
The most beautiful church. This is an absolutely stunning church both inside and out, with lots of stories to tell. A must-visit.

St. Petersburg's Iconic Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood. The Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood is one of the most incredible places I've ever visited. The exterior, thought by some to be garish and utterly without artistic value when first completed, is quintessentially Russian and completely charming. As stunning as the exterior is, however, the interior almost defies description. It seems every inch of available wall and ceiling space is covered with the most intricate and fabulously beautiful of mosaics. I've been blessed to view many churches in numerous countries, but this cathedral is in a class all its own. My initial reaction to these luminous mosaics was, "This is the most amazing place I've ever been." The shrine erected over the spot of Alexander's assassination is especially impressive as well. It's almost impossible to believe that this beautiful edifice fell into disrepair and was used for storage in the post-Revolution years. Our guide shared her memories of the church's restoration during her childhood; those recollections were a poignant reminder of what was almost lost forever. Be prepared for crowds when you visit this peerless cathedral--it is a very popular place. But don't let the crush of humanity keep you away. This church is well worth your time and rubles!

Stunning.... We visited the Church of Spilled Blood as part of a cruise ship excursion. We didn't have chance to go inside (plus there was a massive queue) but the outside of the building is really a sight to behold. Definitely worth a trip to see it.
Spectacular. Enjoyed this cathedral immensely even if it is overrun by tourists. Try walking off into the nearby park where it is more serene and you can even buy some sugared almonds!

Nice picture spot but pretty crowded.. We stopped here on our tour of St.Petersburg. It was quite crowded inside. Note that the mosaics inside are not original but restored reproductions. Still very historic. No longer an active Russian Orthodox Church but now a state museum.

Worth seeing. I had no plan to go but happened to walk by. The street is itself nice to stroll. The exterior architecture is beautiful and like a fairytale. The mosaics inside are stunning as well.It's worth visiting as are so many wonderful buildings in st petersburg and russia generally.
Unforgettable. This is by far the most amazing church I have ever visited. Something that will leave you breathless. The audio guide is warmly suggested.
A must see!. Wonderful church full of icons made of mosaics...Don't miss it! The entrance fee was low (cca 5 eur) and the beauty inside was overwhelming.
most impressive monument ever. most impressive church ever seen. The decoration is overwhelming and good story with it. Build as a monument after the murder of peter the great ordered by his wife

Church of the Savior on Blood. Church of the Savior on Blood was a fascinating church and a must to visit. It was very busy when we visited however we had no trouble entering and our guide was very informative.

Spectacular exterior and interior.. This is one of the most beautiful churches in St Petersburg with all the colourful mosaics. Scenes from life of Christ is depicted in mosaics.250 Rubles fee for entering .Can easly get there from from Nevesky Prospect,by the side of one of the canals.
Incredible inside and out. You think the outside is incredible, the mosaic inside is even more so incredible. The details leave you in awe!

Unique Beauty. Built at the end of XIX century in style resembling famous Moscow's St Basil's Cathedral (built, mainly, in XIV century), this unique structure is created with incomparable to St Basil's Cathedral riches and beauty. The interior is all opened and 100% covered with various mosaic works on biblical themes - all richly ornamented and framed by intricate designs. Two types of mosaics techniques are represented - direct and reverse - in implementation of the art by famous Russian painters of that time.
Definitely check this place out.. Definitely worth the visit, to see the mosaics inside. To consider how much planning and time went into them...amazing.
A highlight of St. Petersburg. This church is not to be missed. I have never seen anything like the mosaic interior. Be prepared to be blown away!

Amazing, Amazing, Amazing. This is a must see if you are in St. Petersburg. Truly an amazing cathedral. The mosaic painting rivals any in the world, including Italy. You'll need a couple of hours to tour this place. Watch for pick pockets.
Amazing. This iconic image of St Petersburg is so much better in real life. Every view is different,each one better than the previous one.

Spectacular!. Both the exterior and interior of this church are truly spectacular and should not be missed. We visited as part of a private tour and therefore did not have to wait in line to buy tickets. The mosaics depicting the life of Christ inside the church were spectacular and we could have spent longer than we did appreciating them but like most attractions in the city at this time of year the church was full of very large and noisy tour groups. The church also incorporates a section of the cobbled street and railings where Alexander II was assassinated.
Beautiful. Probably the most beautiful church I've ever seen. Absolutely gorgeous and worth the entry to check it out.

amazing exterior and interior!!!. I recognized this church from the brightly colored exterior, but before visiting I wasn't aware that the interior is even more colorful! The mosaics that cover the inside of the church are breathtaking. You won't need a ton of time to see this church, but it is well worth the visit. Photo tip-- you will get better photos from the "back" of the church. It is a pedestrian street so you don't have to worry about traffic.

Beautiful on the inside and outside. This was an unbelievably beautiful church and must see if visiting SPB! Was not very crowded but recommend booking tickets online to avoid the long line to get in.

Beautifull.. Great church. Inside and outside. Very interesting and colourful. Easy to get in. You need about 30 minutes to see it. Its just next to one of the river canals and many boat tours pass by. Opens late, if I remember well at 10:30am. Nicely lit at night. 5 minutes from Nevsky Prospekt.
Stunning, definitely worth a visit!. Stunning place that took my breath away. Definitely worth a visit. The staff are really friendly and helpful too.

Onion Domed Church. Fine example of the onion domed architecture of Russia. Beautiful inside and out. If you have to visit one church in St. Petersburg, this is the one. The history of this church from its inception and its use during the Soviet times is interesting.

Family holiday in St. Perterburg. We had a week in St. Petersburg in July 2015. The Church of the Savior on Blood featured on the cover of "The Lonely Planet" and our daughter wanted to see it (and so did we). We approached from Nevsky Prospect which affords great photo opportunities. It's probably more impressive from the outside, but the inside is also worth a look.
Best cathedral. I've never seen anything so inspiringly beautiful. This is unlike the many cathedrals I've visited around the world.

Masterpiece. It's a major presence in the city, and when you step inside you really can't take in all there is to see. Give yourself time to just stand and appreciate the beauty, wander through (amid the throngs of tourists), and appreciate its restoration.Hugs crows outside are a breeding ground for pickpockets, so keep valuable in a money belt or other safe place. Don't engage street vendors with even a look in the eye or they'll be all over you.

July trip to Saint Petersburg. This building is so amazingly opulent it has to be seen to the true. Sited next to a canal in the centre of the city it is in close proximity to the winter palace and the summer gardens
The Russian Pride. Beautiful architecture with the whole history engraved on. A unique master piece. Early morning entrance is cheaper that evening.

A must-see when visiting St Petersburg. . Although it resembles St, Basil's of Moscow from the outside, it is very different on the inside. It has been renovated to perfection and is indeed very beautiful.

An Interesting Tribute to a Fallen Tsar. My children especially liked the crypts of the royal family, including Anastasia. The Russian Orthodox church is so ornate and the mosaics were unbelievable. We were on a paid, provate, guided tour, so we do not know about admission fees.
A real jewel inside and out. This is a place not to be missed. Even if you're not interested in religious art, the mosaics inside are real gems. And the story behind its construction is also amazing.

Mosaic treat. What an eclectic mix of styles and colors. The church is amazing from the outside with its multi-colored domes sitting atop a very different architecture to the rest on view in St Petersburg. Your eyes will always be drawn upwards to the vast mosaic patterns across the ceilings and paintings in the highest points of the domes. A must see in St Petersburg.

Interesting Russian history.. We visited The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood with an organised tour provided by a cruise company. We were lucky as there wasn’t a big queue to get in, however once inside it was quite full. Even though it was busy with tourists the beauty of the Church was amazing. Inside there is a section of original cobbled street and hand rail where Alexander II was assassinated. It has been preserved and the church built around it. It is steeped in history and I recommend seeing inside as well as the very impressive outside. To fully understand the items you are looking at I would recommend going in with a guide.
Intresting. This Building is a Mythical Place. When I was in St. Petersburg every day I Walked there and Visited this interesting Church.

It's a long way up the tower. Slightly off the beaten track but worth visiting - although being renovated at the moment so there is a lot of scaffolding outside. (Aug '15). The walk up to the top of the bell tower is long - worthwhile for great views as long as you don't suffer from Vertigo - the final section is up narrow metal stairs and quite steep

Amazing--inside and out. We had been in Russia for almost two weeks and had seen golden domes and gilded interiors that amazed us, but this church tops them all! The colors of the stone mosaics combined with golden tiles and gilded icons took our breath away. This is one site everyone should take time to visit. The ticket is 250-500 rubles for the main museum. Separate stone museum across the street is additional charge but we did not go in. Tickets are easy to purchase. The staff spoke some English. We went first thing in the morning and found crowds not too bad.

Biggest Mosaic Cathedral in the World - Guinness book. Must visit if in St. Petersburg!! The Savior-on-Spilled Blood Cathedral on Griboyedova Canal is a charming place...don't miss this Cultural & Architecture miracle
Dear God, thank YOU for it!. Excellent explanatory and detailed audio guide (wonderful work), friendly helpful personnel, nice ladies at the icon shop.

So much impressive from the distance. Easily approached from the Nevsky street, good to see both daytime and night time. Always crowded by tourists around the world, you may shop around the souvenir stalls. The icon pictures inside the cathedral were so much magnificent, must visit inside when time allows

The King's blood shed here. The art works in this church is fabulous. You can see the Bible coming alive on the walls and the ceilings. The appearance of the church is majestic. I enjoyed my visit to this church and learned about the history of the royal families.

One of my most favourite churches. Amazing!. This church is simply amazing! From the outside, it doesn't look like anything special. But as you delve deeper into the history of this magnificent monument and then walk through the doors you are presented with the most spectacular mosaics covering all the walls and ceilings. It is quite breathtaking! Definitely a must see in St.Petersburg.
Beautiful Church. It really looks like the photos one sees in magazines and on the internet! Definitely worth the visit and time taken to see all of the interior and exterior.

A unique piece of art!!!. This church is extremely beautiful inside and outside, you probably can spend one day admiring all what there is inside, there are probably hundreds of paintigs with so much detail. This church was built by Alexander III in the place where his father Alexander II was killed. Visit this church you'll enjoy it a lot!

Not just another Cathedral. As I was walking in, I heard a departing tourist giving a flippant comment that it looked better on the outside. Having been to a couple of cathedrals in Russia already and many in Europe, I was really curious to discover if the tourist indeed had a point. He was SO WRONG!The interior was amazingly done with intricate mosaic covering all the walls and the ceiling. It is hard to fathom how it took only 12 years to complete this masterpiece when other churches take so much longer. An audio guide is a must to understand the intricacies behind the architecture and the relevance of the Cathedral to the history of this wonderful country. It's worth an hour's visit to take in the sights!
Church of the Savior on Blood. Our canal cruise ended with a visit to Church of the Savior on Blood. Beautiful church but it was very crowded making it difficult to actually enjoy and take pictures.

A Church with unusual architecture. First saw it from a distance during a Canal tour and later visited also during a Bus hop-in hop-off tour. Great architecture, great colours and a very unique pattern of Church that you see only in Russia

Great historical museum. A walk into this church is like walking into a museum.
we enjoyed watching all the mosiac "paintings".
there is 7000 square metres of mosiac in this church.
interestingly the church looks very ancient but the reality is that it is only 100 years old.

Phenomenal mosaics and great history. Largest mosaics art piece in one place. History behind it is fascinating, do listen to the guide otherwise you can't appreciate its greatness. The work restorers have done is impeccable.

Also known as Church of the Spilt Blood.. This is one church to see. Seven and a half thousand square meters of mosaics on the walls inside. We were able to take loads of photos of this very beautiful church.

Interesting history. Interesting history and decorations. Worth visiting.
Show respect when visiting religious buildings, this is not a museum (women should cover their hair With a scarf or simillar).

Good but not fantastic. Not a patch on St Basil's in Moscow as it lacks its aged ambience but nice enough. Fifteen minutes is plenty of time for a quick look. The outside is probably the best bit. Does convey that Alexander was the Kennedy of his day.

charming. this church has been made on the place where Alexander the 2. assasinated. He did not die exactly here but he got the deathly wound here. Assasination made by bomb. Lenght of the church symbolizes the date of the emperor's birth. There is a bazaar of souveneirs in front of the church.
Church of the spilled blood. Great!!! outside is fantastic... interior is amazing!!!. truly special building..do not miss it!!!! it is really beautiful

Beautiful church but oh the hoards of tourist during the summer. The church is beautiful and most tour groups/guides insist you see it. The church is no longer in use however (the church pews have all been removed e.g.) so it really is just a tourist attraction at this point. The site of where Alexander died is the most significant part and thus the name of the church.
Beyond Belief. This is a must see. Be very careful of pickpockets in this area. The church is amazing. The mozaics are amzing and the history of this placehits you.

Simply amazing. It is the external appearance that catches the eye, and it is completely asymmetric. No two views of the church are the same, and the appearance changes in different light, encouraging a return after dark to capture more pictures. The interior features many mosaic icons, capturing all the well know biblical characters and parables. The shrine to Alexander II a focal point, of course. This is a 'not to be missed' highlight of any tour to Saint Petersburg

Best church ever. This is my favourite church, beside the supernice roof and decoration the inside is full of mosaics and the atmosphere is not like in a super religious place...maybe that's why I liked it!

One of the most beautiful churches in the second. If you want to visit only one church in SPB this is the one. Interior and exterior are equally beautiful and magnificent. I suggest visiting this church (at least the exterior) twice in different weathers, because colors are really different in sunny and cloudy weather, both are fabulous.Also there is a mosaic of Jesus in his teenage in the ceiling of right wing when you're standing in front of altar, which is very unique.

Another Architectural Masterpiece. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I've encountered anywhere in the world. Architecturally delightful and filled with gigantic mosaics that throb with color. Don't miss it.

Simply amazing. The beauty of this relatively little church is simply amazing. The outside is very colorful and very beautiful, but the inside is spectacular.We went just expecting to take a couple of pictures in front of it and not expecting much from the visit, but we were pleasantly surprised.The art work is out of this world. The mosaic are more than impressive and the colors are resplendisant.In fact, if you only got time to visit one church/cathedral in St.Petersburg, skip St.Isaac and Peter and Paul, this is the one to see.I definitely recommend this visit.

the most incredible church. Just wow! The one thing is coming in your mind when you see the mosaic. Wow-wow! Is coming next after a guide tour. Advice: pay attention to the floor as well. You will see, it's also gorgeous. I'm proud we have it in our country and I'm pleasant that so many tourists around the world visit this place. So many french people! They are famous by their good taste by the way.

Walked in off the street. Amazing mosaics . Literally walked in without a line after lunch and walking around Saint Petersburg. The amount of work to restore this building is incredible. Worth a visit. Literally 20 minutes to see the entire thing but the most impressive church or cathedral we saw in Saint Petersburg.
A Church to Behold. The exterior and interior of the Church of the Savior on Blood is one of a kind and a landmark is that recognizable by all. You will not be disappointed.

Simply Beauriful. There's not much to talk about since the photo explains it all. The architecture is beautiful, in a way super "Russia" style church. Along the river to it's way to the church, there's a lot of small shops selling super touristy stuff, a good place to grab some souvenirs? Behind the church there's a big park, a good place to have a rest as well!

Architecturally and Visually Brilliant!. Tragic history behind the construction of the church. Impressive Russian Orthodox exterior and dazzling interior of mosaics. More impressive than St. Basil's in Moscow. Completely restored after decades of neglect and abuse. Extended hours (6-10 PM) were offered when we visited it in June, and the admission was 400 RUB with no discount. There was no lines or crowds. We got to enjoy the brilliant interior at a leisurely pace. Highly recommend visiting it during extended hours to better appreciate its beauty and magnificence. I was awe-struck when I entered the church. Bright and fresh. Mosaics on all the walls and ceilings, and equally beautiful floors. Be sure to walk around the exterior and by the river to admire the intricate exterior from all sides. Kazan Cathedral is a 5-minute stroll away. A perfect after dinner activity to cover both places in the summer.

One of the Best Photo Opportunities in St. Petersburg. Church was built around the exact location where a ruling Tsar was murdered. Beautiful domes domes on the exterior make this one of the most photographed structures in St. Petersburg!

Interesting, opulent and a quick one to visit. Fascinating and opulent - everything you expect from a visit to St Petersburg. This church stands on the spot where the Tsar was assassinated so steeped in history.
Beautiful inside and out, the church is a great place for a memorable holiday snap.
Not very impressed. Very popular with tour groups and seemed to have an incessant tannoyed recorded commentary even when closed. Looks better from afar when the sun is shining.

stunning. This is really a sight that you dont expect to see anywhere, so colourful and yet so dark.
Awe inspiring architecture, amazing history and a feeling that you are actually a part of something when you go in.
Go at end of day when not busy
Well worth a visit to this beautiful landmark. The most beautiful sight in a very beautiful city. It is well worth a look inside, for what was a very reasonable price.
tragic history. do not forget it.a wonderful architecture built based on a tragic story.you can take amazing photos outside it.
Stunning building. What a beautiful building. I chose not to go inside as i thought my time was better spent walking around the building and taking in its beauty
Stunning!. Amazing sight to see in person. Each inch of the church inside is filled with a sight to behold. It is definitely a must see inside and out.

Very ornate domes glisten from a distance and guide you there. The Cathedral is awesome, regardless of the angle at which you shoot pictures. Each dome is exquisite. There is a carnival atmosphere in the area around the church. We walked several blocks along the canal and tremendously enjoyed the area. Souvenirs are on sale by the small vendors in the courtyard. Credit cards are accepted. At one point we were greeted by two real monkeys dressed in children's clothing. We ate at the famous Stray Dog Café (in a cellar). They did not speak English, did not take credit cards, took only Russian money. The Cafe was one of our most interesting experiences in St. Petersburg.
Impressive. One of those places that you have to visit when in town. The inside is just impressive. Words are had to describe.

the only russian one. this church is quite special, not only because it is not really a church but a memorial for the murdered tsar, it is the only church built in russian style (all others you see and find are european ones)beautiful inside as outside, the history why this memorial was built is quite tragic, maybe resembling in the tear drop domes which are typically crowning the church (or memorial or the other way around)

Insane. This church is amazing on the outside and inside. The inside is almost sensory-overload - there is just so much to look at. The outside, however, is my favorite. Even from very far away this church is a must-see.

Must see, even if you are in St. Petersbug for one day. It is one of the most impressive and beautiful churches in Russia. You have to see it, even if you are in the city for one day. At least, come and see it around, if do not have time to go inside.
Iconic building. Wow beautiful building and stunning artwork. You have to go there whilst in St Petersburg. Great location as so much going on around this area too

Typical Russion Othodox Cathedral, Beautifull mosaics inside. Very typical Russian Cathedral with a specific history. Part of the cultural/architectural patrimonium of the city. Advice to visit inside for the beautifull mosaics.
A must see. This was a beautiful church with many famous tomb stones in the church. Well worth checking out. The art work is beyond belief.

Phenomenal!. Truly a wonderful site! Worth the wait, as it is really lovely. Take time to just take it all in. In Europe, the churches can start to run together - but this will stand out among all the rest!
Worth seeing. In spite ft the crowds this church needs to be seen to be believed. My pictures don't do it justice as the architecture and colors are amazing. Well worth a visit.
Spectacular!. Just mind-blowing, both inside and out. A 'must visit' location if you are even vaguely interested in dramatic sights. The fact that it is a church is incidental.

Amazing restoration of a church once used as a morge. The interior was amazing, the walls are decorated in very vivid mosaics that look almost like oil paintings. This is the site were Alexander the seconded was killed and was built by his son Alixander the third.

Stunning church. Absolutely beautiful church. The colours of the mosaics are gorgeous. Unforgettable highlight of our visit to St Petersburg. It was busy when we visited but this did not detract too much from the experience.

Breathtaking! Absolutely the most beautiful church-don't miss it!. In spite of the gory name, we decided to investigate, and what a wonderful surprise it is. The history is fascinating, the crowds a bit much, but the spectacular mosaics, covering the entire inside of the building are worth the wait and the sad history lesson. We deferred our Hermitage trip to the next day, and combined this church tour with a nearby boat ride on the Neva, and it turned out to be the perfect plan.
Extraordinary church, architecture, unbelievable site. Something to be seen and experienced. One could not miss this edifice when in SPB, captivating in every way. a must see.
A Must See. Beautiful ... inside and out! This would be one of the places on the top of my list for a visit to St Petersburg.

Beautiful Church, Can Get Very busy. Be prepared to get squashed! The design and though behind this church is incredible, a must see in St Petersburg. As you walk through the church you'll have to be prepared to dodge people staring up and around constantly but you can hardly blame them.It doesn't take too long to go through and once you exit there is a big line of market stalls for gifts.

St Bassels equivalent of St Petersburg. Ok so this is like the St Bassels cathedral of St Petersburg, and it wont disappoint you. The history of this is more interesting and also i heard that a lot if things happen inside where girls learn a lot of art work and stuff.Overall a good visit, outside the church are a lot of artists drawing portraits, make sure to purchase one if it interests you.

A quick visit. Very impressive wow factor when you go in but not a massive amount to see; as mentioned by others, use the self service machine on the left it saves the queue. I went after 6pm as I thought there would be something extra for the additional cost, but that was not the case, so go early and save the roubles.
A church that glows in the sunlight. This church is well worth a visit when visiting St Petersburg.Its spledour, design and radiant colours have to be seen to be believed.
Must see. Very beautiful, famous, unique heritage-listed church! It impresses you from the first sight and you'll never forget it if you see it once!

Wow!. Amazing. All the mosaic, the fantastic architecture, the floors, but unfortunately, so many tourists that one cannot see all you would love to see.Be patient and try not to be pushed around, it is so worthwhile a visit.

Small but beautiful. A breathtaking church on your trip through St. Petersburg. The artistry is amazing and very intricate. The inside is beautiful, but not as big as it looks from the outside, although, it stays very open and uncrowded.
Busy venue. Worth a visit, so pretty, you don't need much time and it is not expensive. However, it does get very busy.

Beautiful architecture. Beautiful church from the exterior and amazing mosaics inside. I was more struck by the outside but then again, I'm not really into religious art. At 250roubles per person for entry the cost is about right and there is the option to get an audioguide if you're really interested. There was a big messy queue for tickets but nobody using the ticket machine just to the left of the ticket office which we used - quick, easy and efficient!
very beautiful. I couldn't stop taking pictures of it. The church is really beautiful and if you want to buy some souvenirs , you can find near the church and don't forget to bargain!

A Memorial to Alexander II. It was built as a memorial to Alexander II in 1881 on the site of his assassination. It stands out because of its Russian revival style which you see in Moscow a lot but not in St. Petersburg. The church has over 7'000 square meters of mosaics (interior and exterior). A beautiful church, do spend some time there.

The most beautiful church I've seen. This is by far the most beautiful church I've seen in my life. I'm not religious, but the architecture is just stunning! so much detail, finesse and colour!I only checked it out from the outside, as I wasn't particularly interested in the paintings inside, but the high and dense fence around it somewhat spoils the look from close-up.Easily combine this with a stroll in the adjacent park ;)Tip: approach along the canal from nevsky prospekt. makes for nice pictures and leads you very nicely to the church.
Great historical place. From outside it is fantastic. And inside it captures you with his history and architecture. Even if it is a copy of the one in Moskow, still worth to visit it.

SPB tour enlightening history. This church, as with many other churches and cathedrals, reflect a passionate history. While the motivation for the structure originated from a violent event, the outcome stands as an architectural masterpiece
Go late evening to miss the crowds. Beautiful church inside and out. Does not take long to view so leave to visit late evening when there are no crowds.
amazing photos on a sunny day. beautiful inside and out...Top attraction of the city not to be missed...take pictures along the canals!

Mosaic marvel. So many tour groups see the outside, which is extremely colourful, but the inside is spectacular. The church/museum is totally covered in the most exquisite mosaics, it is simply stunning. Everywhere you look there is something new, and when you see it again it is still a revelation. The church is quite small, but once seen, it will never be forgotten. And all for 3 Euros.
Beautiful building. We visited Moscow and St Basil's before going to St Petersburg - I would say personally that this church knocks spots of St Basil's

"Awe-Inspiring Church Architecture". You don't have to be a member of the Russian Orthodox faith to appreciate the striking beauty of both the exterior and the interior of this iconic church. A visit here should be on everyone's "must" list. Look carefully in a corner of the decorated ceiling for a portrait of an adolescent Christ, an image extremely rare in all Christian art.
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning inside, well worth going to see. It is a nice area with a lot to see round about
BREATHTAKING CHURCH. Both outside and inside this Church is stunning to look at and visit. Definitely worth seeing and no trip to St. Petersburg would be complete without visiting this Church.

Fascinating. The pictures don't hold a candle to the beauty of this amazing church in real life: it's more colourful, more impressive and way bigger when you are there, looking at it for real. I strongly recommend to visit it, as the inside is as beautiful as the outside.

Amazing photos. This church is amazing. 70% of the artwork is located inside this church. The mosiacs are done with small pieces of coloured glass. Everywhere is different colours and patterns. y family really enjoy this stop.
AMAZING. This Church is a MUST see in STPB! Everything from the outside to the inside is just amazing! Get there early and try to enjoy as much as you can in the quiet! Just a beautiful place.
Beautiful. A wonderful place to visit. Although it is not a religious place......it is a beautiful place to see.

Church of the Savior on Blood. The church is spectacular, with beautiful colors. A great photo op from anywhere around. There are a lot of merchandise stalls on the way, which detract from the experience, but what can you do.

breathtaking. The detail and impressive size of the Church was incredible, with so much history, a visual feast to the eyes and the grand scale is impressive with a huge coverage of art work through out the church

Very beautiful and interesting. . Definitely worth a visit, however beware of pick-pockets. My husband had license and several other cards lifted from his back pocket while being jostled about in the very crowded church.
Favorite Stop. This was the most decorative and unique place we visited in SPB. Highly recommended with a great camera.

Stunning stunning stunning!. Really beautiful piece of architecture, and easy to reach (just off Nevsky). A popular tourist attraction so expect quite a few people there, rain or shine. The real lure for many is the exterior, but if you are interested in the history and interior (which can feel a little claustrophobic, given the mix of gold and all-covered colored walls), you can visit inside. But, if you're pressed for time or just want to admire a truly gorgeous church, a stroll around this building and the nearby gardens can be inspiring enough.
Not just another church. Out of the churches and cathedrals we visited in St. Petersburg, this was the most beautiful and interesting. Not to be missed.

A mosaic temple. A very impressive building full of colors and typical of Russian architecture. Even more impressive when you know the reason for its building (assassination of the Tsar) and the exact location of the event within the church. Fabulous mosaic work every where in the church. Well worth the visit. Laurent
Keep Hold of your WALLET. Beware the pickpockets here but do not miss it! Easy to be done as you take pictures...Beautiful colours inside

Has To Be Seen To Be Believed. All the reviews and photographs do not do this magnificent piece of architecture justice. It is like being in a fairy tale world. Stunning colourful domes, amazing decoration. It has to be on you tour! Historically very important due to Alexander the great being murdered here.

Beautiful Church. I am not much of a church visitor but this ones quite a good one. You can buy tickets in Rubbles from an automated ticket machines (English Language Option). My ticket caught inside but was easy to retrieve by opening the draw and reaching in a bit further. It took me a little while to get a guide to help me and I felt a bit daft when I saw how easy it was to retrieve. The audio guide is pretty standard with a lot of info. As my bible knowledge is a bit Sunday School it put the images in context. Use your own headphones though as the issued ones were very quiet. It is beautiful church and highly ornate and up with some of the best in the world, if that's your thing. The restoration is great but it shows how revolutionary periods can destroy heritage as they deal with the issues of war or ideology. Thankfully the Russians kept in spite of all their issues and it looks great.I only had an hour which was enough but I'd of preferred a more leisurely visit

Don't Miss the Interior of this Masterpiece!. A must-see stop in St Petersburg! Allow at least 30 minutes to an hour to absorb the amazing history and architecture of this fantastic, onion-domed masterpiece.

A Must See!. This memorial church to Alexander II is magnificent inside and out. It distinctive style is memorable. The inside is filled with mosaics and marbled floors. You can get a great photo of this church in the park across the street by the graves of the heroes of the revolution. It is crowded, but worth going.

Not just ABC (another big church). While it's beautiful outside, inside is very interesting. I'm not sure it can be truly appreciated without a guide or a tour, so if you can get one, it's a good idea. It's certainly on a must do list.

What can you say-simply awe-inspiring.. Church of the Savior on Blood is a remarkable site of worship. Enough has been written about it. The multitude of photos can't do it justice.The beautiful, colorful onion-domed towers draw the eye and are a unique sight to a westerner. Their variety and positioning give viewers a multitude of angles to view the church. You could spend hours just looking at the outside. The inside is floor to ceiling mosaics. Gorgeous and almost overwhelming. The workmanship is incredible and between the mosaic portraits of saints and the embellished architecture it's almost necessary to close your eyes and clear your thoughts before proceeding. I truly wish we had a longer visit and that it hadn't come at the end of a long day of sight-seeing and learning. Take your time and appreciate all the beauty.
Another fabulous church. As all the churches this one is dripping with gold, paintings etc. it is where the emperor Alexander was murdered

Exceptional. If you can go with a small group and a knowledgeable guide then you won't be disappointed. Olga of Tour de Force was brilliant. The church is a wonder, it's architecture unique the decorative mosaics stunning and renovations inspiring. Appreciating the damage, neglect and misuse of this wonderful building is to appreciate its current condition. a real must see.

The most beautiful museum-church in Saint Petersburg. This church was built in old Russian style at the spot where the tsar Alexander II was murdered. It is easy to recognize it due to its colourful onion shaped domes, which are not so common in Saint Petersburg. It is beautiful from the outside, and even more beautiful from inside, where one can appreciate the golden mosaics all over the interior!

The exterior is the best part. We did a quick tour through this as part of a city tour. Of course the exterior is spectacular, but, while the interior is lavish and interesting, it doesn't really stand out, so I am glad we didn't wait in line to see it.

Beautiful Onion Domes. What a beautiful sight! If you go to St Petersburg do not miss this. The church is amazing to behold on the outside and quite interesting on the inside. It is surrounded by souvenir sellers and their prices are competitive. The church's domes are bejeweled and colorful. The Onion domes as Americans refer to them as are actually built that way to more easily shed the heavy snows!

Amazing art work. I knowhat a church is not built for its art, but for praying. Hoever,, not being a Russian Orthodox believer, I still do appreciate the mosaics of this church. Not visiting this church makes a visit to St. Petersburg incomplete
Fabulous!. Such an impressive building as you approach along the canal. So distinctive. The interior is beautiful and serene, and yes you can take photographs. Not to be missed.

Amazing Church. We thought the outside if the building was just spectacular, but the inside walls and ceiling are full of murals all made of mosaic, so inside just as spectacular. Nit to be missed. On,y drawback very crowded.

No Church Fatigue Here. I know, I know another Church but you have to see it because it is spectacular. Even if you've seen a thousand photos it doesn't detract from seeing it in the flesh. Magnificent.

What a work of art - stuinning inside and out. Another stunning Russian Orthodox Church. It is sensational and a must see attraction if you are visiting St. Petersburg. Don't be put off if you have to queue for tickets the wait is more than worthwhile. Ideally go early before the tours arrive. It is a very popular place The outside is stunning and the whole inside of this cathedral is covered in over mosaic pictures depicting the life of Christ and other Bible stories. The floors are all covered in beautifully ornate marble.One of the most magnificent cathedrals you will ever see! Spoilt only by the crowds

Wonderful from the outside. Sadly is closed on Weds. and that was my last day in St. Petersburg.. Can't say much about the interior. As its closed on Weds. Unfortunate as that was my last day in the city. Very impressive from the outside though and no doubt won't be missed by any tourist to this lovely city.

Beautiful but crowded. Of course, the internal mosaics of this church are as stunning as the outside. We went in the afternoon, around 5pm, and it was uncomfortably crowded. We could barely move, tour group upon your group were crammed in. Definitely worth the visit!
Amazing Amazing - Must See. You will never see anything like this Church the colours and the architecture are stunning.Thank heaven it was not damaged during the wars and revolutions.
Wonderful style. I found it beautiful, the contrast between colour of different part of the church , you can see it friom the surrounding area .

Awe Inspiring!. A beautiful awe inspiring church. Church was built where Alexander the second was killed. His blood is said to be inside. A magnificent,intricately designed and colorful church. A must no matter what religion you follow. Watch out for pick pockets.
A must see... absolutely beautiful.. Another stunning Russian Orthodox Church. It is sensational and must see. Be prepared to stand a line for tickets. Its a very popular place

Magnificent!. The whole inside of this cathedral is covered in over 300 mosaic pictures depicting the life of Christ and other Bible stories. The floors are all covered in beautifully ornate marble of over 20 different colors. One of the most magnificent cathedrals you will ever see!

A must see stop in St. Petersburg. So much history in St. Petersburg but the Church of Spilt Blood (which is what all the locals call it) is both magnificent and historically important. Don't miss this place if you visit the city.

It's all about the inside- totally different to St Basil's, Red Square, Moscow. Beautiful church from the outside. However I was expecting a lot of interconnecting rooms and small chapels with altars like St Basil's in Moscow. What we saw was a large inside space with mosaic bible pictures covering every inch of the walls and high ceilings. Worth a sit down on the few (maybe 4 chairs set in the nooks of the pillars to absorb the beauty. 20min should do it unless you wish to extract and absorb every fact about the place. We went at 6.30pm when there were no crowds or queues although the ticket at 500rb is I believe 200rbl more than the morning ticket.

Colorful Onion Dome. The magnificent Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is one of St. Petersburg's most memorable landmarks. The church, built at the end of the nineteenth century, is constructed in a classical Russian style decorated with colorful domes and glazed tiles.
Unforfetable place. This place is a very beautiful place, the decoration is so impressive and I hope to go back to visit again.

A highlight of our trip but beware of crowds.. We visited the Church on Spilled Blood during our Baltic cruise and with the tour group Alla Tours. This church is simply amazing. The outside gives you the beautiful colored onion domes and the inside is breathtaking with the mosaic tile artwork of scenes from the Bible. The only downside are the crowds. The church is located basically surrounded by streets (no lawn or parking). It is chaotic trying to enter and it's crowded once you are inside.
Great. The Church contains over 7500 square meters of mosaics—according to its restorers, more than any other church in the world.

Beautiful.. I'm assuming this is what we know as "Spilt Blood"! It is amazing. Every surface inside is covered in mosaic & is all 2 dimensional, It's such a different style to Isaac. I loved it & highly recommend it. The surrounding markets are also good for souvenirs, but don't forget to haggle.
One of the most nice churches I have ever seen. It's One of the most nice churches I have ever seen.In the morning, take your photos from the behind, because of the sun

The Most incredible mosaic art work I have ever seen!. This is a must see while in St. Petersburg Russia. I could not believe the work that had been done in the building. The entire inside of the building is mosaic tile. To see the outside was incredible but I was not prepared for the beautiful tile work on the inside. Honestly one of the most amazing places I have visited!

Amazing mosaics. The inside of the church is as least as beautiful as the outside! We took the audio-your, but found it a bit too long, the narrator a little boring. We stopped halfway the tour. Would not recommend it.

Stunning - inside and out!. Definitely worth a visit but it can be extremely busy and crowded. Beautiful mosaics. The workmanship is amazing. Helps to have a guide to explain the various parts of the church so I'd recommend doing an organized tour of the city that includes this attraction. Charge your camera batteries!

An Absosute must. I wasn't leaving St, Petersburg till I saw still amazing church and I wasn't sorry!!!! It is as beautiful as the pictures you see in magazines. WE were really lucky to see couples getting wedding photos taken outside the church. Certainly a place not to be missed if visiting St' Petersburg.

A fascinating Orthodox cathedral.. This was the first place we visited during a four day private tour. We didn't want to leave, even though we have an aversion to large crowds (and this cathedral is, justifiably, very crowded). The exterior is stunning, especially when the sun is shining. The interior decoration of large mosaics is spectacular. Do not miss it!

Museum of Mosaics. The awe inspiring cathedral is one of the most impressive man-made sights I've ever had the pleasure of seeing in person. The church walls are adorned in a mesmerizing display of mosaics depicting various scenes. You absolutely cannot miss visiting the Church of the Spilt Blood.

wow...must must see. it is so beautiful from outside and unbelievable interior, it is one of our favorite place to see in St Petersburg, walls and ceiling are covered with mosaic work, it is simply amazing.

Prepare to take lots and lots of pictures.... Unfortunately the church was closed the day I tried to visit it, so all I got to do was walk around it on a beautiful sunny day. It is an incredible sight - people from Saint Petersburg tend to claim it is prettier than its much more famous sister at the Kremlin, in Moscow.

Incredible Story and Cathedral. Really awesome cathedral. This is true Russian style Cathedral for an Orthodox Church. The story behind the Cathedral and the history is a great story to hear. There is a fee for entry, pay the fee. The detail put into this is like nothing you will ever see.

Mosaics all around. After being used as a morgue during the Stalinist era, this church has been restored to its rightful place. The outside is onion domed in many colors. The inside is spectacular. Again, don't miss this one. It's awe inspiring.

Breath-taking. The most amazing facade of a church! Intricate designs on the domes with real gold crosses that adorn the tops of the many domes.
Must be one of the most stunning church buildings! Must see.

So colourful, both inside and out. We drove passed this Church several times on our two day tour of St. Petersburg but it was our final destination and well worth the wait. The mosaics are fascinating and although it was busy we were able to move about freely to study everything in close detail. Would have loved to visit the Bell Tower but there is only so much that can be fitted into each day.

Stunning. Garish on the outside, and on the inside. A feast of colours and stories for the eyes, very crowded when we were there, so some of it was lost, in the noise. the piece of street where the Tsar was killed stands out as it is just a pair piece of pavement in the middle of this church that every other surface is plastered with mosaics. Try to see above the crowds and get away from the tour groups. to fully appreciate this church I think it best to do your research ahead of time and then see it, rather than trying to learn in the noisy confines of the church.
Best church in San Petersburg. beautifull everything, looking the inside you understand why it took so much to built it.I disliked the stalls that sold souvenirs.

Wow. What a beautiful church. I am not one to visit too many churches as I often feel they are all a little same same but this one is different. The spectacular facade is just the beginning. The inside displays a real devotion to restoration of a deteriorated building. It took 20 years to restore and I am not surprised.We saw the church with a guide who explained all the finer points. I am glad we did as not only did we learn more than we would have otherwise. We beat the maddening crowd inside.The mosaics are spectacular and probably the best I have seen.My tip is to get there when it opens at 10.30 and avoid Tuesday the biggest cruise ship day.Don't miss this if visiting St Petersburg.
Great History. Such an interesting story of how the church got its name.Beautiful inside, crowded of course.The mosiacs were impressive

An impressive monument dedicated to Tsar Alexander ll. This is one of the main sights of St Petersburg situated along the Griboedov Channel. The internal art work is fabulous. To see where the Tsar was actually assassinated is a moving experience. Be prepared for the crowds during the summer months.

overwhelming beauty. this curch is outstandingly beautiful and colorful both outside and inside. The interior wall decoration, the floor and the painting up the ceiling are magnificent. the story of the curch is very intersting and like russian history of killing and murders is very intriguing as well. 30 minutes of pure fun and interest.
Amazing. WOW, it´s what i have to say! The church is made in mosaico, very beatiful. It´s to crowded but what you see, it´s fantastic

crowded but a must see. Now restored to its former glory (was a potato storage during the soviet days) this is a must see both inside and out, the photo stop of the town. very busy area with lots of stalls and food stops so watch your pockets as pick pockets abound.
Beautiful. This was as beautiful on the inside as on the outside. Be sure to check out the nearby street vendors and their booths.
Stunning. We were there last Sunday with Denrus tours. It was stunning. My wifes favourite church. Look down the side outside for a beautiful statue of christ. Well worth the visit
gorgeous. Fascinating history. Beautiful architecture. Brilliant colors. It is absolutely amazing. Would love to visit again.

Small, iconic and busy. It is a must to visit to photograph the iconic external image and internal wall icons! It is not very large and is packed with people all trying to do the same so its not much of a religious experience.

Fabulous. Again there was another fantastic building inside was all done by mosaics this was a place were we were told that there was pick pockets and once inside it was so crowded but what you got to see inside and outside was magnificent a must see on your trip

Incredible inside and out. incredible design on the outside, the wouldn't look out of place in red square in Moscow. Does little however to prepare you for the stunning mosaics on the inside. Every inch of the church is covered and the overall effect is breath taking

Church of the Savior on Blood. The picture symbol of the old Russia. Very colorful, even on a cloudy day. One of the must visit sites in St. Petersburg. Surrounding area very touristy with street vendors. Detracts from the site.

Magnificient. No wonder this is one's of the world's most photographed buildings. To stand outside it and try to take in all its nuances would be impossible in any reasonable length of time - shoot a bunch of photos and look at them at your leisure at home.

"Looks like Russian soul, outside and inside…". Important to remember about this place is that it appeared to this world twice: once from the creative impulse of an architect and a monk following the will of the Russian Emperor, and the second time from the deep decay by the will of the Russians who need their history… The décor looks really magnificent, but rare visitor could imagine how it looked like just 20 years back. When I was a little girl, I passed by this wonderful building, its doors were always locked and no one could answer me what is inside. It was a real mystery for me...I first was able to see it a decade ago and it is still a mystery... The last mystery is one more of its jewels put in place – the unique piece of jewelry art – the altar door! These are the doors recreated using old black-and-white sketches of the original from opaque silver, gold and enamel with the colour pallete of 250 colours. It took 8 years alone to recreate the colour palette! All the colours are opaque which makes manufacturing process complicated even for modern technologies in jewelry. Every flower required a certain (and different) combination of burning at high temperatures… In result one hardly can take one’s eyes away! Thank you to the jewelry artists : architect Kochetova, enamel artist Solomnikova and metal artist Nokolsky! Awesome! There is no analogue in the world!

Church of the Savior of the Spilt Blood was stunning. We toured St. Petersburg with V&J Tours, who provided wonderful service. The outside of this church with it's spires and coloring is absolutely breath-taking. The inside is massive with stunningly beautiful mosaics everywhere, as you can see from the pictures Be prepared for large crowds of people mid-day, as this is a very popular site.

Stunning but packed. Absolutely stunning. I went late in the afternoon, on a Saturday and it was absolutely packed, so maybe don't go then. Lots of guided tours going on at the same time make it hard to move around. But it is well worth it.
A tribute to a murdered czar. A beautiful building, with an interesting history and lots of mosaics. I liked it even more from the outside, so even if you dont have time to go in, pay a quick visit.

Take the audio tour. A gorgeous building that is also a monument to a bloody (but fascinating) part of Russian history. Treat yourself to the audio tour to get the full story. Arrive early-ish to beat the massive tour groups.

Breathtaking. I'm not big fan of looking at church/cathedrals, but Church of the Savior on Blood is something quite different, the mosaic inside the church are such an accomplishment you don't have to be a "church lover" to appreciate it.

This is Russia!. What an incredible place that is full of Russian history! This church was nearly leveled by Stalin, since he thought it was ugly. Luckily, the explosives that were to be used to destroy this place were needed somewhere else.
When you are looking at this church, you really like you are in Russia!

Must see cathedral. "Spilled blood" cathedral is one off my 2 must visits church in St Petersburg. It looks a bit like the St Basil cathedral in Moscow and remind me of a gingerbread church. The inside are very ornate unlike St Basil. You can see the spot where the Prince was assassinated. They church was built there as a result. There are lots of street vendors around and asking the canals.

Beautiful complex church in the city. We went during a 2-day luxury tour of St. Petersburg 300 USD pp via SPD (highly recommended). Small group of 12. Not sure if there's a fee as its part of a tour but I would imagine so. I think the outside is more intersting than the inside, especially on a sunny day as the colours and gold shine like a beacon.

Awesome tiling. This church is so very beautiful that words cannot describe it. The entire building inside and out is covered in tiny mosaics and I shudder to think how long it must have taken to build/make. Truly awesome and an absolute 'must see'.
MUST!. The Church of the Savior on Blood is a MUST while visiting St. Petersburg. Absolutely amazing!Its very easy to get there, very centric; and its open until "late hours.

Spectacular. We toured St.Petersburg with SPB Tours. A wonderful tour company! This was one of our stops! Spectacular church! I even purchased a beautiful print from a street artist to preserve the memory!

Spilt Blood Church of the Savior will Dazzle you in its history and sheer beauty. This is truly a wonder to behold. Struck by bomb in WWII that was undiscovered for decades as the facility was used for granary, morgue, and was purely left in disrepair. What took 24 years to complete is an amazing tribute to a fallen king and Christ himself. The walls are covered in mosaics and the spires have a unique shape intended to keep snow from accumulating. The images you will find here are purely magic. We would recommend an early visit for exterior images, there are many options within the facility and photos are permitted. It was shared that women needed a scarf for entry to cover their hair. This is no longer the case. Respect for the facility is enough. Fees seemed quite reasonable for the beauty and majestic appearance this facility possessed.

A must if you're in St. Petersburg. The best view is at night- don't miss it all lit up, but well worth a visit inside. While its not my personal taste, its amazing to see the intricate work done with all the mosaics.
Great mausoleum. Actually its was not intended to be church, inside it marks the site where a Czar was murdered and his son in tribute built the mausoleum at the site....truly a must see.....

Mosaics everywhere. This is one of the biggies to see, and it's very popular. It's understandable, since it is very doable in a relatively short amount of time, is located centrally, and is covered inside in mosaics. Floor to ceiling. Be warned that is crowded, so buy your ticket outside at the little booth, and then proceed to the area where they let you in at the side nearby. Guides lead groups, but you can do this on your own after reading about it in a guidebook.A tip to know is that it is often open pretty late - as are other tourist friendly churches there. So, this can be done at night, often up until 10pm.
It's yet another great site to visit. Do beware of your belongings, as this church is very crowded. You can take great photos both from the front and the left side of the church.

Look at it from several angles. We stopped at this cathedral during our St. Petersburg tour. The building is magnificent from the outside, with it's many turrets, gold domes and contrasting dark colours. The mosaics are outstanding. To get the full effect, we were advised to walk around the outside perimeter and view the cathedral from different angles. It truly is an awe-inspiring place.

have pictures outside. lovely outside normal inside there are some people in customs outside for 5 euros good to have a imperial pictureplease mark in the link below yes Was this review helpful? Yes to keep supporting this reviews
