Awesome. I had seen pictures of this church, but in person it was magnificent.I cannot imagine how long it must have taken to build and decorate this building. This is a must for any visit to the city.

Colourful Russian Architecture. A must see in St Petersburg. The colours and construction are beautiful.Preferably go with a guide who can explain all the amazing interior architecture & decoration to you. As it is a church wear a scarf over your head for reverence.

You won't believe your eyes! Magnificent!. I visited this church as part of a walking tour and wow... just wow. I've never seen anything like it. The inside is covered in the most vivid mosaics and ornate decorations, it's truly incredible. I'm not religious in the slightest but purely as a feat of mankind, this is a must-see. The photos are amazing but nothing beats seeing it with your own eyes!

ornate and storied cathedral. This has to be one of my favorite churches in Christendom. The use of color, geometry, and mosaic to pay tribute to monarchs and saints leaves the visitor awed and impressed with architect and icon painters alike.
church of the savior on Blood. Beautiful cathedral and the thing about this is all the paint work done inside. The statues are are beautiful. You even have to admire the flooring.

Breathtakingly Beautiful! Stunning St Petersburgs Church of Blood. This is absolutely one of the breathtaking buildings in the world - stunning. It could not be any more stereo-typically Russian if it tried. With the beautiful domes, gold, blues. St Petersburge is not short of incredible buildings but this has got to be one of the best. Words do not do this city justice, go you will not be disappointed.

One of the most wonderful churches in Russia. This church was restored to its glory after being severely damaged in WWII by the Germans. It is absolutely unique. Inside is an "art gallery" of intricate tiled mosaic icons from floor to ceiling, covering every wall. It's immensely beautiful, and truly one of the highlights of St Petersburg.

Beautiful inside and out. This is one the most impressive sights of St. Petersburg. The outside is a landmark, but when you get inside you are awestruck. There are a total of 7,000 sq. meters (that´s 70,000 sq.ft) of mosaics decorating the interior walls of the Church of the Savior on Blood. It is absolutely fantastic! There are more than 500 different types of marble composing the floor. Do not visit only the outside. Make a point to visit the church inside. You won´t be disappointed.

Extraordinary Mosaics. Amazing history & workmanship in mosaics to make this church very unique- and worth visiting. Preservation & exposure of roadway where assassination attempt of Alexander II inside church a bit "different" almost ghoulish but brings the story to life.

St. Petersburg Symbol. Probably the second most popular church in Russia, this church stands like an uncomfortable building in the middle of a canal and distorts the perfect geometry that the city has. The reason for that is that its constructed where Emperor Alexander II was severely wounded and died in 1881 after an assassination plot was consummated. The construction was completed almost 25 years later and its a fantastic example of Russian Church Architecture with its famous onion domes. Even though it was badly damage during the Russian Revolution, its incredibly well maintain and the interior worth a look with lots of mosaics and fresco displays. You simply can't miss it.

A must see in St. Petersburg.. Today the Church of the Savior on Blood is more a museum than a church. Both the exterior and interior are well worth seeing. The interior is totally mosaics. Probably something you will not experience elsewhere. While it is busy and could have long lines don't let this discourage you from visiting. It is worth the wait.

Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ. The Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ is commonly called the Church on Spilled Blood because the church was build on the spot where Tsar Alexander II was killed. The church actually juts out into a canal and a shrine is inside the church over the exact place where he died. The mosaics inside are beautiful and everything inside is covered in mosaic.

Church of Our Lord of Spilt Blood. Our tour guide from SPB Tours was instrumental in navigating the purchase of admission tickets and winding through the crowds at the entrance. With strict instructions to watch for pick pockets she walked our group of 16 around explaining in great detail historical incidents and Russian Orthodox practices. The screen is pure gold and interior artwork is breathtaking. The exterior is whimsical and one can readily see why it is often called The Cupcake Church.
My favorite all-time church!. I have been visiting churches throughout the world for most of my adult life, but have never seen one more beautiful than this. Amazing!

Amazing mosaic interior. Striking from the outside with it's very Russian domes this church is also impressive inside as it is totally covered in mosaics. I hired the English audio guide for a very reasonable price which was a bit long winded but did explain the history of the church, how the mosaics were created and the scenes from the bible which are depicted. Plenty of room despite the tours. Make sure you see the exterior even if you don't have time to go inside.

Historical Church built on the spot where Alexsandyr died. Historical sight beside one of the famous canals of St Petersburg. Famous because Tsar Alexandyr was killed on the spot where the church wing now stands and the roadway where his carriage was bombed form part of the floor of the church. Popular for weddings.

Architecturally Beautiful and Historically Important. The Church of the Savior on Blood is unforgettable. The building is both beautiful and grand -- and very different from other churches in St. Petersburg. What blew me away was the history. You actually stand in the site where Emperor Alexander II was severely wounded (and later died) in March 1881. Do not miss this!
Colorful. Very interesting place. A must see with the colorful building and intricate inside! Many local people around to observe. Busy area

Stunning Church!. The Church was restored to its glory, stunningly beautiful outside and inside.
This is probably the most picturesque church in St Petersburg.
You should definitely plan to see it!

Busy Busy Busy. This is a very colorful building both inside and out. I don't think I have ever seen so many colors and surfaces in a church. I don't know if I would call it beautiful but it is certainly ornate and they did not spare the gilt.It can be extremely crowded; there seems to be no limit on the number of tourists allowed in. And be aware there are no bathrooms.
beautiful. the art work is amazing & a bit overwhelming. The cathedral has apparently had the art work reinstalled or recreated after the end of the Soviet Union but it is worth seeing none the less.
WOW. this church is gorgeous both inside and out. The interior is completely covered by mosaics that depict scenes from the life of Christ. it is gorgeous.

A must see. Just to look at it from the outside is interesting. but joining the thousands of Russian tourists, who flock to see it, you will understand why, it is hard to understand that it was a store during the past history.

Looks just like the pictures you see!. Surprising, right? Although you can't go inside, this iconic landmark is beautiful, colorful, and set near a lovely canal and park. It's a must see if you're in St. Petersburg!
So Unique. The exterior of this church is so unique. I have visited many churches across Europe and this is among one of the best. I was impressed.
Unique. Amazing church and a must see when in St Petersburg. The mosaic work is out of this world. Get there early in the morning as you can to beat the tourist buses
Absolutely Beautiful. You can't really miss this church while visiting St. Petersburg. It's gorgeous and worth the visit. Walk around the outside as it is a bit different at each angle.

Spilled Blood Cathedral. Oh. My. Goodness. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. Actually, most of the churches in St. Petersburg are amazing, but Church of the Savior on Blood is especially beautiful!

great piece of history must see even if just from the outside. This church is exactly what you would think off for a Russian church and is therefore a must see for St Petersburg. Even if all you get to do is walk around the outside it is totally worth it.

Over the Top. The architecture is like a fantasy, and every exterior angle is a joy to behold. The inside, however, is overdone: gilded mosaics cover every inch of walls and ceilings. Look at it in a book and save your entrance fee money.
Most amazing church. I don't usually like visiting churches....seen one, seen them all. But this one was very special....floor to ceiling mosaics. Absolutely amazing.
Something to behold. Words are hard to describe the architect and beauty of this church. Wonderful Icons decorate this beautiful cathedral.

Another gorgeous church to visit whilst in St Petersburg. Gorgeous church in St Petersburg, I was pretty amazed though, to see that they had little souviner shops set up inside, bit of a shame really.

"Much too Great to Miss!". Another Wow! for visiting St. Petersburg. There are only so many words to express certain things and most already have been used. This church is iconic in more ways than one. It is probably one of the main reasons tourists flock to see what many think of when you think "Russia". The unique outside architecture is what draws you here. It is truly beautiful and visions of the onion top that you will see here feeds the adventure in all who love travel. The outside could even be enough, but then the inside is overwhelmingly addicting to any art lover, or for those who appreciate religious history, it is there. And then, there is the history of it's past, which has quite a story. So, of course you will go, because it is much too great to miss for sure.

Only inc like it. Very unique church. Great mosaic works everywhere. It's one of those places where pictures don't do it justice. You just have to see it for yourself. It doesn't take too long. A guide to share some of the history is helpful. There are also some street vendors in the nearby streets and parkway that add to the energy of the experience. We saw a street performer or two as well.

A must to see. This was my second time here and as i didn't go inside the first time. I did this time and I would highly recommend buying a ticket to see all the Russian orthodox icons inside. Just beautiful. The church was built on the spot where one of the czars was assassinated. Very busy area with many street vendors and pickpockets so watch your valuables here. Lovely park adjacent.

Over the top decoration. This church is not that historic but if you only visit one onion-dome church, this should be the one. The decor inside and out is so ornate yet I loved it.There is a market next to it and the vendors take all currencies and will bargain.
Amazing. This is the most beautiful building both inside and outside. The whole of the inside is covered in mosaic pictures. Absolutely fascinating to see. We had a very knowlegable guide.
Great experience. One of the most exciting experiences of my life. Our tour guide was awesome and explain with great detail everything about this church. I wish I could go again.
Stunning beauty. The exterior of the structure is simply amazing. Wonderful shapes and colors abound. The murals are also fantastic. Great photo stop even if you can only see the exterior.
Ornate or what?. One of the many landmarks in St Petersburg and the inside of this church is as ornate and interesting as the outside.

Superb. A really stunning example of a Russian Orthodox church in the heart of St. Petersburg. Beautiful & impressive from the outside, the inside does not disappoint either. The artwork covers every surface of floor, ceiling & walls. Although it is an absolute gift to photographers, it's almost impossible to take photos that do real justice to the real thing. It's the way that the columns hide & then reveal the internal spaces, the colours shading & shifting as you move around the place. Hard to get a better example than this. Beautiful.
Dont miss. Again just amazing inside, covered from top to bottom with mosaic pictures. We had a good guide and he was very informative
A church with history. The church with history about the murder of the emperor. Exterior and interior are both spectacular. A must see to appreciate the beauty of the church.
Awesome. Absolutely awesome. After reading reviews on trip advisor we decided to pay the entry fee and it was well worth it. The mosaics inside are just spectacular.

Distinctly Russian Beauty. For our tour we got a chance to go to one of the major churches. We chose this one because it seemed to be quintessential Russian. It did not disappoint. The outside is a photo-op must, and the inside is incredibly beautiful and interesting. Mosaics galore. I would say this is a must-see in SPB.
Wheelchair accessible. WOW, a must see! Wheelchair accessible, no problem! Don't need assistance. I will recommend it for ANY traveller.
TJ travel tour. Part of our tour of the city. Well worth a visit. Lots of history and just a stunning church visually.

Spectacular with the history of Russian treasonous murder adding to its appeal. Wow. A must this one. Spectacular outside and in. Packed with history and the inside has fabulous mosaic walls. You don't need a guide with you as all the information is easily accessed.

Guided tour. a small church compared to others we visited but just jaw dropping. The mosaic work and colours are stunning. Didn't feel crowded. So much to take in, be sure to have a audio guide to learn interesting facts. We arrived by road in our mini bus but also had a fantastic view from our river cruise.
Saviour on blood. Tickets purchased in a group got straight in beautiful cathedral perfect nothing to dislike guide was excellent
Do not miss this building. This was my favourite building in all of Russia. The inside with its mosaics blew us away. A must see

A breathtaking place to see in St Petersburg Russia,. This is an amazing sight to see, it really is beautiful building and very colourful too. It is also known as the Church of Spilt Blood as Tsar Alexander was wounded by a grenade and died as a result in 1881. The Imperial Family paid for the building of the Church which was built from 1883 to 1901. We saw it July 2013.
Do not miss it!. Mind-blowing architecture and beautiful church. Loved the audio guided tour. A spectacular monument that is like none other!

A must see. This was my favorite site in St. Petersburg. It is so different than any other church I have ever been in. The mosaic in the church is stunning. Our guide told us it is the larges mosaic in the world.
Simply Has to be Seen. This was my second visit and although I snapped many photos the first time, I could still hardly believe it when I saw it again on this visit.

One of St. Petersburg's Highlights!. Liked the onion-domed exterior more than its interior. Felt the interior was overcrowded with paintings on the walls and ceilings. Must view the church from all sides.

Most Beautiful Cathedral in St Petersburg. The Church of the Savior on Blood rivals St Basil's in Moscow except unlike St Basil's, Church of the Savior on Blood is also beautiful on the inside. It is not to be missed!
Stunning.. This is an extraordinary monument, both outside and inside and must not be missed. The architecture is stunning and so are the mosaics. Stunning.

Gorgious building. We saw this building(church) from the outside only and it is amazing how beautiful it is. Located next to a canal with thousands of people taking pictures and vendors selling their wares. Be careful of the crowds, as pickpockets are alive and well in Russia.

Probably the most beautiful church in the world. Definitely one of the most beautiful churches I visited
Everything is great, from the decorations to the history of the Church
True luxury architectonic and decorative
A magical place not to be missed in St Petersburg
A Gem. It's not as old as one would think, but well built and restored after the Communists trashed it in the 20th century

If you like to stand where history was made go here.. Having visited hundreds of cathedrals in Europe I have become very selfie on what I will walk into. This church is at a historical sight of significance as a famous assassination supposedly occurred at the site. As you read Russian history you will be pleased that you stood on this church floor

Very impressive. This outside of the church is magnificent with it's multi-colored domes. The inside is stunning with the mosaic art depicting religious themes. This church should be on everyone's list. Cameras are allowed. Watch for pickpockets, a member our group got "picked".

Six days in St. Petersburg and still so much more to see and enjoy!. Breathtakingly beautiful outside and inside, and to top it off there were five tenors singing inside the church which made it even more magical.
Must see. Another great cathedral/museum of great history. Must see and learn of the history of Russia here. Loved all the icons and carvings and the mausoleum
A MUST!. The interior of the church is even more interesting than the famous multi-colored exterior spires of the church.
Marvelous church. It was a very old elegant church. And there were worships going on there. Interiors is exquisite and atmosphere was great!

Breathtaking!. Words can really not describe this magnificent church. Both inside and out it was just wonderful and so colourful too. We were lucky as we were able to spend quite a good amount of time there.
amazing. another fantastic monument inside a fantastic city. located almost along nevsky prospekt, this is a great example of the richness of tsar time. stunning

A St Petersburg icon. Just a short walk from the Nevsky Propect along the canal. Landmark photos of the exterior and many interesting things to see inside including the shrine at the spot where Alexander II was slain and fantastic mosaics

A kitchy renewed church but full of color. I went there after visiting the Russian Art Museum. it is right outside the Museum. i would not have gone there specially. i prefer the original art in old churches

Iconic St. Petersburg postcard. This is THE must see in St. Petersburg. If you only see the outside you only get 50% credit as it is equally impressive inside. Different from the Mediterranian Roman Catholic churches in that the "pictures"'are all mosaics not paintings AND the colors are much more happy and uplifting. It doesn't just leave you in awe, it makes you smile when you least expect it. When your neck hurts from staring up above, take a look at the floor's beautiful design. Yes, it can get crowded but come back when there are no lines to get a little elbow room and really appreciate this gem. You cannot leave the city without visiting this church.
Must see. Unique church. Definately the place must be visited. Beautiful mosaic inside and great exteriour outside. And most important - you can take pictures there.

Beautiful Church. The Chuch of the Savior on Blood is something you must see visiting St. Peterburg. The inside has been restored to it's orginal beauty since being a motorcyle clubs meeting room during the communitst reign. There are some nice shopping vendors outside of the church but be careful of the pick pockets.
VERY BEautiful building. in june i was like a tourist,i made trip by boat and have seen many nice buildings,very hude and magnificent

So beautiful from every angle. If you think the outside is beautiful try the inside, please try the inside.
We visited as part of an organised tour and because it was so good we had to return the next day to take my son and daughter-in-law.

Quite simply stunning. This place is peerless in its beauty, the outside blows the mind but when you get indoors the architecture and mosaics take your breath away. Prettiest thing in st Petersburg by far.
Beautiful inside and out!. Breathtaking mosaics on the inside covering the entire interior and colorful domes that surpass the beauty of St. Basics in Moscow. Worth the price of admission.

Beautiful inside and out!. Mosaics, mosaics, mosaics! This church is amazing. The outside is so unique with its Russian domes that are all different colors and shapes. There is also a beautiful park next to the church.
***Be watchful of pick-pockets at all times***

Amazing mosaics. The mosaics - about 1cm square covered every inch of this huge church. You don't need a lot of time here as this is the feature. However, only in Moscow have I seen such fantastic mosaic work. Loved it.
Mosaics past excellence. Beautiful church with a colorful exterior and magnificent interior. Very crowded with tours and native Russians. A very popular site to visit.

Breathtaking!. Must see landmark in St.Petersburg. Nice to photograph no matter how weather is. Recommend visiting after 4PM to avoid crowds. Murals inside look modernised but worthwhile. After 5PM, taking photo with twilight background gives back plethora of sense of romantic.

Breathtaking Cathedral, Not only Inside, but Outside as Well. Having only seen this in books and postcards, I was not prepared for the massive decorated onion domes of this beautiful cathedral. I spent at least 3/4 of an hour outside photographing the cathedral from every angle and then was blown away at the mosaic work on the inside. You don't have to love cathedrals to enjoy this place, this is beauty unsurpassed and a must-see if you are in St. Petersburg!

Mesmerising. If you thought the outside's impressively colourful and inventive, wait till you step inside and marvel at floor to (soaring) ceiling mosaics. Yes it's technicolor wonderland and yes the religious imagery can be somewhat repetitive but it's a church after all and a mighty impressive one at that. You'll see the site where a Tsar was assassinated (they've left the cobbles from the street as it was) amongst all the splendour so there's a kicker for the history buffs amongst you. The highlight of my trip to St. Petersburg, without a doubt.
assassination. a heartfelt down to earth look at a beautiful building buit on the site of an assination, beautiful art work.

Breathtaking view. The bridge opposite the church is a favourite among the newly weds to click photographs and I understand why.
The exterior is so magnificent (I cannot think of an alternative adjective to describe it). The best time to visit is the at midnight or dawn during the white nights and you won't be disappointed.

Lovely inside and out. I had seen pictures of the outside of this church for years - often one of the "postcard" picts of St Petersburg. The domes outside are even more magnificent in person, and the number and quality of the mosaics inside the church are truly spectacular. It's a bit dark inside so taking pictures is challenging - may be worth buying postcards or a picture book. A beautiful stop in St. Petersburg.

Number 1. Attraction in St. Petersburg Russia.. Without doubt, this Church would have to be the most photograhed landmark in St. Petersburg.It is well worth the few roubles to buy a ticket and go inside to see such a beautifully decorated church for all people to enjoy.The many mosaics on all the walls are a photographer's delight and the church has such a calming feeling as you wander and enjoy all that is there to see.

Amazing mosaics. Amazing inside out. I have never seen a church interior like this one before. Its mosaics are beautifully made with amazing detail and incredible colours. From the outside it looks like a fairy place with twisting towers, fluid domes and lots of colours. Highly recommended.

Wonderful to visit - a world treasure. We went through in the evening so there wasn't the crowds to deal with. You need the audio guide which is inexpensive. The whole interior is decorated with tiny mosaic tiles, and is just incredible to see. Worth the visit, but be aware of pickpockets and don't let people crowd to close to you.
Very nice construction. A very nice, typical Russian style onion tower church with stunning mosaics. A must see in Saint-Petersburg
Don't miss this. This is a must see in St Petersburg. Fascinating that it is all done in mosaics - must have taken years.

Magnificent. This is only one of the many magnificent sites to visit. The outside is a beautiful architectureal masterpiece and inside are breathtaking mosaics. The crowds can be overwhelming but we used Alla tours which helped us manuver the crowds. And gave us a great understand of the problems and history of the church and country.

So beautiful.. Such a special place inside and out ,the colours are amazing .we went as part of a TJ tour so our bus dropped us right out side it gets very busy so you have to pick the right time.this place is very special place for the people of St Petersburg so don't miss it.

Catches your breath. You will see so many towers, steeples, etc throughout St Petersburg that will astonish you but the Church of the Savior on Blood really stands apart from on the rest. Spectacular colors on the outside that you will be amazed. Even if you don't go inside, it's worth stopping and checking out the outside.
What I thought a Russian Church Would Look Like. From the colorful onion dome tops, to the beautiful interior this is one church that is not to be missed.

What a tribute. What a tribute a son has given to his Father as he was murdered and this is the site where he died. The Mosaics that decorate the walls are amazing. A very interesting place to visit, once again steeped in Russian history.
Excelent site to know.. Excelent ¡¡¡ This site is good to ride with all family or friends and get a big spiritual relax and learn much.

A church and a memeorial. A beautiful and exceptional church with a history dating back to Czar Alexander II who was mortally wounded in a spot marked within that church. Read as much as you can about it and get an audio guide or a human one who speaks your language. I read about it ahead of time and the audio guide was enough

Iconic church, lived up to the hype. One of the most important sights in St. Petersburg, definitely a must-see. The outside looks like a fairy tale fantasy, all bright colors and gleaming gold leaf. The inside is filled with incredible mosaics (I have read it has the most in the world, although I am not sure whether this is true). We saw it back to back with St. Isaac's cathedral and the contrast is pretty stark.

Stunning.. A copy of the St Basilica in Moscow the exterior is not as visually exciting as there, but is still worth a few photos.The interior-Unbelievable.Can be crowded with tour groups but even they cannot spoil this marvel.

Interior architectural view of the walls and on the cieling of the church is worth exploring...Just mind boggling. The view of the interiors of the church and the architectural design on the walls and the cieling reveals the history behind it and it is just unique. The various artifacts are worth checking with the design on the exterior of the church. The history behind the name Church of Savior of blood reveals the time and effort that might have been taken to built this unique architecture.Worth Visiting.

A truly amazing church. This is an amazing church, the glass mosaics are just amazing, and to think so much of it had been destroyed during the WW 2 it is wonderful to see how the Russians have restored this beautiful church.

Nicely built, overcrowded, thanks to it being a world famous landmark. We visited the Church during our family vacation trip of Russia, while we're in St. P ; overall the Church is beautifully made, atmosphere inside and outside is nice - inside though it was quite crowded, the place still had exuded a unexplained calm - do not miss it if in St. Petersburg
Pretty, but pricier. Very pretty, worth it, but more then you may expect. inside it is lovely, especially due to all the blue, which is rare for a church at the time.

Amazing Church. This is the gem of St. Petersbug. This beautiful church is built on the site of an assassination that forever changed the course of Russian history. A master piece on the outside that is surpassed on the inside where the cobblestone street assassination site is preserved and surrounded by mosaics of the Bible.

Amazing - Definitely worth a visit inside. This is one of the nicest churches I have visited. Exterior is beautiful and inside even better. Don't miss visiting the interior of the church. Entrance fee is 250 Russian Rubles and ticket counter/entrance is on the right side of the church. The interior is covered in brilliantly coloured mosaics depicting bible characters and stories. The church is just a short stroll from Nevsky Prospect and along the canal that is opposite the Kazaan Cathedral. Watch out for pickpockets.

Mandatory visit in Peter. Difficult to avoid this one and its worth it. Better than St Basil in Moscow on some points. It will surely be crowded but you will be looking up most of the time anyway. Hard not to be impressed.

An essential stop in St Petersburg. One of my favorite spots in St Petersburg. Try to get there in the early morning as the place gets packed full very quickly. Photos of the exterior can be better taken by the bridges around it vs too close to it - a must see in this city.
Church. This was a magnificent place and a must see if you are on a tour or excursion. There is a lot of poverty right in that area, but the church itself is exquisite and pristine condition.
tour from spb tours ...was great. beautiful piece of architecture...a must visit place in st petersburg. it has a history to go with the site

Interesting architecture. Definitely worth a visit. It is conveniently located and can easily walk from Nevsky Prospect, the center of activity. Colorful mushroom domes and have your camera ready. The interior is completely decorated with colorful mosaic.

A historic site. An architectural marvel of yester-years It is a monument which has to be visited if you visit st Petersburg. For the shutterbugs the site can be best photographed from the side where the exit gate is located. The entrance side has too much of traffic for a good picture.

Amazing. I didn't want to visit the museum therefore didn't go in. It is not so expensive to visit the interior, but it was closed on a weekday. However the exterior is amazing. You must see it from all the angles. Walk across it for an amazing view of the cathedral.I visited that almost all of the 3days I was in Saint Petersburg.

Most amazing church I've ever set foot in. This place is unbelievably beautiful. We didn't have nearly enough time here. I will correct this if we ever get to return to St Petersburg. The outside is spectacular, but the inside is off the charts. There is something incredible to look at every turn you make. I could've spent hours inside. So often you are not allowed to take photos in a church, but you can in this church. It's phenomenal to say the least.

A must when in Russia!. This type of architecture is what we all want to see when in Russia. The Church of the Spilled Blood did not disappoint. The interiors are equally impressive. The unique "gaudiness" of Russia is in full display in this church. The history behind the church is equally interesting.
In the evening view.. In the evening lokmok was sinoly awesome...near to the river valley...amazing. Also very near to nevisky prospect.
White nights in St Petersburg. You have to see this church. It's very colurfull from outside and inside also. But it is very crowded. Try to go in weekdays and afternoon.

Souvenir, souvenirs, souvenirs. I didn't go inside the church, not sure whether its open to public or not. But what interesting was , on the way to the church, beside the canal, there was a long queue of stalls. A good place to buy souvenir if you still havent buy one. Go there you will not regret it.

Another must see in Saint Petersburg. We loved seeing the churches in Saint Petersburg. Each church is so different, yet so amazingly beautiful. The art in the Church of the Savior on Blood is done mainly with mosaics. The fine detail of the mosaics is spectacular.
A Must for any Tourist. This Church can only be described as being magnificent. It is one of the many must see places in Saint Petersburg The Icons and paintings will blow your mind.

Eye catching. We only had time for an outside visit of this church--it was a shame to not be able to see the inside. Many others on our shop did get inside and were very pleased!The history is critical to the story of the church. Under Stalin, they stored potatoes in it!The outside paint is really something to see--it makes us want to see some of the other brightly painted structures in Russia,

Amazing and well worth a visit. It is a really amazing chuch. So murch work has been put into it. Ceramics everywhere. It is wonderful inside and outside with the canal next to it. If you can only visit one orthodox chuch in this town, visit this one.
beautiful church with great history. We enjoyed the tour of this church and its fascinating history that we linked to Finland in a later trip.

Well worth a visit. Interesting inside but really it's the outside that is truly spectacular.
We could have photographed every angle of the outside!

Outside visit only. We visited mid day with a tour group and it was packed! We didn't have time to go in, but just taking photos of the magnificent church was enjoyable.
Watch out for the pickpockets, we saw a group of young men who were suspicious, they put on headsets (like they were tour guides) and separated into the crowds.

Magnificient and awe inspiring. Only a short walk from the back of the Winter Palace is the spot where Tsar Alexander 11 was assassinated in 1881.On the spot in 1883 work stated on the Church on Spilled Blood or also known as the Resurrction Church of our Saviour. Unlike the slightly boring baroque European style prevelant in the rest of St. Petersburg the Russian Revival style was chosen; so unlike other buildings in the City this Curch looks and fells like real Russia - like the golden domes in Moscow and the Golden Ring. The outside with its gilded and coloured domes is magnificent from all angles with its intricate detailing and stunning fresco over the main entrance. Inside is just a riot of colour and splendour, totaly ornate everywhere; from the multi coloured marble floor, the highly stylised and painted columns, to the ceiling and stunning iconostasis. Some twenty types of minerals are used. The Church is a museum and reopened in 1998 after some 20 years of careful renovation. If you only visit one Church in St. Petersbug this is the one - you will be stunned. Just take your time and let it all sink in and forget the tourists around you - they soon dissapear.
Wonderful. When you go inside you thin everything is painted but when you pay your attention to the walls you understand that it's not painted it's mosaics.
Mosaics were outstanding. Small church that is quite beautiful both inside and out. The mosaics were really lovely. Very busy, with many line ups, but definitely worth the wait.
Beautiful!. Did not enter, but the outside of the church is breathtakingly beautiful, worth a stop! Whenever I had seen it, I had to make a photo. :)
:). Breathtaking... A really big and colourful church. Unfortunately it is full with tourists most of the time. But deff, worth visiting. :)
Don't miss this church.. This is a uniquely beautiful church. From the exterior ornateness and onion domes to the massive amounts of interior mosaic work, this is a treat for the eyes.
Speechless. Whether you are religious or not, you simply have to visit it. The beauty of the place is worth the whole trip.

Exterior is stunning...interior will leave you speechless!. If all you did was to view the exterior you would have a great experience. The architecture, the complexity, the color are all beautiful. Be sure to walk all around the outside as there are so many different amazing aspects.But inside you will have a special experience. Most every pillar, wall, niche, etc is covered with 1/4 inch square mosaic tiles. Millions and millions of little pieces, many in gold, but all colorful. Each hand placed into amazing pictorials.Words and even pictures cannot begin to describe the feeling of this special site!
Stunning. This church is amazing both inside and out. Definately recommend having a guide who can share knowledge about the history and symbolism throughout the church.
Stunning inside and out. The exterior of the church is stunning. But be prepared to be completely dazzled by the amazing mosaics inside the church.

So Beautiful. This building you will probably associate with St Petersburg along with St Issac's Cathedral. This Church is a work of Art, and is an amazing example of Russian architecture. I have never seen a church with as much Gold on it or in it.
Impressive!. This is an amazing place to visit and lucky to visit as it was going to be destroyed. Has some history inside its walls!

A work of Art. This church is an amazing example of Russian nationalist romanticist architecture with its ever-so-Russian onion domes atop an intricate structure on the outside but its real beauty lies in the renovated interior which is covered virtually everywhere in the most detailed, beautiful and intricate mosaics you'll ever see. At times it's hard to believe they're not paintings. Add to this the fantastic chandeliers, gold ornament and decoration all over the place and you have one of the most extravagantly opulent churches in the world. Since its renovation it's now a far cry from its use as a vegetable warehouse during the communist era. An absolute must in a city of wonderful attractions.

Beautiful. This church is amazingly beautiful. Be aware, if you visit in the summer, there is no air conditioning - as we found is the case with most attractions in St. Petersburg! My husband suffered heat stroke while in the church but the clerics were very helpful.

Overwhelming with Beauty and History. This is one of my most favourite places in St. Petersburg. It takes hours to really appreciate everything about it - understanding the history and the destruction during the war and Stalin's reign makes one grateful that we can stand today in this amazing historical church and take in the beauty, the artistic work and the sheer majesty of the church.
Iconic building. As beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside, also, this is a great place to buy souvenirs, some of the best prices that we saw compared to all of the palaces and other shops.

It is worth the visit. This was really the most spectacular Russian Orthodox Church I saw in Russia. I was not going to go inside, but another tourist at our hotel strongly advised going. This was the last church I saw during my stay (23 days) , and really and truly the most spectacular.
A beautiful church inside and out. The huge pictures inside of this church that were made of colorful mosaics were amazing. Even the high ceilings were done this way.

a real pearl in the center of St Petersbourg. It is really a must! Moreover, it's situated in the very center of the city, so, simply walking along Nevskiy you will definitely end up by entering it! It has an incredibly beautiful exterior, but don't limit yourself by just taking pictures from outside! It's like a magic jewel box, inside it hides even more..we recommend (we did it in summer, so, check that the option is available in other seasons) to enter the church after 18.00 (in summer it is open till 22.00, so it will be not crowded and you will have lots of time to see everything in details). If you speak Russian, a guided tour is included in the entrance price, if not, you can pay for audioguides (available in several languages, not only in English)

Another W O W in St Petersburg. If it wasn't for the murder of Emperor Alrxander II, the Church of the Savior may not have been built. This church was built similar to churches in 16th century Moscow. The massive mosaic panels were created by the leading artists such as Asnetsov, Nesterov, and Vrubel. It is a must see in St Petersburg. Great pics that your friends when seeing them will say W O W!

Totally Breathtaking. Both the exterior and interior are uniquely Russian and breathtaking. There are many competing attractions in St Petersburg but that should not be an excuse to miss this one. This is not a grandeur building and indeed relatively small in Russian term, but the architecture, style, decor, color, and artworks are all polished and articulate and totally fascinating. You do not need to be religious to appreciate the beauty of the place. Of course, it is very crowded. So be there early.

Most Russian Site in St Petes. A centerpiece for the town. You will not and should not miss it. It is a magnet for street musicians, makes you wonder what St Petersburg would have been like if Peter the Great did not emulate European cities. The cathedral inside and out is a marvel.

The Hightlight of St. Petersburg. Obviously the exterior of the Church is a marvel. But just wait until you step inside! If you can appreciate the time and sacrifice that goes into creating one mosaic work of art, try to imagine an entire church plastered top to bottom with mosaics. This place is over-the-top and owning it!
Amazing . Another cultural point as a must!Amazing mosaic, great architecture and colorful as Russians always had ;-)Get there to make your own opinion- it is worthy of doing so!

Church on the Spilled Blood. Feels totally Russian and is almost overwhelming in the details of the decor which is almost all tiny mosaics. It's utterly beautiful and as ever the history of its building and how it survived the siege in WW2 is amazing

For me, the most beautiful church in Russia. The Church of the Savior on Blood, also known as the Church on Spilt Blood, is dedicated to Alexander II who was killed outside it by a bomb. The startling external beauty of the church makes one thankful that the plans to raze it to the ground in the Soviet times was stopped by the city architect who probably recognized its artistic value. It is artistically exquisite, a masterpiece of mosaic and design. This is a must-see in St Petersburg. TIP: try to come early to beat the crowds. Beware pickpockets, there are many reports of successful stealing in the tourist-heavy areas of St Petersburg.

Kitsch. This church was built in the Moscow style in the xix century. It´s quite kitsch and artistically speaking it´s rather lacking. Inside there are interesting mosaics by artists like Vrubel, Nesterov. It was built on the site where Alexander II was murdered in 1881.If you don´t have much time there are plenty of more interesting places to visit.

Spilled Bood Church. The Russian style multicoloured onion domed church with the facade with glazed shaped brick and ceramic tiles and designed with mosaic panels. The interior had Italian marble and Russian semiprecious stones.
amazing!!!. The detail that went into this church is unbelievable. Definitely worth the visit. Highly recommend having a guide to give a bit of history / cultural relevance to the visit.

It's pretty like its pictures. Glad that we visited it, although it is crowded. Suggest to take exterior picture from both front and back (next to a canal/river) to make sure it is not backlit. The altar is absolutely stunning.
If you're Orthodox, you must come. Spectacular. That is all I can say. The art is breathtaking. My only warning is that pickpockets are everywhere. My friend lost his wallet. Beware!

Wow very impressive. I absolutely love this church,,what an amazing experience!!
what a beauty, the mosaic is just incredible!!
The outside is also unique I just loved the visit to this church!!,

Another photo-worthy St Petersburg site. Visited this Church as part of a tour group. Spectacular mosaics that look just like paintings. Don't forget to look up at the ceilings as every inch is decorated. Big crowds!

Very Russian. This place is unbelievable both inside and out. The inside is filled with massive mosaic pictures which have been restored perfectly. The floor is covered with marble inserted patterns. Very impressive place. Outside there is a walk around with small stalls of souvenirs.

Church on the blood. Like the other cathedrals lots of art everywhere. But this Cathedral had a lot of history attached to it. I don't remember which emperor was killed in that location, it was one of the Alexanders. Anyway, his son or grandson built this church in his memory. It seems that it was dangerous to be an emperor in those days. Emperors seem to be in the crosshairs of someone's rifle. We enjoyed seeing this church as we enjoyed all the others. One thing I would recommend: Carry a small recorder. There is too much to try to remember!

Incredible artisans. Not only is the outside of this church spectacular, but the inside is a remarkable work of art. Every inch of the interior is covered in colorful tile mosaics. Religious scenes and icons are detailed in beautiful pastels and gold miniature tiles. The workmanship is just incredible. Definitely worth a visit.
AMAZING!!!. This church is absolutely amazing inside AND outside! Great story that goes along with it also. I couldn't wait to see this in person & it was worth it!
Day 7 in Russia. It's amazing! I didn't know what to expect on the inside and it is spectacular. So colorful and with so many tiles! Definite must see.

Very memorable! Have your camera ready!. I could have stayed here all day. Alot of guided tours in St Petersburg only show you the outside of this church. If you think the outside is beautiful you haven't seen anything until you step inside. It is truly magnificent. If you can only see one church in St Petersburg, make sure this one is it! You will be blown away

Wonderful mosaics. The outside is quite a concoction of domes, colours and decoration. Something like St Basil's in Moscow. It is the inside that is truly splendid. Decorated with soaring mosaics of icons or biblical figures, it is truly a work of art as well as a prime religious venue. Crowded with tour groups it is hard to find a quiet corner to contemplate the art or meditate. Very well worth queuing and the couple of dollars ticket price. A must see in St Petersburg.

Better than St. Basil's. It brought tears to my eyes--so beautiful in the bright sunshine of St. Petersbury. And to think is was about to be torn down some years back. It was in terrible state of repair and has been magnificently restored. The mosaics inside are so perfect--perfection. The doors behind the altar are eye popping. No way to describe how beautiful it is, inside and out. Cost about $10 US to get in.

Well spent 2x 250 Ruebels. Amazing mosaeique! - however, if you've got a stiff neck, this is not the place for you, as you'll be looking up the entire time ;-) An audio head set is offered for an additional 100 Ruebels. Architecture, light and colours are amazing!
Another work of art. Again, beauty, architecture and craftsmanship is astounding. The tributes the people of the day paid to their deity and saints is remarkable.

gorgeous. The story of the church is interesting enough, but you have to go inside to see it. The sheer beauty of every space being covered by art is inspiring. It's crowded but amazing. For a great picture of the church, go up the road to Nevsky Prospeck and take a picture from there.
A need to see. This is a really must to see.The outside is beautiful specially when you enter the side from the park.The inside is astonishing in beauty and colors.

Beautiful!. A personal highlight of my visit to St P. Simply beautiful inside & out. Although I enjoyed St Basil's in Moscow, the exterior here is a little less gaudy: less Disney, more stylish & artistic; and with the benefit of being able to be seen at a distance, down the length of the canal. Whatever you do, don't miss the interior. It is covered with mosaics which have some level of glass content and so appear much brighter & fresher than frescoes. And an amazing feature is the display of photos of its terrible condition after WW2 - makes you wonder where they found the motivation (& the money!) to restore it from such a ruin. Not to be missed.
Beautiful church. Such a beautiful story behind this church as well as the architecture is stunning. It is very crowded so be careful of people that may pick pocket you. Definitely worth seeing.

Stunning but beware of pick pockets. Very lovely church, stunning both outside and in. Full of mosaic wall decorations. But be careful, our group was fine but we later heard anither tourist had her purse stolen. Because of the amount of cruise ships and tourists pick pockets are a problem all over the sights.

Don't Miss This Church. This Church was built on the site of the murder of Tsar Alexander II in 1881. It commemorates his death and is built over the spot where his blood was spilled thus the name "Church of the Spilled Blood". This church was scheduled for destruction by the communists and even had the explosives in place to blow it apart when World War II started. The explosives were need to defend Leningrad so the church was saved. During the siege of Leningrad, a German high explosive shell hit the roof but failed to explode. This is a wonder to behold. The mosaic works are magnificent and the exterior is beautiful. It has not been reconsecrated so it does not serve as a church again but there is always hope.

well worth seeing. Packed with visitors, but worth the jam. Site of the assination of one of the emperors, and richly decorated throughout! Still retains the feel of a religious site even with the crowds!

Be sure to go inside!. We have visited a whole lot of churches in our travels, however I have never seen one where the entire interior is filled with shimmering glass mosaics. Jaw dropping - so beautiful it is hard to take it all in.

A site to see but watch the pickpockets!!!. Amazing reconstruction effort to restore this memorial - it has never been a functioning church but a memorial to a slain Tzar. If you are into photography I'm not sure what is more spectacular the detailed turrets and decoration of the outside or the magnificent bejewelled alter gates and internal decoration.However, there are many pickpockets in this area one tried to unzip my backpack but I caught them before they could remove anything - I thought I was well away from the crowded area and had just slowed down to join the queue to re board my coach trip when they jostled me and I heard the zip opening - I was quick enough to swing my pack off and away from prying fingers. also lots of beggars including children that bumped into you feeling pockets. We were early in the season when there were not a lot of tourists so it would be worse in the crush of peak season

Magnificent . Magnificent! !!That's the 9nly word I can describe it It's amazing wonder how patiently the work and restoration has been done even after the destruction by bombs and shells The high dome where christ looks down upon you is a treat to watch

Amazing Orthodox Church. This Church is located in center of St Petersburg. Place is beautiful outside and amazing inside with many details and places to see around. It is a beautiful Orthodox Church that you cannot miss when visiting this beautiful city.

Spectacular. One of the highlights of my trip to St. Petersburg.. A trip to St. Petersburg appealed to me primarily due to photos I'd seen of this church. It was just as spectacular as I had imagined! The vivid colors are beautiful. This is a 'must-see' if you are in Russia.
Church of the Spilled Blood. One of the beautiful Churches in Russia. Many beautiful objects of history found here. Really enjoyed our time here & definitely worth the time.

More than "one more church"!. Lately I have been appreciating the acronym ABC (another bloody church) but if you find yourself in that mind set, suspend it for this church. Words cannot adequately express the scenes, the sights, the art you will see wherever you gaze within this building - it is truly amazing. I suggest you complete some research before visiting just so you might more fully appreciate what you see. Unbelievable!

great place to visit. Fantastic church, pretty amazing to see but get here first thing as the tourists son flock up. googleit for the history, you dont need a guide and get to the inside - its awesome. make sure you walk through the park next door, a lovely place but dont forget to notice the old church behind you as you stand at the front of the spilled blood church..its pretty cool too

A Beautiful Tribute. This is a magnificent property among many in St. Petersburg. The outside is unimaginably beautiful. The inside is full of mosaics which are works of art.
The assassination was actually outside the church although there is a shrine inside.
It is crowded and one can spend twenty minutes walking through.

Magnificent architectural structure. A splendid architectural structure with a sad history behind it. The interior is as magnificent as the exterior of this church - definitely worth visiting. The park next to the church is also a nice to place to take a stroll
A Church Architecture Wonder. It was an archetecual and artist paradise, It was a complex structure well decorated on the internal and external faces.
One of the most beautiful churches I have visited.. This is a must when in Leningrad. It is worth a few hours, to visit, and it is in the city center. Highly recommended.

Stunning!. Visiting this church is a must. It was fascinating to see the spot where the Tsar was mortally wounded and we marvelled at the ornate mosaics. However, I think it was the outside I will remember longest-it's just so unusual and imposing. Try to view it from the canal too-preferably from a boat! Like many other St Petersburg sights, it was really, really busy so try to go early.

Incredible. St. Petersburg is full of contrasts. The old Rusia and the new blend in so many ways and places..... And this church is one of it. The story is so sad but yet so amazing. You feel you are in a movie. It's work and the details are absolutely astonishing! The Mosaics are incredible. A MUST when you visit St. Petersburg. Remember to take a guided tour. It will give you the whole view....and you may feel like Anna Karenina!!

Not to be missed!. St Petersburg is full of places to see - in fact, it's easy to call everything "must see". But this Church - also known as the Church of the Spilt Blood - is one of the most beautiful and unusual places I have visited. It's also in an area where you are vulnerable to pickpockets and thieves...The Church first. There are 7500m of mosaics, that are indescribable. The place shines and glows. There's a shrine to Emperor Alexander II, who was blown up on that very spot - the actual cobbles form the heart of the shrine. Amazing!The building itself is also striking, with its towers and roofs of different colours. It is worth seeing so don't be put off by the threat of pickpockets etc. be sensible and keep your wits about you, just don't stop for anyone trying to sell you calendars, books etc.

Beautiful. didn't go inside but outside was good enough for me, also loved the atmosphere lots of people gathered around outside and a lovely park and an Italian restaurant. Everything was as you would expect form a famous landmark.

The most beautiful church in St. Petersbug. The church is a jewelry, both inside and outside. Take an audio guide and you'll be amazed of the history of this great church. It will also explain all that is represented inside and outside, the mosaics and many other tings that otherwise you wouldn't notice. It will take you an hour the most. Best spent hour in St. Petersburg. Also, go there during the long sunset and you'll have great pictures of it from the bridges near.

Where Gaudi meet gaudy--in a good way!. It's not like you can miss this if you're in St. Petersburg. It's so wonderfully excessive, and right in the middle of things. On weekends, you'll see many brides and grooms (some in their Cinderella carriages) arriving for wedding photos. The inside is as full on as the outside--wall-to-wall saints and murals. Along the river there are lots of vendors selling everything from Russian dolls to refrigerator magnets. A most picturesque scene!
A must to visit. A beautiful church, very easy to find and must be on your agenda when in St Petersburg. Stunning. Mosaic work is breathtaking.
Stunning!. A MUST see (both inside and out) while in St. Petersburg! So much to see - the mosaics inside are like nothing you have seen! Highly recommend a stop here!

Watch out for Pick Pockets/Street Sellers. I witnessed 3 pick pockers in front of the church - where they try to sell you calendar/poster. One guy will try to use the item to block your front view - so they can apporach your valuables from below. The second guy will go for the back for anything he can get. The third guy will standby on the side for transport the "stolen goods". I saw them they literally try to pull the bag out from an elder woman in day light once they know she is alone by herself.
Just amazing. You cannot leave St Petersbourg before visiting this church. A must go, even if packed with tourists!

Spectacular church inside and out with great Russian history. This is the style church you think of when you think Russian church. And it lives up to the expectations. It is extremely picturesque from the outside so make sure to walk around the entire church. The inside is beautiful as well but is also very different in style and beauty from the other St. Petersburg cathedrals.There is also alot of history here as this is the site where Alexander II was killed by terrorists. There is a very nice memorial to this inside in the church that surrounds the exact area where he was murdered.This is a must see attraction in St. Petersburg!

Unique religious decoration. Like: The interior is unlike any other church and religious or not it should be seen for this alone.Dislike: The football match like atmosphere due to the sheer number of tourists.

Such a stunning church!. This is one of theose church that will stay in your memory forever, both inside and out. The stunning onion domes on the outside and the incredible artwork on the inside are just breathtaking. No visit to St Petersburg is complete without visiting Church of the Savior on Blood.
Awesome. This was number one on my list of things to see and it didn't disappoint. We saw lots of other impressive churches, but not like this. Wow.

Beautiful Mosaics. Stunning architecture, the location is beautiful surrounded by gardens, great audio guide and if you are hungry afterwards there is an excellent nice high end restaurant called MeatHead next door.
Awesome in the truest sense. It's fabulous. Must see inside and find out the story of why it was built. Interesting history. Compares to Haggia Sophia in Istanbul on a smaller scale.

Be sure to get inside. Breathtaking mosaics definitely worth seeing inside! You will be captured with beauty of this church.
Admission varies depending on time of visit. It's cheaper to get tickets before 6PM (250 rubles), if you visit after 6PM until 10PM it costs 400 rubles
Gorgeous mosaics. Highly decorated. Beautiful mosaics covered every inch of wall space. Outside is typical Russian highly decorated church.
Try to get pictures before the crowds arrive.. Wonderfull church to take snaps of so visually stunning , the history of church is sad but one of the must see thing in this part of Russia.
spectacular. stunning mosaics, siberian stone work... unique place, very different from any other churches to visit

What a magnificent monument, seems out of Fairy Land. Suggest starting from Nevsky Avenue and the beautiful canal one can walk the pedestrian street towards this magnificent church. Over the bridge on Nevsky Avenue the first photos can be shot.
Beautiful. Did not enter as was told by others that it's the outside that is the most stunning. The outside is magnicifent though.

Nice, it is worth to see, for a once.. Quite interesting churge, but pritty small one. It is more beautiful outside I whould say. Not lots things to see inside, but it is worth to see for a once at least.

A must in St Petersburg. This is an outstanding building both outside and in. The mosaics are beautiful and the interior decoration very special. While the rest of the city's highlights can be very European this is one spot that exceeds the hype. Do not miss it!

Another Grand Church. It may sound tiresome, but after your fiftieth Church it is hard to distinguish one from another, yet this Church has an air about it that speaks of history and struggle and prayer, worth a visit, bring good walking footware.
Fascinating and beautiful. Easy to get to and not overcrowded. Spectacular architecture and décor. Could do with more information in English

Colourful and splendid inside and out.. The church with its history of having been founded on the spot where Czar Alexander was assassinated is magnificent. Czar Alexander did not die here but a few hours later, from the blood he lost on this spot. Hence the name of the church.Walk around the church to view it from all angles, particularly from the back where there is a street market with tourist souvenirs. There is a charge for entering the church, which is a museum, but it is well worth the price for the beautiful Icons and frescoes which cover every surface.

Visually stunning. I've seen many chapels, churches, basilicas and cathedrals in Europe. Nothing quite compares to it. The exterior is lovely enough. It says Russia. Nothing quite prepares you for the mosaics that occupy the interior of the church. Pictures really don't do justice to it. This is definitely one place you really need to see to appreciate.

Impressive. The St Saviour cathedral may not be a medieval Moscow-style building, but it is impressive none-the-less. Startling mosaics and marble floor, plus icons. Not to be missed if you wish to view 'modern' Orthodox architecture.

Cool but not amazing!. I think time of year, as well as, how far you are traveling makes a big impact on perspective. I went in the winter, there wasn't much sun (if any at all). So, it was very dreary and cold (which was expected), and we walked around the building for a few minutes, and made a decision not to go in. We spoke to some people who had been in that day, and decided to skip the tour. The architecture was super neat, and I'm glad I saw it. From what I remember, there was a lot of shopping near by. I liked being in the busier spots of town and experiencing the culture the most. I don't regret not taking the tour, and I do recommend site seeing around Russia in the summer if at all possible. Take a look at my photos compared to the summer photos, it seems to be a HUGE difference!

Impressive on the outside and in!. The exterior is very pretty and bears a slight resemblance to St, Basil's in Moscow. The interior has paintings on the walls and ceilings portraying scenes from the bible. There's also a canopy that marks the exact sight where Alexander the 2 was struck by an assassin's bomb.I purchased the audio guide also but found it rather drab, just too many trivial details of the materials used to construct the church.

amazing mosaics. This is the quintessential " onion dome" church in Russia, if you only see one church while in Russia, this ought to be the one.The mosaics inside are breath taking, the architecture outside is gorgeous although you might have to risk life and limbs to take pictures and be run over by one of the many tour buses that get parked haphazardly around it. Be also careful( we were warned) that while you admire the onion domes outside, someone does not get busy picking your pockets... apparently it happens pretty often around this particular attraction.I am very happy it was not blown up as it was apparently the original bolshevik plan during the revolution.

Definitely must. The church is not an old one but very interesting. It is similar to the one in Moscow. Interior is full of mosaic.Entrance costs 250 RUB (~4€). You may need (including photos) around 1hour in total.

Beautiful church - worth the time!. We had a tour guide who made sure to take us to this beautiful church with a tragic history. Well worth the diversion to go here. It was the most beautiful church in the city, for sure!

More Amazing St. Petersburg . I don't want anyone to think that I am totally in love with St. Petersburg, but it has absolutely become one of my favorite cities in the world. There is so much to see and has been lost in the constant political confrontations and photos of the new (relatively speaking) national capital of Moscow. This is my third review of places to see in one city and I have never done that before. The whole city is amazing!

Can't believe I asked if I needed to see inside. Having spent a lot of time in Russia, I asked my Russian friend if I needed to see the inside of the Church of the Savior. I'm an idiot. The whole thing on the inside is mosaics. It's unreal. An absolutely top top site.
Stunning Church.. The church is stunning inside and out. The entire inside is made of floor to ceiling mosaics. Just amazing to visit.

The most beautiful church in Ortodox style. For my humble opinion, Savoir-on-blood church is the most beautiful church created in Ortodox style. It's quite hard to decide, is it more beautiful inside or outside. Lots of small details, incredible mosaic inside, amazing exterior. It's one of the symbols of St-Peterburg. It definitely worth to visit. There is a possibility to buy tickets on-line (cathedral.ru) which allow you to avoid big queues. Best time to visit early in the morning just after the opening.

Beautiful Church. This church is a must see in St. Petersburg. The outstanding architecture and beautiful interior is just fabulous. The colorful mosaics inside must be seen to be believed. Don't miss this wonderful attraction.
Breathtaking. A must see site. A magnificent church with great architecture and beauty. Full of history. Should be viewed from every angle on the outside. Just a short walk from Nevsky Prospect.

Good Even for a Quick Ten Minute Stop on the Outside. If you're interested in Russian History and Drama, then the story behind this Church is most certainly for you, and something that you can learn about when visiting. Even if you have 10 minutes to spare on a tour, then make sure to get out of the bus and walk around the Church of the Savior on Blood. The architecture, at least from the perspective of an American, seems quintessentially Russian, and the street vendors and performers that crowd around the church are also quite entertaining. Try and stop by!
Must visit. A must visit, One of the greatest architectures in St. PetersburgWent there is Jan, the river was frozen, and the graden was great for taking photos.
Gorgeous. Amazing inside and out! It's not likely that you would miss this on any organized tour. I found the history fascinating. The restoration work was wonderful.
Must see in St Petersburg. This church is absolutely amazing. The whole outside of it is covered with colourful ceramic tiles. When the sun is shining the colours are spectacular.

History is vibrating here. The church of the Saviour on Blood is a memorial church built in Memory of Czar Alexander ll who abolished serfdom in 1861. He was killed for this. The interior of the chuch, now a museum, is impressive and definititely worth a visit.

Breathtaking wondrous and splendid. IF you do nothing else on a trip to St. Petersburg, you simply MUST stop at this iconic landmark. Words can't begin to describe the awe, beauty, significance, architecture, importance and sheer overwhelming character of this magnificent Church. If you can do it, try to find a tour that allows for a decent time to take in all the splendor and be prepared for long lines and lots of cameras. While we were there, we had the unusual and fortuitous viewing of the astounding floor. The rugs had been taken up the day before to be cleaned. The floor is something rarely seen.

So beautiful, historic, interesting and colorful. This amazing structure is located on a canal. In order to really appreciate it you have to walk around the inside, and the outside as well. The 308 (!) mosaics are extraordinary. Locate the red carnations in the little chapel that marks the spot of the tragic attempt upon the life of Emperor Alexander II.
Very nice picture stop/ Park too. This is one of the nicest Churches we saw when we visited SP. Make it a stop to see. Check out the park across the street.

Good, should be visited, only a short visit though. Of course this should be on everyone’s list when visiting the city, and for 250 Rubles per adult it isn’t bad value for a major tourist attraction. And a fantastic attraction it is too. The artwork and monuments inside are truly inspiring and a must see. It is great that they allow photography inside (just no tripods or flashes) and there are enough descriptive signs should you wish not to purchase the additional audio guide. The only thing dropping the full five stars for me was that there were no toilet facilities within the building. Within the area you’re limited to a ‘pay at the window’ portaloo on the street outside and nothing else. Do consider this as I found it a little surprising. Added to this you’re only able to wander around a single area of the building and this felt a little underwhelming, although I can’t argue that what you can see is impressive. As a result you can't dedicate even an hour to looking around the interior, although plenty of photo opportunities outside. Still, a sight to take the time out to visit.
RUSSIA IS HERE. The most amazing and impresive cathedrals , decorated with mosaic inside and outside, and the most interesting history of the place !

Amazing Russian Classical Style. A must see in St. Petersburg! Go early to avoid the crowd, or visit late during the White Nights. The nearby parks are also wonderful. Just a short walk from Nevsky Prospect.
very good. this is one of the must see sites and well worth visiting ,lots of history ,the last Tzar was died here ,lovely building inside and out.
Great sight. One of the most beautiful Russian style churches and it is centrally located for easy visit. A must.

Great - Very nice. One of the must sees in St.Petersburg - well thats my opinion! Located close to the Palace Square, you w ill find this awsome church build in tipical "Russian" style with onion shaped domes, and this once a very colorfull and also very nice decorated. The view on this church is amaizing when you from the side where the entrace is, but much better view you will have when you exit the church on the other side. The church is very impresive from outside, but when you once enter the church you will be even more inpressed. The paintings inside are inpresive, take enough time to walk all around the church when you are inside, and dont miss to find the small cross on the right side in front of you when you are looking from the point where you have entered the church especially when you are there and the sunlight is falling from outside through the small window on this small magnificent cross.Inside the church you will also find a small shop, but its better to buy the suveniers outside the church, just when you exit the church on the opposide side then you have entered it ! Take some free time during your visit in St.Petersburg and visit this church.

Well worth a visit but feels a little lacking. Well worth a visit to see the interior. It is not a church per say so lacks the patina of age and incense! The building is of its time but the scale is what is magnificent. The exterior is best viewed with blue skies! Lots of stalls and buskers around. Mind your bags!

Amazing& Historic. The Church catches your eye right from the moment you see its domes from Nevsky Prospect. The abundance of decoration makes you go inside the Church to reveal it is even more beautiful from the inside! Mosaics, majolicas, frescos - all these elements of the decoration impress you more and more as you pass through the Church.
Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. Beautiful in day or night. Expecially at night when it is lit up. Like Paris, people put locks on the bridge there.

a wonderful piece of history. Fantastic piece of architecture & history all rolled into 1 building.
A startling example of the division between the rich & the poor

Church of the Savior on Blood. Couldn't go inside -- the architecture was amazing!! Very worth while to drive by, at least. Must see. I'm not sure when it will be open. What you want to see in St. Petersburg!

An amazing site - inside and out. Don't go to St. Petersburg and not see the inside of this church. It's incredible. The mosaics are stunning - simply stunning. The audio guide was well worth the price - and greatly added to our appreciation of the Church.

god will bless me. The Chruch of the Savior on blood is one of the main sites to be seen in St. Petersburg, Russia. The most appealing or another word would be interesting is that this church was built on the pool of blood of then the king Emperor Alexander II. The history of the place is beautiful and it is a must see.
Absolutely stunning!. We toured with ALLA Tours, and this was included in the itinerary. Admission was included, and our guide was very informative! Very crowded, but well worth seeing!
Magnificent mosaics. over 7000 square meters of biblically themed mosaics adorn the interior of the church...fantastic! Beautiful exterior. Do not miss this Church.

Wonderfull. I must say I prefer this church from the outside !
I is even more stunning and the inside is just interesting
AMAZING. A must see when you go to St. Petersburg. I will never forget this place. It is full of charisma and history
Seeing is believing. I do not know how to attempt to describe this place. You just have to experience it for yourself. Two words would be stunning and unforgettable.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful. Too think this was almost lost. Ironically a devastating war halted its destruction from the communist party.
One of a Kind Architecture. The only Eastern Orthodox architecture in the Neo Classical city. Situated on the canal, it is a gathering point and iconic spot to take a photo. It does not disappoint.

Stunning Mosaics. The ticket was 500 I think, almost all are. When you look at the art work, remember Mosaics!! When you see the height and the work in the arches, look at the size of the mosaic stones.A nice part of the overall art and architecture of the city. If you lived in a city like this, you will probably be as helpful and kind as the locals. They have a lot to be proud of.

wow. well worth the jostling, every inch of space has been covered in beautiful mosaics telling stories from the bible, even if your not religious you can appreciate the artistry and craftsmanship, plus the resolve of the Russians keeping them safe during the war

An incredible site. The location of Alexander II's assassination, this Russian Orthodox Church is a splendid visit. Wonderful colored domes. We were warned that pickpockets frequent the area so beware.
Stunning Beauty. The mosaics are breathtaking. In fact, everything about this church is breathtaking, both on the inside and out.
Visually unique. Definitely worth a walk-by. It is one of the more unique buildings I have ever seen. I'd stop by to/from a visit to the Hermitage.

A must visit when in Saint-Petersburg. I thought the church was at least hundred years old but in its current state it is just 25 years old, it was renovated after the perestroika kicked in. Very beautiful from the outside, but you have to see the interior too. Too bad there was no english spoken tour when we were there. Don't forget to walk through the adjacent park.
Beautiful. A stunning place, the stonework is amazing. My 5 year old daughter enjoyed it, too, following the story of Jesus by lovely paintings on the walls.

Amazing except for tour groups. This church is unique as the interior is entirely covered in mosaics. Really quite something! The outside is beautiful as well and photographs well from many different vantage points. Make sure you go around the the back of the church as this affords a better view down the canal.

Nice outside, impressive mosaics. The outside of the cathedral is already very impressive, even though built in the 19th century it was deliberately designed in the old Russian style. The inside contains great mosaics, the whole church (walls and ceilings) are covered with them and the place where Alexander II was assassinated is marked by a marble building inside the church (the initial reason to build the church there).

Stunning mosaics and iconic onion domes. Wow! Turned the corner and saw this amazing site. We went to the hermitage (horribly crowded) and then our tour dropped us off for some free time in the shopping district. Pay outside and show your ticket at the door. On the opposite side are little kiosks selling souvenirs. There are two corners within the church that sell souvenirs. They have a book with photographs of all the mosaics. Many sites to see nearby.
Ongelooflijk . Prachtig , ben blij dat ik naar binnen ben gegaan. The audioguide is usefule but you can do without just read a bit about it.Really worth a visit beautiful Icons and more. Wonderful.

A must see in St. Petersburg/Russia/life. The outside is stunning! Take pictures from the distance and up close. One great view is on the bridge a block or two away - provides great landscape of the city and the Church. Also - pay the rubles to enter the church. Unlike many of the churches you see all over the world, everything inside is a mosaic (vs. painting). They are everywhere and beyond beautiful!

Certainly a must see - Do not buy Petersburg Tourist Card. nice visit, less busy end of day. Do not use St-Petersburg Card... it is a waste of money and most important attraction in St-Petersburg are not included (hermitage, peterhoff palace, Catherine palace, imperial porcelain museum, and many other sites; you will either only recuperate 30% to break even...

An unbelievable example of typical Russian art. Even if the church is recent (buit at the end of the 19th Century), it was done according to the rules of traditional russian crafts, with the largest mosaics ever and many icons. The church is very beautiful when you are outside and the inside is stunning. Visits are possible until 10 pm.
Very impressive. What can you say it's one of the most beautiful churches in Europe if not the best. Buy the photo stamp so you can take pictures freely
Absolutely have to go see. The photo opportunities here both inside and out blew us away. Go Go go!!!!! You will love it. The pictures on here speak for themselves but don't do it justice.
Church of the Savior on Blood. Well worth the time to visit when you are in St. Petersburg. Our guide with Alla tours was so knowledgeable in the the historical significance of this beautiful church.

Fantastic, do not miss it. Really unique, beautiful church. Entry is free. Beside the building it is also interesting to watch locals doing their prayers. Of course do it inj a polite way without starring at them.
