Awestruck, a must while in St. Petersburg. I have been to churches all over the world but this has to one of the most impressive. If you are in to mosaics, this is the place for you. This has to be top 3 things to do while in St. Petersburg.

Awesome Church. The mosaic interior is out of this world - gorgeous. The artwork is awe inspiring. Souvenior shops inside the church were reasonably priced and they had a large variety to choose from. Just behind the church, you would find a large number of stalls/flea markets where you would find lovely souveniors at a cheaper rate.
Beautiful. Unbelievable sight, almost too much to take in in such a short visit. There were so many visitors there that you just had to stand in one place and turn around slowly.
Mosaics!. This cathedral is an all-encompassing aesthetic experience. The floor is beautiful multicolored stone inlay. All other surfaces are covered with gorgeous mosaics. A beautiful experience.

fantastic mosaics. wonderful site. restoration history and mosaics were incredible. It was worth the time, even though it was crowded when we went. We used "Best Guides" tour group in St. Petersburg. They took care of our travel visa!

What a beautiful church. Loved the art work and interior and exterior of this gem. I took so many pics in this church that I had to put another sim card in my camera. It took 28 years to finish the inside of this church and you will definitely see why it took that amount of time. The exterior was also a wonder, with beautiful designs and art..
Wow!. Magnificent mosaics. Interesting provenance. It's a real must-see! It is advisable to take an audio-guide.

Spectactular church. beautiful mosaic history on all walls inside. Spectacular architechture both inside and outside. nice located at the canal bank in the city centre. easy accessible both walking down the nevsky prospect or by taking the city tour bus :)
Not to be missed!. Not only is the outside stunning, inside is worth a visit too. Mosaics line the walls and ceilings. Absolutely beautiful!

Spectacular Russian domed church. Spectacular domed exterior that you must see from all sides. A lot of the tour groups just drive by the outside, we specifically picked a tour group that went inside, so glad we did. The entire inside of the church is mosaic tile, the floor, walls, ceiling, columns. The tiles are made of various stones( malachite, jasper, marble, etc). Amazing to see all this beautiful art work and then get up close and see that it is florentine mosaic. This Church of the Savior is also called Church of the Spilled Blood, because Alex II was assassinated at this site in 1881 and they built the church in 1883. Interesting to note that orthodox churches do not have pews as they stand for their 1 hour services.

Stunning to see. Certainly one of the top attractions in St Petersburg, it's a stunning looking church that should be on everyone's itinerary.
Also a grand feeling when you enter the church, Europe is full of churches church of the saviour on blood would be in top 10 on my opinion to see.

Unbelievable !!!. No need say a lot. It is a MUST GO place. Outside, inside, all are beautiful. No doubt, if you are in St. Petersburg, you will go there and love it. You will also buy a magnet of it to take home :))

Beautiful!. The Church on Spilled Blood is amazing and should be on all traveller's visit lists.We first saw it from the river during a boat trip and thought it was amazing but that was nothing compared to standing outside.It is also worth going inside. The interior is decorated with the most wonderful mosaics. Don't miss the beautiful doors and be-jeweled panels.It cost 400 roubles to go in. It was shut from 17.00 to 18.00 when we visited in early May so we had a small wait before we could go in - definitely worth it though!

A magnificent memorial to Alexander 11. This church is breathtaking from the exterior and even more so inside. It was built on the site of the assassination of Alexander 11, the spot with its cobblestones preserved in the interior. The mosaics are marvelous as is the iconostasis. A must see for sure.

Stunning!. Because of the area around this church being built up its difficult to get the full impact of the colourful and ornate exterior facades but inside is simply stunning. A riot of colour on every surface. With exquisite screens behind the alter area.It can get VERY busy and be prepared to fight for your personal space as some people can be rude and just barge you out of the way.A must see if you go to St. Petersburg.
must see. it is a beautful museum & stays open till 10 P.M. in summer.lots of iconographic icons & artwork.there is nothing to dislie other than hords of tourist.so go early for the visit.
impressive. not the kind of church we are used to in the west , but exterior is fascinating .. interior a bit less

Architecture, History, Beautiful. I stopped by next to the Church of the Saviour on Blood as a part of my tour trip. It's beautiful with so many bright colours, if you have several days to stay in St. Petersburg I advise you to go there without a tour guide, buy tickets and see whats inside,not only outside.
Amazing. truly amazing!! This is a MUST SEE in St. Petersburg!! The exterior of the church is beautiful and the interior mosaics are stunning!The mosaics are really fantastic

Beautiful church. The church is very beautiful. I love the exterior with its bright colors and whimsical spires. And the interior is so intensely decorated - it must have taken an enormous amount of work to complete it.The matronly attendants can be a bit over-zealous in their enforcement of the rules, but hey, welcome to Russia.Gets crowded at times.

Fantastic to call it the least. We had only seen it from the outside as part of of a bus tour but oh my God, what a surprise when you go in and see all ghe magnificent mosaics and the marble floor.
You should NOT miss this attraction under no circumstances

Stunningly beautiful!. This has to be the signature of St. Petersburg. Its distinct colourful patterned domes were some wonderful tourist magnets. They look different during the day and night with the reflection of the different lights.The mosaic murals inside the cathedral were some of the best I've seen. Each and every inch was covered with icons in vibrant colours. The canopy over the spot where emperor Alexander II was mortally wounded symbolises the holiness of the memorial. After all, this was why the church was built and the reason it was called the Church of the Saviour on spilled blood.A must visit for anyone visiting this beautiful city.

A Church everyone should see in spite of their religion. .The beauty of this building cannot be absorbed in a few minutes. It must be savored like a glass of fine wine, slowly and delicately.The architecture is nothing comparable in the Western Hemisphere.This is a church that inspires and humbles you constantly. Like the Hermitage Museum it cannot fully be appreciated in one day
Fleet of tour buses awaits you. If you enjoy crowded tourist traps you will enjoy this church. I suggest walking around the outside, then walking down the street for a latte.
Colorful piece if history. Definitely one of the main attractions of St Petersburg. You cannot help but wonder how a magnificent structure built.

Magnificent, magnificent. We liked all the golden domes in St. Petersburg, but we LOVED the beautiful painted domes of the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. The iconography is absolutely some of the most beautiful in the world and brought me to tears it was so beautiful.

Amazing Ornamental Cathedral. Must see. Easy central location. Almost fully restored. Looks spectacular on the outside and even more beautiful inside (see pic). Extremely ornate and well designed. Crowds are not excessive.
must see in St. Petersburg. Just a pretty unbelievable church and building. Get ready to take plenty of pictures both inside and out.

Astoundingly Beautiful. If you only see one cathedral in Russia, this is the one to see. The exterior rivals or exceeds St. Basil's in Red Square, and the inside walls and ceiling are entirely mosaic. Photos just cannot capture the vibrantly glowing interior. It is just dazzling!
Iconic Domed Church. You can't go to Russia or St Petersburg without paying a visit to this magnificent domed Russian Orthodox Church. Post card picturesque from all angles.

Simply Magnificent. This church , dedicated to the Tsar Alexander 11,is architecturally wonderful, both from the inside and outside - the mosaics are incredible and so worth the visit - highly recommended.

Iconic view and must visit place at St. Petersburg. This church is one of the main sights of the city. Located in the very centre it is impossible to miss while strolling Nevsky prospekt. The best view is from bridges across Griboedova Canal including the celebrated pedestrian Bank bridge. The inside interiors designed by famous Russian artists are worth visiting. Lots and lots of mosaics everywhere. Crafts and art market is located around the church as well as good restaurants on Konyushennaya ploschad and Bolshaya Konyushennaya ulitsa nearby. The admission fee is 250 RUB, closed on Wednesdays.
over the top outside - mosaic feast inside.. Iconic onion roofline. Intriguing interior filled with mosaics. A warm and inviting church interior despite its tourist icon status.
Great mosaics. There are a lot of churches to be seen but all of them quite different. Crowds were not bad and the interior matches the exterior - beautiful!

MUST SEE. If you are suddenly in St.Petersburg you must visit and see Church of the Savior on Blood! The place, architecture and inside decoration is so nice and beautiful that you will be impressed. My recommendation - visit Church of the Savior on Blood on sunny day! Then you will able to feel and see all sun row playing on the icons

Spectacular and iconic church. Aside from the Hermitage one of the most iconic sites in St Petersburg. (Almost beats St Basil's cathedral in Moscow)! Best view is looking up the canal from Nevski Prospect.

An icon in St. Peteresburg. Wonderful church outside and inside, The walls are all painted. We must enter to appreciate all the paintings, the works in wooden. the marble floors and all that golden splendor.

7500sqm of mosaics. Just impressive. The church itself is not very big but all the interiors are covered with mosaics. Join any of the many guided tours available and get to know all the history of the place. Alternatively get online info (no English panels inside)
Fantastic visit. We had a brilliant time. It is such a wonderful church. So much to look at and photos to take. Lots of information in English.

An Iconic Church: A St. Petersburg Must. This church is a must see on any tour of St. Petersburg. The church tells an important story of St. Petersburg history. The mosaic work is unlike any other .....anywhere......We visited this church as part of a tour and we received excellent information regarding all aspects of this very important and stunning building.
Beautiful church in excellent area. The church itself was magnificent. We did not go inside, but spent some time outside. The park around it was beautiful and was a nice place to go and sit down.
Beautiful. Pictures can not capture the beauty of this space. Impossible to get the entire exterior in frame without crossing the busy streets. Great stop.

So very different. A tip to start if visiting in summer, the church is open until 8pm. While visits after 6pm cost double the daytime entry fee (800 ruble instead of 400), the lack of crowds and tour buses makes it money well spent. Light is still great for inside and external shots. Can get audio guide for 100 ruble but we found from what we had read previously it wasn't necessary. You will already be familiar with the exterior which is great to see and photo but the internal mosaics are outstanding pieces of work. Small display in one corner at rear shows some of the restoration work photos and processes.
Breathtaking. One of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. I was a tile mason so have immense appreciation for the mosaic work. Highly recommend.
Nice colourful church. The church has very colourful paintings and decorations which my family liked watching ... nothing special to do inside though!
Beautiful!. Very ornate and beautiful church. Easy to get to and around other attractions, definitely worthwhile.

Impossible to tear your eyes away!. The first time you see the church is an amazing moment. From then on you just have to look at it from as many angles as is possible...and once inside all I can say is wow.There were crowds of people there every time we visited but it is well worth the wait to go inside.

jaw droppingly beautiful. the outside modeled on St Basil's in Moscow is stunning and then you go inside and your jaw will hit the floor,every surface is covered with the most exquisite mosaics glorifying the life of Christ, the alter screen and doors are magnificent, an experience not to be missed
great church. great church and from outside and inside is absolute stunning and for ujs who are orthodox nice to see such beautiful mosaic inside the church worth the ticket and worth to see
Breathtaking!. Has to be seen to be believed. This is absolutely stunning. A must see. The mosaic was really beautiful - and so detailed.
Beautiful. Try an go when you have good weather. This church is great for outdoor photos. the inside is also beautiful.
Amazing Architecture. Beautiful mosaics - a must see when in St. Petersburg. It was more lovely than I had imagined. Be sure to walk up the canal toward it for a picture postcard view.
stunning. Wow....what an incredible place. Just be aware of pick pockets. This church has to be seen.....we went with Alla tours and jumped the que!

Holy Russian devoutness and reverence to the core - please don't miss. Russian churches and cathedrals are always a monument to holiness, devotion and reverence, crammed solid with relics, gold and silver - but there are some that simply take your breath away as soon as you walk in and this is one of them. Not that you have much breath left anyway after taking in that gorgeous, lush exterior, which is seriously not done justice in any pictures. You need to stand there to appreciate the intricacies and marvel at the onion domes and decorations. Inside, your mind will be blown. Every single square metre of wallspace is either a painting, a mosaic (these are stunning), a relic, gold leaf covered statue, icon or such marble / stone as you have never seen. I don't have superlatives for what I saw. The memorial to the spot where Alexander was killed is suitably Russian sombre but splendiferous. Some practical information: We, not speaking much Russian, had absolutely no problems in St Petersburg whatsoever. There is usual SOME English information available inside and out and you can easily get into the church. The prices are very reasonable. We were early in the season, when the queues are not so heavy but do be prepared for a crowd and a wait at the ticket office. Also, we would recommend that you take the audio guided tour, which is very detailed and well worth the 100 Rubels (at time of writing around UK £1.30).
different. This has been restored to its original grandeur .It is so different . Very stunning architecture and history
Must see!. I was overwhelmed! It's one of a kind mosaic church in Russia, and the largest one in Europe. I think it is a must-see monument!
Amazing. This Cathedral was amazing the murals on the wall were great to look at the mosaic floor was spectacular And the amount of gold was breathtaking
Do Not Miss This. Reasonable admission price and absolutely stunning both inside and out. No problems taking photos inside.

amazing art of work. It is so colourfulaand grand that takes your breath away. It was destroyed during WW2 but later it has been renovated to this condition with the work of great people. definitly visit and appriciate the beuty.

Possibly the Most Beautiful Church in the World. The floor to ceiling mosaic work inside is astounding. Fully restored depictions of major biblical stories. Exterior rivals St Basils in Moscow- amazing.

Incredible sight of mosaics to honor peter. This was astonishing in the sheer magnitude of the work. Almost totally destroyed during world war 2 it was complted at great expense and effort by the people of the city and government. Immensely popular and by tourists it is a must stop in the city. Nothing else to compare it to. One of the few places you can snap your hearts content of pictures without fees or anything except crowds

Stuningly beautiful!. After about 30 years of restoration, the Church reopened in late August 1997.The interior is incredible and you will be amazed with its superb mosaics. Several of the icons were completed in the traditions of academic painting, modernist style and Byzantine icon painting.There is a large icon of Saint Alexander Nevsky, Mother of God with Child and the Savior, Christ giving a blessing with his right hand and holding the gospels in his left, and so many more.The entire interior is covered in mosaics and paintings.It is amazing and a must visit, beautiful both inside and out.

dangerous pickpockets!. There are pickpockets around the place and they can be very aggressive! Don't walk towards the church along an empty street. Don't talk to "travel agents" and keep an eye your stuff. They will see that you're a tourist right away

Two Day Highlights of St. Petersburg. The Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood was built on the site of where Emperor Alexander 11 was fatally wounded in the late 1800's and it's construction was paid for by the Imperial Royal Family. It is built in the traditional Russian style with ornate onion shaped domes and elaborate decoration. The interior is nothing less than spectacular - it holds Russia's largest collection of mosaics adorning the ceilings, every wall and the columns. The mosaics are made of coloured glass, lapis lazuli, malachite, gold leaf and many other precious stones. Mostly destroyed during the Revolution and siege of Leningrad the church was re-built and the building was re-opened in 1997.A visit to this Cathedral is a MUST - I found it to be the most spectacular place I visited in St. Petersburg.

Great Monument. Great ancient monument , the high light of St Petersburg. Very colourful and awesome. Located within walking distance from Nevsky prospect. Must visit by everyone visiting St Petersburg

A Must See if you are in St.Petersbrug. This ­breathtaking old Russian style church with its multi colored enamel onion domes and fabulous inlaid mosaic interior is the greatest architectural treasure of St. Petersburg, a truly Russian masterpiece!

250 RB only for entrance. A must see unique church, don't only take photos from the outside, enter and see the majestic mosaics, it is only around 5 euros to get in there, to go there ride the metro station till Nevnesky prospect which is the famous down town station, it is already there, a 5 minute walk

Intresting. Even as I'm not a church person, this was good. It looks great from outside, and inside, well Ok, for me. Propably somebody who understands something about this, gets more out of it than meYou can pay your ticket with an credit card.

Iconic and unforgettable, but mind you pockets and camera lenses. It is absolutely breathtaking. Cameras can't quite capture the artistry of this church dedicated to Alexander II. Couldn't believe we could stand there and take it in.However, when you are there please keep guard of your pockets and your camera lenses. Our tourguide informed us to be aware of people walking around with a cell phone to their ear, but aren't talking. They are typically scoping out tourists to clip a prize from. Honestly, that was the saddest part about visiting all of these amazing sites in St Petersburg was the repeated warnings about pickpocketing...

Mozaiek. Outright beautiful, with al the Mosaic and the Goldleaf. Both outside and in, it's all splendour.We loved the 'onion-style' tower heads and inside it was all mosaic. Beautifully done. Couldn't believe this was once a hide-out during the war.

wow.. what mosaics. 7500 square of mosaic are covering the wall, pilars and ceiling of this amazing church which is in fact a museum as not service where ever performed. it was erected on the site where alexander the third was assassinated . the spot in the church is conserved under a canapee but the truly stunning part are the mosaics in the most gorgeous colours. a must.

Amazing!. In my imagination this is what I expected a typical Russian church to look like and it was magical in real life. As awesome as the outside was I was prepared to be underwhelmed by the inside but quite the contrary, the inside is as amazing as the outside. The mosaic work, the marble all of it just knocked my senses for six. Please don't just look at the outside, take your photographs and leave without seeing the inside. It is well worth a visit.

Churches are not for praying anymore. This is a very beautiful church and the reason for this magnicifant structure was the tragic assassination of Tsar Alexander II in 1881. He was a progressive and well loved leader and this church was built for his commemoration at this spot. Yet it eems that all churches charge high fees for you to see the insight and milk the visitors without hesitation.It seems to me a funny way to try to attract the devout.. The insight is also quite beautiful but my advice is not to pay for more than one insight visit at churches and cathedrals.

Real Russian Atmosphere. The Church of the Savior on Blood is one of the key highlights of St. Petersburg. The exterior is already breathtaking enough - you can marvel there for hours.The inside is overwhelmingly beautiful, with each centimeter of surface area covered in murals of Christ. I advise to go see the exterior at night, as it is even more magical when lit up. To go in however, it is best during the day, early in the morning to avoid big crowds.

Best church in town. Excellent example of Russian Orthodox architecture in St Petersburg. Beautiful outside, hope for a clear blue sky (doesn't happen often) which really brings out the colors of the domes and stone. Pretty inside. Worth your time.
Worth a visit. Not too many decorations inside, icons painted on walls, otherwise a normal orthodox church with counters selling candles, souvenirs etc.
Wonderful! . Even though we were not able to go inside, just by simply looking at the architecture was more than enough! Lovely experience!

All russian mysterious soul. This the most impressive church and religious monument I´ve ever seen..And I try not to cry all the time I see her coz the emotions overflow my heart.If you want to know something about russian soul you must see it.Love this.

well orginized place. i visited this place being limited by time. i was impressed with speed of the queue and with the guide organized ( so far it was on russian, but i speak this language). however for foreigns there is audio guides.

breathtaking.. I almost skipped the interior of this because it was our last day and they were closing in an hour. I AM SO GLAD WE DIDN'T. The inside was one of the most breathtaking things I've ever seen. Go. (and go inside!)
Is this a dream?. Everything they say about it is true - breath-taking, fabulous, need couple more hours in there when you realize it's time to leave!

A delight of colour. A story of assassination, dedication, neglect, pillage and restoration.
See it from Nevskiy Prospekt to appreciate the domes then drop in to enjoy the icons and murals.

Must See!. This is a must-see in Saint Petersburg. The outside is the real attraction, in this writer's opinion. It is simply amazing. If you can, walk all the way around the outside, as there is no charge for doing that. There is a fee for going inside, which is OK, but not as good as the outside.
A Must See. This is likely the most beautiful interior of a religious building I have ever seen anywhere so far.
Extremely beautiful. Absolutely beautiful church, both outside and inside. Another must for every tourist visiting St. Petersburg.
Fantastic. The outside is just as you imagine, but make sure you go inside as its even more spectacular, the whole inside is covered in mosaic tiles.
Not to be missed. Absolutely stunning .Looks straight out of a fairytale.Second to only Hermitage among the attractions of STP
Beautiful!. It was good to go with a guide to get the history of the church and have everything explained more. The outside is very picturesque too and a great place for photos!

Absolutely beautiful. By far my favorite church in St. Petersburg and Moscow. The inside of the church is absolutely stunning with its deep blue colors. I will never seize to be amazed by the mosaics all over the wall and the true artistic mastery that is this church.

the unconsacrated church. the history behind this building is interesting especially since although it is for all intents and purposes a church it was never consecrated as a church since blood was spilled there as a result of a duel. The mosaics are incredible although do plan to go early as the queues can be quite long especially in June - July.

april 2015 visit. it is really very nice architecture and nice paintings inside. it was very crowded in eastern time ..you can spend around 1 hour inside when looking at the paintings. also outside there is open bazaar

Incredible Mosaics. From the time you try to take in all of the mosaics covering the outside of this building until you enter and see even greater mosaic detail covering everything in the church, you are in awe. The Church was built to commemorate the place where Russian Emperor Alexander II was assassinated. But it has only recently been restored and some of the alter pieces are actually paper mâché" and you would never know the difference. Russian artistry survives. To see the beauty of the Church is a must but try to arrange a private tour to understand the incredible history of the building over its"lifetime.
7000 mq of mosaic. As in title 7000 mq of mosaic, wonderful colour and very authentic masterpiece of religious ortodoxe art
Amazing.. Just got to go there no point in trying to describe. The icons are so beautiful and history intriguing
Really great. Its a great church and most important monument of the city. Its so baty. Its so beauty on the outside as inside the building. The history of this religious place is well rich
Over the Top Interior. Must be seen to be believed --- but it so ornate one can understand why the Revolution may have been necessary
Impressive. Probably the most stunning church in Russia. Not so famous as St. Basil's Cathedral (in Moscow), but much bigger and by all means, much more beautiful.
Must see. Mandatory visit in St Petersburg. Don't forget your ISIC card for free entrance, in case you are a student.
Beautiful inside. The whole place is a riot of colour. Sometimes rather overcrowded by tours but does allow you to take as many pictures as you want.
Stunning church. The mosiac work covers the whole of the interior and it stunning. Its only 250 rouble per person. Was closed on Wednesday.
Have to see!!!. Fantastic historic place!! Beautiful both inside and outside! Better take a guide to get more very interesting information regarding the Church.

Iconic St Petes. You most likely will not visit St. Petes without seeing the Church of the Savior on Blood. We only spent time on the outside of this building but it is magnificent. We were in St. Petes for over a week and you will pass by this great structure many times, it was always great to stop and look at.

Bit of a let down...but well worth visit. Think this Church is best viewed in bright sunny weather. From the distance, it's appearance did not do it justice, looked like it needed a good clean up. But that said, close up it is stunning....especially set against a blue sky.... It does look lovely viewed from the canal bridge some several hundred yards back.

Excellent Restoration. The restoration of the Cathedral is superb. After the Revolution the Cathedral was left in a state of disrepair and then it took some damage during WWII. Excellent craftsman have bought it back to it's former glory.

Fantastic!!! Beautiful indoor and outdoor. I suggest you to use a tour or the headset tour to understand about the interior and exterior! ITs really a special Church its a must do in St. Petersburg!!!!

The Savior on Blood. A must-see if you in St. Petersburg! If you like Hayga Sophia, this is a newest version of it! Just imagine, to build it, they included the porch, to which the wounded emperor held, after he was shot, in the inside of the church. Because they want and can do. I really like it. The restoration work has been done amazingly, everything is new and shiny! It is strikingly beautiful... Stone iconostasis that is done to look like wood! While I like the Hayga Sophia for its more than 10 centuries history and everything else, this is very nice.
those pretty tops. Pictures doesn't do it justice, you have to see it. We had to come back again and again to take better pictures.

Outstanding . Not being a great believer but this church is really something special that you should definitely visit!It is about 7000 square meters of mosaic and I have never seen something like it!Part of the floor is covered with rugs but you can see wgat it looks like on one of the tv-screens.Only church in the world where you have a painting of Jesus in his teenage years.Just go there!
Godiva chocolate good. Everything is a photo op, I had to bunch my coat up under my neck because it was exhausting looking up. The ceilings are detailed and magnificient.

Another amazing must see place in St. Petersburg. A bit of a walk from the Hermitage but not too difficult to find. We were there on a sunny but cold (temp -3) day. Got some great photos from inside and outside. Not too crowded. St. Petersburg is just amazing!!
Very impressive and beutiful. I wonder how they did it! The Mosaic "pictures" are most beutiful and it must have taken a while to make them....

Absolutely stunning inside and out.. As above, Go and take loads of photos and you will still not have enough. I have lots and I still think that I could have been there all day taking them and still missed out on some beautiful part of this.
Easy to find ,Just of Nevsky.

Breathtaking!. So incredibly beautiful inside and out! Didn't want to leave! Interesting characters outside of church watch out for people dressed up who want you to pay to have photos taken with them!

Quintessential Russia. Not to be missed! Worth the walk, the wait and the lines. Get tickets ahead, if you can. And, take a peek at the Baptistry across the street.
{ September 2012 visit - never forgot the experience! }
Very good and colourful place.. Surely a piece of architecture it is. Very colourful and artistic piece of work. They can reduce the entry ticket price though.

Great place!. Really beautiful place, close to Nevsky (one of the main roads). Easy to go there with bus or Metro.
Even the children thought it was a great place.
Very impressive. Must to see in Peter if U r interested in architecture or history or religion. Nice church monument of history russian nation.

A mosaic wonder! . Having seen Several orthodox churches already on our trip to Russia we weren't sure it would be worth visiting another one. However we were proven wrong. This church is unique in its decor due to the mosaics which cover the entire interior. Truly it is phenomenal to see and puzzling to work out how they accomplished such a feat! Also an interesting piece of history in terms of the story of its construction and name, the church on the spilled blood. Worth a peek inside.
A must in St. Petersburg!. You should definetly go and see the spectacular building. We were all very pleased to visit this place. Also the kids.
Very Russian impressive architecture. Very colorful, a lot of small details. I spend hours watching on the walls and it is right on the canal Griboyedova. Next to it is Russian museum

An engineering marvel and a beautiful decorative stone and mosaic structure. The Jasper, Marble and Granite monoliths, the sheer magnitude of construction for that time and beautiful painting on the ceiling plus the dove in the center
Looks a little like St. Basil's Cathedral. Very intricate work on the spires atop the church. It was really cold the day w visited, but the trip was worth it.
One of the most beautiful places in the world. I liked everything about this church. It is very impressive and you feel very small when you read about the history of the church.

must see (but bguide in English may be difficult to get on short notice. at the beginning a bit too much about the killing, not enought about the art, but then it caught up. this is all so new, made also in Italy, quality of artwork very different, as many different artists, difficult to find a building this beautiful which is not more than about one century old

Unique-looking church!. Church is located in central part of the town. Its near to Kazan Cathedral and there's lot of coffees and restaurants near of it. If you visit Nevsky Prospect you should check this church out! Also there's a State Russian museum almost next to it. Tickets were on pricier side compared to how much you spend time there or how much there is to see. There were so many pretty mosaics inside,but I think its good place to visit without going inside. Depends a lot probably if the place is crowded or not. When i visited it, it wasn't. I preferred St. Isaac's Cathedral over this one :)

Simply Breathtaking. To see this church in real life outshines the pictures you see. Its incredibly detailed, the colours and the architecture is all utterly amazing, let alone the story that goes with it. Its a must, we did this in a private tour that included many other sights. The private guide gives you the history lesson. Too beautiful and iconic to pass up. travelled dec 2012

Beautiful church. I was stunned by the exterior of this fantastic building but nothing prepared me for the beauty which awaited me inside. I have seen wonderful murals before, but there was not one inch of the interior which was not covered by the most wondrous murals I have ever seen. They put the ones in Italy to shame. The price of admittance was most certainly worth every penny, as was the dvd I purchased, which explained the history of the church in detail. No one visiting St. Petersburg should muss this experience, but again allow plenty of time to take in the beauty before your eyes.

Stunning, beautiful, Iconic. The moment you see the church you instantly get goosebumps. Its breathtaking to say the least, Its outside facade is stunning, from the mosaic roof tops to the paintings, it is just spectacular. You would think it wouldn't get better, but the inside is awe inspiring! The mosaics the colours, the paintings and the gold you are just overwhelmed with beauty. You can't explain it but standing inside you really feel like you are somewhere special, somewhere significant!You really have to see it to believe it! Worth the Rubles! Great little souvenir stalls all around also!

Breathtaking! . This church had to be seen to be fully appreciated. The colors, detail and architecture are stunning. It's well worth the line up to get in. Be prepared to be overwhelmed by the artistry.Make sure you get to know the history of the site as well!
Mosaics. Worth a visit. The Mosaics are simply beautiful and it is amazing to see a church that is covered in them.

One of the largest mosaic collections in Europe. Sobor Voskreseniya Khristova na Krovi (Cathedral of the Resurrection of Christ on the blood) or Khram Spasa na Krovi (Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood) erected in memory of the fact that at this point in March,1(13) 1881 as a result of the attempt was mortally wounded Emperor Alexander II (the expression “on the blood” indicates the blood of the tsar). The Khram was built during the years 1883-1907, as a joint project of the architect Alfred Parland and Archimandrite Ignatius (Malyshev) in "Russian style" and is somewhat reminiscent of the Moscow's St. Basil's Cathedral. Inside the temple a veritable museum of mosaics can be found, covering an area of 7065 square meters. The mosaic exposition inside the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood is one of the largest collections in Europe.

Extraordinary building. There are so may detailed reviews for this church but one should see by himself. I would like to add that our guide told us that it is totally covered with mosaics due to the high level of humidity since they are more durable than paintings .Also that it was built to look alike the church Ivan the Terrible built in Red Square.The entrance fee is too small for this work of art.

Beautiful church inside and out. Stunning and worth every ruble to go inside and see. The mosiac work inside is really intricate and very unique, and the Russian style of the outside of the church is so beautiful

Mosaic church. This church is definitely a must see-place. The interior and decoration is something you won´t believe unless you see it in your own eyes. Huge pictures on the wall is completely done from tiny pieces of mosaic and its amazing. The colors, the light... just wow!It was built in 1883-1907 on the spot were the tsar Aleksanter II was murdered in 1881.
Summer Holiday in St. Pete. Beautiful church with amazing icons inside. Great historic location and a must see for any visitors to St. Pete.
Great view over St. Petersburg. We went there during our last day of our trip to St. Petersburg. It's one of the best places in the town with a great overview over the city.

Stunningly Beautiful. The church was included as part of a day tour to St. Petersburg and we were so glad it was on the itinerary. The exterior of the church is almost breath-taking - colourful, ornate, beautiful architectural details. Make sure you have a camera with you because you'll want to get pictures from every vantage point.

A must-see!. Not to be missed on a trip to St Petersburg - a fantastic sight and well worth visiting.Approach from Nevsky Prospekt for some great photographs alongside the canal with the church as a spectacular backdrop. Allow plenty of time to spend inside the church for photographs of the mosaics and icons - no extra fees for photographs, but no flash photography or tripods permitted.

Fantastic monument. the church is stunning to see from outside and even more so from inside... the walls are covered with hundreds of enormous detailed pictures; all of which are made with mosaics!! there is not one single painting in it
Magnifique!. Beautiful church with great piece of history. Not to be missed! Inside and out look beautiful. By the way, dinner at Jamie Oliver is just around the corner.
Perfetc. One of the most beautiful churches in Russia!! Lot of history!! Realy realy wonderful... Be pacient with the lines!!!

Discount with ISIC and Ice cream domes)). Visited back on 1 Oct 2012! The outside design of the ice cream domes with different colours certainly attracted millions of curious travellers who are eager to find its inner secrets. Inside the dome, surprisingly isn't as attractive, but like with any cathedrals, it was ornate and decorated with Icons of Virgin Mary, Jesus, and other apostles. Entry ticket costs only 150 Rubles back in 2012 for ISIC holders)) If not, then is 300. You pick)
an incredible colorful experience. The interiour of the church is fully decorated with nice colorful mosaic - its all over the place, i have never seen anything like it before

Beauty. This very beautiful design is so Russia. The mosaic interior is very impressive. It certainly makes for perfect photo shots. Never a church...better looking in my opinion on the outside along side the canal.

The classic St Pete photo. Very similar in design to St Basil's in the Red Square in Moscow. It's not as impressive inside as it is from the outside compared to the way many European churches are.Down a side street off Nevsky Prospect, you will definitely want to visit although it's not necessary to go inside. Walk to the other side and photograph it from the park for a better photo, particularly if you are then in full snow like I was.If you do want to enter, there will generally be a line waiting, and it will be crowded inside.A photo of this church laden with snow is your classic St Pete image!Visited February 2013

Beautifully distinct church. This is a beautifully distinct church in an otherwise very European looking city (architecturally). I didn't spend long on the inside but was definitely impressed by the entirely mosaic interior.Makes for a great photo during the day and night.

An Icon of Medieval Russian Architecture. St Petersburg is virtually all baroque and neo classical style so this Church really stands out and is better than St Basil's in Moscow. Never a church for public worship, it was built by Alexander III as a memorial to his father Alexander II who was assasinated. The exact spot has been left intact inside. It was looted and vandalised after the Russian Revolution but has since had a 27 year restoration. Fantastic outside with the enamel onion domes and famed for its mosaics internally, some 7500 sq. m of them. A great place for photographs and its location on one of the canals is just stunning.
So russian. The church looks so authentic from the outside and so beautiful inside. It will take some minutes to pass the queue but it is worth doing that. A little bit crowded inside.
must see this place. The restoration took about 20 years and many people efforts. I don't know another such a beautiful cathedral, you must plan a few hours in your trip to check it out.
Stunning. We were amazed by the church and the attention to detail all over the interior and exterior. We used the audio guide which really explained the architecture and history of the church.

Stunning - simply stunning.. I had heard about this place and always wanted to visit - I was not prepared for how wonderful it actually is, both inside and out. Beware - it is closed on Wednesday! Entry is only a few roubles and well worth it - do not pass up on the opportunity!

Trip not to be missed. This was part of a day trip to St Petersburg and what a trip. You walk along the very wide, straight clean roads to the church. It is a sight to behold, gorgeous. Lots of photos need to be taken here and most of the other churches and museums in this fine city. You have to be aware of pickpockets but you have to be careful in most places you go now anyway. The city is glorious and not what you expect of it really. Lovely trips on the river and just a fab place, another must on the travel wish list.

Absolutely wonderful - a must see. This church is truly superb - the mosaics are incredible and the ceilings and walls are beautifully painted. Very good value as it only cost 250 roubles each - about £2.60.

Photo stop. Photos and more Photos. We have visited three times and it is always hectic. You are likely to come across wedding parties too as this is the place all the brides go. If you take photos of the couples parading in historical costumes expect to pay. Just a short walk away is The Field of Mars, a calm and peaceful place to catch your breath.

Fairytale Church. What a beauty. Nicest architecture for a Church in St Petersburg, or perhaps all of Russia. Beautiful in all directions. A great Photo stop.Many Wedding photos taking place with Church as Background.
Beautiful place. Gorgeous place to walk around, very busy outside though. We walked around with our guide, would have liked a bit longer. The building is just as gorgeous inside, as out.

Get the audio tour. This is one of the most visually impressive churches in Russia. Though it is not as old or iconic as St. Basil's in Moscow, it beats it for sheer grandeur and detail. I would recommend spending 30-45 minutes and renting the audio tour, particularly if you don't understand Russian. (Pro-tip: bring your own earbuds and keep your hands free for picture taking). The cathedral has a fascinating (and bloody) history that is worth understanding as you it in. I also recommend going earlier in the morning. Otherwise, you will spend most of your visit dodging tour groups.
Beautiful exterior. The church is beautiful and interesting looking on the outside. Inside you can see where Alexander II was assassinated.

Incredible mosaic. Loved the mosaic pictures all over the church. The colors and the work is really great. Had heard that it was not worth the visit, but I believe it was really worth the visit. And the entrance fee was cheap.
Must see. Fabulous both inside and out. A wonderful monument and piece of art. Essential for any trip to St Petersburg.
Worth visiting. Very nice architecture, I enjoyed my way there walking by a canal and watching me approaching to this cathedral. One of the best sights in the amazing "Northern Capital"

Inspiring and Somber. The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood was constructed on the site where Alexander the ll was killed. Construction commenced in 1883 and was completed in 1907. There is beautiful and colorful architecture and mosaics. There is a lot of use of pastel colors and gold. There are lots of place to look, ceiling, floors, walls and simply everywhere you can look. You want to be able to take your time and you walk through the church and look everywhere you can.The history of its construction and the tribute to Alexander ll is a part of the very fabric of the building. It has withstood time and revolution and is worth a visit.

So beautiful I cried. From the onion domes on the exterior to the gold encrusted interior, this one of the most breathtaking churches in the world. My ship's excursion on my previous St P visit did not take us inside, so this was at the TOP of my list this time, and for good reason. Alla Tours made sure we saw everything!

Very nice place to visit .... A really nice place to visit, but I think its outside is much more memorable than its inside, still it is really impressive and beautiful.... I would rank it #2 as St.Isaacs is my #1 religious place in St.Petersburg...

Got to see inside. I have been to St Petersburg on a few occasions, and have just looked at the outside of this church. It has quite a history, being the site where Alexander II was assassinated. This time I took the effort to go inside. The entry charge was a bit higher than expected (250 roubles). However, the first impression was Wow.
Out of this world!. The outside is spectacular - wait till you get inside. Wall to wall mosaics. It is mind blowing! A visit will cost you about £2. Can't say no to that!
Beautiful. Get a picture of the outside, read the story, then get over to St. Isacs for the most beautiful interior

Mindblowing. This is the most beautiful church both inside and outside that i have ever seen. About 400 rubles to get in i think, theres a gift shop inside which sells allsorts for really cheap, you are allowed to take photos although no camera could ever capture the beauty of this place. Located just off Nevisky Prospekt, theres a souvenir market outside for gifts. Absolutely gorgeous place.
Beautiful Church. I have never seen a more opulent Church, but the spot where the assassination took place is really nicely understated
Breathtaking. adored all the colours and murals. Beautiful and adored this amazing city. This building looked incredible from the outside and I stood for ages just looking at it.

Wow....go inside worth the time. Another amazing church with mosaics depicting life of Jesus. In great shape. You dont need too much time in here if you just want to get an overall impression. We were churched out so just took in the view - no guide

Really impressive. You have to see this if you go to St. Petersburg. Really beautiful.
Tips: Be aware of pickpockets, and don't buy anything from anyone at this place.

It's a must go!. When you're visiting St Petersburg you just can't miss this place! It looks beautiful and interesting outside and also inside as the walls are covered with mosaic art- it's amazing :) It's definitely worth a visit!
Unbelievable Mosaics. This church is not only of iconic beauty on the outside, but inside almost every wall and column is adorned with some of the most amazing mosaic religious artwork in the world.

Simply Amazing!. Wow, from the outside, this church is breath taking, postcard picture. Once inside, I was absolutely spell bound by the mosaic work and the history. From walking in, you can feel the aura surrounding the building inside and out. You're able to take photos and while I managed a few good shots, these do not even recount just how amazing this church is. Do not miss a visit here.

The two capitals should not be mixed. If you wanna see the original variant you'd better go to Red Square in Moscow where the St. Basil's Cathedral has benn standing more than 500 years. Talking about this exaggerated copy which is dedicated to a place of death of a russian Emperor... I have nothing to say about architecture, it is just terrible. It looks besides so unoriginally for the downtown district of St. Petersburg that I would really have removed it with an eraser if I only could.

Mosaic Church of the Blood. Beautiful - inside and out. Inside, the entire church is covered in the most wonderful mosaics. Outside, the turrets topped by onion domes can be seen from a distance and are thus a good landmark for finding your way to other sites.
A lot of history, colour and wonderful memories.. The small market behind the church of blood was a tourist's haven for collecting all types of Russian souveniers.

Must see. Beautiful on the outside, amazing and surprising inside. Give yourself 30 mins minimum here. It's so tall, you could be overwhelmed by seeing churches but this is the first I've seen with mosaic art.

Wow.. WOW.. Wow ! ! ! ( did I say WOW yet ?). A "MUST SEE/EXPERIENCE" for all venturing to the St Petersburg area. Architecturally, sitting next to the water this structure dominates your focus totally. Make sure you walk all the way around and even on the other side of the water to get the full views she broadcasts. Look closely at all the details of the masonry, domes, and decorative art work that give this building it's external uniqueness.Inside it is even more exquisite. The use of so many elements to raise the beauty of this church to a high level.Again slowly consume not only the floors, pulpits, walls, and ceilings but the displays scattered throughout also. Intricately detailed mosaics coupled with a varying use of marble also makes this Place of GOD special. The name "Spilled Blood" is most popular name for tourists but, Church of the Resurrection, Church of our Savior on the Blood, Cathedral of the Ascension, Resurrection of the Christ, or Assumption, Church of the Redeemer, Church on Spilt Blood, and a few more I don't remember are probably more accurate.Do yourself a favour and come early because the LINES will be long and longer as the day progresses. Please do some reading about this wonderful church before leaving home. It will allow you to understand the magnitude of what you will be seeing a lot more.Oh, and one last WOW ! ! !

more impressive on the outside. The church is remarkable from the outside in splendidly displaying the over ornate architecture of the late Tsarist period
The inside is gloomy and apart from the unusual memorial - blood stained cobbles from the Tsar's murder- of little interest
Breath-Taking. Absolutely gorgeous! Make sure to actually go inside - it is something incredible. never seen anything like it.

Not an average church. This church already looks amazing from the outside with all of his colours and towers. But the inside is even more impressive, the decoration on the walls look like paintings but the are made of mosaic.

speechless!. One of the most beautiful things I ever seen in my life!
I was so impressed that I felt like crying!

Magnificent construction. I visited outside on cold sunday evening with temperature -4, and even such bad weather I was impressed by magnificent construction of Speal Blood Savior Church! Too beautiful, speakless.

Worth a visit. This church was the highlight of my trip to St Petersburgh. As incredible as it looks on the outside it is on the inside. As I walked in I thought the walls and ceiling were painted but as I got closer I realised they were not paintings I was looking at but millions of tiny mosaic tiles which depicted beautiful biblical scenes. The only down side were the crowds but there is a great market just across the road.

Beautiful and unusual church located on a river embankment in the middle of the city. The place is lovely and so beautiful! It is like you would be in a fairytale. It is very close to the main street so its quite fast to stop by there. The river is beautiful and there are people selling souvenirs in the yard. This really is a church you should see.

Amazing and truely unusual Russian church. even if you are not into Churches, you have to visit this one, as it is actually ' a work of art' disguised as a church, so get inside, there is a huge secret awaiting you there. This place has been lovingly renovated after being used as a storage for potatoes during the Communist times !

Great history n art. Very great art n very pretty cathedral u will be amazed plus it's part of Russia history ,thanks to audio guide n the guides there I know lil more of history of Russia now n was very pleasure
breathtaking at night. go to see this church at night when illuminated. it's like a fairytale cathedral. just a short walk from Ermitage and Winter palace.

A masterpiece. It is a real masterpiece and attractive chuch with its interior architecture and design.
The entrance fee is not expensive plus if you are a student there is discount.

a must to visit.. Stunning internally and externally. Internally very, very different to St Basil's in Moscow although superficially similar externally. The canopy over the 'spilled blood' area has cobble stones you can just see if you peer over the barrier, I'm guessing they are the ones where the assassination took place. Mosaics spectacular of course and a beautiful monument.

A landmark that you will not forget.. A beautifully located building we had the pleasure to visit in great and warm sun in early evening, the next to channel location had talented musicians and artist in the street and a great garden is just besides. Athmosphere all together calm and embrasing. Going inside was like entering into a Faberge egg with all its richness. Next to church there is a very nice restaurant Meat Head (not sure about the name though), great food a wine list.
Excellent mosaic depictions.. Everyone praise the outside beauty, but the inside is also as good as the outside. definitely worth visiting.

Excellent . A wonderful place ; where you can see the perfect design and colour matching in the begining i was not so impressed; but when i knew that all drawing was made of mozayeek ! I realise how beautiful and valuable it is. And the most important we felt the blessings of God and the glory of the church
Marvelous. There are basically no words to say about this church.. it's a must in St. Petersburg with all its mosaic incredible work inside, an amazing holy door inside and fine ceiling work.
Beautifull. Saint Petersbug main atractions are worth a long visit.This is probaly the city that has everything in the way that you will never forget.

Stunning and spectacular. I had never heard of this place; St. Basil's in Moscow seems to steal the spotlight on Russian churches. After reading about it in travel guides I decided I had to stop by. I'm so glad I did. This easily has to be one of the most ornately decorated places I've ever seen. Not one square inch of the beautiful church is untouched and it's not simply "decorated" it's stunning, ornate and lavish.

The nicest cathedrals in st. petersburg. This cathedral is looking awsome both from the outside and the inside. The inner cathedral in full with magnificent wall paintings, and it is very rich with colors and gold.A don't miss (!)

Another must see!!. This church is amazingly built and decorated. The outside alone is worth just stopping and enjoying. The history of the church is interesting. Our tour guide was great about telling the history and pointing out the must sees. It can be a quick visit, maybe an hour.

Spectacular outside view. Good restoration work inside.. Spectacular view on the outside, Very good restoration work on the impressive mosaics inside. Some restoration work still ongoing, but this is only on a very small area.
Amazing. Unbelievable place. The detail and the architecture are superb. The church is steeped in history reasonably priced and you can get commentary via a headset in English for a small fee

Beautiful. Beautiful inside and out. 7000 square meters of mosaics inside the church - absolutely beautiful.
Audio guide only 100 rubles.
I personally found it more impressive that St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.

Undisputed number one. One of the most beautiful churches in the world, truly stunning to see both from the outside and inside, and it's located in the centre of the city so there's basically no excuse to not fit it into whatever itinerary you have!

Beautiful church. The church is located on the spot where Tzar Alexander was assassinated. It took many years to build it, but after it was build, it became one of the three most beautiful and most attended cathedrals in St. Petersburg (in addition to St Isaac and Kazabskiy). All three are in the heart of St Petersburg, so you can't miss them!

Pretty, but..... This is a very popular tourist stop especially for tourists who don't know their Russian history. This church was meant as a memorial to Tsar Alexander II after he was blown up by revolutionaries. It was closed and ransacked in 1930, used as a morgue during the siege of Leningrad, and then used as a vegetable warehouse, before it was restored to be used as a tourist attraction. It has never been reconsecrated as a church To give it it's due,there is fairy tale architecture, an over abundance of mosaics and fine frescos and a nice outside sitting area, where buskers entertain. Is it so popular because it is so convenient to visit.?

very nice but disappointed.. I wanted to visit a church, but it visited a museum... It's very inside, but once outside I had the same feeling I had in Moscow after visiting St-Vassili Basilica. (Red square). Quite disppointed.

An amazing church. This is a wonderful church and as beautiful inside as outside. I would say much better than St basils in Moscow so well worth a look. They open later in summer so you can find a time to have less people there.

wow. magnificent colours just like in the photos and when we saw it we just said wow and that was from the outside , inside was just as amazing with all the czars buried there, i would say one of the highlights of our trip
Splendid monument. The monument is very colourful with lots of detail. Perfect opportunity for photo lovers. It is splendid inside and outside. Not to be missed while visiting St-Petersburg.

Amazing. That building has a history story at St. Petersburg. I thought every visit MUST visit. Very beautiful inside and outside, awesome. I thought everyone like to take a photo from the other side of the river.

Must visit. This building is spectacular from both the outside and the inside, the shape of the building out side is amazing (we seen it at christmas time and the pictures in the snow were fantasic) the colour and detail inside are amazing. This is a must see site when visiting St Petersburg

Great photo options and river cruises nearby. Conveniently located 2 minutes from Nevsky prospect this church has a spectacular and colourful view, really russian orthodox style similar to Vasily Blazhenny Cathedral in Moscow. For those who are planning a short visit to St. Petersburg is a great option to walk around during inspecting the main Nevsky Prospect. Free entry. Mosaic museum inside. There are many souvenirs markets at the back, DLT department store and many upper class restaurants, in the opposite side of Nevsky there is St. Isaac Cathedral. Very worth visiting and photographing

Amazing mosaics. This one is well worth the ticket price. This beautiful church is filled with gorgeous mosaics on every wall, even the entrance and exits are beautiful. English guides are available but it's also very nice to to slowly wander through 2 or 3 times and admire the intricate detail. A must see when in St Petersburg

Stunning. This church looks amazing from the outside, but it's only when you get inside that you really get blown away. The entire inside of the church is decorated in mosaics and the colours and detail are incredible. It is 250Rb for an entrance ticket. It was very busy when I visited it.
Mosaics!. The sheer number of mosaics took away my breath...beautiful, too! Worth the small entrance fee, funny blue shoe covers. A quick must-see adventure.
Marilena. Perfect unbelievable place!!!!everyone must see inside is better including colours and work of 40years for this amazing pictures

Breathtaking. This was by far and away the highlight of our trip to St Petersburg. The mosaics are simply mind blowing. Take time to look at the pictures of the restoration toward the back near the shrine. It can get a bit busy in there with lots of people but don't rush.Linger outside for a while and walk around the building. Look for the section which was deliberately not restored after the war to see how much damage this building took.
Impressive church. The Church of the Savior on Blood is truly a landmark, whose the interior is as impressive as its exterior. The interior is fully covered with amazing mosaic. Do not miss it!
SO beautiful. The most beautiful chuch I saw in Saint Petrsbourg , full of color , beautiful architecture , full of History. I think Teresa was too much people inside at the same time .

Different kind of church. I've seen quite a few majestic churches in Italy, so it was cool to see something so different. The interior is completely covered in beautiful mosaic. Definitely something to see!

Very Crowded the first week of January for Holy Week. This is an amazing church completely covered in mosaics and a great location for a picture in front of the church as you exit. It is a uniquely Russian looking church.
Stunning!!!. This looks beautiful from the outside but when you get inside it takes your breath away!!!. Mosaic from floor to ceiling depicting beatiful scenes that make you gasp.
Incredible architecture and history. Breathtaking detail, very well maintained. One could easily invest an hour or more. An important part of one's first visit to St. Petersburg.

Cannot imagine how they build such magnificent Church, let alone the mosaic pictures on all the wall inside the church. The first sight when we arrived in front of the Church, the building architecture is totally different with ordinary church, it is really magnificent. And when you enter the church, you cannot imagine how they make all the pictures on the wall using Mosaic... it is extraordinary and you cannot think how many years they could finish all the wall... it is a must destination when you visit St. Petersburg

amazing colour pantone :). looks like a colour pantone with all the colours and decorations...so classic, so traditional, and carries the smell of Russia's history! must visit!loved it, and all the history and stories between its walls...

gorgeous, with mosaic interior. definitely the must go place. No more good words of it's view today.Considering re-deco since 90's, let's remember the history.BTW I found the most valuable eggs within the church shop (only interior).Nice restaurants around also (northwest direction).

Above the rest. You may notice that most Russian churches are very similar. But this one, this one is different. On the outside it is the most beautiful church in St Petersburg. The same is true about the inside. There are beautiful mosaics that are unique to this church.I also bought many souvenirs at the market that is right there close.

Absolutely Stunning!. We visited this church on a walking tour of St Petersburg. The guide had told us about the history of the church, but nothing prepared us for our first view of the church. It is next to the canals, and as we walked along the canal, enjoying the views of the city square,the church came in our eyesight. Pretty much everyone in our group just froze and said 'wow'. This is one of the most beautiful, colorful and ornate church I have seen.The location, the view, the bdutiful onion dome is so vibrant and colorful! It just takes your breath way. The entry fee to the church is about 250 rubles. This is an absolute MUST for any visit to St Petersburg!
GORGEOUS. It's absolutely fantastic!! The church itself is really beautiful and the history is very interesting. Everybody should visit this place!

A Stunning Architectural marvel. This is an absolute 'must' for visitors to St Petersburg. The very fabric of this magnificent structure is woven into the souls of Russian's and delivers a punch to the senses that will remain with you forever. The stunning artistry and colours dazzle and the effect on you is overwhelming.Take plenty of time to take in this amazing spectacle. We fired off hundreds of images without any repeats! When we visited, the crowds were immense so be prepared for this and keep small children by the hand at all times. We were also warned of the inevitable pick-pocket threat.Outside is as much a wonder as inside so try and plan your visit to coincide with clement weather. We enjoyed a private Russian guide for our visit which enhanced our understanding of the meaning of the landmark and its place in Russian history.One of our most favourite venues visited during our stay in the Russian Federation.
Beautiful mosaics. The entrance fee to the church is 250 rub. Very nice interior with mosaics. You are allowed to make pictures without flash.
beautifull cathedral. beautifull cathedral in Saint Petersburg center, i recommand higly the visit, plus day time , plus night time with nights lights

Stunning. The superlatives have already been written, so little need to repeat these. In St Petersburg, entry prices vary a little. Overseas tourists (not only Americans as one reviewer stated), pay 50 roubles ($ US 0.85) more than Russian citizens. At this price, you are getting a bargain. Remember, Russia has paid millions for the restoration of what you are viewing. Enjoy the experience.
Stunning! . This is just a place you dreamt of seeing. A place you see in movies. And when I was here it was surreal! It was huge, and it was fantastic to see!

Iconic and beautiful. You cannot leave St. Petersburg without actually being to this iconic church. It dominates the skyline so beautifully that you will want to pay a visit to the place. As much as it is beautiful from its exteriors, the interiors are even more ornate and intricate with good artworks all around. It is part of its culture and therefore deserves to be visited while in here.
Fascinating copy of Moscow structure. This cathedral is such a striking copy of the famous cathedral at Red Square. The interior is breadth taking and worth the effort.

Nice place to visit.. It's an interesting and beautiful architectural landmark of St. Petersburg and you'll learn a thing or two about the building's history once you visit it. However, bear in mind it's nothing more than a monument for a fallen autocrat and its significance, more than historical, religious or architectural, is political.

Iconic Russian building. Very beautiful artistic Church which was one of the highlights of our visit. We loved the colours and architecture but was slightly disappointed with the location for such an iconic church

Amazing Church. Savior on the Spilled Blood is a typical Byzantium church. We spent a night there, listening to a performance by a local choir on 24 December, 2014. Although the Russian celebrate their Christmas in January, there are many activities for tourist during our Christmas holiday. The church itself is worth visiting but with chior, just amazing!
Most Beautiful of Churches. What a beautiful church, full of imagery, history and colour! The outside is as decorative as the inside.....hard to believe it was a vegetable warehouse in its history.
Masterpiece!. Must-see historical, artistic and architectual jewel. Unforgettable arches, mosaics and biblical stories.
Magnificent. Must see in St Petersburg, get crowded but you must go inside the work is like nothing I have see before. My favourite place in St Petersburg

You need to visit !!. This place is amazing if you appreciate art, religion and history. The tour I took was in Russian but I had someone with me who translated the highlights while I admired as much as I could of the beauty and artistry. This is not a big place but I recommend you take your time to admire so much beauty, anywhere you look you will be amazed.
Best candy church ever!. A bit too much propaganda on the kindness of the Tsar in the audio guide, but the art and architecture is amazing.
Stunning. Truly not to be missed. Just watch. There are unadvertised prices for Americans, and prices for locales. Act like a non-tourist and pay less.
My favourite place in St Petes. Stunning. A must see in this beautiful city. There is a market just outside which is interesting too.

Outstanding!. This church is for sure the most beautiful inside and outside I`ve ever been! I wanted for so long to visit St Petersburg, and I spent so much time googling its location and everything about it... I can tell you with absolutely sure it haven`t disappointed me at all! It is incredibly candy-look-like on the outside and completely made of mosaics on the inside... Wonderful! Do not miss it!

WOW! - one of the best thing I've ever seen. I'm not a big fan of churches, but this one you just have to see. It's simply AMAZING!! If you don't have it on your llife time bucket list, you should add it stright away!
Iconic building. We never went inside as our tour did not include entrance fee, however that did not matter to us, we visited as a day tour, well worth a return visit.
Stunning. We see these structures on TV but nothing prepares you for seeing it for real. Amazing colours and design. A must see. You can feel the history of events that happened here.

My Favorite Church in Russia. I have been here a few times. This church is my favorite in all of Russia.....even ahead of St Basil's at Red Square in Moscow! The mosaics inside are impressive. The church has an interesting history and a nice setting along one of the canals in St Petersburg!
One of the 3 or 4 must see places in St Petersburg!

Absolutely beautiful and inspirational. We never thought we'd be actually entering the beautiful onion-domed Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood ... like walking into an icon of Russian heritage. Such different architecture and shapes. The mosaics were stunning, breathtaking even, since this historical site has just recently been refurbished and readied for viewing. Our guide explained the historical significance of the church and brought the story of the Tsars to life. The exact spot of Tsar Alexander II assassination is enclosed and encrusted with much topaz, lazurite and other semi-precious stones, much of it mined in the Ural mountains. The overall Blue mosaics have to be seen to appreciate the artistic work rendered throughout the church.
very crowded. I really loved the mosaics of the outer wall. It was much nearer to the center of the city than I thought I went there ten years ago. The park nearby is very peaceful.

Magnificent Mosaics. I visited here on a shore excursion with SPB Tours. The outside is a beautiful traditional Russian Orthodox church. When I walked inside, I was just stunned by the beauty and art. It was very crowded so at times it was difficult to move around, but a not to be missed sight. It is amazing that every one of the murals is a mosaic. There is nothing painted and every inch is covered in gorgeous art work, a feast for the eyes. A Russian czar was killed on this spot so that is the reason for the name, Church on the Spilled Blood. I would recommend a visit here when touring St Petersburg.
beautiful church!. It was the first attraction I got to see in St. Petersburg, and all I can say is: wow. Absolutely beautiful.

Something Very Unique. We joined the throng who swarm this amazing church every day and after purchasing our entry ticket enter this heavenly home on earth. Amazing art works adorn all corners of this most revered and holy place. My wife and I visited many churches of all denominations whilst in Russia and Poland and each of these visitations left us with the feeling that each and every one is its own experience. That all are deserved of our inspection and that each is special. This Church is one of those special places.

One of best place in at.peterzborg. We visited individual not with tour because we moved in city with historical metero & we retuned to hotel by walking. In our path we saw many shops & building & new couples (bride & groom) after that they invited us to their wedding it was so nice being there.
A must see. This was one of my favourite sights in St Petersburg - such an amazing church with a riot of colours
Must See. Worth the walk in the snow and was still very busy. Beautiful inside and some divine sights.Seemed that many people on pilgrimage in St PEtersburg and lots of buses at the Church.
Really pretty building!. This was one of our favourite buildings in Russia. The area around it has a lot of buskers/street entertainers giving it a Covent Garden like atmosphere. Go with your camera!
A must visit!. Highly recommend a visit here especially if you have a knowledgable guide to give you a detailed visit.

Truely a work of art. Amazing, not to be missing. This was worth the trip alone. If you have the chance to go to St. Petersburg go. The subway is quite interesting also 200ft down, the longest escalator you will ever see haha.

Beautiful church. It is near the Hermitage museum and you can easily get there from Nevsky Prospect. The church is beautiful form the outside and from the inside and I couldn't stop photographing it. It really looks like its from some fairytale, just gorgeous.
Fantastic. Fantastic church with overwhelming decorations - interesting story too. Inside you see the cobblestones, where the blood of the assinated emperor was spilled, quite interesting.

Not a frequent church visitor. Our guide was local (from Alla Tours) and added context to the history of this very impressive building. i love the swirling patterns in the ornamental stone. Crowded as expected, but not too much.
Stunning. The mosaics inside and the beautiful onion domes outside make this an iconic spot in St Petersburg. Everything has been beautifully restored and the effect is dazzling

This is like from a fairytale. The church is incredibly beautiful from the outside. You do well to pay attention to details, perhaps you should carry a camera with zoom capabilities or binoculars. The church is really popular among tourists, so expect a lot of them and street vendors. The church is excessive and the whole St. Petersburg is full of monumental buildings. There seemed to be a competition, who can build the most over the top building in St. Petersburg, while ordinary people could not afford bread. Revolution was a natural outcome of that disparity of construction bulimia and desperation. That is even in the Bible. The revolutionaries used icons for target practices. What makes me wonder is that they did not force the priests to hold them still. It was build for a killed czar. The Romanovs did not get the warning.

Take pictures outside, enjoy the mosaics inside. It is worth popping into this beautiful and ornate church. The outside is special but the inside is worth seeing too. The mosaics almost look like modern cartoons and are very striking. We spent about 45 mins here in total.

Startling beautiful. Quite beautiful architecture. Stunning dome inside vaulted and imposing. Quite struck by the detail that the majority of the artwork is fine coloured tiles and the work is so detailed.Round the outside of the church are plaques which detail the momentous history of the people of Russia from a social and legal perspective, well worth the walk and understanding.

of a similar model to St Basils's in moscow the interior of this cathederal is spectacular. I would recommend this attraction to any visitor to the city of St Petersburg. even for those who are not history or architecture buffs the interior outshines the spectacular exterior.

Must see. I was fortunate to do 2 trips to St. Petersburg, one on January and on July this year. I was lucky to see this structure daytime, night time, near and far, with or without snow. This is indeed an iconic structure.

An Architectural landmark and monument to Alexander II. The sight and size of the Cathedral captures your eye, as it boldly dominates the surrounding neighborhood. Once inside, your eyes are dazzled by the intricate and beautiful floor patterns, the stunning marble columns, the numerous huge mosaics, the ornamental details around windows and domes. Everywhere you look, you are in awe of the construction, of the beauty, or the planning that had to be done to achieve this great church. It is a 'must see', when visiting Saint Petersburg, you will be in awe.Jon Lefeber
Beautiful. Crowded but amazing. All the vibrant colors outside are beautiful but once inside the church is spectacular.

A must to see. Within walking distance of hotel. Good tip is to approach from the back walking along by canal. You get best perspective. Choose your time if you see loads of touris buses delay your visit by having a coffee

Unmissable !!!. We visited with a Newmarket Travel tour bus and were blown away with the detailed art work Tiles and Painting .Stunning to look at outside and in. word of warning go early as the queue is quite long to get in and there is so much jostling it does affect your enjoyment...not to be missed ,If your are in St Petersburg put it on your Itinary......This building shouts Russia at you
Like a fairytail. It's my favorit church. Beautiful colours outsite and insite. Dont'miss it. It's just around the corner from Sky hotel.
Absorbing. This Church is amazing for its outside beauty but also for its history and interior. Well worth visiting.

best of best. as you enter this church looking at art work on walls the colours so beautiful me I rarely visit a church I would return a 100 times just look at story behind art workprice was say about $2 across road is a markets worth a look

Cruise of a lifetime!. This attraction is absolute worth it.Stunning mosaic and it took my breath away!Lots of weddings take place there and its very romantic.Inside was beyond my imagination, a defenitely must!

Surprising. Visit just to see the spectacle.... Architecturally so interesting!! The history is astounding too
Check opening times ....
Amazing Church. Really beautiful church in a great location in St Petersburg - Great photos and located in a pedestrianised area
Beautiful mosaics and atmosphere. We found the atmosphere there very enchanting and spiritual. Had an excellent guide and learned a lot. Stunning mosaics. An absolute must visit.
