I loved it!. Brilliant architecture! One of the must churches you have to go in St. Petersburg. I recommend you also go to the Wood church exposition, it's only 100 RUP more but totally worth it!

Still very affordable. Do get the personal electronic tour guide handset, as it gives a good sense of politically-charged art history and you can skip around to any part of the interior very quickly to avoid groups and crowded parts.

The most amazing church I've even seen!. The mosaic inside the church is so perfect and detailed that it is hard to conceive how they did it. There is a temporary exhibition across the street about the rocks they used on the mosaic that is worth a visit. Cannot miss this church!!

Most significant landmark in St. Petersburg. Great photo experience both inside and outside. Different from any other church you have seen before. The visit itself will be done fast but please allocate enough time for the many picture opportunities that you will have outside.

Best place for a selfie :-). Get there by walking up the street along the canal from Nevsky Prospect. This gives you lots of photo ops of the canal with the church in the background. This is the classic photo of St. Petersburg!It is a lovely building and if you only have time for one Russian church, this is probably the one. It is next to a nice park if you need a break or you need to exercise off the Russian food. There are lots of small souvenir stands nearby with prices that you might negotiate cheaper than the fancy shops.
A must in Saint Petersburg. Beatifull outside and absolutely astonishing in the inside. Not to be missed. They close on wednesdays
Don't miss this. Spectacular from the outside and beautiful inside. Well worth a visit. Guides available as theres a lot to learn
impressive architecture. Very beautiful Both on the inside and exterior. The golden Domes a real land mark. The interior is small but beautiful and a must see whilst in St Petersburg.

Be Prepared to be Amazed. I still find it hard to sort out my feelings about this landmark church as I prefer simpler design. However it is beautiful in its own way – albeit an incredibly ornate way (inside and out) on a level that I doubt can truly be appreciated through photos. The interior walls and ceilings are completely done in finely-detailed tile mosaics and alters are made of a wide variety of jaspers, granites and semi-precious stone. The images are stunning, mesmerizing in a way I could not have imagined and they are impossible to take in (especially with the unending crowds).The church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881 after many key reforms. I simply cannot imagine the job of designing and planning the construction of this building – or the restoration job undertaken in 1970 to repair the damage done through the revolution and WW II.There are beautiful views in all directions from near and far – especially as seen along the canal.

Amazing place. I just loved it. Do not hesitate to go inside, the artwork is simply amazing. All the walls and the ceiling are covered in tiny mosaic made works of arc depicting bible stories. It´s breathtaking.
Beautiful!!!. The church of split blood is a most see when visiting St Petersburg!! The wonderful architecture is amazing.

Favorite memory of Saint Petersburg . This church, with large onion steeples, has always symbolized Russia for me. The Russians don't like to refer to them as onions they used another word. I forgot what is was, but not a vegetable. It was a great visit. We went with a guided tour. The inside is spectacular. I have seen many many churches in Europe and this one is amazing.Not to miss, a must see in Russia. We were there for about an hour. I could've used more time. The survival story during World War II was very interesting. The grounds are beautiful. It houses the only teenage rendering of Jesus.
super. art and architecture. the walk up to it. the street sounds. i dont have much time to write 50 charterers for each review.. so ill copy and paste

Breathtaking - a must see. The architecture of the church both inside and outside are spectacular. It is located by the canal near the Russian museum, right downtown St. Petersburg. You must see it yourself to feel the magnificent design and architect of the mosaic painting. It is worth the lineup.

It Looks Like a Russian Church Should Look. The onion shaped dome on the exterior is what one would expect. The name is rather off putting but Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in the church in 1881. The official name of it is "The Church of the Resurrection of the Christ". It's modeled after St. Basil's in Moscow. The interior is filled with well restored mosaics. It also has a shrine to the tsar. The church was crowded the day we were there and is not huge. It was interesting.

Fantastic on the outside and inside. I would put it at the 2nd or 3rd after The Hermitage and St Isaacs. Fantastic mosaics. Outside along the canel makes for good photography too. Being the place where the assasination took place makes it a interesting piece of history.

Lovely Church. I went just for one day to St. Petersbourg, but I wish I would have stayed longer instead of send so many days in Moscow, it is such a nice place! and the Church of our Savior is like taken from a fairy tale. A MUST in Russia.
Spectacular revivalist architecture!. What a visual feast, and how inspired is this structure. Fascinating, quirky, colourful and alluring. Read its history - quite a landmark!

Church of our Saviour is a popular place for St Petersburg locals.. Though the church itself is a great example of the ornate -almost gaudy style popular in the nineteenth century( and possibly an influence on Disney ?) the locals love to add their own personality too the area close by.. Artists of every persuasion add their personality to the canal bank leading to the church.... and to the area near the park gates nearby.

Amazing impressions. This cathedral is beautiful both externally and internally. History itself wears a sad character, but maybe it gives such strong emotions and impressions.One of the MUST SEE attractions in St. Petersburg.

Sofia Perovskaya's Choice. I was satisfied to visit this site, after much reading and researching Alexander II and The People's Will. Alexander II's biography by Edward Radzinsky was especially helpful in this. The interior mosaics are rather interesting, and I always enjoy seeing how the saints are represented (in this church they look a lot like Mary Pickford). There was a rather interesting display of building tiles at the exit counter, too bad it was in Russian so I didn't learn as much as I would have liked. It was fulfilling for me to walk the area and try to see the placement of the assassins and how they plotted. We even walked to the nearby Malaya Sadovaya to see where The People's Will mined the road to blow up the tsar's carriage. If you are interested in the revolutionists' work, you may be interested in this site. Russian Revival architecture leaves me cold, but it's worth it to see this church if only for the bragging rights later. If I hadn't known so much history about Alexander II , III and Nicholas II, I probably wouldn't have been very interested in this church, although it is very colorful!!!

A very special place. Wonderful mosaics, they really glow and shine. It is not like any other church I have seen. It is based in Byzantine roots, developed with 19th century Russian best artists and craftsmen with the use of the advanced mosaic technology of that time. Was interesting to hear the dramatic history of the church. You may want to see if there is a guided tour in English (Russian-language tour is included in ticket price).
outstanding. A must to visit when in St.Petersburg. Artwork is all done in mosaics. Beautiful interior and the onion tops are spectacular.Don't forget your camera!

Stunningly Beautiful. We saw this amazing church only on the outside during a tour. There is an admission fee for going inside, but we were told that it is well worth the fee to go in. The church took 24 yrs to build, then 26 yrs to restore after it was left many years without care. We were told that it had even been used as a storage facility for a while. Don't miss seeing this when you are in St. Petersburg.

Everything you imagine. This is the quintessential photo of St. Pete, the thing we all want to see. And you know what? It absolutely does not disappoint. How many times do we see postcards and hear friends' stories only to arrive and think, "humph"... This is one visit that will meet your expectations and more. I think it is one of the most beautiful churches I have seen in the world.

Oh those Onion Domes. It certainly lives up to the pictures you see in guide books. Stunning from the outside but breathtaking from the inside and historically fascinating. As with all the memorable sights of St Petersburg, very, very crowded.

this church is breathtaking!. this is the most impressive church I've met in my life. The mosaics are wonderful, the church is beautiful inside and out. Be sure to visit her, is an unforgettable experience and a different attracting everything you've ever seen
Incredible. Although not a fan of religious art, the church surprises with its details, both external and internal. Worth paying to see and visit the incredible mosaics.

spectacular church in st. petersburg. architecture of this church is unik in st petersburg, outside is really beautiful , aside river chanel and garden of museum. inside is breathtaking, full of ceramic paintings. absolutely worth to visit outside and inside.

Museum, not a Church. And that is not a downer. Just don't expect Choirs and Priests. The outside is stunning, inside is on the same planet. Do not forget to look up- the ceiling is as impressive as the rest of the church.Not a large place and 30 minutes would probably be sufficient for a lot of people (ignoring the wait at the souvenier shop).This is a must see in St. Petersburg.
Truly wonderful.. Truly wonderful. Very beautiful. Must see. Though be prepared that there will be quite a lot of people their. Walking distance from Hermitage Museum along Nevsky avenue.
Tour of St Petersburg by coach from our cruise on the Marco Polo from Tilbury. Amazing structure built on the site of a Tzar assassination .Many domes and mosaics. Situated beside a canal.
Crowded but stunning. I liked the mosaics, but disliked the crowds. Wish there was some sort of public transportation. It is probably best seen with a tour group
Fascinating. This church is a must to see in St. P. It is beautiful, and amazing. It can be crowded, but worth the wait.
A great church. The history of the church added to the beauty of this fine construction. The mosaics are beautiful and well worth a visit. The ticket lines can be long on holidays.

When being a kid I thought its a fairytale sweet palace, even not knowing there are such fantastic mosaics inside. Definitely worth visiting!Try to choose not a rush hour time so that to enjoy the mosaics and not the crowds inside
Old Boys trip to St. Petersburg. I have never been in a place of worship, where it is completely covered by mosaic. It is the most fantastic place to visit.
An absolute knock-out. Just stunning, whatever your faith, if any. Amazing frescos, fortunately now substantially restored. And certainly superior inside to St Basil's in Moscow.
Must do. Inside it has the best decoration of all the religious buildings we visited. If you do a guided city tour insist that you will be given time to visit.

Magnificent Saviour of Spilled Blood. THE picture to have if standing beside a church. Take your pictures from the rear as that is clearly the best view of the brightly coloured domes. The internal walls ceiling are ALL small mosaic tiles to produce the most absolute picturesque murals ever. Once inside, stand under the dome & see OUR GOD, Gabrielle a dove among others. What mastery .... did not expect a superb piece of art.A must see in St Petersburg along with St Isaacs church
Worth entering. Wonderful and historical church. The mosaic inside is breathtaking. Pure art. I highly recommend visiting inside.

Fantastic church with a salutary history!. This church has to be seen to be believed, the internal decoration in particular is stunning and the outside is pretty impressive too!The use as a storage site in the Soviet era and the damage done, shown in photos, and the excellent restoration is delightful. The memorial to the murdered czar who, allegedly, was about to sign a decree on greater freedoms, but was killed just before he did: how different history might have been!?Highly recommended

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. went at noon on a rainy tuesday. there was no line but it was still a bit crowded inside. the onion domes make it look like the whole thing will float awayi was surprised to find it was completed in 1907, i was expecting much older based on the few pictures i had seen

Don't leave the city without visiting this stunning church. If you have only a limited time in this magnificent city, then this church and the Hermitage must be the two 'must sees'. The exterior is extraordinary but the interior is equally amazing. Definitely worth hiring an audio guide which gives an impressive amount of detail about the history of the building and the craftsmen who created it.

Good Reason this is #1. I would tie this beautiful Church with the Hermitage as the top must see attractions in St. Petersburg. You have got to go and spend some time enjoying both the inside and the outside of the building. Step back and see the outside and get some good pictures. Small admission gets you into the building to enjoy that also.Many times you will see young couples taking pictures here for weddings.

Do not miss.... Do not on any account leave St Petersburg without visiting this cathedral. The exterior is amazing but it doesn't stop there, the interior is incredible, you have to see for yourself. Just stand and gaze open mouthed at the absolute beauty surrounding you.

One of the iconic symbols of St Petersburg. One of the finest religious buildings I have had the pleasure of visiting. The exterior is world famous but the interior is also worth a good look with literally hundreds of stunning mosaics. Essential to have your camera with you for this visit. I have been lucky enough to view it both during daylight hours and in the evening when all lit up. Both views are superb, the best ones in my opinion being from Nevsky Prospekt. Take pictures both close-up and from a distance. Lots of souvenir shops nearby.

A must see, Must photograph. All of the Russian cathedrals have the same floor plan and similar decoration. St Isaacs may be better interior. But, this cathedral's exterior is iconic. Take photos from the bridge on Nevesky Prospekt or the bridge on the opposite side of the church.
Beautiful. This is what us Americans think of as the traditional looking Russian Church. It has such an interesting history and is overwhelming with all the glass mosiacs.
Unbelievable. Be sure to take lots of photos and get a book on this magnificent church. So much history and so much to see from the mosaic floors to the ceilings that are highly decorated or painted.

A wonder to behold.. An amazing experience to see this incredible structure through my own eyes---totally awe inspiring from the outside but it was inside that took my breath away.The most beautiful art work done with millions of mosaics mainly in blues and gold which made it feel truly magical.A must see of St Petersburg.
Beautiful Cathedral. Some of the art was under construction, but it was still beautiful. Take advantage of the souvenir shops around it.

A must for the itinerary. Hard to put into words the pure breathtaking beauty of this building. The exterior it's self is impressive at every angle and the inside is nothing what you'll ever expect. Photography is allowed without flash and it's needed in this church. Take note though due to it being a church they're a few parts you cannot take photos of due to respect of those praying however the walls and ceilings are what you want! I would say this is a must even if it's just a quick look in to say you've done it
Wonderful. I can describe all the things we saw but they were all beautiful. Informative. A dream come true. Given the chance take it.

Amazing and 'must see'. Other reviews have rightly explained what this church has to offer - an exterior that looks like a fairy story construction, but for real - and with each turret and dome having a significance and religious purpose. And then the incredible internal mosaics and other religious items, along with the patterned marble flooring. This must be a 'wonder of the world'. Photography permitted inside with no flash.

i like the vibe. I like the vibe around the church like Kios of hot dog were around (it's delicious) ,The minstrel(quite hippy style on the day i found),the river exists parallel with walking street where I could find the restuarant to stretch my tired leg from walking tour etc.
Must visit attraction. This is a most delightful and surprising church with amazing mosaics and near to a market if you wish to buy local goods

Impressive. In June I visited the Church of our Savior on Spilled Blood and what a place to visit. Please don't be put off by the name as once inside all will be revealed, but you will have to go to find out what. When I stepped inside, I was in total awe at the beautiful art works made entirely of mosaics they were very impressive. The only down side was, the church can get very crowded and you tend to get pushed along and can miss seeing all the items on show. Try to go early in the day as my party went midday and I wished we had been allowed more time as it was very busy. Please make a trip to the church you cannot miss the building because it is as impressive on the outside with its coloured orthodox domes as it is on the inside. A beautiful building and a popular trip. The highlight of my visit to St Petersburg.

Pick pockets BEWAREI . Beware. I was assaulted by two professional pickpockets immediately in front of this church. They aggressively attack me install many valuables including my camera. This was done in plain sight of many locals, other vendors, to us and guides. The police did absolutely nothing when I filed the report. Apparently this is acceptable behavior in Russia.Later, several other members of our group were also robbed.

a famous landmark in St. Petersburg. Worth a visit. The site of murder of Emperor Alexander II is marked by a special chapel in the building. The construction of the church and work on the decor took 24 years. The outside of the church is decorated with mosaics, while the cupolas are covered with bright enamels & hipped roofs with coloured tiles.

Pretty from outside. Many people confuse pics of this church with Moscow because of the colorful traditional architecture. This church is beautiful from outside much more than from inside. Women dont forget to bring a scarf to cover your hair! Also I think this is the church where Pussy Riot played...

So beautiful in person.. Please don't miss the opportunity to go inside this beautiful church. There is a nice gift shop inside so don't buy any of the souvenirs on the street outside until you see what is offered inside of the church.
Outside and Inside Spectacular. You know you are in Russia when you see it. It is wildly gorgeouos on the outside and If you lke Mosaics then you will be in Heaven. Go early when crowds are lighter.

Stunning!. Lovely site to explore during the day, at night from a riverboat cruise breathtaking! I explored the city on my own and came across the church by accident. I was blown away and took many pictures of it from the canal bridges while the people of St. Petes just went about their business.
Spectacular!. Beautiful and historic both inside and outside. At night, it becomes even more enchanting when viewed from a riverboat cruise. Take some time to explore the area surrounding it as well.

A MUST. St Peterburg was built as a window on the West and the architecture, while stunning, is very Western. This is virtually the only traditional building in the Russian style. I have never been inside (which I must next visit), but it is a must. Built on a canal off Nevsky Prospect (the main street). It was built as a memorial to Alexander II on the spot where he was assasinated in 1881. A great photographic opportunity.

Most Beautiful Church!!!. This is the church you see in all of the tourist literature. It is simply beautiful!!! It was so stunning, we bought a watercolor painting to take home to remind us of our visit!

Spectacular church. There are May beautiful churches in St Petersburg and this is one of, if not the best example. The splendour of the outside is matched by the sheer extravagance of the interior. I'm not normally a lover of churches or architecture but the church of our Saviour on Spilled Blood is simply breathtaking. If your in St Petersburg its a must.
Church. Beautiful, well worth a look lots of history. Must go with a guide. Dont be put of by the number of people there. Seems very busy but well worth.

Very interesting. Saint Peterburg's answer to Saint Basils Cathedral in Red Square, Moscow, built by Tsar Alexander II on the spot where his father, Alexander II, was assassinated. Beautiful when illuminated at night.
Amazing. If you only visit one church in St Petes make it this one- absolutely stunning mosaics inside- unbelievably beautiful.

Spectacular Church. This is one of my favorite churches in the world. It is beautiful both on the outside and inside. make sure that you take in all of the details on the outside and appreciate how something special was added to every inch of the outside structure. Than when you go in you will see the spectacular mosaics and all of the details inside. Again every inch of the inside has a special detail. Just wander around and appreciate the care and artistry that went into the construction of this master piece. I hated leaving because I wanted to continue to discover the various details. I bought a beautiful water color from one of the artists on the street of the church to take home to remind me of this amazing structure.

More modern but lovely. Ornate, colorful and full of meaning. Have a guide if possible or use Lonely Planet to help you enjoy this masterpiece. Great things around that area as well so stroll afterwards. Faberge Museum is close as is the ballet.
Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Iconic Cathedral of St. Petersburg- simple beautiful. The many many mosaics blew me away and the dome is equally impressive.

A Do Not Miss while in St. Petersburg. The first time we visited it was in February - clear,cold, and snowy. This time it was much warmer, overcast, and very crowded. On our first visit it was very easy to walk around and take photographs unobstructed but even with the crowds, it is a place not to be missed. The exterior is quintessentially Russia. Incredible architecture and onion domed towers. The interior is what is truly amazing as all the walls are covered by small colored tiles that make up these incredible murals. Even though you will be pushed through by the crowds (in the summer months) and not be able to linger as long as you wish, it is well worth visiting whenever you can.Another very similar place not too far away is St. Isaacs. The exteriors are very different but the interiors are finished out in the same style. St. Isaacs is larger but there are still plenty of people to keep you moving in the summer. If you are able, by all means, visit both.

Worth the visit. This church is beautiful both in the outside and the inside. It is similar to St Basil´s cathedral in Moscow so if you loved that one...you are gonna fall for this one too! (however if you hated it you´d better go somewhere else).Look at the mosaics...seriously LOOK!

Gorgeous to see in person.. I posted a picture of this on Facebook the day we were there and got more "likes" than for anything else (haha) but to see it in person is an incredible experience - it is magnificent.
Wow. What a fabulous building just wish we could have stayed longer and seen more. It is a popular tourist spot so expect crowds.

Amazing Church. This church was destroyed by the Nazis. It took 24 years to build this mosaic tile pictures on the walls and it took 27 years to rebuild it. Please be sure to go inside the church and not just pass it by from the outside...

See the inside. If you think this church is beautiful from the outside, then you must visit the inside. Of all the churches we visited in Russia, this was by far our favorite. The beautiful Biblical mosaics inside rival the colorful outside. Upon closer inspection, you realize that the window sills and even the ceiling is mosaic, so the uniformity of the main part of the church is oddly in conflict with the gold altars. Nevertheless, this church is so different than others, that it is a must see when you are in St. Petersburg.

Great Architecture !. the church is magnificent building and a must see when you are in saint petersburg,i liked the dome and the drawings on walls,so colorful and beautiful,i recommend it very much and The mosaics are incredible, they are so beautiful and well drawn,never miss it :) !
Very colourful. Beautiful inside and outside. Lovely mosaics. This work is all recent, but beautifully done, so worth a visit. Shop inside sells souvenirs at good prices.

A must see in St. Petersburg. The domes on this are very ornate, and seem almost out of place, as they are opulent yet disjointed in that ascetically they don’t seem to go at all with each other or the ornate façade. Inside the church is just as much a mish mash of colors and styles. The mosaics are incredible, they are so beautiful and depict many diffierent biblical stories from the new testament. And the woodworking in the parquet floors are also marvelous, but then the overdone gold altars seem out of place with the rest. The historic significance is interesting, in that the church was built on the spot were Tsar Nicholas I was assassinated. His son commissioned the church and the mosaics that decorate it, in his honor.Although ascetically disjointed, it is a classic Orthodox church with the icons displayed in mosaic fashion. It is a definite must see to understand and appreciate the historic significance and the wealth that was Tsarist Russia.
silence. liked the calm atmosphere, something we have never experienced before put together with the unbelievable architecture.

Unfortunately closed on our visit. It was a lovely church but couldn't get in because work was being done at time of visit which was a shame as it wasn't advertised anywhere that this would be the case

Stunning. Having seen very many churches throughout our trip, the Church of Our Savior still remains our favourite. The mosaic work inside is breath taking and the lighting at night makes it even more memorable. Do note that the church is opened at night only in the summer, and the entrance fee is R100 more than daytime entrance, but well worth the money.
Got to see to believe. What an amazing place to see. It just takes your breath away looking at the detail and sheer size of the place. A must visit

Such a beautiful building inside and out. We visited St Petersburg for 2 days whilst on the Queen Victoria cruise ship. On arrival to Russia the port was empty, and deserted all that could be seen in the distance were row among row of concrete bland looking flats with only one or two pointy looking roofs above. This not a good impression from the new port! we took our tour bus on the first day into the City centre where we boarded a canal boat which took us amongst the Heritage buildings commissioned by Catherine the Great an Tsar Alexander. All very square looking and quite European but they were stunning theatres, museums and palaces etc, then we walked to the Church of the Saviour of Spilled Blood, the place we had been waiting for and it was breathtakingly beautiful. The onion style roof covered in mosaic and gold! and the inside was painted in gold depicting stories from the bible, my favourite depicture was Moses on Mount Sion receiving the tablet of stone. This was a truly wonderful experience for anyone who appreciates architecture. I couldn't believe it was used for storing vegetables during the cold war!!

Best Church in Europe. We have been to so many churches in Europe and it just gets old. Not here! This is the most awe inspiring building we have ever seen. It is so beautiful, it is difficult to describe. It is located in the heart of the city, next to the river. The architecture on the outside is unbelievable. Pictures do not do it justice. It is just as beautiful inside. We will never forget it. A "must see!"
Awesome and magnificent. The long lines and lack of ventilation in the palaces and museum, otherwise it was a great and educational experience.

Absolutely breathtaking. My favourite building in whole Saint Petersburg city, and seems like the most beautiful church from the inside that i've ever seen. Just adorable view. If you're planning a trip to Moscow after St. Petersburg, don't be suprised that St. Basil Cathedral on Red Square will seem to be nothing special, after seeing the Church of Saviour on Spilled Blood. Must must see.

Splendid Memorial to Tsar Alexander II. The colourful onion domes of this church conscientiously echo the famous domes of St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. With its flamboyant architecture, it is a little out of place in St Petersburg but within the walls is a special shrine that guards the original section of cobblestoned street where Tsar Alexander II was murdered in 1881.The Soviet government closed the church in 1930's and it was used for many years to store vegetables. 27 years of restoration was needed to return the church's wonderful mosaics to their former glory. The official name of the church is The Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ and is well-worth the visit.
Beautifully restored historic chu. Beautiful outside and in this was a highlight of the trip around the city. Well worth a visit - small but the entry charge is well worthwhile.

Most beautiful mosaics to be seen. Unusual architecture. We were not rushed and there were not too many people when we were taken there. It was important to have the history of this church given to us by our guide Stanislaw.
Amazing!. It was the first atraccion I saw in this city and I was in shock! it is really one of the places you have to go.

Beautiful.. A nice church to visit when in St.Petersburg.The church is located in a very busy area of the city (of course it's busy because of all the tourists wanting to see it), so just be aware when crossing the street around the church. The architecture is unlike anything I have seen before and the colours are absolutely inspiring. We didn't have a lot of time to spend there but it was certainly worth seeing it. If you are in St. Petersburg it's certainly a must do.
Most Popular Church in St. Peterburg?. Unusual architecture that is associated with Russia. Beautiful mosaic interior with awe inspiring artifacts inside.
Amazing. It is so much more in person. If you could only see one place in St. Petersburg...this would be the one you should choose. It was one of the most amazing things I have in my life.

must visit. The Beauty of the church is mesmerizing the architecture and the interior is breathtaking, all the walls are made of mosaic, the marble will give you the feel of blood stain as it is made in such a way, i truly enjoyed the entire experience.
a russian beauty. Visited during the night when church was closed, but even outside view kills. Classic Russian church, perfectly restorated and painted... Very nice.

Great !. Very beautiful place ! We were walking through Nevsky prospect and i saw the this beautiful place , i thought that there is now way to enter this place but the ticket was only 7 euro p/p Inside you will find such a peaceful atmosphere.

Beautiful Russian Church!. This is a beautiful church. The facade (without being an expert of any sort), I think, shows a unique Russian architecture. It's facade I believe is very different from other churches I've seen in Europe. Very colorful and beautiful.This is the place where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated. Interesting history. It's a pleasure just to walk around and view the various mosaics, religious paintings. There is a cost to get it. This was one of the stops for our SPB-Tours Grand Historical tour, so it was part of our package.

Visually Stunning Inside and Out. Keep in mind this is more a memorial and museum than a church. The website even refers to this site as a memorial and museum. The mosaics inside and the architecture (old Russia) are amazing. This was a stop on our 2 day tour of St Pete's while on a 9 day Baltic cruise with family. There are lots of tourists (no surprise) but we were able to take some decent pictures and enjoyed the short tour. It's also hard to miss. We could see it from other parts of the city as we were driving around in our mini tour bus.Our tour here took about 30 minutes and then we took pictures and looked at souvenirs. I thought it was worth it given it's location. Because it was part of our tour I don't know how much it cost. I gave it 5 stars because it's so beautiful and there's an interesting story. It's not very old so there isn't a long story to tell but it was interesting.
Mosaics!. Everything! Incredible! Nothing to dislike! Except to remember to turn off your flash on your camera otherwise a little old lady will scream at you "No Flash"
A must see in SPb. This cathedral is an icon of Saint Petersburg. It's beautiful from the outside, but particularly impressive from the inside, with all its mosaics.

Amazing from the outside. The outside is absolutely impressive. The inside is very similar to other orthodox churches and is lacks the large spaces of other temples. If you are short on time it is worth spending some more time on taking a couple of more pictures from the outside than queue to get inside.

Amazing Mosaics!. The church on the outside is just absolutely beautiful! I actually like this better than the St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. The colors were nice and the details were very intricate! When you go inside, you'll be blown away with all the mosaics on the walls, ceilings, everywhere! Totally worth it to go inside!

Wow!. I've recently seen a lot of churches and other places of worship, and was getting to the stage of not expecting to see anything new or more spectacular than I had already seen. Ha!The external view of this church is quite amazing — the colours and patterns are not always as symmetrical or predictable as may be anticipated, but still seem to work very well. But inside is a feast of mosaic work that is simply breathtaking. Colourful, meaningful, incredibly ornate. This represents a tribute to the craftsmen and women, and those with the vision to create it. Yes, one may criticise the money spent on this, but it does seem to represent an act of worship by its creators, and serves to promote an aspect of the Christian message which is core to a church's or church building's existence.
Stunning Beauty. There is an entry fee, well worth paying it. The inside is stunning. It is a popular place to visit.

Definitely worth a visit. Had to go here and see this beautiful church and was not let down. Couldn't get enough pictures. Unfortunately on a Wednesday it is closed so could not go inside. Did come back the next day just to go inside. Inside covered in mosaics!! Must have taken ages to do this. Recommend a visit if you are in Saint Petersburg, even if you don't go inside it worth a look and to get photos. It just so pretty and different.

Stunning architecure. On my tour this was only a 20 minute photo-stop on what was a very busy schedule, but is one of those iconic buildings that must just be seen. I would have loved to have time to have visited inside, but had to make do with a walk around. Even if you only have time to view from the outside then that is well worth it. Make sure you walk around to the other side from where the coaches stop to view the main entrance, and avoid the costumed "photo opportunities" who seemed to descend on each party as they arrived offering to have pictures taken with you. A wide-angled lens really helps to capture the building, as otherwise there isn't enough room to move back to get it all in-frame.

Astonishing. Mosaics at their best, it's absolutely astonishing. Gorgeous from every angle. We went at night, I guess it makes no difference the time of the day so it was a great way to finish the day.
Amazing sight!. As you approach you see the coloured spires, but when you get up close, it's unbelievable. Really worth a visit and the history behind the building will bring you out in goose bumps.

A Must See in St P. Inside and out, you will want to gaze on this splendid church. The mosaics are amazing-how much labor did it take to create them?- and the onion shaped domes will match your mental picture of this amazing place. It is built on the actual place where one of the Alexanders was killed, and the original cobblestones of the assassination spot are part of the interior.Souvenirs are sold inside and out, be careful with your money! Pickpockets are lurking.

Loved It!. This has to be the number one MUST-SEE in St. Petersburg. It will definitely not be a visit to St.Petersburg if you miss the Church on Spilt Blood. Architecture is awesome and if the walls could talk they would spill forth chapters upon chapters of captivating history. Please don't miss this magnificent building. Highly recommended!!

Beautiful Church. The church can be found down a side street off the main Nevsky Prospect Road. It is absolutely stunning. The mosaics inside are incredible. A real must see in St Petersburgh. We bought a picture of the church from a vendor outside. Now had it framed and is hanging in our hallway, as a reminder of our visit to St Petersburgh.
Beautiful. Perfect symbol of the country as it is beautiful and iconic and there are fun hotdogs seller outside the church. Good for lunch.
Great place to visit . Great place to visit in Saint Petersburg the church is near to nevsky prospect and white places of Saint Petersburg. Love to go again
Mosaics. What a beautiful colorful church! Beware of pick pockets. Not something one would expect while touring a church, but a young man on our tour came away minus his wallet.

Wow!. Absolutely stunning, but the crowds of people pushing us along was a bit too much! Make sure you go first thing in the morning to try and avoid crowds, and to take more time to see this beautiful church.
Very nice!. Definately worth a walkthrough and if you are on a budget Id rather visit this one than the St. Isaac's Cathedral. Even better though are the gardens of the summer palace in Peterhof!

Outstanding. It is totally breathtaking. I have never seen anything like it anywhere in the world. The building is like myriads of the “onion” domes, standing quietly on the water canal away from the busy streets. Its founding story is very sad and horrible as it was dedicated to a Russian czar who abolished the slavery in Russia, but was killed by terrorists.

Wow. Unbelievably restored church.. At one point in the Soviet era this Church was a vegetable warehouse. It stands on the spot where Alexander II, who sold us Alaska, was killed by an assassin's bomb.
Incredible Church. Awesome from the outside, and magnificent inside. A must to visit. Can also be reached from the Canal Waterway.

You must visit. Wonderful church, beautiful inside and outside. What a piece of art. The works inside are very detail. It was very crowed but I recomended. Defenitive it must be seen for any visitor to St. Petersburg.
Peculiar and beautiful. Maybe the most peculiar and different church I have ever seen. You will have to pay to visit it's interior, but it worths!
Do not miss Spilled Blood. With 7,000 sq meters of mosaic in this beautiful church, you can not miss stopping by! Usually the last stop as part of the SPB tours...thanks SPB!

Picturesque and Memorable. The setting on the canal and the distinct medieval mosaic architecture is amazingly beautiful. And that is just on the outside! I found out that the church was built on the site where Czar Alexander II was assassinated and it was built in his memory by his son; hence the name, Church of the Spilled Blood. You must see this church when you visit St. Petersburg.
Exquisite exterior . . .. quiet and divine interior. Glad the Bolsheviks didn't completely destroy it. Restoration is beautiful. Worth a visit.
Gorgeous inside and out. Too crowded of course, but amazing mosaics. Not to be missed. Try to go early or late. I don't know what else to say.
classic russian architecture. The domes are similar to Saint Basils in Moscow, bordering a green park and market stall, nworth a visit if you have an hour to spare.

MUST VISIT!!!. That's amazing!!! Just amazing!!!! You should come and see! And better with guide (they have free groups organized inside Cathedral). I have shivering every time I'm there, especially when you know the whole history of this building. Every cm made with mosaic! All over! Nothing is painted! I've never seen anything like that in the world!
Lives up to the glossy photographs. Lives up to the glossy photographs that are featured so prominently. As a bonus the breakfast room at our hotel looked out over the church.

Awesome Attraction. Iconically Russian. This magnificent structure is a must see when visiting St Petersburg and can be best viewed from Nevsky Prospekt. It is located adjacent to a canal and is an imposing sight when first encountered. It is built on the site where Emperor Alexander 11 was assassinated in March 1981by a group of revolutionaries who threw a bomb at his royal carriage. It was built between 1883 and 1907 and its construction was funded by the imperial family and private contribution. Similar and of equal magnificence to St. Basils in Moscow, no visit to St Petersburg would be complete without a visit. The artwork on the inside is totally of large Russian inconic Orthodox type art and is mainly mosaic. This is totally different to the Renaissance art featured in European Cathedrals and will either appeal to you or not. This church contains a lot of Russian history of both the Tsars and the Communist eras and was closed back in the 1930's by the Bolsheviks and had not been reopened until recent time for religious purposes. Anyone visiting St Petersburg really needs to include this one on their wish list.
Incredible Imposing Structure. A must see when visiting St Petersburg . An incredible imposing structure. It is very impressive and truly unique, very colorful with stunning architecture.
Stunning church. Fantastic building both stunning from the outside and inside. Very interesting and informative.Try to get a photo at night. Beside a canal so reminds you of Venice
Magnificent!. Beautiful! this is one church not to be missed! The mosaics are outstanding. The churches here remind me of Italy in their beauty!

One place to go. Even though the price may be high for the small church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood - you have to go there, after such a long delay for its construction the interior is wonderful, if you love the orthodox style you will get enough for the next 10 years !
Must see .. Amazing inside though the picturesque outside is spell binding. Luckily it was sunny on my visit n though small inside a real wonder n feast to the eyes. Highly recommended.

Didn't disappoint. A must see when visiting this often beautiful and amazing city.
The architecture and colour is incredible.

Amazing Church. We both agreed that this was a magnificent church built on the site (partially over a canal) of the assassination of Tsar Alexander 2. As you step into this church, I guarantee that you will say "Wow". The mosaic work is so sublime, that you have to keep reminding yourself that you are not looking at paintings. The altar is pretty spectacular too. Another 'must see' attraction in St Petersburg.
One of the many churches. The church is imposing but the inside offers a strange blend of emptiness and spirituality. Skip it.
Amazing Church. What an amazing church both on the exterior and interior design. We were so impressed by all the overall design and the details. This is a must see attraction.
Amazing and peacefull. Inside a very inspiring atmosphere, huge paintings in the roof, huge paintings in the walls, everything inside is so huge and amazing to see.

Impressive church - can be seen far away!. Colorful and grand architecture from the outside - can be seen miles away. I did not get a chance to visit the inside, but heard from my tour group that it is well worth a visit.
What a beautiful colorful building. Now a museum but rather beautiful architecture and it deserves returning to its original use in the future, make a point of seeing the interior

A "must see" on any tour in St. Petersburg. Amazing architecture; take photos you will cherish when you return home. This was an optional excursion offered by our cruise ship. We highly recommend taking this excursion when in St. Petersburg.

Beautiful on the outside - inside not so much. Absolutely loved the outside of this church. Walked around and around it to make sure I missed none of it.
However once inside I was disappointed. Took an audio tour but would not bother going inside again.
The church was incredible.. The architecture and the history of the place was incredible, also the paintings were so life like, there was nothing to dislike about it.
Impressive. Avery unique Church. Looks interesting from outside and wonderful from inside. Unique wall paintings and more.

Decent Cathedral. Reminiscent of St Basil's in Red Square, but seemed a bit smaller and without as much of the museum-like feel.Unfortunately, I was not paying as much attention as I would have if my wallet had not been pickpocketed on Nevskeiy Prospekt on the way there. Carry only what you need, and then put it in a secure spot, not a back pocket! I never thought it could happen to me, but it did. The Russians seem to have the attitude that pickpockets are a natural, acceptable feature of their city.
Beautiful inside and out. This is so pretty from the outside. Inside is worth seeing and we had some interesting information from our guide.
Awesome. Awesome in the original sense of the word. The mosaics are breathtaking, rivaling those in the mosques of Istanbul. The scale is immense. This is one of the great churches of the world.

Magnificent. How do you describe such a brilliant piece of architecture, with art work and sculpture throughout this wonderful structure. This is one of the wonders of the world and a credit to the SPB inhabitants in keeping a building in such a state.

Iconic looking Russian church. This was the one of the highlights of our two day visit to St. Petersburg. The mosiacs inside and the iconostasis were very impressive. Crowds were not too bad and our small tour bus was able to park right outside the church

This is a Church too see. We only saw the outside of this impressive Church but it was well worth the visit, it can be a bit crowded and you will get neck ache as you admire the sheer scale of wonderful towers and onion shaped gold Domes And the vast Religious art work has to be seen .
Fabulous from the outside and inside. Loved this Church and the canal running by outside. This was a beautiful church with a lot of history.
A beautiful church. It looks the same as St. Basil's in Moscow, but this cathedral is a lot more beautiful. The detail on the outside is amazing!
Amazing experience. Unbelievable craftsmanship, beautiful images. Very popular and busy attraction, allow for an hour as part of your trip

Beautiful art work. This church has the beautiful onion domes on the outside & excellent mosaics, but it's the inside that takes your breath away. I don't think I've ever seen such wonderful colours in church paintings.

Wonderful Church. A must in St Petersburg. The most beautiful church in the city. Arriving to Nevsky Prospekt tube station, the best point to start your tour in the city, you turn to your right and find this stunning monument. The real name is "Church of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ", but people call it "Church of the Savior on Blood" because it was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated, and was dedicated in his memory.
A must!. Amazing history surrounding the building. You will have to visit it to find out. Always very busy. Get a tour guide when you are there to explain the history.
Don't miss this.. A great half hour of mosaics and history. A turn of the century masterpiece. The audio tour was worth the small extra fee.

Beautiful church, insane location. I realize this church was built long before any vehicular traffic was around it but it takes something away from the pleasure if visiting and seeing the church when the traffic and the buses and the taxis and the insane drivers put the fear of getting mowed over above any other thoughts you might have while visiting St. Petersburg. The church is located in a very busy area of the city (of course it's busy because of all the tourists wanting to see it), so just be aware when crossing the street around the church. The architecture is unlike anything I have seen before and the colours are absolutely inspiring. We didn't have a lot of time to spend there but it was certainly worth seeing it. If you are in St. Petersburg it's certainly a must do.
Beautiful place.. This is a beautiful church and the inside is just fabulous. The outside is wonderful. A must see when in St. Petersburg.

Gorgeous mosaics. After seeing this church, I never have to see another. It was that amazing. We have been to Revenna, but the mosaics here surpass anything I have seen.The entire interior of the church is floor to ceiling mosaic.And it is rather new, so the colours are very bright and alive.
beautiful. One of the most amazing churches I ever visited (the other one was Köln Cathedral). Certainly a must see church.
Beautiful interior and exterior. Beautiful interior but no English tours and only the ground floor is open to public. No English information written about the paintings on the walls.
Brillant. We were on the a trip around the Baltic if you are in the area you go see it you will be amazed it is beautiful
Exquisite. The mosaics were exquisite and the artworkis so rich one doesn't know when to stop taking photos. The exterior was post-card perfect, the golden domes glistening in the sunlight.
Simply stunning. What I always imagined a Russian church to look like! Go with a guide the location, how it is built over the river etc is worth understanding

Go Inside, It's Worth the Entrance Fee. As nice as the church is on the outside, it is definitely worth buying a ticket for inside. This is one of the main landmarks in St. Petersburg and all of Russia.Make sure to check out both sides on the outside, while the view is basically the same it is nice to see one side with the canal by the side.With many of the church in St. Petersburg, I opted to stay outside and not pay for a ticket to go inside. Nearly all of the churches are no longer churches but have been turned into museums so that they can charge an entrance fee. The ticket office is right next to the entrance and when we went the line was only 2-3 minutes long as was the wait to enter. We did not buy the audio guide as we had tried to do own research before entering, but audio guides are available.The inside is absolutely stunning. Detailed mosaics cover every square inch from floor to ceiling (actually including the ceiling!). Be sure to check out the roped off area where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated (the reason that the church was built on that specific site). Regular photographs are allowed throughout and is included in the entrance fee.When we went it was quite crowded, especially with tour groups as it was nearing the end of summer. Remain patient and expect that people will be bumping into you as they stay together in their tour groups. There is also a gift shop (prices are quite expensive) that sells souvenirs related to the church, St. Petersburg, and Russia.
Beautiful night and day. We drove by the church in the evening and were thrilled to visit the next day. It is absolutely beautiful!
Church now a museum. Exquisite building and beautiful art inside. Everything restored to as close to original as possible.

WOW!. From the outside the church looks absolutely amazing with an array of colours and the onion domes, inside it is absolutely unbelieveable. The walls are completely covered with mosaics that literally take your breathe away. We visited with a Russian guide who make the visit complete with her knowledge.

relatively modern church but exceptionally beautiful. This church is the St Petersburg equivalent of St Basil's in Moscow. A playful and colorful exterior. Inside, the icon's are mosaics with rich color. Be sure to go inside.
Great frescoes, great architecture.. Wonderful. Every inch inside covered with extraordinary paintings.Also the architecture is outstanding. Worth to visit.
Amazing Place. Spectacular church a bit different to the average. The ornateness of the place is quite breathtaking. It was a popular attraction..
The Best view is from Outside. The architecture is over the top. This is what you have come to Russia to see! Don't miss it. We didn't have the time to go inside however the outside was fabulous.

Orthodox russian church. This was great, as we did not have the opportunity to visit Moscow, so this stood in for it. The exterior architecture along with the beautiful interiors of the church make it truly great.

Best Interior of Russian Orthodox Cathedrals We Visited. In our time in St. Petersburg and Moscow, this was one of the most beautiful cathedrals, with a very beautiful interior. The exterior with the traditional onion domes is great, but the frescoes (which had been restored and are well preserved) are simply amazing. In the summer it was a bit crowded, so go early or late in the day.
Church. The mosaic work in this church is magnificent it's right by the river it looked wonderful in all it's colours

Top Church in St. Petersburg. This church was our personal favorite of the main church's in St.Petersburg. The onion shaped domes and the vivid psychedelic colors made admiring this build and architecture very simple.
Quite beautiful. Very beautiful , worth the time and cost of admission. It is now a museum not actually a church. The inside is very impressive and outside is quite beautiful.
Wonderful frescoes. It looks amazing from the outside but.it is worth paying the entrance fee to see the frescoes in the stunning interior.

Gorgeous Mosaics; Interesting History. The interior of this church is covered floor to ceiling with unbelievable mosaics. Erected on the spot where one of the czars was assassinated, it's history is intriguing. Very crowded when we were there, but definitely worth a visit.
Church of spilled blood. It was very decorative. You could spend an hour in there -beautiful. The outside looks a lot like St. Basil's but the inside is totally different. It is amazing.

try to go during sunset. try to go during sunset. it is VERY VERY beautiful.
and during the day, if the sun is shining, you can see the reflection of the sun on the golden couple. Beautiful colors

Beautiful and stunning 'fairytale' style building. An absolute must see.. This church is beautiful both outside and inside. Built on the site where Alexander II was assassinated. It has stunning mosiacs, just too many to take in all at one go, so make sure you take plenty of photographs, it is only after our return and looking through them that I fully appreciate the beauty. An early entrance is a must as it does get very busy. We went as part of a private tour of 5 with SPB tours and the guide Elena was very knowledgeable and made the visit most interesting.
amazing. this building is amazing its beautiful, every inch of the inside of the building is covered in what looks like painting, it isn't until you get close that you realize that its all mosaic's

A must see in St. Petersburg. The Church is absolutely stunning. Even from the outside it looks very impressing but the inside is awesome. If I understodd one guide right it´s about 7000 square meters (75000 square feet) of mosaics. It huge and all the different pictures and stories are fantastic. It cost about 250 RUB to get in. Meanwhile it´s a museum so that all women don't have to cover their hair but shouls probably do it anyway out of respect to the culture and religion. Please don't plan a visit to St. Petersburg without visiting the Church of the Savior on spilled Blood, you will miss it.
Impressive epitome of Russian architecture. The interior and exterior of the church are decorated with incredibly detailed mosaics. The view of the church is absolutely breathtaking and dazzling.

Church of Our Savior.... We were fortunate to visit with Anna from TJ Travel, who was very knowledgeable about the history of the church. The mosaics are magnificent...this church is a definite "must see"
Fantastic church. This church is truly a must to visit when in St. Petersburg. Beautiful and impressive with all the different domes and ornaments.
a beautiful church. a landmark of St. Petersburg, more appreciate the outside appearance of the church then the coffins inside.
stunning. This is the only Russian church in this style in St. Petersburg Inside there are fantastic mosaic pictures all over the church200 Rubbles entrancewell worth it

if you're into these churches this is fine. One can get churched out easily in Russia, or Europe for that matter. This one is built on the site of the Emporer Alexander II's assasination. It has some interesting spots and if churches are your thing, you should likely see this one.
A lot of history. well worth a visit, but go with an excellent tour guide that knows the history about this church. We used Alla tours (Excellent)

Must see. Both the outside and inside of this church are spectacular. The work that has gone into the construction of this building is fantastic. The whole place is decorated in mosaics which look like the best paintings done by a famous artist. Get there early because the crowds soon start to build up.

Unbelievably spectacular mosaics. All the cathedrals in St. Petersburg are worth a visit. What sets this one apart are the mosaics. When painting St. Isaac Cathedral they discovered that paint in St. Petersburg does not dry well because of the high humidity. Spilled Blood decided to use mosaics. There are 6500 square feet of them and they are stunning. No visit to Sst. Petersburg is complete without a stop here.

No words to describe the beauty. I have never seen something alike. I was absolutely impressed by the beauty, the opulence. Also the outside is something. We made an uncountable number of photo's from the outside and the inside.Absolutely to be visited also because it is so real Russian.

Perhaps St. Petersburg's most distinctive landmark. The "Church on Spilled Blood" is perhaps St. Petersburg's most distinctive landmark.The church has a colorful fairy-tale like exterior featuring mosaics, ornate onion domes and spires. The interior is covered with intricate mosaics. The church was built by Alexander III in memory of his father. Alexander II's blood really was spilled on this spot when he was assassinated in 1881. This church has really been through a lot. In the aftermath of the Russian Revolution, the church was ransacked and looted, badly damaging it's interior. The Soviets shut the structure in the 1930's. During WW II the church was used as a temporary morgue for those who died in combat and the many who died from starvation and illness. After the war, the church was used as a warehouse for vegetables. Even though I always prefer seeing the original surfaces, this church has been beautifully restored. We enjoyed viewing the opulant, mosaic covered interiors.
Beautiful inside and out.. I had wanted to see this classic building and it is beautiul inside and out because of all of the reconstruction work done to it. One of the best sites of St. Petersburg.

Stunning. While I didn't go inside this church just looking at the outside was amazing. The domes are covered with mosaic tile. The outside is covered with Icons that are just unbelievable. It's really hard to put the beauty of the Church into words. We walked around the Church and were awestruck by the paintings of Saints and Marters that adorned it and the mosaic tiles, truly beautiful.

The Church on the Spilled Blood visit.. If you think this church looks pretty special from the outside, nothing prepares you for what it holds on the inside, as your breath is taken away by every bit of floor, ceiling and walls covered in iconic paintings and mosaics of various saints. We were very impressed with it and the assassination spot of the Tsar Alexander is there on view where they built the church around it .We got a great sense of history which overtook us in this church. We went on our own, so missed a lot of what the Russian tour guides were talking about, but no words were necessary to see all that was on display. Cost was 250 roubles, payable in local currency or credit card, and translated into less than $20 for the wife and I.

Short and amazing. I prefer short trips in any kind of historical architecture, the Spilled Blood church is an amazing place for people like me, you can see an amazing mosaic that comes all over the place, since russians start to revival this place just couple of years ago, you may find something new reconstructed even if you had been there already.There are a guide tours going out each ~15-30 minutes on various of languages, my suggestion ask in the reception once you enter the place.

Real Russia. If you are able to, don't miss visiting this church. It is a spectacular sight in the traditional Russian fashion - lovely mosaics inside and gold domes outside. Not all tour groups visit this church - our tour was with TJ Travel and was a small-group tour that visited both inside and outside. As another poster has said, the disadvantage is the crowds - but that is unavoidable throughout St Petersburg. Actually, our guide recommended visiting in the winter when all the buildings are centrally-heated and the crowds have gone - worth considering if you have the cold-weather gear!!

Must see site in St Petersburg!!!. Best to get here early in the day, as the area tends to be packed with tour buses. Spectacularly decorated, multi-colored domes, make for a great photo opportunity. Don't miss seeing this!
worth a visit. soak in the history and visit this Church...........the past merges with the present GO and visit as part of your cultural visit to the city
Can't go to St. Petersburg without seeing this place. The classic icon of the city. Have to get a picture here. Just watch out for pickpockets...Otherwise a lovely site.
amazing inside and out. Amazing inside and out. Very special architecture from the outside. Inside fully decorated with mosaic. A must see when in St Petersburg.

Simply Amazing!. This is truly a "Must See". The thought of all this beautiful artwork being created piece by piece almost defies belief. Who ever thought mosaic work could be so extensive.The exterior is just a preview of what is inside. Don't miss getting exterior photos from along the canal as you exit.The single drawback is the constant massive crowds. It is worth any inconvenience to see this, however.
Picture Postcard Church. Magnificent inside and out and it is very busy but you won't care as you'll be to entranced to notice.
Absolutely stunning!. Beautiful church, inside and outside! There is so much to see. History is wonderful as well. Absolutely one of the highlights!

Really is # 1. This is the iconic picture of St. Petersburg. The onion domes are what everyone thinks of when contemplating a trip here, The outside of the church is so beautiful and when you get inside the impact of all the mosaics in stunning. Our guide led us through the crowds and explained in detail the meaning of the church. We were in a very small group (13 people) with Alla Tours so we had an advantage over the large bus groups. Most people were trying to get pictures of the church from the front entrance, but it was difficult with all the people and busses. When you exit the church you come out in the back and the view is every bit as good as the front with far fewer people in your shot.

A piece of history. It's a typical russian church in a non-typical russian city. It worth a visit for the technique an beauty of the exterior and interior design and work; and for the historical relevance.
Amazing. The mosaics in this church are amazing. You need more timeto take it all in. There is so much to see. It can be a bitoverwhelming. The outside of the church is also very photogenic.
awesome. like nothing you have ever seen before. amazing. the history behind this place is enthralling. dont miss it
Beautiful. If you need to choose which church/places to visit in St Petersburgh make sure you select this one. It is a beautiful place both on the outside and in.

Read the plaques around the exterior. Sadly our tour didn't allow time to enter the church but the exterior is very interesting if you take the time to read the plaques. Wish we had the time also to step beyond the magnificent gates and explore the adjoining park.
Stunning interior.. Of all the amazing sites in St Petersbourg, the Church of Our Saviour is the most impressive for its incredible interior. A must see.
Church of Our Savior on Spilt Blood. The onion domes make for a great picture. The entire church inside is done with mosaics. It is just amazing to see. We loved our visit to this church.
Must see sight. Fantastic architecture. The interior was also stunning. It was crowded when we went, but our private tour guide escorted around the lines and gave us a great feeling for the church
worth a visit inside..art work, inside and out. the entry was easy, lines moved quickly. Art work filled every inch of space, floor to ceiling. It is a must see .

A must-see. You won't believe it until you've seen it !! Very impressive from the outside, but wait until you get inside !!
It's impossible to describe in a few words, but trust me - it's Fantastic !!
Impressive mosaic work. This is what people expect of Russia, onion domes and mosaics. Smaller than expected. THe mosaics show master artistry
Beautiful Church. Every inch is covered in mosaics. I also enjoyed how it was used during the Revolution and though the jewels were taken from the designs, the rest of the artwork is intact.

Beautiful... Classic... Historical. Reading of its history, hearing our tour guides outline and seeing its splendour, was worth the trip. The ability to get up close and personal was neat. It is well maintained and it's location next to a park and canal make it a serene. Trouble getting clear pictures due to busses and people. Panhandlers are irritating. Watch the pick pockets in the crowds

Amazing feast of colour and shapes. I really enjoy religious art and architecture from any faith as you can always find monuments and buildings than surprise you even more than in the civil world. This church is the first of its kind I have visited and I loved it. It is just a feast for your eyes if you like colours and shapes. Certainly worth the visit
Unique. This is the only Russian Style Church in St Petersburg. The mosaic pictures on the walls are unique and worth the visit. Church is relatively small and then crowded
Must seen place!!. Very nice church to be seen, fully and properly restored!!It is magnificent both from the outside and inside.Don't miss it for nothing!
Beautiful church. Outside is spectacular as was the inside. Very busy but worth it. Our tour guide gave us lots of information as we went through
Seeing in person is unbelievable.. This was part of our SPB Tours in St. Petersburg, Russia. You see these places in pictures but nothing can compare to see these places in real time. Unbeliveable...

Beautiful Church. A really spectacularly restored Russian Church. The inside is as spectacular as the outside. We were unable to go inside on our last visit to Russia in 2000 because they were in the midst of major restoration work. Having the opportunity the second time around to see a place that wasn't available to see on your visit is a great reason to visit a place a second time. I know a lot of travelers don't like to repeat, but I really appreciated seeing and hearing about all of the changes Russia has experienced in almost 15 years. There were little shops set up inside the church and also vendors outside who had some nice little items for reasonable prices, and I would definitely stop to take a look if you can.
Wow. We did not know what to expect, but is truly worth seeing even though it was so crowded. The colors were a sight to behold. Can recommend this to travelers.

Magnificent Church. You will fall in love with this place since you walk close to this church. I love their colorful domes and church especially summer time when it's bright and blue sky. Lovely moment!
Don't miss it!. Lets walk inside the church observing all details, and explore it from outside from different point of views.

Magnificent. The church exhibits marvellous architecture from outside and is amazing. How many photos you may see but it is superior than the photographs and is worth a visit. Didn't get a chance to go inside.
Beautiful. You should see our photos! What a beautiful historic church inside and outside. It is a must see even though it might be crowded! Our guide took us when it was not too crowded.

Stunning Interior. The artwork in this magnificent church mostly consists of mosaics in the interior. They are some of the best Ive ever seen and the colours will simply amaze you. You will not see anything like this beautiful explosion of colour in any other church. Simply class, well worth the visit!

THE most beautiful exterior in St. Petersburg. There are the usual tombs and icons but is quite light inside (which can present a problem with backlighting)
The usual 250 rouble entrance fee.
Spectacular. Cannot be missed. No matter how many pictures of it you've seen, it's really impressive, both outside and inside. Very near the main street Nevsky Prospekt

Beautiful exterior moderately interesting interior. This church is the primary example of Russian Ecclesiastical architecture in St Petersburg. It is quite beautiful and well worth a visit. What is inside, while interesting is no match for thw exterior. The adjoining park is a lovely place to relax on a nice day.
Magnificent. This place is astonishing. The mosaics will dazzle you. And it's history is interesting, especially how it was abused during the communist era.

Church of our Saviour on Spilled Blood. This Church is stunning inside and out, as are so many of the Russian Orthodox Churches. This one though is exceptional and has a lot of history behind it. The unusual name is because it has a chapel within it commemorating where Alexander ii is said to have been murdered. If you have the time it is well worth a look.
Beautiful. This is a must see venue in St.Petersburg - rich in history and culture of the people of Russia. The pre paid reservation helped the wait time as the church was very crowded.

Wonderful mosaics. The outside of this church is unique in itself, but the inside is entirely covered with mosaics of the life of Jesus. I can't imagine trying to place all of those tiles. Truly beautiful
An Obvious Must See. Classic, mosaic-laden church. Fantastic architecture unlike any other. Our SPB guide told us it is tradition and good luck to jump on the bridge leading to the church.

very unique. Very unique piece of architecture though I had perhaps build up an expectation that was great than what we saw. I would have spent more time at the Heritage if I had to do it over again.
Worth seeing.
amzing facade. classic russian orthodox excess, wonderful location on canal, adjacent a garden and just off the main drag of st petersburg
Spectacular inside and out. Stunning on the outside and beautiful inside. Make sure to allow plenty of time to soak it all in and take photos - watch out for the mass of tour groups however.

Impressive. Wonderful church with fascinating history. Be sure to learn about it before you go so you can truly appreciate this site. The decorations are awesome. This is probably the ultimate Russian church.

Off my bucket list. This was the only thing I wanted to see in Russia. I had seen pictures of the "ice cream cone" church all my life, and I wanted to see it. As absolutely spectacular the outside was, the interior was 1000 times better. Covered with mosaics, your breath is literally taken away. Go, plain and simply, just go.

Beautiful and intricate church. This church is a quintessential piece of Russian culture. The church was very decorative and ornamental yet peaceful being place of worship. I recommended visiting with a tour group in order to learn about the more unknown history.
Don't miss this site!. This is a beautiful church with amazing history. It is not to be missed when you visit St. Petersburg.

Worth going inside!. Impressive on the outside - look for the panel at ground floor level that was not restored after the WW2 siege. You'll quickly realise how good the Russians are at replacement (not restoration) - same goes for the interior - don't miss the original cobbles on which Alexander II was assasinated! .
Amazing mosaic craftsmanship. Such an amazing and stunning church ! I could go with St. Isaac at the first place but this church is like a artistically created jewel. lt is a must-see.

Awe inspiring. This church is the first I've been that rivals the Sagrada Familia in Barcelona or some of the great mosques in the arabian peninsula. Yes, there are crowds, although I didn't find it too bad on a Sunday morning. The entry price is fair (250 rubles). We paid for our guide to go in, and I'm glad we did, because she had things to add about the history of the church (e.g. how the communists treated the building). The thing I liked best was the ability to pick out stories from the Bible from the mosaics. Sometimes stained glass in churches depicts scenes that are not obvious, but the mosaics depict scenes from the gospels that can be easily identified by any Christian. This was my favourite site in St Petersburg, inside and out.

Gorgeous!!!. This church is just gorgeous. One of the most picturesque church in the world. Please note that The church is closed on Wednesdays. I have seen both interior and exterior design of the church. Honestly, i am totally more fascinated by the exterior design of this masterpiece but it worths to pay 250 rubles to get in and spend some time inside. There is a nice market where you can buy some souvenirs near by the church. Euro or Dollar is accepted in this market unlikely other parts of St Petersburg.
Must be seen. Mosaics are unbelievable....every inch of the walls and ceilings are covered ...must be seen. Interior and Exterior absolutely beautiful.

Churches. I went on a cruise with my partner at the end of July and the main reason we chose this particular cruise was because we had three days in Russia. Well if you ever get the chance to go to St Petersburg you should. It is a beautiful city and this Cathedral is absolutely amazing especially when you see all the mosiacs inside the church of saints which must have taken years to do. St Petersburg is rich in culture and history and I would love to go back if I ever have the chance to so that I could do the bits that I missed.
Old but new. Incredible restoration of interior mosaics which cover interior Walls.audio guide available. Very accessible for individual viewing without a guide.

St. Petersburg 2 Day Deluxe Tour. Our visit to the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood was part of out itinerary on our 2 Day Deluxe Tour in St. Petersburg and we enjoyed it very much. The whole tour was great!Leonie and Bob

Spectacular Fantasy Style Building. A must see just to behold the incredible architecture. The church looks like it is from a fantasy film. The colours, shapes and domes are beautiful. You need to spend time just walking around it in amazement.

AMAZING. Spent three days in St Petersburg, the history here is breathtaking, the highly decorated, both inside and outside, churches is something else. We were part of a cruise therefore any fees to enter these buildings was taken care of by the cruise line and incorporated into the cost of the shore excursions.

Absolutely amazing. Absolutely amazing.. St. Petersburg itself is a piece of art, and this church is one of the most spectacular visions of the city. If you ever have the chance to go the St. Petersburg, be sure to add this to your tours. We used TJ Tours of St. Petersburg and they were the best.

A beautifully restored church, the interior is amazing. If you go to St Petersburg a visit to this church is an absolute must. The exterior is fantastic but it's definitely worth paying - 250 Rubles - to see the beautiful interior. Remember it's closed on Wednesdays. The whole place is a triumph to Russian craftsmanship.

Speechless at the beauty!. Amazing history once you learn all about this Cathedral. It is breathtaking. The emperor died on the site of this church and the original brickwork where his blood was spilled as well as the railing from the side of the canal where he was mortally wounded is there in it's authenticity. The church was restored but the mosaics that are within are the most spectacular I have ever seen! so grateful to go see this amazing site!

impressive. This church is not to be missed. The colors and sheer numbers of mosaics is astonishing. Only thing missing was some benches, so you could sit and enjoy the sight as everywhere you looked, you found more to feast you eye upon.
Must must must see. Amazing, stunning, words can't explain it. All those mosaics. Just totally stunning.Bright colours and totally awe inspiring.
No 1 visit attraction. This is an absolute MUST for any visitor. Just an amazing sight, you can spend hours just looking at this place
Not to be missed. Stunning interior that has to be seen to be believed with every surface covered with the most incredible colourful mosaics. Well worth seeing but it does get crowded.

gorgeous art works on the walls. I had no idea what to expect here but the artwork was so beautiful and vibrant. The history was well explained by our guide. It's wonderful that the restorers were able to do such a good job after communism ended.

Pictures cannot replace the experience!. Amazing! You have to go! To be surrounded, 360 degrees by this much beauty cannot be reproduced by film or still. Just go, take a coupe of pictures to aid your memory and then spend a good long time soaking up the experience.
A must. There were very impressing mosaikwalls inside the church and the outside is typical russian style beautiful but overburdened with ornaments.

must-see!. Don't even contemplate whether you should go. Just do it! I'm glad I got the chance see this church on my short trip to St. Petersburg.
