It's an amazing church and I would suggest to get the audio guide because it gives you a thorough and interesting explanation of the history of the church. The work inside the church is very detailed and has an interesting story behind it.
No Wonder it is Rated #1. One of the reasons we selected the tour company we did, was to see the inside and not just a photo op outside as listed on the ship's excursion. Awesome!

Highlight of Saint Petersburg. This is one of our favorite churches for a visit. We visited in 2006 and just had to go again. The inside of the church is beyond me describing in a review. Pictures outside are unbelievable. This church will always be a stop for us in Saint Petersburg

Nothing like it in the world.. Definitely the standout, number 1 attraction of the city as unlike the Hermitage which at least has parallels in terms of museum collections / historical buildings, this is completely unique. You won't spend very long here but when you leave, it will probably be the thing you remember as the biggest highlight.
Unique church. Wheelchair user - easy access. Plenty of time to look around at the fully mosaicked walls and floors. Worth buying the guide book to get the full significance of the building

One of the best Orthodox Church. In a city that is a walking museum, this Church truly stands out. As you approach it, it almost seems surreal like something from Disneyland. Yet, it has lots of history and art to boot. I found the exterior to be more interesting than the interiors. Many of the icons inside have been removed. The interior is still stunning no doubt.Please note that for some reason, the entrance price goes up to 350 Rub after 6pm. Before that, it is 250 Rub. Of course I vehemently disagree and oppose the idea of charging any entrance fee for a religious place.

Take a tour. The church is beautiful, but to fully appreciate it, you should really take a tour of the inside. It is stunning inside with all the mosaics on the walls. Beautiful place and worth a tour.

Stunning.... This site is a must-see during your visit to St. Petersburg. The exterior is just amazing. The colors and design are something to just stare at in utter amazement. You will want to keep taking pictures whether you're close up or far away. Then you go inside and see the amazing art and mosaics and of course the exact spot where Alexander II was assassinated. The iconoclast is stunning as is every wall and even the floor. You can take pictures inside. The site is busy during peak hours but you can still have a satisfying visit. I went with a private guide and felt I got a lot out of the visit by having a guide.
Amazing. Really amazing church. Both, from out and inside. Looks especially great with sun and blue sky. Definitely must visit place in St. Petersburg.
Church on Spilled Blood. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood had amazingly beautiful architecture, and contained such interesting history!
History and Style. Good story behind this church and the mosaics are really worth seeing in the church. Thought St Basil's in Moscow was better.
Wonderful looking Church. This is a fantastic looking Church and typically Russian. We did not get the chance to look inside but you can take lovely photos from the outside.

Sublime!. I was surprised it was open untill 10 p.m.! At that hour you don' t make any line and there are guided tours ( didn't know until I saw them inside); the entrance costs about 8-9 €. Is such a beautiful Russian Ortodox Church outside ( with its oninon like domes) and inside, with extraordinary paintings and icons . They have a small book store , a little ( or a lot ) difficult to comunícate with the Lady in charge. It is a MUST while in San Petersburg!
Exquisite. The exterior was a wow factor when I saw it, them the interior was even more so, exquisite ! Love all the detailed architecture, each room is different.
Beautiful. What an amazing church, the restoration is incredible. How man pays homage to The Lord is gratifying.

A historical site worth a visit.. This is the site where Alexander the 2nd was assassinated. The church is impressive in size and design, taking 24 years to complete. What is interesting is that the bricks where the assassination took place are actually preserved in an open well inside the church. I went there on a tour so we were pretty much rushed through.It is

Baltic cruise. This is a beautiful building with wonderful art work the mosaic tiles are really breath taking well worth a visit but the area can be very busy. Take plenty of photographs, but watch your bag there are pick pockets working in teams.

Try to go at a quiet time. Overrun with Tour groups. Yes it's lovely especially outside but so heaving with big groups, you could hardly move let alone see things. We went to St Isaacs in the evening and liked it so much more.
Beautiful restoration. While almost nothing in the cathedral is original, it has been beautifully restored. The mosaics are breath taking.
Baltic Cruise. Beautiful church with historical significance. Entrance fee was reasonable and inside is ornate and beautiful.
Worth the visit. 350 rubbles to enter but excellent murals and you can use your camera inside, really glad we went inside, stayed around 25 minutes.

Church of the Spilled Blood. Absolutely amazing mosaics. I have a friend who is a mosaic artist and all I could think of was how much I wish that she were with me to enjoy the phenomenal level of detail.
Incredible ... absolutely breathtaking!. A stunning monument both inside and out. Well worth the small price to visit inside. Simply breathtaking *****

Beautiful. We did not go inside but from the outside it is a work of art. Looking down the canal from Nevskiy Prospket to the Church is my favourite view in the city and we bought a painting from a street artist reflecting this.
Amazing place. From the colorful onion domes to the internal artworks senses were in overdrive. Set beside a canal with some attractions close by.
Stunningly beautiful. This is a gorgeous building, with amazing history. The area around it was a good place to walk, and enjoy the scenery.
Amazing mosaics. The design in this church is so unique with the mosaics everywhere. I have never seen anything quite like it, and it is worth a special trip for that reason.
best art work. best for money the art work inside something too see and take it time look and look prices of enter so cheap my eyes so fixed to art on roof
Stunning Restored Church. Breathtaking interior - no paintings, all the walls & ceilings are covered with mosaics. Pay a few ponds extra for an audio guide to appreciate the history to the building.

Beautiful onion dome church. This classic onion dome church is exactly what you expect to see in Russia. This one is easily accessible when you visit St. Petersburg. Like many popular tourist attractions, it can be very crowded, but I recommend it. The exterior architecture is beautiful. The interior is equally beautiful with the many mosaics made from tiles and the history of the church makes the visit informative as well as a visual pleasure. There are a lot of tourist "traps" around the building and the only restroom facility is a pay "booth" on the street, so be sure to have a few rubles or euros.

Very impressive interior. This Former Church which is now a Museum has one of the World's most impressively decorated interiors. It is well worth a visit. The church has colourful "Onion domes" in the style of the Kremlin. Beware of Pickpockets as the area gets very full.
One of the St. Peterburg landmarks. Wonderful Italian marbles inside. On the outside, the architecture resembles the much older St. Basil church in Moscow, but is nowhere near as beautiful.

Unique church with mosaic artwork. This was my favorite church in St Petersburg. All the churches are beautiful but this one was unique with its onion domes and the mosaic artwork. This is a must-see.

Absolutely beautiful. This has to be one of the most beautiful churches I have ever been to. The mosaic artwork was stunning to say the least. We only went in there as we had a bit of time to spare and it was a real surprise package. An absolute must see.
Breathtaking. The mosaics in the church astonish us, both in quality and quantity, worth a visit. The colors, size and workmanship excel.

Beautiful like in the movies. The church was a magnificent piece of architecture. It had all the elements at first glance like one expects, like in the movies. Our guide from Alla tours gave us interesting info about it. The only thing negative that I would say is that we were warned strongly to watch our personal property here as pickpockets find it appealing as well. We experienced no problems.
truly a work of art. one of the most impressive cathedrals in russia, made of mosaic tiles. Jaw dropping. Never used a a cathedral.
A must see!. A must see attraction! The cathedrals in Europe are really fantastic attractions. They are so amazing and well worth the time, effort and money to visit them.
A must see in St P. Just off the main shopping street, this place is a must. The pics say it all - its a classic place to viist.
Must visit.. The pinnacle of art and history in St. Petersburg- if you're in the city, there can be no plausible reason for you to NOT see this magnificent landmark.
Incredible beautiful. We have seen many churches during our trip through Russia but this church interior wall finished was the only one with mosaics.

Go when not crowded. An exquisite edifice viewing from the outside, walking all around.Being August, as with all the main attractions in SPB, the crowds are enormous. And when the Aiada cruise ship disgorges it's 7000 passengers, everywhere is swamped. Just 300 roubles entrance fee but we couldn't wait. Besides, as with the Hermatige, you would be shoulder to shoulder with 100s inching around in the heat inside. Not the the best way to enjoy the visit.

Beauty. It is always interesting to see by yourself things, places, buildings, sites you have seen so many times on pictures in movies, in books... This is one of buildings that in reality makes you stand in front and say: wow! It is just great from outside and inside. There is a fee to enter it but it is worth every rubel. Fascinating...

The mosaics are unbelievable. You can't miss this! The outside is much like St. Basil's in Moscow (skip the inside of that). Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is worth the wait to get inside! The mosaics are almost surreal in scope. We got the English audio guide which was very good but VERY long. We skipped through parts of it. The gardens are lovely and on the other side is the Russian Museum which is also worth a visit!

One of the city's highlights. Well worth (low cost) looking inside - ticket queues and groups inside were not as great as expected. Photography inside permitted and the church presents a beautiful, floodlit sight at night.
A fabulous church. This church is one of the reasons I travelled to St Petersburg . It is amazing inside and out. A absolute must see

A must see. This is a stunning building to walk around and the history is incredible. The church was easy to find and is just a lovely place to walk around. DOnt forget to visit the gardens alongside as these are also beautiful. Fun to see so many bride and grooms viist for their photos!

So beautiful, fascinating - a must-see!. St. Petersburg is a wonderful city and so rich with history, architecture, culture etc. There is so much to see - I hope you have enough time for everything. But, if you know anything about this city, you certainly understand that you need at least several months - and most of us don't have this luxury. So, for a short visit, these are absolutely must-see places: Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood, Isaac Cathedral, and Hermitage. This church is so beautiful and unique!
Very impressive from the outside. Definitely need to seeWe didn't go inside but still impressive to walk around the outside if a little touristy

Enjoyed it. It's one of those places you just smile when you first see it! Beautiful looking building, very colourful and ornate. I didn't find it too busy around the cathedral, thought it might be a bit busier but there was a decent crowd around all the same. The queue to get inside wasn't too bad either. It's a must see when in St Petersburg and a lovely area around here too.

Amazing inside and out!. While visiting St. Petersburg the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is hard to miss. Most likely it will fill your memory card with stunning photos of it lingering over the canal, but make sure you go inside as well! Priced at 250 rubles it's not the cheapest of attractions but is still worth it. The church is built over the spot where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated so of course there is a memorial inside dedicated to him that you must see. Take your time to absorb the details and craftsmanship of the interior as it can be easy to speed through the inside. This is something that you absolutely have to do/see in St. Petersburg!

Fascinating history. Another must-see!. This church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated - thus the name "...on Spilled Blood". As Tsar Alexander's carriage passed along the canal, a grenade thrown by an anarchist conspirator exploded. The tsar, falling out of the carriage, started to confront the grenade thrower and a second bomb was thrown mortally wounding the tsar. Alexander III build the church as a memorial to his father. The most stunning part of this church is the incredible number of mosaics depicting biblical scenes and figures in it's interior. As with many other landmarks in St. Petersburg, the church was badly damaged during WWII. It was reopened less than 20 years ago as a museum. No services are held here.

Mosaic splendor. This monument toTsar Alexander 11 is magnificent and therefore everyone wants to see it. We were there first thing, hired the audio guide and had half an hour before the tour groups started to arrive in ernest. Being on our own allowed us to spend as long as we wanted at any one spot and fit into a quiet corner and observe the building. Because the mosaics etc are above head height, there does not seem to be as much of a problem with viewing. We were given a laminated map of the audio guide route, it would be extremely helpful to people like me ( direction ability deprived) to have compass points marked on it as the audio refers to these. One of the best thing to me about seeing this church was, it allowed me to imagine the beauty of such places as Hagia Sophia in its hay days.

interesting. Liked it all. Interesting architecture, art content, historical content.The outside of the Church is beautiful, different to the other churches. Inside you have the amazing artwork, the story of the foundation of the church and the family who are buried there.

Fantastic Church, a Must See in St. Petersburg. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is definite must-see for any visitor to St. Petersburg. Its architecture is not only spectacular (and different from the other beautiful churches found in the city), but the interior with its exceptional mosaics is stunning. Moreover, the church is historic in that it was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II (who liberated the serfs) was mortally wounded. Be sure to see the memorial inside and outside the church marking the spot where the tsar was assassinated. Also, try to check out the plaques posted on the ground near the railings around the church which state the major events in the tsar's life. The church, within walking distance from the other major attractions in the center of the city, should be among the top three sites to visit in St. Petersburg.

Kiwi Keith stunned by awesome beauty of interior. Words cannot really describe this magnificent building and amazingly skilled tiling workmanship and artwork. If you are interested in art,Russian history,religion ,or building/tiling this is a must see icon.

marvellous exlerience. The first site of the beautiful coloured domes across a large lawned garden was awe inspiring. After a short wait to gain entrance the wait was worth it. The beautiful golden door in the main alter was out of this world. The tall round windows in the roof let through shafts of light with haloed an image of Jesus. The colourful paintings on the inner walls were beautiful and thought provoking. The patern tiles of the floor were as solid as a saint faith and upon leaving the building a sense of the devine came over me. It is THE place to visit for anyone visiting this historic and beautiful city
stunning. Beautiful and impactful building. Every detail is a art work.It is a must to see this when in the city.

Do not miss this one. What a beautiful hotel with a tragic story line. The exterior is highly decorated and colored and it is worth taking your time to visually explore all of the nuances of the exterior shell. HINT: You will also want to make sure to view this at night as the church has wonderful lighting. The interior is all mosaic and worth paying the price to see.
Elaborate church, make sure to get an audio guide. Go as early as it opens - 10h30, it can get very crowed. The English audio guide is very informative, one per group is sufficient.

Pictures do not really show the amazing walls...... Went on tour with Viking River Cruise--guide and headset were great for understanding the history and inside features of the church. So colorful--the intricate mosaics were restored by 30 artists over 27 years. They are as detailed as paintings. Photography is allowed--but really just wanted to look and take it all in as much as possible (of course I did take pictures too). Even the metal fencing around the church is beautiful 3-dimensional metal art. Nice park area to walk thru from parking area to church--with icecream & drink stand.

Impressive mosaique. I sugget to visit not from an artistic point of view but for the history that flow behinf the imponent mosaiques and the precious stone that are on the wall.If you close your eyes when you are inside you can watch what's happen a century.

Another amazing site. Again as part of our TJ Tours itinerary, we visited this very busy, but amazing site. As mentioned before churches and cathedrals are not really our thing, but we were very impressed by this amazingly ornate church. It is one of the must see destinations in St Petersburg.
Great multi color church. Dont miss. its great. its similar to St.basil in Moscow. its very beautiful . maybe crowded in summer . Don't miss the multi color church.
Awesome. very beautiful chrch. russina traditional architecture. You are to visti it for sure when you come to Saint-Petersburg.
very good excursion!. Now the tickets to the church are sold together with the excursion, There are several in English, too. Very interesting information!

A must when visiting.. A lot of history and a really breathtaking place. Beatiful mosaiks. Way too crowdy during the summer, so you will not be able to enjoy it completly. But for museum freaks this is a must place to visit. You can buy souvenirs there and you can pay with euros too :). Don't miss it!
Well worth visit. Having seen the multi coloured Church on TV for years it did not disappoint inside or out when seen in the flesh
nice. This church is so similar to St Basil in Moscow.The church looks nice inside and out.and the reason of building this church really touched me.
Really cool!. A real astonishing church. Outside and inside overwhelming decorated. For me it was a top attraction of St. Petersburg. Really worth going there. Not very expensive to visit.

Almost beyond belief. Expect a crowd, especially when the cruise ships are in town. The architecture is iconic, and the mosaics, wall to wall, ceiling to floor are overpowering. A top international tourist destination in itself.

Bring your camera. As a lover of churches, particularly those in Europe, this one is a must see. The beautiful colorful exterior and incredible interior rivals many of the churches in Western Europe and it's unique Russian flair makes is a delight. I am glad I had an 8GB chip as I took about 100 pictures!
UNBELIEVABLE. What a site. This is the place you see on all the brochures for Russia. A do not miss. Try to go early as the crowds get worse as the day goes on.

Beautiful but Omigod What Crowds. Easy to appreciate the wonderful icon art and painting in the church, as well as its architecture resembling St. Basil's in Moscow. Worth getting the audioguide to learn about what was done. Having said that, the crowds were so thick at 3pm, it was busier than a rush hour subway car. Go late or go early, but do go to see this beautiful spot then go to the garden behind it to take a break.

Make sure your camera battery is fully charged. Stunningly beautiful. We found our way to this beautiful landmark on numerous occasions during our stay in St. Petersburg (helped by the fact we were staying fairly close). The architecture, the colours, the mosaics... made for some beautiful photos, even for a point, click and hope for the best photographer like myself.On a warm summers day, the atmosphere around the church is also compelling as the tourists, buskers, street merchants etc all mingle happily together.

Beautifully restored, a visual wonder. This church is unlike any other I have visited. It seems that every interior wall is covered with nothing but mosaic tiles. The color art works are a wonder to behold. The church is not very large and was a bit crowded. Fortunately pictures are allowed inside. There is an interesting, small exhibit near the exit describing the rehabilitation work carried out, some not complete until 2010.

Amazing mosaics. Gorgeous building which is often depicted In almost all postcards from st petersburg. What is visual from the exterior is even more amazing in its mosaic detailing of the interior. Spell bounding and quite extraordinary. A must visit if in st petersburg
Wonderfully over the top!. Get the audio guide. Very crowded but an absolute must if visiting St. Petersburg, for its historical importance as well as for its opulence.

Must see, so I did!. That church was #1 to do in StP, so I visited. Not that impressive for me. But did not take more than half an hour. By the way i used TripAdvisor city catalogs app in StP and it was quite helpful. Must see. Go and visit :)
Crowded but so worth it!. Stunning art and architecture experience. Crowded all the time and a pickpocket destination. Photos allowed and they turned out gorgeous.
amazing. probably my favourite place in st Petersburg - stunning!! A must see, make sure your tour takes you inside and not just to look at from afar.
Another great church. We did not tour the inside but just around the building. With the domes, it looks great. It was just one of the great places to visit when we toured with Gate 1.

Well worth the visit. We visited this Church when we stayed in St. Petersburg as part of a Baltic Cruise. First of all I must pay credit to the coach driver who eventually manage to park right outside after touring round the block! Parking is free in St. Petersburg and consequently there are a lot of cars in the city needing somewhere to park.The visit was well worth it. I am not sure of the price as we entered as part of a tour called "Picturesque St. Petersburg" The exterior is quite overwhelming, with the onion domes and magnificent architecture embellished with semi-precious stones.Inside is equally amazing. You have to look very closely to notice that the pictures are mostly mosaics which are formed into remarkable works of art. Yes, it was very busy but we found that other tourists were willing to share the best vantage spots for photographs.Originally built by Alexander 111 to mark the place where Alexander 11 was assassinated it is no longer a consecrated building. However there is no evidence remaining of the time it served as a mortuary or as a vegetable warehouse.

Beautiful Church in a wonderful setting. This beautiful church was well worth a visit. The church is nestled beside a canal in the middle of St. Petersburg....from the outside the classic domes are scenic and the mosaics and paintings on the inside are fabulous. The memorial inside is also well worth the visit.

St Petersburg. We visited here as part of our tour. For me, it was a highlight although it only needs a short visit it is an amazingly beautiful place. It is only used for religious ceremonies four times a year which is a shame. It will be packed with people so watch for pick pockets..
Beautiful!. Very historic church, where Tsar Alexander II was murdered. One of the main attractions not to be missed in this town.

Utterly Stunning & Highly Memorable. As this Cathedral is on every tourists' 'list' of MUST see's, I recommend visiting as early in the day as possible (be aware when planning your itinerary that it is closed on Wednesday's) as it gets extremely busy, as this day progresses (many bus loads of tourists, jostling for space).In addition (and where possible), visit with a local guide, who will assist you to understand of the Cathedral's history.
Beautiful Cathedral. One of the best examples of the Russan cathedrals, beautifully . A done from outside and inside. A lot of paintings, icons, mosaics and of couse gold!

Crowded but Worthwhile. I visited this Church 7 years ago and came back again last week. It was so busy this time I felt I did not get the time to look at the interior in detail. So many people shoving and jostling for positions for photographs. It is such a shame that there is not a good explanatory leaflet about the mosaics and our tour guide gave us very little time to enjoy the church. The nearby market of 7 years ago now appears to be a coach park. Try and bring your own guide book and avoid the tour groups.

Magnificent Church!. Seeing this church was number 1 on my list on our Baltic Sea cruise and I wasn't disappointed! The onion domes on the outside and the glittering mosaics that decorated the inside were breathtaking! You really have to see it in person to appreciate the beauty of it. It is a landmark that marked the spot of an historic assassination and the spot is identified inside. I can't really express how very pretty this church is. Go and see it-be sure to go inside. It is worth the trip.

Magnificent, must see. There were 5 of us visiting this church. All of our friends that had been in SPB said this is a Must Visit, and it is!It is magnificent outside and when you go inside ... It's hard to describe something that just overwhelms you when you first walk in, but ... this church did - and in a very positive way. It is a most magnificent church, with lots and LOTS of mosiacs, depicting various aspects of the life - and death and resurrection of Jesus.Huge inside; allow plenty of time to enjoy the mosaics/paintings and let it soak in. Hopefully, you won't get people that 'need to have their pictures taken in front of every item', as the church is very crowded.The outside deserves time to be photographed also.Fee of 250 rubles
Wow. Busy room but amazing. The entire Church, from floor to ceiling is done in little tiny mosaic tiles.

Iconic. I was lucky to be part of a private tour of this magnificent church. The mosaics inside are more beautiful than I ever imagined. It is huge inside, and you will spend extra time outside just taking photos. Worth a trip despite the crowds...a must see.

That's all about Russia!. I've been to this church many times but it doesn't lose its charm-no way! It seems to be absorbing the emotions that people emit and it makes it even more attractive. You don't feel sad though its story is full of dramatism and sorrow, but it really gives you a feeling of regret and some transparent beauty at the same time. It's the heart of St.Petersburg, soul-stirring and naked, open to everyone and ready to share its inner power with those who need support and consolation. Go, see it and love it!

St. Petersberg. This was very interesting to visit. The domes and their colors were what I had seen in pictures. There were various wedding groups at this site so this made for an interesting addition to the historic site.
Church. This church is nothing like churches in Northern Ireland. There is so much paintings on walls and ceilings.mosiac floors. Spectacular church .well worth a visit.

Awe-inspiring architecture. This is truly a unique experience to see. Each dome is different and has a different meaning (although I don't remember what they all are). Besides the domes, there are mosaics all around the outside. The best place to take pictures is from a bridge behind the church and down the canal. Unfortunately, the day we were there it was closed, so can't comment on the inside. Our tour guide said the outside was the best part while someone else on our cruise got to go inside a different day and said the mosaics were the best thing she'd ever seen. Go see if for yourself and decide.
As good as St. Basil's.... This is one of the best sites that St. Petersburg offers to the visitor. An incredible example of architecture, history, religion intertwined. A must see.

Absolutely stunning inside and out!. The Church of Our Savior on the Spilled Blood actually has a few names but the important part is it is called on the Spilled Blood because Alexander the Second was mortally wounded where the canopy stands in the church. He was attacked 9 times because he wanted Democratic reforms that the politicians didn't want. Inside the church there are 7,000 square meters of mosaics. It is built in the16th century style but wasn't actually built until the beginning of the 20th century. This is a must see!

One of my favourites. Had just visited it's look alike in Moscow (St Basils). This church's exterior is striking but with the same bright colours. The interior however is absolutely beautiful. Covered in icons, marble etc. We visited in the late afternoon and the crowd was huge. I would recommend visiting a little earlier. Also note, churches in Russia often don't allow people in shorts to enter.

Beautiful inside and out. This is a spectacular church, inside and out. Crowded, but worth the visit. The mosaics inside are incredible, but what is even more incredible is that, not that long ago, Russia was considering demolishing this church. Thankfully, they did not.

Simply stunning!. I love the name of this place. Inside & outside you certainly know it is essentially Russian.Loved the fabulous decoration. The story of Tzar Alexander II used to be something I just read about for A-level now I was looking at the very spot of his assassination!You will need a guide to fully appreciate this historic place

Fabulous. Russian churches often look similar to each other, but this one is unique. It has outstanding architecture, interior decorations and history. I like the place, the fence around the square and the location

Wow, a must see !!!. Fantastic architecture and so special. Extremely busy as one of St Petersburg's top sights.
Built on the spot where Alexander II was assassinated, this building is absolutely beautiful.
Difficult to get external pictures without including some of the crowds who flock here (or are brought on organised visits), but well worth it, it is simply stunning.
Colourful. Amazing exteriors and interiors. You may say it is borderline kitsch, but I loved it! It is strange how Russians charge to enter churches, but totally worth the entry.
Beautiful architecture! This is a must see place in STP. The building is beautiful. The floors are amazing. The tiles are so colorful! You really must take the time to see this!
One of the symbols .... It is beautiful both for outside and inside, during the day and at night. Can you imagine that all the decoration are made from small puzzles? No? Then go there!
Worth the Stop. While its just another church or cathedral, its really quite stunning and the history regarding the assignation makes it a worthwhile stop

Nice area, great architecture, magic inside. As a citizen of the city, I’ve been inside only twice, accompanying my friends. In a distance of two years huge difference has been made! Spectacular Tsar’s gates have added in the center of the altar, some frames renewed and mosaics refreshed. Definitely worth visiting place, one of the best in Saint-Petersburg! It is situated in the heart of historical center of the city, close to Russian museum, Michailovsky park with picturesque fence, and Mars square and Summer garden. it is not large so you will not get tired and you may walk around for the hole evening else. The best time for attending is from late April up until September. It is true for Saint-Petersburg generally, but at any other time you will enjoy this place being not so overcrowded. Taking a guide, if possible, will bring you more pleasure. Welcome!

Tours of St. Petersburg. It is a little bit hurry due to the departure time and too big place to follow, otherwise, it was very nice place to visit and good history background to know with our great tour guide.
amazing. it is better to go by 9 pm, where there will be no excursions and you can relax,, amazing experience

Mosaics were incredible. The church had beautiful mosaics, stunning architecture, and has a significant place in history. After a long, hot day of touring we stopped at the café in front (by the canal) and listen to street musicians whilst drinking a cold beer. It was lovely.

So beautiful, definitely worth it paying to go inside!. As beautiful as this church is from outside, do yourself a favor and get a ticket to go inside. The whole thing is made of little mosaics, bright colors, extremely extremely beautiful. This church for me ranks as high as St Peter's Basilica in the Vatican.
Beautiful Place. The art work all done in mosacis is outstanding and unbelievable. Hard to believe it was a warehouse for 30 years.
Historical. A great visit for those who are interested in Russian history and historical culture. I really enjoyed the visit.
Amazing church. This church is so pretty with, covered in floor to ceiling mosaics. The shot of the towers from outside is an absolutes classic shot from your visit to st Petersburg
Great architecture. Beautiful architecture, close to Nevsky Prospect on the side of canal, worth a visit to take some great pictures while in St Petersburg.

Church visit. Beautiful architecture; impressive interior and easy access
Not much of a religious person.
Nothing else for now.
Very photogenic. Didn't get to visit inside (fee) but you have to see it from outside. On one side are the gardens that lead to the Russian Museum, on the other is a canal.

History brought to life. The church interior is amazing with so much to see. The architecture is breathtaking! It is touching that the church is built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. The detailed mosaics are something to see.
The end of a Monarchy. This church was full of historical interest. A must if you are interested in history. Like all the attractions in St Petersburg there is an entrance fee.

Definitely, a Must See!. This was my first visit to Russia and my first encounter with an Orthodox cathedral of this magnitude, so I was totally blown away by the vivid color and detail of the mosaics. I'm surprised I didn't loose my balance walking around with my necked craned so far back to see the life of Christ documented up the walls and along the ceilings and inside the onion domes! The interior of this church is just magnificent. And despite the crowds, it still had a feeling of reverence and awe. Pay the admission fee and go inside!
Unbelievably Beautiful. A must see for its history and beauty. In a city of beautiful churches and palaces, this is a stunner.

An absolute must see in St. Petersburg. The first stop on our tour was at the Cathedral of Our Savior on the Spilled Blood. It is a beautiful gold-domed church built on the place of assassination in 1881 of the Emperor Alexander II. The cathedral is especially famous for over 7,000 square meters of mosaic interiors. This Russian-style church was officially named Resurrection of Christ Church. We enjoyed it so much that we couldn't imagine anything better!
Awe insipring. Heavily frequented by tourists, but stunning on the inside and outside. The attention to detail is astounding.

Amazing architecture. I really enjoyed going to this Church. You usually see them in pictures, but when you actually arrive and see it your eyes can not believe it. It is a different form of architecture, full of color and in the inside silence and respect. This is a must visit.

Amazing History. This was one of the places in St Petersburg that we wanted to see. It did not disappoint. The church was amazing, the history, the feel inside the church was just amazing. Just so much history in this place, truly spectacular.
A place of tranquility and awe. Do not miss this attraction and learn its history before you go. There is more here than pretty onion domes and magnificent mosaics
Beautiful church. Loved all the mosaics. Slight admission fee. Was somewhat crowded when we were there. Definitely worth seeing.

wonderful. architectural of church's in Russia mainly in famous ones like as Spilled Blood , Saint Vasily in Moscow , Saint Isaac Cathedral ,.. are really wonderful , inside paintings , colored landscapes ,...
most beautiful church. this was my favourite church, it was so beautiful. We went there with a guide from SPB tours which was an excellent way to see the church.

one of the most beautiful small museums of St. Petersburg. It is amazing how much magic you can see in a relatively small museum like this. It took many years to restore this place to its current state and it is not yet fully complete. I have been to most of the museums in St. Petersburg and I can tell you that it is a real miracle.It takes about an hour to visit it. The guided tour is included in the ticket price. I believe you can also get some sort of media player offering you the pre-recorded guide but I have not tried it.
Absolutely Beautiful. Your jaw will drop when you walk into this Church. The mosaics are a work of art as well as everything else. This is a must see in St. Petersburg.
Impressive. Mosaic inside the church is impressive. It is a must see. But the area around the church is full of pickpockets. Be careful when outside.
breathtaking. absolutely awesome and breathtaking, keep an eye out for pickpockets. Afterwards take a river cruise and view it from different angles. Lots of restaurants nearby for lunch.

Amazing. That's about it. Amazing. You can't take a bad picture of this on the outside - depending on time of day, just pick your favourite side to shoot. The inside is amazing as well. It's just very very crowded, or was the day we were there - on a Sunday. We didn't spend a long time there, as we were on a tour, but after seeing it from a distance everywhere we drove, this was a sight to see up close. Having a guide tell us some of the history was very helpful as well.

Stunning!. This church, inside & out, is the most beautiful place I have seen! There is nothing like it when it comes to the mosaics which cover every surface of the walls and ceilings. Nice that they allow photography too as so many churches & cathedrals do not.

Draws like a magnet!. It is impossible not to fall in love with every angle of this incredible structure. Thank goodness for digital photography or I would have gone bankrupt on film costs! As incredible as the outside is, the inside is even better. One can criticize the excesses of the church, but there is a degree to which the human spirit is also celebrated here.
My favourite place in St Petersburg. The mosaics covering every wall and ceiling in the church are just amazing! I think it is the uniqueness of this church that I loved the most.

awesome mosaics. This is one of my most favourite churches in the world to visit. The domes and frescoes decorating the outside of the church are nothing compared to what sights await you inside the church. In one interior dome, looking way up, you see one of only 3 known pictures of Christ as a young man. Add the various types of marble for the floors as well as the various wall mosaics of various stories from the bible such as the woman at the well, "rise up and walk", and the story of Christ's birth (just to mention a few). Be prepared for crowds and more upscale souvenirs stands inside the church however. Well worth the visit.
Beautiful. It is unbelievably beautiful. No negative comments except watch out for pick pockets. Always busy but a must see.
Worth a visit. This cathedral was unique to say the least, history permeates from every corner of the cathedral. you will be disappointed

A must see in St Petersburg, Russia.. The exterior is incredible as is the interior. The interior walls and ceilings are covered with beautiful mosaics. The floors are stunning too. Visiting this amazing work of art was a definite highlight of our stay in St Petersburg.
A Must See. The craftsmanship and artwork using mosaic is amazing. One of the top two churches you must see here.
Must visit To spilled Blood. It was closed for some reason when we arrived. But if inside is as impressive as outside it is spectacular

Best Potato Warehouse in the World. This was a potato warehouse in the Soviet era. The beauty of the treasures inside are only beaten by the external beauty. Gold Onion Domes are classic Russia. On an organized cruise excursion entry was easy, but their were queues for casual visitors. Like most major sights it was busy. Photography is permitted inside, but no flash.
Great mosaics. If you're visiting other sights of St Petersburg, you can love the spectacular church from the outside. If you love mosaics, then get in there!

Spectacular mosaic interiors. This church is well worth the visit because of its spectacular mosaic interiors. We had misleading information about the opening hours from the church's ticket office, so when we arrived the following day and saw the large crowd of people in front of the ticket office 30 minutes before closing time, we decided not to visit he church and went to dinner instead. When returning, the ticket office was still open and visitors exiting the church so we asked again when it closed and were then given a different closing time than when we asked the day before...It's not easy to get accurate tourist information when travelling on your own in St Petersburg, but my advice would be to try to visit this church in the evening if possible, as there will be less crowds.

interesting history, not only a nice church. Really amazed not only about the architectonical beauty, but about the history it has. Due to communism this almost destroyed jewel took longer to be restored than actually being built. Visiting this cathedral is well worth it's time.

Must go inside. Saw the church from the outside but didn't have the time to go inside on our tour. The next day we had some free time and went back, as much as it is spectacular from the outside it is even better inside. I've never seen anything like it.
Interesting place. An interesting place in European history, ticks the boxes for interesting decor, iconography and political change part of the tourist route.
The most astounding building I have ever seen!!. The interior of this church is filled totally with mosaic tiles and is breathtakingly beautiful. I have never seen anything like it in my life.
Still as stunning as ever. Not least as it is so different from the rest of St Petersburg's architecture. You need to queue to get tickets and I would recommend modest dress.

Absolutely amazing building or real historical value. We went to this attraction in July, it was an amazing piece of architecture and the historical background of this church, we were told that you had to pay 3 euros to be able to take photos inside the church, everyone was taking photos and they had no idea who had paid and who had not it was very busy and impossible to monitor, the people in our group who paid felt a bit ripped off with the cost, it is well worth the visit if you are interested in history this is a must see. The mosaics are outstanding. You come out of the church at the rear, it is a lovely walk along the canal and there are some interesting museums and the place where the ballerina Pavlova lived when I. The Russian Ballet, really enjoyed this visit,watch out for pick pocketing, it is all over Russia, we were advised to put our backpack at the front while I. These built up areas. if you think someone is watching we were advised to look straight at them or even takes photo of them and hold on to your bags, they usually work in threes so keep your wits about you, we nearly had an incident, they were following my husband so I just turned and starred at the fellow and went to take his photo and he took off empty handed

Beautiful exterior... inside not much to see... the exterior facade is beautiful and makes for a great photo opportunity. however, when we went inside the church, paying a steep fee, found it overrated. its a small hall and can be covered in like 10mins. if you dont take pictures inside, you can be out in 5 mins...i think if you have seen this Church from outside and taken pictures and walked around the church and explored the souvenior shops and cafes around, it's enough. there is a garden nearby which is pretty and you can spend some quiet time there.

Quite impressive. We've seen our fair share of churches and cathedrals of the Christian variety but our experience with Orthodox churches is fairly limited, a few days in Greece and fewer days in and near Russia. This certainly at the top of the class in our experience. The church is quite impressive from the outside and more so inside. It is covered in icons and mosaic throughout and would not be described as understated. As some recent reviewers have noted, it is fortunate to have survived the Communist Regime. Our guide said that it was used during those days as storage for fruits and vegetables. In any event we world travelers and the people of St Petersburg are fortunate to have this church available to the public today.

A must see. If you're in St. Petersburg you have to visit this church. As others have said, do pay to head inside - it's very similar to other Orthodox churches, in that every square centimetre is covered in decorate, but none is as ornate as the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood.

Magnificent Building. This was one of the most impressive churches I have ever seen, but we could see it only from outside. The colors, the spires and architecture of the church makes it unforgettable. I only wish we could have entered to see what was inside. I understood that it was a museum now but not opened.

The best thing I saw in St. Petersburg. The architecture was not only amazing on the outside but was just as good inside. You will not be disappointed if you pay the small amount to actual go inside the church. By far my favourite landmark in St. Petersburg.

Magnificent Landmark. This church is one of the gems of St. Petersburg. Built in the more traditional style of Russian Orthodox churches, it is less like the other major churches in the city which are more western in exterior style. The mosaics are phenomenal as is the memorial to Alexander II with its unique dome. The relationship of the marble used in the church to the tombs of Alexander and his wife in the fortress, the story of the unexploded Nazi bomb nestled near the heart of the Pantocrator in the dome, and the scriptural stories on the inside walls and how they relate to Alexander's life story on the outside walls made our visit to this church more meaningful.

Magnificent. If you think that the church looks breathtaking from its exteriors, wait till you see the interiors. You will be spellbound. It is like overload of art for me. No matter where you look there is amazing piece of work and in fact there is so much to see here that you will end up with a stiff neck with all the twisting and turning. No wonder this cathedral has become sort of a mascot to St. Petersburg. A must visit while in Petersburg

Make sure you go inside!. Brilliant! Make sure you take the time to go inside and get an audio guide to enable you to hear all about the history of this place. It was packed, but so what - well worth it and amazing example of russian art and architecture.

The most beautiful church that I have ever been in.. This church has the most beautiful mosaics inside. The thought that it was slated for demolition during the communist rule makes me ill. It would have been a horrible loss. Stunning interior and exterior.

most beautiful church I've ever seen. I love old architecture--especially churches/cathedrals. When I walked into this church, my breath was taken away! The entire church's insides were done in mosaic--the walls/ceilings/columns. It was absolutely amazing! I have seen the mosaic pictures at St. Mark's in Rome but that was nothing compared to this! My pictures just don't do it justice! This is a must see!

Russian churches are built to remember events!. This marvelous Russian-style church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881.The Icons are fabulous and the gold is extensive. Used as a museum in the soviet era, the church has been restored to its full glory.

Magnificant!. The most beautiful Church we've ever seen. So colorful and ornate. The interior is more of the same! We just wish that there weren't so many other people visiting there. It's one of SP most popular attractions and we recommend that you visit this during the off season when the crowds are less.
Beautiful Building. One of the most beautiful buildings in the city of St. Petersburg. You can grab a great photo of a canal in front of this cathedral also. Must go inside!

Magnificent. Both the exterior and the interior are magnificent. Every square inch of the interior is covered with detailed mosaics. This, in my opinion is the best church in St. Petersburg, and that says a lot because there some stiff competition. I believe some tours just treat this as an exterior photo stop. While the exterior is certainly gorgeous you really must see the interior.
Must See Site. Very beautiful inside and decorated with over 6000 sq meters of mosaics. Just that one had to be extremely careful with pickpockets.

beautiful but very crowded. Absolutely stunning, but you have to be very wary of pickpockets. If you are on a group tour choose to leave your passport and bags on the coach.beautiful architecture, amazing renovation , loved seeing the one part they left as it was during renovation to show the impact of the war on the building.

Even if you're not into art or religion, don't miss this!. This cathedral is stunning on the outside and spectacular inside. Only about £5 to go in and they allow photography. It is jam-packed with mosaics, everywhere you look. This is a must-see. Cross over the canal afterwards and find the Cafe St Petersburg, for a truly historic apple strudel.
Baltic Cruise. Amazing to see...such history behind this church...we took lots of pictures and our tour guide from SPB Tours was very knowledgable..

Spectacular Both Inside and Out. We visited here as part of our 2 day tour, and it turned out be a highlight. When viewed from the canal side it is an imposing building, topped with bright and colourful onion domes. Very photogenic. This is impressive enough, but when you walk inside you think wow. The floor to ceiling mosaics are amazing, and when you learn how this was achieved you can't help but be impressed all over again.This is must when visiting St Petersburg.

Church of Our Savior. Of all the churches and Cathedrals in St Petersburg, this was the one I'm glad I didn't miss. I was amazingly beautiful, with incredible mosaics throughout and striking from the outside. There was virtually no waiting in line to get a ticket, and a simple in and out.
Must See. Absolutely beautiful! Must see. The market behind the church is gone. Stunning Mosaics like none other.
Wonderful building. One of the most beautiful building in St Petersburg. Pay to get in to see the incredible gold mosaic inside. Be sure you have your memory card empty before get there!

Breathtaking. From the street this church is amazing, but wait until you go inside - spectacular. The mosaics are lovely and there is incredible art wherever you look. Don't make do with a look from outside, the interior is well worth the price of admission.

Colourful!. This cathedral is colourful, spectacular and beautiful near one of the canals of st.p. Its possible to compare it to the vasiliji cathedral in Moscow. Tourist trap but if you havent planned to go inside, you can come here all day. Nice when the sun sets.
Magnificent. The mosaics are amazing. Plan to spend a couple of hours inside and around the cathedral. Fun shopping close by as well.
Beautiful Building. I didn't go inside, because were were in a rush to go somewhere.But been told its amazing inside the church I should have gone inside.
Spectacular Church. A little touristy in the area but still a must see when you are in Saint Petersburg. Did not have a chance to go in but if inside is like the outside I guess I missed a lot.
Beyond our expectations !!!. All I can say is that you have to see the interior of of this church to understand such majesty. Mosaic heaven !!!
What a sight!. Unmissable, if you are in town you need to go and see it! What a beautiful church! We walked past it many times and each time it took our breath away.

Very colorful…. The Church itself made it to history on how and when it was built. The exterior of the church is quite impressive with the colors and the artistry…much more the interior as you walk in and hear about its history. Highly recommended spot for tourists. Good thing is….it's a few steps away from the good bars, cafes and restaurants.
A must see. Beautiful church. Worth the visit even if your not religious. The decoration of the church is stunning.

Absolutely gorgeous, inside and out. If there's only one cathedral you decide to visit on your trip to St Petersburg, let it be this one. On the outside, it slightly resembles Moscow's Saint Basil's church, but on the inside it is filled with countless beautiful mosaics. And there's very interesting history to it, too. I don't know about other languages, but the Russian guides know a lot and are pretty good at what they do.
Magnificent. I have been to Saint Pete 5 times but this was the first time it was open - absolutely brilliant - took my breath away

Absolutely brilliant. One of the top sights visited in over 50 countries, the impressive facade and exterior design is only topped by the interior of thousands upon thousands of mosaic art. To try to describe it is would only fail by comparison to its wonder. Rightfully at No.1 on St. Petersburg's TA attraction list.
Beautiful. This was a beautiful church with some of the most ornate mosaics ever seen. The 9 onion domes on top and the intricate details inside were just awesome.
Very Beautiful. Despite the name of the church, I found the icons and general setting inside the church most beautiful. Church is always included in the 2 day SPB tour.
Only viewed from the street. I catching and similar to St Basils in Moscow, we didn't go inside but it certain make for a good photograph.

Our Favorite Russian Church. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood marks the spot where Alexander II was fatally wounded in an assassination attempt on March 1, 1881. The design of the church draws heavily from St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. This incredibly beautiful church endured threats of being torn, damage from WWII and closure for decades. Fortunately the church has been completely restored to its former glory. Besides the beautiful onion domed exterior the church has an outstanding and varied collection of mosaic icons. An impressive, extravagant shrine to Alexander II was constructed on the spot where he was fatally wounded. If you can only visit one church while in St. Petersburg, this should be the one.
Beautiful Church.. Very beautiful inside. Guides walk you through the church giving you some history and interesting points about it.

Beautiful and Historic. a stunning and historic building! Outside construction amazing and with the onion domes you expect to see in Russia (but few in St Petersburg). The inside is hard to describe -mosaics everywhere-a true feast for the eyes.
The story of tsar killing just makes it hat much more special.

Awesome. The history and architecture of this church is amazing. Seeing the spot which Alexander the II was assassinated was moving. The architecture was modeled after St Basil's in Moscow, but it is more functional as a church. A must see...

GORGEOUS!!!. If you visit Saint Petersburg, this cathedral should be #1 on your list. Built to commemorate Alexander II's death, it is one of the most beautiful cathedrals of the city. Definitely consider taking the tour: you'll learn a lot of interesting details about the royal family.

Colorful Onion Domes and Mosaics. It felt like there was a contest between which could be more magnificent - the exterior or the interior of this church. A must visit for the picturesque architecture and riverside setting and for the amazing mosaics in the interior.
Stunning. As far as cathedrals go, this one is incredible - the artisans and time it took to accomplish this interior is mind blowing. Top of your St Petersburg list

A Reason for a Church. The architecture of this particular church was just stunning as the reason for it being built. Even though it is newer construction, it is beautiful to see, so don't miss if you find yourself in St. Petersburg.

Ok ... Good to see .... Sure it is history and anyone at school did hear the story.and every picture you will find in the net. To see it real, to stand inside is much different, much dignity you will experience

Never seen anything like it. There's too many people, but it's all worth it. Once you start exploring the delicate mosaics you can forget anything around you. It's amazing, beautiful and a must see!
PS. Don't miss the park next to the church it is a quiet and nice as the church is crowded.
Very beautiful church!. I was stunned with a beauty of this building! The story of tsar killing makes it mysterious and even more attractive!
Fantastic. Loved the amazing sites and a must see when visiting Russia. What to go back to see more. It was a vacation of a life time. The time we had was not nearly enough.

Don't miss.. It really is something to see. My travel book was incorrect
about closing time. We were lucky and just went anyway.
Our Viking tour was just going to be a "drive by". We were
in St. Petersburg for a few days before start of tour.

A must see.. Visited as part of our SPB tour and while it wasn't on my "hit" list of must see's it should have been.
It's breath taking

Beautiful, crowded, but worth the visit!. Yes, a must see when in St. Petersburg. We were in awe of the architecture, pictures, and beautiful mosaics from floor to ceiling! It was very busy but the line moved quickly. Interesting history about the church, our guide was very thorough, recommend you take the tour guide. The building is gorgeous to photograph both exterior and interior. (Oh, no washrooms in here, were not allowed to be built in these types of churches)

Best example of onion skin dome design in St. Petersburg. Make sure you try and get a view (photos) of this church from all angles. The structure and colors of the onion domes are the best in the world.The inside of the church rivals Westminster Abby. Be sure to see the final resting room of Czar Nicolas and his family.Great visit.

June'14 visit. Beautiful church. Not sure if it is worth going inside (unless you really understand/interested in design of orthodox churches. However, i would definitely walk around the church since its decorated slightly differently fro different sides

A must see attraction. It is very difficult to describe this breathtaking attraction. It is a 'must see', ranking above nearly everything else we have visited in the world. It is difficult to put into words the impact this had on us both! It was the most photographed place on our Baltic tour. DO NOT MISS THIS!

a must see in St. Petersburg. Church of our savior on spilled blood is very Russian in term of style. The color both exterior and interior is vibrant. The story behind it is touching. Definitely a must see beside summer palace and winter palace.
Must see!. It was crowded, but worth the fight to look around. Audio tour was informational, though a tad bit lengthy.
A must Visit. This should definitely be on your list of things to see while in St. Petersburg. A very nice example of Russian Orthodox.

My favourite "tourist" haunt in St Petersburg. Most tourists make a bee line for the Hermitage when arriving in St Petersburg. Since I was studying the language here for 2 weeks I could afford to be more leisurely and I loved this Church situated at the end of the Griboedov Canal. Check out the history as to why it was constructed in the first place! The interior is stunning with mosaic "pictures", the floor beautiful, the history of its restoration fascinating. The exterior dominates the City. Enjoy....

Stunning. There is nothing quite like it anywhere else in the world. Unfortunately there were men with machine guns guarding the door the day we wanted to go in, so we couldn't but even the outside alone is a must-see
We were impressed!. The beauty, the history of the church. It was crowded, but that wasn't bothering that much. The colours, inside and outside.

Breathtaking!. Set on a canal, the area is rich in history, and a visit inside will move you. The detail and materials used are spectacular. Make sure you have a guide or you will miss out on a lot. The ceiling has a rare painting of Jesus as a youth.

"Blood" refers to Alexander II who was killed here. This church was on our itinerary with SPB Tours who offered multiple day sightseeing tours of St. Petersburg attractions. The Russian architecture of the church is probably the main reason for a visit, but another might be to see the place of the Russian czar's assassination in the late 1800's. The church is a visual delight both inside and outside. The multi-colored onion domes outside are noticeable from many places in St. Petersburg, but the unusual details and colors of blues, greens, and gold leaf on the exterior walls are only seen with a visit to the church. Inside, there are no benches, seating, or pews as the church is not a working church, only a memorial to a past czar. The interior is one big open space, a little on the dark side, with a huge floor mosaic in the middle. Our guide focused on the reno of this mosaic noting the skills needed to do such work. More mosaics of biblical figures with gilt embellishment were visible all the way up the walls. The inside of the domes are also spectacular with gold leafed and painted religious figures. The tall gilt gates at the front of the church glitter with colorful stones. As I turned to exit, my attention was finally directed towards the massive memorial at the back of the church built on the spot where Alexander II was maimed by a terrorist bomb, but bled to death shortly afterward in his palace bed. The original cobblestone roadway, where the czar's blood was spilled, was incorporated as the floor for this memorial. It too is dark using a burgundy type marble/stone and is built to resemble a Greek temple with its 4 corner columns, a canopy, and ornamental oversized vases. It is hard to think that this magnificent building was so badly used after 1917, but it has regained its rightful place as an outstanding memorial. Expect crowds on your visit. Go to see the gorgeous mosaics inside.
Gorgeous!. In spite of being fatigued from walking all over St. Petersburg for 2 days, this was well worth the visit. Absolutely beautiful architecture!
Facinating place. Absolutely beautiful Church. The tile work is like nothing else I have ever seen in that scale. Do not pass this stop.

Beautiful Church, a must see!. The outside of this Church is really beautiful, and very Russian in its design. The roof alone is worth a visit. So much to see, but the inside is equally impressive, particularly if you have a guide to explain everything to you. We saw this near the end of a long day, but it was well worth the visit.
Iconic Church. See it, but the outside is far more appealing/attractive than the inside, which is also quite impressive.

Do Not Miss!! Unbelievably Beautiful. Aside from its historical interest, this may very well be the most beautiful church I have ever seen! It is in a beautiful setting next to a canal, and the exterior is breathtaking. When you think it can't get anymore beautiful, once inside, you don't know where to look first. The colors are phenomenal, and the architecture amazing with the onion domes. A very special place, for sure.

Breathtaking masterpiece inside and out!. Loved it! Make sure you don't miss the orthodox church of our Savior! It's colossal, the mosaics in the interior are amazing, all the history behind it is fascinating! I suggest you visit it as early as possible before the crowds barge in and ruin the serenity of the place and there's no room to see, walk or feel anything!Also be aware of pickpockets when it's packed!

Beautiful down town - MUST get up close!. This entire building is covered in beautiful VERY detailed mosaics. It was closed and covered for more than 30 years of restoration and reopened in about 1996. It is right off Nevski Prospect and near almost all the down town attractions. Take 30 minutes and walk down the canal to the cathedral and at least enjoy the outside. It is a beautiful walk, especially during the spring and summer.

Must see inside, too!. The inside of the church is even more colorful than the outside, with over a million mosaic pieces. If you're going with a tour group, make sure they include an inside visit like ours (SPB) did. The people on our cruise that booked a tour through the cruise line were disappointed that they weren't allowed inside the church.
Beautiful. It is hard to believe that this church was also blown up if not for the outbreak of WWII. It is certainly one of the sites to see. We loved it.

Gorgeous!. This is a must for any visitor to St Pete's! While you will most likely walk by several times during your trip take the time to go inside as well- this is the spot where Alexander II's blood was spilled when he was murdered by reactionaries (hence the name). Moscow's St Basil's may be more famous but this Cathedral is more beautiful!
The best church I've seen. Impressive church, totally different of what I've seen in my life, colorful and all the history that is behind the monument
Amazing. It boggles the mind as to how this church and suroundings were built as they so many, many years ago.
Favorite Church in St. Petersburg. This is the most ornate church I have ever seen. It is hard to see from pictures all the ornate detail in the mosaic exterior. Don't miss it!

Amazingly ornate, inside and out. The church was harmoniously over the top. Because Tsar Alexander II was assassinated on the spot, it was built in the style of Moscow's famous cathedral, but with even more tile decorations on the domes outside and beautiful mosaics throughout inside, with an intricate marble floor mostly now covered with carpets. It was my wife and daughter's favorite St. Pete experience, the climax of 3 wonderful days.
Mesmerising Visit. Brilliant - a must not miss place. Dont need a guide, just pay 100 RUB for the headphones on entering, with a gadget offering language of your choice, and youre good to go!
Fantastic. We went here as part of our tour with Petersburg Voyage....a must see when you are here ....has been renovated inside and out and will take your breath away.
An architectural masterpiece. You can only stand back and admire this beautiful church, built on the site of an earlier church where Alexander 11 was mortally injured in 1881. One not to be missed.
Make sure to go inside. There is a lot more to this site than the beautiful exterior. Don't skip checking out the interior - it's amazing.

Spectacular! A Must See.. This is one of those rare places that should be on the "must see" list for travelers. The architectural detail and vivid colors form a lasting mental picture worthy of "framing". Best to see in the early morning before the throngs of tour buses and visitors arrive. Expect to be mesmerized.
SPBs St. Basils. The history of this place rivals St. Basils in Moscow, and it looks similar. There is plenty of reason to see this. Besides, you can't miss it if you are in the heart of SPB.
Gorgeous architecture!. A "don't miss"! The exterior and interior are equally stunning and it was a fabulous opportunity to see the beautiful onion domes that Russian churches are known for.
A must see. Both the interior and exterior are stunning. The mosaics and chandeliers inside the church are gorgeous.
My favorite church in St Petersburg. The mosaics are phenomenal. I could spend all day there examining them but there are too many other places to see and thing to do.
Stunning. Wow! Even with the crowds this place was worth the visit. Skip the audio guide and take time to gaze at the beautiful mosaics. Photo worthy inside and out.

Remarkably Beautiful!. This church is an architectural gem. Designed as if it was taken from a fairy-tale, you shouldn't miss it while visiting the city. Go and see it at least from the outside.
Inside the church, you'll find a fantastic mosaic artwork - the whole interior is covered with mosaics portraying different scenes from Jesus' life and Christianity.
beautiful place and icons inside. Really nice place, more beautiful than the pictures of it that you see online. Interesting story of it's history.

Church of spilled blood. Our first visit to both Moscow and St Petersburg. Great experience.The church of our Saviour of spilled blood is a must on any visit to St Petersburg. Easy to find from the centre main areas. First impressions from outside, that it was a unique building experience. Wonderful architecture, both inside and out. They do allow photographs, however no digital tourist camera could do the inner dome or other features justice. We completed the visit on our own throughout Russia. Fortunately we arrived at this church and managed to listen in to an American guide. We then had plenty of time after they left to see all for ourselves. You can get an English speaking guide to help. This is also not far from the Hermitage , also well worth a visit, best to allow a full day for both. Very impressive church building.

Awsome. Amazing. Do not miss it.. I am somewhat surprised that this is the number one top-rated attraction in St. Petersburg, when the Hermitage Museum in the Winter Palace of the Czars is also located here (and that rates only number 4!), but, having said that, I am not at all surprised that this attraction is so popular! Stunningly beautiful both outside and in, from a distance and from up close, this is an absolute must-see sight in St. Petersburg. And, it's a lot easier to get into and through than the massive Hermitage. Built in the early 20th century to commemorate the spot where the beloved Czar Alexander II was assassinated by disgruntled right-wing conservatives who did not like the fact he had freed the serfs, it is 20th century but looks medieval. In fact, from the outside, it looks incredibly much like St. Basil's Cathedral in Red Square, Moscow. However, that church was built starting in the 12th or 13th century (or something like that), so it is much, much, much older and different than this one in St. Petersburg. Both are must-see sights.

A must see!. This is a beautiful church. From the outside it has the iconic"onion"domes found in this part of the world. Once inside be sure to check out the ceiling and what is painted inside the domes. It's best to get a guide or at least some literature that explains what you are seeing inside the church. There is a lot of history present. Also check out the floor, the walls and alter speak for themselves.
Brilliant Architecture... Love the domes in Russia, this was just another beautiful piece of architecture that I managed to get on my camera, definitely one of the prized buildings in St Petersburg.

Historic Place. A brilliant piece of Russian history. The ornamental style of the magnificent church is matched only by its historic majesty. A great place to visit and enjoy the history of this church
Must see!. Such an impressive and beautiful church. We were on a tour and enjoyed hearing about the history and detail. I could have spent an hour walking around the church alone. Such great photos!
Has to be seen!. Very centrally located, this church has to be seen just to view the architecture, vibrant colors and a city landmark. Very easy to access from most major hotels by foot.
Beautiful church. Beautiful, Very impressive, nice plane around. Better to visit early in the morning or end of the day to avoid the crowd

Spectacular Interior and exterior. Over the top glitz on the exterior and outstanding paintings on all the walls and ceiling inside. A must see. Try to get around the back of the church and to the other side of the canal to take some really great photos. We were not allowed to do this on our tour but it would have been perfect.

An extraordinary church....!. This is a must-see. Spectacular from the outside (best views probably along the canal from the Nevsky Prospekt side), amazing inside - the whole interior covered with intricate mosaics, huge ones, reaching right up to the ceiling. We were really pleased to have a guide for our visit, to help explain the Russian Orthodox approach to their churches (no stained glass, no statues, just icons, no seats, head-coverings for women in churches, all priests having to be married, etc). The church was packed of course - it was July - but this is a genuinely unmissable sight.

Overwhelming!. Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood, built on the site of Tsar Alexander II's assassination, is so overwhelmingly beautiful. It seems to be always crowded, but once you get inside you're just looking up anyway - at the hundreds and thousands of mosaic pieces. This is another "don't miss" site in St. Petersburg.

One of the very best churches ever!. Spent a few hours taking pictures of the church both inside and out. If you think the outside is colorful and picturesque, wait until you get inside. We spent some time outside trying to get the best family picture with the church in the background...and we got some. The visit inside of the church opened our eyes to some awesome and extremely beautiful mosaics that line the walls. We found the experience to be extremely exhilarating and enjoyable because its much better in person than looking at pictures.

breathtaking. we expected a lot, and it still blew us away. beautiful inside and out. the mosaics inside deserve more time than we had (approx 30 minutes) to fully soak in, but we are very glad we saw it. on the outside, be sure to walk all the way around it as the entire structure deserves attention.

very unique. I love this cathedral, it reminds old Russia so much, and it is very unique.The Church contains over 7500 square meters of mosaics—according to its restorers, more than any other church in the world!!!
impressive. the church is gorgeous on the outside and the inside. We went here with the kids and we all enjoyed it. Surprisingly short line.
An awe-inspiring church. Inside and out, this famous symbol of the City is spectacular. It is hard the believe all the beauty you will see when visiting.

showcases Russian history and religion. Beautifully restored Cathedral which was built on the exact spot where the Tsar got assassinated on the charity money from the Russians. It was partially destroyed by Germans during the second world war and renovated in the nineties.

A classic domed cathedral in the St. Petersburg style. Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood a/k/a Church of the Resurrection is similar in style as the famous St. Basil’s in Moscow’s Red Square, except this one is larger but just as beautiful. Check out all the icons on the walls and the ornate mosaics on the floor. The name comes from the site that was the spot on which the murder of Emperor Alexander II was committed. Observe that the style of cathedrals in St. Petersburg are different than in Moscow. The outside of this cathedral is in mosaic and the cupolas are bright enamels.

Large and colourful. One of St. Petersburg's "must see" museums. Quite impressive and not too exhausting so even if you are not particularly interested in which exact spot tzar Alexander II was fatally wounded or how all the mosaics were made you will enjoy visiting and remember it.

Worth seeing no matter what. This place is truly one of a kind, and no wonder that there are always huge crowds there in summer.But I would recommend going there anyway. The interior of this church is not less breathtaking than the exterior. Inside the place is entirely covered with mosaic, that only took 12 years to complete.There is a way to avoid crowds even in summer, if you enter right when it opens, at 10:30 AM. Also, try to find out if there are concerts held there during your stay. Russian church choir is really worth hearing, and not that many people now about such concerts, especially tourists. You can look it up n their web cite http://eng.cathedral.ru/spasa_na_krovi
One of the most beautiful things I've ever seen. Breathtaking and unforgettable! Every time I go out I walk a couple of blocks just to view it again and again.

Church that commemorates a tragic event that happened.. The church was build in memory of the Tsar Alexander II. Do remember that you have to be properly dressed (no shorts, no slippers) to be able to enter the church. Also, no photos inside.

Amazing Russian Church. Church of Our Savior on Spilled BloodThis church is amazing, both outside and inside. Outside is typically Russian, modeled after the great church of Moscow. Colorful spires with exotic shapes. Looking at it upriver from a bridge on the Main street is a sight never to be forgotten. Once you enter, you will be truly amazed. It is all made of mosaic pieces,beautiful intricate designs. Visual overload. This was the sight of St Petersburg I was most impressed with. It is overwhelming.

Festive church that commemorates a tragic event.. The church was built to honour the memory of Tsar Alexander II, who was assassinated on the very spot by a member of the Narodnaya Volya, a Russian left-wing terrorist organization.
Spilled Blood Church. I liked the history, story, the church itself was very nicely decorated, the big clock inside the church was a different clock but very interesting

Stand out Cathedral.. Went on our first visit, were not allowed in because partner was in shorts. Went and changed, well worth the trouble ! Cathedral is amazing inside, We were even fortunate to be there when service was on.

Amazing. Loved to look at the exterior of this remarkable building.I wasn't as keen on the interior as I thought I would be and it doesn't have the feeling as a church, most definitely as a museum but don't miss visiting it.
