Incredible history.... To think that they bombed this is a painful thought...it has been restored magnificently...it was something to see it bombed out in the photos inside the church. Very colorful, very detailed, very intricate architecture.

Must see's - Photographer's must in Night and day. The colorful domes and the location across the canal makes this a must see landmark of Petersburg. It is built as a memorial to Alexander II in 1881 on the site of his assassination. It has a great collection of mosaic walls in addition to icons, coat of arms, steeple and has a shrine marking the spot where alexander was assassinated. Another interesting fact that during the leningrad siege, it was used to store potatoes and also gets its another name Savior on PotatoesThere are many photo sights in and around this catherdral both during the daytime and for night shots

Just fabulous!. Very evocative this is the iconic image of St Petersburg and is a real highlight of any trip. Reopened in 1997 after nearly 30 years of restoration this is not to be missed. Of the 15 people on our two day tour, over half considered it the top site visited.

colorful!. this lovely cathedral is really full of colors.
you can see it from almost everywhere - but only when you come close you can realize how beautiful it is !!!
Beautiful church. This is a must see in St. Petersburg. Don't skip going in, when we went there was no wait even though it was in the afternoon on a Saturday.

Stunning building, both inside and out. This is a fabulous building - magical! You do get to see an awful lot from the outside but it's still worth going in as the mosaics are amazing. It's a little cheaper to visit in the daytime than the evening so go a bit earlier if you're on a tight budget.
Interesting history. Our guide Julia told the story of the fatal wounding of Alexander 11 on this site so well - fascinating!

Iconic onion domes. This is the quintessential church with colorful and gleaming onion domes, right next to a canal. There's a smattering of junky souvenir sellers nearby, and some street musicians as well. Lots of good photo ops here!
Church. Very interesting. Liked the icons and the structure of the building.all the gold lots of history I this church

Truly spectacular!. This Church is amazing on the outside, truly insprational and vibrant. The mosaics inside are beautiful, would have loved to have more time as was on a tour, had limited time inside. Our tour guide Uri was very good and gave us lots of history about the Church.It is likely to be busy when visiting but this did not ruin our visit at all, highly recommend a visit here to anyone visiting St Petersburg.

Spectacular mosaics. I think of this church as Muscovite rococo style. It is loosely patterned after St. Basil's in Moscow, but is a later, more exotic version. The interior wonderful floor to ceiling, wall to wall mosaics, painstakingly reconstructed since WWII. It is a must-see in St. Petersburg, especially if that is the only Russian city you are visiting.

A must see. It is quite a sight, and well maintained on the outside. The inside is not quite as spectacular. There is a bazaar of souvenirs right beside it and if you can haggle, probably the cheapest place to buy them because you can pit one vendor against the other.
Must-see in St. Petersburg. This beautifully painted and renovated Russian church packed with history will be of interest to everyone
Very inspiring. Awe inspiring design. Ornate amazing inside. Loved the atm inside, very religious. The roof, frescos are really quite spectacular and really worth going to see.
Great tour. It is a beautiful building and inside is out of this world, well worth a visit. It is a bit dark, but it is all mosaic must have taken years to do.
Exceptional mosaics. The Church is very colourful both inside and out - maybe get there early to avoid the big tour groups. Pay the 250 Rubles to visit inside - wonderful art work

Must See. My favorite site in St. Petersburg.Absolutely beautiful. The inside, the outside ,everything is beautiful. I had seen lots of pictures before going but they do not compare to seeing the church in person. A must see in St Petersburg. Make sure you have time to go inside.
Interesting. Beautiful surroundings interesting history. This was one of many stops. Enjoyed the incredible mosaics.

The massive crowds spoil the enjoyment of this site. My guess is that you can't go to St Petersburg without visiting this site, but, being in the very middle of the city, it is easily accessible to every tourist and tour group and the abominable traffic and tour buses outside and the massive crowds inside ruin the enjoyment. If you are at all claustrophobic, proceed with caution. That being said, the mosaics are incredible, and the history of this church through the ages very interesting. For my taste, I preferred the Cathedral in Monreale Sicily for exquisite mosaics, done with far more reserve and far better artistry.
Amazing place. The place is amazing, and so typically Russian, the interiors are out of this world and have to be seen to be believed. Well worth the effort!

Stunning!. We stopped here during a tour of the city as I imagine most people do. It wasn't one of our main stops but I requested to take photos from the outside.I wish I would have included it for a proper visit. I had seen photos at home but nothing could prepare me for the feeling you get once there and the atmosphere and buzz all around. Would of liked to have seen the inside in person :)A truly iconic building among all of the amazing places you can see in St. Pete's!!
colourfull. This church is beautiful and really colourfull. must see on your trip to St. Petersburg. The inside is maybe even more pretty than the outside!

Absolutely splendid. One of my greatest experiences of St Petersburg. The design is non-European and distinctly Russian, making it rather unique amongst the hundreds of other churches I've seen. The colours are splendid, especially on a clear day. Inside: ignore the selling stalls and appreciate the massive amounts of mosaic that line the interior - something I have not seen before.

Beautiful; just like the photographs...... After spending a lot of time at The State Hermitage and seeing St Isaac’s Cathedral, our final stop for the day was The Church of our Savior on Spilled Blood. Unfortunately it was getting late so we did not get a chance to go inside; but we appreciated seeing this magnificent cathedral. Even though it was slightly raining with cool weather (some 45° F) it was great seeing this magnificent church.
A must see. This was a beautiful and wonderfully historic site. It's a busy sight and getting to see everything requires some patience but well worth it.
Nice but rushed. Great place to visit....absorb the history.............be quick though your rushed around the shore excursions visits........Well worth a visit.
Magnificent. It is one of greatest Russian churches, worth visiting.! Try to go inside. There is also an observation deck.

Outside is better than inside. This is the iconic St Petersburg plague to see. The church is in every tourist photo, and it is spectacular to see in person. Fun shopping at the booths outside. However, the inside is jammed with tourists all the time, no room to move around easily, and every turn in this small church brings you to a new stall selling icons. Go late in the afternoon if you want to go inside.

Magnificent architecture. Colours incredible.. Absolutely incredible. Sadly due to time constraints we weren't able to enter but our photographs are fantastic. There was a small market opposite that sold good quality souvenirs. Make sure you barter though. We were there in 2013.
WORTH VISITING. It is nice if you go to the top dome and take a city picture from it. It was very cold in late may however we managed to get bird`s eye view pictures

Amazingly beautiful. Have seen this masterpiece architecture on TV and magazines but to be in front of this is different.Fantastic,breathtaking and spectacular.Every angel is awesome.I like the big onion shapes on top.Guide said it took 25 years to complete.Beware of pickpokets .Some are disguised as tourists.
Only saw the outside. We were on a tour and didn't get enough time to view the interior but the outside is magnificent and the surrounding area is pleasant for a nice walk.

Great Church. My wife who was born here never saw the completed restoration, so we both enjoyed the church and it history. I took the audio tour and found out the church was reconsecrated in 2004. The audio tour while long gave many interesting facts, while my wife listened to some Russian guides and had the audio fill in some items the guides left out.The audio tour is 100 roubles, but worth it for the extra information.

Excellent Art work-Great History. Most of the Cathedrals are similar, this one has very detailed Art work. If I were going to go to Just one, go this one. Read the History of it and just look around. You can pay for an excursion but if you read a little history of the Cathedral, and you are familiar with the Bible you will not really need a tour guide. It is also right across the street from the Russian Market where you can haggle over souvenir Gifts.

Iconic landmark. The image of this church (although in name only now as it is no longer consecrated) appears in most images of St. Petersburg and just about every tourist seems to make a visit based on the crowds - it's a haven for professional pick pockets and still a must-see on your itinerary.The whole building is a bit magical and when you walk in - keep walking straight for the homage to the 'spilled blood'. The entire building is quite remarkable.

Best thing in St Petersburg. If you're visiting St. Petersburg you have to go to this place. Having been renovated to it's pre soviet era glory, it is spectacular. We only spent about 40 minutes there, but we really liked it.

Church. A church with a sad reason for being their - the assassination of a reforming Tsar - Alexander II. Be sure to read the plaques which encircle the exterior of the church - these record the reforms this Tsar introduced.

There's a reason it's #1--It's Breathtakingly Beautiful!. Mere pictures can't depict the opulence and grandeur of this church, built 1883-1907. Although it's not ancient, it has an ancient and mystical feel about it. The mosaics are absolutely awesome--in the truest sense of the word. Everywhere you look, you'll see magnificent portrayals of Biblical scenes. Yes, it can be crowded, but the crowds are respectful of the art and the reason for the church; to preserve the spot where Alexander II was assassinated.
Fantastic place to visit. Very busy but an absolute must on anyone's itinerary when visiting St Petersburg. Take your time to look at the wondeful mosaics

Really interesting building. This church is one of the icons of St. Petersburg so needs to be visited but it is so much more than just a photo opportunity, I found the history of the place and it's restoration really interesting. I recommend the audio guide which helped me to appreciate the mosaics and the background to the church. As with most of the places in St. P, the earlier you go, the more likely you are to avoid the tours from the cruise ships.

Avoid tour group times... Approach the church along the canal to get the best views and anticipation of what is coming as you walk inside, and try to time it to avoid the hordes of tour groups, who gum up the works inside. There's no extra charge for taking photos, and you'll want to take lots, from the moment you step through the door. We looped around several times to get a full sense of the building and the history, once just looking and again guide book open. The decoration is incredible and you'll spend half your time just admiring the ceilings - be sure to get up close to the walls too, to see the detail and some of the restoration.There's a small display toward the exit that details restoration that happened after WWII and the siege of Leningrad.No toilets available inside, but there is a paid for booth outside the front, near where the tour buses park.
Spilled Blood Church. Very memorable onion shaped church. Magnificent detail. Could not visit inside because there was a service.
A Mosaic Wonderland. This is the most beautiful example of a traditional Orthodox church. Inside every inch of the walls are covered in beautiful mosaics. Well worth a stop.

Magnificent!. This onion-domed church is lovely from the outside as well as within, the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander II with the spot preserved. The mosaics are wonderful, the church one of the most striking of those we visited.

No tripod photography!. We love this magnificent church and have visited it several times. This visit (June 2014) we just wanted to take some quality pictures for long memories. The day before the visit we walked from our hotel to ask about photographing. The answer was definitely positive. So next day we came with our Nikon mounted on the small tripod to make it easy to hold the camera and get a good picture without a flash. As soon as we got our tickets ($8.00) and approached the check point, we heard that tripod photography is prohibited. We promised to the guard that we'll use the tripod only for support and we'll not open the legs, and we kept that promise. 25 steps later an elderly female guard again told us: no tripod! We explained to her but seems she could say only "Net-Net-Net!" In Russian. Then she went to call the supervisor, and a nice young lady speaking English a little bit, came and let us take some pictures without opening the tripod's legs. She explained to that elderly (obviously, ex KGB agent during the Cold War). Then we took some pictures but that elderly agent never left us alone, we never got out of her sight. Very personal attention considering several hundreds people inside of the church at that time! She left us only when we were buying some souvenirs, just a few steps before the exit door, another ex KGB agent stopped us asking for a written permission to take photos. We could not help ourselves but laughed and left! We feel that non-flash/monopod photography is much better for preserving the icons not to mention the more damage to the floor from high heels than rubber coated feet of the monopod do. We loved the church but we were treated very rudely.

Beautiful and Traditional. Gorgeous building, easy to access and be sure to take a photo from a distance along the canal. It's very pretty inside, but it's not large at all and takes approximately 10 minutes to walk thru and see what it looks like on the inside. Unless you want to burn the money, and love mosaics, pay the price. I was happier with the view from the outside.

Make sure that you put this church on your list of attractions.. One of Saint Petersburg's stunning churches. Fell into disrepair under Soviet rule and was used as a potato store but has now been restored and is well worth a visit.

Be careful with your bag. The place is nice, however I particularly prefer Moscow and its attractions. Everywhere with tourists there is a risk of pickpockets, but in St. Petersburg this was excessive - at least, this was the impression I had. We decided to take a day tour and everywhere we stopped, the first thing the guide said was: "be careful with your bags, cameras and etc.." I travelled around the world and I come from a big city, so I'm used to the "dangerous" of ghost places - but in St. Petersburg this was very annoying.
As impressive as the pictures. We were as impressed and it really looked as grand as the pictures! The lines were very short and it was not too crowded.
beautiful place. recently restored so it was very interesting to see for the first time, pity that some collection is missing and is probably lost

Breathtaking Mosaics. Go early to avoid the massive crowds. The church was absolutely breathtaking from the colorful onion domes on the outside to the mosaic scenes adorning the inside. We were on a tour and I wish we would have had more time here. I could have spent hours taking it all in. Don't miss seeing this!!
A beautiful must see in St. Petersburg.. We didn't have time to go inside, but the church is beautiful and distinctly Russian. We took many pictures of us standing in front.

amazing. i've never seen such a amazing and beautiful church in my life, colorful, gold everywhere,
I 've been in many places but nothing compare to St. Petersburg
imponent place!

Not to be missed. The church is magnificent outside and inside! The murals are often mosaic, as well as painted. The altars and icons are breathtaking. We did not have a guide, but would have liked one. Very crowded, so allow lots of time!

Beautiful. Our Hotel 3MostaA, was 2 minutes from this very imposing church.it was so colourful and ornate and sat on the side of one of the many canals in St. Pet,( a bit like Amsterdam ). It has to be visited, if you travel to this brilliant city.
Beautiful mosaics. A gorgeous church filled with incredible artistry. So humbling to see the scope of the mosaics and realize how old they are and the fact they were done by hand. Stunning.
Amazing sight. You cannot help, but love the unique architecture of this church. I spend a month in St. Petersburg and everytime it was a pleasure to catch a glimpse of the church.
Must see !!. You can not miss this extravagance. Beautiful detail unlike anything you have ever seen. Reasonable price tickets and tours

You need an hr to do this justice! Beaustiful!. Our SPB tour guide, Kate, got us there for under 30 min. We were all nervous about returning to the ship on time, but we made it. Church is magnificent. As I look back, I'm annoyed with the short time allotted. Definitely a must see as others have noted. Magnificent restoration and fascinating history.

most interesting church. Visited for a short tour the History about he spilled blood would interest a historian The brightly colored tiles makes this church unlike any other. It is a must see in St. Petersburg
A must in St Petersburg. This iconic church is a must for a first-time visit to St Petersburg. The entry fee is well worth the money. The mosaics are beautiful.
Gorgeous!!. Such a beautiful building inside and out! We visited with Tailored Tours (see my full review there) and received so much interesting information to go along with this church!

Breathtaking. I could only see this from the outside as time constraints and wheelchair accessibility were a problem, but I have to say this was the most amazing building I have ever seen. If you see nothing else whilst in St P give yourself time to go here even if you can't get in.
Beautiful architecture!. It's nice, but St Pete is an overall bomb...went on a cruise but would not spend more than 3 days there.
Not the best. A lot of people around, (Sunday) warning for pickpockets. didn't go inside because of time, (tour bus) not on my future schedule
Beautiful renovation!. It was wonderful to see the church renovated. The spires are so colorful. A must see in St Petersburg!
Spectacular. An absolute must if you are in St Petersburg. Just go ... Totally different to the Palaces. Mosaics are amazing. Nothing to disappoint.
Must see sight in St Petersburg. We had a quick visit here as part of our SPB tour package. A very impressive church and one you must see if visiting St Petersburg,

The WOW factor?. This was something else. Nowhere else will you find a church with such architecture, history, presence, and atmosphere. No, I suppose that is untrue, but it is unique. Unfortunately, it is the same with all such places, everyone wants to see it, and they all seem to be there when you are. As there was a service going on during our visit, our 'tour' was limited, but this did not detract from the beauty of the paintings, icons, etc.

World Class Attraction. Amazing structure and innards. Worth the trip to St. Pete. all by itself.Don't have time for 50 characters so trust me on this. Don't have time for 50 characters so trust me on this

Really wonderfull. By day (with a little sunshine) or by night (white nights in St Petersburg) this monument still really amazing ! You can stay behind, take a look all around : everyside is beautyfull !!

Beautiful church. Spectacular outside and inside. We went for the 6-8pm session and didn't have to queue although there was quite a crowd inside. Definitely a must-see in St Petersburg. An hour is sufficient to see the inside of the church but you can spend more time admiring the outside, having a horse-ride or other touristy activities.

Superb. A total feast for the eyes! It looked magnificent from a distance but absolutely spectacular the closer you get. You can go round in an hour and see everything. The church is ALL mosaic quite the most beautiful building I have ever seen. Please don't miss seeing this you will never forget it's beauty!
Something fantastic. The place is huuuge, is really impressive.amazing mosaic, amazing altar.dont know wher to look frm floor to the sealing is perfect and beautifull.

Breath Taking. This church is so impressive that it's hard to describe it in words. The only think I can say is that it's a must see while you are in St. Petersburg. Also, the church is closed on Wednesdays so don't walk all the way over to it (like I did) and be disappointed!

Fantastic. This church is unique. In fact the mosaics reminded us of Haghia Sophia in Turkey. We took the audio guide without which you will be staring at mosaics without understanding its importance. But the guide is quite long and detailed. Be prepared to spend atleast 45 min here. With its vibrant colors and onion shaped domes, you cannot miss this place from anywhere in the city.

Magnificent Mosaics Not to be Missed. This church is a must see for the traveler to St. Petersburg. Both the exterior and interior are stunning examples of the highest form of Russian artistic achievements. The subtilities of color and human expression shown in the mosaic art forms leaves one completely flabbergasted.Try to avoid prime crowded times and lingering outside where pickpockets are known to congregate.

Beautiful church. One view from Nevsky Prospect on the canal is worth a 1000 words. From far away its beautiful but as you come closer and closer it becomes amazing . Maybe no where else on earth can you see a church that is comprised entirely of mosaic tile. Inside is amazing , pay the extra money so you can take photos you will want them for the future.

Interesting gingerbread church. This is a spectacular sight and has an interesting history. Although the church is not very old it has echoes of the more famous version of this style in Moscow. It is also the site of the assassination of a Czar and near many other interesting features of the city. Worth a visit and has some spectacular mosaics and interiors.

Rivals the great European cathedrals. The Bolsheviks converted it into a museum. Mosaics are unbelievable. Unlike the Winter Palace, doable in a few hours or less. You can climb to the top for a great view of the city.

Church of our Saviour on Spilled Blood. My daughter & I shared this experience & I can speak for both of us.When in St. Petersburg, this is a MUST. It's a very very popular & busy site, & we were glad that we did it as part of a tour, & would therefore suggest that's the way to do it. There was little waiting in the line ups, due to the fact that the tour guide had pre booked our appointed time, & more importantly, the information & history which she provided were the highlights of visiting this unforgettable place. "Brought it to life", you might say.The beauty of the church, both inside & out, will stay with you forever, - you simply have to go there.
Beautiful, breathtaking, amazing!. Just as beautiful the 2nd time around!A definite must see while in St. Petersburg, don't miss this gem, just as amazing as Saint Basil's cathedral in Moscow.

Not spiritual, but beautiful. This memorial to Alexander II is wall-to-wall with iconic paintings. The most moving part is what most people may miss: Part of the actual pavement stones on which Alexander fell, which lie under the monument to him at the right when you enter. But the place has no sense of spirituality when compared with a holy place such as the Cathedral of Our Lady of Kazan, where ladies with head scarves form long lines to kiss and pray to the icon of Maria. So: Do visit this site, but view it largely as an art exhibit.
Iconic. Majestic with a Russian contrast, read about the history prior to visiting. We went late in the evening it was quite and more engaging without a crowd.
AWESOME. Another wonderful sight in St Petersberg but very busy, don't miss it.Difficult to take photographs because it is so crowded. The outside of the buildinf is very impressive also.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. You must go and check this place out. The building is absolutely stunning. It has that 'Russian' look about it and is quite central so you should be able to walk there from anywhere downtown.
Fairytale building. Exceptional outside but the inside is full of mosaics all over the wall. Unfortunately loads of other tourists - a very popular place.

Well worth seeing. Beautiful building outside , stunning inside , view at the back is easier to take photos off to avoid the taking pictures of people queuing, also you can get a good picture from the Boat on the river trip
Watch your footing on the cobblestones outside. I tripped and fell, leaving some of my blood on the spilled blood! It is a beautiful church and in a nice, quiet location.
Stunning beautiful. This was a highlight way beyond colour, beautiful artwork, history and belief. You feel this building!
Stunning. This is one of the most stunning buildings in St Petersburg.It is a must to visit.not very big but amazing.

Excellent. This place is a must go for every travellers visiting St,Petersburg , Indeed, this place is very beautiful and located at Metro Station Nevsky Prospekt. [ BLUE LINE ]. I had a great time with my family members around this Church.
One of the most beautiful churches in Russia. There is nothing you can dislike about it! Wonderfully designed and very different from other churches of Russia

A must see in St. Petersburg. This place was gorgeous and something to see in St. Petersburg. The inside of the church is beautiful. We had a tour guide and it was interesting to hear the facts behind the church. I would recommend a guide for the church or some sort of information about the church to make it more meaningful. Beware of the pick-pocketers that can be found behind the church. We were warned about them multiple times.

Beautiful!. This is a must see when in St. Petersburg. It is not very big and will not take very long to tour. The beautiful colors are in stark contrast to the drab Soviet buildings in St. Petersburg.
Beautiful mosaics. This church looks like a fairytale from the outside, but don't miss the interior. The mosaics inside the church are so colourful and they cover every surface.
Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This was a historically significant site to tour and most beautiful church inside and out. Highly recommend!

Most Beautiful Church I've Been to!. It's even more beautiful in person than in pictures and contains a rich history as well. Definitely a must-do while in St. Petersburg! The church is not very big on the inside, so a visit of a half hour should suffice.If I remember correctly, there is a fare; however, it's a small one. It's also pretty centrally located, so it shouldn't be hard to get to.

Church of our Savior on Spilled Blood. Wow, of wow......do not miss this if you find yourself in St Petersburg! Total jaw dropper. Impressive from the outside, as you can see in photos but quite surreal in real life amidst so many soviet style concrete apartments. Then you step inside and it is completely covered in tiny mosaics forming amazing art works! DO IT!
3rd best church. in St. Petersburg. It's nice place, but very small. Full of mosaic and shops.There is nice walk from Nevskij Prospect.

Stunning from outside to inside. This iconic structure is a must see in St Petersburg and it's stunning from the outside to the inside. Admission fee was modest and queue was short so really worth a visit!
Visit to Church Of Our Savioron Spilled Blood. Very interesting visit to this church, certainly a beautiful structure. A lot of history and our guide did a great job explaining all of it.

If you got time, try to do the audio guide as well. I paid for the audio guide, and I suggest you to do so as well if you wanted to know more about the church. Many of the information given in the audio guide are not shown on the description.The church is a lot small than what I expected, but the inside is beautiful, full of mosaic. Some of these, without a close inspection, look like oil painting!!!
amazing Detail.... Beautiful detail and wonderful history... what a beautiful church... a must see when visiting St petersburg

Incredible, amazing restoration. Approach the church along the canal to get the best views and anticipation of what is coming as you walk inside, and try to time it to avoid the hordes of tour groups, who gum up the works inside. There's no extra charge for taking photos, and you'll want to take lots, from the moment you step through the door. We looped around several times to get a full sense of the building and the history, once just looking and again guide book open. The decoration is incredible and you'll spend half your time just admiring the ceilings - be sure to get up close to the walls too, to see the detail and some of the restoration.There's a small display toward the exit that details restoration that happened after WWII and the siege of Leningrad.No toilets available inside, but there is a paid for booth outside the front, near where the tour buses park.
Beautiful. You have to see this just to see how beautiful it is. The architecture is amazing. Well worth a visit just to take photographs.
A must see. This church has so much history. Very crowded the day we were there but our guide did by pass the line up and we there only long enough for her to explain the history.
Amazing. Breathtakingly gorgeous, lots of tours just drive past for a photo opportunity, but do go in its a must see

Most Incredible Church- A Must See!!!!. This is the most incredible church that I have ever visited, The architecture and detail of the domes is spectacular. Much more impressive than St. Basil in Moscow.Make sure that you enter, and spend time just taking in all of the glorious interior mosaics. The history of the church is also fascinating so do not forget to do your research.You do not need a tour for this attraction, and tickets can be purchased right in the front.
Do not miss. Iconic Russian Church. Unbelievable and ornate, and you can appreciate its beauty regardless of denomination.

amazing mosaics, interesting history. not a long visit needed, but history and architecture amazing. The mosaics are fantastic. Church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated and was dedicated in his memory by his son. Ransacked and looted in Revolution, used as a morgue in WWII and then after a vegetable warehouse, what a waste. Finally restored as a museum, not a church anymore.
Outside view only. I was disappointed we weren't able to go inside. The outside was beautiful. We were on a DenRus tour that did not include going inside.
Atmospheric. This church isn't just visually arresting on the outside - the interior is freshly restored and well worth seeing.
Nice mosaics inside (about Rub 250). A small but cute church. Different from the others. Well worth a trip inside if your not on a tight budget.
Don't miss. Unbelievably beautiful. Most spectacular church and a highlight of our visit. Intricate work. Reasonable entry cost
Spectacular Church. This church is just a nice, if not better than St Basil's in Moscow. Make sure you read up on it's interesting back story.

Beautfiul on the outside. Our tour did not allow us to go inside, but the architecture on the outside is just magnificent! Looks like a candy coated church, but it's all tile and decorations. Take lots of photos because you don't want to miss a piece when you look at your photos when you get home. There is also an eternal flame burning on the property too to honor the dead.

Stupendous. Every bit as beautiful as it's photos tell you. Amazing variety of decoration outside and in. If you don't have time or inclination to visit ABC. Just do a walk around...even the wrought iron work in the fencing is amazing... (My significant other says it is steel work as it us welded, and evidently that us even more impressive metallurgically!!)
Beautiful - inside and out. A must to visit when in St Petersburg but be warned it can be very very crowded as the interior is relatively small and many many people visit.

can't imagine St. Petersburg without this place. You can't imagine St. Petersburg without this place as you can't imagine Russia without onion domed churches. It definitely worth dropping in and dropping by. It is build on the place where the Emperor Alexander the Second was killed so they call on Spilled Blood. Both exterior and interior of this church are impressive and immense. Unfortunately they charge some small fee to get in, but it worth paying (around 5eu i suppose) inside it is decorated in gold and mosaics. Highly recommended to see if you are in St. Pete!
Almost another St Basil's Cathedral. Fantastic exterior that can be photographed from any side and a very ornate interior that one is allowed to photograph with out a flash.

A WORK OF ART. Even atheists will enjoy what I think is the most spectacular of all the St. Petersburg churches. Lovingly restored (it took nearly 25 years) it's a work of art both inside and out. Millions of hand-set tiles, rather than oil paint) create the seemingly endless mosaics that stretch from floor to ceiling. If you see only ONE church in St. Petersburg, THIS is one. BREATHTAKING.

Don't let the name fool you. If you can look beyond the crowds you will see biblical art work that I have never seen equaled in such mass. The colorful onion domes are outdone by the colorful majesty found within the church. As an art lover I was overpowered by sheer beauty of this cathedral. Don't miss it!
Nice. It was an interesting church and colorful. Did not go inside. The church makes beautiful pictures for the family to remember and look back at.

Amazing!!!. Must see! I was breathless of the beauty of the mosaics inside the church. It's a museum now. It has most wonderful decorations and unique optical details to look at. There is also a place where the Emperior Alexander the Second was killed (that's why it's called on Spilled Blood). Excursion in Russian is included in the price of the entrance ticket. The most colorful cathedral inside and outside. Recomment to visit!

Beautiful outside crowded inside. Beautiful outside crowded inside this amazing ice cream like church is a must. There is some disappointment when entering since there are too many people inside and the feeling is if a market but the ealk tobthe church and the scenary is a must see !

The art of Bible stories and figures. The art in this church is amazing. Everywhere you look there is a mural depicting a bible story or figure or saint. It was fun trying to figure out the different stories.
Breathtaking. This has to be my favourite cathedral ever. It is incredibly bright and full of light, from the outside view of the multicoloured cupolas to the wonderful mosaics inside.
You Need to Visit. Great experience you have to visit this Church to appreciate all there is and just how amazing a Church can be.
ice cream cake cathedral not an inch of wall is bare of ornate art. Gorgeous Russian icons and amazing atmosphere. There is even a crown of thorns! Crowded though. I liked the whole event.

Well worth the visit. I was on an organised tour that was efficient if a bit regimented, but it was so worth the visit. The attention to detail by the artists, builders, craftsmen and other gifted artisans is the greatest pleasure to behold. I almost didn't care what the tour guide had to say - I could just have stood and stared in wonder for an hour or two. There is no atmosphere of spirituality in the church of course, being such a popular tourist attraction, and the crowds never end. I'm pleased to have seen it and it can't fail to impress even the most jaded of traveller.

Awesome Architecture. The Church was not open on the day that we visited to site; however, it was still a spectacular site to visit. The architecture is amazing and it is a must visit location when visiting St. Petersburg!
Unreal. It simply does not seem real, it just too gorgeous. Generally I don't like churches but I liked this one.

Very impressive. It's a very unique and interesting cathedral for a quick visit. The gold artwork is absolutely amazing. It's interesting walking around and appreciating the fine detail of the artwork. We also enjoyed reading about the diverse history and restoration that the place has gone through.

Fabulous, especially on the outside. This place was gorgeous to look at from the outside. Just look at the pictures. And of course it is better in person. The inside was amazing too, almost entirely covered with mosaics. But nit especially amazing compared to many jaw dropping churches Ive seen around the world. If you are short on time or money and trying to decide between this one and St Isaac's Cathedral, go with St. Isaacs IMHO, unless you happen to be really into mosaics. Definitely stop by the outside of this one still though. Its absolutely incredible. Love that design. But St. Isaacs was a lot more jaw dropping inside to me.

Phenomenal!. The history, design and architecture of this church are all utterly captivating! This church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated and was dedicated in his memory. And it's impossible to describe just how exquisite the mosaic work is. We were so lucky to have visited in winter when the crowds were sparse, because we took our time wandering and examining the entire place. We all know this is a must-see in St. Petersburg, and for very good reason. Read up on the history before you go, because that's just as interesting as the church itself.

Beautiful Church. A beautifully restored and maintained Russian Orthodox church very conveniently located close to other main attractions in St. Petersburg.Well worth the time to tour inside and out (1-2 hours). The admission price is fair and they accept credit cards. There are drinks and food located just behind the church with very friendly sales people and reasonable prices.

The icing on the cake. St Petersburg certainly surprised my wife and I. A city of culture and stunning architecture crowned by the Church of our Savoir on Spilled Blood. A fitting highlight for this wonderful city. Add it to your list - St Peterburg is a truely must see place.

So Good we went again.. We had our first visit to St. Petersburg in August 2011 whilst on a Baltic cruise. We had read about the Church of the Spilled Blood and decided to go as part of a tour excursion.The outside is pretty spectacular but the interior is even better. If you have the time there is information you can read but we were given head sets and a local guide was pointing out the important bits. It does get VERY busy and you do have to shuffle along or get out of the flow of other visitors if you wish to take photos ( NO FLASH) Although we had been in 2011 we went back in 2013 because we wanted to take some more photos and marvel at such a magnificent achievement. Well worth a visit and make sure you take a camera.

Go at night!. This review is just to give a bit of an in'sight' for those who can only visit the church after dark. For some reasons we couldn't avoid, we had to visit at night so we didn't get to go inside the church... But the night view of this church is nothing short of spectacular! Definitely one of the best man-made structure my eyes ever laid upon!

Amazing. We visited the Church of Spilled Blood on a tour. A must see when visiting St. Petersburg. Beautiful architecture, interesting history and awesome photos. The grounds were immaculate, the staff was friendly and there were plenty of souvenirs available at a good price.
Gorgeous!. While I didn't get to go inside as we were on a tour of the city, the exterior of this church was spectacular. A work of art!
So Beautiful!!. What an amazing church! So beautiful - almost unreal. Lots of visitors - very crowded. And we were reminded of pick pockets by our tour guide.

Fantastic tiles and wonderful building. Just an amazing place to go and see. Outside is pretty amazing and then you go in... Just do it and also get the headphone tour as it explains a lot of the details behind why the church came about, why it is as it is and why things are missing. Fantastic piece of architectural art.

Wish I could have seen inside also. What a magnificent looking building. This puts all it her churches if what ever denomination in the shade with its wonderful coloured domes soaring above the city. If only we'd had more time......... Our friends said that the inside was absolutely spectacular - wish we'd made the time to go in.

A standing piece of art and inspiration!. I visited the church not knowing much about it or what I had in store. Approaching the building you can see the colorful spires and the incredible amount of workmanship it took to make a building with this much detail. When you walk in you are start to see what that workmanship and artistic vision really entails. Every square inch of this huge interior space is covered in tiny tiles that make up huge murals that raise up to the ceilings. The amount of time and vision it takes to make a small scale mosaic is impressive... this was just mind blowing. If you make it to the great old city of St. Petersburg, I recommend you give this a stop.

Caught me off guard. Saw this incredible place and had a hard time leaving it. I could have stared at the walls for days. The whole place was almost incomprehensible, the labor of incredible magnitude and beauty, and such a spiritual essence. Saw many things in St Petersburg, I have been there twice and this is one of my favorite places. If you are anywhere near here, seek it out, go there. Everyone does Peterhof etc but this is top of the list for me.

Beautiful. we enjoyed visiting this church - we did not go inside but most days we would come and sit outside in the sun, enjoying the pace of life around the church and looking at the beautiful architecture

Amazing place . One of the most beautiful church I saw it and the most attractive , near it is a garden then there is some art show is done there and it is not working in Monday as I knew , it is near the Main Street novobrosky and nice view from near it
Awesome. Probably is the most beautiful church in Russian style in all country. Those impressed with St. Basil's (Moscow) will not be disappointed, I'm sure. You can't miss it.
Truly amazing. We thought St Basil's in Moscow was good.This was that one step above in terms of presence, ambience and quality.

So beautiful. Absolutely incredible. The outside is probably one of the most recognized landmarks in St Petersburg but it's well worth paying the entrance fee and going inside. I have never seen mosaic-work like it - some areas are still being restored - but so beautiful - I felt hypnotized and could have stayed there the whole day! It's impossible to describe - you have to see it for yourself.

Gorgeous Church. This church is gorgeous both inside and out. The colourful domes are such a delight to see from afar, but even more so when you get closer to the building. I was also really impressed with the colourful and intricate mosaics made of semi-precious stones inside.Some tours may only include an external visit so if you want to see the inside, make sure it is included.

A Must See. Even if you've seen 100 Russian Cathedrals, this is one you should absolutely NOT miss. The exterior is an amazing feat of construction and the interior mosaics have to be seen to be believed. The Cathedral was extensively damaged during WW2 but has been painstakingly renovated (see the info on display near exit). It took 14 years to reconstruct the mosaics and wow, what a great job they've done. Tiny tiles cover the entire interior walls, ceilings and pillars and form beautiful biblical scenes. Try not to visit on a Friday or weekend however if you have to go then, don't despair. Russians love this place as much as tourists, so prepare for a crowd. Ignore them all and enjoy the beauty and workmanship of the place. In the forecourt at the rear along the canal there are souvenir stalls offering anything you're looking for. They're sometimes willing to bargain a bit so give it a try. Because of the sheer number of visitors you should probably watch for pickpockets here but we had no problem

An incredible church. Go to the church, it is amazing inside and out. The onion domes are incredible to look at it. They almost tore it down during the U.S.S.R time. It is incredible that it was not damaged during the war.
Spectacular. Spectacular external construction with multi-coloured domes, internal religious scenes are all done with mosaics. Well worth seeing.
Unbelievable!. Beautiful, everyone who visits St.Petersburg must see it. I love the beauty of this church, history and the fact that it was renovated after the fall of Soviet Empire.
Incredible Church. This Church is a Must See, interesting both inside and out. There is a section where you can see the stages of the refurbishment which is very interesting.

Most beautiful mosaics I have ever seen.. This cathedral is an amazing part of Russian history, certainly worth the $8 fee. If I could do it again I would get the Audioguide, though I don't know if it is English.

Magnificent. This church is spectacular inside and outside and has a fascinating history. It was built to honour Tzar Alexander 11 who was assassinated on the site thus calling it 'Spilled Blood'. The part of the street where the assassination took place is enclosed within the walls of the church and the site of the murder is marked by a chapelThe principal architect chosen to build this church was Alexandrovich Parland and cost about 4.6 million roubles. The outside was designed to mirror St Basils in Moscow. Both inside and outside features about 7000 square metres of mosaics and the beautiful onion domes are covered with bright enamels.Again we were there with a group, had headset, however, we were hurried through as it was extremely busy. Still well worth the trouble and we were able to take many photos.
Amazing architecture!. Even though we did not go inside this is a wonderful building to see. From the spires to the mosaics and colours, this would db a vision of a Russia most Westerners would have.

Beautiful Inside and Outside. As spectacular as this church is on the outside, the inside is very impressive too. Thanks to our excellent tour guide from SPB Tours, we learnt about the fascinating history of this church. We visited in the afternoon so the sun was not conducive to taking pictures from the front. But as our guide said, we had fantastic lighting when we exited on the opposite side and got some wonderful pictures of the beautiful domes of the church. Definitely a highlight of the many things we saw / visited in St. Petersburg.

Must See Highlight. This church has a fascinating history and is absolutely beautiful inside and out. Inside are mosiacs, souvenir shops, and an overview of the renovation of the church. It was incredibly crowded inside, as it was the afternoon and the area is relatively small. I would recommend exploring the inside but try to go before the tourist buses arrive. The exterior is breathtaking and provides some great photo ops. Definitely worth a stop while visiting St Petersburg.

Beautiful and Unique. The sun was wrong for good views and we didn't have time to go inside, but the exterior was very unique. If I were to go back to St. Petersburg, this would be on the list of places to go - and give it the time it deserves.

More. The Church of Our Savior on the Spilled Blood is a very Russian Orthodox-style church. It was built where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. There is a "red blood spot" inside, supposedly from the assassination, but as guides explain, it never darkens, and stays red. Hmmmm....sounds like it keeps repainting itself, or so they say.Beautiful architecture. The colored spires, so Russian, so classic it's like what you imagine and see on travelogs. Fantastic!
One of the most Beautiful Churches. One of our top highlights during our visit! Quintessential Russian Architecture site. Lots of people flowing through on tours. Exquisite mosaics abound.

Well worth spending an hour or so here.... This is a very interesting place to visit due to its history and mosaic tiling. It's easy to get around in an hour or so. The audio recording is an extra 200rubles and well worth it.
Great monument to Czarist history. While we did not go in, we got out of the bus, learned the history behind this church and enjoyed the intricate design. Excellent attraction.

Inside the Church of Blood. The first thing to note is how many staff there all over the place. It is a fascinating Church and well worth visiting. It is fairly compact and totally covered from head to foot with paintings, murals etc ~ Best to go when it is not too busy so you have chance to take better photos.
Must Visit. Lovely cathedral. Great for taking photos and very central. A place you should visit. Great also for people watching.

Exotic Splendor. This cathedral is beautifu and exotic to the Western eye with it's inlaid color and onion domes. Inside are beautiful religious mosaics that if I remember correctly were completed elsewhere and assembled here, and the church was built in about 20 years--which is amazing. (This is what I recall the guide saying, if I remember it correctly.) The mosaics are fantastic and much moredurable in the time of candle smoke. A site not to be missed in any visit to St. Petersburg.
Crowded. A nice place to see but very crowded. The historical information about this church is impressive. Learn about it before your visit. I would spend my time at Peterhof or other large venues.

Magnificent, crowded. Striking intricate exterior. Beautiful mosaic interior and marble floor. Site of Alexander 2's assination marked. Not much in English. Get an audio guide. Admission is 250 rubles, audio guide extra. Smallish interior so gets very crowded with tour groups. Lovely golden iconostasis. This is the church you associate with pictures of st petersburg. Not to be missed. Many restaurants and shops nearby. Also closeby is area to get a canal boat tour which I recommend. One hour for 500 rubles seemed pretty standard rate for boat of 10-12 people.
If you only see one building in St Petersburg. This is the most amazing Russian looking cathedral! And it is really stunning inside. It will cost about 250 RUB to enter.

Superb. From outside it is superb and from inside even better. I have never seen mosaic of this quality or extent as is inside this church. From out side it is fabulous. And what a history! A perfect photo opportunity and a must visit.
Fascinating. Very interesting - our Guide gave a thorough and detailed explanation of why the Church was so named.
Don't miss this!. I have never seen anything quite like this - it is staggeringly beautiful, the whole of the interior is covered with mosaics in the form of icons - astounding!
AMAZING! YOU CAN'T MISS IT!. The most beautiful church I've ever visited in my life! I simply don't have words to describe it! YOU MUST GO!

Amazing. A fabulous, highly decorated, onion spired church in the beautiful city of St Petersburg. We walked through the park and iron gates to the most breath taking church I have ever been into. One word of warning, protect your valuables as pickpockets are everywhere

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This is probably the most photographed attraction in St. Petersburg. No wonder, as it is just absolutely beautiful, and your photographs will look just like you have seen in so many travel magazines. The tour inside was also very informative and interesting due to the nature of the murder that took place inside. It is no wonder that this is a top attraction.
Seriously impressive architecture. Well with a visit. The stuff of fairy tales to look at outside. Amazing what the Russians have done to care for and restore this place. An hour should do it.
Beautiful!. Incredible church to visit, amazing architecture and work inside and out, one of my favorite sites. This is a Must See place!

If you only have time for one thing in St Petersburg . . .. make it this one. The outside features the iconic brightly colored onion domes, but it turns out that's only the beginning. The inside is - believe it or not - even more spectacular.
An impressive Church. It is amazing from the outside, the architecture is something special and the atmosphere inside is moving, the mosaics are amazing.

HAVE YOU EVER FELT SMALL?. Alexandre the II was quite a character. He was murdered by a group of anarchists called Narodnics on his way to announce the new constitution. For his Church they even changed the embankment of the Neva river. It is on the classic tourist itinerary so you won't miss it. Only the gold will make you feel very poor. Get out and you are rich again.

An Iconic Cathedral. Saw its pictures most often when flipping through some books or magazines talking about Russia. We stopped at a nearby park to have a best angel to take its photos before visiting it. Since the site was built around a Tsar’s murder spot, it landed such a bloody name despite such a beautiful structure. The interior is even more stunning than its exterior, a show case of how excessive the Russian Imperial family can be.

The Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood is Beautiful!. This church is one of the most beautiful Orthodox churches in Russia. It's filled with colorful detailed decorations which includes huge mosaics and ceramic works of art.

well worth a visit. the exterior is striking in design and features you have to photo graph it! But inside it is quite incredible the whole place is filled from floor to ceiling with wonderful mosaics depicting scenes from the life of Jesus Christ well worth a visit.

Classic architecture. Stunning artwork and architecture on the bank of the canal. You could photograph it from so many different angles. Not as old as some (1865) but still a lovely building with a story to tell.

Awesome church views. This is a must see in st Petersburg similar to st basil's in view but also worth a view. Didn't go inside as there was a charge. Walked all around it and even the surrounding fence was beautiful. Just go and stare at it. That's all you need to do!

Gorgeous. This is what I think about when I think about traditional Russian cathedrals. Ornate bobbles decorating the tops of the cathedral, gilding, bright colors, interesting shapes and Jesus and the different scenes. Really with a visit.
Church of the Spilled Blood. If you have made your way to St Petersburg, then this is a must see .... You don't have to spend a great length of time here, but what time you do will be rewarded.
Looks great. Well we were all churched out so did not go in, great from the outside! Onion domes similar in style to St Basil's in Moscow

Has to be seen to be believed!. Whilst visually appealing on the outside, I have to confess I probably prefer St Basil's in Moscow. However, inside is a completely different story. The interior artwork will take your breath away. The whole church is decorated with mosaic pictures. It looks stunning and the attention to detail is amazing. This is also the resting palace of the remains which were apparently recovered of Tsar Nicholas II, his family and servants.

Amazing mosaics. This church is beautiful from the outside (it rivals st Basil's in moscow for beauty I think) and is pretty amazing on the inside too with it's mosaics. Every surface is covered- walls floor and roof! It won't take long to get around but be prepared for lots of people and some jostling!
an interesting place. This is a very beautiful church, especially inside. An excursion is included in your ticket it is not long, but intesesting.
Amazing. The pictures do not do justice to the gold and gilt on the walls. You have to see it to believe it. It is a good example of the excesses of the Tsars and why the peasants revolted.

Stunning Inside and Out. Outside, it is the most beautiful church in St. Petersburg - and in the world!. Inside, the decor was amazing. This church was built on the site of the assassination of Czar Alexander II. Some say that it is a monument, but to me it is a church.A MUST SEE IN THIS CITY.

Better Than St Basils Cathedral!. OK this is probably going to skew the St Basil's appeal, but this Cathedral was hand over fist top of my list to see first. The exterior is exquisite and absolutely glows in beauty. It commemorates the location where Alexander II was assassinated by terrorists in 1881 ( after 6 prior attempts, the 7th, being the final). Given the year of his death, the main dome was designed to stand 81 meters tall.This cathedral has so much lure behind it, it's just more enchanting than one can stand. It quite recently underwent 27 years of restoration during which, (according to Marina Zhdanova's book :Alternative Petersburg--we found this book in the Singer Building for sale and is a recommended purchase) the Cathedral was supported by wooden support pillars. When they were taken down in 1991, it was the year that the Soviet Union saw its collapse. There are supposedly other important dates in Russian history that are associated by icons within the building. Now, how cool is that?The interior is just mesmerizing. I really could have spent days in there just meditating and letting myself let the spirits of history into my soul. Many people were in there receiving communion and lighting their memorial candles. It contains over 7000 square feet of mosaic murals on its walls. AND! You are allowed to photograph in there, so be prepared for this treat.For you cats lovers: It seems that most of the Cathedrals in St. Petersburg we visited had a patron cat, so you can have some fun trying to find them. The one in "Spilled Blood" sort of found me without me searching it out.Tips: We went later in the day when a lot of the tour buses cleared out, so there were no lines and fewer people. Also, if you are looking for gifts, they have a small gift shop, but they have some nice items (non-religious too) that were classier than the street venders, fairly priced, and whom I trusted to use my credit with.
Awesome!. Amazing cruise to Russia with a visit to this church. Do not miss this experience. The saving of the spilled blood was such a memorable event and we had never seen this before.

St. Basil's with a Gorgeous Interior. This church, built in 1883, resembles St. Basil's in Moscow on the outside, but its interior stands out for the blue backgrounds of the columns and the incredible mosaics. Not to be missed on a visit to St. Petersburg.

The most outstanding church in St Petersburg. This church is exactly what you think of when you think of Russian Orthodox churches, but it is even more unusual and intriguing to see it in reality than any picture you've seen of it. The domes are visible from different part of the city, they have different colours and textures and the red brick walls are also decorated with stunning mosaics. On the inside, there are about 6500 square metres of mosaics in excellent condition. The entrance fee is a mere 250 rubles, less than $10. It's definitely worth it to get an audio guide for another 100 rubles, you get a bit of history about the church, the site and a detailed explanation of the church interior.There is also a small display showing how the church was restored after it was pronounced an historic site, very interesting.Definitely a must see when is St Petersburg.
Beautiful. Stunning inside and out. We would highly recommend visiting . You do not need a guide. Try to avoid going in at the same time as large groups if possible .

Beautiful church,....commemorating site where Alexander II was shot. Outside most beautiful church in St. Petersburg. Inside, decor was amazing. Church was built on the site of the assassination of Czar Alexander II.
A must-see. A must-see in St. Petersburg. The church is very Russian in style and has a lot of history and character.
Stunning. We only saw the outside of this church, but WOW. We took a nice walk along the canal to see this and it was worth the walk.

Stunning. This chuch is just stunning. The colorful domes are fabulous. The inside is as beautiful as the outside. Such rich history and beauty. No tour of St. Pertersburg wouldbecomplete without stopping here.

Absolutely Stunning . The Church Of the Spilled Blood is both a historical monument and a work of art . Inside the church there is not a single painting ; the walls are covered with stunning mosaics . The site of the assassination is marked by a special chapel and there is a area you can still see the blood stains . The history and mosaics make this a must see landmark in St Petersburg . Please note it is very crowded and give yourself ample time

A mix of Gaudi and Russian revivalism. Well, not really Gaudi, but the mosaics and super saturated colors put you immediately in mind of Gaudi's designed Cathedral in Barcelona.......this Church was built for Alexander the great and has not had an actual service - apparently concerts here are magnificent - a feast for the eyes and hard not to be blown away by the art. Admission fee is money well spent. Beware the tour groups.

ICONIC RUSSIAN CHURCH. Beautifully restored Russian Orthodox Church and a blaze of colour both inside and outside due to the use of mosaics & different minerals. Topped off with the onion domes in gold paint & more mosaics.It is a gem & a photographers delight -so many different shots are possible and we were lucky to have a sunny day with only the occasional cloud which made the photos spectacular. The inside is majestic in typical Russian orthodox way -so much colour and every wall is covered with various biblical scenes. A must see when you visit the city.
Memorial. What an architectural memorial for Alexander II like many things in St Petersburg quite amazingVery colourful with amazing spires & built over Catherine's Canal
Amazing mosaic. Stunning interiors, amazing exterior but it is very crowded in high season. Also try to see it lit at night form the canal

WOW. I had no chance to go inside, but the exterior is just WONDERFUL! excellent. with the sun shining and a blue sky - you'll get a splendid picture. Colourful, clearly stands out from other building in the city. a real gem

A World Heritage worth a visit. We stopped at this Church during our visit with the Cruise Ship (Royal Princess). We did not visit the interior as it was our last stopped prior to returning to the ship. On that full day of discovery with Princess, we visited a few of the best places, including a stop at this one. The building is magnificient. It took 24 years to build and finish, from 1883 to 1907. This is definitely a place you would want to stop if visiting St. Petersburg. We were actually glad it was the last point of our day as this is quite an icon for the city. The structure of the building, the canal on its right side, and the beautiful little park are simply a great discovery. If you get a chance to visit the inside, you might want to take it. This is the only deception that we have had with our stopped, is that we could not go in to take a couple of photos (not sure that they were allowed anyway). If you are like us, you will definitely call this area a "click point"... where you won't stop take photos of this beautiful World Heritate structure. Even a stop there is an easy way for everybody, even those with limitations. The view is something you will remember for the rest of your life. Go for it!

The hordes the hordes. Iconic so you have to do it. It is amazing and worth doing, but do it when you are feeling patient. The selfie brigade are out in force. It is great inside too - almost as crazy as the nuts onion towers outside!

Most Magnificent Church other than Sagra Familia. We were amazed at how huge the church was and when we went inside expected it to be mutilple floors- it wasn't, it was made up of huge murals of Christ and dthe Madinna. Took my breath away and the significance in history makes you appreciate the relative peaceful times we have grown up in. Bucket list worthy!!

Very colourful!. We visited in the evening as it is open until 10.00pm in the summer. The outside is very beautiful and the mosaics inside are extremely colourful . It really takes your breath away when you walk inside. This is where Alexander II was fatally wounded.
Beautiful & Masterly crafted mosaic work. This amazing church is masterly crafted with beautiful mosaic intricately done , soulful & peacefull
Magnificient building. It is magnificent, colorful, and well built. Excellent historic site to visit, we like it. Just need to watch out for many pick pockets around this area.

Stunning. Go inside and push your jaw back up. Absolutelly stunning interiour....as on the cover of the lonely planet guide for St. petersburg...definitely worth to experience...outside view probably the most photographed sight in St. petersburg.
the spilt blood. this cathedral is spectacular!!!! everything is hand made for the walls, and none are actually painted.....they are all mosaic, and unbelievably good!!!!!
worth a visit. built in a historical russian style in a beautiful gold draped onion dome. the church is being cleaned in the afternoon. also, the entrance fee is a little bit more in the evening.

Stunning. Despite not being open on Wednesday (always closed), I still could appreciate the beauty and architecture of the place. We could only see the outside on this day.
Definitely one of the highlights of our trip to St. Petersburg and worth the visit.
Please make sure you visit this church on your trip.
Great Church. This church is stunning both inside and out. The history is also very interesting. The decoration is absolutely amazing. It is a must see in the city.
Worth a journey. Amazing decoration both inside and out. Crowded with tour groups but be patient - they move. Open late, which is a plus

Just beautiful. This church I'd beautiful, huge and architecturally gorgeous. While there is
so much poverty, yet these churches are built with so much gold. The detail
Is unbelievable. There is so much talent surrounding this church, you will
Want to take allot of pics.
Amazing. The architecture was amazing and us truly a must for any visitor. I would recommend having a guide to truly enjoy this wonderful church.
A beautiful place. If you want to see something good, go there, it's very old and very authentic. It is a central location, so you can go by foot from there to meny more sites...

YOU CAN'T MISS SEEING THIS MEDIEVAL ARCHITECTURE. This has to be one of the finest architectural splendors in the world. It is referred to as medieval architecture in the spirit of the Romantic period.It features many colourful onion domes that may be seen from great distances in St. Petersburg.The church is striking as it contains over 7500 square meters of Mosaics. This is the most in the entire World.Interestingly the Russian Orthodox church is built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated and it is dedicated to his memory.It's especially stunning at night when it is all lit up.
No words can describe. Wow!!!!! This church has multicoloured spires typical of the Russian orthodox churches, but these are immense and breathtaking as is the interior, not to be missed!
beautiful. The church spiers were gorgeous. The inside had murals everywhere. It is one of the must sees in St. Petersburg
Bizarre, almost cartoonish church. Pretty much unique church with multi-coloured façade and golden domes. Queuing is a pain but worth the time.
Stunning colour. The typical onion domes outside are impressive enough but inside the riot of colour made up from tiny mosaic is a work of art. Very inspirational.

Most beautiful sight in St Petersburg. When we saw the church as we approached it, we stopped in our tracks and stared in awe at the amazing sight in front of us. It was a rainy day but the church still looked awesome. The frescos inside are as breathtaking. This is a must-see in St Petersburg.

beautiful architecture. beautiful edifice with colorful onion-domed spires and ornate interior. History of founding of church also fascinating; so much money spent on edifice, so little spent on peasantry... no wonder
there was an eventual revolution!
One of the most beautiful cathedrals. The mosaic tile work rivals The Vatican. The architecture and history of this edifice should not be missed when you travel to St. Petersburg.

Spilled Blood. This church is beautiful from the outside, and then the inside reveals what must be one of the worlds largest and beautiful collection of mosaic religious art. It can be thoroughly enjoyed with or without guide and is one of St Petersburg's least expensive attractions
very nice chirch. the looks of the church are very nice from the outside but you should not get in as it is not worth the payment

Small but impressive. The church is small, but looks impressive both inside and out. One of the must see sites in St. Petersburg, so check it out yourself. A bit pricy at ~ 350 Rubles, but it's one of a kind.

Beware of pickpockets. This church is a splendor. Extraordinary inside. It is an immense fresco of mosaics. The second biggest in the wolrd. The church is 30 meters high. Good photo ops.BUT- beware of pickpockets (they got me). The scheme is the following: a very very insisting vendor approches you to sell his merchandise .He even pushes you. You are so busy trying to get rid of him that you do not notice a second follow who swiftly open the zipper on your belly pouch and grab your money (this was my situation). Not only they steal you, but they have the nerve to give you back your wallet (empty) making you believe that it was found on the ground.. So be very careful.
Outside and inside are worth it. The outside is breathtaking! Inside much the same, but I preferred outside with the music and a guy playing a saw with a bow :)

Beautiful Architecture and Amazing History. We had seen photos of Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood prior to our trip to St. Petersburg and the photos pale in comparison to being there. This church is absolutely magnificent. The architecture, the colours, the history and the location make this church an absolute must see. When you walk around the exterior, you can see where it was hit by bombs during the Second World War, when it was being used as a food storage facility. The history of this church is truly fascinating and it will take your breath away with it's beauty.A note of caution, it seems pickpockets really like to target their victims at churches here.

Absolutely must see. Stunning architecture on a stunning day. This church epitomised what I expected in Russian heritage building and didn't disappoint. Great photo opportunity. Would recommend taking the tour inside as the history and story is very interesting. The mosaic work is in some cases very fine and very detailed. Don't miss this jewel.
Great mosaics. This church looks amazing from the outside but is also very impressive on the inside. The restoration of the mosaics and the guilding of the statues/altars etc is just breathtaking.
wonderful exterior. I liked the exterior and surroundings. You need to walk around all of the church. It is possible to go inside but I do not know what it is like
MOSAIC & ENAMELS. Simply unbelievable: all the walls are covered by mosaics...and the enameled roof...impossible to miss it!
COSB a must see!. Truly an amazing attraction - the colourful mushroom domes and the inside is just a wonderful site - if you have time this is a must see!

magnificant. beautiful, inside and out, thousands of mosaics, stunning
do not pass this by, nice to sit in park or by river near by
lovely church. We were amazed at the beauty of this church. All hand laid mosaic tiles line the entire inside of the church. It was well worth the small entrance fee.

Beautiful inside and out. Amazing to think that assassinations and terrorism existed all those years ago.
The mosaic interior was stunning.
Built on the site of Tsarist murder!. Fascinating church just off Nevsky prospect. See the cobbled street where Alexander II was assassinated!

Magnificent. It is worth seeing. It will take your breath away how magnificent it is inside. It is run by the church, and if you are looking to an icon, then this is a good place I found. Reasonable and a good variety.

Beautiful. Church is beautiful from the outside but inside is equally beautiful. It was 250 roubles entrance, if you don't have roubles they will not accept any other currencies, some people in front of us in queue had to use credit cards. If you have time, do go inside, the mosaics are stunning. It is located beside a canal as well very picturesque.
Outside looks very special. We chose the wrong day and couldn't get inside. The tiled exterior is unusual and very distinctive. Located on a canal too.
Beautiful and breathtaking. It is an amazing sight. Takes your breath away when you see its for the first time. The colours are so bright.
a splendid example of the onion domed Russian church. i only saw this church from the outside as there wasn't time to go in, it was so beautiful was dissapointed not to go inside.
Spectacular. Fantastic church with an amazing history. Easy to access - really close to the Russian Museum, plan to visit both at the same day

Wonderful place - well worth a visit. This Cathedral is wonderful from the outside with its onion domes. It is what to us seems typically Russian. Well worth seeing the inside too with all the mosaics and the spot where one of the Tsars, Alexander, was killed - hence the name.
Amazing. Part of a 2 day tour with Alla tours - so not sure of the entry price - but surely there is nothing like this anywhere else - so MUST be worth a visit. Mosaics are amazing.

A masterpiece !. There is no equivalent to this church ! Once you step close to it, you will be fascinated by the colors and the beauty of it's decoration. A step closer and you will enter into a world that is filled with artistic paintings and gold finishing. The inside of this church is something truly out of this world, very interesting and will definitely leave you shocked ! Must visit
Worth Entry. One of the prettiest churches in the world. The mosaics are extraordinary and the history tragic-typical Russia.

No wonder the Romanoffs had it coming. The excess you witness executed by the Romanoffs in St Petersburg has to be seen to be believed. This church was built in memory of the czar who was assassinated after abolishing serfdom in Russia. All I can say is the church is awesome and those serfs have a long memory!

Never miss this one. Inside and outside. Striking from the outside, and many people leave without going inside as I and some of my friends did.. but when we heard about the stunning mosaic work inside, we gave up our lunch to visit it from the inside and were so glad we did...the intricacy of the mosaic work is unbelievable and every inch of the walls is covered with this beautiful work
Historical Church. Colorful, Historical ChurchThe church has interesting story before go you should read story. They give guiding service inside the church.
A TREASURE FOR THE WORLD. All I can say is that being inside of the Church is like being inside a jewel box. it is wonderful. If you go to St. Pete, do not miss going inside.

Breathtaking from outside and inside. The church is incredible: imperial, colourful, huge and full of stories.Recommend to visit it after reading about it in order to appreciate it in the real dimension.
Visit before 17:30. The fee increases after 6pm and there is a technical break between 17:30 and 18:00. The ticket can be combined with a visit of a stone museum.
Church of Our Savior. You will need about 1 hour to see both the inside and outside of this church. Suggest you read up on the history prior to your visit. Get the audio guide
Amazing mosaics. Fantastic restoration. Beautiful mosaics. Big crowds, beware pickpockets. Stunning altar 'gates'. Certainly worth visiting.

Restored and stunning!. Right in the centre of the city, this amazing church has been restored to its former glory and it is genuinely amazing. Free for students to get in and about £5 for everyone else (Dec 2013), it's totally worth the stop and has signs to explain the interior in English.
Amazing Color. This church was beautiful. The colors and architecture. The inside is amazing. Have a strong flash for the inside.

Beautiful church. The road up to the church along the canal is a nice setting for a beautiful church. The outside is very striking and has some resemblance on the church on Red Square in Moscow. The inside is stunning and is quite unique. There is a gift shop in the church where you can buy souvenirs. Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing Architecture. I love to travel and i love Architecture. This place is awesome. Design so intricate. Lovely. Too bad we run out of battery we weren't able to take pictures inside. It's as beautiful.

Restored masterpiece!. The difficult history is hardly noticeable when visiting this church. A magnificent spectacle and the history reveals itself when listening to the audio guide. Wonderful exterior and the interior is even more amazing.
Wonderful. Sure place to visit. Marvelous interiors, Extravagant Aura, Great history behind the building and good management.
Visit to this Church. Very interesting and at 250 rubbles entrance well worth it. Lots of colour inside. It will not take long to see inside and take a few pictures.
Beautiful!. I absolutely loved this church - I'm not too much into architecture, but seeing all the detail mosaic work was just incredible!

Favorite part of St. Petersburg. Simply amazing architecture. You can see this sight from many angles, and notice different parts such as the murals. I loved taking photos from different parts of the city where you could still see the steeples over the roof.

Jewel in the Crown. This was my first ever visit to an Russian Orthodox Church and I was astounded by its beauty and meticulous craftsmanship in the construction and decoration. From the outside the colourful and golden domes touched on by the suns rays,the inside a mosaic of colour and gold truly splendid, well worth the 5€ entrance fee. It is possible to ride past it on one of the canal rides to get a different perspective of the building. A must see!

Breath Taking both inside and out. We are not familiar with Russian Orthodox Churches and this was our first visit to one.The place from the outside is very picturesque with the best view obtained as you approach from Nevsky Prospekt with the canal between you and the Church.
