Inside the church is equally breathtaking with all the walls and ceilings covered in Mosaics.The outside view is known to any who have research Saint Peterburg as a destination but the inside has so much I can only say go see it.

Amazing exterior, even more amazing interior. Much like most of St Petersburg, this is another stunning piece of architecture and decoration. Endless amounts of artwork covering every single part of the building. Just plain beautiful.Much like most toursit destinations, be aware that it is very busy, and lots of tour groups bustling about.
As beautiful as St Basile in Moscow. outdoor Church like St Basil of Moscow. The interior has been renovated and you will see beautiful mosaics.
See it to believe it. Unbelievable architecture and beauty. A wonder of the world in my eyes. You really cannot miss this as you won't see something like this in any other country
Divine. This church is even more outstanding inside than outside, just beware you don't go on a Wednesday as it is closed!
very nice maintained church. I liked the way the Russian treat their traditional buildings. Is was so well maintained. I did not bother to try to go inside, but the outside was very impressive...

Love those colorful domes.. I highly recommend going inside to see the mosaics. We only enjoyed the outside, since this was our second visit. There is so much detail in the architectecture, I wish that they offered a tour in a cherrypicker so I could get closer.
Mosaic delight. Cannot believe the time and skill involved in this restoration. An amazing structure and work of art wherever you look

A must see. In my opionon a must see in St. Petersburg. The church is amazing and it is in the city center so if you are not totally blind you can't miss is. The construction is impressive. But be aware of pick pockets close to the church, when I was there they almost got my cell phone

just perfect!!!!!!. from wherever you look this cathedral you want to take photo ....is one of the most wonderful places in the World which you must visit,very nice, in the heart of saint petersburgclose to this there is a book store with a small cafe on...very nice place, called cafe singer with good service and excellent dessertsfor me one of the unforgetable places which i have ever visit
I wouldn't go is new 1900. Is to new, terrible mixture of styles. Disneyland look. If I'ld new it I had not go. New mosaics for me it isnot worth going.

Amazing -- make sure you see the inside. Many tours by cruise companies just drop you off for a few minutes to take photos. While the outside is impressive, the inside is just dazzling, with mosaics everywhere. It will take your breath away. By far the most impressive church we experienced in Russia -- not the oldest or the most ornate, but the impact on your senses is long-lasting.
Amazing. Absolutely amazing to see. The colours are something else. Definitely not to be missed when in St Petersburg

A Magnificent Church/Building. How else do you headline such a Church/Building? This Church is magnificient in every way and a must see for anybody visiting St.Petersburg. It's visited by all tourists to St.Petersburg so get there early, it's easier then to see everything inside the building.

Amazing mosaics. This Church was the First One we Visited in Saint Petersburg.
I loved the Color Blue covering the walls and the mosaics. This is a superb Church.

Impressive. A must when in SPB.
Now, Do *not* miss seeing the interior of the church.
I went six day ago and still haven't been able to take the interior of the church out of my mind.
Spectacular interior. The walls and ceiling are jsut filled with golden fresco of the orthodox style. Worth the visit bettre than the other churches.
Fascinating place. The outside is worth a trip on its own. We paid to go inside and although small it is fascinating. I particularly liked the way the mosaics had been restored.o

Breath-taking. I've never been so awe-struck nor so overwhelmed at any Church as I was here. The grandeur, artistry, ceiling, beauty were positively inspiring. I was incredibly lucky to arrive during a service, when the Choir was singing and the Priests doing a service. The Church was teeming with those who came to pray and give thanks, which added to its beauty. If you have only time for ONE Church, this is the one to see.
A double WOW. Unbelievable mosaics both inside and outside Understandably the #1 attraction in St Petersburg. A must see. The best morning view is from the footbridge toward the Singer bldg.

always a cultural and treat for the eye. come early in the day for the best light and less visitors inside and out. on the tour of hop-on hop-off busline.walk over to russia museum in michailovsky palace and enjoy the splendor of old russia.
A Must See. Get your camera out! Well worth a visit. Beautiful exterior and amazing interior. Decoration inside all of mosaics in different styles.

Really beautiful. A pleasure to see and beautifully decorated throughout. There is a charge to get in but it definately is worth a visit. The inside matches the beauty of the outside. When we wnet in April it was not too busy.

Fascinating. The exterior of this church, with its typical Russian cupolas, makes taking photos' irresistible. The walls of this church are covered with several 1,000 sq yds of mosaics, which are fascinating. There is also a beautiful marble floor. The historical reason why this church was built is sad - hence the name. It can get very crowded.

it's more marvelous outside than inside. it's an unfortunate monument to Alexander II. It had been built for 40 years, many times was repaired and in XX century was 40 years in scaffoldings. Many people cannot believe that it will be times when citizens of Saint Petersburg are able to see it again. Now it looks very attractive.It stands right on the place where Alexander II was killed.So its history is rather gloomy.
Impressive. A church of mosaics, it was an impressive interior, if a bit expensive. We weren't in there long. It was very crowded.

The interior of the Church is entirely covered with mosaics.. The total area of interior and exterior covered with mosaics is more than 7,000 square meters. An absolute must see on your visit to St. Petersburg.

a dead monument. Although church on Spilled-Blood is one of the most photographed places in SPB, yet inside can be a bit disappointment especially for the price you pay. The mosaics are impressive yes that is true but unless you are a devout Christian or historian once you have seen a couple you have seen them all. Also the fact that it has never served as a place of worship it has no "spiritual " feeling; it is like a monument to a church but not a church. Hard to explain but I prefer places like Isaac's Cathedral or Kazan Cathedral ( both within walking distance) who though not so colourful yet have a soul. that's just my opinion of course others will tell you that it is a must and that the colourful mosaics are impressive, it is just overwhelming - too much for the size of the place....
Stunning. This is one of the most amazing churches I've ever seen. It's compact, but every inch is covered by the most amazing mosaics. Highly recommended.

A Must in St Petes. Absolute gem of a church to visit. Visually appealing from the outside and with a very colourful history. One has to visit the interior to appreciate its beauty. Its been renovated for the past 27 years after it's last use was potato storage-unbelievable!
Amazing. Very colourful interior with some stunning artwork. Doesn't take long to do but it will stay with you.

If you can only pick two churches.... Spent two days touring St. Petersburg, and saw numerous churches from inside and out. Spilled Blood is amazing from every angle. The church interior is decorated with mosaics. The carved brown marble actually looks like wood. The history of the church is very interesting - apparently used for produce storage in Soviet times. Some of the church is still being renovated, but it is still worth a visit. The other church that you must see is St Isaac's.
Bling from the outside. We didn't go in, but it's very pretty from the outside. Try st.petersburg cafe just down the canal for very cheap food and drink at 5star dining.
First taste of Russia. The Cathedral is stunning well worth a visit but go early to see details as it is open 10.30 a.m. and crowds quickly fill the small internal space.

Magnificent Mosiac Church. An absolute must stop when in the former Leningrad, Saint Petersburg, Russia. Start with getting the perfect photo of this colorful onion domed shaped cathedral from across the street. Take a moment and really survey one of the mosaics that are throughout the interior of the Cathedral. The detail and workmanship of each is magnificent. The history and story of this Cathedral also warrants at least a self guided tour with a written guide book. Purchase a religious souvenir in one of the little shops within the Church. Worthy of spending a few hours wandering and learning in the Cathedral. Not many get the opportunity to visit this magnificent Cathedral. Enjoy it if you can!

Wow. Even the best pictures of this don't do it justice. The story behind this beautiful cathedral is truly amazing and the fact that every mosaic tile was placed by hand just make this fantastic feat just even more... well, fantastic. Thus was the best bit of visiting St. Petersburg for me and not visiting it while you're here would be a crime.
Good attraction. This place looks great from the outside. However, for me, I think it was too much. The alter, made from Italian marble was beautify.
amazing exterior. Never a working church, this space has amazing icon art, especially the front facade. Area nearby has some good restos, and better than average souvenir kiosks.

Iconic St Petersburg. An absolute must see... From both the exterior and interior. Interesting history, and details in construction and decoration are awe inspiring. A fun flea market across the street is worth a visit too.
Interesting place for a short visit. The entrance is quite expensive (250 R.) for what you get. However, it is an interesting place for a short visit.

WoW stunning. this is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen and it continues inside the history of it is fantastic- we went in March and there were quite a few people then so in peak time it will be packed and harder to see the beauty inside.

Iconic Russian building. Really look nice inside and outside.Tips: View from behind, from Nevsky side is nicer cause u can see the canal with he building.There is a small flea market in front where you can buy much souvenirs at good price.If you went to the similar church in Moscow, i think you can still enter this one, they are totally different inside.the interior is very nice, worth buying ticket to enter.
Wonderful colours. Great architechture, and very well restored. It's worth the 200 ruble fee to visit inside, the mural walls and ceiling are fantastic.

Impressive...but overdone?. Incredible to look at from the outside. Unusual, colorful, gaudy on the interior. Filled with symbolism and reverence, the Church of our Savior is a must-see. Each and every square inch of wall and column space is filled with intricate, colorful, almost overwhelming amount of composition of images, all created with fine mosaics - an amazing construction. One can only imagine the intense labor that was demanded in order to build this church to commemorate the assassination of Tsar Alexander II.

something huge and wonderfull. if ones you will go to St. Petersburg city you cannot loose this church. It is a true Jewell outside and inside and everything all around is nice... cafè, park, little souvenir shops... there is also a girl that sells is aquarel works, they are beautifull....

Beautiful!. inside the cathedral is very beautiful. Many small interesting details from top to bottom. Consider all the details with incredible enthusiasm. Inside, it is not big. Beautiful image, incredible marble floor. 30 artists worked on the mosaics. There is a special place, where they killed Tsar Alexander II . On this place survived the drops of his blood, and part of the bridge, where it happend.The most beautifull place!Sorry that people write here about the queue and other not importaint things...
A Colourful Oasis!. Wonderful on the outside and amazing on the inside. Really not be missed on your list of things to see. But be aware of the pickpockets outside!

THE BIGGEST MOSAIC IN THE WORLD. You can look at photographs on the internet but there is nothing like being there.It is amazing. Pop in to the adjacent market for your Russian doll purchases, I would recommend the man on the right nearest the entrance his English was excellent and his knowledge of the dolls fabulous. Never pay face value! We visited one stall who reduced price by 2000 rubels because she was cold and wanted to go home!

Exquisite. Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is one of those places you will have seen in movies and heard about from other travellers. When you first spy it just off Nevsky Prospect it will stand out, twinkling in pretty much any light. The seemingly infinite decorative detail as you get closer is remarkable. Take time to walk around the outside and enjoy before heading in. You won't be disappointed. Inside and out it is a vision of loveliness and artistry. I did the audio tour and my friend just wandered with a pamphlet - either way take time out to just look and take it all in. We were lucky it was winter and the crowd and queue was manageable. Pop back after dark and it looks even more magical. There is a lovely three way bridge behind popular with wedding parties. Close by the Russian museum, sure it would be worth a look but we just ran out of time.
Beautiful mosaic. Beautiful on the outside and spectacular on the inside. Look at the mosaics and arches definitely worth a visit. Make sure you see the church from all sides
Beautiful historic church. Wow....we were in awe at this building. The inside is a must see. The admission price is very reasonable as are all the museums we saw in St. Petersburg.

Magnificent Mosaics. Whether you think it is vulgar or beautiful this church is certainly spectacular, and is a magnificent building.Photographs do not do it justice, the designs are excellent and the colours are vibrant, and remember it is entirely mosaics, no paint work at all.. The church will certainly be crowded, but with patience some excellent photographs can be taken. On a guided tour you may well be ushered round fairly quickly but the guides are excellent, we suggest you buy a book e.g “The Saviou r On The Spilled Blood” it contains some text and photographs you can only dream about.

Incredible mosaics cover the inside & out!. A beautiful church one of few buildings in russian style in St Petersburg. Built to commemorate the death of Alexander II, took 27 years to build then and 30 to restore more recently! If you visit St P you must see the church that was intended for destruction by the communist regime and was saved from this by the Nazi's and the start of the second world war. Left to degrade massively and now a beautiful sight inside and out, test yourself (and the kids) by trying and find a non decorated/plain part anywhere inside! Absolutely stunning, apparently takes 1 person 1 year to do 1 m square of mosaic work… there are a lot of years in here. Agree a tour guide really helps get the picture, we used Kate G from toursbylocals and she was amazing and well worth every rouble.

Must-see attraction in St. Petersburg. You must go to see this building, even if you are not that into churches. It has a significant past tied to politics and events in Russian and European history. Plus, the colourful building is very beautiful inside out. There's an entrance fee if you want to enter. Beware of pickpockets.
Stunning interior. Amazing mosaics and fabulous restoration. A 'must visit' in St Petersburg. Best visited with a tour guide to get the full story.
Worthy of a visit. Very small on the inside, but it packs a punch. You can't look in any direction without seeing the mosaics. Beautiful, but busy!

Magnificent. This is a small cathedral, but the most beautiful one i have ever seen in my life.
It is incredible, the amount of work that must have gone into making this building.
It will leave you opened mouthed! A must see in St. Petersburg!

Wow, magnificent, beautiful. This is one spectacular building. The architecture is amazing at every angle. All I can say is thank goodness for the digital camera because I took so many photos.This is a major tourist attraction in Russia so be very carful of pick pockets a muggers. A person in our group was approached by someone pretending to sell postcards and immediately surrounded by a group that picked her pockets, stole the lens right off the camera and tried to cut the camera strap to get the camera. They were very brazen and when people went to help they simply pushed them out of the way. Be careful be alert and do not miss this site

Not to be missed. Irrespective of religion or belief, this is absolutely a must in St Petersburg. I have visited several times and it never diminishes in its beauty or exquisiteness. The attention to detail is stunning, and when you think it was a grain store 70 years ago, just simply wow. The first steps inside and you will be astonished... the outside is beautiful, inside is beyond words, please see it if you are in the city and you will remember it
Wow factor. Definitely worth a visit. Mosaics are huge and very impressive. Far better interior than it's big brother, St Basils in Moscow

words can't even begin to describe. Positively one of the most gorgeous places I have been in my life. The design and colours on the outside are breathtaking and the beauty of the mosaic pieces inside the church cannot be described with words. You must go and see it for yourself. I cannot believe the intricacy of the work put into creating such masterful art pieces. Because these mosaics are dedications to God, the craftsmanship must be impeccable and it most certainly is!
Spectacular. this beautiful church is covered in mosiac Christian paintings which simply takes your breath away. It is stunning even if you are not a Christian.

Amazing! An absolutely must go. If you only have time for visiting one place in Saint Petersbourg, this should be it!The church defies description both inside and outside. Pictures doesn't do it justice either. It is absolutely breathtaking and mind blowing.
Awesom place. One of the most breath taking churches out there. It's architecture and design are beyond amazing and it definitely holds it's place as one of the must-see places in Russia

And you thought that St. Basil's Cathedral was special!. I always thought that St. Basil's Cathedral was something to behold. Well, Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is even more beautiful to view. The outside onion domes are awesome as you can see in the photos. The inside of the Church is filled with beautiful mosiacs. We were told by a former visitor that this was a "must see" and it is. You would never see a church built like this today because the cost of the craftsmanship would be far too high. It is so nice that these places have been maintained for all of us to see. It was re-opened in the late 1990's. Another thing that makes this place so special is the history of it.was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander was assassinated in March 1881.

Simply outstanding. Got your camera with you? Then be prepared to take dozens of pictures of this glorious and beautiful building. Walk away, pass it again and take another dozen. It's that type of place. Make sure you see inside too. Quite stunning.

Very impressiv church.. During the week we spend in St. Petersburg I visited the church three times, always to find the place full of believers. The choir on the balcony in the back of the church sings so beautiful, it's unreal. The atmosphere is solumnly, dignified. An absolute must to see in this beautif city.
breathtaking. One of the most beautiful churches I have seen in my life. All the walls are covered with mosaics, really amazing.

A must-seen!. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited in my life. The style and architecture is outstanding.There is a small fee to pay in order to get inside, once you get in, you will be stunned by the interior.The only downside is the size: from the outside it looked way bigger compared to the inside. But well worth a visit!!!

Picture postcard church. This beautiful church was built on the spot where the Tsar Alexander II was assassinated in 1881. Part of the floor features the actual cobbles where he fell.The outside is stunning with a riot of multi-coloured domes and mosaic biblical scenes.The interior is just as colourful with mosaic walls and a decorative floor made up of many different minerals.This has been extensively restored and there is an interesting exhibition of the restoration work, which took over 20 years, and the materials used.

Not St Basil's, but just as good!. From the outside, this definitely looks a lot like the much more famous St Basil's in Moscow. However, enter and you will find that it is so much more beautiful then St Basil's due to the completely covered walls and ceilings!Mosaics and other artworks completely cover the walls and ceilings to give the inside a memorable and unique look. It's reasonably priced and is most certainly worth entering as it's not just another Church!

Worth a visit. The church is a small building, without much to do unless you have a guide or a guide book (I recommend one of the two as the church has some amazing history that makes it worth the visit.
Most Incredible Church in St. Petes. This church is a must see in St. Petersburg. It is centrally located and near some great shopping and restaurants too.

Beautiful!. Awe inspiring amount of work in this building. Stunning mosaics and beautiful decorations. Not expensive to visit and well worth the entrance fee. Don't expect this to be a long visit though...30 minutes to an hour will be plenty of time. The people outside trying to sell us souvenirs, were a bit of a nuisance but they went away when we were firm about not buying anything.

A wondrous visual confection!. I never realized that the turrets were made of ceramic tile until we actually saw it up close; great commentary vis a vis the information headsets. Not too crowded and a fun tourist market in the street behind it. The history of the Church is well described and documented.

From murder to magnificence... Built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881, this church certainly reflects the iconic image of Russia. The colorful spires and sheer size of this church is a sight to behold.Unfortunately, cannot comment on the interior as was there on a limited time for a cruise excursion. Having been to Moscow old say this church outshines it and worth a look

Breathtaking interior. Once you enter the church and start to look at the walls you suddenly realise that the entire church is covered in mosaics. The time and effort that must have gone into these amazing pictures is mind blowing and is well worth a visit. Worth getting a guide book (in most major languages) just to learn the history of this amazing church.

Church of Our Savior visit. The interior had limited visiting hours the day we went to visit and missed the time deadline.....however, it was worth the time just to see the exterior. The workmanship of the exterior is absolutely fascinating.....a beauty to behold. The colors are breathtaking.

The Best Church in the World. This is probably the best Church we have ever seen. The architecture is breath-taking but nothing prepares you for the interior - awesome! You must visit via the waterway and please please go inside.....
best church in Russia. This is one of the most interesting churchs I have visited (I have been to many). The place is stunning & filled with history. The walls are amazing!

Colourful exterior & mind-blowing interior. Though the inside of this church is not as big as it looks like from outside, all the interior walls are covered with amazing work of mosaics. We didn't care much of the "spilled blood" aspect of this place (the supposed spot where the Tzar was assassinated) but the sheer beauty of interiors worth visiting.

One of the jewels of the city. Wow, this place is spectacular inside and out. The mosaics inside are just amazing. You could spend half a day just viewing them. The outside of course is iconic. This is a must see in St. Petersburg!
Great outlook. Looks beautiful. but so sad that cannot visit as not open 6 Feb 14, but glad to see a couple take pre wedding photos there. Congratulations.

Beautiful from the outside, amazing from the inside. The mosaics are like nothing I have seen. Used because of the harsh weather of Russia they produce a truly unique interior. Get a guide if you can. you would miss so much information if you just walk around. It's currently about 240 rubles to get in. The best outside photo is out the back (no ticket office in your photo). Go this is not to be missed. Breathtaking
A must see, inside out!. Amazing architecture and one of the most stunning mosaics, covering every inch of the walls and ceilings. Worth paying to go inside.

Beautiful!. An exquisite church with so much history. The beautiful facade is amazing and worth a few pictures. Be very careful of pickpockets. The interior is stunning with marble floors, beautiful stained glass, and mosaics. Definitely worth a stop.

Glittering Site. This church is truly a work of art! The outside is colorful and architecturally different on each side. We spent quite a bit of time circling the building to try to get the full scope of the building itself. The inside is full of beautiful jewel-toned mosaics. And by full, I mean every inch of wall space is taken up by mosaics. The alter is also breathtaking with its jewel-encrusted gate. This is one of the most lavish churches I have seen throughout Europe and certainly the most lovely in Russia. We exited off Nevsky Prospect and walked alongside a canal to the church. Halfway to the church is a bridge and we took many photos from this spot. Also, the market behind the church is worth a visit. There was a wide selection of souvenirs at affordable prices.
Mosaics. 'The Savior on Blood' church was built upon the sad place of the murder of the Alexander II by the terrorists. It is incredible with all the interior made up of the mosaics.

Colourful. If you only have time to visit one church in St Petersburg then make sure its this one! Stunningly beautiful with vivid colours and strikingly similar to St Basils in Moscow. Not far from the centre of the city this church is well worthy of half hour of your time and a few photos, I found myself taking pictures from every conceivable angle to ensure I didn't miss anything! You can enter the building for a closer look but we didn't have the time on this occasion!

Well worth the detour off Nevsky. The view from the bridge halfway to the church is the best! The park off the church is amazing. I'm told that the flea market behind the church is well worth checking out as well.

If you only visit one church in St. Petersburg.... Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is an iconic symbol of St. Petersburg and a must see during a visit. The colorful exterior is only matched by the spectacular mosaics inside that have been lovingly restored. Unlike the majesty of St. Isaac's Cathedral, this church has a special warmth. The exterior shined like a jewel box against the grey winter sky on the day we visited in January. The bridge over the canal is the perfect place to pause for a picture. There is a gift shop inside selling the standard souvenirs - icons, crosses, postcards, etc. As an aside - Be aware of your surroundings as you exit as this is a well-visited tourist site.
Very Pretty. Very picturesque, very Russian church. The story about the reason behind the name is really interesting.

Symbol of Saint petersburg-Most beautiful symbol of the world. Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is the Symbol of Saint petersburg and in this regards is the most beautiful symbol of a city in the world. Magnificent outside and glorious interior with irresistible surrounding garden and canal.If you should see just one place in Saint petersburg,this should be your choice.

Worth the stop. Unique church and very different from all the others in the city. As beautiful inside and outside. Very colourful and impressive with the details in the mosaics. Interesting history as it was almost destroyed because of it's difference. A must see while in St-Petersburg.
Unlike any other church I have ever seen.. Amazing colours and bright, shiny facades. Not a huge church but well worth the visit for the surpising colours in a fairly grey area of the city.

Most impressive church ever. Holy Shnikies! Give this place the numero uno MUST SEE place on your St. Petersburg itinerary. We were all blown away by the mosaic tile work inside. Unbelievable workmanship and artistry.
Heard there were heaps of pickpockets outside - certainly easy pickings with all of us gawking at the domes! Didn't see any, thankfully.

Beautiful, not to be missed. Incredible mosaics and amazing history behind the inception of the church
The restoration is extremely impressive
Easy to locate

Overwhelming...the best!. Wow! What an amazing piece of art, religiosity and uniqueness! This site was definitely one of the highlights of St. Petersburg...and the whole trip to the Baltics and a couple of Russian cities (Moscow, St. Petersburg). A MUST!

The best thing I've seen in my life!!. I was amazed from the outside.So many colours and different layers of the church!Visit it!!
-Churches in S.Petersburg are like a business.You pay a ticket to get in,you pay to light a candle,you pay for the paper that you write for someone to be healthy and then pay for the souvenirs!Access to religion should be free for everyone!!

mosaics. I was overtaken by the beauty of the mosaics. After a very long day of walking the city, it was our last stop. I am so pleased we did.... definitely a surprise and highlight of my visit to St.Petersburg

So much Culture and History. St. Petersburg is so full of historical sights that one is truly spoiled for choice. Like most others, this church is place of worship and museum in one. Totally worth the visit, totally worth paying an entrence fee. If you travel with children, make sure they bring their ID/student pass for discount.
Amazing! A definite must-see. A must while in St. Petersburg. Definitely one of the most impressive buildings that I have seen. Set aside at least an hour to marvel at the building.

Most beautiful church of them all. Churches in Russia charge you for the visit but its completly worth it, this one is the most beautiful of them all; also google or study its history and art to appreciate its value better when you have it in front (its not just pretty)

Built to memoralize Tsar Alexander. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. It was built on the exact place of Alexander's death. The intricately detailed mosaics are breathtaking. Don't miss this treasure!

Exceptionally preserved piece of Russian history!. Visited St Petersburg in September of 2013 and enjoyed the visit to the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood on a cool and slightly rainy early morning visit.We had a hotel car drop us off right outside the entrance near the ticket booth in order to pay the small fee to visit this attraction.Once inside one is completely astounded and somewhat overwhelmed by the fact that there is barely a square inch of the walls and ceilings that are not decorated in some form of mosaic or painting depicting a certain part of Biblical history.You actually need more time inside to appreciate the beauty of the artwork than you might initially think. The mosaic work is detailed and beautiful.If you're in St Petersburg, in my opinion, this has to be a must visit along with the Hermitage Museum, in this beautiful city!From the outside if you move back somewhat along the canal it makes for a gorgeous backdrop for photographs with friends.
Impressive interior. Very impressive mosaic work, however the crowd tend to be rather overwhelming. Do get the audio guide to have a better understanding of the history.
So beautiful!!!. We didn't go inside thoughBut it is very unique and we took some very nice pictures next to it :)Also there is a very nice souvenir market in front of the entrance to this church...

Make this a stop during your trip. This church is remarkable and worth an hour of your time. The entrance fee was reasonable and the art was unlike any other Russian Orthodox church I have seen. Visit the photo exhibit of the remarkable restoration. A labor of love to be sure!
A Must-See. Other than the cathedral in Red Square in Moscow, this is the essence of what one expects to see of a Russian Orthodox cathedral.

Unique Orthodox church completely covered in mosaic tiles . Ive seen so many Orthodox churches in Russia that I couldn't see why I should pay money to see this one. My friends convinced me otherwise. I'm glad I decided to visit. It is the most original church I've seen, plus it has a unique history. A tour was offered at no extra fee in Russian, and was well worth it. Not sure if one was offered in English.
must see- amazing. you will never see the like with mosaics floor to roof and it took 70 years to repair after WW2. Outside is fantastic but inside is so special.
well worth the visit. this church is very nice and worth a visit even though it is considered a museum and therefore you'll have to pay to get in.

Most beautiful "candy-like" church. When in St Petersburg, you can't miss this symbolic church, probably one of the most famous in Russia.You may pass some time taking fotos from inside and outside. You should chose summertime, I guess.

Breathtaking Mosaics. We were stunned to realize the amazing works of art were created with millions of tiny mosaic tiles. Every inch of interior walls, ceilings covered in brilliant color. I highly recommend making time to take the tour inside the cathedral. There are crowds, but worth it.
Spilled blood church. It's not an old church, only a recent typical Russian church replica. Its location is nice but very touristic.
Incredible sight!. Just wish the crowds were less-but in fairness, they all wanted to see something so incredible, too!

Beautiful inside and out. Unlike the several other major orthodox churches in the central part of St. Petersburg, this one looks stereotypically "Russian" with its cluster of brightly colored onion domes and spires and a picture of it along the canal is an iconic tourist shot. This is a decommisioned church; a state museum, not a functuioning house of worship and as such can feel a little spiritually sterile; no gutted candles in front of the icons, no priests chanting in basso profoundo. The late 19th century mosaics are beautiful, the whole restoration work is quite spectacular. Avoid the souvenir stands; prices are among the highest for similar items you are likely to find in Russia.

Amazing Restoration. I am not one for churches and museums but very glad that we chose to enter this one. The external architecture is amazing and behoves you to enter. The mosaic art inside is incredible and even more so when you see the old photos of the building and its meticulous restoration over the last 40 years.

A church like no other. Get prepared for lots of people, I cannot express enough about the people, cars and busses around this place. It's worth all the trouble to see it. The outside of the church is so beautiful, you have a take a few minutes to admire it. By the canal at the fence is a really nice place to see it's beauty. The mosaics inside is magnificently done and so beautiful. This is a must, must see in St. Petersburg.

The cherry on the sundae. NO words. More gold, icons, high ceilings and enormous pillars with insets, statues, pictures, .. I usually don't have this much trouble describing places or things.. but between this, Peterhof and the Hermitage... you just can't do it justice with "people" talk. ;)
church of spilled blood. st sburg is the most breath taking place i just loved every minute i was there will be returning one day

Unbelievable mosaics. An incredible work of art with the entire insides of the edifice covered in mosaics. It is a tribute to Tsar Alexander II and covers the place where he was assassinated. It's a must see for everyone.
Very beautiful church.. This church was beautiful with the colorful onion domes outside and beautiful mosaics inside. It was what we expected from pictures we had seen of Russian churches.
beautiful church. it's very beautiful inside. The restoration took a very long time so it's worth the wait. Very typical Russian style church.

Stunning!!!. Didn't go in but took exterior photos. Beautiful structure, worth the trip over if staying at FS Lion Palace. Great location for restaurants in area and canal views. Great gardens for a stroll adjacent...lovely

Great place to see. This was a great final destination in St Petersburg. Fantastic sight with the various colours and onion domes.
Great market across the road.

Worth the tour.. This church needs to be visited inside (take the paid tour) once when the sun is shining and outside both in day and after the sun goes down. Maybe the best place for a "Russian" photo for your Christmas card. Next to one of the many canals it is just a short walk from the Hermitage. There is a bazaar just to the north of the church with typical tourist items but the prices seemed a bit better there - negotiate and bargain!
One of the most beautiful churches. Church is beatiful inside and outside. It is situated near the Summer Garden and canal Griboedova ...a spectacular view!!!

The church that is the epitome of Russia!. We were taken by our tour guide to the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood, and I was very grateful we had a tour guide forthis, as she did warn us, that the Church was not situated in a very safe area! She told all of us to stay together, and not to buyanything from the vendors, as they could be working with pickpockets, and also not to carry your coat over your arm, making it veryaccessible also for pickpockets. Once we got inside it was very crowded, I only mention this, so others know to be careful atthis impressive attraction in Russia. The Church with it's mosaic pictures which stood several feet high, are beautiful and very impressive! There is much opulencein this church, along with it's history. And of course the outside with it's gilded onion domes, makes for some wonderfulsnapshots to remember your trip to Russia!
Simply Amazing!. This is one of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen.....Inside & Outside. Bring your camera! A DON't miss In St. Pete.

What a beautiful cathedral!. Such wonderful architecture, beautifully restored and stunning craftsmanship - the entire inside is covered with mosaic-tile images as well as some beautiful gemstone structures. A must see, inside and out.

a glorious church, with very obvious pickpockets.. Gorgeous gold and marble, mosaics everywhere, and a very humbling experience. Just look out for well-dressed young men, in suits and ties, who followed many tourists around, especially to the banks of the Neva.They vanished when we made it obvious that they had been spotted.

A beautiful building. A beautiful building dedicated to a great man who died rather heroically, stopping to help the innocent people who were killed as collateral damage by people claiming to be helping liberate the people by killing the Tsar, before the Tsar was able to finish his legislation effectively freeing the people which his death put an end to. Less of a church and more just an amazing work of art, top on any list for St Peters.

A classic example of Russian orthodox church. Of all the churches i have seen in Moscow and St. Petersburg, this is the most ornate, colorful, very detailed architecture Russian Orthodox church. This church is very meaningful because of the history behind it. And when you go inside, you will be mesmerized by the paintings on the wall, very colorful and extravagant. You will realized the richness in culture of Russia. The fallback is that there are many tourist inside the church and you will have the hard time moving around probably if you want to visit the church, visit early.

Glorious Technicolor. This has to be one of the places to visit in St Petersburg although your visit is unlikely to be that long as it isn't that big. The splendour and true artistry is something to be seen. Every inch of wall covered in mosaic with huge attention to detail. a real spectacle.

In a memory of Alexander II. One of the most unusual buildings of classical St-Petersburg, the church of Resurrection of the Christ nicknamed our Savior on the Spilled blood, was completed and sanctified in 1908, after 27 years of assassination of Alexander II. It copies the style of medieval Russian churches and is obviously one of the most picturesque churches of our city. It is a memorial of formation of Russian democracy, started from liberal reforms that were understood as "permissiveness" and caused terrorism widespread among young people...Since the museum is very popular it is always very crowdy there. If you plan to take pictures, come between 7 and 9 AM. In winter - as soon it gets light (appr. 10-11 AM). Museum opens at 11 AM, Wed is a day off. It is famous as a building with the biggest mosaic square - 75,000 m2 inside and outside. If you decide to go inside, you have to buy a ticket (MIND -it is not a functioning church, it is a museum!) and an audio-guide is advisable if you go on your own, without a private guide. Pickpocketing - unfortunately - is one of the disadvantages of that popular place and therefore - be alert like you are in Rome!
Stunning church!. I loved how different this church is architecturally from anything else around. Its like the 'St Basil' of St Petersburg. .

Spectacular - not to be missed. Beautiful example of an ornate Russian Orthodox church. I visited early in the morning to avoid the queues. I would recommend paying the few hundred rubles for the audio guide, as all the signage inside is in Russia. It tells you a lot about the history of the location and the construction, as well as explaining the more significant icons.As another reviewer mentions, the nearby souvenir market just across the street and is well worth a visit if you want to pick up a matryoshka doll (nesting dolls) or other typical Russian souvenirs.

Best and beautifull. Beautiful Russian church was built by famous architects and painters of 100 years ago.This place was killed by terrorists Russian Tsar Alexander 2The church is beautiful inside and out.On the walls are reinforced marble slabs describing successes of King

Go early in the morning. To see the sun rise on the gold turrets go early and it is quiet and OH, so beautiful. There is an amazing market just nearby where they sell genuine fur hats etc so you can go and try them on and barter away.

St. Petersburg, Russia. In 2012 I had my own personal travel guide to St. Petersburg and Moscow, Russia. St. Petersburg is definitely the nicer, cleaner more interesting of the two. Definitely see the various churches as they are something to behold...nothing like them in the U.S. Also, go to the Summer and Winter Palaces (Hermitage) of the Tsars. Take a boat tour of the canals in St. Pete as well as the fort across the river from the Hermitage. The Hermitage, alone, takes 3 days to see all of it. We were in Russia for a month. In Moscow, you must see Red Square especially in the spring so you can observe the many wedding parties celebrating. Also, visit the Kremlin which is simply the original walled city of Moscow dating back to the 1400s. The shopping mall across Red Square from Lenin's Tomb (no longer open to the public) is something to behold but be prepared for sticker shock as there are many Rolls Royces in the parking lot. My wife looked at an $800 bikini but passed it up.
Well worth the money. A stunning church covered in mosaics from floor to ceiling. I was completely blown away by the sheer number of colorful mosaics. A must see when in St Petersburg!
Do not miss it. Utterly magnificent.But spend a bit of time there, admiring or being astounded at the interior wall paintings; if you only visit one religious building in St P then this should be it.

Go inside and across the Church. Apart from taking dozens of photos outside or across the church you should go inside to get an assault to your senses.The interior is really breath taking and it is like a museum in itselfBut do not leave right away once you have been inside, across the Church is a flea market where you can buy souvenirs. It is a great flea market, although the products are not as good in terms of quality in the shops who are airconditioned. The prices are cheap! Cheapest from all the souvenirs shops even in Arbat in Moscow. So Buy something!

Gem. A church is a church is a church, right? Wrong! The Church if Our Savior on Spilled Blood is beyond amazing. The art and architecture is so traditionally what you think of she. Thinking of Russia. The exterior is so special and I found myself taking picture after picture, just be ware of the crowds and any pick pockets. The inside is filled with wonderful mosaics unlike any I've seen elsewhere. Don't miss this!

Most incredible mosaics I've ever seen. I've seen a lot of churches, and a lot of mosaics, and nothing compares to this. My jaw was literally on the floor. Do not miss this, one of the most incredible places I've seen.

If you can only do one city in Moscow, then see this church. I agree this probably was the best attraction in St Petersburg. The exterior is amazing, and the interior is also fantastic. So, if you are doing the walking tour, this should be one of the spots to make sure to check out. The crowds do get busy during the day so try to go early or late afternoon... I do suggest earlier as you never know what the weather is like as you'll be taking lots of photos.Unlike a lot of other buildings that have cheap paint job on the exterior, this building and surrounding park and shops are all interesting so do spend some time to take photos.I was in Moscow and if you can't get there or weren't planning on going to the Kremlin, then this Church is as good as St. Basil.

Must see church. This church is very beautiful. It resembles St. Basil’s in Moscow and you just can’t seem to get enough pictures of the exterior. The interior is breathtaking. It is covered in the most beautiful mosaics I have ever seen. The lines were long the day we were there but they move quickly. I would also recommend you stop at the gift shop and pick up the book about the history of the church along with the colored photos. The interior photos that we took did not come out that great due to the low level lighting in some of the areas.
Breath taking. Oh my God, this Cathedral is so beautiful and so different from what Westeners are used to. It´s luminous and colourful, absolutely amazing. Don´t miss it!

Best thing in ST Pete. This church is magnificent both inside and out. My alltime favorite attraction in St Petersburg. MUST see inside! Unique experience, unlike any other church/cathedral I have ever seen!

Must See. we only had a photo stop here on out tour of st Petersburg for about 15 minutes... would liked to of stayed longer and went inside as there is a lot of mosaic work... the story behind the church and why it was built is also very good to listen too.......definitely worth seeing if you are in St Petersburg..... My only advice would be to beware that the area is known for pickpockets... you just take the same precautions as you would in any other congested areas...... I must say out of the 26 of us that were there we were all ok.

Breathtaking mosaics, amazing place. I'm not surprised this is number one on trip advisor. I love visiting cities and part of that is always looking at churches, and this is one of the most jaw dropping places I have ever seen. The outside is wonderful, of course, with the onion domes and gold that make it unique but inside is just - words fail me. The artwork is all mosaics, but the quality is far superior to anything I remember seeing elsewhere. The faces of the figures are detailed, and give each an individual character. The shading of the colours mean that fabrics appear to hang like cloth. Dark tiles are used to outline the figures, giving them a sharpness not usually seen in mosaics. And if this wasn't enough, just opposite is a great market with, so far, the best and most eclectic range of traditional souvenirs we have seen - I haven't bought yet, because I'm still in St P and looking, but so far it looks as though I am going to be going back there.

The highlight of St. Petersburg. This cathedral is truly the highlight of St. Petersburg. The best place to catch its beauty is from the bridge across Griboedov canal. It might get very crowded during summer (just like any other touristy place in St. Petersburg). The entrance is free for the Russian students. The cathedral is closed on Wednesdays.

Beautiful church. Most tourists stay outside and look at the funny and beautiful Church with all the "Onions" in different colors and style. But I recomend to go inside and look at the very beautiful church

Beautiful church. Probably first church that is such unique image of St Petersburg,
you can see it almost from everywhere its gold spirals are shinning especially on sunny days. Its stunning from outside and inside
Over the top. The outside was magnificent but it was quite expensive to go in, pretty crowded and way over the top decorated! But still - a St Petersburg experience

The cake cathedral). This is one of the most beautiful cathedral in the world, all covered with mosaic. Even though it was built in the beginning of the 20th century, it looks really old because of the classical Russian cathedral style. Really worth to visit it, btw tickets are not that expensive and there is no line to the ticket box usually. It is so colorful, bright and decorated with the enamel domes then the church looks like a cake from the distance. As soon as you see the Cathedral you are all distracted by the view. You can also visit the park nearby for a walk in one of the most beautiful ares of Saint Petersburg.

Looks impressive. The church has an interesting history (hence its name), and it has a record number of mosaic tiles, but it's all recent. It all looks impressive, but it also feels like it was built for show, and it really doesn't have the sense of religious history that you might expect.

Breathtaking, simply a must see. You will just have to visit here to see how stunning the place is, words or photos simply couldn't do it justice, every single piece of wall inside is covered in something and the onion domes and other features outside are magnificent, simply the best piece of architecture I have ever seen. When you visit and see the number of people waiting to get in you expect the worst but inside had plenty of room to move about and take photos I don't know what to review that could give anyone reason to see it but honestly you won't regret it it's is absolutely beautiful, be aware of neck ache from looking up too long

Breathtaking!. A must visit when in St Pete. The beautiful colours are reflected differently at different times of the day. If only they had the lights on at night, it would have been beautiful.... Just amazing!

A magnificent place in St. Petersburg. Situated on the margin of a wonderful channel, just from the outside it is wonderful ! The inner side is equally superb, there is the place where Alexander was brutally murdered, and the church was constructed above it.

It won't disappoint.. An amazing spectacle of mosaic and craftsman ship waits inside. We went late afternoon and found an hour to be enough but we had already gawked at and photographed the outside of the building for half an hour before hand. You can't miss this if you're in st Petersburg, it should be at the top of the list.

Spectacular. Built on the site where Alexander II was assisinated, and completed in the early 20th century. It's pretty modern by church standards, but its styled in a classical/medieval Russian style, and simply, it's magnificent.I don't know if this should be the no.1 attraction in St. Petersburg, but it is without question a "must see".I can't comment on the interior as I wasn't prepared to pay the entrance fee.

Get there early!. Beautiful structure, but surrounded by a lot of touristy stuff that detracted (for me) from the place. I was there kind of early one day, and got to enjoy the place a little. Best part was walking through the Mikhaylovskiy Garden, right next door, with all the fall colors.

Amazing externally and internally. The mosaics inside the memorial church were exquisite the colours amazing. Do get an audio guide to go round at your own pace. I never knew that the 'onion' shaped domes were designed to stop the snow from settling on them!

A must see place. At the time we lived in St Petersburg (Leningrad) this church was hidden behind construction structure. We kept hearing that it was "under restoration", and it lasted for many years. Finally, when we came to visit our favorite city many years later, we saw it finished! It was beyond any expectations - beautiful inside and out! As always, St Petersburg proved itself as one of the most beautiful cities of the world. After you visit the church, take a walk along the canal to Nevsky Avenue or take a boat tour on Neva river. Avoid buying souvenirs near the church. They are low quality and overpriced. Better go to the Souvenir department in Gostiny Dvor (Гостиный двор) on Nevsky. They are much better quality and some of the prices are lower - you will be surprised!

Mosaic Wonder. This was a new experience for us to see such a unique and breathtaking church - Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood (Russian: Церковь Спаса на Крови, Tserkovʹ Spasa na Krovi). This stunning Russian-style church was built between 1883 and 1907 on the location where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. It is one of the most popular and crowded attractions in St. Petersburg. Its appearance differs from other churches in the city of St. Petersburg; it is a Russian-style church similar to the St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.The church is located in the city center and is easily accessible from the Nevsky Prospekt (Russian: Не́вский проспе́кт) metro station. It takes less than 10 minutes (500 m/1650 ft) by walking along the Griboedova canal from the metro station. You can recognize it easily when you are on the sidewalk of the canal. The church is composed of red and brown brick and features a fantastic ornate "Russian-style" exterior of traditional colorful onion domes, ceramic tiles, colored glazed bricks and white marble. Inside you will view one of the largest mosaic collections in Europe. Its large works of colorful mosaics include different religious themes as well as an extensive collection of Christian images that can last much longer than traditional painting normally found in churches. The dome ceiling is covered with the mosaic image of Christ the Pantocrator.The church has suffered damage during several wars, the Russian Revolution being the most ruinous. It took 27 years to revive the exceptional 7500 square meters of mosaics to its original look from 1970. The restoration was completed in 1997. We were lucky enough to enjoy this masterpiece today and saw how the artists could make the mosaics so consummate. We also learned that the building is not really a church since it has never been used for worship services; it was built to be a memorial. It is now a museum of Mosaics.This was the only place that I spent all my time taking photos and not paying much attention listening to our guide of my St. Petersburg’s trip. I was also the last one of my group to leave the church. It is a beautiful and unforgettable visit.

Spectacular. One that needs to be on a must see list. Be aware it does not open until 11AM at this time of year!Suspect it may get very crowded at peak times although we had plenty off time & space to admire the magnificent interior.

Theatrical inside and out. I saw this church at the end of the canal as I left the Russian Museum, and it stopped me in my tracks. Its exuberant onion domes are covered in multi-coloured tiles, and are one of the few 'old Russian' sights in a Europeanised city. It was built deliberately in an archaic style in 1883, but is none the worse for that. Inside, it is equally colourful, with every surface covered in mosaic, and with subtle light diffusing through the complex interior spaces. We spent quite a long time looking at this church. Don't miss it.

Stunning Building! Must see!. Unique and astonishing building nestled by the river side. Visually stunning on interior and exterior well worth a visit inside although at 250 rub it is perhaps a bit steep as it is rather small within. Beautiful frescos though!

Breathtaking.. This is somewhere you must visit. First impressions exceeded my expectations and these had been high.The overall shape of the building is spectacular and the decoration quite outstanding. We had to queue for a short time to enter the church and, in common with most of these sites, it was very busy, both outside and inside.Such was the crowd, I had some slight difficulty in taking a few photographs of the inside but, with patience, eventually managed it. The interior is as wonderful as the outside, with superb paintings on virtually every wall and ceiling. Go visit....you won't be disappointed.
Wonderful. Very nice from outside and from inside with all the walls covered with mosaicos, you can't miss it!!!

Amazing day and night! Must see!!!. I first saw this church lit up at night and took in the incredible sight that it is. Fantastic colours and details. Then the following day I went to see the inside too. I was completely overwhelmed with how beautiful the inside of the church is.There was murals and paintings covering every single part of the inside and they were so beautiful. I spent about 15 minutes just looking at it all unable to take it all in. The canopy where the tsar Alexander III was killed was an important part to visit.It's an absolutely stunning building and if you go to st petersburg you simply have to visit!!!
A must visit . It was a brilliant unforgettable day, if you're in Saint Petersburg for even an hour, don't miss the chance and get there !

Surreal. To see this church after seeing images of it was amazing. The outside, indescribable. The inside, even more so. Beauty, grandeur, opulent, steeped in history. A very memorable attraction, hard to park if you have a vehicle.

Beauty. This church is really beautiful, much more beautiful than any church in Moscow in my opinion. It really stands out not only by its location but also by its architecture and history! RECOMMENDED

A do not miss site You have to see the INSIDE.. A DO NOT miss site. You have to see the inside with the floor to ceiling mosaics. !!!!! Seeing this church from the outside is a nice photo opportunity but the inside is amazing with the the floor to ceiling moasics
The artistry inside and out is detailed and of course beautiful.. Ease of entry. I went with the tour company TJ Travels. Both the exterior of the building and the Mosaic work inside is breathtaking.

Absolutely stunning!. This was my favorite church in Russia that I visited. It was so ornate and decorated, but not overwhelming - it was simply beautiful. Every angle from the outside was stunning and interesting, and the mosaics inside were gorgeous - very Russian and an amazing place to visit. It is also close to a market where you can get some small souvenirs for your visit which was a nice place to walk around as well.
stunning church. Can't really fault this is a stunning building. It's also worth paying extra to go up to the dome as you get some good views from the top.

Amazing. Both the interior and exterior are fabulous to look at. Apparently a favorite for wedding party photos - there were many brides and grooms getting photographed on the grounds. The natural light inside is beautiful, and exterior colors and shapes is extraordinary. A must see where you are religious or not. Ironically, it is the site of the Czar Alexander's murder, not as one would presume. The many signs and plaques help with sharing the history of the church.

Church of Resurrection on the Spilled Blood... Wow!. Wow. There is no better word to describe this unreal site than 'wow.' I've seen pictures of it online and in books, but none do it any justice once your own eyes gaze upon it. Our tour bus rolled up alongside it and let us off across the street, adjacent to a street crafts fair (aka - flea market). When you first lay eyes upon this church, you can't help but stare at the vivid colors on the onion-shaped roof features. It spans such an array of colors. With our Grand Tour 2-Day excursion from our Carnival Cruise we skipped the line and our group of 44 from the Carnival Legend walked immediately into the church to begin our tour of the inside. It's inside where you can witness hundreds of years of artistry upon the walls and ceiling of the church. The walls are decorated with the most intricately painted artwork of an era not seen for centuries. Last time I saw this highly detailed artistry and elegance in a church was Italy with its Duomo in Florence and the Vatican Museum among a great many others there. There is an abundance of gold used in the paintings on the walls as well as the domed ceilings. Also in the church is the resting place of Alexander The Great. His tomb is marked by a grandiose structure which always has fresh flowers laid just in front of it. In one of the stories told during our visit, it was described that the Russians had made plans to demolish this church because it was not stable -- it had been originally built above the intersection of 3 rivers / canals which made the foundation very unstable for a structure this size. Those plans were put aside because just a few days before it was to be demolished, the Germans had declared war on, and invaded, Russia during WWII in June 1941. Were it not for that fortuitous timing - for better or for worse I suppose in the grander scheme of things - this amazing church would be lost forever. Move to the outside of the church and you get lost in its architecture, its colors, and its unique characteristics. There isn't one church, landmark, monument, or building that remotely resembles this one with its colorful onion-shaped rooftop features. This is certainly a MUST SEE if you ever had one.

Stunning. Like a lego church - amazing design - beautiful and interesting even if you are not religious or into visiting churches. Just off the main shopping street Nevsky Prospect so very easy to get to. Avoid the tourist trap market just next to it though.

Absolutely Beautiful Outside and Inside. The exterior of this church is unbelievable, it is very hard to describe. The onion domes, the color, the ornate designs are breathtaking. Once inside it is very ornate, mosaics of the apostles, a very beautiful and highly decorated alter. All in the Russian Orthodox style, similar to Greek Orthodox. It was very crowded and our visit was only 30 minutes but it was a highlight of our visit to St Petersburg. I thought it was called the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood referring to Christ's blood that was shed on the cross for us but it was builtt on the spot where Czar Alexander was murdered. It makes you feel more like you are in a museum than a church but it was quite beautiful and impressive. An absolute must on any visit to St. Petersburg Russia
A visit to spilled blood. Mosaics amazing. Did visit by ourselves. Amazing stone work. It was very beautiful from the outside. Very Russian.

Our favorite church. We have travelled extensively and I am not all that interested in seeing yet another church/cathedral. However, Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood proved to be a wonderful exception to the run of the mill altars, stained glass, paintings, etc. The mosaics in the church are amazing! If you only go to one church in St. Petersburg, make it this one!
Beautiful. Beautiful church and a tragic story behind it. We had enough time to take photos and ask questions about the history and politics of the USSR.
Nice, great photos.. Truely a good visit. We visited twice as the tour also included a visit and explanation of the churc.

The Wow Factor. The church was amazing on the inside and outside. The inside is covered in mosaic with marble floor - it has to be seen to be believed, my photos did not do it justice. It is actually a museum and not a 'working' church but it really does have the WOW factor.
Spiritual. You get a strong sense of the spirituality of the people. It is not as large as some other churches, so you get get an overall sense of awe more easily.
Unbelievable.. One of the best churches I have ever visited. As beautiful from outside as from inside, don't miss it, I mean it! The number one to visit in whole Russia.

Gorgeous and Overwhelming. We visited this on our own, and found that there is really no obvious need for a tour guide. This building is actually a memorial rather than a church. It is filled with gorgeous mosaics, and the outside is at least as stunning as the inside. We went late in the day, in September of the year, so the crowds were somewhat less than they would have been in July. It is really a "don't miss" but doesn't take more than half an hour to see and take pictures.
Amazing. One of the best things we saw in Russia - the external of the building is beautiful and inside, the mosaics are breathtaking

Overwhelmed with colour. Worth seeing but you need not spend a long time in the church. Its the mosaics and their colour. But check out the ornamental fence and gate around the east side of the church and entrance into the adjacent park.
Lovely photo opp. This is a lovely photo opportunity, even though it was actually fairly modern construction. Go early to avoid the crowds.

The church is very unique. To me, this cathefral is actually more beautiful than the St Basil Cathedral, just less colourful.
There is a park just next to the cathedral. It is nice to have a walk in the peaceful environment.

Church Preserves Russian Architecure. The architectural majesty and artistic beauty are reasons that this is the most visited church in Russia and one you must include on your trip itinerary. Sadly, the churches in St. Petersburg are now merely museums and not places of worship, but you can still stop here to raise a prayer of your own.

Amazing!. Well worth the visit. We were fortunate to go with a seasoned guide (SPB tours) and we learned a lot about the Church and why it is named "Spilled Blood" . The church is marks the the location of where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated. The interior mosaics are truly magnificent and the architecture of the church is amazing. One of the highlights of our trip.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Do not miss this wonderful cathedral. While it is spectacular on the outside, the mosaics inside are stunning. Don't stop with the exterior......this is one you really don't want to miss. Amazing to think these works of art are mosaics. Fall is a great time to visit too. For shoppers, there are opportunities to shop both behind and across the street from this cathedral. Across the street the vendors welcomed US dollars, but the other vendors behind the church would accept only rubles.
Good art. This was very good with a lot of photo opportunities. The paintings were amazing. The outside of the building was amazing and beautifully painted

Awesome sight. I can honestly say I have never been more impressed by a church in My life it's overwhelmingly beautiful. We visited on a cruise holiday a rainy dull day but really Worth it. The colours the are just unbelievable the inside is a must you can Easily spend a hour here. A good tip the meat restaurant at the side as wifi and is not locked bonus when you on a cruise

Very beautiful. Magnificent cathedral built on the spot a Czar's son was murdered. Very colourful and a good photo opportunity.It is next to a tourist street market and just down the road is a Jamie Oliver restaurant.

Beautiful!. Make sure you have your camera ready. The architecture and bright colors made this a unique church. It is well worth the stop. The tour guide gave us a great narrative on the history of the church. The market across from the church was a worthwhile stop. Be prepared to barter.

Amazing. It's not just the exterior that is spell binding, the whole of the interior is decorated with amazing mosaics. Every inch is a blaze of colour. Don't forget to look at the floor it's just as beautiful! When your brain has reached overload, take a visit to the souvenir market outside. Not the cheapest prices but certainly an experience.

More impressive outside than in. The outside is amazing - shades of St Basils in Moscow. Inside it is nice but, to my mind, not spectacular. There is a lot of history attached to this church which is very interesting and worth reading up about if you are not going with a guide. Opposite is a market where there are hundreds of Russian dolls, chess sets and other paraphernalia for sale. The gardens behind are also worth a visit. Don't dare to walk on the grass!
Check on opening times. The architecture and colours are truly amazing. Such a contrast to see trinket sellers in booths right on the doorstep almost of this ancient church. fascinating.

Absolutely beautiful!. A church like no other inside and out. I took so many pictures and just kept wanting to take one more. Our great guide Julia from Dancing Bear Tours showed it off to us in a way we couldn't have seen it on our own. Impressive!

Crime doesn't pay. Interesting history, matched by amazing architecture. Beware of pick pockets who operate here. I could see someone trying to distract my Husband while their friend went behind him and was about to take his wallet when I shouted at him. They both went off very quickly. Put your valuables inside your jacket with a secure zip etc.

Up Close and Personal with those Iconic Domes!!!. Can be very busy here,but we were fortunate with our timing.The outside is magnificent, but the inside is equally worthy.There are beautiful mosaics, scale models, amazing altar pieces, and some photos of historical events in the church.Amazing to see the site of Alexander 2nd's murder, which gave the church it's name "spilt blood".Could have spent half a day in here just taking it all in!

Visual delight, a memorial not a church. A stunning building on the outside with very dome and decoration possible but nothing prepares you for the beauty of the incredible mosaics inside. The restoration has been well documented in an interesting display. Take the time to stroll up the canal away from the tourist buses and souvenir sellers to walk with locals and visitors enjoying the view.

Amazing mosiacs throughout the church.. I loved learning the history and trying to visualize the artists working on this church. The location next to the canal is picture perfect. Ready to paint? It would remind you of being in Venice.

Really beautiful. This is a really beautiful church at the Peter and Paul Fortress. I don't know what more to say other than don't miss out on seeing it. The "public toilets" in a stationary bus might be a bit off putting but at least there are toilets. Well worth seeing, this was my husband's favourite place in Russia.

Beautiful church, on a lovely canal. This is not a traditional church - it is a memorial chapel. The mosaics are incredible. The church was decimated first by the Soviets, who vandalized the building and used it as a storage facility, and even more by German bombardment during World War II's 900 day Siege of Leningrad. There is a very interesting display showing the decades of restoration work which was done structurally and to restore the magnificent mosaics. When I went there, I was moved by a group of young Russian children on a school excursion, taking photos and completely enthralled by the beauty. . . The church is located on Griboyedov Canal, named after the author of one of the funniest Russian plays of the 19th Century. Gotta love a country that names streets and canals after literary figures.

The reason I wanted to go to St Petersburg!. The outside is stunning and the inside is gorgeous! Fascinating history too.
See it during the day and at night too -- very impressive.
A must see church!. Historical site on an impressive orthodox style. Stunning! Many beautiful pictures, mosaics, marble things. So rich! Something wonderful to be seen in every corner.

The Inside is even Better. When you visit the church, walk all the way around to get a good look at all of the beautiful architecture and mosaics. If that is all you get to do, it is pretty good. But, inside the restoration is spectacular.

Absolutely stunning. The approach to the church from Nevsky Prospekt beside a canal is stunning, but many more splendours await. The exterior while fabulous is outshone by the interior. The unique mosaics are truly breathtaking, covering the walls and soaring domes. Do not miss this when visiting St Petersburg.

What I always imagined. This church is exactly as I had imagined a Russian orthodox church would be. Onion domes, mosaics, tiles, gold plated altar screens a feast for the eyes. In can be crowded, but take your time to enjoy the art. Lots of history also as a favorite assassinated Tsar is buried here. This church is no longer used as a church. It is maintained as a museum.
Must see. Church on Spilled Blood is amazingly beautiful. Recommend you have a guide to fully enjoy the architectural achievements.

Church of the Spilled Blood. Exquisite church. Every inch is painted with icons. Unbelievably beautiful. The altar doors are golden and filled with icons of saints. There are no pews for services. It was used for potato storage by the communists. It had to be renovated to its past beauty. Be careful of pick pockets outside the church.

An outstanding sight!. We didn't have time to go into the church on our tour and our guide said there were other places on our itinerary with more to see inside anyway. She was also a bit dismissive because the church is relatively new (only about a hundred years I believe) and she said that it was not built in the St. Petersburg tradition, but had been imposed on St. Petersburg by the central government in Moscow. So my rating applies only to the exterior, which does need to be seen to be believed! An outstanding sight!

Very Photogenic. This highlty visited church is beautiful with a charm all its own. Located next to a canal it makes for a beautiful photograph if the weather is nice. We were lucky to see it with our own personal guide who pointed out some amazing details. If you don't have our own guide you should get on one of the commercial ones in the church. Amazing mosaic interior but it does get crowded so go as early as you can, just like we did. I don't remember if our guide paid an entrance fee or not? We entered so many churches and museums it is hard to remember.

Shrine with art. The outside is breathtaking and the inside is too. Allow at least one hour and rent the audio or hire a guide like we did. She was wonderful and made sense of the whole thing.You will be near the Russian Art Museum so plan to visit that either before or after.
A must see.. The mosaics and icons are incredible. One advantage of having mosaics is that you can use flash with your camera. The inside and outside are picturesque.

Magnificent cathedral. Amazing mosaics and the everpresent gold statues and decorations seen all over the city. A must see. Go early before all of the tour groups get there. If on a tour, listen to the guide for important details.

I wish it could have been more.. Sadly we were taken to this amazing building so early in the morning that the empty bottles of vodka smashed all over the road, had yet to be cleaned up. The building was shut to the public. On a very positive note, the actual beauty of the building is jaw dropping. Stunning colours and shape, a photographers delight. If you are going, please make sure you will be able to enter as I am sure that it would be as amazing inside as it is out.

Absolutely Amazing. If you are in St. Pete and you don't see this, you're crazy. The mosaic interior is something you will never forget, and have a hard time finding an equal. The history is great and the audio tour really helps. I would recommend hiring a guided tour and spend the $15 to buy the professionally made book of photos. Regardless of what you think, you can't take photos well enough to capture the beauty of this place.

amazing place. This was an amazing place to visit. The history is facinating and very moving.It was rather crowded with different groups but even so we managed to see most of it (even with my husbands mobility scooter)

Not to be missed. Loved everything about it. Our tour did not include a visit to the Church but I was determined not to miss it. So I walked forty minutes from my hotel and found it quite easily. The interior is as beautiful as the exterior. It was magnificent!!!!
Another stunning building. Another beautiful building to visit. Good market with competitive prices on vicinity, be sure to bargain!

Awesome on the outside and pretty interesting on the inside too. We really enjoyed visiting this church. It's extremely photogenic on the outside, with its interesting spiky onion domes. The inside has some interesting details and learning the history of the church was enlightening. After you're one here, go to the market across the street to get souvenirs, but make sure to haggle hard because those vendors really jack up the prices.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This fabulous church is one of the most beautiful and most decorated buildings I have ever seen. It is also known by other names such as Church of the Savior on Blood, The Resurrection Church and The Church of the Resurrection of Christ which can be confusing when reading tour sites. It may be crowded; however, that does not matter because the beauty and architecture is everywhere, especially overhead. The area is level, paved, and near other key historical sites, hotels and restaurants in St. Petersburg.

Staggering mosaics. We visited this amazing church in August 2013 as part of an Alla tour itinerary. What a gem of a tour stop! the outside of the church was impressive but this paled into insignificance compared to the awesome interior mosaics - visually staggering. The locals appear to be proud that such a cultural legacy has survived the "Soviet era" and rightly so. This church is just one nugget in a that is St. Petersburg and in my opinion rivals any historical location in mainland Europe.
The most impressive. church art work inside in Russia. No oil paintings - all glass mosaic work. Not to be missed. It is truly a shame tours "honk & wave" past this classic structure.
