Best £5 Ever!. Had no idea why I had not remembered this church on my previous visit to Leningrad, as it then was, in 1984 - all became clear. See earlier reviews. A fabulous building and beautifully restored. If you like church architecture you'll love this. Photography is allowed inside, including with flash - heaven for those of us who love the challenge of unusual holiday photographs. Luckily the sky had some blue in an otherwise grey September week to allow great photographs of the outside too.

Absolutely Stunning. Have not seen anything like this before. One of the best churches I've ever seen. The interior walls are so colourful and detailed. whilst the outside is vibrant. Even better to see it on a clear day.

psychedelic candy confection. Of all the places I wanted to see in St. Petersburg(and there were many), I especially wanted to see the Church of the Spilled Blood. Although it was crowded, I managed to see the beautiful interior and admire the spectacular mosaics. The workmanship was unbelievable. It's hard to believe that Stalin had planned to demolish the church; only the German invasion saved it.
St Petersburg for oldies. Good transport system.Level walking.Good trips beyond the city.lives up to it's name of Venice of the North.

amazing mosaics. 2 minutes walk from our hotel and a must site to visit.The mosaics are amazing so much detail and to think it was used for storing potatoes and theatre things in soviet times the work in restoring the building to be such a beautiful site if wonderful.

Beautiful church with spectacular mosaics. This is a must see for visitors to St. Petersburg. We were limited in our time because of other items on our tour, but one could spend substantial time there admiring the artwork.
A must see !!!. You have to visit to believe !!! The mosaics are absolutely spectacular. This has to be one of the top 2-3 things to see in the St. P area.
amazing. this was a amazing church has not to be missed. make sure you have your camera with you as you want to keep every picture with you lovely wee stall outside as well
gorgeous church. Very beautiful and quite astonishing church given it was only built not too long ago! Definitely one of the top ten of St. Petersburg.
gorgeous church. Very beautiful and quite astonishing church given it was only built not too long ago! Definitely one of the top ten of St. Petersburg.

church not to miss in your visit to St Petersburg. church of our savior on spilled blood is extreamely rich from outside with its colorful domes and inside is interesting with its beautiful floor and ironworks as well as art. it makes one quiet down the moment you enter inside. worth a visit hundered times over.

Mind blowing mosaics. The entire inside of the church walls are mosaic. Like nothing I have ever seen before. The outside has so many different elements to photograph. Very interesting and quite amazing.

World class frescoes.. This Church reminds of the Vasilij Cathedral in Moscow from the outside. As soon as you are getting inside you will see that it is not comparable. The mosaic Works inside are unique. A must see. Do not speak or discuss inside the Church - this is not popular and you will get a strict look or even a strict Message from one of the babuskas in the Church. But go and see it. It is Worth the rubles asked.
Marvelous Church. This Church is splendid! In St. Petersburg is one of the most beautiful places to visit. Have to visit. Outside or inside is remarkable.

A feast for your eyes. This is an absolutely beautiful church which is no longer used as a place of worship. The church fell into disrepair during the atheistic period but has been restored to its former glory and is now a museum. The strikingly colourful onion shaped domes dominate the city skyline and are an unforgettable sight. The outside decoration of the church is outstanding. The interior is quite spectacular with beautiful ceramic mosaics covering almost 7,000 square metres. This would be an unforgettable visit.
Amazing visit. Not knowing what to expect and sceptical that we would enjoy this visit judging by the crowds at the entrance. The interior decoration amazed us. A memorable visit not to be missed

Part of a 2 day organised tour. The architecture of this place inside and out is compelling as well as the history of it.Most tours get a 1.2 hour but if you want to visit inside for the history and photograph the outside you really need more not to feel rushed.
Amazing frescoes. An interesting story lies behind the erection of this church and the interior will give your eyes a feast of images to draw upon. Not to be missed

Breathtaking Beauty. We had a wonderful view of the exterior from our room at Grand Hotel Europe. The interior took our breath away. From a distance, you think the murals are frescos. Up closer, millions of tiny mosaics are revealed. For me, this is a must see along with The Hermitage.

"Cupcake church". Historically this is a very important place. Built right on where the Tzar was killed, they have turned this bloody spot into a very beautiful church in memory of the "reformist" Tzar. And it has a lot of information about the Tzar Alexander, although they only talk about the "good" aspects of him of course. Might be little biased and nationalistic, but still good to see those too. Some tourists there were calling it "The Cupcake Church" because of the colorful, magnificent top of it :) Certainly one of the most important places to visit. You will see it from a distance as soon as you arrive in the city center, which is one of the reasons why this city has such an excellent silhouette.

Go inside!. I was there on a cruise and noticed when I was exploring various tour group alternatives that some tour groups went by this church but did not go inside. The exterior is certainly worth a visit, but don't tell people you've seen this church unless you've been inside - it is essentially one huge gold mosaic and just spectacular!

Unique church/museum. More that a magnificent church and museum, it is a critical piece of Russian history, as the exact site of Alexander's assassination. The oversized mosaics are breathtaking, and you will never tire of the views from the outside. Added bonus - the crafts market across the street.

Not to be missed in st Petersburg. St Petersburg is a beautiful city and there were many lovely sights there to visit but this little church took my breath away. It's an icon for this city - looks beautiful from the outside -but inside the church the intricate mosaic works on the walls and throughout the church are also amazing. Not to be missed if you are in the city.

Unique Among All Other St. Petersburg Churches.... This church is a must see in St. Petersburg for several reasons. First, its architecture is different than other churches there. Even though it was completed in 1907, its architecture is in the style of medieval Russian with classic onion domes and beautiful coloring. It also has more mosaic tiles than any other church in the world - over 7500 square meters of mosaics. In the 1930s, the Communists almost tore it down, but no date was ever given so consequently, the tear down was forgotten. The church was restored in the 1980s. The best place to take a picture of the church is from afar, standing on the small bridge that crosses the channel, a short walk away.

OMG. Maybe the most stunning church interior in the world. Entirely mosaics. Simply breathtaking. The outside is not bad either with its colorful onion domes. A must see...and really, you must go inside!
Do not leave St Petersburg without seeing. This is Just magnificent ,words escape me ,beautiful architecture, set along the canal.Leave plenty of time to take in its wonder.

Very beautiful!. Amazing architecture, likes it more than St. Bazi's in Moscow! Colose to the Russian Museum, which is also worth seeing - it's bigger than Hermitage! But may be, entering a museum inside this very church isn't the best idea - it's far more beautiful from the outside. Better read it's history!

Great Catheral. While in St. Petersburg, I had to see this place. I didn't do any of the translation tours but it would have been nice. You don't need to but I would recommend it. I was traveling on a budget and it was more about the visuals for me.
Eyecatching. The interior of this catherderal was breath taking with the religous icons dominating in all their splendour. It was also a handy reference point as it could be seen from everywhere.
Probably my favorite church!. This Church is amazing! It really helps to have a guide to explain some it it's history and recovery in history.

Interesting Inside & Out !. Yes, this really looks the part from the outside, but alos venture inside & you;ll find a lovely church with fab mosaics etc.
A must see really !

Don't just be dazzled by the exterior; explore the interior, too.. My river cruise tour guide took us to the exterior for a quick photo op. My friend and I returned to visit the inside, and we were so happy we did. One of the most beautiful churches in St. Petersburg, filled with more than 7500 square meters of mosaics, more than any other church in the world. Built in 1883 on the site where Tsar Alexander II was murdered. Classified as medieval Russian architecture.
Impressive mosaics. The restoration of this cathedral is meticulous. We used the audio guide which was very helpful. It is very impressive.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This Church is absolutely beautiful and the photographs do not do it justice. The ceiling on the inside reminded me of the Sistine Chapel. This would be a must on any visit to St. Petersburg, Russia.
Super architecture. They name kind of fools you since it more related to the spilling of the Czar's blood then Christ. The place is very beautiful but expensive to enter.

Mosaic Beauty. This Church is beautiful. So many wonderful treasurers and the Mosaic's are spectacular. Be sure to bring a camera. The outside of the Church is special with it's onion domes and colors.

It might be over, but it is a must see church in St. Petersburg. This church is an example of catholic church made on medieval style. It is located in the heart of the city and it was built by Alexander III in honour to his father, in the exact place where Alexander II was assassinated by a bomb.It might be over for some tastes but I think it is a nice example of Russian architecture that must be seen. Numerous domes, full of gold and other colours surrounded by also colourful carvings. Inside the church is as colourful and full of paintings in its walls as it is outside. The church is located by a canal and at the sunset the view is wonderful.Pay attention to the names, because the official name of this church is "Cathedral of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ", but if you ask for that name, probably no one will help you to find it, since the Split Blood is the way it is known in the town.
Don't miss. Great place to visit, beautiful mosaics, flooring, architect and art on the walls. Beautiful both inside and outside.
Breathtaking!. Was truly beautiful! Be careful of trinket stalls prices drop by 50% on the exit side of the building!!!

Stunning. I can't say anything, MUST BE VISITED.
Very nice Architecture, it was unique and different to all the churches seen before.
A lot of souvenir shops outside, offer good prices, but you have to discuss prices ;)

Wonderful; but look out for thieves. The cathedral was marvelous, you'd have to see it to believe it. The mosaics were stunning. **One thing to be aware of, there is a gang of thugs/pickpockets that rove and intermingle with the tourists outside. They are disguised as tourists. They carry shopping bags and dress as tourists would and they number at least six. My husband caught 3 of them trying to pick an old woman's back pack. He alerted her that her pack was open and afterward they bullied him and assaulted him until we departed. **

Beautiful church. Stunning church. Architecture in the medieval Russian style, beauiful to behold up the canal. Walking distance from the Hermitage. Beware of pickpockets, we saw a gang operating in this area.

Very unique Church!. Seen it in so many pictures, but was awestruck seeing it in person! Hesitated to view the inside as I thought it won't be any different from any of the other churches. Very pleasantly surprised, it was unique and different to all the churches we saw in Italy and France! Must visit! The souvenir shops outside, offer the best prices if you can bargain!

Just amazing...Be careful of days closed!. THe majesty of the mosaics and the architecture is breath-taking. Be mindful of the guards who are very strict about what you can and cannot do with a camera...
Awe inspiring. Superb mosaics, wonderful colours, so much history.Strange name for a church, but well worth the visit.
Back from the dead. A 15 year restoration period was required after the communists turned it into a store house. The interior is now simply stunning.
great piece of architecture. We weren't allowed to go inside but even the exterior is breathtakingly beautiful. Unique designs and very colourfully decorated.
Church of Spilled Blood, St. Petersburg.. Amazing church! Well worth doing the audio-tour - just a few dollars (A$). Allow an hour or two - beautiful!
Well worth a visit. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood, site of the fatal woulding of the Tsar was very interesting and well worth a visit. A beautiful church with a great deal of history.
Hard to find words.... It just needs to be on your 'Can't Miss' list. Be sure and get a guided tour to help understand the symbolism of it all. Truly breath-taking.

Commemorating Victims of Terrorism. This church was literally constructed on the site where the Tsar was mortally wounded by a bomber. It was built to commemorate his life and death, but today also commemorates all victims of terrorism. The early 20th century interior is a delight, the building itself a riot of colour and design, and the commemorative plaques around the exterior walls are well worth looking at.

One stop in St. Petersburg. A place to visit that should not be missed. We visited on a weekend and the crowds were great. The interior is the most elaborate I have seen in any Orthodox Church. Be sure to avoid the market area across from the church. It's a good place to get robbed.

Russian Orthodox Church, St Petersburg. The beautiful coloured 'onion' domes, magnificent mosaics above the entrance of this magnificent church is just a taster of the interior. Every step reveals another unbelievable scene, all made with mosaics. The history of the church is very interesting, only downside is... too many people in a confined space, not for claustrophobics!!
Breath taking. One of the most beautiful and opulent church seen. Not only the exterior , the interior was amazing. Definite must go.

Fabulous Mosaics. A brief visit, but beautiful mosaic tile art. Definitely worth an hour. The name comes from the location of the location of the assignation of Tsar Alexander II, and a canopy marks the location.
Unique. Another one of the many fabulous churches I visited in my short Russian holiday. The icons are massive mosaics - a speical feature of this church.

LOVED this church... This might be my very favourite church (both inside and out) in the world. It has amazing, highly intricate mosaics, but also has these really kitsch decorations that made me smile. I don't think it is worth bothering with the audio tour, which is very long and detailed.

Stunning. Absolutely beautiful inside and out. Did not open until 11am but well worth a visit although the interior is small but the mosaics are amazing and the whole of the interior is covered with colour
Absolute gem. After spending two days in st Petersburg, viewing its unique roof from every angle, on our last afternoon our trip took us inside, we were not disappointed, worth the wait.

One of my top 3 churches to visit in the world. Not only is this church awsome from the outside but inside it is wall to wall gold mosaics everywhere. The only churches i have seen that are better are the Vatican and the Sistine chapel. Definately worth the 250 roubles entry fee.

Amazing building. It's a typical Russian-built, this church is perfect inside and out. Everything shines like gold, it's breathtaking! Saint Petersburg is the most beautiful russian city with the most beautiful European church.
Amazing. An absolutely stunning church, made even more impressive when you learn how damaged it was in the war and how beautifully it was restored. Not to be missed

Impressive. The fabulous work achieve with the mosaic. Very colourful. You need at least one hour to appreciate theinterior. Be warned thoughthere is no placards with information for one to read to understand the icons inside.
Stunning Restoration. This Church is absolutely amazing. The years of restoration has made this church a must see in St. Petersburg. The artifacts and icons are gorgeous.

A must see. Beautiful. A must see but make sure you have at least 1 hr and take your camera. The walls of the church are all mosaic panels and the colours are just beautiful. The history of the life of Jesus from birth is told all around the walls.

another amazing russian orthodox church. Definitely worth a visit. Incredible miniature tile work on huge pieces of religious art and icons. You are in awe of those people who built, and those who did the restoration work.
Beautiful!. The Church of The Spilled Blood is most definitely worth seeing! It is exquisite both inside and outside.
Iconic exterior!. I didn't go inside, but the exterior is well worth finding this very centrally located church! I believe the 'spilled blood' was that of Alexander I (or II!)

expensive!. i didn't see the cathedral because 250rub is not good price for the church! maybe it is beautiful inside, i can agree on that, because from the outside is fantastic. but still paying that much for the place of religion is greed.
fabulous mosaics. What a great place to visit, the most fabulous mosaics, bit crowded though. Fantatsic photos and a treasured memory

Excellent Fresco Iconagraphy. The best ever built a Fresco Iconography Cathedral from the ground up...ceiling and all.
This was used a morgue at the seige of St Petersburg second world war!!!
A true miracle.

Outstanding. Even in a city so full of amazing sights, stunning and elaborate buildings this stands out. Absolutley gorgeous outside and inside with every bit of wall covered in colourful mosaics. The before and after photographs of the restoration are really interesting, what painstaking work to restore it to its full glory.
colourful spires. a lovely church- resembles St Basil's in Moscow. Wonderful colours and brilliant frescoes overlooking the canal

Must see inside. The outside is fabulous, but the true beauty is when you walk inside. Beautiful mosaics are everywhere. A must see! There are lots of tour buses that only stop for exterior pictures, but you really need to go inside.

breathtaking!. One of the most beautiful churches in the world, a must see, fantastic!
Splendid details, position and architecture. I would have gone back to Saint Petersburg's onlybto see it, but there are mny other reaons to do so.

Beautiful. It is a very beautiful church. The murals and the stained glass were stunning. The alters were exquisitely carved. The story of Jesus was told beautifully them in the works of art around the church.
Pictures don't show it's true beauty. Being up close to this magnificent church is a privilege. It's beauty inside and out was incredible.

Just stunning.... As most of the reviews before say, Savior on Spilled Blood is a must if you´re in St. Petersburg. The mosaic both inside and outside are just unbelievable....I ´ve never believed that a church could be so colorfull! Unfortunately it wasn´t possible to go up to the dome, but it still was very impressing. Outside the church you can find a market (just to buy souvenirs), but it´s very expensive. You can also find some musicians outside the church - and it´s really magical to sit there, watch the sun going down and lightening the colourfull cupolas while listening to a guy playing the saw....

a must-see. Incredible mosaic detail all over the inside walls. The outside looks good but the inside is the most impressive I have ever seen. Plenty of tourist shops, restaurants and other sightseeing opportunities nearby.

Brilliant ...just as in your dreams. Nothing to dislike...go inside, it is as wonderful. Be aware of pick pockets in the market outside.
The market is wonderful...those Russian dolls are so expensive..but worth it. Make sure it is made in Russia !

Great photo opportunity and worth popping inside to see the mosaics. Not dissimilar to St Basil's in Moscow in terms of style from the outside but quite different on the inside; walls covered in mosaics and generally very bright and colourful. A tall building but not actually all that big, partly because central section of floor was/is cordoned off (presumably set for restoration work). As a result, we were only inside for about 10 minutes.
Beautiful architecture. One of the most ornate churches, beautiful both outside and with fantastic mosaics. Well worth visiting.

Incredible!. The details...imagining the time to create such a fantastic place. The incredible history-the Church was impacted by the many changes Russia has gone through.The only downside would be that it is so very busy and crowded.

Wonderland !!!. This church is amazingly beautiful. If you see the insides...the mosaics....the outside...it looks like a building from fantasy land...but that is true !!! One nice souvenir you can buy inside is a coin withthe church on one face and the head of the murdered Tzar Alexander II on the other face. It costs just under 2 $ (50 roubles)

St Petersburg Classic.... The building is fabulous and classic. The area, however, is filled with tourists and wedding couples --- so photo opportunities have to be planned well! it was a very nice stop for the first time visitor to St. P.

My favorite stop in SPB. We visited here the 2nd day of our 2 day stop in SPB. It surpassed everything we had previously seen. The outside is architecturally fascinating which I expected, but the inside was a surprise - 7,500 sq.ft. of mosaics. Brightly colored and beautiful designed, they looked like paintings. There was so much beauty inside I wish we had more time to look at everything.
From the outside it is great, but inside is amazing. Ouside it has the ice-cream cone spires, but inside the amuont and quality of the mosaics is just amazing
Best church ever. Just an awesome place. In parts, I would say better than the Vatican! The intricacies of the art and mosaic is spectacular. Such a serene place.

More Amazing than you think. The entire interior and exterior of this amazing church is decorated with mosaics. The entire thing! This is a must see. It is very crowded, but it is well worth it. The audio guide was very informative. You won't believe this until you experience it.
stunning!. Been visiting lots of churches in different countries, but this one has something very, very special to offer. Mosaics on all walls, beautiful and stunning. Cannot recommend this enough!
Great photo op!. I had no interest in going inside, but I did want to take pictures. Our guide stopped on both sides of the building for me.

It is Stunning... breathtaking... make sure you go inside!. As you are walking down the street you just glance down a side street and this delight greets you. The reflection of the Church lights up the canal and the beauty of it takes your breath away.
As stunning as St Basils in Moscow!!
Make sure you go inside too. The Mosaics are out of this world.
Must see it. A main point to see in St. Petersburg. Very beautiful inside with all the mosaics. It's worth to visit.

Amazing!. Visually like something out of Arabian Nights!
Colourful, unforgettable!
Unable to go inside, but worth the photo stop.
Exotic exterior. Just begs to be photographed from every angle and gets more interesting the closer you get to it. Superb.
My favourite place. I love looking at the exterior of this this church, the interior is lovely too. Avoid the market though, there are far nicer places to shop.

church of spilled blood. Simply amazing! There was a wedding at the time i visited. It was a beautifull sunny day which made the colours even more stunning. There were musicians playing, many people at this site

Beautiful. Over the years, we have seen many cathedrals, too many cathedrals. This one is in my top two (the other being St. Paul's in London). The mosaics are amazing and have been beautifully restored. Yes, there are are too many tourists, but what are we all? That this church survived the Soviets is in itself a miracle to be celebrated.

A not-to-be-missed. You should not miss this visit. It is simply amazing. The mosaics have been restorated and are breathless. My suggestion, is to go there as early as possible in the morning, in order to avoid organized groups. The gardens nearby are nice if you want to take a walk in the green after the visit.

Beautiful Church. Beautiful church inside and out. Be sure to go inside.The view of this church is synonymous with Russia.Ironially, i have a large painting of this church in my office not realizing it was a church. I bought it because I loved the way it looked.It was amazing to be at the footstep of this beautiful place. It has a great story behind it. It's not to be missed.

Amazing Outside - Spectacular Inside. Upon arrival outside it is one of the most beautiful views of any Churches we have seen and it gets better inside. The architecture is spectacular with a real feel for earlier times. The mosaics of Jesus Christ are stunning.As has been stated by other contributors be aware of Pickpockets.A must see venue in St Petersburg.
Really over the top. An amazing place; just unbelievable. So much construction, gold leaf, marble and decorations for someone assassinated. You can see why there had to be a revolution.

Stunning. What a beautiful building and an amazing example of what can be achieved. Best visited out of peak holiday season, when not so crowded. Probably the most photographed church in St Peyersburg.
dont miss it. I have seen photos bu nothing prepares you for the sight of the Church, it just takes your breath away, one of the most beautiful sights you will ever see.
The art of mosaic. It's not a huge church. All the walls are covered with mosaic that are telling the story of Jesus christ.It's stunning! And for art and architecture lovers it's a must I think.

Really beautiful. This church has the most impressive interior, all covered by beautiful mosaics. Our guide also shared some very insteresting stories about how the mosaics were almost destroyed during the soviet era, and were saved only by turning the churc into a mosaic museum (with cultural rather than religious appeal). It is definitely worth a visit!
Beatiful and agreta market nearby. A stunning venue and a really must if your are in St Petersburg.The Nearby market is great if your prepared to haggle the cost down.

An incredible church. Make sure you go inside this church.. It is beautiful outside but the mosaics inside are incredible. The history of the "spilled blood" of Tsar Alexander II is interesting too. Don't miss the photographic display near the exit which shows how much of the church had been destroyed and the extensive renovation that has taken place.
Beautiful architecture and colors. The church, and the gardens nearby, are a nice attraction to spend a pretty afternoon. There is opportunity of taking great pictures and enjoy the beautiful church.

Truly spectacular. We had an excellent guide with SPB tours. The church is truly spectacular, all decorated with mosaics. Alexander II was assassinated on the site, so his son built the church as a memorial to him. It took 25 years to build, but was only used as a church for 10 years after being completed in 1907. After the Russian revolution in 1917, the church was ransacked and badly damaged. It was used as a temporary morgue and after the war used as a warehouse to store vegetables etc. It was reopened in 1997 after 27 years of restoration, and is a must see when visiting St Petersburg
Awesome. This museum is very picturesque and a must-see. The interior is quite phenomenal and the exterior is the most popular photograph ever.
nicer outside than inside. This is one of the most famous churches of St Petersburg and the exterior is lovely. But the mosaics inside although impressive and beautiful look a bit too ''new''
a must see. it was very crowded but worth it just the time of year for tourists we had a great tour guide so got the history would recommend a guide

Unique Russia cathedral. Very first time visiting Russia Orthodox church, very impressed with the church building and inside icons. But church is a place for worship, how to manage the crowd, becoming a tourist spot is a tough challenge..

What the Tsar's could do if they wanted to. This is a remarkable memorial to the assassinated Tsar Alexander II. If you have a guide who can explain the engineering and construction feats it is even more impressive. This is what a Tsar could create if he wanted to. A remarkable building well worth the visit.

church of the spilled blood. unusual name for an interesting church. the architecture of the structure is beautiful. seeing the tombs of russia's czars was fascinating . very crowded with tourist trying to see all the that the sanctuary holds.
Best church in St Petersberg. Amazing mosaics inside and photos and descriptions of restoration with English text. Well worth a visit.
BEAUTIFUL!. A lovely Church, although we could only view the outside. Very 'Russian' and so clean! Well worth a photo-stop!

Stunning. Inner is mind blowing, the exterior still shows signs of the bombings in war time. The story of the church helps to understand what you are looking at then go to the Peter and paul church to see the burial site. Good gift shops inside have angry Russian ladies who speak no English. They scared me away so I bought elsewhere. Museums usually are more expensive than the regular shops. What an amazing place.

Stunningly advanced. Considering it's age, this wonderful monument was so ahead is its time when built, and even today is so beautifully preserved and restored. Definitely worth the entrance fee, because when you step inside, it is as stunning as it is amazing. The 7,000sq feet of mosaic just blows your mind and gives you a idea of how much Alexander II was revered.

The Spirit of Russia. The Church of Our Savior on Blood was built by Tsar Alexander III on the spot where his father, Tsar Alexander II was attacked by an anarchist. The church is built in the true Russian Orthodox style, with numerous towering onion shaped domes some of which are painted others covered in gold leaf. Its style is similar to the more famous St. Basil Cathedral in Moscow's Red Square. However, this church is located adjacent to one of St. Petersburg's canals and has a beautiful public garden on the other side. It is truly Russian in both interior and exterior detail. Rather than having painted interior walls, the iconic figures are all done in mosaic - truly magnificent. No visit to St. Petersburg is complete without visiting Spilled Blood.

Just Beautiful!. We must have taken over a hundred photos just of the outside from every angle. When on our group tour, we only had time to see it from the road side that the busses park. When on our own a few days later, we walked from our hotel to the opposite side which was much better to take full photos. We also were able to go inside and spend quite a bit of time admiring the beauty.
A real highlight. The mosaics are stunning. A beautiful church, even when you're on church overload, the colourful domes are beautiful but its def worth checking out the interior.

Stunning!. Due to being on a tour and a tight schedule, I didn't spend as much time in the Church as I would have liked. It's extraordinary inside and out. A tour guide would give you the full story but your own eyes would tell you plenty about this remarkable structure.

Remarkable Building. St. Basil's in Moscow gets more attention but the Church of Our Savior on the Spilled Blood in St. Petersburg is a similar design, with remarkable interior mosaics and one of the best things to see in St. Petersburg. Surprising to us was the three dimensional quality to the domes and many of the decorations.

Out of place, yet magnificent to see!. One of the main attractions of the city and one of the few buildings with Russian architecture in a European looking city (It almost looks "out of place")! Definitely worth a visit!
Magnificent. While it is a must see from the outside, the inside is simpky magnificent. Completely covered in mosaics, it is amazing. The sudio guide is good.

beautiful church. The church is beautiful inside and outside. There is a small gift store inside that has a few things we didn't see elsewhere. This should be at the top of the list for places to see in St. Petersburg. The inside is somewhat less impressive than the outside, but still worth whatever the admission price was.
Cant miss it. Be sure to go inside, you will be in awe! This is definitely a must-see in Moscow. Be sure to check the hours because they are not always open.
Well worth it.. A must for the mosaics , the onion domes and the history as the site of the assassination of a Tsar.

Stunning and colorful landmark. And to think that Stalin planned to tear this church down ! The use of polychromed precious stones in the interior has a brilliant, almost psychadelic effect. It dazzles, and is unlike any church I have ever seen before. Almost enough to make you get up early on a Sunday morning !
Amazing. It is very beautiful outside, but I have to get in. It is impressive! Mosaics in all the walls and ceiling. Amazing.
A very unique Church. Interesting architect design, millions of mosiac decorations that compose bible stories and local saints. A good site to learn Russian history.

A must see. This wasn't high on my list of 'must sees' in St Petersburg but I have to say it's architecture and interior were stunning - fabulously coloured onion domes and great mosaics inside. It is difficult to get a good view from a little distance outside because of traffic and buildings, and difficult inside as it is, I'm told, usually just as busy as when we were there (though we didn't experience the queues to get in that others have reported, perhaps because of our guide's timing).The church was built as a memorial to Alexander II who was assassinated on this spot and it's worth checking the history and, if you can, taking your time inside to allow the groups to pass by (though they'll probably keep coming).

Amazing. Wheelchair accessible with a little help for a few steps. Crowded, as it was August. Sergie, our Alla Tour guide, was knowledgeable about the Church and had interesting historical details. Very ornate, and historically interesting. Sadly, Alexandria was found a couple of years ago and her remains were there with her family that was executed during the revolution. We paid our respects and were sorry she did not get away. However, the son and another sister have not been located.
Beautiful. A beautiful building inside and out. It was only spoilt by the number of tourists, but there's nothing we can do about that.
Just beautifull. You will like it no matter whether you are a beleiver or an atheist. An exceptional example of the Russian Orthodox architecture and art.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This building is so overwhelming. The construction and the decor took 24 years to complete! While visiting all I could say was wow, wow, wow! To experience such beauty does something to the inner you!
This is the church with the multi coloured turrets. Beautiful church with breathtaking mosaics. Your eyeballs couldnt take everything in. It was busy but you could take as much time as you liked.

Incredible!!!!. Our tour of the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood was fantastic! This is one of the most beautiful places we visited in SPB. Valentina from Alla tours was exceptional and shared all the wonderful history. This is a must see!!!!

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Visited the Church and surrounding area on a beautiful day in July 2013. The city of St. Petersburg is beautiful, clean and all the people very helpful and friendly. The Church is charming and classic-what you would expect to see in Russia. There is a beautiful park near the Church where we got a drink, a sandwich and some great nuts to munch on. Will visit again!
Beautiful church. Lot of history.. Was not allowed to go inside. It is quite a sight. We're able to get close to it, but not able to get inside since they are using it for storage.
Breathtaking. Just looking at the outside of this church tells you the inside will wow you.Another great visit included in our SPB tour.
St Pertersberg,Russia. Very crowded during peak season.Need visa if I dependant,with group ...group visaSteeped in history a very interesting city

Worth the lines. While not a big church on the inside, it is well worth the possible lines to get in. The artwork and Icons inside are truly worth the time and cost to enter. There are guided tours available, and you are allowed to take photos.
Impressive Mosaics. The interior is a must-see and it's only about $6. The mosaics are amazing. Read up on the history of the church, it will enrich your experience.

Rivals St. Basils!. This church is must see. I didn't realize St. Petersburg had it's own colorful and highly decorated eastern style church. Built as a memorial to Alexander II by his son, the church is gorgeous and incredibly extravagant. Lot's of marble, gems and gold. And filled with mosaics.

Unique cathedral. St. Pete has nice cathedrals and this is one of the nicest. The exterior stands out with its colorful and gold domes. The inside is also impressive with all the detail that is meticulously preserved.

Breathtaking Mosaics. From the magnificent onion domes to the millions of mosaics on the interior of the church, the views here will have you using up all of your disc space on your camera! Packed with tourists at almost anytime, it is well worth the wait and the congestion to view this treasure.

Mosaics Galore!. Church on the Spilled Blood was a wonderful surprise for us. We had read the tour guides but until we got into the church itself we had no idea HOW MANY mosaics we would see. Every inch of the church's walls, domes and floors are done in mosaics. WONDERFUL. Don't miss it, it is a treat.

A Cathedral that is a magnificent work of art. The church has an exterior that is one of the finest of orthodox cathedrals. There are many many mosaics inside. The elegant church- currently a museum- on the site of the assassination of the czar is one of the great sights in St. Petersberg which is one of the great museum cities of the world. For a city with many fine cathedrals, this is the most impressive in terms of exterior beauty though St. Issac Cathedral is much bigger.

Beware the pickpockets!. This church is absolutely amazing and not to be missed. But the pickpockets are equally amazing and should definitely be missed! My friend forgot and left her backpack on her back and lost credit cards, passport and drivers' license. Within 2 hours $10,000 were charged on her cards! BUT this professional must have had a heart, left the passport and license on a table in a nearby cafe, and a waiter figured out from the exit document where we were staying and delivered it to us on his day off! That's what we'll really remember about the experience, the kindness of strangers in Saint Petersburg. We did report it to the police with the help of a local. They said they had training videos of pickpockets in action, and even knowing that, they couldn't see it happen, so don't think you will either.

Byzantime Iconography in its glory. This was a most unique church setting with Byzantine iconography and the Orthodox faith in all its splendor. This is a must see church in a beautiful setting along the canal. Colorful unique architecture and vibrantly colorful.
Stunning but small. It is a great place to visit and a must see on your trip. Be prepared for crowds. They do a good job of requiring tour guides to follow a path.

Beautiful inside and out. This ornate onion-domed church is visible from many places in St. Petersburg, and is well worth a visit. Although the exterior is gorgeous, the interior is even more impressive, with beautiful fixtures and dazzling mosaics.
This place has a soul that talks to whom who listen. I don't have this feeling often about historical places but this one talked that loudly that I could hear it all ;) Absolutely amazing <3

Beautiful but watch out for pickpockets. This church is beautiful as is almost every place in St. Petersburg. Be sure to look up at the ceilings as well as down at the floors. When outside enjoy the beauty of the spires. Do be careful as there are pickpockets galore around here. Wear a money belt!
Amazing decor. Truly an awesome church. Murals completely cover the walls. This was the place Alexander II was murdered. Incredible experience being there and so beautiful
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever been in. Well worth a visit. It was not wall to wall people inside so that was great.
Day of St. Petersburg. Beautiful and full of History. The colors were amazing and the artwork was overwhelming. Would love to go back when it's not so crowded and really enjoy it.
Gorgeous inside and out. The colorful onion domes on the outside and the fabulous mosaics on the inside. Incredible to think that the USSR used it as a vegetable storehouse.

Must see for wheelchair users. Absolutely the most beautiful church I've ever seen in my life. Good wheelchair access. Free entrance for helper. Credit / debit card payment possible. In walking distance of Hermitage.
Picturesque church. full of mosaic painting, beautifully arranged, also must see, not to miss, divine feeling and great to spend some time inside.

Beautiful interior. I've travel throughout Europe and have seen many churches but this ones interior beats them all. The mosaics are amazing and its great to wander around and view the gorgeous artwork all through the walls and roof.

Amazing Church. We just visited this church in August 2013. It was beautiful! The colors and traditional Russian architecture did not disappoint. Another nice think is the location- it's right across from a little market with inexpensive typical souvenirs and it's next to some lovely park and a palace. Definitely with a visit.

If you visit St Petersburg, you must visit this church. An excellent cathedral, with magnificent stained glass windows and statues. To me, it seems a pity that it's now more a tourist place than a place of worship. Still, in secular Russia, it's great that it is kept in good order.
One of the Most beautiful Churches I have ever seen in my life.. Simply Breathtaking. Do not miss it. Without any doubt one of the most impressive Church / Cathedral I have ever seen in my Life.

Church of Spilled Blood. Excellent and incredible. The mosaics were all done by hand!! Looks impossible to do but they did it. Many of the famous New Testament Bible stories done in mosaic. Where Nicholas (not sure, if l or ll) was shot is inside the church with a beautiful canopy over his death sight.

Absolutely gorgeous both inside and out.. The church is dedicated to the death of Ztar Alexander. The outside features the onion domes which are multi coloured. The inside is covered in the most stunning mosaics. It was absolutely stunning and a must see.

Beautiful. My favorite place. It was so much more than what I had read and it represented Russia for us.
You are left wanting to stay longer.

The best.. This is in our,opinion the best of all things seen in our trip in Moscow and Saint Petersbourg. An absolute Must, i would suggest to pass by as many times as possible to have different lights, perspectives, people and so on. Inside is at least as valuable as the outside. It is a diamond.

Great Mosaics. Closed on Wednesdays. We went by ourselves and paid for the English Audio Guide.Yes it was crowded! But what historic site in St. Petersburg isn't?Loved the mosaics. The gold detail was incredible. Burial spot for Alexander the II. Memorial made by his son.Audio tour was a little long and boring, but worth it. Skip some of it.Nice souvenir market across the street. Yes they bargain, typically not more than 20% off.Nice a huge park next to this site.

Highlight of our short time in the city. We were in town on a cruise and only had two days to see as much of the city as possible so we booked a tours and this was the best stop of the 10 or 12 sites we visited. The church is iconic on the outside and is really what we think of when you hear the term "onion domes". Brightly colored, it stands out from the other buildings in the area and for us, looked like a beacon on in the skyline. The area around the church gets pretty congested with buses, cars and limos milling around and there were lots of people walking around but it wasn't overly difficult to get some good photos for the church. There is also a small market across the street for trinkets, and snacks. If you walk through the market to the end there is a bridge over a canal that has a good view of the church.Inside the church is amazing. The detail and sheer amount of mosaics will take your breath away. Photography is allowed and there is some natural light but it is somewhat difficult to get great photos unless you have a fast lens or an extra flash. Plus it was very crowded making getting enough distance to compose photos well. Still, it is one of the places you have to see when in town.

Another church. It looks great on the outside, so I expected better on the inside, a bit disappointing, and again was really crowded so that may have clouded my judgement, much smaller than I thought it would be as well. Really just another church with a prettier outside than some.
Beautiful. Just what you expected to see in Russia - beautiful onion dome. Unfortunately it was closed so could we could not go inside.

My favorite church, Mosaics galore!. Loved the history behind this church, the colorful and very Russian exterior, but especially the mosaics that covered every wall and ceiling. Do not miss this church!
How did they do it?. All that mosaic is really amazing. Thank God, although Stalin signed the orders to have this beautiful cathedral blown up, it never happened. It is really a treasure to see.

Beautiful inside and out.. This was a beautiful church and we enjoyed the visit. It was extremely crowded the day we went but we really enjoyed it. It is not a particularly old building but it is stunning inside and out. There is art on almost every surface inside and it has been fully restored. Photography is allowed. The natural lighting is beautiful but makes photography difficult. Buying tickets and getting in was quick and you can see everything in less than an hour. There is a gift shop inside and a snack bar and pay restrooms in the square.
Beautiful. We walked here by ourselves the inside was truly impressive.The icons and architecture were well worth the walk. Alexander II was assassinated here and there is a memorial over the spot.

Stunning. This place is stunning inside out. Inside are all mosaic...it is like San Marco basilica but in a different color...built in honor of Czar Alexander II...the good king who was slain by terrorist...we went there with a guide...
A must-see. No where else like this one! Try to visit when there are fewer people, it is very popular. Small but spectacular.
beautiful church. exquisite mosaics. wonderful history of Russia here and the important of the Eastern Church. Beautiful church and surroundings

beautiful. It was beautiful inside. It is hard to believe that is was used to store food during the Communist Regime. It has been beautifully restored. It is definitely worth a visit. The outside is outstanding also.
Spectacular. Different from any other church we've been to - go and you won't be disappointed, beautiful inside and out.

Stunning architecture inside and out. I hadn't seen pictures of the interior of the church, so it literally took my breath away when we stepped inside. We found the audio guide useful, but some of the 'numbers' were very long. It wasn't too busy on the weekday we went in, but there are large groups being taken around, so try to avoid being there at the same time if possible! There's not much more to say other than it's absolutely worth the entrance fee.

Not just another church. Another St. Petersburg "must see". With iconic "onion domes" in a riot of colors on the exterior and a stunning interior, this church is a real attraction and worth battling the crowds. Watching all the tourist buses try to park is always fun. While we there several wedding parties came for photo ops and that, too, was very interesting.
Beautiful but.... but overpriced given how small it is inside. Still, it was beautiful! Maybe even extraordinary if a bit crazy.

A masterpiece.. When you turn the corner & see this museum it is just eye popping, we paid to go inside and was glad we did , even though the money we paid was a bit steep, for the 10-20 mins it took us to see. Every wall, every ceiling done in mosaic , it is just so beautiful.

Beauty and History Combined. This unique church with its incredible onion shaped domes and beautiful mosaic interior is not to be missed. Situated on a beautiful square with a canal running beside it provides a fitting setting for this magnificent church. The history associated with the killing of a Czar on the grounds provides intrigue to this church. Some tour groups do just a drive by which is a tragedy because this church is worthy of at least an hour to visit.
Breathtaking. This Church is absolutely beautiful both inside & out ..... There is a small fee to see the inside, but it is worth every cent!

Candy-roofed wondrousness. This is a church built in memory of Czar Alexander II who was assassinated on the spot where the Church is built. It is a wonderful amalgam of colours and styles which work well. A riot of colour and shapes attract he visitor inside. It is VERY busy and the entrance is a bit of a lottery not to get separated from your group. Once inside the beauty of the place is revealed. Saints Angels and other biblical references rise above the mere mortals who are gazing at the beauty and dignity of the interior. The designs are not frescos but are made of mosaics due to the damp nature of the surrounding environment. It is a breath-taking place to visit and you will be touched by its beauty and the effort which has gone into worshiping God and the Assassinated Czar. A must see when in St Petersburg

A beautiful building with a sad history. This Church was built by donations from the community and people on the site of where Alexander was mortally wounded by socialist revolutionists in 1917. A beautiful monument to such a sad moment in history.
Worth Seeing. This is included in the SPB tours not only for the historical importance, but beautiful architecture and decor.

Most Impressive Church. The architecture and history of this magnificent structure is worth seeing. We had a short wait before entering, but it gave us an opportunity to take pictures of the outside of the church.

Russian character par excellence. Talk about over the top! This is it folks. But it's appealing all the same. Nothing succeeds like excess and the Church of Our Savior was designed to wow. Be sure to visit the inside of the church to see amazing mosaics and paintings. Of particular note to me were the columns: solid malachite and lapis lazuli. Definitely a must-see in St. Petersburg.
Awe Inspiring. Don't miss it! The architecture is stunning and the mosaics inside are jaw dropping. Simply fabulous!

A truly beautiful building. Whilst this has a very interesting history history, it's worth seeing just for the sheer beauty of the building. I could have gazed at it for ages. Inside the building is covered in mosaics, making it worth visiting as its so different from the RUssian churches that are full of icons.

First impression. WOW. From the outside to the interior, the design is colourful. Definitely worth the time to explore. For one of my first sights of St. Petersburg, it set the tone for the rest of the vaction.

WOW impressive. Only visited the outside of the Church given the limited time in St Petersburg and that we were on an organised trip, but its truly amazing and not to be missed. Would have liked to have gone inside but time didn't permit. Also be careful of the pickpockets who operate in this area.As you stand in front of the church go to the flea market over the road for some bargains, but haggle and you will get better prices!
It is Russian!. It is worth seeing! It is well over the top - but fantastic! Well worth visiting - and taking photographs - so that you will remember what it was like!
STUNNING. My children and I absolutely loved this incredible building and they are not hug fans of church visits. Unique and stunning!

AMAZING. Beautiful from outside and inside. It`s very impressive and a must in St Petersburg.
You can see the church from many places of the city, which makes it more amazing.
very beautiful. the icons painted on the walls and dome are beautiful, and there is the place of the spilled blood of the heroe
Can not imagine how this was done.. One of the most beautiful and unusual churches I have ever been in. A must see whether you are into churches or not. You won't forget this one.
WOW Must See. Incredible, full of details and history. Never seen something similar to it. It’s incredible how they did the decoration and paintings in wall and ceiling with small tiles.

Incredible - Must See. Well, we've been in hundreds of churches all across Europe and while the pictures of the outside of the church epitomize Russia, we assumed the rest of the church would be like most of the rest. In fact, this is an excellent church that adopts many styles inside. There are some great gift shops selling icons, etc. in the interior and words simply can't do justice to the outside. One of the more amazing things we found about this particular church were the shell marks on the outside marking its place in history. Watch for pick pockets on the outside.
Must See. This is one of, if not the, most spectacular church you will ever see. A friend told us not to miss this and he was right.
No wonder there was a revolution!. The awesome mosaics were so lavish...it's an understandable and visual demonstration of why the peasants revolted against such ostentatious works.

What's to say but "Wow!". Built in 1883 on the site where Tsar Alexander II was mortally wounded by an anarchist’s grenade this amazing church is rich and elaborate, the exterior being a confection of highly ornamented onion domes, the interior being a feast of gorgeous mosaics and inlaid marble.After the Russian Revolution the church was ransacked and looted, sustaining serious damage to the interior. It was closed in the early 1930’s in danger of demolition before being used in WWII as a temporary morgue. Subsequently it was used as a vegetable warehouse. Then to add to its colourful history in the 1960’s they found an unexploded WWII bomb in the cuppola. It’s clear that this church was meant to survive – and is well worth a visit. At 250 rubles per adult it’s cheap! Be awestruck by its magnificence – from the marble to the mosaics to the glorious wrought chandeliers.

Just Another Church. A lot of visitors, but you can see it's best features from outside. Beautiful architecture on the outside, and a lot of history, but not much to see inside the church in my opinion.
A must see. This church is a must see. We were able to go inside. Both inside and out were worth the experience.If you have time this is a must if you are going to st petersburg
Another Must See. The exterior is one of a kind, Iconic. But the inside is amazing. Huge vaulted ceilings with every wall painted with scenes. immense inside....inspiring
Christina Boonzaier. This is so spectacular! Beautiful and awesome. So much to take in and admire. Highly recommended. I took a lot of photos of the inside and outside which is very ornate.

A post card of St. Petersburg. The name is due to the fact that it was built in the exact spot where the Emperor Tsar Alexander II was killed.It was almost demolished during the war and days after. Today became the most famous post card of St. Petersburg, The channel from the Neva River pass by her side, completing the fantastic atmosphere and arquitecture. It´s a romantic stroll around the church, and if you´re getting married, bring a "locker", lock it in bridge´s rail, over the channel, and key is thrown in the water.

A very interesting church. From the outside, this looks like something that might be in Disneyland. However, it is a very spectacular place. A Tsar was murdered at the spot where the church now stands. Besides the very interesting domes, the inside is filled with wonderful mosaics. A great place for photo ops.
Interesting history!. We like the story of this Church, and while inside , although full of tourists, you can feel certain connection with the past. Hard to explain but worth a visit!
Must see. Simply amazing - a must see even if for just a quick visit. You will be disappointed to not see inside

Wonderful, highlight of the visit. Best part of our St Petersburg tour. Church is very beautiful, it's worth the trip. Even better, after the visit you can take a boat trip through the canals, 100 meters from main entrance.
Great outside, very good inside. Remarkable church and something well worth seeing. When you go inside, its a bit smaller than from what you expect when you see it from the outside.
What a gorgeous church. I don't mind too much about the history but among the +- 15 churches we visited SP and Moscow, this one is in the top 3 for sure

Magical! church*. This is a beautiful church with its architecture & onion domes.
It has a truly "surreal" quality, like something more akin to a magical land! Then again St Petersburg has a few magical experiences to behold! Go & see for yourself!

Takes your breath away!!!. I visited this church 3 times recently on a cruise to St. Petersburg, I just could not get enough of it.It is absolutely stunning.The first time was on a city tour where we had plenty of time to photograph the exterior, the second time was on an evening waterways cruise and the third time was a visit specifically to this church to view the interior as well as the outside. It was constructed by Tsar Alexander 111 on the site of the assassination of his father. I really cant decide which I prefer, the interior or the exterior, both are mind blowing and are the reason I made the trip to St. Petersburg.

A stunning sight!. This Russian Orthodox church, set by the canal, is an amazing place.We visited at 8.30pm, when the evening light on the colours of the building was very spectacular.The 350 roubles entry fee ( approx £8) to see the interior is well worth it-every square inch is covered in ornate and colourful mosaics.A very special place, and a must-see in St Perersburg.

Impressive outside and pretty good inside too. The outside is a glittering array of colours and is so photogenic especially when looking down the canal at it. We also went inside and the marble floors are very good. The walls and ceilings are totally covered in intricate and impressive mosaics. Looking at the photos inside you will appreciate the restoration that has gone in to this fine building.
Beautiful. Gorgeous inside and out. Out favourite church in Russia and definitely worth the entry fee to see the breathtaking mosaics inside.

Worth the visit. During our time in Russia (two days in St. Petersburg and one day in Moscow), we had the opportunity to visit the church on two occasions. The first time was during our discovery as we were strolling through the city. This church was top on my list of churches to visit and I was happy to spend time amazing to see such a work of art. The second time we visited the church was with a cruise ship tour. I thought the church could not look any better, but with the sun glistening off it, it was a sight to behold.In addition to being able to see this incredible sight, our tour guide provided an extensive history of why the church was built. The story made the visit priceless!
Breathtaking. Simply the most beautiful church that I have ever seen. Well preserved. Very ornate inside. The outside photo op is the quintessential view of St. Petersburg. Must-see.

A work of art. The exterior of this church is only rivaled by its interior! The art work would be incredible in and of itself...and then one notices that the amazing illustrations are not painted on at all, but the product of millions upon millions of tiny mosaics...

Best of the best. Any whirlwind visit to SPB is likely to include a series of churches. Te Church on Spilled Blood is the most stunning of the usual group. The exterior is disjointed and asymmetrical, yet definitely appealing. The interior is awesome. Soaring ceilings covered with incredible mosaics are everywhere. The church was converted into a museum of atheism, during the communist period. It also was nearly demolished at one point. Today, it is somewhat chaotic with a virtual flea market inside, but it is beautiful. Include this one on your itinerary.

Wished we stayed a bit longer.. We visited this beautiful church on the 2nd day that our cruise ship was docked in St. Petersburg. My friend and I were looking forward to this church because of how beautiful it looked from the outside. For some reason, our Russian guide walked us through for only about 15 minutes without giving us time for pictures outside the church. We decided to stay a little behind to appreciate this beautiful church. The mosaics inside the church was even more amazing than the facade. I wished that we could have stayed here longer.

The most incredible church I've ever seen. This church is unique! I've not seen nothing similar in Rome, Paris, Sarajevo, London, Copenhagen, Helsinki, Oslo, Jerusalem...It is all made of mosaics and precious stones. The front panel is from salmon colored Italian marble worked in high relief with two doors all made in precious stones. It is astonishing.If you go to St. Petersburg, you have to go there! It is a must see.

Russian architecture at its best. Nothing to dislikebeautiful from outside and inside. Looks like postcard from outside and very impressive art on the walls inside.our guide constantly warned us to be careful about pickpockets
Stunning. Stunning building, can't believe the mosaics, gold etc. take time to go around several times to try to take everything in!

A must see!. A beautiful church with magnificent architecture, both inside and out. If you go to see this Church, I would recommend doing so with a tour guide so that you can learn about the history that goes along with it. Well worth a visit and I would certainly go back!

Must see. Amazing that so much has gone into a memorial church. The outside is beautiful and the mosaics which cover the inside fantastic. Worth visiting with a guide for additional information/history.

Must Visit. We visited this church once in the afternoon. It was mind blowing. We visited again one early morning. It was extremely nice without the crowd and we took our time to appreciate the artwork. The interior was equally impressive.
Stunning. I haven't been inside the church but the exterior is amazing. The church stands above the river, there is also a park nearby. A must see in St Petersburg.
Magnificent. This church was magnificent. It was well worth the visit. The outside is amazing. The inside is interesting. We went with a tour guide who was able to describe the history.

Spectacular Church. This is WOW, and place of loss and dreams. The internal of this church is mind blowing and one just cannot fathom the amazing mosaic work. We spent 3 hours inside, so much to hear and see. The outside is just as the pictures show like a fairy castle. A Must see .

ICON of a building - you must see this !. Visited here during a Baltic cruise with Princess. Took a tour with Alla Tours direct - much better value than with the cruise line and a much smaller tour group.
WOW - what can l say - staggering place. Fell in love with St Petersburgh - will definately be coming back.
Amazing church!. This church took my breath away! The colors were so vivid. It really shows the true beauty in Russia.
Incredible Mosaics. You must go! The mosaics are incredible and it is difficult to believe that this church is rarely used beyond that of a museum!

Yes!! A definite inclusion for any St. Petersburg visitor!. The historical significance of this special museum makes visiting it a necessity. There's lots to see but you should definitely include it on your agenda. Try to get there as early as possible to beat the crowds.
incredible must see. this is an amazing church - would definitely include it on a downtown tour of St Petersburg. great photo op too!

Very little to see once you've marvelled at the mosaics. It's as expensive as the other Cathedrals but it's not all that big and once you've take all the photos you've wanted of the very picturesque mosaics, you'll probably end up leaving.It's worth seeing at least once, but I don't think I'd be bothered to pay to see it again. I preferred St. Isaac's Cathedral and think it had more to offer.The park beside the Cathedral is lovely for a stroll before or after a visit and it's not too far to get the the Field of Mars or Summer Garden from here; or Nevski prospect in the other direction.

Mind blowing. This Church is like no other. It is overwhelming with icons, colour and light. One could say it is overwhelming on your entry and takes your breathe away. it is mind blowing. It is a Russian gem.
Stunning!. We visited in the evening when it wasn't busy... what a place! I cannot describe the interior, you have to see it to believe it. Worth every penny of the small admission fee (and more!).
An amazing building. The church is quite spectacular with its coloured turrets. It is certainly worth a visit as it is quite unique and is typically 'Russian'.

Fantastic. This was the highlight of our recent visit to Saint Petersburg.the frontage and onion domes are truly magnificent. we were fortunate during our trip to view the magnificent interior of the church and I would strongly advise anyone visiting to see inside the mosaics are truly amazing.one thing worth noting is that men should remove their caps when entering the building or you will be asked by the staff to do so. The church draws large numbers of summer tourists but is well worth the visit but do not forget to see both front and rear elevations. and the market across the street where you can buy gifts for friends back home .
Wow!. Doing mosaic myself I could not believe how intricate and beautiful this church is on the inside and outside. It is truly a work of art! Unbelievable! Though crowded it is still worth seeing.

Amazing. This was one of the highlights of our recent trip to St Petersburg. The artwork and craftsmanship is amazing. We visited as part of an organised tour with Alla but felt we had sufficient time to have a good look around.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Awe inspiring. This Church represents all of Russia in its greatness and beauty. It is the living attraction that symbolizes Russia as does the Eiffel Tower to France. So breathtaking that I purchased a local artist's rendition at a wonderful small art gallery while there in St. Petersburg.

A must see in StP. Don't leave StP without seeing this gem, both inside and out. Appreciate the fact that much of this city was bombed during WWII and needed restoration. The mosaics here are unparalleled.
Church on Spilled Blood. Highlight for St Petersberg and as good as any picture you have seen of it. Very colourful and has flea market in adjacent streets.

Go early for nice photos. The metro stop nevsky prospect is up the street from this church. If you go early you will beat the crowds and get great pics. Otherwise, there are lots of people coming off the tourist buses.

Fantastic. We visited St Petersburg on a cruise in July 2013 and were amazed to find the temperature was quite high touching 30c. On our first day there we joined a boat trip on the river and canals and saw some wonderful sights. Back on land we then went to the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood, what a fantastic place it is. We took some lovely photos of the onion domes of this church and they looked amazing against a beautiful clear blue sky. Inside was a revelation, the walls and pillars were decorated from floor to ceiling with wonderful holy pictures created from tiny pieces of mosaic. It is so difficult to adequately describe this building, all I can say is if you are in SPB you MUST visit and see for yourself!!!

The most beautiful church we've ever seen. We visited many impressive churches and cathedrals on our Baltic cruise, but this one blew us away. The incredible mosaics could be viewed for hours and you still wouldn't take it all in.
wauw. we have been ın may ın St. Petersburg. ıt was lıke a first seight love. you can not miss to be there

Don't be imprudent. An incredible Church built on the exact place where the Emperor Alexander II was assinated, because he was impruden enough to come out of his carriage while being targetted by a bomb. Nowadays, what you should worry about are the pickpockets. So, don't be imprudent (like I did!!) and enjoy seeing this incredible Piece of Art.

Great for photos, watch for pick pockets and other cons.. Very interesting exterior , great composition and color for photos. Just be aware of cons working the area. My adult daughter & grandson come close to being targeted by pick pockets. My daughter grabbed her Purse close and said NO. They left. For photos it's the best of St. Petersburg. There are a number of quick service Restaurants around the area. And, a number of benches to sit for a moment if you wish.
Beautiful. Could take all day to check out all the mosaics in here. We weren't going to go in initially but we're so glad we did.
Amazing architecture and artwork. As with most of the things we saw in St. Petersburg, this Church was over-the-top in terms of decoration. The story behind it (and its name) was quite interesting.
Beautiful..... It is so beautiful outside, and then you go in, and it's even more beautiful. A must-see! It's great they allow you to take photos inside!

Amazing!. This church is absolutely amazing from the outside, with huge onion bulb globes that are brightly coloured. Its history is fascinating and in the surrounding area there is a park which is good for a quiet rest.

Phenomenal. This is the best building I've ever been to. The coloured domes are so beautiful and the interior is made all of mosaic. It does not take long to look around but if you go go inside as the interior is more beautiful that the outside.
Take a picture. Beautiful outside but not worth $10.00 admittance. There are many church's you can go in for free. Difficult to get a good picture inside.
amazing from the outside. I will not get tired of looking at this church. So beautiful; unfortunately, we did not get the chance to go inside.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood and the Singer Building. Incorporated in a bus trip visiting this church was a highlight as well as 2 hours free time of which I headed straight for the famous Singer Building on Nevsky Prospect, famous for the Singer Sewing Machines now a very good book shop but go upstairs to the cafe and find yourself a table near the window and you are directly across the road from Our Lady of Kazan cathedral.Order red caviar and blinis, when in Russia........... A bit pricey but well worth the experience.

Awesome. The outside of this church was incredible, very colourful and impressive. There were several "just married couples" coming to the church and gardens to have pictures taken. Lots of curios and typical tourist junk. The inside was a bit overdone and blingy for a church but still very impressive. I preferred the St Isaacs church.

amazing. The colours and design on the outside are fantastic !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Then you go inside amazing... very humbling and serene

Amazing. I've never seen anything like this. It's beautiful. 250 roub each adult well worth it. It's busy inside with lots of tour groups but you can find a spot to stand back and soak it up. The outside just as magnificent.

Stunning. This is beautiful, in fact it is more impressive in many ways that St Basil's in Moscow. Well worth a visit. You take photos, and the interior is beautiful. ANother great post war restoration.

Magnificent church. This church, built to commemorate the assassination of Tsar Alexander II, has magnificent iconostasis and biblical pictorials on its wall. Definitely a must see if for nothing elsebut its external architecture.

Amazing mosaics- how'd they do that!. This was one of our favorite stops! Although our tour guide kept calling it 'Church of Spilled Blood' the mosaics are incredible and the whole time you are thinking HOW did they do that...and then also, how could they have stored vegetables in here at one point?( You'll hear...) must see.
unbelieveable. The domes, the colors, the fairytale-like quality was great. The quality of the inside artwork was also beautiful.
Church first policy would be nice. This is a church built on the site of the assassination of an emperor. Why charge so much for admission?
Spilled Blood. I loved the architecture of this building. The outside is breath taking. The inside is filled with mosaics. In my opinion this is a must see if you go to St. Petersburg.

Most Amazing Mosaics. This Church is beautiful inside and out. The outside has colorful onion domes atop it's many spires. Inside are some of the most impressive religious mosaics I have ever seen. A must see attraction when in St. Petersburg.

Worth a visit. I am not into religion, but respect those who are. I can still enjoy various churches and like to see how they are built. Inside this church you will be surprised at how beautiful it is. The small fee is worth it. You won't be disappointed.

Awesome. The most beautiful building we saw in our stay in St. Petersburg and Moscow.
Really worth the money you pay to get into.

Is new old as beatiful as old old?. This church looks very old but dates from the early 20th century. Inside it is almost completely covered by mosaics.The atmosphere is definitely associated with the late middle ages churches elsewhere in Russia, but it is new.This faced us with the tricky question above: after visiting many old churches along the so-called Golden Circle, is this church as beautiful as those with their often withered paintings?

4 Aussies in St Petersbugh. The mosaic art work is breath taking. Truly an artistic and cultural must visit. Wheelchair access difficult but not impossible as there is no large central entrance. The central dome mosaic is most impressive. Slightly more crowded than other venues .

This is a beautiful and unique church. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood was a beautiful and unique church. The exterior is reminiscent of churches located in Moscow that are brightly painted and have architectural onion domes. The church was very crowded on the day that we visited. However, n the winter there are no lines and very few visitors. There is a very nice gift shop near the exit to the church.

gobsmacking, awesome. Grandeur, art, colour, architecture, religion, sadness, impressive....amazing church. Don't forget to look at the ceiling. and look what's under your feet. Wherever you are in the church in or outside .LOOK and SEE ...Its the labour of blood and tears and now the incredible beauty and joy for the eye, for us to enjoy

The Church on Spilled Blood doesn't disappoint. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood was the visit I looked forward to most - and it didn't disappoint. The exterior architecture is breathtaking, and the mosaics inside left me speechless. This was my favorite stop during our two-day tour of St Petersburg.
Go See It!. This church has such great history. You see that terrorist attacks is not new to our day only. The church is beautiful in over the top splendor and offers a great photo op opportunity.
WOW. OK the outside is an architectural wonder but the interior is wall to wall to floor mosaics. Simply stunning, worth the few dollar admission.
Amazing!. Amazing church. The paintings and the icons worth the visit. One of the best we visited in Russia. Price is really decent for the beauty you will find inside!

Magnificent with a caveat. The Church is truly a sight to behold, and reminiscent of Medieval times. Spend time to see each section in order to appreciate its magnificence. The vendors and hawkers surrounding this attraction detract from the overall appearance, with some bold enough to approach and offer their products. The general area is truly a madhouse, and especially on the weekends. The nearby park adjacent to the Russian Museum is a welcomed sight afterwards, if one seeks some degree of tranquility.

Awesome.. The colours are excellent. It is a place you have to walk round silently as it is so awe inspiring. Unfortunately too many coach parties doing St Petersburg in a few hours!- usually from a cruise liner. I liked the market of souvenir stalls outside where you can bargain happily.

Looks good on the outside. This church looks pretty darn good from the outside, but charges high admission prices during the White Nights with no additional obvious benefit.Entry costs R250 (R150 for students with ISIC), but during the White Nights, costs R350 with no student discounts. As a result, I did not enter the Church (most reviews say that best part of this church is the exterior, and the exterior can be enjoyed for free).I chose to spend my cash at the St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow (which looks better on the outside, has so much more history than this, and is less discriminatory).Still, if you're not going to Moscow, and/or you feel that it may be worth paying to enter at least one stunning looking church, let this be the one.
Fabulous inside and out. The mosaics in this church are one of a kind. It was fascinating! Love it, well worth the extra time to go in.

A beautiful church. To imagine that this very large building has almost all inside walls and ceilings covered in mosaics! And the floors intricate inlaid marble - one can only marvel at the devotion of the builders of such a wonderful church!
Amazing in real life. couldn't stop taking photos of the colours and many many angles in this wonderful building. We went to a concert in it, marvellous echo-y acoustics.
Must See. Amazing architecture outside and beautiful on the inside. The history is very interesting. Just doesn't seem to fit with your conceptions of cold war Russsia.
Majestic architecture and great location. Loved the building and architecture stunning inside. We did not spend lot f time inside but the history was fascinating.
