Amazing mosaics/murals. Had a much shorter queue than the Hermitage, and therefore much more appealing. Has some incredible history, as well as being a lovely "onion" domed building.

Small and amazing. The outside is well known for its brightly coloured domes. Inside is another thing. Every space is covered by marble or stunningly beautiful mosaics which contrast with the simple cobbles where Alexander II was killed.Another St Petersburg must see.

Beautiful cathedral. There are tons of cathedrals to visit in Europe. This is special in that the site of Tsar Nicholas II's assassination is commemorated. The very pavement stones and sand where he was killed are on display, on the ground, surrounded by a balustrade. Beautiful architecture and mosaics on the walls. Definitely worth a visit. The walls are literally covered with mosaics, quite a sight.

A feast for the eyes. I think this was my favourite church in St Petersburg. It overlooked our hotel and we kept walking past it, but not visiting. I am so glad that I finally went in because it is exceptionally beautiful and a triumph of restoration after the damage it sustained in WWII. That said, it was packed with tourists and difficult to negotiate because of the crowds, but well worth the effort.
Incredible architecture!. Don't miss this church during your stay - the architecture is beautiful and the inside is amazing as well!
Must see in St. Peterburg. Make sure you go inside the church and look at the murals all done with mosaics. It is amazing.I believe the tickets are cheaper if you go after 6:30 pm.
Spilled Blood. A side of history we never learned very much about. Alexander guided us through the place. Pointing out the highlights that you could spend months inside and never see it all.

A feast for the eyes. A beautiful almost chocolate-box style yet still imposing. Ornately decorated from top to bottom. Taking photos in the sunshine, just about every inch of gold glistened and sparkled. So many architectual details to see it is almost too much to take in. A more subtle colour palate than St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, and in many ways far more beautiful. Stunning mosaics. The most beautiful church that I saw on my entire trip.
Spilled Blood Church. Just beautiful.The murals & walls are just grand. It is amayzing to see all of the old churchs. You must go inside.
A truely wonderful place. Not only is this place extremely beautiful and historically significant it has possibly the most spiritual feel of any of the other Orthodox churches in St Petersburg.
Brilliant inside!. This church has a fine history but is also breathtakingly beautiful inside. The walls are covered in gold and paintings within this and the ceilings are a work of art on their own.

Dark and Forbidding. Church was dark under the thunder clouds above with the forecourt wet from the recent rain. Made the story of the 'Spilt Blood' more real.The site is great with the gardens abutting the Church.Entrance fee was a little steep but well worth the visit.

Wow!. This is an awesome church. I totally recommend a guide who explains the history as you go through the inside. It basically started out as aa memorial that turned into a shrine that turned into a massive church. The mosiacs inside were incredible...such precision. I have no idea what it cost to get in sinceitwas included in our tour, but it is worth it! Do your self a favor book a tour and it will help avoid the lines and you will learn a lot. We did SPB but there are other good reviews on teip advisor to determine which one is right for you!

Get there early or tiptoe through the tourists. The Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood will appeal to anyone who has an interest in beautiful, dazzling gold and lapis lazuli mosaics. The church's onion domes are straight from a fairytale. Anybody going to St Petersburg ought to see this attraction: it is just lovely. I would, however, go early so as to avoid other tourists: tiptoeing around people waving their cameras in the general direction of the ceiling and debating ISO and apeture (in various languages) might reduce any sense of peace that the place moght otherwise engender. It is not open on Wednesday and does not appear to be a working church.

Not to be missed. We visited the Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood recently and absolutely loved it! The outside was remarkable and had amazing detail. Inside the mosaics were so beautiful! They are not to be missed. I would highly recommend it.

Visit inside and out. History, faith and architecture combine in this one package. Worth the visit. Make sure you walk around the outside as well as visiting the interior, taking the time to read the proclamations, and taking in the exterior design, before or after visiting the restored interior.

Stunning. The church is truly spectacular, with mosaics spanning nearly every inch of the interior. Even its exterior is incredible. If you have the chance, pay the entrance fee to go inside (just ignore the crowd of people).

A magnificent 19th century church built in traditional Russian style. Reasonable entrance price (about £6/person) to see superb mosaics on all walls and spme overwhelming interior artwork. Like all Russian churches, it's deceptively small inside, compared to the huge exterior, but well worth the look, which will take only about 20 mins. In a quieter part of the city centre, just off the bustle of Nevsky Prospect, so rather less crowded than some places and fewer coach parties! Right next door to Russian National Museum (Art Gallery).

Spectacular, historical church. This church was restored and reflects the effort made. Outside and inside are incredibly beautiful and look totally authentic. It received its name as it was built on the spot where Czar Alexander II was assassinated. This is a must-see in St. Petersburg.
Amazing. The architecture was amazing. There was nothing there that I disliked. In any crowded place, you must be aware of your wallet.

Magnificent Russian Orthodox cathedral. The Cathedral of the Resurrection of Christ, also known as the Church of Our Savior (Spilled Blood) is utterly magnificent – majestically domed outside and glorious within, featuring opulent ceilings, intricate mosaics that mimic paintings, and spectacular icons.
Breathtaking. An amazing place but very busy, only go if you're with a group getting in is much easier but check how long you will be in the church there is a lot to take in.
Breathtaking. This was my reason for visiting St. Petersburg and I was not disappointed. Can't believe they used it to store grain, it's covered in mosaics and is just breathtaking.
Ornate Beauty. Although we were there at the absolute height of the tourist season, we were able to have a few moments here and boy was it worth the pushing and shoving.....lol.

spectacular view from outside and inside... set besides a narrow canal. although in a crowded part of city, the setting lets it shine. very photogenic place. inside is also grogeous and worth buying a ticket. Most amazing was to see how much effort was made to restore the church in recent years and yet it looks so authentic.

My absolute favorite of all St. Petersburg. The colorful onion dome and the church being entirely mosaic make this my favorite church of all the places I have visited - and through Europe, I have visited A LOT of cathedrals and churches. It is just so different than the western style church that really took me by surprise. I love this place!
Very beautiful church. Its located on moyka river and garden on the side. Amazing inside. U can also see brides there. Check the date as I remember its closed on monday

Beautiful!!!!. A must visit!!! If you dont have a guide, make sure to do some reading prior to visit, its a beautiful historical place, the line was not too long but it was pretty crowded with big tour groups, dont worry you will enjoy the beauty no matter what. Plenty of souvenir booths outside, some restaurants and a park where russian museum is located just next door.

Breathtaking. An absolute marvel and architectural masterpiece. I think I could literally stand and just gaze in amazement. The inside is just as amazing as the outside. Absolutely a must see while in St. Petersburg.
to be seen. not only from outside as the beauty of those ceramic as just great inside... Decoration, stone carving, a church who will amaze you

Typical Russian beautiful church. I love to see this Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood in every season. It's lovely in hot summer day and in foggy winter day. It was built on the same place where the Russian Tzar Alexander was killed.

Beautiful. This very ornate Russian Orthodox church stands out and can be seen from a street off the Nevsky Prospect.It was built to commemorate the assassination of the popular Tsar Alexander II.It really is a stand out and is similar to St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.

Highlight of St. Petersburg. I happened upon this Orthodox church while roaming around the St. Petersburg canals around 10p.m. on a Tuesday. The area was deserted but then this church popped up in front of us. It was unlike anything I've ever seen before, so beautiful and magnificent. This, to me, is the reason to travel to Russia. I would recommend seeing this first over the Hermitage!
magnificent. I do not have enough words to describe the beauty,and craftsmanship of the work both inside & out of the buildings.They have left a wonderful impact on my memories of Russia

BEAUTIFUL. This is definitely more than just another in a long line of churches and cathedrals that you visit while in certain parts of Europe. The decor is breathtaking from the ceilings to the magnificent windows and floors. I also liked the fact that they incorporated the blood splattered sidewalk where a much loved Russian was murdered into the floor of the church. It's different from the usual run-of-the-mill tale behind so many churches. It doesn't take more than 15-20 minutes to visit but it is definitely worth the time. Speaking from experience even non Christians will enjoy this church.
psychedelic. Sounds odd, but as a child of the 60's that was my first thought when I entered this church. Spectacular mosaics, more colorful than St Mark's mosaics in Venice.

Absolutely breathtaking. It was an amazing experience visit the church. The exterior is a marvelous Russian style construction. The interior has a stunning colorful, all walls and ceiling are covered with small mosaics representing passages from the Bible.

Unbelievable. Beautiful on the inside and outside! Gorgeous glass mosaics, one of the most breathtaking sites I have ever seen! You could spend hours studying the panes. What craftsmanship and talent!

Escellent architerture!. Amazing place, we opted for audio guide and went by our selfs trough out the building. We had such a placer to listen to a group of tenors right at the top, brought tears to our eyes.The crowds again can be to much.
A must see in St Petersbourg. excelent photo opportunity, one of the landmark in town. there is a market near by where you can buy lots of local souvenirs

Breathtaking!. Inside and out, this is a must-see when visiting St. Petersburg. I would recommend that you go later in the day to avoid the crowds but even with throngs of people, it does not diminish the experience. Definitely get an audio guide.

Fantastic Religious Mosaics. The quality of the mosaics is outstanding and impressive. The colors and workmanship in honor to Alexander 1 was a high tribute by his son. Be prepared for extreme crowds as their is no crowd control. Difficult to hear our guide and hard to shuffle around the church. But I did take unbelievable pictures inside and outside.

Magnificant mosaics. Not to be missed. With its ornate coloured domes this seriously rivals the more famous St Basil’s in Moscow, but of the two, the interior of this church wins hands down. The mosaics incorporate 20 minerals and semi-precious stones plus enamels and coloured tiles. Interesting history too – hence the name. Unlike most of the attractions in St Petersburg we found it relatively easy to avoid the group tours and admission queues (we went late afternoon).

stunning interior. The exterior of this famous church is beautiful. The interior is stunning. By all means, buy a ticket to go inside. If you see only one cathedral inside, this should be it. Brilliant colored mosaics cover the walls, ceiling, columns. The floors are gorgeous inlaid stone. Don't miss this one.

Fairy tale church in the middle of St Petersburg. We were advised not to go into the church, but we did and are very glad to have done so. If you like mosaics, this is the church. From the outside it is to Russian Churches what Neuschwanstein in Bavaria is to castles - a 19th century fairy tale vision of a Russian church.

Don't miss this Church. This is a beautiful Church, not to be missed on a trip to St. Petersburg. There were long lines to get in but it was well worth it. Its so unusual. Plus hearing a chanting choir on a Sunday afternoon was an extra treat!

Stunning mosaic interiors!. We were debating about whether to go inside or not given this was near the end of our trip and we we'd seen so much already. But it would be a mistake not to - the interiors are stunning. You can get nice views of the church from along the canal from Nevsky prospect or from the rooftop of the Kempinski hotel (worth a splurge for dinner/drinks).
Amazing. The building's outside is striking but you MUST go inside and view the amazing mosaics. The entire space is covered with beauty.

My most favourite building in St Petersburg. If you have an architypical idea of what a Russian Orthodox church looks like - then surely this must be it. DO NOT PASS THIS BY - put it on the top of your list of places to visit in St Petersburg. You will not be dissappointed.

The Mosaics were amazing. The entire church walls and ceiling are covered in mosaics depicting the life of Christ. Their is also an amazing golden alter screen which is enthralling and held me spellbound looking at its amazing craftsmanship and beauty.

Amazing Church. This was probably the most beautiful church I've ever seen and I've been to lots of european cathedrals. The mosaics are just amazing. My favorite of all the things I saw in St Petersburg.

Impressive church / museum. The mosaics are truly stunning, but be prepared to pay to see them. The church is actually managed as a museum, hence the hefty entrance fee. That said, while the exterior of this church is impressive, the interior is just mind boggling.
beautiful. an absolute must go inside as the inside is just as beautiful as the outside. spend some time looking at the mosaics as they are unique check opening and closing times

A very special church and a must see in SPb. There is a lot of history in this church. The history is that this Church was built on the site where the Tsar Alexander II was assassinated. The church was dedicated in his memory. You can see the exact spot where he was assassinated.

One of the main sights of St. Petersburg. It is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city of St. Petersburg. The architecture of the church harks back to medieval Russian architecture (called Romantic Nationalism) and I guarantee you will not see anything like it in another place.
It's worth the visit to take a couple of pictures!! You do not need to spend much time there.
Amazing. You can only visit the inside of the cathedral during the evening in the summer. It is a little expensive, but incredible.

Death spot of Czar Alexander II. Within this fabulous church is a canopy which marks the spot where Czar Alexander II was assassinated. It would appear that he failed to listen to the discontent of the masses and paid for it with his life. The work to create the intricate mosaic work within are tremendous. This is a photo opportunity which will fill you with wonder and will be difficult to surpass. At 250 Roubles it is a venue you must include in any visit to this beautiful city.

Just gorgeous. This is 100% tourist attraction, purely museum that is not used as a church. Indisputably must-to-see attraction in the city. Built in memory of Emperor Alexander II the church was aimed to remind Russian people about divine origin of Tzar's dominion in Russia. And about impermissibility of Tzar murder.Highly recommended for a visit.However there is a lot of tourist groups in a day time. If you're individual - come after 7 p.m. You can see all the same but in the empty cathedral. Very impressive.
Piece de Resistance. A remarkable piece de resistance of religious architecture and now just a museum it is worthy of a if visit.

Amazing Russian Church. An amazing church with a tragic but amazing history. Beautiful architectural details. Wonderful color palate - an explosion to the senses. It is remarkable that it survived the 1917 Revolution, Communism and the siege of Leningrad.
Beautiful Building. This edifice shows the wealth of the tsars and the skill of the craftsmen. A beautiful place to visit.

Decorations Unlike other Churches. Pictures of the church interior do not convey the size and vastness of the wall paintings. The paintings are unique, colorful and dazzling in scope. It is definitely a place to visit while in St. Petersburg.
Beautiful Tiled work. The church exterior was colorful and breathtaking but the tiled interior was unbelievable! The mixture of colors and artwork depicting the gospel was inspiring.
A must see in St. Pb.. Awesome. Not to be missed. Must see it. No one should visit St. Pb and not see this one. Wonderful. Spent two hours there in July, 2013.
Not into churches. Interesting history, pretty architecture but nothing terribly special about the place. Not into churches. Nice location.

Definitey worth a visit. I've been to magnificent churches all over the world, and sometimes they start to blend together. This church, while small, is completely covered in mosaics which are stunning. Definitely worth the admission price and different from the Vatican-esque painted/marble churches. Unless you are the type of person to stand there and study each mosaic in detail, I don't see spending more than 15-20 minutes here.
church of the spilled blood. One of the most beautiful religious buildings ever! Colors and shapes that impresse our mind in a very special way. A great esthetic experience!
Another beauty. Another must see, the history is interesting so either buy a book or go with a guide. Found it hard with the camera I have to get it all in so brought a postcard.
Astounding!. Very pretty church, a good angle to take a picture is to let the canal show in the frame. One of the highlights if you are visiting st. Petersburg

beautiful architecture. beautiful church in the middle of the city.we were able to find our hotel by finding the church domes on the skyline.beautiful mosaics,painttings,floors......there is art in every centimeter of the church.......

wow. this is often photo graphed as one of the sites in St Petersburg, and no wonder. Beautifully enamelled decorations on the outside and mosaics like you have never before seen on the inside. It is jaw dropping. In a city full of awe inspiring over the top decoration, this one is right up there. Hopefully you can get good lighting to take great photos.
Iconic. Easy to get into just a bit crowded - avoid the coach party times. Get a coffee down the street and sit in the park until things quieten down

Great Photo Stop. This is a brilliant group photo stop as the church as a background is stunning. Pay the small fee to go in and check out the tiled mosaics. It really is an art gallery inside and worth visiting.

The most beautiful church I've ever seen. Well, the title of my review really says it all, this is for sure the most beautiful church I've ever seen. Both the outside and the inside of the building are amazing, and you really should take your time while you are inside the church because every detail is simply awesome. In the souvenir shop you can by a paper model that is a replica of the church that you can build at home (not easy to do it, takes a lot of time, but the end result is really beatiful). Got myself one, so that I would always remember this awesome place!

MY VIEW. This amazing church is a work 0f art.visually it takes your breath away , the gold and coloured domes give it a fairytale look,and the colours inside just continue and all the more stunning when you find out they are very small mosaics the time and patience required to have done this must have been incredible .Like all the wonderful churches and palaces in this fantastic city the craftsmanship is to be admired. The canal flows by the church and if time permits take the river and canal cruise you will have a spectacular view of all the buildings.

Dont miss this church. This is a beautiful church that was dedicated in honor of Alexander II and I son the site where he was assassinated. Started under Alexander III and completed during the reign of Nicholas II. every inch of this church is a work of art form the delicate mosaics on the exterior to the icons and beautiful paintings inside. it's sad that during the revolution, the Bolsheviks ransacked the church but much of it has been restored.

Exquisite decor. Also known as the Resurrection Church of Our Saviour, built where the Czar Alexander II was murdered.The exterior is exquisite featuring gilt and enamel decorations, in the classic onion domes. However as the immediate area surrounding the Church is heavily built up, and worse the coach / car park with diesel engines grinding away does nothing to enhance this busy spot.Also according to our knowledgable local guide this is a well known pick pocket area. A relaxed visit; it is not.The heavily restored interior is, of course, a beautiful sight, with icons, mosaics and ceiling paintings competing for your attention.Unfortunately we were also overwhelmed by the sheer number of visitors; the was many nationalities and as many tour guides, all expaining to sligly bewildered tourists.

Simply Amazing.. This amazing church was one of our highlights to St. Petersburg. Perched overlooking a canal, the setting is breathtaking. Walk inside the church, and any remaining breath is taken away. This is a must see on any visit to the city.

magnificent sight - inside and outside. I would recommend the audio guide for this if you are not with a tour as it is great value for £4. I knew very little about the Russian orthodox church and this one in particular. The church was very busy but when you have the audio guide you forget about the other people around. The English is very good, obviously a native speaker, and so easy to listen to and absorb. I have even learned why the domes on Russian churches are onion shaped.
Gorgeous mosaics!. Beautiful church with lovingly restored mosaics covering all of the walls. It was well worth the admission price. Make sure to visit the souvenir market behind it!
Beautiful. At any time of the day or night, one of the most beautiful building in St Petersburg. The inetrior is breathtaking and it is all mosaics.

What a photogenic site, both inside and out!. We must have taken 100+ photos of this museum, it was absolutely incredible in the afternoon sunlight as we approached from Prospect Nevsky. The church is now a museum, so dress code isn't an issue. The museum charges a fee, and credit cards are accepted. The inside of the museum is literally covered from floor to ceiling with stone mosaics, and the artistry is amazing. Leave time to view the range of mosaics as you wander around the church. The stone pieces at the sides of the altar area are also unusual and amazing. We would highly recommend a visit. Note that a small market is across the road from the entrance to the museum.

Favorite Church Visit. This church is breath-taking inside and out. A "must-see" place if there ever was one. I wasn't expecting this kind of architecture for some reason, so when we turned the building to see the church, it was amazing. The mosaics inside were incredible. It made me want to see to see more of Russian churches like the the one in Moscow.
Iconic. Unlike anything I have ever seen. A little difficult to take it all in without having a tour, but spectacular and beautiful.

My Favourite building in St. Petersburg. Loved this church. Its a wonderful photo to have. Its so Russian. The roof is amazing. The inside also so ornate. We stayed about 30 mins and took great photos. We also took great photos of this from our canal cruise also. If you go out near the gates as you exit you get a good full picture of it.

A must see in St Petersburg. I've been to lots of churches and this one still stand up among others in my opinion.The eye candy dome from the outside makes it a good photo object. The eastern cross is very unique to me coming from Protestant background. Inside you can see the beautiful mosaic in the style of orthodox, no wall left empty. If you bring a small child, then they can play as well in the park infront of the church.
Amazing church. This church is amazing all the art in it made with mosaic vary impressive never seen anything like it
Magnificent building. Just as you imagine Churches ought to look like. Best go et there early in the morning before the tour groups arrive.

Take your time .... I can see why tripadvisor recently rated Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood one of the top 25 attractions in the WORLD. It is spectacular, inside and out. The eye candy combined with the history of the Church (site of the fatal attack on Alexander II; it was almost intentionally destroyed during the Soviet era; the amazing restoration) make it a definite must see in St. Petersburg. Take your time ... go early or dodge the tour groups, but look at all the detailed mosaics inside and out: one overhead mosaic on the inside of one of the domes is a rare look at an adolescent Jesus. The exterior is also stunning in early morning and late afternoon light.

Amazing,ornate beyond description, must see. Closed on Wednesdays. This "cathedral" is build on the site where Czar Alexei II was assassinated. The marble floors are outstanding. The mosaics will take your breath away. In summer, try to go early as it gets warm and stuffy not to mention crowded.
Lovely to view.. We didn't go inside but the story and the photos from outside are magnificent. Also souvenir sellers were in no way forcing us to by anything.

If you see only one sight in St Petersburg, this should be it!. What an amazing church, inside and out! Our guide did a great job showing us the highlights of the church and detailing the history. Bring your cameras for some amazing pictures. For all you geocachers, this might be the only one you do!
Stunning.. Fascinating history and spectacular building, inside and out. The interior walls look like murals but turn out to be magnificent mosaics.

Beyond Expectations. There are just some things you have to see for yourself and you just have to walk around the whole thing. I felt impelled just to sit down on an edge and look. There were some earning some money playing music with different types of instruments-no hassles from vendors. Great atmosphere.

Make sure to visit!. Again you will be together with many other turists and not to forget the tour groups, it is a church-museum. But if you are going to see just one church see this There is so much just you are looking up. I find the mosaics over the top that I think they make every other church look doll.

Beyond beautiful. All I can say is that you are betraying yourself if you visit S Petersburg and you don't come and see this beautiful Cathedral.
It is absolutely stunning and is even more magnificent that St Basil's in Moscow.
Beautiful Church. Wow is all I can say! Exactly what you envision when you think of a Russian Church. Beautiful inside and out with an interesting history.
Gorgeous.. do not miss. This building is so beautiful and fairy-tale-like... A must see if in St Petersburg. The little shops outside have decent prices as well.

Church of beautiful mosaics. If you like mosaics, you will like this church. The outside is beautiful, colorful and majestic as it reaches into the sky. The inside is ALL mosaics. I forgot how many pieces our guide said, but every column, every wall decoration, everything...mosaics.
Another must see.. As we did a tour with SPB Tours this was one of the attractions included in St. Petersburg and it is really beautiful inside and out. Make sure to visit!

Your jaw hits the floor!. If you are going to see several churches; see this one last. The mosaics are so over the top that they make every other church look quaint. It is a church-museum so you will have swarms of tourists but there is so much that you are looking up at, you start to lose track of the people around you. It really is everything that you think it is going to be .

Magnificent Russian Church. The exterior is quite a sight, but the interior is even more amazing. Our guide was able to share the history of the church and explain about the artwork inside. She was able to make the place "come alive". Like most of St. Petersbrug's attractions it was quite crowded, but definitely worth the visit.

Beautiful!. The church is filled with incredible works of art and is really beyond description. I just wish the churches were more filled with people going to worship rather than just sight seeing. Your camera photo shots will help sustain the beauty in your mind.

very simillar to saint basil's cathedral. very beautiful and lovley church in st petersburg that that remind you Saint Basil's cathedral in red square in Moscow
I like it more than Kazan catheral.
Visit to the chruch of the resurrection. The mosaics were awe inspiring. We marvelled at the detail of the work which must have taken years to do.

Beautifully restored and maintained. The popular name is a bit morbid, but the building itself looks bright and cheerful on a sunny day. The mosaics inside have been carefully restored and maintained, though some treasures have inevitably gone missing during the 1917 revolution and its aftermath.

breath taking. The outside of the church is breath taking and so is the inside. Most of the art work inside is mosaic. Very crowded attraction and when we went there it was closed for some unknown reason so check prior to going there to make sure it is open.

Amazing. The Church of Spilled Blood is so spectacular in person. The colors of the church onion tops are like jewels and photograph beautifully. A must see in St. Petersburg, Russia. Seeing the restoration of the mosaic work inside this Church is an amazing testament of the artists in Russia of yesterday and today.Dont miss this when visiting St Petersburg. Location is good and near other sightseeing attractions.

Big Changes from Soviet to Russia re churches. When I toured the old Soviet Union we visited Leningrad (now St Petersburg) and I saw the exterior all in scaffolding and was told by the soviet guide it was under restoration (but later found out it was like that for years) and when I went inside it had been gutted and was being used as a warehouse. This was back in 1984. Near the top of my list for revisits are Kiev, and of course St Petersburg. Even then the Hermitage was awesome but the summer palace had been blown up by the retreating Nazi army so only partly restored. Credit must be given to the Soviet government as far as restoration is concerned. What they elected to restore was done with great vigor and authenticity Next visit was summer of 2012 and saw the Church once again functioning as a Russian Orthodox church and the Summer palace with its wonderful fountains all restored.

A Top Attraction. This is a must see attraction in St. Petersburg.The exterior architecture is truly amazing, the colors are just brilliant. And the interior and story behind the church is certainly a part of Russian history. Having a private guide was helpful as we could maneuver where larger tour groups were not by adjusting the sequence of the tour. This is an attraction that always seems to be crowded.Cannot comment on the admission price as it was included with the cost of the guide and full day tour.Of interest is the number of musicians and other street performers that surround the church, worthy to stop and listen or watch as appropriate.

The WOW factor. Look beyond the rigid employees and rude attendants...and enjoy the mosaics of this interesting church. I loved it...but the staff gave it a negative vibe. The church feels very Russian, and it has a lively history. The church is a short walk away from downtown, right on the canal, great area, great significance.
Wow! Very Impressive. This was the highlight of our first day in St. Petersburg. The outside is so unique and the mosaics inside are amazing. If you have rubles, the small gift shop has good prices.

Expensive but worth it. This church is always surrounded by newlyweds having their pictures taken outside and then padlocking a love token to the bridge opposite the church. Inside is colourful and spectacular but oddly dissapointing as the frescos were all redone in the 1970's so all of the scenes looked oddly Disneylandesque. As it's only a small church there isn't much to see but it is worth a look. I would say that the outside rivals the inside in some ways. Come on a late summer's evening and enjoy the vision of the onion dome spires against a sunset. Afterwards, head down the road to the famour Singer Building for a stylish cup of coffee which is like an upmarket Waterstones.

Must see. It is better to take the audio guide. Little bit too detailed but explains very good. Make sure that you push the numbers of things that you want to listen otherwise it does not stop and passes to another number without telling you.There is no long waiting line.

Beautiful church. This church was very beautiful and an amazing place to visit. The thought of all the work that went into building this, was really overwhelming. The icons and architecture is breathtaking. Very much worth a visit if your in St. Petersburg.

The background for your pics!. This is the postcard pic that you are truely hoping to come home with from Russia. We got here at the very end of the day, when our kids were exhausted. (actually one was sleeping) I highly reccommend you go here first thing before all of the other tourists and while your family is still excited and not worn-out-grumpy. You will get your best pic here! The area around this church is very "trafficy" it takes about 5 mins to move 1/2 mile in a cab. You are better off walking.
Breathtaking.. The church is easy to find, easy to navigate through. Unfortunately many things are not explained in English, so read up prior to going or get a guide to inform you.

Beautiful!!. This as such a beautiful church on the inside and the outside. This church was originally erected in memory of Tsar Alexander II by his son, Alexander III, and the exact place where the Tsar was assasinated is enshrined here. Interesting history and a MUST SEE in St. Petersburg.
Beautiful. It is amazing in the inside and the outside. You have to pay to enter but it is worth it. The church is next to a channel and you can also take a boat trip.

Profusion of colorful mosaics. After crossing the Love Bridge full of locks and witnessing a young bride and groom taking pictures with white doves the Church of Our Savior on Splilled Blood loomed before us with its vibrantly colored onion shaped domes. Upon entering the church we were in awe of all the beautiful mosaics covering so much of the churches interior. Inna, our guide told us about the placement of the mosaic pictures and how they told parts of the Bible. We've been to many great churches, mosques and temples all beautiful in their own right but this church stands out by the sheer percentage of the mosaics covering everything. I wish we could have just laid on the floor and looked ever so slowly to take it all in. Of course time was an issue but upon our return to St. Petersburg we will contact Inna for a more in depth tour of our favorite places.

Colourful exterior, amazing interior, very crowded. In other churches I've visited, the line for admission tickets generally takes a long time but once you get past that obstacle, you have no further problem. At this beautiful landmark, the line for tickets moves quickly but inside the church, it is extremely crowded. Nevertheless, it's worth it. The mosaics are stunning! Some are so expertly crafted that they look like paintings.A night-time visit might be less crowded as the big tour groups tend to visit during the day.
Alla Tour with Marina. Fantastic church. Marina did a great job of her presentation on this epic church. This is a church you will remember forever.

Must be seen. It's magnificent inside and out, don't leave st. petersburg without seeing it. If you go about 1 hour before closing time there are no queues and you will have plenty of time to see it all.

Amazing interior. The entire interior is covered in gorgeous mosaics. As the Church is actually not a church, but rather a museum and a former memorial shrine, there is no dress code. Well worth the visit.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. I'm not usually one to rave about churches, but this is a must see if you're planning a trip to St. Petersburg. Other attractions around the city have great cultural interest, but are usually very crowded. The church is amazing from the outside and just as impressive inside. It's located right across from a great flea market which is perfect for shopping.

A beautiful Church, maybe the most beautiful ?. The outside is impressive. We saw it from a block away, on a "photo op." And 6 of us decided to visit the interior the following day, as our tour did not include this church. The interior is exquisite! Do not miss this gem. The marble and polished stones form marvelous mosaics and make this a remarkable beauty of a church. Yes, the story is of simply ONE assassination, so not as fabled as other churches, but maybe the most beautiful Church we have visited.
An amazing church. It's as beautiful inside as it is outside. Well worth the time to see this church; the mosaics are just amazing. It's hard to believe this church was completed in 14 years.

Be sure you go inside..... As beautiful and colorful as it is on the outside, the inside is simply breathtaking. Mosaics built on the floor and put up in sections. Spiritual as well as lovely. A real must visit!
Church on Spilled Blood. Beautiful! Very awesome in a strict definition of the word. So unusual from typical churches although this was a memorial to one man, not a functioning church.

I'd give it 5 stars but. on the day I went, it was closed as it is every Wednesday, as was the park next door which would have been nice to walk around. Our tour group went the next day also but had no time to queue to go in (it had not actually been included in our city tour, but we pressured our guide to at least take us there for photos). However, the outside is as impressive as St Basil's in Moscow, and very similar. Also very interesting were the buskers and entertainers lining the walkway beside the canal that leads to the church. On my lone visit I spent a good hour just sitting people watching and enjoying the entertainers which included an organ grinder and a man playing classical pieces on a saw.
Beautiful Church. So beautiful and such history! We learned so much from our guide about this church. A work of art about a tragic assassination.

A little gem. I was always of the impression that once you have seen one church you have seen them all. This place changed my mind. It's more a cathedral than a church. It has a stunning interior. We have seen the cisteen chapel in Rome and although that is more famous I would rather visit this church again. Not to. Be missed

A Beautiful Russian Church. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is dedicated to Tsar Alexander II, much beloved by the Russian people, who was assassinated on the spot where the church was erected. It is a beautiful example of a classic Russian Orthodox church with multi-colored onion domes rising to the heavens. Don't miss this gem!

Incredible!. The outside is impressive, but the inside is exquisite! Do not miss this gem. The marble and polished stones with the marvelous mosaics make this a remarkable beauty of a church. The name is intriguing and the market just outside is fun!
Beautiful from outside.. This a well photographed Church from the outside, and that is probably the best way to view it. The interior can be a bit of a let-down.
beautiful. beautiful on the inside and outside. One of the most beautiful cathedrals in St Petersburg, colorful and very big

Unbelievable. You must spend the time to see this Church. The mosaics are truly magnificient. The history of how the artisans created the many colors used in the mosaics is quite interesting. Our tour guide was key to our enjoying the experience

Beautiful mosaics. fabulous. Go late late evening...for quiet & space. In summer its open till 10pm.
Avoid the mid morning visits...you only see millions of people
Beautifl Church - not to be missed. one of the top site for tourist. worth a visit. very beautiful inside. don't miss it , it is most pictured site in st. petersburg

Simply beautiful. We walked to the Church on the Spilled Blood, and it was a sight to behold and remember. The colors, the gilt, the onion domes, it was all unbelievable. We went to the park nearby and it was beautiful.

Breathless. Fantastic...amazing works, magnificent art.
Avoid buying souvenirs at the market right in front of the Church. They are three times expensive than the ones in St Peter and Paul Fortress
Church of the Spilled Blood. Hard to imagine that everything was done in mosaics. Colors were magnificient. So much gold everywhere. Very clean and people friendly.

What can you say more?. 7000-sq meters of mosaic walls! It is a breathtaking view. It is a beautiful church with strong history. Worth to check you history book or travel guide before entering the church.
We almost missed the interior because we thought that seeing it from outside would be enough. Fortunately, we bought the tickets (250 roubles each) and visited it. Outstanding.

Beautiful and inspiring!. This was a beautiful building with an interesting past. Not only is it gracing the skyscape of St. Petersburg with Gold and color, it has a beautiful park and much to see. This is a must see when you come!

St Petersburg by Cathedrals. We hit St Petersburg at a busy time and a heat wave--worst conditions possible. Lines at Hermitage were hours but one could walk right in to this amazing attraction. Don't miss it!
'Onion' Church. Visited this church while on a tour of St Petersburg. It is a beautiful religious edifice, a must see for all visitors.
Quick trip through it, but gorgeous. Just behind the Hermitage, close to the Russian Museum. If you are at the Hermitage easy to see and a well retored church.

The onion domes of St Petersburg. Built on the lines of the Cathedral of St Basil Moscow and it's famous onion domes. stunningly decorated panels, Beautiful mosaic pictures. worth going just to see them

Gorgeous Building. This was our favorite building in all of St.Petersburg...and that's saying a lot. The exterior is breath-taking with its stone work and porcelain domes. Very unusual. The interior just sparkles with fantastic mosaics. Go in the evening, after 6:00, to avoid the crowds..
Dramatic name but overblown and boring. The church is 19th century and the architecture is extremely heavy and ornate. If you love Victorian churches you will love this. I didn't.

Amazing reconstruction of a unique building. Beautiful building inside and out and with an entrance fee of around £5, under a third the price of a visit to St Paul's or Westminster Abbey in the UK, so I do not understand how anyone can complain about the cost of the visit. You do not need to be religiously inclined to appreciate the artistic merit of the mosaics and other artefacts. The interior of the church is unique compared with other Russian Orthodox churches.

Most Pituresque Church in St Petersburg. You can't help but want to take a picture of this superb church. Next to the water way, the pictures are awesome. When it is sunny, all of the great colors come out and shine, I think this is what everyone comes to see in St Petersburg. I agree it is probably not woth the 250 rub to get in because it is the outside that makes for a lasting memory.

the incredible mosaic church. The entire interior is made of mosaics, it's so beautiful. We were speechless. Difficult to explain till you come to see the real beauty. Again we took many photos at https://picasaweb.google.com/100092841543065224921/StPetersburgRussia2013

Wow and wow. Towering mosaics and unlimited opulence to commemorate the place of the murder of a Russian emperor's son. The structure is more significant than the personalities who led to its existence. It is a must see.
Church is gorgeous. The unique Russian architecture with the onion domes was beautiful. It sets on the Nevky River on Nevsky Prospect and is easy to get to.
Picturesque. very colourful inside and out, and more picture opportunities than you can shake a stick at. Its definately a must see if your ever in St Petersburg

Must visit in St.P. This is a must, spectacular both from outside and inside. Of course better by the sunshine, in this case you have the chance to see the glittering mosaics and reflections inside the church. Fabulous mosaics made in Russia, all from local artists, nothing imported. All the icons and paintings on the wall ( and the church is fully reach decorated ) are made of mosaics!! Incredible! And- every 10-15 min( depends on the qty of visitors) there is a guided tour, the professional guide will explain all the matters and stories about the church. I would give you only one advise- take you time to enjoy it, and try to avoid the touristic crowd. Highly recommended

Wow!!. You get what you see on the tin! This beautiful Church is stunning outside prepare to be blown away when you enter there is not a square inch that is not covered with the most stunning mosaics it is truly awe inspiring. This is a must see when you are in St Petersburg, Unmissable...............Enjoy

Not worth entrance fee.. This church looks big and impressive from the outside but once your inside you will find out this is one big room with the walls decorated with tile mosaics of saints and other churchy stuff. The only interesting thing about this church is the canopy over where Tsar Alexander II was attacked. Not worth the 250 rubles entrance fee.
incredible mosaics. Very ornate building - inside and out and well worth a visit to see something pretty unique. we really enjoyed it and its pretty reasonable - RUB250

Fascinating both inside and outside. Visited in June and had a clear day. The outside is spectacular up close and the inside with the mosaics everywhere is really beautiful. The artists must have had tremendous skill. We had an English speaking tour guide that provided lots of great commentary on historical details. I recommend a guide to help with the experience. One key alert is this site is well known for high incidence of pick pockets so you need to be vigilant on your person and your belongings.
MUST DO. This sight is incredible and something like I've never seen! It's very busy outside this cathedral so watch your personal belongings.

Most beautiful interior. Built in the spot of the assassination of Tzar Alexander II, this church is the most beautiful and breathtaking memorial I've ever seen. The external façade and exquisite domes are already a fantastic view, but do not miss the inside. It is ALL decorated with mosaics and marble, forming a powerful ensemble with the natural light. Now the church is actually a museum, which means you have to pay but you don't need to follow the archaic rules of orthodox churches (wear pants and women cover their heads).

Church of our Savior on Spilled Blood. We did this on our own and was impressed with the amount of Old Testament paintings. It was further pointed out that this was the placed where Alexander II was mortally wounded. He probably was the best of the Czars.

Awe-Inspiring - NOT to be missed in St. Petersburg. We've seen many great churches and this one ranks quite high. The artwork inside is staggering and to think that nearly 100% of the works are mosaic is almost hard to fathom. Truly inspiring stuff and NOT to be missed.
Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This Church is amazing and must not be missed when you visit St.Petersburg, it took my breath way. Such detail in the workmanship.
What history.... History and art. The story around churches in Russia is fascinating... We are lucky these works of art still exist...

Dramatic Exterior and Stunning interior mosiacs.. The Glowing mosaics are worth a visit to this beautiful Church, located on one of St. Petersburg' beautiful canals. There is a gorgeous wrought iron fence surrounding the site. It is nice to have a guide who can get to the front of the line!

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood - St Petersburg, Russia. The history and architecture surrounding this church site are incredible. It is an amazing site. I have visited a lot of churches in Europe and this one is near the top with its colorful exterior domes and incredible mosaics covering every inch of wall space in the interior. In addition to the architecture the building is an important place in Imperial Russian history where one of Tsars was assassinated. The fact that this structure has been restored to it original grandeur is amazing considering the Soviets used the building for storage during the communist era after WWII.
Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood. Worth the time to go see this incredible place! Amazing ceilings, domes, mosaics, architecture and history.
not what you would expect. Not usually a church visitor, we were surprised at the opulence with floor to ceiling mosaics. Another must visit.

Approach the Church When the Sky is Active!. Absolutely the most amazing church on the outside as well as inside. From the colorful domes on the outside ( visible from blocks away) to the incredible paintings and mosaics covering every surface of the inside, the visitor will be overwhelmed at times. Visit at sunset for the best ofexperiences. Just look upnand snap your shutter.
Stunning. A really beautiful building.Watch out for pickpockets around here.We were warned time and again by our guide.Unfortunately we did not go in and ran out of time.

amazing. this is something really breath taking. Never seen anything like it. We went on high season and it was still confortable enough to see everything. A unique place to visit, the mosaics are out of this world!

Spectacular. Rick your neck gazing up at the fantastic mosaics and paintings.
A truly mind blowing experience, ostentatious and overwhelming, showing the vast wealth of the tsars.

Beautifully amazing.. One of many beautiful places in St. Petersburg. The architecture is outstanding, but what amazed me the most were the mosiacs. Absolutely magnificent. So very glad this was restored.
A must see, outstanding.. A stunning place to behold, one of the highlights of this wonderful city. Visually outstanding, breathtaking, a must to experience and not to be missed.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Ramps for wheelchairs and mobility scooters allow easy access. Wonderful, colourful examples of mosaic pictures on the walls. So pleased to have been able to see this site

Stunning. The church is beautiful on the outside, but inside is truly stunning. Everything is decorated with beautiful mosaic work and not one square inch is left bare. If you go, don't forget to look up and see the ceilings.

local info on a brilliant church. as there are already over 600 photos of the church I thought I would give you local info. it has a canal on one side and a fenced park on the other and a souvenier market in front. apparently the market is patrolled but just in front of the church is not so watch for pick pockets. the park opens at 10 and has CTV. there is a mobile toilet to the left which costs 30 roubles to use. the best photo spot is on the little bridge at the back of the market.

Possibly the most beautiful church in Russia . .. This is the most amazing piece or architectural art I have seen for a very long time. Every minaret is spectacular. If Walt Disney was going to illustrate a fairy tale church it would not be as good as this. Not only is the outside of the building incredibly detailed and quite colourful but the inside is even richer. The Russian icon illustrations feature traditional gold work and intense colours. The inner roof is spectacular and must not be missed. It is worth going to St Petersburg just to see this.
Simply beautiful. Don't miss it - like nothing I can compare. Very central and easy to get to. Cant remember the entrance feed but it wasn't expensive

Beautiful Inside and Outside.. The Church is beautiful,Mosaics incredible.After the Revolutionit was used to store Potatoes!And during the War as a Mortuary.It took a long time to restore and is a very special place.

First day in St Petersburg. We only had a photo stop here on our trip around the city. This is an amazing exterior, just wish that we had been able to go inside. Good market opposite but watch out for your bags.

Magnificent church.. The architecture of this building is superb, and lived up to all my expectations, it's colours are tremendous, and along with the Hermitage Museum, are reason enough to visit this city. The only down side of this city is it's terrible traffic problems, making getting around tiresome, BUT don't let that put you off, as the culture trip is great. We had 2 hours at the Hermitage museum, which is not really enough to see it's wonderfull array of treasures.

Beautiful Church and spires.. Now this is what I pictured Russia to look like. This church was built on the place where Alexander II was assassinated (hence the name). It is relatively new compared to many of the churches in St Petersburg. The interior walls are covered with mosaics. Wow. Plenty of photo ops inside and out. Watch out for pickpockets! There is a souvenir place near here with lots of stalls. Good prices and pleasant people and they took dollars!
beautiful inside and outside. tha walls are all covered by paintings. Sometimes the hurch is too crownded bcause of lot of tourists groups

Stunning. Didn't go inside, because it wasn't open, but every single time we passed it we had to take a photo, either from a different angle, lighting (this time of year it doesn't get dark until 0200, and even then its not pitch black) or just because. This is a quintessential Russian building and absolutely beautiful.

Wow, but we only had 20 mins to appreciate it from inside.. This church is amazing. In Europe there are so many churces and it can end up hard to be impressed which is sad. But there is no problem in lack of amazement in this church. the audioguides help you further understand the symbolism of this church. Dont know if it is myth, but I was told by someone that Russia used the money they got for Alaska to build this place. The mosaics are so beautiful as is the floor patterns. It is a worthy shrine also for Alexander who had the blood spilled on the site. History might have been much different if he had lived and been allowed to continue his reforms for the people that he started. I would have loved to have stayed much longer but our bus was not going to wait for us.

This is a must see. This is a must see both inside & out. I choose a 2 day city tour from ALLA tours that included the inside and so we had a local guide. Hard to comprehend the detail both inside & out of this church- every time you look a new direction there is more to see. For photos try increasing your film speed due to the lower light.

STUNNING....Do not miss this!!!. I must admit after visiting what seemed like every church in Europe over the first 10 days I wasn't that excited to visit here and boy was I wrong. This church WAY exceeded all other churches with the stories of how it got it's name ( I won't ruin it for you) to the architecture both inside and out. It was simply amazing.....please don't miss this!!!
Amazing. One of the most amazing churches you will ever visit. Both inside and out. Could spend hours just staring at all the art work inside.
Beautiful. Well, not much else to say; it's beautiful. Thought it was beautiful from the outside? wait until you see the inside!

Well worth a visit. This is a beautiful church and well worth a visit. If the photos appeal to you, then you must see the inside. The mosaics and other details are most impressive. The church is usually crowded so be aware of other folks around you. A good guidebook is also helpful.
What a beautiful church. I loved the whole thing I am still reeling from the beauty of the place. Pity a out all the tour buses

wow !. Looking from the outside, this building is totally off the scale for decoration and the presence.
The area is choked with sightseers so plan your visit.

Impressive on the outside, small on the inside.. This building is amazing on the outside & everyone recognizes this building. I thought the inside would be much bigger, and though you can hire an audio to go around the inside of building, you can cover it all in 30 mins - or less if you read the signs and don't hire the audio. The flloor to wall paintings are really amazing however.

This is why I came here!. When my husband was trying to talk me into coming to St Petersburg, he showed me a photo of this cathedral, and I was in! Absolutely beautiful and iconic!A nice walk from our hotel, with good shops along the way. Outside are various vendors selling paintings and other items, as everyone attempts to get a photo of themselves by the cathedral. Inside is just as beautiful and breath taking! Very reasonably priced and not too crowded around the 11:00 opening time!

Mosaics. The art works in this church have to be seen. On looking closely you realise they are not paintings on the walls but beautiful mosaic tiles that are so small from a distance they look like a detailed painting. Beautiful.
Impressive!. Spectacular structure. The detail and history is simply amazing. Every wall and celling is covered in mosaic design. The pictures do not do it justice; go see it in person.
great architecture inside and out. What an experience to walk around this outside and then enter it. Amazing decorations and fixtures. Take a guide or a good guidebook or the audio-tape.
gorgeous church. Everywhere one looks in this beautiful house of worship is a visual treat. Even though it was very crowded during our visit, we were able to enjoy it greatly.

Two good guides. Having read Robert Massie's Peter the Great, we longed to see Moscow and St. Petersburg. Our dream came through recently and what a dream it was! Our competent guides (Anna in Moscow and Anya in St. Petersburg) made the visit into a memorable experience. Not only did we get to see the marvels we were only imagining, not only were we given professional explanations and smooth arrangements, but we also had the privilege of being with two young persons who live in these cities and could listen to their views about life in Russia and hear about their experiences.
Absolutely stunning. You need lots of time here, try to find a guide if one is available, the symbolism, the history and the mosaics are amazing

Overrated. We just walked up to this church, decided not to go inside from what we'd read in reviews. Our travelling companions did go inside and were very disappointed. It fails by comparison to other churches you could visit - apparently.

Unbelieveable works of art and storytelling. Even from the outside it looks amazing and can spend quite some rime studying the architecture and exterior design. But step inside and you are blown away by the work they put in to restore the mosaic on more than 90% of the walls and ceiling. Most are in reference to biblical stories but all are done extremely artistically and spectacular to see. I've been to numerous cathedrals around Europe and this is definitely Top-5 for me.
Very interesting and decorative from the outside. Didn't go in as our tour time was not geared to it. Was used as a vegetable store during the Soviet times and a morgue during the siege of Leningrad
Loved the mosaics inside.. This church has a very Russian outside and a very Russian inside so it is worth going in. We loved the huge and detailed mosaics.
Spectacular Mosaics. The beautiful mosaics covering the interior make this worth a visit, even for people who are not big fans of visiting churches.

A real highlight. Beautiful, fascinating, so picturesque. We were super fortunate to get to go inside, as we hear some tours just saw the outside. The inside is so phenomenal, it is a must to go in if you get close enough to see the outside.
History based.. Again this is a place that has been refurbished for visitors and it is not clear what the real population gets out of the building. It was built to honor a murdered tsar.
My favorite church in St Petersburg. The mosaics, the history of what happened on this site, how incredible and difficult the architecture was, and the many stories of Jesus' life.
Beautiful place. In summertime there are a lot of tourists with cameras, however in the late afternoon - the place seems pacified and quiet.
Sensory Overload. This place is filled with icons and images on every piece of wall and ceiling available. It marks the location of the murder by terrorists of a czar.

Church on the Spilled Blood. Was one of our favorite sites during our visit to SPB. It is truly amazing and our tour guide from Alla-Tours did an amazing job in bringing this site to life. Highly recommend a visit to this site.
Simply amazing. The most beautiful thing I've ever seen. The outside and the inside are just breathtaking. Definitely the nicest part of my visit to St. Petersburg.

Russia as you imagined it. This astounding church, built as a memorial to Emperor Alexander II, is now a museum and not used for services. Besides seemingly endless mosaics, you can see the steps where Alexander was mortally wounded. The pictorial of the church's restoration is very impressive. The exterior is just amazing. Actually, the interior is, too. If you can, don't miss it.

Stunning Mosaics. The mosaics are beautifully executed. I really enjoyed the bright blue tiles in the mosaics and the superb stone floors. For a sense of how much effort was spent on the restoration, take a look at the unrestored granite plaque on the back of the church. Almost every inch of the granite plaque is covered with pockmarks from shells.

Well Worth the visit. Magnificently restored and full of superb icons with great emphasis on the spot where the emperor was killed ... hence the name Church of the Spilled Blood ... lots of people - go early in the day to try to avoid crowds
Beautiful. Definitely rent the audio, it explains everything. Don't worry, not every point of interest is as long as the first one.
A must!. Absolutely beautiful place. Audio guide was pretty good or if you could get a guide that would be even better..

Perfect. The history of the building and it's construction itself are a reason good enough to visit it. But that's not all, the view of it, along with the landscape nearby makes this place something divine. The details are all over, inside and outside, from the little stones that composes the huge mosaics, until the big ornaments place all around the church. This attraction is already good enought to worth a travel to Saint Petersburga. Nothing else to describe, just PERFECT!!

What a spectacular cathedral!. Amazing exterior and interior! 7500 sq meters of mosaic in deep colors and gold is just overwhelming! When you see this church from the outside, you can't stop looking at its beautiful architecture and design. I recommend to also visit the church in the evening (outside). It’s just a dream for a photographer (see my attached photos). Remember your tripod! RegardsSvein-Magne Tunli from Bergen, Norway.

Stunning. A really stunning attraction. Built on the spot where Russia's Tsar Alexander II was assasinated by terrorists in1881. Inside the church is built a conopy, which covers the actual spot where the Tsar was mortally wounded. The interior walls are entirely made up of Mosaic pictures and icons. It is simply breathtaking, and just as stunning is the exterior. It is built on the canal embankment about 400 mts from Nevski Prospect, the main road from the Winter Palace down past Kazan Cathedral, what a view!It is a MUST SEE attraction if you are in the area.

Beyond Amazing. This is what you came here for and it does not disappoint....!! We initially saw the outside on a tour and walked back the next day to go inside which is AMAZING...specially when you read of the post WW2 restoration to its present state...!!
Beautiful. When I visited, there was a group of tenors singing. Their voices filled the church with wonderful music
See this one. The architecture and restoration work that has been done is totally amazing. A most impressive interior and exterior

Wonderful. Don't miss this lovely church located nearby the Russian Museum's park and about 150m from The Nevski Prospect. You can enter the church if you think that it's better than seeing it from the outside.Behind the church, you'll find a local market where you can buy gifts (chapkas, Faberger eggs, Matriochkas,...). Don't hesitate to haggle with the local merchants....Enjoy

The mosaics were amazing. The Church is not a working church, but rather a museum. The mosaics cover the walls and ceiling of the building, just amazing, beautiful and a sight not to be missed. The floor in the Church is made from semi-precious stone and so very beautiful. Don't miss it.
Incredible. So much to see and take in, went with Tour Guide Alla Tours, you could spend a long time in there looking around and taking it all in.
Beautiful mosaics. A beautiful piece of art. The church is covered in mosaics on the inside. It is amazing to look at both inside and out! Must see while in St Petersburg!

Beautiful marble and mosaics. The 26 different colours of marble on the altar and floor are beautiful as are the mosaics all over the walls, The outside is just as impressive with its onion domes.Well worth a visit.

A Site to See. Even if visiting churches is not your thing you need to see the Church of Spilled Blood if you are in St Petersburg. If I described it to you...you wouldn't believe it, so go see it for your self.
Very Unique and Ornate. If you are into old churches, you are in heaven with this. Inside and out is meant as artwork not a church. It was great as cathedrals go, it was a church....

A Masterpiece. This church to me is the most beautiful church I have been to. I have been to countless churches around the globe, and was amazed at the exterior and the interior. Every part of the interior was covered in beautiful mosaics. Just a visual masterpiece. A must visit!

A Mosaic Dream. Absolutely breathtaking! We've seen a LOT of churches around the world, but this one is amazing! If you think the exterior is amazing, you haven't seen anything. EVERY square inch of the interior is done in bright tile mosaic and it is jaw-droppingly beautiful! What's even cooler is they actually preserved the spot where Alexander II was killed, and built the church around it. Awesome! Do. Not. Miss.

Incredible tile work. Russia's Duomo. Lot's to see. Don't miss it. Easy to get to from Hermitage. Tiny mosaic tiles are used to make enormous and gorgeous religious pictures throughout the church. Can be a bit crowded. Go early.

It was a magnificent site.. You won't believe how beautiful this church is. When you think you have seen it all, then they take you here. I was amazed at the workmanship...........these people were true craftsman.

Mosaic Masterpiece. It's much newer than St. Basil's in Moscow; but St. Petersburg's Church of the Savior on Spilled blood, dedicated to the assassinated Tsar Alexander II. The interior is simply breathtaking, to say nothing of the wondrous exterior. Don't miss it!

or Spilled Art!. Imagine arches every two feed. Now imagine them filled, domed ceiling to floor, with iconic painting and mosaics, Add same to the walls in between. It's hard to get close enough to do the touching your hands almost involuntarily reach out to do, and that's a good thing. Nothing should spoil this overwhelming beauty. The lines move you too quickly through to begin to take it all in, so keep circling back around until you're sated or satisfied.

Beautiful outside and inside. Looks like something from the Tales of the Arabian Nights, but the Church is built on the spot where Alexander II, the serfs emancipator, was assassinated. Even in the 1800's no good deed goes unpunished! The spot where he was killed is under a canopy. The first bomb didn't hurt him but injured others, who he was trying to help...when the second fatal bomb hit. He is considered a martyr.

BEAUTUFUL CATHEDRAL. This marvelous Russian-style church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. In 1861 he freed the Russian serfs (peasants, who were almost enslaved to their owners) from their ties to their masters . However, during the second half of his reign Alexander II grew wary of the dangers of his system of reforms, having only barely survived a series of attempts on his life, including an explosion in the Winter Palace and the derailment of a train. Alexander II was finally assassinated in 1881 by a group of revolutionaries, who threw a bomb at his royal carriage. The church was built on the spot where the Emperor was mortally wounded. The church was built between 1883 and 1907 and was officially called the Resurrection of Christ Church (a.k.a. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled blood). The view of the church from Nevsky Prospekt is absolutely breathtaking.
beautiful but busy. Mosaics inside the church were stunning but it didn't feel like a church because it was so noisy. the altar was redone it gold and was breathtakingly beautiful.
Wow!. The entire church walls are covered with gorgeous mosaic. I've never seen anything like it anywhere I've been and I've been all over Europe. The church is resplendent.

Definitely a DNM (Do Not Miss) sight. This is the cathedral that you see on postcards and travel ads for St.Petersburg. The exterior is capped by ornately decorated onion domes. You can spot it from a distance in many places in the city. It looks like the very visual essence of St. Petersburg. Be sure to go inside. There are beautiful mosaics everywhere you look. The floor itself is a visual feast. If you can, go with a guide who can provide the story and history of events regarding the church. It will add another dimension to what you see.

great church. The most extensive mosaic internaly of the world. Even superior of S. Marco Venice Church. Please don't miss the souvenir market just in front of it and remember to negotiate the prices.

Awesome. You can't miss the silhouette of this church/museum as the onion domes are brightly colored. Once you enter the space, the mosaic-lined walls will leave you speechless.Note: This is a state-owned museum so paid admission is required.

Breathtaking visual experience.. Unbelievable architecture with the interior completely covered in mosaic tile from floor to ceiling. Beautifully detailed mosaic "paintings" everywhere. Should be number one on your list of things to visit while in St Petersburg.
breathtaking. There is not one of the St.Petersburg attactions that not woth seeing, they are all great and as most people will only visit once you should see as much as possible.

Bizarre!. We just saw the outside of this church and now regret not going inside but the outside is just a wonderful concontion fo every type of architecture! The colours are vibrant and the shapes just brilliant!

I do not like this place. Well it is well made (restored?), it is with a history, impressive mosaics on the walls inside, but it is too much a showcase and too little real Church.It is a "must see" object, but is it worth to stay in line to come inside, I do not think so.
Beautiful Church. This was my favourite attraction in St Petersburg and must have took 100 photos it was well worth going inside as well.

Beautiful Cathedral. The interior murals are incredible and you can use your camera. The exterior view, especially from the canal is also quite beautiful. A not to be missed destination while in St Petersburg. The only downside - very crowded.

7000 square meters of mosaics!. 7000 sq meters of mosaics in deep colors and gold - this is what covers all the walls of the inside of this impressive cathedral. Intriguing and whimsical on the outside, the interior really lets you feel you are in a different world. You are surrounded by meticulously done artwork, and the atmosphere is reverent and hushed. This is primarily a museum now, so there are no pews or other seating inside except for a few benches. The central part of the floor, being a stone artwork also, is blocked off. Definitely a must-see on your visit to Saint Petersburg.
Interesting. unusual architecture -- huge crowds though -- you could argue that the ornamentation is excessive, but it's worth visiting

Breathtaking. Absolutely must see !Never seen so many beautiful and colourful stones let alone the marvellous enamels wlls and ceilings. An absolute treasure. The art nouveau wrought iron gates all around were a gem too.

beautiful. the church of our savior on spilled blood is a lovely church in St Petersburg. It has absolutely wonderful colors and it is nice in the inside as well.Good restaurants nearby, if you are hungry.

Wonderful !!!!. When you see this church from the outside, you can't stop looking at its beautiful architecture and design. If you can pull yourself away to go inside, this same feeling continues. What a masterpiece ! The stunning art and especially the mosaics are in pristine condition will take your breath away and you haven't even started to think about all the history involved. The church no longer holds services there and is a tourist attraction only. There is a fee for entrance.

The outside's beautiful, the inside's sublime.. The outside with its mosaics and many colorful domes is charming. This story of how the blood was spilled any why the church protrudes into the canal is part of great Russian history. The interior covered with wonderful, colorful, mosaics is not to be missed, it's simply overwhelming in scale, beauty, history and religious expression.

Red October Tours. We recently spent 2 days touring St Petersburg with Red October Tours where one of the stops was the Cathedral of Spilled Blood. This is not to be missed on a tour of St Petersburg. The inside is entirely covered with mosiacs! We highly recommend Red October Tours for cruisers who wish a bit extra without the high costs of ship excursions. We had a group of 7 from our cruise which is a great number for being able to get around massive groups at all the venues. Our guide was excellent and very accommodating to our requests. Thoroughly enjoyed and recommend it!
Colour. Surrounded by colour,paintings mostly beautiful mosaics,very tactile but do not touch.Again lots of people,not a working church now a museum.

I came for the outside and loved the inside too. I have wanted to see this for years because of the photos I had seen of the outside but until I started planning the trip I had no idea that the inside was even better. Come late in the afternoon on a sunny day for excellent views from the bridge nearby.

Simply spectacular. If you only had a short time for sightseeing in St. Petersburg, then this has to be very high on your To Do List. Not a lot of time is needed, but you could easy spend hours staring at the spectacular artwork that is the very beauty of this church. The attention to detail that has been shown is breathtaking. More mind-blowing is to stop, stare and wonder - how they actually did it.One of the most unique sights I have seen around the world and a highlight of my short adventure in St. Petersburg. And if you are up for a spot of shopping, bargain hunting and haggling with the locals over the price of a Russian doll, then there is a good market across the road. Highly recommend this sight to all.

Awesome. This church is special as it is unique and has a number of special items that are unique to this site ... eg the cobblestones where the Csar was murdered, mosaics mosaics and more mosaics, the decorative onion domes and the location close to the park and the canal

Overwhelmingly impressive. The mosaics that cover every surface are gorgeous. Gold sparkles everywhere. The marble floor is an art piece in itself. Tours are all in Russian when we where there - seems they don't cater to English speakers very much

Gorgeous structure with tons of mosaics!. This was the reason why I wanted to come to St. Petersburg, & this beautiful church did not disappoint. The colors are amazing & the inside was a pleasant surprise. I did not realize beforehand that the church is covered both inside & out, in a combine total of 7,000 sq meters of mosaics, & they were beautiful. Because we were on a guided tour of the city, my only complaint is that I did not get enough time to photograph the church.
Unbelievably beautiful. Wonderfully restored church. The fabulous roof attracts you at first but the mosaics inside are a must see. Interesting tourist market outside.

UNBELIEVABLE. The one site in St. Petersburg that I wanted to see and it exceeded my expectations. I was impressed with the outside but wait until you go inside. Unbelievable! A don't miss while in St. Pete.

Stunning on the inside and outside. This was another one of the stops on our tour and it is even more impressive than St Issacs. The interior of this church takes your breath away with its mosaics and flooring.You can just stand there for ages and marvel at the work it took to build this place. Totally totally stunning and if you only see one place in St Petersburg, it should be this one.
The bigest mosaic in the world.. The church is really beautiful, the mosaic is huge 7000 square meters. Entrance fee 250/150R. It worth.

EYE CANDY!!!!. Of course this is a must-see when you're in St. Petersburg, but don't just take photos of the exterior. GO INSIDE! It's absolutely stunning and was one of my favorite places in the city! (Beware of pickpockets -- they're everywhere!)

beautiful church. This is possibly the most beautiful church in St. Petersburg. It is not a really old church, being built in honor of Alexander II, on the spot where he was assassinated in 1881. The interior is decorated with some very incredible mosaics.

Loved It. This was what i wanted to see the most and it lived up to the hype for me. It was a beautiful place and photographed well. Loved the inside and outside. It was in a cool park like location and was fabulous.

Beautiful Inside and Out. Loved this church! The outside is beautiful and so different from so many of the churches you see in Europe. The inside houses mosaic art that takes your breath away! Try to do it with a guide if you can. You do not need more than an hour to see this site. There is a beautiful garden right next to it that is a wonderful place to walk, have a picnic and observe Russian life.
