Jaw droppingly beautiful. Inside and out this is a wonder of the world. Painstakingly restored, the wall to roof mosaic is absolutely beautiful and leaves you gazing in wonder at the place. A must see in St Petersburg!

Interesting exterior!. It looks different in photos than it does in real life. The roofs look a little "plasticy". But it was a unique sight to see and beautiful in its own way. The interior is very different from the outside. It is pretty. This church has a lot of history and should not be missed!

An absolute must-see!. When I started my researches on St-Petersburg, my first destination on arrival had to be this church. It's a treasure, from the outside to the inside. This will probably be your best photo from your trip. Also, it's very well located on the side of a canal and the picture opportunities are just perfect. It's really gorgeous and the visit inside is worth it as the walls are adorned in incredible mosaic murals. Truly an amazing must-see.
Very photogenic. Beautiful iconic sight. You know you have arrived in St. Petersburg! I couldn't stop taking pictures. As beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside. Beautiful mosaics inside.

Best attraction in St. Petersburg. This church is breathtaking and not to be missed while in St. Petersburg.The intricate details and the amazing artifacts make this one of the best churches I've ever visited. I find it hard to put into words how magnificent the mosaics are that cover nearly the entire church.

Don't miss. Gorgeous exterior and interiors with numerous paintings, a stunning, very high dome/skylight and an extraordinary history, with a section that preserves the cobblestones on the exact spot where Alexander I was assassinated by a bomb-throwing terrorist.

Fabulous architecture and mosaics inside.. An absolute treasure and so different. Mosaic pictures are fabulous, our trip was hiughlighted by meeting Prince Michael of kent who spoke to us and told us some of the history.

Beautiful. The whole church is a piece of art. Impossible to miss this church so colourful outside and even more impressive inside with all the mosaics covering every inch of the church. Not to be missed.

If you think the outside's cool, wait 'til you get inside. Built in the Russian revivalist style, this church is deceptively younger than you might think, but it is a gem nonetheless. The exterior is ornate and irregular, but the interior layout is very symmetrical with four superb portraits in the corner domes, lit by the windows. The mosaics are stunning as are the iconostasis doors and the use of jasper and other colourful stones.

Not just another Cathedral!. I know officially it is a church but it practically speaking, a lot of people say - if you've seen one, you've seen them all. It is certainly as grand as any cathedral I've been in. This one is spectacular. It is covered in mosaic which is unlike anything I've ever seen. It is very well cared for and kept up. One thing - it costs s little more at night so go in the day and save some $. They have free tour guides there that leave every ten minutes or so at night (for Russian speakers only). Audio guides are there for other languages.

There are mosaics and then thers is the Church of the Spilled Blood. Be prepared to be stunned beyond belief of this incredible church and it's mosaics....and drink it up...Bring binoculars to be able to see the upper mosaics....

Gaudy. I liked the view from a distance - and had been told that it was covered in mosaic inside. That is true - and if you like bright colours you will like it! But the inside is no Monreale (a church in Sciily - utterly beautiful and peaceful and covered in equisite mosiac) but more of an asault on the colour senses.

Gorgeous Church!!. Alsolutely gorgeous church. The outside is as beautiful as the inside. Mosaics on every wallcovering every inch of the place. It's impossible to convey the beauty with a photo. A must seefor St. Petersburg.

Simply Beautiful. The mosaics and icons in this cathedral are spectacular. The recreations of Jesus' most memorable moments are simply beautiful. The history behind the church is very interesting. Highly recommend as a quick stop.

St Petersberg's answer to St Basil's. A really great buliding in a great location on the canal. Fantastic "onions" and mosaics adorn the catherdral and the main entrance door is really beautiful. Did not have the time to go inside it but - in our short stay there was just soo much to see. If you walk down the canal you can get great shots of it.

A beautiful memorial. A glorious monument to Tsar Alexander II, this church was built over the spot where he was assassinated in 1861 by nationalist aristocrats who resented his modernizing reforms, particularly freeing the serfs (Alexander is heavily compared to Lincoln). The church's actual name is something like Church of the Resurrected Savior but everyone calls it Spilled Blood. The interior decoration, aside from the altars and shrines, is entirely done in mosaic, with scenes from the Bible presented in the Orthodox chronology. The souvenir market outside has every possible souvenir you could want from Russia: amber, matryushka dolls, Soviet paraphernalia, hats, icons, etc. Also a short walk from the Russia Museum. Photo permission in side the church is extra.

Go early to avoid the crowds.. This is the church with the onion domes that feature in so many photos of St Petersburg. It is good to go with a guide so he can explain the history of this magnificent church. Outside is a very good outdoor market where you can buy your souvenirs for much less than you will pay for in the museum shops.

A Must See!. Whatever else you do whilst in St Petersburg, DO NOT miss visiting this marvellous church - it is breathtaking. I took so many photos I literally did not know where to look next - wonderful!
Amazing. Not only the outside is impressive, also the interior is overwhelming. Definetly worth a visit. Also a nice area to hang out at night in the surrounding bars and restaurants.
AN EPIPHANY. The first thing you ask your self is if that is a real church or something else. It is a mixture of a Candy House and a Cathedral. A pleasure for the eyes.

Interesting architecture. Built to commemorate the murder of Alexander ll in an old Russian style. Amazing decoration on all walls and ceilings, and preserved street cobbles on the spot the murder took place. Worth a visit.
Excellent. Great workmanship in the art around the church and every inch of the church offers another piece to look at. The centre piece of the altar is amazing and worth the visit alone
Travel by hydrofoil. Arrived as soon as fountains started, our guide took us all ver the various buildings and throughout the park.

A stunning church. Built on the spot where Emperor Alexander 2 was assassinated in 1881 when revolutionaries threw a bomb at his carriage, this is one of the iconic images of St Petersburg. Easy to get to in central St P and on the route of every hoho bus tour. Lots of space around the church, so it can be photographed from every angle and it looks fab from every angle. Closed on Wednesdays. we were fortunate to catch it on a clear and sunny day - it looked stunning.
Don't miss this one!. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is the iconic church in St. Petersburg. It is located in the center of the city and is outstanding in its beauty.
Amazing. Beautiful! All interior made with mozaïk. Really stunning. This is how I pictured Russia. A must see, really. Beside the mozaïk I loved the inside doors!
Picture perfect. On hop on/hop off bus route. Not to be missed. Plenty of vendors accross street for souvenirs. Meat Head restuarant nearby great for lunch
Pricy. Whilst the interiors of this church are spectacular, they do not detain long enough to justify the 259 rouble entrance fee

Work of Art. Amazing skill and artistic talent decorates this church with huge mosaics of religious themes. Beautiful, intricate work. Staff friendlier than most we have encountered in Russia, even getting a smile and goodbye as we left. Weather was a bit gloomy for good photos but you can have your camera out without being chastised. Enjoy the adjoining park for a stroll and reflection. Also reasonably close by in "Caravan St " kapaBAHHaR street number 7 is a quirky shop selling the work of artist from all over the country, nothing like the typical souvenir shop. The front of the shop shows stuff made from recycled bits and pieces but inside there is some fantastic work that is reasonably priced and definitely unique and funky.
Getting lost in mosaics. I have never seen such a great monument of human greatness. It is an homage to all the creativity and beauty men can create

Stunning, inside and out. I was amazed at the beauty of this church. Outside is gorgeous and you can take hundreds of pictures of all angles. It's best on a day with a clear blue sky, however whatever the weather it's impressive. I would highly highly recommend to get there as soon as it opens. I believe it is 10am in the summer. We were there just after this and the church was relatively quiet. When we exited there were lengthy queues building up and a number of tourist coaches starting to arrive, which could have ruined the serene atmosphere inside.Once in, the interior of the cathedral is equally as stunning as the exterior. The mosaics and artwork stretch from floor to ceiling. There is not a bland or dull space inside the entire building. A definite must see when in the city.

Outstanding - outside and in!. This is my favorite site in St. Petersburg, In fact, my favorite during our trip to the Baltic Countries and Russia. The outside is beautiful and the inside is just as good with the mosaics. Definitely worth the admission.

Very Photogenic. The outside is spectacular from every side. Try to get here on a sunny day for the best photos.It costs about $8 to go inside. If you enjoy elaborate, colorful mosaics on religious themes, pay the money! We only spent about half an our inside, but I was impressed by what we saw and were allowed to photograph.

Probably best site of tour. Classically Russian Orthodox Church, even though not very old. The decoration and architecture are a wonder to see - maybe other parts of Russia have better "Onion" domes, this was the best in St Petersburg.
Impressive. Like nothing else you've seen. A must visit whilst in St Perersburg. Check it out, plenty of bars around and the Russian Museum
worth a visit. remember that this church was not a public one, but just available to the royal family.... interesting history
Beautiful Church. Very beautiful church with a lot of history. The interior is wonderful and worth a stop on your trip.

Wall to wall mosaics. Lovely Buildings & Architecture the opulence is amazing, just stroll around take note of the pictures throughout they are in fact all mosaics probably the only church I have been in with so many and don't miss the floors
Beautiful inside and out. Well worth a look inside as it is beautifully decorated with mosaics.at weekends you will see lots of wedding parties having photos here after their ceremonies elsewhere.
Spectacular. A must for any visit to St Petersburg but make sure you get the story of "Spilled Blood". A photographers dream!

Most impressive cathedral in St. Petersburg. I thought this cathedral was very impressive. It's very large with intricate decorations on the exterior. It's not as nice on the exterior as St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, but I'd say it's #2.It's also very nice inside. The walls are decorated with beautiful mosaics. That was a nice contrast to most of the other cathedrals where frescoes seemed to be the main decoration. Frescoes fade more easily, and they have to be kept in dark settings to stay in good conditions. Mosaics don't have these disadvantages so they're still vibrant and can be seen in full light.
The next best to st Basil's. Will probably never make Moscow but this is a good second best.lovely location on the canals..inside fascinating and absorbing

Stunning architecture. We only viewed it from outside, but for me this was probably the highlight of all the great sights of St Petersburg. An absolutely stunning building, which I preferred to the more colourful St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. Lovely.

Important Place. Considering last Czar will killed here by Russian revolutionaries it has great significance. It is adjacent to canal and you would pass by if you take canal ride. It resembles St Basil's Cathedral of Moscow

Beautiful Church both inside and out. I got the opportunity to go into this beautiful church and was happy to pay both entry fee and the fee to tske pictures inside this gorgeous church every wall column and ceiling was painted outstanding and if anyone thought the outside better inside is crazy both were wonderfully beautiful and l was privileged to see both

An incredible example of a Russian Orthodox Church. Everything one expects in a Russian Orthodox church. Well maintained in an excellent location. Take advantage of the open air Vernisage market across the street for some good watercolors and the usual assortment of Russian souvenirs.

Most impressive on the outside. The beauty of this place is that you can devote just a short 30 minutes of your city tour to it and you'll still come away with wonderful visuals and photos - the inside is less impressive than the outside, so I'd recommend just a quick snap-and-run but it adds to the overall experience of the city!

True Russian architecture. We unluckily visited this beautiful church on a Wednesday, when it was the only day of the week that it was closed,though I don't agree with paying entry fees to churches and cathedrals as it makes them into attractions rather than shrines for worship. The striking colours and architecture hit you, as soon as you spot it, took various pics at different angles, because you can walk all around it as it is set in the middle of a cross-section. On the one side is a long busy road which heads towards the Nevsky Project-the largest and most popular street in the city; towards the back of the church is a small market area, where you can buy all your souvenirs at good fair prices- baboushkas in all sizes, different ceramic plates depicting St Petersburg themes, fridge magnets, keyrings etc etc and they also take euro! You really get a little of the "feel" of Russia here, and there is also an enclosed park next to the markets, where you enter through the gates and can go in and have a wonder around, with a river running on the side of it. A small church is across from the park, where there were many many weddings taking place while we waited for our tour bus to pick us up, as we were on a cruise and St Petersburg one of our ports of call...
A Small Church adorned by colorful facet. Beautiful building for the symbol of Saint Petersburg. It's not essential to visit inside unless otherwise you want to donate to church to save its beauty.
awesome. There are no way to criticise this place it is a must see place. the audio tour is very good and easy to use
Spectacular. Better than St Basils in Moscow? Very beautiful. Make sure you visit on a day it is open to see the wonderful interior.
Breathtaking. The Church is spectacular and the interior blows you away. Take time to look at the different images the mosaic reproduce and be carried away by the magnificence of it.

Excellent. The total trip was incredible, I had a terrific time, the places they took me to see were the best, the cities I have visited were beautiful and the train ride to St. Petersburg on the Cancah train was awesome

Beautiful church!. This is a typical Russian building - anything you would expect when visiting Russia. It has a classical, colourful outside and an even more amazing colourful inside. A beautiful sight and surely worth a visit!

St Petersburg, Church on the Spilled Blood. The beautiful exterior of this builing is certainly the most easily recognised of all the sights of St Petersburg. The Church was built on the spot where Tsar Alexander the second was killed...a bomb was thrown at his carriage as he returned to the Winter Palace, and although he was not injured by the blast, a second bomb was thrown as he tended a survivor of the first blast. The Church has never been used for a religious service. It is surprisingly small on the inside, and expect to be given a pair of plastic overshoes if the weather outside has caused messy shoes.

Loved this church. Look at some churches in St Petersburg and you could be in any big city but look at this one and you know you're in Russia. It's lovely from the outside with its colours, gold leaf, pictures, onion domes but inside it's wall to wall colour and craftsmanship. It obviously gets very crowded and isn't big but is really worth a visit. It's a heavily touristy area and we had an encounter with a pick-pocket who was out of luck as he thought my husband would have his wallet in his back pocket! It still didn't spoil our visit.

Cartoon interior decoration. Great gawdy beauty that looks bright and wonderful from all over the city but if you have seen many artfully decorated churches and cathedrals in your time (I have recently been to the painted monasteries of moldavia, Romania most of which have been restored sensitively and faithfully) you will find the inside restoration (while impressive in sheer scale of the 20 odd year piece by tiny mosaic piece feat) unsubtle, dissapointing and not worth the large entrance fee. Think black outlines and modern cartoony faces. Glitzy though.
Fantastic Church. it costs to enter but it is a wonderful experience and worth it. We did not have a guide and this may have been a mistake as limited English notices inside.

Must see!. Completely renovated, Alexander ll killed here, what a monument to him. Oozes opulence inside and out. A lot of extremely hard work put into it. Is about £6 to enter, but the exterior is free. Would be willing to pay more after seeing the interior.
Quite the Story. Much of this church has been restored. A private guide is quite necessary to get the whole story of its existence - ours gave a fascinating rendition. Can get quite crowded.

Breathtaking. If you have chance spend some time here and really take in the architecture, the gemstone pillars and the stunning mosaics on the walls of this church. They have some unique gifts too in the church for sale (that we didn't see anywhere else). Enjoy time in the park across the road as well, it is a very peaceful place.
Breathtaking. The building is purely breathtaking inside out. Completely renovated, the inside of the church is an absolute amazement!

historical site. Beautiful mosaic images as well as housing original part of the road where Alexander II was killed which was apparently covered in his blood. Amazing building to look at both inside and out.

Worth the visit. This is something that should be mandatory for any trip to st petersburg, or its just dumb not to go. It's easy to get too, doesn't take much time, and is free (the exterior). You don't have to be into religious stuff or churches to enjoy it, it's just something that awes with the amount of effort that has been put into every detail.

Out of this World. We liked the Hermitage. We LOVED the Church on Spilled Blood. No one told us that the inside is not painted...all the stunning art is made of tiny, little mosaic tiles. No wonder it took 25 years to build. If you go here, you won't regret it.
Even better inside.. Spectacular from the outside and amazingly unique inside, this church is really worth a visit. FYI I think that it is closed on Wednesdays.

More than I expected it to be!. I was very excited about visiting this church - it seemed to represent Russia (for me). I wasn't disappointed.The exterior is beautiful and the mosaics covering the interior walls are absolutely incredible.

Classical cathedral. The onion domes in Russian architecture make this cathedral a real standout. The interiors are good but not as jaw dropping as some others. But a great picture postcard exterior across a river in St Petersburg

A must see. From the outside a cross between high church and Disney, but it works. Inside some fabulous mosaics from floor to high vaulted roof, lovely little historical chapel inside too, so much history in such a small space. If you're in St Petersburg this is a must see. A great place in a city with so very much to offer.

Unique!. The exterior is stunning but the interior is even more incredible! Every piece of wall, ceiling and floor is covered in what appear to be paintings, but are really beautiful mosaics. The audio guide was very useful. One of the most impressive architecture I have ever seen!
Beautiful mosaics with a calmness you can touch. The scale and art of the mosaics is breathtaking. This was my third visit and it would difficult to tire of this must-see wonder.
Must to see. The best place- you must to see! This is real Russian bealty in old moscovities style Church with a great museum exposition inside.

Golden cupcake. Reminds me a bit of the Kremlin due to the cupcake shape and color of the building, but once inside religion kicks aside politics and showcases itself head on in golden mosaic and doors of gems. Don't forget to close your mouth after you leave this building...

Look up in awe. The church has recently been totally restored to its full color and historic beauty. It is overwhelming! Very much worth the entrance fee. Don't forget your camera, but do not use flash.

Every aspect holds your attention and the inside is incredible. A real focal point, worth approaching from each aspect and the inside is spectacular, the mosiacs have been reviewed so often superlatives can only be confirmed with our visit. Make sure you visit the St Peters and Paul Cathedral and St Issacs to put this into perspective whilst in St Petersburg.
Photo op. Wait for the sun to shine and then take a hundred pictures from all angles. You will marvel at it's beauty.

Church of onion and garlic. First Russian style church of our trip, drew our attention because of its shape and architecture. A very nice small church, interior very different compared to ones in Western European countries. There are man and woman dressed in Russian costumes for you to take pictures with.

A Highlight of our Visit to Saint Petersburg. Very beautiful and unique church. The exterior is a marvel from a distance, and the inside is incredible for its mosaics. Entire walls appeared to be made of mosaics. We were short on time, so I did not take the audio tour, but inside this church I did buy the DVD of this cathedral and Saint Isaac's Cathedral for viewing later. I consider this church a must see if you are trying to catch the sights in Saint Petersburg.
Boring.. Just another church with for me, no sense of history, although the decor was to marvel at .I wanted it to explain Russian history ...it didnt for me .

Beautiful and Unique. The exterior is the archetype of intricate Russian decorative architecture and the interior is filled incredibly beautiful mosaic images of religious and historic topics. Do not miss this unique and beautiful site!

Beautiful & great for photography. On my first visit I thought it looked like Moscow's St Basil's Cathedral from photos I saw - may be smaller version. It was located on a lovely street by the canal. Definitely worth a view!

Over priced - its a church!. Not to my taste at all - you have to admire the craftsmanship that is truly stunning - the marble mosaic floors and the overpower wall and ceiling mosaics - but it is a one-trick pony and over priced at 250 Roubles - if you have the time and money visit by all means but I wished I'd used the extra time in the Hermitage!

An image you'll never forget. A brightly coloured and gold onion-domed church which is set alongside one of the many canals which are a feature of St.Petersburg (it is referred to a the "Venice of the North"There is a charming outdoor market close -by selling tourist souveniers.

Excellent place to watch religious history. Stunning beautiful church. Good english mobile sound guides. How much work it took to build this. Amazing. And the church have a violent history. Less than 100 years ago it was used as storage for food!

Simply amazing. Even though I've seen many churches and cathedrals, this one is among the most amazing ones. Apart from its fairytale look on the outside, the interior is stunning. Everything is decorated in mozaics instead of murals so that it looks very fresh and the colours are vibrant. The style is also very interesting as even though done in the 18th century, it's very comic-book-like. It appealed to me and I think this church is a great place to take your kids to, as the mozaics from the New Testament will speak out to them. The have a very contemporary feel. The rest of the interior is equally fascinating - the Italian marble on the floor and the iconostais' made from semi-precious stones. Overall a must see.Now a little deliberation on the English audio-guide. Do not take it if you are pressed for time! It makes the tour last 42 minutes and it's mostly to a very specific naration by what I presume is a Russian speaker who tries to do the British English and speaks unnervingly slow with large pauses between single words and sentence intonation clearly more natural to Slavic languages. It gets half of the playing time to get used to and is kind of annoying. Thankfully the Church is an amazing experience itself so it does not prevent me from giving it the best possible rating.
Unmissable. The whole of the inside of this place is covered with hundreds of mosaic scenes covering basically the whole of the New Testament. Worth every rouble of the entrance fee.
WOW!. This cathedral was absolutely magnificent. The entire interior is mosaics. Truly stunning. My favorite interior of all cathedrals on our trip to Russia.

Don't miss this--as famous as the Hermitage. Not only does the exterior overwhelm you with its picturesque and colorful domes, but the interior frescoes and alter area should not be missed. Be sure you read the history behind this great cathedral. On Saturdays, the bridge next to it over the canal has bride-after-bride to be photographed with the church in the background.
Beautiful in and out. Gorgeous exterior and most beautiful mosaics inside the church. Quite spacious as well - worth a visit.

One of St Petersburg's most beautiful buildings. In addition to the beautiful architecture (Russian style) and location (next to a canal and the Summer Garden), it has a historic annecdote attached, like many places in St. Petersburg. Alexander II was killed on that spot. Donations from people of all classes around Russia (Alexander II had abolished serfdom). The murderes were soon arrested, and in the same building where that happened, Dostoievsky was laying on his death bed, but that is a different story...The church never actually was inaugurated. During World War II it was badly damaged, and was restored only after the end of the Soviet Union.
Biblical History in Pictures. What at first glance appears to be paintings are in reality all mosaics. This church is spellbinding as well as its history. Certainly a "Must See"

Fabulous mosaic interior. We loved this church. The height of the ceilings, and mosaic tiles are unbelievable. We enjoyed all the interesting photos of the church after WW2, and the restoration process. The painstaking work that went into this is incredible.

Amazing. Well, I, myself do work in churches (not orthodox though), well and this is one probably one of the most magnificent churches i ever visited in my life!The details and beauty can hardly be described in words or pictures... If you are in St. Petersburg its a MUST to visit this one!Mosaics like in this church are to me not known!

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. This church was a must see as advised by my niece who is a Russian instructor and has been to St. Petersburg many times. We were there twice during my trip and the second time we went inside. Magnificent! All the gold is just beautiful. Spent time at the market across the street.
Beautifully decorated shrine. Lovely church which apparently isn't really a church. I've never seen such beatiful mosaics. I thought the entrance fee a little high

The Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood. The magnificence both the exterior and,especially, the interior of The Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood is extraordinary. The interior is quite possible the best of any church in Christendom, Unique and beautiful. . This Russian-style church was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated In St.Petersbug. The church was built between 1883 and 1907 and was officially called the Resurrection of Christ Church (a.k.a. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood ). The construction of the church was almost entirely funded by the Imperial family and thousands of private donations. Both the interior and exterior of the church is decorated with incredibly detailed mosaics, designed and created by the most prominent Russian artists of the day . Most of the buildings in St.Petersburg are classical in style and the whole city has an Imperial feel to it but his marvelous church is like something from a different planet. With its colourful Onion Bulb Domes and mosaics on the exterior it could very easily not work but all of the pieces fit beautifully to make a very imposing building. If you are impressed by the exterior you can only be blown away by the stunning interior. The interior was designed by some of the most celebrated Russian artists of the day . An elaborate shrine was constructed on the exact place of Alexander's death, garnished with topaz, lazurite and other semi-precious stones.The church contains over 7,500 square meters of mosaics - according to its restorers, more than any other church in the world. The intricately detailed mosaics depict biblical scenes and figures, with fine patterned borders setting off each picture. The mosaics are quite simply magnificent, in no other church interior anywhere is there sure splendor with every inch covered in priceless beauty and stunning icons .

Awesome onion dome church. This is what I thought about when I think of Russia. We didn't go inside but we walked around the outside and took amazing pictures. You can tour the inside for a fee. We were on a cruise tour so didn't have time. If we did have time we would have gone in. This is one of the most impressive churches I have ever seen!!

Beautiful. Beautiful architecture!!!this is a must see in St. Petersburg. It's also good as its located right near the Hermitage museum and also the souvenirs market, where you can get a nice Matrioska!

This church was beautiful, and I loved it.. This church was beautiful, and I loved it. The hubby and I splurged on an audio guide and shared it. I enjoyed learning about why the church exists, what it was used for during Communism, and how the religious mosaics are supposed to relate to the Tsar’s life. Tickets are $250 Rubbles/Person and Church opens at 11 A.M (note, these could be winter hours).

Incredible and awestruck. Withut a doubt, this is one of the most impressive and extraordinary churches I have ever been to. It is mind boggling how much work and artistry went into building this church. I had a limited time to visit so unfortunately did not get all the information necessary. I felt so amazed and joyful at the brightness and awesome colors displayed throughout every detail. It is indeed worth a second and third viewing.

Beautiful to look at. The inside is small but for $8 not that expensive. The outside is a great photo too. If you are at the Hermitage the location of this place is almost right behind it. Stand in front of the entrance to The Hermitage and it will be around the corner on the right side of the building just a few blocks.
Stunning!. Beautiful amazing building! Nothing more to be said! Part of a bus tour so busy wen we were there but definitely worth the crowds!

More beautiful and ornate on the inside than the outside. The interior of this church is extraordinary and well worth the price of admission. If possible, find a guide to the interior decoration before your visit.
Incredible mosques. The outside speaks for itself but the inside is incredible - covered in miles of mosque and precious polished stone.
Unique sight. Nestled just off of Nevsky Prospekt, this church is a beautiful sight. I especially loved my visit after dark, when it was lit up.
Mosaic, mosaic, mosaic!. It's nice to join a guided tour, especially when the guide speaks good English and knows every piece of history related to this church inside-out! Stunning mosaic work!

A Beautiful Russian Orthodox Church. This church is filled with highly ornate mosaics and icons. Exquisite workmanship. We had a Russian tour guide who was able to explain the history and art work. It was built to honor a Russian royal (Tsar Alexander II), who was assasinated at this site.

Enjoy St.Petersburg. The nain attractions were The Hermitage,The Church of Spilled Blood and The Winter Palace which is some distance from the city.There are interesting things to see everywhere in the city center. The housing of the people in very spartan apartments.Men will find the stores selling Russsian -USSR army gear very fascinating.
my favourite. Very beautiful, in a very nice area, recommended to visit at 100%. Just check the date when it is closed

Beautiful!!!. This church was incredible on the outside and inside, although a little pricey to enter.
The park behind it offers an incredible photo opportunity and lots of walking.
I was speechless. It's so vast, this massive block of a building and still there's such an attention to little details that it's just amazing. And all those things inside... wow.
Amazing architecture. I loved everything about this place. The only drawback (types jokingly) is that the architecture is so varied and colorful, that it's impossible to draw it. :-)

Mosaics. The former royal church is a real masterpiece of mosaic work. It is really a breathtaking sight. We have seen many beautiful sites but the Church of Our Savoir on Spilled Blood made them all fade. It is one of the places in the world that people can be proud of. .

stunning!. i love the architecture ;-) I saw this Church from the Kazan. It's just stunning, standing between the blue sky and the white snow... When i stood in front of it, the camera would not be able to copy what i was seeing ;-(((
Amazing. I've never forgotten this amazing church and its beautiful mosaics. We had a private guide from Anastasia tours and she made the place come alive, fantastic experience!

colourful. I left this to my last day and I am glad I managed to fit it in. It's colourful on the outside, with an amazing interior of mosaics glittering - as the winter sunshine shone through the high windows. It also retains a sense of a used religious space and visually links the Russian Orthodox Church with the glories of Byzantium.
Beautiful. what can i say about this building other than beautiful both inside and outside so beautiful and colorful. what a great piece of architecture must to visit

Heaven. Visited whilst on a cruise ship. Was looking forward to the visit from photographs we had seen but reality was even better. The first time we saw the building we were mesmerised! We just wanted to go straight there rather than continue with our walking tour!The exterior is amazing but the interior is something else! Every piece of wall, ceiling and floor is covered in mosaics. It is hard to take in the surroundings. We have never seen anything like it. The restoration being carried out is superb and you can feel the history oozing out the core of every tile in the place.Bizarrely it did not really feel like a church but like a building that transcended religion!Would go back in an instant!

Holy Mosaic!. Beautiful cathedral built on the spot where Alexander II was assassinated. It looks much like the famous St. Basil's Cathedral that heads Red Square in Moscow. The inside is covered in mosaics just like the outside. A unique way to decorate instead of painting or plastering.

Soooo pretty.. The only thing I don't love about this church is how long its stupid name is. I'm a little obsessed with it though. It looks best in winter on a clear day (the contrast with the snow is great, but when it's cloudy you can't appreciate the colours so much). You can get some truly awesome photos from the nearest bridge up towards Dom Knigi/Nevsky Prospekt. It looks amazing from every angle though. I've seen newly-weds come to get photos by the nearby canal in summer, across from the Matryoshka markets where there's also a postcard-worthy view. Inside the church is amazing too (you have to pay though). Epic colours in the mosaic-covered walls and roof. This is my favourite thing in St Pete.
pure beauty. At this particular place we liked everything. It's truly very beautiful from outside and inside. Must see!

Mosaics everywhere!. This church (now museum) is built in a very similar style to St Basil's in Moscow, but is a lot more recent. It is pretty spectacular from the outside, but it really is worthwhile spending the money to see the interior, which is covered on every surface with beautiful, colourful mosaics. A stunning place!
Stunning. Beautiful, inside and out! Full of colour, extraordinary paintings all over the inside walls. Photos are allowed to be taken for the memories.

A tiny jewel box. An mosaic of mosaics. Walk around the outside, read all the accomplishments of Alexander II, ponder what might have happened if he had survived the attack, buy a ticket, go inside, and then just look. Look up, straight up into the towers to see the faces looking down, look down to the floors that are covered with utilitarian rugs that cover the rich stone "rugs" and look all around. Color and mosaics leap from all sides. It's no more than a 60-minute visit. Then,walk through the park

Amazing architecture. The Church of our Saviour on Spilled Blood has an amazing exterior and the atmosphere inside is very moving. There is much more of a movement towards formal religion now in Russia and this is interesting to observe. We visited in February so it is was interesting to see the church in the snow.

A colourful place with a colorful history. The place is just brilliant especially considering that it was completely destroyed during the war. The building took 24 years, and the restoration took 27 years. The church has amazing mosaics in the orthodox tradition, and it is simply amazing.

WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. In the center of city you could find this gem. You just have to see it to understand the skale and grand status of this place. It is one of the best monuments and cherches I have ever seen in my life!!!!!

Wow!. Having undergone a full restoration this 'Church' is something to behold. Built as a memorial as opposed to a Church it is worth a visit even if you've had your fill of Churches and Cathedrals. The mosaics and enamelling are extraordinary. It has a display that details the restoration works which is really interesting.

very interesting and well appointed. There are so many churches full of icons that by the end of 3 weeks they all flow together. This was one of the first I went to and I remember I liked it the most.

Beautiful. It's quite small inside but it is decorated over every inch. Worth a look. You pay to go inside and you're not in there very long but I think it's worthwhile. There are some really nice looking restaurants to the right of it too, I noticed.
Stunning. Absolutely gorgeous, hands down one of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen. A must visit if you go to St Petersburg!
A must see attraction. Amazing building and stunning mozaic decorations inside, you won't see anything quite like it anywhere else.

This is Russia. We had a two day private tour and we opted out of going inside this church to save some time for our other activities, but I am happy that I at least go to see the outside and take some nice shots. You will have A LOT to see in St. Petersburg so a private tour is the best way to organize everything and to make sure you get the best out of your stay, and that you are not wasting too much time at certain sites.

Dazzling. Amazing from the outside, and plenty of colour and light inside, but it is a small church, and you can walk around it reasonably quickly, even with admiring all the artefacts and the icons. They charge a fair bit to get in as well, but it IS one of the landmarks of St Pete.

Magnificent!. I was absolutely blown away by the art and craftsmanship of creators of this Church. There is not a single painting or drawing in there, everything is mosaic, floor to ceiling. Very impressive. The Church is also beautiful on the outside, a true landmark of St. Petersburg

Stunning. The beauty of the place does not have words! It was a moving place & I am not easily moved! Just keep looking up to the ceiling, if you can take your eyes of everything else, stunning just stunning.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking inside and out.This Church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated, dedicated in his memory, and definitely worth the visit.
Grand exterior. The church is really a burst of colours from outside, however the interiors are not as grand, however definitely something to see and admire!!
A true "roccoco" wonder. Absolutely beautiful. Russian Church art at its best. Difficult to understand if it is uggly or simply beautiful. A must see...

Absolutely amazing!. This beautiful Russian landmark is well worth the visit! It is truly a work of art. The church's exterior is colourful and quite spectacular, but the interior is also impressive with its countless mosaics. Not to be missed when visiting St.-Petersburg!

A must see!!!. A definite must see to anyone visiting Saint Petersburg!!The exterior is really pretty, lovely in the daylight and at night.A bit expensive (300 RUB - £6) to get in but worth going inside, to see the wonderful mosaics and embracing the Russian history. Ended up spending about 45-60 mins in there as we walked round a few times and took a few photos.A great attraction!!! :-D

THE church to go to in St. Petersburg. Won't have enough of the onion tops! St Basil in Moscow, The Church on Split Blood in St. Petersburg. Just a 15 minutes walk away from the winter palace, you have to come visit this church as well during your stay in St. Petersburg!

Typically Russian with turrets and cupellas. Such a pretty church having witnessed such a sad event that gives it's name. It is worth paying the 250 rubles to go inside as the splendor continues. It is right on the canal and worth a walk away to get a photograph of the whole building. There are some little stalls selling typical tourist items that are well worth a miss but all in all a delight

Don't pass up chance to visit inside.. Our second time visit but the first time inside. Overwhelmed by the continuous coverage of frescos, so typical of orthodox churches, but so well done and preserved here: painted, mosaic, and some gilded. Beautiful iconostases and side altars. Beautiful marble columns and paneling. It is not gaudy at all. Photograph to your heart's content. Do not pass up the opportunity to see the inside.

Enough Already. The church or should I say memorial is small but over run with so much art that if it were a piece of jewelry you would call it gaudy. I know that was the time period but I found it over powering. They do allow photos without an additional fee and the audio tours work well if the small space is not over run by tour groups.

The most wonderful experience. You have to go inside. I was not intending to at first, and it was my guide who urged me. I am so happy she did! The mosaics inside are indescribable. I have never seen such stone carvings. And there is also a tragic story behind it about the murder of a Russian Tsar...You MUST go and see!!!
Stunning. Make sure you visit this stunning church. It is beautiful inside. The outside looks stunning during the day and at night.
stunning. this cathedral is amazing, the various influences, Baroque and Neoclassical, it is built on or over a canal and resembles the St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.
marvellous. Just a not to be missed place, the history of Russia is so hard to comprehend, you need time, this is a country not to be rushed.

Spectacular.. During the cold war, all the churches were painted grey and used to store grain , foods or weapons. Restored a=t o their original grandeur the mosaic work in this church made my jaw drop. It is truly a wonder.
awesome!. I've never seen anything like this! All this color and icons. You should definitely get in and check it inside - don't save money on a ticket. It's a definite 'to do'

Wonderful church. Beautiful on the outside and inside. After take a lot of pictures of the amazing facade, buy the ticket, enter the church and see the incredible mosaics on the walls. Really worth a visit.
100 Times Better Better than St Basils in Moscow. Even in the dead of winter when it is not at its best, it's gorgeous both inside and out. A photo op that can't and should not be missed.

A must see. A unique look outside but make sure you go inside as well. It really is well worth the visit. Although it looks like it has been designed by many different people the more.you look at it, the more glorious it is
Beautiful place. Definitely a must. Architecturally incredible and beautifully restored. Internally the murals are intricate, colourful and artistically restored.
The most outstanding church I've ever seen. It is full of mosaics inside, and it is beautiful at dusk. I've taken something like 500 pictures of it. The best I've ever seen in my whole life.
Beautiful!. The beautiful mosaics inside are breathtaking. Every wall and the ceilings are covered in what appear to be paintings, but are really detailed mosaics. It is worth the entrance fee.

Beautiful Church. Magnificent not only from the outside but inside. The shops inside selling souvenirs aren't extremely over-priced. Try to skips restaurants next to the church due to the high mark-ups
Dazzling. Pay a visit, so many wonderfull colours. You can have a nice walk around the church to look at it from different angles.
Impressive!. This is the most impressive and amazing churches I have ever seen, along with St. Marcus (Venice). The mosaics are breathtaking! It's simply wonderful!

Another beautiful church. 'The Cathedral of the Resurrection' commonly known as 'Church of Our Saviour on the Spilled Blood' is another St Petersburg icon not to be missed. An historical icon, this Cathedral was constructed on the site where Emperor Alexander II was mortally wounded in 1881 (he died later the same day in the Winter Palace (Hermitage Museum) and was consecrated in 1907 after 24 years of construction. Built alongside the Griboedov Canal, the Church suffered signficant damage by German military forces with restoration only be completed in 2011. The walls and ceilings inside the Church are completely covered in intricately detailed mosaics covering 6,000 square metres inside and another 1,050 on its exterior. A four column jasper canopy with a cross of black crystal shelters the place where the blood of Alexander II was spilled.
Magnificient. If you have time for just one cathedral, choose that one. It' smagnificient and still very authentic even with the tourists
Beautiful place. The church is beautiful and the mosaics are totally worth the price of getting in. A must see. Don't forget to check the handicraft fair behind it.

coolest church ever. this church is awesome. great architecture, great colours - completely different from any church I had ever seen before. definitely a St P-burg icon. the outside of the church is better than the inside,but if you have time and money, the inside is pretty cool as well. very colourful and over the top. you are allowed to take pics which is great. This church is on the spot where Tsar Alexander II (who freed the serfs) was killed which is also VERY historically significant

Impressive building. The onion-domed structure is slathered in neat colors and interesting art work. This is one of the must-see stops you have the try while here. Our tour stopped here for a short time, and we wished we could have spent more time here.
Weddings. All young couples that are going to be married, drop by this place for the scenery... It's worth to just sit and watch.

Impressive inside and out!. A great photo opportunity outside - very nice church building. However, in side there is loads of additional art work. The audio guide was very useful and explained the process of paintings and mosaics and what each of them meant. The building is very interesting, especially the floor. Very much worth the visit and entrance free.
Fabulous colours. Just lovely. Outside and inside wow factor. Very interesting.Great souvenir stalls at the back of the church.

A remarkable structure. As the Brits say, touring Europe involves your ABCs - Another Bloody Church. Also known as the Church of the Resurrection. Great religious eye candy but you can't get in to see the famous mosaics. All the tours go by for the photo op and it is a worthwhile thing to do just for the impressive visual and its place in history.

Breath taking. The amount of work and richness put in this is amazing. The details, the colors are beautiful to see. Loved the fact that there is history boards outside telling more about Russia.
Only got approached by one vendor, but other then that felt safe and secure, even being a solo traveller.

Amazing work of art!. The outside of this church is like a candy-filled dream. Every little brightly colored piece glistens in the snow and winter light.. It's just breathtaking. Definitely recommend going inside. The mosaics are stunning and the sort of altar bit at the back has been elaborately crafted in shinning gold and silver. Try going around sunset for amazing photos of the outside. The light is just perfect.

church of historical tragedy. have learnt a bit more abt Russian history. first time see a Russian orthodox church in onion shape. I must thank our guide Dasha for telling this part of Russian history. And it is a regret we didn't have enough time to view the cathedral interior and the beautiful architectural disign outside.

Church on Spilled Blood. Breath taking on the outside, It was closed the day we were there. Check travel guides to find out what days it is closed. Be sure to bring your camera. You will have to cross the street to get a good picture of the church
Beautiful!. Beautifully build church. It was closed when we were there. There is a souvenir market just behind the church where you can get Russian souvenirs. Bargaining is a must.
A Must See. Fabulous outside, even more incredible inside. Stunning mosaic workmanship, with seemingly every inch covered.

Outrageously extravagant. The mosaics covering most of the interior of this church are glorious and over-the-top extravagant. Certainly something different to see. The audioguide is worthwhile to help you understand some of the history and construction of the church.
Great church. All the mozaics inside are just fabulous. The exterior is just like the pictures you see and the whole tour was fantastic.

Beautiful Church. Be sure to see the interior. The exterior is very photogenic but much history and art work inside. We had no problems but were warned but our guide that pickpockets and thieves abound around this and the other tourist sites.
Must see !. A must see attraction in St Petersburg. Impressive mosaicwork all over the place. Outside and inside are worth a visit.

Not sure why this is up as high as number 2. Obviously incredibly impressive visually but I didn't find there's anywhere near as much to do as the other places so doesn't justify as much of an attraction status as some others in Saint-Petersburg where you can genuinely spend 3 hours without blinking!
Spectacular. This is a real stand out landmark. Great to see from a distance but also close up. Its so intricate and on the site of a tragic historic event.
Iconic Building in Russia. This church is just so beautiful, and so iconic of what we expect a Russian Orthodox church to look like. It is just fantastic. A must see.

Magnificent, got to go inside to see the full magic. Not only is this Church stunning to look at from the oustide (and you'll see plenty of photos of it so you won't be too surprised) it is well worth taking the time (and spending the few roubles) to go inside. The Church is covered from top to bottom in gorgeous mosaics which have been beautifully restored.
Different. This was where the czar Alexander was assassinated. We didn't go inside but it is quite a beautiful church. It's a bit unusual but that's part of the charm of Russia

7,700 square meters of mosaics. I'll tell you. You don't know how big 7,700 meters of mosaics is until you walk into this church! And when you figure it out, you're absolutely amazed. You have nothing left to do but gaze in awe ot the amount of work that has gone into not only the construction, but the decoration of this church. This is more than your typical, run-of-the-mill cathedral with old artwork and wood-carvings. Not only is the outside visually beautiful (take some time to walk around the outside), the inside is absolutely stunning! My favorite site visited in St. Petersburg, by far.Behind La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, this is my favorite church/cathedral in the world.
The single best place to see!. Liked everything and there are some great Restaurants nearby. Gets really busy so best time to visit is either early in day or in evening
A great view.... The construction, the golden color... What's the art!!!! It's great for viewing from outside to inside, for taking pictures if you do not know you will be back a second time???
Beautiful. I have never seen a more beautiful church. I loved the Entry doors from inside! Wow! The workmanship that went into this church is priceless.
My favourite place in St Petersburg. Just beautiful, iconic and serene. You must go. You can see the sweet looking towers from all round the city, but inside the mosiacs just take your breath away
EXCELLENT!. The most beautiful church, cathedral that i've visited! is breathtaking when you see all the outside paintings!

Marvelous. Baroque, ornate and awesome to gasp in awe and wonder...
Piece of historical information which I learnt was that a Csar was murdered here. This church was built in his memory as a martyr
Can get terribly crowded
Overpriced but beautiful. Would accept our school student IDs (only ISIC cards) so we had to pay full price. The church and its mosaics were beautiful and we really enjoyed the inside.

One in a million church. As an atheist, this church is worth seeing! Not your everyday filled stuffed with gold and filled with old paintings of a lousy quality, it truly is unique, and more magnificent than it's Moscow counterpart.

Historic Visit. Called in on a very wet morning.
Worth the effort, The interior is breathtaking, allow a decent amount of time to view.
Exterior of building looks amazing , even on a dull wet morning.
Imagine it would look superb , on a sunny day

See it to believe it. Amazing sight to be hold, both inside and out.
I was lucky enough to go inside during a quiet weekday in November... I'd hate to see how crowded this place is during season. There may be more inspirational houses of worship located across the city but this site combines artistry and history like no other.

Good not great, worth the trip.. Very cool, more impressive than your average touristy European Church site. The architecture is obviously incredibly unique and impressive but it didn't have the awe inspiring effect that some other places have had for me.
Never saw anything like this before. Incredible place. Althouth there are so many great places in Saint-Petersburg, it is #2 after the Hermitage museum, I think
Detailed Mosaic - Russian Style. Everything I expected and then doubled. The interior is filled with amazing detailed mosaic art from top to bottom.
Amazing History. Do notmissthis shake sure your guide can tell you the history. Nothing to dislike. Everything s exquisite.
Amazing History. Do notmissthis shake sure your guide can tell you the history. Nothing to dislike. Everything s exquisite.

What I see when I think Russia. Beautiful to look at. When I think of Russian architecture this is what I think of. But is enough to just see it; there is no need to go inside, unless you are an at fan. But the fee is only small 250 rubles, so is doable.
Is a must to see. Yes, you must SEE this wonder of world!!! I like it very much. I stayed hours nearby admiring its colours, neighborhood channels, I loved it too much!!!

Fabulous!!. My wife and I went to this Church (more of a museum) on a shore excursion whilst on a cruise.
The internal mosaics are wonderful, the whole interior being covered with them. It is a "must see" but is very crowded inside.
I love this church!. The prettiest church ever! The outside of the church maybe something special but inside it was a big surprise. The church is covered with mosaics from top to bottom. A must see!
Marvellous church. Exterior and interior decorated with extremely beautiful and detailed mosaics designed by prominent russian artists.
Beautiful. Just stunning, both inside and out, amazing leaf work, and great photograph opportunities. Reasonable admission price too.

Unmissable. If you do one thing in St Petersburg, this should be it. Even if you are feeling very church-weary (as can easily happen when traveling in Russia), the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is special and different. The outside, of course, is lovely and is deliberately reminiscent of St Basil's in Moscow. Unlike St Basil's, however, the inside is the hero. The inside consists of an incredibly ornate mosaic, which covers all of the walls and the ceiling. It is absolutely spectacular and has clearly been lovingly restored since WWII, when I believe it was used to store weaponry. Do visit this deconsecrated church. It is a true work of art and is stunning. It is also not very big, so it won't take you long to take it all in.

Lovely to look at but a bit overrated. Nice church with good history, however you get better value from Kazan Cathedral (free), St Isaacs or just pop into any of the local churches that are not as crowded but still nice

This Church is unbelievably ornate and beautiful. The inside of this huge historical church is so pretty. It is ornate, beautifully painted frescoes on all surfaces, and gold gild everywhere. We were on a tour with TJ Travel having arrived via a cruise ship.

Stunning. Beautiful building, ornate and colourful outside. Decorated by small mosaic inside. Well worth a visit to one of the most iconic building in Russia. Though I will add we did not spend too long there it is basically an ornate room.

Astounding. This is my favourite church in St Petersburg from the outside, as it just looks so beautiful - and once you get inside, it continues to amaze. The artwork on the walls - millions of mosaic tiles that create the most beautiful pictures - and the contents of the church are all amazing, and I like the way that there are information boards dotted around and tours going on so that you really get to know about the place - I can't imagine that happening at a lot of churches and cathedrals that I've visited, and it definitely made this one stand out in a good way! Souvenirs were available to buy that seemed of good quality, and all in all it was a very pleasant way for a tourist to spend an hour or so in St Petersburg.
Breathtaking!. It doesn't take long to visit and shouldn't be missed! Located close to the Russian Museum, and next to the canal.

It's a pretty church with a nice market next to it. It's a nice church with a little canal running next to it. Also there is a nice little market next to it selling souvenirs etc which is interesting to visit.

Gorgeous. Gorgeous architecture, worth the trip itself. Inside the church there are vast mosaic walls depicting Biblical moments and saints.I also learned that during the WWII and the Soviet Union churches were kept untouched to serve as an example of ostentation.
mosaic masterpiece. A must see. The mosaics are beyond description (see the photo) Had a great photo on the grounds with the architecture in view.

Wow! - Better than St Basils but expensive entry. The church is spectacular and much better than the famous St Basils in Moscow. However I feel disappointed that they do not offer student or elderly discounts considering this is a church.
A Beauty. Jaw dropping mosaic interior. I simply couldn't stop taking pictures. The Russian's determination and dedication have my full admirations.

Iconic site of St Pete. Stuuning outside - iconic site of St Petersburg - smaller inside than anticipated but well worth it. Such a beautiful building and the bright colours stand out even in the grimest of weather. About £5 to go inside

Colourful facade, colourful history!. The church of the spilt blood because this is the site where Czar Alexander II was assisinated in 1881, and the church commissioned two years later. A very ornate church with multicoloured onion domes and imposing position, just off the Nevsky Prospekt. Interior is ornate with good use of mosaics. It's difficult to believe that the Soviets stored vegetables here during WW2.Imposing Church, very colourful facade, very colourful history.

A little gem. Onion domes on the outside, acres of art mosaics on the inside.
Built over the site of the Czar's assassination, this church is truly special, and not to be missed if you are in Peter.
Truly beautiful. The Church of the spilt blood is a must whilst in St Petersburg. Both the interior and the exterior are jaw dropping. Make sure you have plenty of space on your memory card!

Breathtaking!. Be sure to see the beautiful reflections of this church on the canal. The workmanship on the outside is just as spectacular as the inside. Don't miss this place! (And the Cafe St Petersburg on the canal is charming, convenient and the food excellent)

nice, a bit show-up. no doubt it's a great work of architecture, and the mosaic works are quite mpressive. Also the soil and the facade ornaments are unique, but the whole thing givesan impession of arrogance that is not very religious

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. The church was originally built between 1883-1907. After suffering severe damage and neglect it underwent a 27 year restoration and was reopenned in 1997. Today the Russian Orthodox church has 7,500 square meters of outstanding mosaics which depict biblical scenes and figures. The art has a martyrdom theme which commerates the place Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881.Various shades of marble and gilding further enhance the interior. The church is open Thursday through Tuesday and is closed on Wednesday. Hours are a little unusual (11am-7pm). It is about $10 USD (300 rubles) and a good hour allows you to inspect all the church has to offer. The use of cameras and camcorders is a additional fee.There is a shrine to Alexander II made of topaz, lazurite and semi-precious stones.The onion domes and 16th-17th century architecture reflect the fact that it was inpired by the St. Basil Cathedral on Red Square in Moscow. Resting on the banks of the Griboedov Canal, there is easy access to the church from the Nevsky Prospekt (the main street) metro station. The Russian Museum is a short walk and is wortwhile seeing as well.
Stunning from the outside. I didn't venture in, but the view from the outside is amazing. Definitely worth walking along the canal to take some pics.
Russian Classic. Ornate church inside and out - highly decorative with good story - a must see - lit at night - photographers dream

awesome. this church looks as beautiful on the inside as it does on the outside.. on the banks of Gribodeva, built on the site where Czar Alexander II was assassinated in 1881,.. beautiful mosaic icons and spectacular altar... the place where blood was spilled grows red roses now , cordoned off and facing the altar... must visit place in petersburg
Beautiful - worth a quick visit. It is very beautiful from the outside and extremely ornate on the inside; however, it is really not much more than a 15 minute visit.

Beautiful Church!. I love this church. Its interesting candyland-lookalike exterior (medieval Russian architecture) is so unforgettable! The number of mosaics used in the inside of the church is amazing too. I also love that the church was next to a canal. It's a great photo spot!

You Should See. Although not my top choice of places visited in St Petersburg it is well worth seeing.The site is very busy and quite small and I think this spoilt it a little for us as there was just to many people viewing the exhibits at the same time. That said, some of the mozaics were stunning and intricate in there design.The outside of the building is stunning, and everything you think that a grand Russian church should look like.For those who want to see the church at it's best do come early.

Amazing mosaics.. This church was built next to the site where Tsar Alexander III was assassinated, hence the spilled blood. The exterior has many beautiful onion domes and the interior is solid mosaic pictures: walls, ceilings and pillars. It is gorgeous and well worth the modest entry fee.
Great for the historical context. Very impressive experience. Interesting to see how well it has been preserved under the circumstances

A classic Russian Cathedral. This is probably the most traditionally Russian Cathedral in St Petersburg built on the spot where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated. The inside was glorious with all its mosaics (rather than the traditional icons)
Amazing. This is a must see in st Petersburg. We went here 2 times over 2 days and I would have gone back two more. It's so very cool.

Amazing after 30 year restoration. In the heart of the city center this working church is magnificent. The outside is covered in hundreds of mosaics and is right across from the summer garden sculpture park. The inside is equally impressive. Another MUST NOT MISS.
Colourful church. Very interesting interior! Situation on the canalside made for beautiful photos with the reflections on the water.
overwhelming mosaics. shoulder to shoulder people, could have been spiritual, great art all around and in rather good shape, watch out for pickpockets
amazing pictures. try to go there at dawn and take some nice pictures from one of the bridges. The inside is also astonishing!

Traditional Russian Orthodox Church Architecture At Its Best. Even though the church is quite faraway from the main boulevard, I recognized the church from many street blocks away because of its magnificent onion domes. There are canals all around the grounds, giving it a feel of exclusivity. The admission charge is reasonable in comparison to the admission charge of The Hermitage. Because it is so much smaller than the Hermitage, I could appreciate the details even more. It really stands out, in my memory, among all the other onion domes in Russia.
Very Russian. Not sure quite why this is so highly rated on trip advisor. Yes worth seeing but relatively expensive for the limited amount of time that you will spend inside.

The most beautiful mosaics I've ever seen! A must!. This church is not as colorful as the ones in Moscow, but the architecture is really typical. The must see in this place are the inside mosaics. They cover simply all the walls and are fantastic. It worths every cent you pay at entrance.
Beautiful and Historic. The amazing exterior is matched by the interesting events that took place. This is mandatory with any visit to St. Petersburg
Interesting. don't miss this place of Historical significance. This is just one of many great places to visit in St. Petersburg.

rare example of the church completely covered in mosaics.. This church has been opened fairly recently after extensive restoration.It is somewhat a new construction compared to other churches and palaces of the SPB but well worth the visit.It is a rare example of the church completely covered in mosaics.When we were visiting they were opened after 6 pm for “night excursion” – which we understood is the same thing as day excursion only a little more expensive Enjoy the stroll in the Mikhailovsky park – it is very pretty and low key.

The Church of the Mosaics. The mosaics were indeed most impressive. Glad we bought DVD at the Church as a reminder. Very interesting to learn that it was built in 24 years but took 27 years to restore. Great credit to Russian artisans.

Beautiful Russian Architectural Landmark with Sad History.. Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is the resting place of Russian great rulers. It is the spot where Russian Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in1881. The interior and exterior of the church is decorated with detailed mosaics, designed and created by the most prominent Russian artists V.M. Vasnetsov, M.V. Nesterov and M.A. Vrubel. Beautiful with sad history.
Well worth a visit.. Interesting church with a very colourful interior of beautiful mosaics.Impressive exterior but you must see the interior.

Not to be missed!. This Church is not to be missed when you visit St. Petersburg. Some organized tours only stop for a photo opp, and some don't even stop at all!! What a travesty! We skipped an afternoon of planned tours in order to take our time visiting the Spilled Blood Church, and other sights close by. We paid about 400 rubles each to enter; there was good security and crowd control. Needed to be as the weekend of August 25 was the busiest of the season, some 13 cruise ships were docked in St. Petersburg! We weren't on a cruise ship so missed most of the bus loads of tourists. There were still a great number of people inside but the crowds pass through quickly. If you're the kind of person who enjoys browsing and taking their time, find a quiet corner and move around from there. The mosiacs are outstanding, as is the renovation of the exterior. What a wonderful thing for Russia and the world that this church as never completely destroyed during Soviet times. Be careful of pickpockets while you're distracted by the mosiacs inside the church! Our little backpack front zipper was unzipped while we were appreciating the art - nothing stolen as we only had paper tissues and gum inside!
one of the must go places. built not in Petersburg style but really a master-peace. Located in a very center close to Saint-Kazan cathedral and Nevsky prospect. Looks fantastic in any season.
A definite must!. If you are going to St Petersburg then this church should definitely be on your itinerary. Beautiful inside and out!

Amazing Church. This is by far one of the most beautiful and amazing churches I have seen to date and I have seen a few. There is so much beauty to look at that you will be very glad you took the time to visit. The outside of this church is just as beautiful as the inside! We did have a private guide who explained everything in detail. Very much enjoyed our visit here and would recommend to anyone coming to St Petersburg. Do not miss visiting!

An eyefull, could use more interpretation for English speakers. Gorgeous place but very little material in English. I also had little time to spend there. Somewhat expensive given lack of guided information.
Beautiful!. The first church i went that is all mosaic! There aint a single afresco our portrait, only beautiful, blueish and huge mosaic! Amazaing, i just set there, looking, for hours!
Access. Beautiful and historical. On Sunday mornings the church is openbut not to tourists. There is a sign sayin no tourists, and when we walked in anyway, they directed us to leave. No problem.

A MUST GO. I liked everything about this church. The mosaic all over the church was explicit. The marble floor is unbelievable. It will be a definite miss if you go to St Petersburg without visiting this church.
Beautiful. The cupolas are reminiscent of St Basil's in Moscow. Very beautiful building with awesome mosaics. It also has historical significance.
My favourite church!. Fabulous looking, straight out of a fairytale and just as wonderful inside. Good value entrance money. Lovely park and gardens nearby.

Amazing. The artistic work that has gone into this church is just amazing, absolute opulence. The audio guide is well worth getting and will explain the history of the building. You will need driving licence or passport as a deposit for the audio guide.

Superb Artistry. This was a superb example of indulgent artistry as a dedication to the assassinated Tsar Alexander II. The marble flooring, mosaic tiled friezes and gilded columns all were so remarkable.
beautiful church. there was nothing to dislike it was amazing it was hard to believe that the pictures we all mosaics they were like paintings beautifully done

Another great beauty.. Each Church we visited in St. Petersburg was opulent and magnificent. Here we enjoyed the history, the art, the unbelievable beauty of the structure and its contents. Another must see in St. Petersburg.
Spectacular. 100 percent of every surface. Covered with meticulously made glass and gold mosaic tile. As in most russian orthodox churches, no place to sit and admire the beauty.
A Whistle Stop Tour!. No denying it's a fantastic Church, but for the money it took about 20 minutes to see. That said it's amazing and worth a look
Stunning sight. The English audio tour takes about an hour but gives you a great account of the history & architecture. Look out for the mistakes that weren't edited out ;-)
Amazing. This would have been a highlight of our tour in St Petersburg! So beautiful and amazing. All made from mosaics!

Best attraction in both St Petersburg snd Moscow... a MUST. After spending 3 nights and moscow, and four nights in St Petersburgh.... visiting and looking at attractions... in my view this was the best and MOST amazing...... its is only a 5 minute walk from the hermitage museum...The church is now a musuem and not an active "church", i was informed.... it costs 25 rub each for adult, tourists to entre, and another 100 rubs, for an english audio guide....... The chrurch is closed to enter on a Wednesday all day every week, its open for 10am till 7pm......In my view the mosaics... on the inside are breath taking... especially considerring all the renovation work, which has been completed on this church in the last 20 years... as it was badly damaged durring world war 11... there as an excitbation in english showing the renvations which had been completed....I would say it was the best 250 rubs... i have spent on my trip... bring your camera....

Gorgeous beyond our expectations. Everywhere you look, the view is gorgeous. Yes, there is an admission charge but it is worth it as the funds go for continued restoration and for the guides/guards in attendance. The view from outside is equally stunning. Try to buy an English guide book or have someone with you that can explain the symbolism of the building. We are well acquainted with churches, but this one will always be on the top of our list.
postcard St Petersburg. it is a perfect motive for a photo. Inside beautiful but you need to pay fee to enter. It is in city center - very easy to access.
AMAZING!. What a remarkable church! Wasn't able to go in since it was Sunday morning but the outside of it will just take your breath away!

Spilled Blood Cathedral. Beautiful church. A must in Saint Petersburg. Take pictures from all sides as it is simply beautiful. It is centrally located in Saint Petersburg, about 300 meters from Nevsky Prospect, the main Saint Petersburg artery.

sensational to look at outside and in!. I was amazed by the expert way this church had been rebuilt after its demolition during the revolution. The floor is made of patterned marble and the icons are made of individual mosiac tiles.
The colours are superb . It is on a canal and by a beautiful park. Lots of wedding parties go there for photographs.

Beautiful Church inside and out. Cnions and spires in a variety of colurs...great on the eye. You buy your ticket outside and have to queue. Very ornate interior and the history of the church and location is facinating. A short walk out of town.

BLOOD AND MOSAICS. OWING to temperature and condensation problems, now sorted, many of the frescos were replaced by moasics, with the challenge to tell the difference. Some half round moasics left at the bottom of the pillars will help in the detection.
Stunning architecture. Very detailed architecture inside and out. Stunning design. Inside all the walls are covered in detailed mosaics.
Beautiful mosaics. Slightly garish from the outside - with Disney-like turrets, but very elegant once inside. Lovely mosaics and ceilings.
Fully restored to full glory.. Sensory overload alert! A fully restored cathedral and now a museum. Well worth a visit. Get the audio guide to fully appreciate what effort had been involved.
A must see. the onion domes on the outside were impressive and the inside decor was very impressive, you don't need a large amount of time to see but is a must see in St Petersburg
This is a MUST SEE!!!. This is spectacular, located along one of the St Petersburg Canals. Definitely one of the most amazing exteriors in the world, and with beautiful interior as well.
Do not miss this-inside and outside,superb. Breathtaking,words cannot describe how fabulous this place is,needs to be seen daytime and at night,mind blowing

Colourful church. The church of Spilled Blood is simply breathtaking! Sadly, our visit was via a cruise tour ( to avoid the problem of obtaining individual visas) and this did not include any time inside this glorious monument, I think this was a missed opportunity!We did have the time to circumnavigate the church and each view was truly special! even the canal running up the side was pretty!
Breathtaking. Typical russian church style, completely breathtaking. Be sure to get the audio-guide, it's not expensive and there is a lot of history explained.

mosaic magic. What a stunning church! An exterior boassting golden onion;shaped domes and turrets and inside....every single wall filled floor to ceiling with mosaics of biblical scenes. There is aan exhibition showing photos of the condition of the mosaics prior to their renovation and what a splendid job has been done.

Magnificent church. Really beautiful church, inside and out. Be there early, to avoid the crowds. Best pictures taken from the canal behind the church, where there is less people and you could get a good view of the church from your camera, without a lot of tourists posing in front.

CHURCH OF SPILT BLOOD. Split Blood because the czar was assassinated on this spot, and his son erected the church as a memorial...A new church compared to European standards...Incredibly beautiful with its mosaic interior...A classic St. Petersburg icona Don't Miss attraction...If you don't have time to go inside, at least, please see the outside. You won't forget the view.
Beautiful!. Didn't manage to get inside on our trip, but just the outside will take your breath away! Absolutely wonderful!
Impressive church. Church beautifull lit during the night. Located close to the centre of town. This is not an old church but worth a visit.
