Beautiful, intricate, worth a visit.. The tile work is absolutely amazing. The colors and precision of each and every mosaic are truly impressive.
Incrediably ornate and beautiful church. Incrediably ornate outside and inside. Interesting look at the Russian Orthodox religion. Worth the entry fee. I loved the art work inside and outside.

Remarkable. Easy and accessible to visit and simply stunning outside and even more incredible inside! It almost to my breath away when i stepped inside this remarkable building, the colour and spectacle were something to behold and far beyond my humble skills as a reviewer to adequately describe, just go visit it for yourself and see.

Pretty on the Outside.... This is one of SPB's landmarks, but is barely 100 years old, having being built on the spot of Alexander's assassination. Converted by the Soviets into a potato warehouse, then a morgue during WW2, it was badly damaged and lost to several generations of locals until a recent remodel, as it now shines in all of its splendor.

Good intro to Russian history. This church with the right interpreters give a great history of the czarist period in Russian history. The church is amazingly ornate and shows just how excessive the wealthy were during this period.

Wonderful inside and outside. Wonderful inside and outside. You need to pay to enter but it's totally worth visiting - all wall are decorated with astonishing mosaics which look like paintings it's not just regular orthodox church

WOW again. The detail in the mosaics is incredible. Not entirely sure there is any blood left on the stone though but one cn pretend. Truly incredible work of art. It is sad that that type of craftmanship is no longer available.
Make Sure You Go Inside!. The outside of this church is, of course, very impressive. But it's what's inside that will blow you away. The mosaics are not to be missed.

Absolutely Breathtaking!. This marvelous Russian-style church was built by Alexander III on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. The exterior is Baroque and Neoclassical whilst the walls and ceilings inside the Church are completely covered in intricately detailed mosaics designed by the most celebrated Russian artists of the day—including Viktor Vasnetsov, Mikhail Nesterov and Mikhail Vrubel . Truly spectacular inside and out and should be included in any sightseeing.

Excellent architecture. The church is as beautiful as in pictures and has been wonderfully restored. One of the few places with plenty of information in English.The craft market nearby is worth a visit: if you are truly interested in an item, haggle hard and you will get good value!

Architecture. Absolutely stunning building. Built on the site where one of the szar's was murdered A must see visit outshines every other building & believe me this is some achievement in a city full of fantastic buidings & summer palaces etc.

ROBBED BY PICKPOCKETS. We have just returned from a 3 week visit to Russia which was marred by a gang of pickpockets operating on the street on the opposite side of the canal from The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. The Church and its mosaics were stunning and not to be missed.We left the church and crossed the footbridge to the opposite bank of the canal. There was a musician playing on the bridge obstructing the path and a man opposite him with a rolled up umbrella so you had to squeeze between them to get past. I now believe they were part of the gang that robbed me.After leaving the bridge I turned left and was immediately accosted by three men purporting to sell large post cards and a map. The man with the umbrella also appeared I tried to push past them and they became violent pushing and jostling me against the wall. I pushed them away and noticed they had unzipped my breast pocket I immediately re-zipped it and they again unzipped it this time more obviously. I checked my pocket to find that they had taken my cash and were now trying to get my wallet, cards and passport at this point I shouted that I was being robbed and the ran off.So PLEASE, PLEASE be very careful in this area they are very professional they know what they are doing and it is very quick and would not stop at harming you.We were a group of nine and are experienced travelers but could not stop this happening so be very very wary, keep your belongings safe only take with you what you need.Enjoy your visit to the church.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Everything! The history, the stories, the architecture, our guide - amazing! Incredible to be walking around and seeing history that we learned in school coming alive. The church is magnificent. On the way out there was an all male choir in a little side room with chairs and we were able to sit down and enjoy a very beautiful and spiritual performance.
Definitely one for the list. Both the outside and inside of this churcn/museum are very ornate. It is one of the icons of St. Petersburg and a must see.
Wow. This is a must for every visitor. Hard to imagine what went into building something this grand. A great place to take a photo with the church in the background.

Beautiful - night & day. Worth seeing & photographing both during the day and night. You can take a very nice shot of the church as you walk from Nevski Prospekt along the canal to towards the church.
one very fantastic church. full a colors and unusual shape, you have to go there and walk near the canals, take a lot of pictures

Beautiful architecture. A smaller version of the one in Moscow, beautiful domes. It was closed so I could not see inside. beware of pickpockets in the area. Best place to take a postcard picture is to go behind the church on the right hand side if you are coming from the street towards it.

Beautiful Outside and Inside. A must see attraction. The Church of Our Savior of the Spilled Blood has this name because it was built on the spot the Czar Alexander II was assassinated (rebels revolutionaries threw a bomb at his carriage). The construction, based on St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, was ordered by his son and was finished in 1907. The church is located alongside the canal and the view of it from the Nevisk Prospect- Avenue is indubitably breathtaking. The same as its interior - entirely cover of colorful mosaics. Astonishing! Today is a museum and inside there is a souvenir shop with nice prices. Late on, after a day full of walking and sightseeing, we took a 1 and 1/2 hour canal and river Boat Trip to see more the “Venice of the North”. Very nice indeed!
Amazing artistry!. An amazing piece of architecture! We were spell bound with the exterior grandeur and the interior tiled work. A must see, for sure!

Don't miss it this medevial Russian arquetecture gem. This Church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated and was dedicated in his memory. The walls and ceilings inside the Church are completely covered in intricately detailed hand made mosaics but with very fine patterned borders setting off each picture.The church was closed during the II WW as it was badly damaged and it was used as a morgue for those who died in combat and from starvation and illness.The church was restored completely and reopen in 1997.It is a gem!!
Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. A magnificent Church with a status of must see. The story of why it is called Spilled Blood is very interesting.

Russian Masterpiece Revival. Inside and outside this is probably the most ornate, beautiful and unique church in St. Petersburg. The mosaics are intricately detailed and spectacular and the nine domes crowning the church are stunning.A unique tribute to the assasination of a Tsar who liberated the serfs.
Amazing. Beautiful place. I was there 17 years ago but it was closed so it was an opportunity to see now that is is open.
Awe inspiring. Beauty beyond the imagination. Costly to visit but worth it. Long lines.Great shopping across the street.
Only saw the outside. It was a most magnificent building! The colors were so bright and vibrant and the church so...lovely. I want to go back and tour the inside, which I hear is lovely, too.
A Marvelous Structure. The architecture, colors and history of this Church make it well worth the visit. Great photo shooting opportunity!

Church. This church is equisite. Knowing why the church was built due to the assissanation of one of the Tsars makes it that much more memorable. The gates to the altar had just been installed so it is reaching more and more to total restoration.
Amazing. Nothing can prepair you for what awaits you inside this church. The mosaics, with all the vivid colours are absolutely stunning.

Prettier than I thought. Although I didn't go in.. I was surprised as to how pretty the Church really was in person. Doesn't hurt that it's on the canal with gorgeous old buildings surrounding it to make it stand out even more. Took tons of pictures at all times of the day.. plus there is a pretty darn good souvenir market right behind it.. highly recommend.
Great photo op. Begs to be photographed, both outside and inside. Next to an interesting souvenir market, too! Very close to other landmarks as well.

Cathedrals of St. Petersburg. The cathedral i rather imposing with its colorful onion domed architecture. It is beautiful on the outside, and rather subdued on the inside. There are busy crowds visiting the cathedral. The inside is stunning with the mosaics and statues. It has many "stations" to look at. One of the most beautiful. Interestingly we saw a lot of brides and grooms coming to the areas behind the cathedral. It is a stunning park. Aparently they marry wherever then make a tour of the city's major sights as part of there "wedding" since the whole party comes with them for pictures.
Nice freakin' building. It's just awesome-- inside and out. Pay to go inside because it's relatively cheap, and you'll feel good about where the money is going.
Don't miss it. Fascinating history. Fascinating detail. The fact that all the murals are mosaics makes it that more remarkable.

Only saw the outside. We stopped for pictures as we had no time to visit properly, but the walk along the canal to the Church was beautiful. The onion domes gleaming in the sunlight were breathtaking.

Classic Russian Orthodox Church. What a beautiful church in a lovely location! The only bad thing was that there were so many tour buses that they ruined the views of the church. It looked like something from a fairy story.

GO INSIDE!!. I almost listened to the reviewers who said that the inside wasn't worth seeing and not worth the money. Thankfully, I didn't. The mosaics in this church are utterly amazing and like nothing I've seen in my normally Western-Europe contained travels.

Savior on Spilled Blood. Gruesome name based on where Alexander II was killed. Beautiful to walk down the street next to this church, turn the corner, and see it all at once rather thaen come upon it directly, seeing it all the way. A beautiful church. Quite impressive. Was there on a Saturday and say many wedding parties. All in all, a very fun time!
Its a beauty. Its the best looking structure I have seen and well restored. The mosaic work is the most unique and rare. Please do not miss this one.
another St Petersburg must see.... there is not much like this anywhere in the world, worth the visit. the quality of the restoration is outstanding. the mosaics are overwhelming and must visit.

Don't miss!!!. This was my second visit to the Church of Spilled Blood. I had to get a family Christmas Picture out front. Don't miss the inside. The church has beautiful blue, gold and red arches and domes. I could stay and view the inside forever!!!!Alexander II is also buried inside here. Don't miss the market outside the church. They will accept American Dollars and I found great prices on Green Amber and the Russian stackable dolls.

Beautiful Church. This church is a sight to behold from the outside, but the inside was so crowded with tour groups that I spent most of my time pushing through people rather than looking around. I would have been happy saving my money and just looking at it from the outside.

St Saviour on Spilled Blood. This is one of those onion-domed, over-the-top-beautifully-decorated churches that make sightseeing in St Petersburg so rewarding; I have seen plenty of lovely cathedrals in Europe but nothing as splendid as this, even on a cool, wet day. Very centrally located, within walking distance of most of the other major locales in the city centre as well. Opening and closing times seem to be capricious but sometimes it is open until quite late. Closed on Wednesdays.

Fascinating.. Reach Sadovaya Metro Station, take the Moskovsky Prospekt, turn right after crossing the road and take Maberezhnaya Reki Fontanki and walk straight. This is the route you should take to watch the church from quite a distance being reflected in the clear waters of the canal - click a photograph. The multicolored domes you see from the front of the church are awesome.One regret is that the tour buses stop just in front of the church and remain their idly and denies you a chance for a photograph of the whole church. Wish the authorities takes proper steps to relocate them a little further from the front of the church
Stunning. Try and get inside not all tours take you in. The whole interior is made from mosiacs!Look up to the ceilings in the center look at the white dove it is three meters across!

Beautiful, unique, must see. The Cathedral on Blood is an amazing historical building with multiple mosaics icons and outstanding design. Truly symbol of St. Petersburg and Russian culture. Absolutely loved my experience, one of the greatest historical and cultural monuments I ever saw.

Rather interesting. It's a rather typical, although huge church of Russian Orthodox architecture, somehow similar to St. Basil in Moscow. If I'm not mistaken, it has 9 onion-shape doms. Quite a lot of work was put into it, including mosaics. Built in honor of 19 century tsar Alexander II, killed by terrorists devoted to revolution, although this tsar abolished serfdom, gave lots of political freedom to people etc. Back then, as it is now, terrorists did not have any consideration...The church was not intended for regular services & that's probably why I did not feel this powerful positive energy inside. I still recommend visiting it but don't buy any souvenirs inside, they are overpriced.

a beautiful church. I would say this is the most beautiful church during my Moscow & St Petersburg trip. take pictures from the other side of the canal is better. it is within walking distance from Nevsky Prospect.
A must-see. An enjoyable sight both inside and out, the typical postcard picture you can´t avoid taking with you
The prettiest building in St Petersburg. We considered this church unquestionably the most impressive of all the churches and palaces we visited.

A truly incredible sight.. One can look at pictures of tourist attractions, but to see this church is truly special. The location on the water on one side and the park like setting on the other , and it only being a few blocks from the center of the Nevsky Prospect is an easy stop for pictures.

Beautiful!. Beautiful place! It is worth to see inside. The staff is very professional and nice. The audioguides are excellent! It is full of mosaics and its history is fantastic. Try to visit it when the guided tours are not there, around noon or after 400 pm. When the tours are there you cannot notice how beautifilthe churc is. The tour guides practgically scream in different languages and are very overwhelming. In addition, they the tourist very fast and the information they provide is not always right and for most of the of the part just partial. This is a church you should visit without a tour; just spent a few more dollar on the audioguide and you will enjoy it better!
unmissable. This is a fantastic church, really beautiful inside and out and probably my favourite thing in St Petersburg. The mosaics inside are just stunning. Its a must see.

Hard to believe it's real. As you walk closer and close to this you can’t believe what you are seeing. It’s like walking towards Cinderella’s castle in WDW. The difference is that this is not something out of a fairy tale. The level of detail put into this place is beyond imaginable. The interior is absolutely stunning. I can’t think of a more underrated sight in the world that this. Learning why and where it was built just added to the mysticism.
Special. With our private guide we spent an 1 1/2 viewing the marvels of this church. A unique experience and not to be missed.

Its all in the detail. First saw this place from the canal/river. It looked like a dark fairytale The went to look on foot and turned left from Nevsky Prospect towards it. It just kept getting better the nearer I got. What a place!! Absolutely magical. Brilliant! Looked at it from every angle. It doesn't have a 'bad' side. And then a walk in the park which is next to it. Visited a nice cafe and had a rest. Excellent,

Looked good enough to eat. This is the cathedral that you see in all of the pictures. It is not that old--a little over 100 years. I thought this was the most interesting of all of the churches. Be sure to take a tour that includes an inside visit because it is all mosaic. I thought it was magnificent and was my favorite building in St. Petersburg

Magnificent Church, must to see while in St Petersburg. This church has such a significant history, and is an absolute must to see inside and out while in St Petersburg. All the walls and ceilings are covered with detailed mosaics which are quite unique and absolutely breathtaking.
Visited as part of a tour with Alla. One of the many places we visited on a nintensive 2 day tour. Long queues that we walked straight past.
Simply Marvellous. Lovely on the outside, great pictures from the canal. Absolutely beautiful inside, not really worth the audio tour as it's not that big.

Interesting History. The name is misleading, as the spilled blood is that of a Tsar, not a religious figure. Interesting history all the same, and absolutely worth putting on the itinerary. The exterior of the church is unmistakable and identifiable from a distance, very beautiful and colourful domes and spires.

Mosaic artwork and building is amazing. Really beautiful church, and remarkable amount of talent went into the building of it and its decoration. The audio tour was interesting but perhaps a little too detailed for our level of interest - we found ourselves tuning out and eventually gave up.

Worth the entrance fee. The interior is filled with mosaic tiles represented in religious icons. Every square inch is covered by something.There is plenty of room to walk around inside.photographs were permitted, and you could stay as long as you liked.There is a gift shop inside the church selling religious icons.

Beware of Pickpockets!. We just returned from visiting this Church along with our Russian guide we had hired for our 1 week visit to St. Petersburg. PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE be aware that this site is known for pickpockets....and we personally saw their work in progress. Four men surrounded a couple and began bombarding them with goods and distractions and actually watched as they removed the gentleman's wallet from his fanny pack....it was terrifying! There was also street performers ( a violinist) that I believe was working WITH this team of thieves....anyone who stopped to drop money in the hat were immediately surrounded by them and robbed. Later that day when I got on the bus to return to my hotel they were on my bus....YIIIKES!!! Seriously scary..Having said the above once you are safely inside the gates of the church with your ticket you are safe to enjoy the incredible beauty and unbelievable works of Mosaic. It shouldn't be missed...just be careful!

Staggeringly ornate. Mosaics which have to be seen to be believed! We thought the outside was stunning and only decided to pay to go in cos it was pouring with rain but were delighted when we entered. Well worth the entrance price. make sure you see the "before and after" photos which make the finished interior even more wonderful.
Not to be missed in St. Petersburg. This unique, famous historic church is a must-see highlight in St. Petersburg! The mosaics and detail are stunning. Our entire family enjoyed this stop.
Spilled Blood Church. Interior of church was not open to the public. We were disappointed. However, on the outside, it was worth getting a close up of the church.
Sense of History. Only visited the outside of this historical place. The architecture is amazing and the history that surrounds this Church is important to the Russian people.

Very interesting. The historic church in St Petersburg is wonderful to see on the outside and very interesting on the inside. Inside the many scenes are done with tiny mosaics and leaves you in awe of the difficulty. Didn't take much time to see inside.

St Petersburg. This was one of the many places we visited on our I Travel SPb tour. All were beyond expectation. The amount of detail in the interior of these buildings is a sight that has to be seen to be believed. No expense was spared when these buildings were constructed.

More than I could have ever expected!. The name of this church leaves one to wonder since most often they call it the Church of the Spilled Blood...the picture I had was mostly focused on the "Spilled Blood" part of it...I was more than surprised to see the amazing iconigraphy exhibited here. It is an amazing artifact displaying such craftsmanship...well worth the visit!

One of the most breathtakingly gorgeous structures anywhere.. This iconic religious center is pure gold...really, it was decorated with insanely elaborate religious mosaics whose tiles are made of pure gold....and other precious stones and metels. It's like jewelry on the walls!! It makes no difference whether or not you are a christian, a jew, a muslim, a catholic, or an athiets....this is one of the most beautifully decorated structures, inside and out, that the world has ever see. If you like shiney, colorfull, brilliantly, intricately, complicatedly, elaborately designed mosaics--made of JEWELS AND GOLD AND SILVER this church is for you!!!

My tour highlight!. The image of the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood will never leave me! It is exactly as I had pictured it from history books and articles and it did not disappoint. Colorful, majestic, informational - I looked forward to seeing it and I was definitely not disappointed!

Take time to experience this one. This is possibly one of the top two or three religious centers in the entire world. It is beauty beyond description, both outside and in. The gold-capped onion domes, the incredible mosaics inside, and so much more...it is simply breathtaking. Whatever you do, do not miss this church during your visit.

Mosaics, mosaics, mosaics!. I have never seen so many impressive mosaics in any other place. If you like mosaic art, as I do, then I can think of no other place that comes close. Aside from the mosaics inside, the exterior of the church is also striking. Since most of the building is no longer an active church you can take photos to our hearts content. I highly recommend this place for a visit.

Absolutely stunning. The craftsmanship is breathtaking, and although a top tourist attraction there is a sense of peace in the building. The majority of the floors are covered to protect them but look at the small portion that is uncovered, beautiful. The mosaics are brilliant

Wow factor 1000x over!. This was my favorite place visited on our cruise. Imagine the grandest cathedral. Now imagine allthe walls floor to ceiling filled with mosaics in the richest colors depicting saints and history. Phenomenal sight!
Mosaics to die for. Everything. The cupolas, the interior of the church and that you could buy a DVD to bring home and relive again.
Classic Russian Church. This was on our tour. This church was built on the spot were Tsar Alexander 11 was killed in 1883. There is a piece of the original canal fence as part of the memorial.
Don't miss it!. So photogenic and unusual inside and out. Couldn't stop taking photos. This is the must-see church in St. Petersburg.
A Site for Everyone's Eyes. Unbelievable church that has floor to ceiling mosaics. These are in picture form and designs that blow your mind. I have never in my life seen anything like the interior.
Wonderful Russian Architecture. This is an easy choice. Classic Russian architecture. The line to get in was short. You should make a stop here going to or from the Hermitage.
Beautiful building. Not sure this belongs at number 1 since you can spend much more time at the Hermitage and Erarta is much more unique. Still, a definite stop on the travel list.

My preferred church in San Petersburg. Prepare your eyes, you camera and, of course, your neck to fully appreciate the 7500 square meters of mosaics that will surrond you as soon as you'll enter the church!

Church of Spilled Blood. The quintessential onion-domed Russian orthodox Cathedral. Don't be misled, though - it is largely a museum with only a small corner still being used as a church. The mosaic murals are incredible!
A jewel. Be amazed by the beauty and the story! One of the most spectacular churches in the world! Built in the Russian style once you hear the story you might understand why there was a revolution.
Church by Canal. Close to Russian Museum and a nice park out back with families and vendors close to the river. Allow an hour to tour and couple other activities for the day.

Magnificent. This church was built on the site of the assassination of Emperor Alexander II and is magnificent. Since St. Petersburg was built on swampy ground, there is a lot of humidity...and therefore the use of oil paintings on the walls and ceilings of the churches in this area is avoided since the paint will fade. Instead, they use thousands of little bits of ceramic tiles and create mosaic frescos on the walls and ceilings....and you have to see it to believe it. Truly beautiful!
Uitstekende locatie in deze tour. Peter the Great was great. Very impressive church with a rich history. Great impression!! Excellent spot during the Russian Experience.
incredable. This building, is easy to find. The colors of the building are amazing, photos do not do it justice, this building leaves you in awe when your standing next to it
WOW!. This church holds an exceptional history and a unique colorful exterior of master craftsmanship. Open daily except Wednesday.

Very nice site. Just on the water. Very nice location. The inside is very impressive as well. We got there with a boot that was included on our tour with baltic wind agency. Exsania our tour guide was very good.

Awesome Exterior. The exterior of this church is unbelievable. The onion tops are very colorful. It was very crowded during the season. The traffic was heavy and they were so many buses, that foot traffic was difficult. Hold tight to your belongings in this area.

The best thing in Russia. We spent two days in St Petersburg whilst on a cruise and as we didn't want to get our own visas we joined a group tour. We were taken to this church and it was the most jaw dropping experience. From the outside it looks amazing, although there are a fair few similar looking buildings architecturally, it is still very impressive. But wait until you get inside! Every piece of the inside structure is made out of different coloured mosaic, It is breathtaking! If you are visiting St Pete's, this is a must visit!
Beautiful Church. One of the most beautiful Cathedrals in Rusia. Similar to Saint Basilio in Moscow. Try to take as much pictures inside the church as you can.

Beautiful and worth a look inside. This building is beautiful outside and inside. Some of the tours will take you by to take picutres of the outside, but this is one church you should go inside. The whole church is mosiac! Gorgeous.
a must. must see both inside and out...fantastic there is a little market near the church which was fun to browse.
Beautiful Church. This is the most beautiful building. I took so many pictures because I loved it. The spilled blood is Tsar Alexander 11's This is where he was murdered.
nothing special. I don't understand what's so special and why it has so great review. Kind of small cathedral has quite expressive look from the street and quite poor inside.

Great visit. We have been in several churches and this one is unique. Just a couple blocks off the main street and only takes thirty minutes. The exterior is grand and the interior is full mosaics. There are also sone nice shops set up behind the church after 10:30 am. And a great little court yard resturant across the canal, st Petersburg cafe. Prices were good and food was too.
stunning visual. It's a sacred place as it marks the spot where Tsar Alexander II was murdered by a bomb thrown int his carriage. Inside is awesome visually.

You HAVE to go inside... Closed Wednesdays!. The church is covered from floor to ceiling in mosaics and paintings. Very colourful and well worth seeing! Open from 10am- 7pm (ticket office closes 6pm!) and the entrance is 250R.As it looks similar to St.Basil's Cathedrale from outside, you might expect it to be similar inside.. But the spilled blood church is so much more beautiful inside- no comparison!

Artistic & Colourful. This church is beautiful from both outside and inside.One of the must visits.The other advantage being its closeness to the city centre.The mosaic work inside is quite intriguing,and the dome structure reminds one of Moscow.
Amazing. This church is the one most spectacular church I have visite so far. The millions of mosaics that make all the wall and ceilings are just amazing.

Don't miss interior. I was skeptical of going inside (the outside is a standard and necessary St. Petersburg experience) but my wife asked if we could so we did and it was one of the highlights of my trip. It is shockingly beautiful, especially when you learn that no paint of any kind was used. The extraordinary colors are all achieved with mosaics.
Beautiful inside and out. One of the most picturesque churches I've ever seen with it's beautiful onion shaped domes in gold and various colors.

For the best photos, visit at dusk/evening. Just like St Basil's in Moscow, this building is magnificent, even from a distance. Best Tip: Visit at dusk or in the evening. It's well-lit and you'll get some beautiful photos free of tour groups passing through!Note that after midnight, there are many clubs in the area so the crowd changes from sightseers to partiers. They're mostly harmless, but something to think about if you're visiting late at night.
beautiful mosaic. must! must! must! it is beautiful ftom the outside and the entire interior mosaic is unbeatable. never seen anything like it.
Baltic Cruise July 2012. Excellent Site to visit. Great chance for Photos and there is a great little market across the road.

Beyond my expectations. I recently visited Russia and the Church of the Spilled Blood. I had the preconceived idea of an atheistic, Communist Russia and no mention of Jesus. We went into the church and started looking at the art work. Jesus and the events from the bible are everywhere!!! I mean EVERYWHERE. I did not expect that. There was the manger scene, Jesus and the woman at the well from John, Chapter 4, there was Abraham and Sarah receiving news of Isaac from the three angels. There was the Mary being told she would give birth to the Saviour. Once we saw one, it became a hunt to find another. I was blessed beyond my wildest imagination. I was told that in some of the bigger churches during the Lenin-Stalin era; they painted over these and used them as stables and storage houses. Smaller churches were destroyed. Then under Boris Yeltsin, after the Soviet Union broke up, they began restoring the churches. What a gift to the world.

Top-Three. This Church that is prominently situated along the Griboedov Canal is definitely worth seeing. My husband and I do not think it is the #1 thing in the area to see, though. Both the State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace, and Peterhof Palace and Garden are bigger and better places to see in the Saint Petersburg area. The highly unusual name for the church is due to the fact Tsar Alexander II was assassinated at this site. It contains over 7,500 square meters / 80,700 square feet of mosaics. It is definitely worth paying admission to see the inside of this impressive structure. The artwork, floors, inlaid stones and mosaics are something you will not see in many places. Many photographs of the impressive mosaics were taken by us.It should be worth noting that our tour guide mentioned this is a high pickpocket area. Make sure your valuables are secure while visiting this beautiful Baroque and Neoclassical (with some romantic nationalism) structure. You want your visit to this magnificent piece of architecture to be a great experience.
Crowded. But worth seeing. Part of the hop on hop off bus tour. The ceramic tiled paintings are pretty amazing.

WOW Gaudi Rival. I have always considered the Gaudi church one of the neatest and most beautiful places in the world, if not the best. However, I ay have to change my opinion after seeing this church. I actually think the outside of the church is better than Gaudi's as i like a lot of color and design and this place has it in spades. The inside is also very cool with all of the mosaics but Gaudi is better with the abundance of light and color. So, this is a place that must be seen to appreciate.
Church of the Spilled blood.. Looked marvelous from the outside, did not have time--on the way to the Hermitage.I only didn't like that we had no time to go into the Church. Edifice is magnificent.

Truly russian building, amazing mosaic decoration inside.. We visited St Petersburg and were not amazed at all on what we saw, but this church is really worth the trip all the way from Mexico. It is a truly Russian building, very well maintained. Inside the church we delighted our Souls and our eyes with the beautiful mosaic images all over the place, a very detail Work to place millions of mosaics, approximately 1 sq inch each with different shapes and colors, placed properly to form huge images..... absolutely gorgeous.
must see church.. it is a great church with water around it. one of the top sights in st petersburg. we didnt have time to go in but hope to stop again someday.
Fantastic. There are reallyl no words to describe this Church- like no other I have seen- and believe me I have seen a lot. The mosaics are mind blowing.

Maybe The Worst Decorative Effort I've Seen. Large rectangular mosaic portraits of patriarchs and saints stacked vertically on all the walls. Notable: One image of Jesus as a teenager. A very smallish image of God with a Star of David behind his head. You needn't plan to stay long.
Visit it!. Beautiful!Dramatic!Impressive!Mosaic everywhere. Serious restoration completed.I am strongly recommend to be with guide.

Spectacular. Beware of thieves. Absolutely amazing and a must see. It's one of the most beautiful churches in the world.Here's your warning: my companion walked out of the tour van, crossed the street, and then was robbed of his camera lens while he was holding the camera in his arm. Yes, it wasn't just hanging there, it was cradled in his arm. Several men approached him, shoved calendars in his face, and stole his lens while he was trying to swat them away. It took only seconds. This can happen anywhere, of course, but I must mention it here, since our Russian guide told us after the incident that things are particularly bad at this site. So, do go, don't be afraid, but take extra precautions with your valuables.It's a little difficult to maneuver inside during cruise season due to the throngs of visitors, but it's worth braving the crowds.

Beautiful Inside and Out. The exterior fulfills the typical russian church photos, but inside you will be amazed at the detail of the decorations, mosaics. It is impressive the amount of time it took to make these mosaics.

Must see but I missed. We only had time to take pictures at a distance. But my fellow travelers who bravely went there by themself without local guide told me the inside was beautiful and excellent. May be the next time I visit St. Petersburg.

The best!. This is the best church I have ever toured. It captivates your attention right away. I was at the St. Isaac's Cathedral when I saw this church in the distance and I just had to go. There was a fee of about 200 rubles but I could not resist going in. Walking around the outside is a treat but when you go inside it is an even greater wonder. The inside of the church is covered with depictions in miniature tile of scenes from Jesus's time here on earth. There are so many reminders of the amazing stories of Jesus including his birth, death and miracles that he performed. I would definitely visit this church again if I return to St. Petersburg.

Incredible mosaics. This beautiful church was built on the site where tsar Alexander II was murdered. Inside and out, every surface is covered with mosaics; I've never seen anything like it. There is a beautiful city park adjacent.

Magnificent. This church is a must see if you are in St Petersburg. Built on the spot where Czar Alexander II was assasinated (the railings he fell upon are also inside the church) this church is a masterpiece. Virtually all the walls, ceiling and columns are decorated in mosaic of a very high quality and all the mosaics are of course hand made.

One of the best sites in St Petersburg. The exterior is copying the church of Moscow . But the interior is a treasure of genuine Russian painting of 19 c. It is unbeliavable the realistic iconography by the 3 geat masters .Vasnetsov, Vrubel, Nesterov. Dont miss it

Church of the Spilled Blood. This is a beautiful church and one of my favorities in Russia. I did not get the opportunity to go inside (long line and there is a charge). I was told the inside was rather plain and there was so much to see surrounding the church. The ironwork on the fences surrounding the church is beautiful, across the street there is some good souvenir shopping (remember to barter a little) and it was fun to watch the canal next to the church.
The Church on the Spilled Blood - St. Petersburg. This was my favorite site that I visited while in St. Petersburg. Make sure you go inside too. The inside is just as picturesque as the outside.
Well worth the visit. Beautiful, but crowded. Well worth it with our guide. Beautiful insides. Glad it wasn't bombed to the ground.
Church of the Spilt Blood. This is one of the great churches of the world with great frescoes. The high ceilings enhance the display of these great art works and the overall ambience.
As beautiful on the inside as on the outside. This is a spectacular sight and a must see on the inside. And if you are lucky like us, you will get awesome photos of the outside on a sunny day!
Fascinating and amazing interior to building.. Found it so interesting to look round. Just another breathtaking building with a wonderful story to go with it. Our guide brought it to life for us.
Fascinating church. This church is one of the unique and most interfering in the world. It also sits on an historic spot where Alexander II was assassinated

Mosaic masterpiece !!!!!. The inside of this church is covered with iconic mosaic religous scenes that are breathtaking !!!!!!!!!! It is situated in a delightful setting right alongside one of the great canals of Saint Petersburg,very easy access and well worth a visit.
Magnificent. Do not miss this church. It's beautiful. You won't be disappointed. All of the artwork is mosaic tiles and the oppulence is breathtaking.

Beautiful small church, outside and inside. This is a beautiful building when you see it from outside, one of the most famous icons of St. Petersburg... and the inside is also beautiful, covered with mosaics recently restored. A great sight even for the non-religious.
Don't miss it. Beautiful, amazing. Well worth the effort and entrance fee? The mosaics are out of this world and the history is fascinating.

Iconic Russian Church. This church is exactly what you think of when you think of Russia and St. Petersburg. Its onion domes are covered in beautiful mosaics. The inside has beautiful mosaics as well. A visit to the Church on Spilled Blood doesn't take very long, but it is well worth your time.
Stunning. Just beautiful inside and out. Worth going inside to see how the chruch was rennovated after it was left to become a ruin in the 20th Century.
Amazing. This is a must see and we went inside when there were not many people going through this church.the history of this Church is very interesting and the guide was very good.
Beautiful. So beautiful...we only viewed from the outside but it was just breathtaking...a must see. I'm sure there is beauty inside as well!

Holy Onion Domes! (Good gift shop). This "must-see" did not disappoint. Far too many pictures were taken, but this Russian church is the perfect size for close-up wow photography. Unlike the vast, extraordinary expanse of the Blue Mosque in Istanbul with its spectacular mosaics, this church doesn't require professional equipment and a neck brace to take fab pictures. It's intimate and spectacular, with the mosaics close enough for detailed ogling. Definitely a highlight of our St Petersburg visit.Don't by-pass the gift shop just inside the entrance. It's full of delightful souvenirs vastly better than the dubious and often over-priced offerings on the streets. If you have Catholic (or even agnostic) friends, there are affordable icons, cross pendants (very nice selection), other religious and vaguely religious items that make very Russian gifts. I would say, quite an attraction on its own!

Also a must when you visit St. Petersburg.. So beautiful, you can't believe the outside and inside. You can take pictures without a flash, and I recommend doing this for the beauty is hard to remember with just one visit.

My favorite church in St Petersburg. It has the wow factor from the first glimpse, it is magnificent. When you walk inside it is even more stunning, so much work has gone into the mosaics, then of course there is the shrine on the exact place of Alexander's death, it is covered in semi precious stones. This church was severely damaged during the war and has undergone an amazing restoration.
Incredible!. Hard to add anything new or original to the list of rave reviews .... both interior and exterior are striking, one of St. Petersburg's foremost attractions for a reason. Don't miss!

Impressive decoration. While most Europian churches and cathedrals have stained glass to record holy historical facts or saints' life, Russian churches use wall paintings to acheived the same objective. There is no space left unpainted.

Best Attraction in St. Petersburg. This church is absolutely awesome. From the outside it is everything that a Russian building should have......onion domes, multi colors, turrets, etc. On the inside the mosaics are the best I have ever seen...better than the Mosques in Istanbul. Also the Eastern Othodox religious artifacts are wonderful. A must see!
Mosaic, Mosaic, more Mosaic!. Was a overcast day and construction in front, hard to get a good look at the colorful building. Inside, amazing mosaics covering 100% of the walls!
a MUST see in St Petersburg. This is a simply marvelous reconstruction of a beautiful building that was much negelected post-1917 and much damaged in WW2.
Wonderful. Didn't have time to go inside this church but fellow travellers say it was wonderful. Just the outside is awe inspiring. The colours of the domes - wow.
Don't Miss Church of the Spilt Blood. While the exterior is gorgeous, the interior of this cathedral is beyond belief. Beautiful examples of the intricacy of murals,

Beautiful - a must visit. The outside of the building is beautiful but you're blown away again by the wonderful mosaics on the inside. This is definitely a must see when you're in St. Petersburg. Not only that but the market adjoining it has some neat trinkets that make for good souvenirs!

Mind blowing. We approached via Konyushennaya Pl. Can't see the church until the last minute, as you pass a building. The church is next to it and set back. Literally took my breath away. Sandy commented that in our 18 years together she's seldome seen me speechless. Unfortunately most days here, including today, are cloudy for this would be even more spectacular in the sun. We rented the tape to hear as we went around inside but it was of limited interest. It talks about many different things in the church but you have no idea where they are. Photography is allowed inside, but no flash. The entire inside of the church is mosaic panels, not a square inch is left uncovered. Mosaid was used becaumuch more durable than other coverings. The interior is equally as beautiful as the exterior, just completely different. This church ranks right up there with St. Basils Cathedral in Moscow as one of the manmade wonders of the world.

Church of the Spilled Blood. One can O.D. on churches, but this is a must-see. Every square inch of walls inside (and there are many, with alcoves and nooks and crannies and high ceilings) is made of small colorful pieces of mosiac.

Stunning Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood. This beautiful church with its gorgeous onion tops is a must when you visit St Petersburg.
Its stunning on the outside, but dont just take your photographs of the exterior, make sure that you go inside, where you will see the most truly beautiful mosiacs you have ever seen. The whole interior of the church takes your breath away.
Gorgeous!!!!
Its SPB answer to St. Basil's. In a lovely area and well worth a visit. The surrounding parks and canals mean there is lots to do. A little bit too "touristy" for us but well worth a visit.

Best place for shopping in all of St. Petersburg. The outdoor market across from this Church is the very best place for shopping for tourists in all of St. Petersburg. Lots of vendors, most speak English, very friendly, and prices are about 1/3 of what you will find in the overpriced tourist shops most buses will take tourists to. Especially good bargains in the lacquered boxes. Quality ranges from cheap to excellent, so do a little advance research to know what you want. Most tourist buses make a short shop at this church, so try to quickly take some pictures of the beautiful church, and run across the street to the outdoor market, do all your shopping as fast as you can, and you will save lots of money.
Worth going inside as well as seeing the outside. Although it looks very good from the outside, it is worth paying the small fee to see the interior, which is very sumptuous.
epic. worth the entry, pretty incredible, one of the highlights of the touristy stuff in St petersburg, just wished we could of gone up the tower
Church of Spilled Blood, St Petersburg. an awesome church. Just like a fairytale from the outside, but so beautiful inside. Walking distance form the Winter Palace and Nevsky Prospekt.
Beautiful exterior. Very dramatic exterior. Didn't visit the interior but good photo opps from the outside. Walk down the canal/river at the side a little for the best photos.
Renewed. Amazing!! Nothing to compare this Cathedral. All my live I wanted to visit there and it was closed. I was all around the world and I have to say, it is really amazing!
Beautiful view from the Griboedov Canal. This is another MUST SEE in St Petersburg, walk along the Griboedov Canal to reach the church, great picture spots.

Beautiful and moving. The outside of the church is spectacular - but the inside is even more so. The sacred artistry and beauty of the interior was amazing and the story behind the building of the church very moving. It was very crowded during our visit, so make sure that you tour it with a guide to get the most out of your visit. Do not miss the opportunity to tour this church.
amazing architecture. liked the architecture, onion domes were awsome. Once inside though it was even more amazing, no paintings, but all the pictures on the walls were mosics. Well worth seeing.
The most beautiful!. This church should not be missed. The outside is so colorful and iconic, but the inside will blow you away. So colorful! So is its story.

Must See. The spilled blood title deals with the assination of one of the Czars on the site of the church. The church was almost destroyed following the revolution and even used as a motuary during the seige. It is now fully restored.

another monument to slaved wealth. Yes, it's a beautiful building, and plenty of Russians come to genuflect in front of it... but it's really a better monument for the millions of slaves/serfs that paid for this monument in THEIR blood and not some rich dead guy.

Awesome. Although we were there on a gray, rainy day, this was the most colorful church we visited, both inside and outside. You can get a good view and photo of the exterior on a bridge down the street/canal from the entrance. The interior is overwhelmingly beautiful with tiles covering the floors, mosaics on the wall, columns, and ceiling, and with plenty of gold. Despite the crowds, this is a church you don't want to miss. Interestingly, it was built over the site where Alexander II, a reformer who freed the serfs, was killed.

Beautiful church. The church was magnificient. It could be seen from all over St. Petersburg. It is so beautiful it almost doesn't look real, but it is. Inside the fabulous art and treasures will fill every sense.
Lovely!. I loved the aestetics of this church - very capturing to the eye! Can be seen from many vantage points and I also used it to guide me around the city!

Get a tour or audio guide for the whole story. I've seen my share of cathedrals around the world, and this one is certainly among the most impressive, inside and out. Something about those colorful domes of the Russian churches in general gets me, but the progression and story told by the elaborate mosaics lining the inside of the enormous building are entirely impressive. Go of the tour or audioguide; the stories behind it all are not to be missed. Do be prepared to endure a boring, snooty sounding voice on the audioguide, though.

A hidden treasure. This stunning church is hidden in the smaller streets of St Petersburg at the Moika canal. However, it is well worth looking for. Its rich decorations and colourful 'kupola' make it one of the most photographed landmarks in the city,

Amazing. This is what everyone imagines when they think of the architecture of Russia. The domes, the colours are exceptional in the sunshine. It is quite something to think you are so close to the spot where Alexander II was injured and later died of his injuries.

unbelievable- do not miss. Huge interior almost all covered with incredible mosaics
Fairy tale exterior with bright coloured cupolas
Admission charge 250roubles
Crowded but worth it!. Beautiful architecture, and jaw-dropping floor to ceiling mosaic art. Just be prepared to fight the crowds.

An amazing church. This church is beautiful to look at on the outside and the inside is a wonder to behold. The gold gleams from every wall and it is simply stunning to look at. The history is also fascinating. It is definitely worth the visit as it has been beautifully restored. It has a nice little market place over the road and a lovely park beside it.

Beautiful exterior but stunning interior. This is a definite must see for visitors to St. Petersburg. The interior is simply stunning with all the gorgeous mosiacs which cover every inch of wall and ceiling space. And you are allowed to take photos. If you're not there with a guide, I would recommend getting an audioguide.

Admirable. This church is super beautiful. Both inside and outside it's a masterpiece and a St. Petersburg must see. It's located opposite a garden (park)which I don't know the name but that was beautiful too.
Beautiful. This church is recently restored and beautiful. It is crowded and there is a fee to enter, but I think it is work the price. The mosaics inside are stunning.
Striking and eye-catching church.. Used to be a warehouse during Soviet Union era.Beautiful mosaics. Breathtaking.Absolutely must see!

Absolutely Wonderful. This church is amazing and is as good as the photos. You just stand and admire the outside and then you go inside and it is the most incredible place, floor to ceiling mosaics depicting everything religious you could imagine. Our camera worked overtime but we didnt do it justice this is a place you need to see first hand.The street vendors outside selling souvineers were very expensive so remember to bargain, we had no sucess and bought same trinkets elsewhere at a better price.

"Just Magnificent!". The outside was just amazingly beautiful but the inside really did make me gasp! The walls and ceilings were covered solid with mosaic's. I just mouthed "Oh, my God" to the guide and she just smiled knowing how beautiful it was. If you didn't believe in God before walking into that church you did then. Probably what you would feel at the Vatican in Rome. A place not to be missed, is just amazing!

Have your camera ready. Unfortunately we were not able to enter the building, but still worth the visit to walk around this building and take photos. Initially saw the outline from a boat trip around the canals , even more impressive when you actually stop outside. One of the must sees in the city

Stunning!. This church is the sight where Alexander II died. During the Romanesque period, it served as storage for potatoes and other produce. During the war it was used as a morgue. Its restoration started in 1970 and lasted 27 years.
We did not go in but still I had a wonderful time!

Very beautiful, inside and out.. This building is no longer a church, but a museum. It seems that every inch of the walls are covered with art so beautiful that it could have been a distraction to worshiping here when it was a church. It is will worth the 250 Ruble (about $8.50) entrance fee. The contents of the gift shops inside seemed the most reasonably priced of any I saw in St. Petersburg.
Church of our saviour on spilled blood. A must see for every visitor to St Petersburg with both impressive exterior and mosaic interior. Try to go early to miss the crowds.
recommend to visit. We were really impressed! Just look slowly around, take your time, pay attention to the floor and to the ceiling. Beautiful mosaic pictures are everywhere!!!

Church of the Spilled Blood. Wow!! Weren't able to go in on our last visit but this was absolutely stunning. Only being a small group of 9 we got in early and were able to see it all. Got very crowded and rather noisy later.

Very impressive. This is a very beautiful church both from the inside and outside, defenitely a must see place. It was filled with people though, it's probably best to see it as soon as it opens in the morning.

russian architecture. This is a magnificent structure! The interior is an abundance of mosaics, amazing!!!!!! Puts one in the mind of the interior of the Vatican. Breathtaking. If on a cruise make sure this is included in your tour exclusion
Interesting. I have been visiting in year 1980 too. The old storage is in the right use now. So beatyful also outside
amazing inside and outside. mosaics all over, even if they're just 19th and 20th century, they make a dazzling interior display. And the site where Tsar Alexander was assassinated is interesting.

Busy place so be prepared to move slowly. Steeped in history, the place where the Tsar Alexander II was assassinated, and the original cobblestone paving is still visible. The Church was built over the place of assassination, prior to this I thought the Tsar had been killed whilst in Church! Again you are able to take pictures/video's but the place is quite congested so be prepared to move in slow time. The iconastas are amazing!
a gem. wounderful place ,small, but fantastic. If you have to see one church choose this one. Not really far from hermitage

Mosaics to die for!. Lots and lots of mosaics, up to the the dome and over the top. But the church has not the "spilled blood" nickname because a tsar was killed here--and they turned the spot where he was killed into a shrine. Garish, grisly, but in its odd way, rather fun.

wonderful. Wonderful, amezing, coluorful and beatiful church. Near the river, shining under the sunlight, eye catching. Open untill 22:00 in july . One of the must see list in St. Petersburg. There is gift shop inside.

The outside is more interesting than the inside. The inside was wrecked by Stalin and the second world war and only very recently restored to its original glory.The inside is mostly mosaics and granite carvings which either hold your interest or don't. One complaint is, we bought the audio guide and the commentary had very little connection with the 'stations' to visit.Visit the outside for a photo opportunity but save yourself some money and give the inside a miss.

Amazing church - even if you are all churched out. This building from the outside and inside is amazing. It's history and survival thru conflict is also interesting. The big warning is be prepared to be a sardine here - crazy crowded!

So Amazing !!. I visited this Church about three times in three days and thought both the interior and exterior to be so beautiful. Seeing those onion domes against the still bright sky at 10 pm at night was something I will never forget. To think it was nearly pulled down in the early 1940's !!!!!!!!!!
Unique. The exterior decoration draws you as no other place I've been. The interior was thoroughly restored and captured its former spirit as a church.

Excellent Church. Another 5-star attraction in St Petersburg. Both the interior and exterior have been renovated and are outstanding.Beautiful mosaics abound throughout the interior (well worth the admission price of $10). The church is on one of the city's many canals and across the street from an open-air shopping area. Plan on two-to-three hours for the church and shopping zone.

Breathtaking. The Church of Redemption, also called the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is a grand, opulent, slendid, must see church built over the sight where Alexander II was murdered. Turned into a potato and vegetable storage warehouse during world war II you can still see the marks on the beautiful mosaic tiles where the shelves were. Go with a guide or read a book first that will tell you about how the glass (onion dome) flame tops were made and the history of this magnificent building. Definitely a bucket list stop!
Breathtaking. The Church is beautiful inside and outside. The architecture is amazing. I loved the floor to ceiling mosiacs which depict scenes from the Bible... it's beyond words. A must see!

Odd name but interesting church. Brilliant architecture, colourful cupolas, interesting story as to the name of it
Little tourist market across the road-how many Russian dolls does each stalllholder have!!!
If in St. Petersburg, a great visit. Definately the perfect example of Russian Orthodox Church Architecture that we as western's have come to expect. Beautiful, and the park next to it is beautiful

The beauty queen (or king) of SBP. This is a wonder. In order to avoid the busy periods it is worth visiting during the afternoon 1-2 hour before the closing time. We went around 5 PM, no que for the tickets and even inside we did not have to bump into groups every minute and should not listen the noisy tour guides. The enterior is even more spectacular than the outside of the building. For us this was the "TOP" of our SPB visit.

Church of Our Savior of Spilled Blood. One of the most beautiful structures that I have seen. Inside, everything done in mosaics of small tiles from wall to wall. Make sure you take a picture in front of it.

Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Always wanted to see this. Inside of church wonderous. Glass tiles magnificent. Indescribably beautiful! inside and outside. Went late afternoon, not over crowded.

Beautiful inside and out.. I was looking so forward to seeing this building as it is always the picture that is featured on St. Petersburg. What I didn't know was how beautiful it was inside as well. Amazing
Amazing church!!. This is an amazing church!!! You must visit!!!The walls interior is made of 7.000 m2 of mosaic!! unbeliavable!!

Do not miss this church!!!. I can not say enough on how impressed we were with this church. It is so different from anything we had seen before. Plan on spending an hour if you want to see the whole church. So lovely. You can read up on the history of the church ahead of time, or hire a guide. We found the guides very helpful in Russia and not expensive at all.
Rather over the top. Very interesting to see, but somewhat gaudy. Excellent externally. This is the location that Czar Micholas II was assassinated.

Don't miss this jewel of architecture and history. This is beautiful building with fascinating history. Look carefully both in ad outside. No effort has been spared to decorate this church in most elaborate way. Note especially the vast mosaics.

Great. AWESOME, what a fantastic sight.
Full recommend visiting this if you are in St P
Interesting visit. great location and a very interesting interior. Well worth a visit.

This rivals the Alhambra and the cathedrals of Rome for excellence and amazement!. The mosaics that constitute the wonders of this structure can't be described adequately by mortals such as I. If you have the chance, go see this!
Unbelievably beautiful. Look what the renovaters did to this brautiful church which nearly vanished during Soviets !

Jewel of St Petersburg. Very elaborate memorial to one of the Russian royals. Better in real than the pictures you see in travel books. Interesting story behind the church. Beautiful mosaics inside. Do not miss this.
Awesome beauty. Not Christian, but you have to be impressed with the magnificent design, sublime beauty, sense of spirituality.

Beautifully presented onion dome church. A lovely exterior and typically Russian. Fantastically photogenic on the outside but I found it so over-the-top on the inside that it was ugly. I'm sure many people will disagree with that but every possible surface was painted or covered with gilt. Far too ornate for my liking. Definitely a Must See tourist attraction though so don't miss it.

Makes your head spin!. The richness and complexity of the mosaics makes your head spin trying to see everything inside the building.Impossible to take it all in when you see the restoration project. So many colours and so much gold.The onion type domes outside & the many faceted details are an amazing reflection of human skill.

History, beauty, renovation. Fantastic church encompassing the beauty of Russian architecture, the dark history of Russian rulers, and the country's heroic restoration efforts. Lovely Byzatine icons for sale, the best and prettiest ones in my opinion.
Different stories from different angles.. Read up on the murder and see this palace from the water. It's an amazing icon that stands for greed and injustice.
Outside superb, inside similarly. One of our first tastes of Cathedrals of Russia. Really awesome.

Exquisite.. The exterior is amazing and on entry into the church the magnificent mosaics are breathtaking.There is nothing to dislike apart from the reason for the church being built in the first place.
A superb memorial.I was spell bound.
Well worth a visit. We were very glad to have the opportunity to visit the Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood.

Gorgeous from all angles. This church, like many attractions in SPB has been restored both inside and out. The workmanship is breathtaking and it is interesting to see the photographs of the restoration efforts. The park and surroundings of the church are also worth a visit if you have time.

The domes and tiled interiors are phenomenal. This place was a gem of a surprise. The artwork, floors, inlaid stones and mosaics are really beautiful. Even if you are not a believer or a fan of religious art, this is still a wonderful place to come and see while you are in this most elegant city, A guide will give you the history of the place (which explains the name-there is not a religious reason for spilled blood), and will bring the era to life for you.
One of my most favorite places in the world. A lot of memories, a lot of sentimental attachment :)
Amazing. This is a amazing church. The mosiac tile inside leaves you speechless. The outside is the post card picuture for Russia. I would have a guide to help explain everything inside

Look out for the evening openings. This is such a popular church to visit and we must have about 100 photos. By luck, we were walking past later in the evening (maybe about 9pm) and noticed that it was still open! We visited then and there were very few people there so got lots of time to look about and enjoy it. I did notice on leaving that the evening times were advertised. I would really recommend looking out for these times if you can.
Church of our Saviour on Spilled Blood. This is a beautiful church with fresco's on the ceiling and it is well maintained.
Magic. You have to see yourself to understand The Church of our Savior. It is big, it is beautiful and impossible to describe, truly
Gorgeous looking Church. Loved all the mosaics and the facades. Just beautiful.
Fascinating. The mosaic work both inside and outside are detailed and colorful. It's worth paying the entrance fee to go inside.

Amaising!. The most important place in Church is place where the kiling had heppened. But, the most impresiv is that church is all, walls and flors are in pictures, but none of tham is painted. Everithing is done of small stones in diferent colours. Amaising! Flors are done of diferent kinds of murbel and they look like pwrsiam carpets. It is somethin you shouldn't miss.
Restoration. They spent years restoring this church and it is so very beautiful.
Great. A magificent structure, with wonderful mosaics inside!Very worthwhile visiting
Just like the book shows.. I've never seen such amazing and prolific mosaics. Not too expensive either considering what all of Russia has begun to charge.
Beware pickpockets. Outside is stunning. So colourful and interesting, but the area in front is notorious for pickpockets. I know my companion lost all his credit cards.
Must see. This is great amazing history and the workmanship is something.

Magnificent Inside and Out. This Church is beautiful on in the inside and out. You should not miss this when visiting Saint Petersburg. The Church is located just next to a nice green park and one of the water canals. You will pass by this church if you do a water tour. There are vendors selling souvenirs across the street and there are some eating options nearby.The exterior is stone and has the coloured domes like Saint Basil's. But unlike Saint Basil's the interior is spectacular. Everything is pretty much in gold flake. The walls and ceiling are covered in large murals. There are many scenes depicted and I think this church is well worth a guide be able to explain all the scenes and details if you have the time.There are bathrooms available and the staff is cordial. Photography is permitted.
Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood. Admission to get in, photography allowed. Interiors are beautiful mosaics.
Go here, take lots of pictures!. What a beautiful structure! It's a bit crowded, but that's to be expected. Well worth the hassle though.

Good space. Very different from any other church buildings we saw in Europe. The colour and the gold on the exterior was something I could look at for hours. The wall paintings of new Testament scenes were inspirational. Well worth a look if your in St Petersburg.
Don't miss the inside. It's amazing! The church's outside is already beautiful and its inside is awesome!

You will never forget your first view. This is truely a magnificant site. While most churches amaze inside or out but not both this is something special. The colourful facade and the walls of mosaic combined with history make this one of the highlights of St Petersburg

The entire inside done in Mosiacs!!. I am not going to comment on all of the sites that we saw in St Petersburg, but as I look at reviews on this church, I cannot believe that anyone does not point out the mosiacs that are inside. The entire inside, all scenes, depictions, etc. are done in Mosiacs, all the way up to the dome, incredible! How long did that take to do? For anyone that has been to St Pauls in London or St Peters in Rome, imagine a similar size interior ( not quiet as large but close) and the entire inside done in Mosaics. It is absolutely stunning and not to be missed. I understand that a lot of tours only stop at this cathedral at the outside, you must go inside and see this, unbelievable !!
Like a fairy tale. This church actually very different for St.Petersburg, it's totally covered with wonderful mosaics and remind me the russian fairy tales with it's architecture.
Do not miss the inside. Extraordinary - a historic and beautiful place with plenty to see
TRUELY TOOK OUR BREATH AWAY!!. We were fortunate, the crowds were tolerable. The church was spectacular. Many churches in St. Pete to see, however, this is one that can not be missed!
Late afternoon visit.. Make sur you go in the morning for the best camera shots, because that's where the sun is - on the front a.m. Very crowded, and 30 minutes is probably enough

Very Russian. It was only built in the 19th century but has a feel of a much older place as it was done in a very old-fashioned Russian style. Very rich and beautiful (particularly from the outside) and well worth a visit. It should not take long (30 mins to an hour at the most).
Amazing!. This church is best example of russian mosaic art and great work of russian restores. The church have very interesting and not ordinary history.

amazing. amazing russian architect , colourful and the best photo u can take with the cathdral from the canel side.
unfortunatly i couldnt get chance to watch it from inside.

A spectacular church. This was my favourite place in St Petersburg. It is spectacularly beautiful inside and outside. The architecture is amazing but go inside and WOW! The entire internal walls, dome and ceilings are covered in beautifully crafted mosaics. I'm not religious but this place is breathtakingly beautiful and uplifting. A 'must see'.

Jaw Dropping Beauty. This was definitely the highlight of our St. Petersburg tour. The stunning beauty of this church is unbelievable until you actaully see it. Our tour group all agreed as we finished our tour and stood outside for a few more glimpses that this site is just spectacular. Don't miss it! You could spend a lot of time here just looking at all the intricate details.

Beautiful Church with Sad Story. The outside of the church is unique and catches the interest. The story behind the church is sad -- as I was told it was never a worship place but rather used for burial services.
Great way to stay warm. The churches are great examples of marvelous architecture and the decoration and elaborate interiors are well worth seeing.

One for your checklist. It's hard to take a bad photo of the exterior of this place.Terrific mosaics cover every inch of the interior. Lovely and worth seeing. Shouldn't take more than 45 minutes at the very most
This is richness!. on the site that a czar was killed, they built this incredibly rich church. words can`t describe so much opulence.
Beautiful. Did not go inside, but a wonder from the outside, the architecture is awesome
Ticks all the Russian boxes. It looks like St Basil's and is exremely impressive close up. Best looking church in town.
really mystical. We visited it on the late afternoon of our first ay in town. people were attending the ceremony, singing sweetly, and the czars were there. A great welcome
Don't miss this church. Steeped in Russian History, this church is extraordinary. The mosaics are amazing. The entire church is just gorgeous.

Fascinating!. Yes it is ON the Spilled Blood as it is the place where Alexander II was killed by terrorists - make sure you look right under the canopy where you will see the cobblestones still there where the assault took place and on which the Church was built.
A masterpiece. I am not a religious person at all but it really makes you wonder if there's some superior forces somewhere when you see this place....
I can't believe all the mosaics. This church was erected as a memorial to an assassinated tsar, and is covered (inside and out) with fantastic mosaics, many of which include gold tiles

unbelievably beautiful. This church is a must see if you visit St Petersburg.The mosaics are sooooo good that they look like paintings until you get closer.
The only down side to visiting this church are the pickpockets.One person in our group was accosted and we also saw another being pickpocketed.Such a shame they should have a larger police presence.

artistry at a new level. While in St. Petersburg, we checked out all the usual attractions, but this is the one not to miss. At first you might think, wow- nice paintings. Look closer and you will be amazed.

Don't miss this!. The Architecture of this church is quite fantastic! Allow extra time to walk through the gorgeous gardens that adjoin the church and the little markets next door. Opening times are after 6.30pm so save this for an evening activity.
history lesson. unbelievable church and history behind it . unforgettable and provided by TJ TRAVEL
Must see inside. The visit inside rather than the ship tours who mainly only go to the outside.

Church of the Spilled Blood. This is a beautiful church with colorful spires. The walls have many mosaics to test your Biblical knowledge or just to admire. There is a good market across the street where you can barter for prices.
Stunningly beautifil church. You really have to see this church to appreciate the beauty and splendor.

Spectacular!. If you love mosaics, since 1968 they have reconstructed or refurbished every square inch of wall space from the damage of the revolution. Its not just a holy shrine but an extraordinary piece of architecture and artwork. There is a 45 min DVD of the history, restoration work and tour inside and out for about $10. A must see.
OMG!!!! Beautiful!!!. Stunning inside and out! A must visit. I would place the Hermitage and the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood as the two must visit places in St Petersburg.
Beautiful. We saw it from outside but it is a sight not to be missed. The domes are beautiful and so colourful...
Must to see. No paintings. 8000 sq.meters of mosaic. Simply must to do.
Simply glorious. I have never seen anything so breathtaking as this church, truly a Russian masterpiece, awe inspiring mosaics, visit this before anything else
Splendid church. Built on the site of the assassination of Tsar Alexander II and very nice inside

Beautiful outside, nothing special inside. The most beautiful church I´ve ever seen from outside. When you see it, the first thing you think is: I want to get in! It´s little bit costy and looks like all the ortodox churches from inside.I recommend the church close to the Peterhof. You´will see it when taking the bus to go back to St. Petersburg city center. It´s free and you can go to the top with a "donation" of 50RUB. Awesome view !
Beautiful. Ranks with the Taj in India as the most beautiful thing we have ever seen.
Must Go Inside. Its a landmark everyone will take a picture of but the inside reminds me of the Sistine Chapel but instead of paint its done in mosaic from top to bottom. Very amazing!

Amazing and Colorful. I was absolutely amazed with this church. It was wonderful how you could catch glimpses of this church throughout the city as you approached it. The colors were wonderful and the mosaics inside the church were fabulous. At every turn there was something wonderful to see. I never expected this church or any of the others to be as wonderful.
Unbelievable!. This was an amazing church to see. The mosaics were breath-taking. One of the most beautiful churches in the world - don't miss it. Even my teenagers were in awe!

Marvelous. St. Isaac's Cathedral is the largest cathedral in St. Petersburg. Yes we had fun .......It was the largest church in Russia when it was built (101.5 meters high), and is still the third largest domed cathedral in the world. For visitors willing to climb 300 steps, it provides a spectacular view of St. Petersburg.

Colours. The walk up to the Church, the visual treat ...brilliant colours and history of the Church make the visit a breathtaking experience.
Viewed from various aspects, the spires are visible from various angles and from behind many other sites in this picturesque city

Absolutely stunning - what a masterpiece. Incredible, this is definitely one not to be missed in St Petersburg. The mosaics are incredible and information on the repair work was very interesting. So beautiful inside as well as out.

Colorful. Different architecture from typical Russian architecture. Very central. You may buy some souvenirs across the Church. There are many souvenirs shop. So colorful to take some pictures. Similar to Moscow's St Vasili Cathedral.

Gorgeous! Ticket booth closes early.. A must see when you're in town. The ticket booth closes early and I think it is closed one day a week so check before you go. Nice souvenir shopping across the street.
absolutely gorgeous!. Didn't go inside, but the outside is spectacular! Check out my pics at http://growninsouthernground.wordpress.com/2012/07/02/moscow-st-petersburg/.

Unbelievable! Incredible mosiacs. The outside is just the beginning of how incredible this place is. My jaw literally dropped when we entered this amazing church. The mosiacs are just incredible! I'm sorry we did not have more time to linger here, but I would put this at the top of my list in St. Petersburg.

Unusual eye catching. The church of the spilt blood is one of the most unusual yet beautiful churches we saw on our world travels. It is all done in small mosaic tiles. Outside and inside. Across the road we also went to some great little markets
Another russian spectacle. The scales of the St Petersburg attractions is simply stunning.
Church of Mosiacs. We have seen many impressive churches throughout Europe but this one was so unique with the entire inside done in mosiac murals. Beautiful beyond belief!

Magical. We didn't go inside but the outside was of course a sight to behold. Despite the fact that it is a 'newer' church it is still quite the sight, not to be missed. Right next to a canal , park and little souvenir market it is a lovely atmosphere.

Worth a visit. Named "Spilled Blood" because on of the czars was assassinated here. The icons and frescos are unbelievable. The church is near the hub of St. Petersburg, so it's an easy visit and well worth the time

Stunning mosaics. This was our second visit to the Church having been on our previous holiday in April 2010. I was even more astounded by its incredible mosaics in the interior, the complexity and beauty of the wrok and particularly how the artists showed emotions within the faces. If you are interested in Russian religious artefacts this church fulfils all expectations.
