Once again having a book on the church gave all the information which I wanted and is a marvellous souvenir to retain.

Breathtaking - not to be missed, rain or shine!!. Fog had enshrouded the spires and it was looking like we'd miss the chance to photograph the stunning colors of the Church, but as we stepped out of the van, the fog lifted and there was the mosaic splendor!! Make sure to have a guide to hear about the designing and artistic rendering of the spectacular mosaic work.

Breathtaking!!. A very beautiful church and a magnificent restoration. Despite the mobs of people on tours, the wait for tickets was reasonable and I was able to see things without being badly blocked by groups. I cannot recommend this highly enough - and this from someone who has seen thousands of religious buildings.

Pickpockets go to Church too - watch your camera lens!. The Church of the Spilled Blood is indeed a must see in St. Petersburg. Walk around the back and across the canal for a great picture. The outside is amazing and the mosaics inside stunning. Everything related in the Traveladvisor reviews is right on. Go there, you will love it! However ...The front plaza is a mass of humanity. Tourists from all over the world and unfortunately a few pickpockets too. I am a careful traveler. There is nothing in my pockets or on my person that can be easily removed by the slick of hand, or so I thought! I was carrying my Mark ii Canon with its $1500 lens around my neck hanging in front of me. (On a braided metal reenforced strap.) I was approached in the crowd tall blond guy trying to sell me (i thought) a calendar. He held it parallel to the ground and pushed it into my stomach above the camera. Instinctively, without thought I roughly pushed him away. He went into a fake "hurt my leg stance" and his partner approached on my other side. I quickly kept walking away. A few minutes later the lens fell off my camera. Fortunately it wasn't hurt. It did however teach me a lesson or two.One, they are very good and very fast and two, Canon has a button on the side of the lens which when pushed and the lens is 1/4 turned at the same time it can be gone. Just as easy as that. If you have a Canon try it. It is amazing how easy it is. Stay awake people! Hope this helps. It can happen anywhere and none of this is intended to detract from the Church of the Spilled blood. It is more than worth a visit.
WOW. This was unlike no other. We were dumbfounded at the architecture. The history is something we knew nothing about and were mesmerized by the story.
beautiful. a bit crowded inside, but the mosaics everywhere are stunning. definitely recommendable
Worth a visit. You need a guide to give you the historical information otherwise you will not appreciate what you are looking at.
Spilt Blood Cathedral. Really enjoyed viewing the detailed mosaics inside the Cathedral.

Unique and Beautiful. During our city tour of St. Petersburg, we stopped at Chuch of our Savior on Spilled Blood. It is a must see while in St. Petersburg. Its unique and colorful structure is truly beautiful. Our tour guide told us that the best view to take a picture is to walk a few meters to the bridge. It was amazing! We were able to walk around the church and take more beautiful photos.
Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood. Remarkable structure, History fascinating. Mosaic interior unbelievable
Amazing Space. The crowds can be daunting but don't let that deter you from this impressive church. The mosaics are powerful--rich in splendor color.
Very Russian. The church of spilt blood is a must see in St Petersburg. Amazing from the outside and so interesting inside with all the colorful walls being mosaics.

If you can't get to Moscow this is a must!. A church/museum of significant history. Worth seeing as the mosaics are gorgeous. Was a warehouse during communist rule, it is now a museum. It was dedicated to the tsar. Similar to St. Basil's in Moscow it is a demonstration of beautiful architecture.

more like an art gallery than an church. liked the paaintings on the wall, disliked the crowds, would suggest getting there before the tour groups get there or later in afternoon wwhenv they have gone. A camera is essential
Spilled Blood Church Magnificent. A must see on the inside. Ulko tours takes you into the church while others only do a drive-by. Gotta see this magnificent church.
A Must See!. The Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is truly one of the most unique churches I've ever seen in all my travels. You could spend days just marveling at all the mosaic work.
A Must See!. Opulence and opulence. Cannot believe how beautiful!

beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever been to. I recommend an inside tour also (it is just as beautiful inside as it is out). Given its central location, you are bound to bump into it when you are out and about. This makes it not only a historical treasure, but extremely convenient.

One of my favourite churches. Not a large church, so your visit will not take long. But pretty much every inch of the inside walls and ceiling is covered with mosaics depicting bible scenes etc. Amazing. Up there among my favourite churches with the Sagrada Familia (Barcelona) and St Peter's Basilica.

Try to view during day and at night. Beautiful building a must on all tourist lists, try to get there at night as well especially during the white night season, you will be able to capture some fantastic photos
very interesting. beautiful church with mosaic tile throughout-built as a memorial, services only recently on high holy days.
Text-book looking Russian Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral with lots of informative plaques, in English and surrounded by nice parkland and little cafe's etc
Amazing. This one is a must-see for everyone who visits St.Pete.

Nice architecture with interesting history!. Somehow, this church reminds us of the St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. This church may not be as popular as St. Basil's Cathedral but its history is not any less interesting.

What a spectacular view!. We arrived in St. Petersburg by cruise ship. This church was included as a photo stop on one of our day long tours. It is one of my favorite photo stops on our 2 day trip to Russia. Even in the rain, the church is very beautiful with its "onion" domes and breathtaking display of colorful mosaic tiles. My only regret is that our tour did not include an inside visit. Maybe next time!!!

Beautiful design. The church itself is beautiful and is probably one of the most prominent landmarks associated with Russia. However, the area can be crowded at times. I got pick-pocketed near here so please be extra careful and take care of your personal belongings.

Fascinating exterior, go inside if you like mosaics. This is a fascinating building, which you can obviously see for yourself from the outside. The interior is probably worth going into to see wall to wall lined with mosaics - pretty impressive, but if that doesn't float your boat, I wouldnt bother going inside.

not just another church!. This the church with the 'onion' style domes which stands out on the skyline of St Petersburg but the inside is equally wonderful. It is a breathtaking display of intricate mosacics .

Stunning and Unique. This is truly one of the most unique churches we have ever seen: it takes your breath away. See inside and out, and preferably not in the summer months, when hordes of tourists detract from the experience.

A true wonder, amazing. Almost didn't take the time to stand in line for a ticket & then changed my mind and am so very glad that I went inside this beautiful church. The church has a very touching story to why is was built & you will need to discover that yourself. (Mystery for you). Just doesn't seem possible that buildings that this were built & then you go inside and view the whole interior which is covered with mosaics. Each mosaic piece is about 1cm - amazing. It has been restored and a display is available showing the work involved. The building was even bombed - so tragic that that happened. But, this wonder is standing so bolding in St. Petersburg and open to the public. Left there with so much gratitude that I was able to visit such a precious site.
Beautiful. Whole of inside is mosaics, excellent craftmanship when you realise most has been redone since the second world war.
Got to go but.... This is a must see as it marks a dark incident in Russian history, but it is a bit of a dark place so for me, not one to hang around in.
Breathtaking. This building is unbelievablly beautiful inside and out. Make sure you take time to view the displays showing the restoration efforts, the before and after pictures.
Mosaic madness!. The work that has gone into this place is mind-boggling. A picture-perfect traditional Russian church that will not disappoint.
Prettsy place to stop for 10 minutes. As amazing on the inside as on the outside, it's worth paying the small entrance fee. Amazing icons, but doesn't take long to go round

Unique and a true gem!. Very special place and truly demonstrated the artistry of mosaic art. Try to go/ pass by during different parts of the day. The soft afternoon light on the exterior is truly captivating.

Must Visit. Instead of the usaul painted icons, these were al mosaic and will last and hold the colours for far longer.
Externally one of the best churches we saw in Russia.

Incredible!. You can't possibly visit this church and not spend time inside. Many cruise ship shore excursions include only a short stop with external view. I was on a private tour that included time inside which was amazing. The mosaics are exquisite. I would have been very disappointed if I had missed it.

Magnificent mosaics. My camera was not able to do justice to the magnificent, colorful, detailed mosaics inside the Church. Breathtaking. And the exterior of the Church is beautiful and colorful as well, situated next to a nice canal. Check it out!

But for the exterior.. The building itself is quite a magnificent piece of architecture and there are many superb features inside but it was very dark and needed a bit more lighting. However well worth the visit.

Favorite Church I've Seen!. It's easy to blur together all the hundreds of churches that we go into on our travels...however this one stands alone. It is definitely worth the entrance fee just to see the mosaics. They are truly breathtaking, and you will never see anything else like it, at least I haven't.
Beautiful inside and out. Beautiful church. For 250rubles u can go inside, you only see a small section but it is truly amazing to see
A work of art. The colourful spiral domes are an amazing site. Inside is all done in tiny tiles forming richly decorated mosaics. Well worth the entry fee...it was minimal.
Over-rated - very nice but more from the outside. While very photogenic and with beautiful external mosaics, the inside is not a must-see, IMHO, if lines are long.
Great Historic place. Nice to see especially with it's historical background.
a must see in st. Petersburg. another place to bring the camera, but please bring a guide as you may miss something

Stating the obvious - this is a must-see church in St. Petersburg. The Church contains over 7500 square metres of mosaics—according to its restorers, more than any other church in the world. This record may be surpassed by the Cathedral Basilica of St. Louis, which houses 7700 square meters of mosaics. Go to both. Breathtaking!
Curch of Spilled Blood. Exterior is from Disney World. Interior is spectacular. Wall paintings are actually mosaics. Unbelievable!
http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g298507-d300133-Reviews-Church_of_Our_Savior_on_Spilled_Blood-St_Petersburg. Beautiful mosaics, very central, special story, wonderful exterior also.
Beautiful. Beautiful inside and outside, a must see! mosaics are fantastic
One of the highlights of Russia. Beautiful domes and architecture. Not to be missed. The inside is very impressive also.
The must. You need to go inside, also nice souvenier shop-wooden dolls on nice price-not matryoskas, which you can hardly find in the rest of the city

Picture-Perfect Attraction. Good picture-perfect location inside and out! The exteriors of the church with its golden turrets provided good background. The inside with the gleaming icons everywhere makes you forget that you are actually in a church.
Interesting interiors. I am notthat much into churches but this one is a must. Nice market for souvenirs (you need to haggle for prices) around the church
MUST SEE IN ST PETERSBURG. You cannot go to St Petersburg and not see this church- so book ALLA tours like we did and see it on land AND from the water bu boat tour!!!

Absolutely Stunning!!!. It is definitely one of the most beautiful churches that I have ever seen! Each inch of the church is covered in mosaic and is very colourful. The Church contains over 7500 square meters of mosaics—according to its restorers, more than any other church in the world.This Church was built on the site where Tsar Alexander II was assassinated and was dedicated in his memory. You cannot visit St Petersburg and not go into this stunning church!
Beautiful!. While the interior of the church was closed when I visited, the amazing exterior still made the visit worthwhile.

We almost lost this gem!. It's amazing to think that they almost razed this place! It's an architectural wonder that you should not miss! The doors remind me a lot of the great doors in St. Peter's in Rome.

The Church not to be miss. No matter how long, just visit this fantastic church build on a drama, amazing tillings and history. Close to the Canal - then don't miss a boat tour to look around and to understand the meaning of an Imperial capital !
Great and beautiful churche. history, cultur, amazing place to not miss when in St Petersbourg - enjoy the ceramic, the art work of those master...
Beautiful. This cathedral is amazing, such beautiful architecture. It is well worth a visit, and there is a market at the front which was good for souveniers.

The moasics are excellent.. Stay and look at each moasic, look at the detail, tell the story to each other and absorb and soak in the intricate work in placing each tiny moasic to create such beautiful art of the life of Jesus Christ. This is a MUST see! and take your time and enjoy!

A Sight to See (Even if You Decide Not to Go Inside). We visited the Church of our Savior on Spilled Blood on our first day in St. Petersburg. We had about half a day to spend exploring the sights near our hotel (Holiday Inn in Moskovskiy), so we decided to see this first as it is located only 4 stops away if you use the metro. It is truly a sight to behold. We decided not to go inside anymore because there is quite a crowd and they charge an entrance fee. :)
Church on Spilt Blood. My view of Russia changed drastically! It was lovely and the Russian history is very intrigued.
Go inside. spend the extra and go inside, it is as amazing as the outside. We also got an audio tour which I recommend. Across the road is a great area to buy your souveniers.

Simply the BEST. This is my favourite site out of so many places. You will be first impressed by the exterior of the church - colourful tops! For the interior part of the church, it is amazingly beautiful with mosaic decoration everywhere - yes, it is literally EVERY places inside the church. They are colourful and shinny. As you may know, when you visit such a classic place, you must 'head up' to appreciate the ceilings. Do expect a lot of crowds, like other popular sites in the city.

Larger than St. Basil's and as Beautiful. We had a glimpse of her beautiful domes colored and with many designs along the River Cruise. We then went by bus to see it from the ground. It is truly larger than St. Basil's at the Red Square of Moscow and is as beautiful.
Beautiful. Well worth a stroll around. Walk through the little park next door as well, and smell the old stables over the road!
must see. Beautiful church, we were there in march and the river next to it was still frozen, very impressing to see.

The most attractive place in St Petersburg. Mum and I went on a Baltic cruuise and we spent 2 days in St P. We did a trip to the church and went inside it is incredible especially as it was only finished in the 20th Century. The tour guide was good but my earphones were picking up another guide ! We did a second tour the next day and saw it again in the sunshine even better still. This really is a must see and is very photogenic.
Loved it, well worth the visit. The architecture was unique. The church was gorgeous inside and outside. The church was quite ornate. Very historic as well.

only from the outside. We stayed near the church and so saw the beautiful exterior every day, but never went inside as we ran out of time. Also we were told by someone very familiar with St Petersburg that the interior was not a must-see - although I'm curious and would have liked to go in.

Breathtaking. This church is one of the very few structures that are in more 'traditional' Russian style in St. Petersburg as the city was modeled to be more like a European city by Peter the Great. One would be amaze just walking towards it on the street, and once you are in front of it, it's simple incredible. Make sure you have a zoom camera or a pair of binoculars so you can see the details high up around the onion domes. The interior will seem a bit smaller than expected but it's absolutely amazing nonetheless. The entire interior is covered in mosaic tiles depicting biblical stories, and by the end of the day your neck will hurt from looking up the entire time. But it's worth the pain. Try to go during the week to avoid big crowds.Another little thing I liked about the place was the small section that showed pictures of the restoration process from when the building was severely damaged by the wars. It's great to see pictures of people who painstakingly tried to restore the church's beauty and succeeded.
Another unique church. more icons than one can absorb just too much to explain...go visit.

Outstanding Church. It was the most spectacular church I have ever seen and is located in St Petersberg, Russia. It stands on the site where Alexander II was mortally wounded and red flowers are put on the memorial to mark the place his blood was spilt. The mosaics are something else and as you come towards the building you cannot fail to be in awe. The Russian people are really lucky to have such wonderful history and some of the buildings are exquisite. I would recommend anyone to visit the Church if staying in St Petersberg.
Beautiful mosaic tiles. Gorgeous from the inside and out. The altar where Alexander II was mortally wounded was particularly touching.
Crasy interior design. This was a facinating place the walls are covered in icons, it's pretty special and interesting history of the building, definately worth looking at and reading up on.

Incredible. We visisted the Church on Spilled Blood. It was truly an amazing experience. It is as beautiful inside as it is on the outside. Words hardly do it justice. Even the hordes of people did not take away from the awe inspiring beauty. We had a wonderful guide who did a wonderful job of explaining the history.

Incredible detailed mosiacs...... Alexander the II was assasignated on the spot where this church was built. Seeing the colourful steeples from afar creates excitement as we slowly approached the monument. Spectacular murial of Jesus and his disciples on the exterior, inside there is a shrine in the exact place where Alexander was assassinated, lined with precious stones. We were taken aback with the intricately detailed mosaics depicting biblical scenes. This church structure won a special place with us duringour visit to St Petersburg, I hope that it does the same for all.

Beautiful inside and out!. What a thrill! I saw it first when visiting the Hermitage and thought, "We have to get there soon!" Went inside-- stunning mosaics. Then I went on a river cruise and viewed it from there. Thrilling! And then at the end of the day (which came very very late) we saw the lights turned on for night. It remained a landmark to appreciate the rest of our time in St. Petersburg.

Breathtaking!. A church that has never Been usted as such. It Washington erected to marking the site where Tsar Alexander II was murdered as a shrine to him. It has totally been restored and the only way I can describe the interior is as if you were in the presence of all the saints that surround you when you are in the Church. The mosaics are intricate and exquisite as is the entire structure. Behind the church there is a nice market with various vendors offering everything from dolls to antique icons. A nice place to souvenir shop.
beautiful.. wonderful church with gardens next door. do not miss this.
History, not Religion. Not a church really. More of a location of historical significance. Beautiful architecture and mosaics. Souvenir stalls across the street, too!

Interesting history and architecture. Although the church is fairly new the architecture design was modeled after a much earlier period. Inside the church every wall is covered in amazing mosaics. We visited late afternoon and it was very busy.
Must see. Beautiful inside, worth seeing. Also visit market across the street.

A must see!. This church is not only beautiful outside - it is amazing inside. Floor to ceiling mosaics. A definitely don't-miss in St. Petersburg.
Great little restaurants around the church -and also many souvenir stands selling at fairly good prices.
beautiful. most beautiful building i have ever seen all turrets and gold on outside and the inside is made up of millions of mosiac pictures words connot describe a must see for anyone

Marvellous mosaics. The church may look colorful from the outside (and remind you of the Vasilij cathedral in Moscow). But wait until you step inside and face the mosaics covering all the walls and vaults inside. It is amazingly beautiful and definitely very different from most other churches. Some churchgoers might find the colors a bit too extravagant.

Awesome. I have been to St Mark's and have seen so many churches temples and mosques, but this place is the mother of all. Simply awesome, the best thing I saw in St Petersburg, I can not write enough about this church...

Most beautiful church in Russia. The combination of "art deco" flowers murals and traditional icons is not to be missed. The location, right on the canal, is breathtaking. If you are unfamiliar with Russian history and art, take a guided tour.
Mosic. Beautiful and amazing . Watch out for pickpockets. Busy
Beautiful view from outside.. A sacred place and one of the landmarks for St. Petersburg.
Beatiful. This church was built on the place the tsar Alexander II was killed. The church is beautiful inside and outside. Highly recommend to take an audio guide.
Impressive. The interior matches the majestic exterior. Get the audio guide and you'll enjoy the visit more

Outside of this church rivals St Basal in Moscow. My wife and I were in Moscow and visited Red Square and viewed St Basils Cathederal. I was in awe but when I first saw the Church of Our Savior I was stopped in my footstep. I cannot describe the beauty in this church, both inside and especially out. The square in which this church is located became our central focal point of the city and there are so many beautiful things in this city
Mosaic Church. The largest monument of Russian mosaic art. Mosaic covering an area of ​​nearly 7000 square meters. Temple restored to the place of death of the Emperor Alexander II.
Beautiful. Nice architecture, not inside (arrived too late, closes 5PM
Very nice. Worth a visit if you have time. Central location, and amazing mosaics. Definitely worth a visit if you are on town and have an hour to spare.
Beautiful building. Pretty spectacular building in a stunning location. Worth the visit and the entrance fee to see the mosaics lining pretty much everything.
Must see in St Petersburg. Looks like something out of a fairy tale. Very very beautiful

Dazzling. From the outside the church looks like a more approachable version of St Basil's, with more tasteful colours. Inside, it is a miracle of mosaic - every surface covered in jewel-like colours. My daughter used the audioguide and found it rather tedious. I just absorbed the pictures and the sheer wonder of it. Look up into the domes and see the pictures inside. If you come to St Petersburg you must see this.
Awesome structure. Beautiful church and if you're going to buy souvenirs, you're going to want to go to the booths located across the street from the church because you'll be able to hussle.

Big money, big Sight. It's pretty expensive, especially since you have to pay to see the inside and again for the collonade (walk around the cupola deck overseeing the city). I recommend doing the inside (museum), as it is most spledid and you could spend a lot of time looking at all the incredible details.

Must. Built on a place of Russia Emperor assassination is a top sight to visit. Foreigners pay more then Russian. They do check tickets on the entrance so if you want to sneak with ticket bought by friendly Russian make you don't dressed and behave as obvious stranger :-)

Go there and look at this treasure.. My first impression was `wow`, situated by a canal and hidden off the main street this impressive church is wonderful to look at. I didn`t go into the building but I would advise people to step inside to see what it has to offer.
Special. Beautiful mosaics and many of them. A bit crowded when we were there - but who complains when seeing this wonderful art?
Beautiful building. Amazing piece of architecture which will no doubt fill up a large section on your camera's memory card!

Astounding building. So garish it is wonderful. Unfortunately in each photo of some lovely sight in Petersburg–particularly noticeable in photos of this incredible church– the overhead wires seem to fill the sky.

2nd only to St-Basil's in Moscow. This church is an extraordinally structure, intricate and intensely appealing to the eye. You must circle it and observe all the details with a telephoto lens to appreciate it. The finest example of Slavic architechture following the example of St-Basils built in the 16th century on the edge of Red Square. A must see in St-Petersburg.
Mosaics galore. Fab Onion dome church. Interior covered with mosaics. Smaller than you would expect and the Mosaics are not as impressive as Revenna for example.
Another must see. From the outside it is impressive enough. But its real splendor is the interior you need to see it for yourself

The quintessential image of Russian architecture. Great onion domes! The outside is spectacular and it was cool that when I went by there were numerous couples in wedding garb. The municipal office to get married must be very nearby, as it seemed the couples got married by a justice of the peace then came to the church for photos!
Wow. Like so many other things we saw in Saint Petersburg this was built to impress!

Onion domed spectacular. Also see my Hermitage review. This onion domed spectacular had me walking around it to view all the different aspects.
Really special!
The mosaics are incredible!. The entire interior is done in mosaics. The exterior is beautiful but the history and architecture surpass in meaning.
Beautiful Church. Enjoyed the visit. The mosaics were beautiful. The outside was a bit crowded.
Amazing interior. The interior is exceptional and the history makes it very interesting. Well worth the 200 or so roubles to enter. Opens at 11.00 a.m. and closes on a Wednesday

Don't miss this beautiful church. This was part of the city tour of St. Petersburg with my group and probably the highlight for us. It rivals St. Basil's in Moscow and that says a lot. Absolutely beautiful and majestic.
Almost no words to describe this beautiful place. Just a must see if you are in St Petersburg ....never have seen any more unique architecture...almost could not stop looking at the church!!!!
Freaking Awesome!. Just awesome. Go inside too for a peculiar setting. Take many photos for the amazing outside and surroundings. Reminds me somehow of Gaudi! A must see
Nice building. Nice building attracting many tourist every season.

don't miss. While it doesn't seem right to have to pay to see a church, this amazing place should not be missed. Every surface of the interior is covered with amazing mosaics. I haven't ever seen a church like it.

Impressive but don't dedicate too much time to it. Very beautiful architecture and mosaics but I'd say our tour took too much time here - there are other things in St. Petersburg which have more variety on offer. A must-see while in Saint Petersburg but leave a 20-minute window for it just to stop by and move on
Mosiac Art. Unbelievable mosiac art inside and out. Such detail. You can't take it all in. Beautiful example of a Russian church.

Worth Seeing. It is hard to image the age and history of this Church. You have to see it to understand the beauty. Good idea to research it first so you really understand the depth and importance of what you are seeing
Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood. The mosaics were out of this world. The stories that our guide told us were fascinating.

Amazing mosaics. We liked that there were just enough to keep our interest. The craftsmanship was exemplary. No restrooms inside. Entrance just to right of the ticket booth - we walked left. Look to the ceiling - imagine having to work that high. Too bad we couldn't get closer to them.
Don't miss this!. Wonderfull church and mosaic works! Yet reasonable in size in this city with so much to see.

Beautiful shapes and colors. Although I did not visit the church, I had the possibility to admire it during the day and during the night. Its colors are brilliant and shapes unusual.
It is easy to reach and conveniently located.
Next to it there is a souvenir fair.. the only place where I found Russians speaking ENGLISH!
Beautiful!. The art, the paintings, the icons, the colours... a must see!

Not to be missed Cathedral - inside and out. This is a not to be missed cathedral where the inside is just as spectacular as the outside. The cathedral has recently been restored and is a delight to see. The entire inside of the cathedral is covered in the most amazing mosaics. The staff inside were very courteous – even though we had no common language, they were happy to take you by the elbow and point out a few things they thought you might be missing. This cathedral is on par with those in Western Europe.

One of top five st petersburg attraction. It was built on the site of Czar Alexandre II was murdered A masterpiece of Russian typical architeture. During the soviet time it was used as a storage facility for vegetables, corpses during world war two, etc. It was restored after this time.
Definitly a highlight. This was probably my favourite museum, a gem, colourful, great history beautiful inside and out

Unique and worth the visit. The exterior and interior are unique and so something many Westerns will see, the mosaic work was beautiful. The major shame is slot of the floor is covered. Few English signs also limit an appreciationmof the site. The queues to get in can be long and be prepared tompay three times as much asmlocals to get in. The signs are pretty clear non citizens pay a premium, but this is standard for all exhibits in the city
Fabulous photos here. Superb photos - lovely restored cathedral - worth a half day out of your holiday
Amazing. This church is beautiful. Without a doubt, one of the icons of St. Petersburg.
Grand Mosaics. Mosaics such as the haunting images of Christ make one realize that this was created as the film of centuries past. Incredibly moving.
Breathtaking!. Centrally located, and a just beautiful example of Russian Historicism art - even if you have no idea what that is, you will enjoy it!
Beautiful church. It is a beautiful church, you should definitley go in and see it.
timeless art. I was lucky to stay around the corner from this amazing church. It is truly a work of art outside and in.
One of the symbols of SPb. If you lucky to get a knowledgeable guide you will hear an interesting and dramatic sometimes story about this place.

Spectacular. Im not sure if its to my taste but this Church is very impressive, so much decoration covering every inch. But maybe don't bother with the audio guide unless you have a lot of time to spare, lots of details, we gave up half way though. Just enjoy the sights in silence.
Amazing. What a strange that Russian wanted to destroy this art but then suddenly a war appear and they cancel destroy. The war care the building. It is exactly magical like alive.
kitsch and spilled blood. Copy of Byzantine church mosaics. I found it quite offensive.
Incredible. What an incredible building. It is an absolutely must see. It is very central and easy to find.
Beautiful. Truly beautiful inside, surprised by the ATM machine inside the church!
Breathtaking. The architecture was amazing and inside was a true sight to behold. The whole interior is decorated in mosaic and is beautiful.
Not to be missed.. I personally don't really care for the insides of castles and churches and the like, but this one is definitely worth going inside.

A western religious feature in eastern colors!. This church is great. I never forget how I felt when I found it at the end of a canal. I love its colorful domes. It seems that Russian love color. You can find a huge collection of colors inside the church. Its architect decorated inside walls with small part of mosaic. The best thing is that it is located very close to the Nevsky Prospekt metro station. If U want to visit the inside U should know they don’t let U in on Wednesday.

Breathtaking. Having visited Moscow not long ago and been around St Basils I wondered how the Church of our Savior would compare. In a word- breathtakingly. Church of our Savior is situated on the canal which makes it more impressive and the interior is just as impressive as the exterior- a 'must visit' 'attraction' in St Petersburg.

What I imagined Russia to look like. An amazing building, the colours are so vivid. There is not many buildings that look like this in St Petersburg, apparently most are in Moscow. There are some markets across the road to buy souvenirs, but watch for pickpockets.
Beautiful!. This church is your archetypical Russian Orthodox church and follows you wherever you are on that side of the city. Again, its restoration is remarkable
Perfect. Great church, and the magnificent mosaics, a must see
Amazing mosaics. Again not much explanations given anywhere if you are an independant traveller

Spectacular. Uniqueness, Awestruck are just 2 words when you first see this amazing Church. It now operates as a museum for tourism, but this takes nothing away from what you will experience both externally and internally. The highlights are the location just a short stroll of the of the main street. This adds to the experience as you approach the church to appreciate the workmanship in its architecture. Upon entering (a little cumbersome as we had to put on little plastic booties to protect the carpet due to the winter) the detail and respect to the images are sensational with smaller mosaic pieces constructing murals like nothing I have seen ever. Breathtaking.

amazing cathedral. Inside is all mosaics. No paintings just mosaics including the roof. Its incredible and definitely worth every penny you have to pay to go inside. We found St. Basils in Moscow a little underwhelming inside but this was amazing.
Have to see it. Very beautiful church you must see it, it is not only grand from the outside, the inside is exquisite with the mosaic interior walls and ceilings.
Unbelivable Church. WOW this church will blow your mind the uilding is unlike anything else in the world

Spectacular craftsmanship.. This restored church is a marvel of modern craftmanship, with superb mosaics both inside and out. We couldn't stop our feet taking us past in all lights day and night revealing something new each time.
Wonderful by day or night. Picture postcard church both inside & out.. Read the translations around the church. The mosaics are amazing, stunning and colourful
Unbelievable. So beautiful, difficult to put in to words. Don't miss it.

Gorgeous onion-domed cathedral with equally gorgeous interior.. This beautiful cathedral (fully restored in 1997 after 30 years of work) was built on the spot where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in March 1881. Both the interior and exterior of the cathedral is decorated with incredibly detailed mosaics, designed and created by the most prominent Russian artists of the day. It is located on the Naberezhnaia Kanala Griboedova.
Allmost too perfect. Its a beautiful church,but again it is a huge restoration project that you see today. It is small compared to most attractions but is almost perfect.
A must-see. We had entrance to the church added to our tour. The mosaics are breath-taking, and the place was the site of so much tragic history.

Beautiful Building. This beautiful building may not be the oldest building in St Petersburg, but it's definitely unique and showcases Russian tradition. The colors and geometry of the building's decoration are beautiful when viewed up close, and the mosaics on the inside are very impressive. Avoid the tour groups and crowds by renting an audio guide from the kiosk. This will let you wander through the building at your own pace and learn more about its history.

Farytale-like church with amazing decorations inside. I cannot decide whether this church is more amazing from outside or inside... it is probably shocking in any way you want to look at it. Definitely the best church I have seen so far.
Impressive. A wonderful example of the dedication of artists to the mosaic form.

Stunning.. Stunningly beautiful. The outside is pure Russian fairytale with its crazy onion domes and gingerbread house detailing, but nothing prepares you for the inside - every surface is rendered in vibrant mosaics that reflect the light from the candles and chandeliers. It's dazzling. An absolute priority for any trip to St Petersburg.
Must see in St Petersburg. Amazing Church inside and out. Completely decorated with mosaics inside.
Great Photos. An excellent photo opportunity and must see for St. Petersburg.

As jaw droppingly gorgeous on the inside. We visited the Church of our Savior as part of a tour organized by Princess Cruises. The visit came on the second day of a two day tour, and after being overwhelmed by the Hermitage and the other gorgeous architecture of St. Petersburg, I was honestly a bit overwhelmed when we finally stepped off of the tour bus. The exterior of the church has to be one of the most photographed buildings in the world, so I won't dwell on it, but the interior is every bit as magnificent as the exterior, soaring high above the crowds (The place is packed) and completely covered with some of the most amazing paintings, frescoes, and architecture I've ever been privileged to lay eyes on. There is so much to see that you could spend several hours and still not see it all, and the sheer quantity of beautiful artwork is just astonishing. Be sure not to miss a visit if you are in St. Petersburg.
Cathedral of the Spilled Blood. Unfortunately I did not go inside this church, but from the outside it looked magnificant.
Well worth a visit. Expensive entry fee but well worth a visit. Wonderful frescoes all over the wall.
Do not miss it!. You can indeed take photos inside. Bring your camera. It is opulent!

Historical importance and must be seen. The importance of this church, built on the site of the assassination of the Tsar in the late 19th century, and signficance to Russia cannot be understated. This is a must-see on any trip to St Petersburg.

The most outstanding landmark in St. Pete. Noticeably, it is only one place in the center of St. Petersburgs that still presents the Soviet architecture. So it makes this place to be the most outstanding among tourist sites in the center.

Right up there with Sagrada Familia in Barcelona. Both the inside and outside of this church are beautiful. The interior walls are covered with mosaic pictures. Absolutely stunning. The floors are just as beautiful but are protected by an ugly carpet.I am not very happy going to chuches or cathedrals but I have to say both Church Spilled Blood and Sagrada Familia are 2 of the most beautiful places I have visited in the world.
very ipressive. beautiful, full of mosaics. Actually, nothing else inside, but it is so colourfull and unusual
A great wonder!. Really beautiful and so full of history also make for great photo opportunity
Posh and moving. Perfect example of russian 19th century art. It is very moving to see the actual place of Tzar's assacination.
Absolutely beautiful!. Real treasure of the city - marvelous church, wonderful cupolas. This is something breath taking, which definitely requires more than mandatory 5 MUST see object minutes .
beautiful, inside and out. iconic; absolute must photo opportunity. we paid 250 roubles to go in and I thought it was worth it- huge mosaics on the walls, very colourful.

One of the best!. This beautiful church with it's dramatic history is definitely one of the most beautiful churches in the world! Just take your time to walk around and then go in and listen that sad and great story about it, you will be in love with this place

if you haven't seen it, you haven't been in St. Pete. It is city's most beautiful church with mosaics outside and inside, very beautiful. Don't miss the flea-market next to the entrance (not exit) of the church
Saint Pertersburg simbol. It's amazing, the colours, the paintings, the structure. Personally, for me is more beatiful than Saint Basil in Moscow
Interesting. Great Mosaics and a great deal of History, does not require too much time, but should be seen, opens up the perspective of the Orthodox faith.

Beautiful onion spires shining in the sun. One of the most spectacular sights I have ever seen on my travels, I couldn't stop staring at the magical spires. Unfortunately did not have time to go inside.

Superb & Unique. The Church is just off Nevsky Prospect next to one of the canals. Was approximatelly £5 each which did seem relativelly expensive though as the money is going towards ongoing renovation - maybe not so expensive. The exterior is awe-inspirring a cacophony of colour which changes depending on the light. Inside the mosaics are stunning as is the huge amount of marble used for various reasons.
Feom the outside. We did not have the time to go inside but it s location makes it viewable from the main street. It has great colors and shapes ( very good lighting at nigght)

Loved the mosaics inside. It was interesting to see such an iconic Russian church up close and even more incredible to see the beautiful mosaics inside (despite the fact that they have been extensively restored). This was probably my favourite church in Russia because of the detailed mosaics across every inch of wall and ceiling.

A masterpiece. This chuch is almost comes out from a story book. The domes are like made of candy, very colorful. Outer face is full wuth icons and shiny geometric shapes. Golden touches give a feeling of piece of jewelry. Amazing building. Don`t skip during your visit.

Yet Another Must-See!. Incredibly gorgeous inside and out! The icons, iconostasis, dome paintings, etc. were amazing. Don't miss the shrapnel gouged palcque on the exterior and think about how awfully the city and people suffered during the Nazi siege! Over a million starved! Pray for their souls if you are a religious person!
Beautiful Church. Amazing mosaics, especially considering the condition of the church after World War II. Excellent prices in the bazaars next to the church.
It's a little bit too much!. So much color and different kind of decoration, all the mosaics: too much for your eyes! But then, also something you MUST see!
Beautiful cathedral with colourful domed spires. A take on St Basil's in Moscow, this place is worth a visit. The history is also interesting.
Magnificent!. Beautiful building! No longer used for services, but you can gain entry to look at the inside, but a bit pricey compared to other attractions in the city.

A unique place to be visited in St.Pete by all. I didn't know anythign about this church before my visit to St.Petersburg. The last time I was in the city, it was not still reconstructed. For a price of a ticket - 250 rubles - we had an interesting excursion with a guide as well. It was in Russian though.
Stunning!!. The inside is beautiful but I think the exterior may just be better.
Church & then some!. beautifully presevered church, fantatic interior which is quite breathtaking in its beauty.

unforgettable. In a city laden with immense and immensely impressive sacred structures, this church stands out as the one "must-see" church in St. Petersburg. Readily visible and accessible from Nevsky Prospekt (the main street), the church is a visual glory both outside and inside. Tour groups clog some spaces within, but they clear out after a bit of description from the guides and allow unobstructed views of mosaics, paintings, sculptures and architectural details. As photos are allowed everywhere, expect to fill your card with memories of this place, still a functioning house of worship where you might be privileged to catch a performance by one of the many area vocal ensembles specializing in Russian Orthodox liturgical music.

Worth seeing. If you have seen St Basil's Cathedral in Moscow then this will seem like a smaller and duller version of it. However, it is very charming and definitely worth seeing and taking a few pictures. There is a garden next to it which is quite lush and pleasant. You may notice some bullet dents on parts of its walls so there is some violent history there.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful Russian Orthodox church with amazing frescoes and paintings adorning the walls. Audio headsets in various languages available which gave a very thorough overview of the church and how it was built and decorated. Worth a visit.
Church of our saviour of spilled blood. Again an absolute must see colours and history of the church I found fascinating

Ornate and stunning. As you turn off Nevsky Prospect you will be stunned by the beautiful ornate Church of our Saviour on Spilled blood. The church was build to commerate where tsar Alexander II was shot. If you walk around the building you will see plagues noting all the great things he did during his reign. V. Educational and pretty!
a fascinating labor. are timeless, but I do not see what the inside of the architecture was great, even outside
Amazing mosaics. We've seen a lot of churches during our time in Russia, but the Spilled Blood is amazing not only outside but inside as well. Definitely worth going into!
Historic. the historical significance and the Russian architecture make it a must see in St.Petersburg. The trip is incomplete without it !!
Awsome Architecture. More stunning than St Basil's in Moscow. The mosaic pictures on the walls are breath taking. Very close to the Grand Nevsky Hotel
Totally over the top. Extraordinary decoration on both the exterior and interior. Don't just look at the outside.
A must. This must be included as part of the "Royal sites to see"
Don't miss this. Fabulous mosaics; one of the most beautiful churches after 13 days of touring. also, there were good tourist booths near the church
Architecteral and iconic beauty. The harmony of iconic paintings and the interior gold ornaments were expressing beauty, welth and comfort.
iconic but over over rated. The gaudy domes are in a naif style which a child might have concieved - that part I like. But the interior is rather unimaginative

Can you say "over the top?". While crowded, it is worth the line to get in. Stunning, artistic, no purpose other than to say "this man died here." No services, never any use, just a memorial. Now that's a memorial.

Colorful tiles that shine forever. This is 5 stars as churches go. The tile work is absolutely incredible and what a break from those deary Gothic churhes.
It is beautiful outside and even more spectacular inside. There are lots of bible stories made from the tiles. There is also lots of colorful marble including the floors.

A Church that is different from all the churches you have seen before. We liked and the visit was well justified. The architecture was quite different from all the churches we had previously seen as well as the interior decoration.

Blood Church is beautiful. Take photos, but don't stay too long.. The tour is pretty useless. It's impressive to see, to be sure. But don't worry about taking the tour and no need to schedule an entire afternoon. It can be seen and appreciated in about an hour.

Wow!. It's amazing how all the colors on the outside can look so fabulous, and not garish, despite being .....wow. Not a working church. Site of a tzar's murder. Inside interesting too, but it's the exterior that gives this place its claim to fame.

This church is amazing!. This site is unbelievable, not only from the inside and outside, but also from the history of it. The ticket also gets you into the Sate Museum, which is situated in a park right across the street from the church. The Spilled Blood church's interior is breathtaking from the floors to the ceiling. Once in there, look at all corners of the church, from floor to ceiling and you will find so many things to admire! Also, the views of the church are gorgeous during the day and at night! It is a must see place right off of Nevisky Prospect.
Stunning!. We visited this several times - by day, by night & in the rain!! It never failed to please. If going at night wait until after 7:15pm for it to be illuminated for the best impression.
Thought Provoking. The reasons for the building of this Church are food for thought but the outcome is a monument to delight future generations.
Beautiful cathedral. The inside mosaics are amazing and quite different from many onther cathedrals you will see in Russia. Try to see it lit at night if you can!
Amazing. I had only time to view the Chruch from the outside as I had to catch my flight home. It's an amazing site.

Most beautiful church visited. Went there in early Oct. After visiting many famous churches in Moscow, St. P, Novgorod... I found this is the most beautiful church in Russia in both its exterior and interior. If you will visit only one church in Russia, this is the choice.

Amazing Place. This over-the-top church was built by family and friends of Tzar Alexander II on the spot where he was assassinated. No expense was spared and no inch of the building either inside or out was left undecorated. It's interesting to note that this extraordinarily expensive building was erected at a time when people all over Russia were barely surviving. It shows how out of touch the tzars and ruling class were to create such a lavish, no matter how worthy Alexander II was.
A Fairy Tale Church. The exterior of this church is like something a child would draw. The colors and shapes are breath-taking. I was rushing so I didn't have time to see the interior.

overall the most beautiful orthodox church in the world. Both the exterior,a masterpiece of beauty and diversity in Russian-style churches,and the interior,a masterpiece of Byzantine-style mosaic, make the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood the most beautiful Orthodox church in the world. I visited,in Moscow, both St Basil's cathedral,with a less refined but comparable exterior and a clearly much less beautiful interior,and the cathedral of Christ the Savior,which has a stunning interior but a clearly less beautiful exterior - and I can say that the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood is overall the most beautiful Orthodox cathedral / church in the world. The breathtaking exterior suggests perfection (in Russian-style churches),while the interior is a stunning combination of partially gilded mosaics,marble iconostasis andsemiprecious stones (Rodonit,jasper etc) chapels. Therefore,the overall impressionis of stunning masterpiece. After visiting this church,both outside as well as inside,you feel overwhelmed by beauty and luxury. Very impressing the specially marked placeof the assassination of Czar Alexander II,with fragment of the original pavement,within a kind of jasper and Rodonit chapel.

A beautiful traditional Russian church. When Westerners have a vision of a Russian city skyline, it will include this grand building. Not really a church but rather a large monument to the assassinated Tsar Alexander II, its roof-line is full of ornate glittering gold and multi-coloured domes and spires. A must, even if you've just got 10 minutes to spare. (I can't comment on the interior).

Gorgeous!. There are a lot of churches in Russia! This one is perhaps one of the most beautiful. We would suggest hand picking the ones you visit as guides can often wnat to show you LOTS. This one should be at the top of the list as it is very beautiful.

So Beautiful! Don't Miss!. This is so magnificient and different from so many cathederals. What on first impression would appear to be paintings are in fact mosaics...the work and beauty is just incredible. I put this as one of the top 3 things I saw in St. Petersburg.

Absolutely mindblowing. This church is just absolutely mindblowing-ly stunning. Instead of paint, the Russian artists used mosaics to construct the onion domes with the effect of 3D decoration on top of decoration. We didn't go in as we had 15 minutes to take pictures but its just amazing. Definitely highly recommend it. And you can see it from almost any point in the city; Peter the Great had the city built so that there were very few skyscrapers so this church easily dominates the background.
Well worth visit. Beautiful restoration. Great market nearby for souvenirs. Closed on Wednesday.

Superb Restoration. On my last visit to St Pete in 1980, this building was in a sorry state but has since been superbly restored. On the day of my visit, it was not open to the public, but the views from the nearby Moika Canal and the Mayelosky Gardens were were sitting and looking for a good while.

Exotic Outside, Kitsch Inside. The church towers on the outside look quite attractive and exotic. The inside is very elaborate but also so garish that it is hard not to cringe. One cannot argue about taste, but I would not go again.
Impressive colouring. Outside it's really impressive and is a magnet to the eye. Inside I was less impressed and got the feeling it was being over tourist-exploited.

Uncomparable. Truly stunning and amazing, not comparable to anything I've ever seen before. I just wanted to note that it is possible to buy a guidebook at the souvenir counter for only 10 rubels. This is really cheap, since you get a nicely transated English little book with pictures and helpful information. The information helps you to identify the subjects of the mosaics, very helpful to figure out where they are actually about. Knowing what mosaics you see makes the experience all the more worthwile.
Beautiful - Mosaic work is awesome. A very beautiful church. Not to be missed. The mosaic work on the inside makes it very different from the others.

Amazing Inside and Outside - stunning mosaics. A must for anyone visiting St Petersburg. Do the audio guide to get the best from this attraction, it;s worth the £2 extra. Stunning mosaics decorate the interior and there are even pictures inside the onion domes. Well worth a visit!

Go if you have time; Or else, take a picture of its beautiful outer appearance. This church has a very beautiful outer appearance : ) I actually saw another more beautiful onion church close to Peterhof but I can't remember what it's called. We paid more expensive tickets to go in at late evening during white night but its inside interior isn't much impressive compare to other cathedrals and churches in St Petersburg. I've seen better such as Kazan Cathedral. Besides, there is a souvenir market nearby but recommend you to buy Russian dolls at Moscow instead. I found same one but cheaper price in Moscow >"<

Very Typical Russian! A Must-See in St.Petersburg.. The architecture of the cathedral is very typical Russian and Orthodox. The colors and the mosaics on it, the onion shaped domes are amazing. You go around it and take a look at it from different aspects, and you just can't take your eyes off of it :)It takes its name from a historical event where the Czar is assassinated (or tried to be.. don't exactly remember). The park just across the cathedral is also a nice place to spend some time to relax with greenery.As a summary, the cathedral is a must-see in the city.

The most amazing site. We were lucky enough to spend 4 days in St Petersburg in June this year visiting a friend of my husband. We would highly recommend it. It is a totally facinating city.One of the highlights was this Church. The colours are so beautiful especially on a lovely sunny day. Spend some time inside just looking up, you cannot imagine how hard people worked to achieve something so beautiful.

My Favorite Stop in St. Petersburg. Another St. Petersburg icon even though it's a knockoff of Saint Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. It's a traditional Russian Orthodox church with onion domes done in crazy colors and patterns like it was tricked out by a Disney imagineer. This church was exquisite both inside and out. I was especially impressed with the renovations, which were masterfully done. This place has been spiffed up and perhaps has never looked better. The mosaics were beautiful, but I was even more impressed with the carvings of marble and other precious rocks, some of which were so well-done that I nearly cried. When you’re inside, look all the way up the domes for a friendly surprise. This place is worth the extra investment of an audio tour or a guided tour.

One of my favorite sites in Russia. Awesome. Go...and be sure to go INSIDE! Better interior than most cathedrals in the world - tops St. Mark's in Venice, tops St. Basil's in Moscow for sure, more ornate and beautiful than the Hermitage. Gotta do it.

Just imagine the time it took.... You can't miss the colorful onion domes and ornate facade of the church - they stand out in a sea of Style Moderne and classical buildings like a Faberge egg, a colorful jewel-box (try the view from the Field of Mars for a slightly different approach).Inside, every surface is covered in tiny colored tiles, millions of them, in mosaics of biblical figures and stories. At first glance, if I hadn't known that they were mosaics, I would have said they were paintings, they were that detailed. The work is beautiful. These are not the clunky mosaics that I'm used to seeing, blocky and brightly-colored, these are subtle and finely-detailed and crafted so carefully they are dazzling.Also fascinating is the history of the church (which is not an ancient one) and the restoration work on the exterior and interior after WWII -- some of the "before" pictures are ghastly, and looking around at the gorgeous colors and images today, it's hard to imagine the work that went into restoring the mosaics to what we see now. That's one of the things I had to keep reminding myself of, in many of the buildings in St. Petersburg, is that what we see now is relatively recent -- the rebuilding efforts in some of these buildings to repair the damage done 70 years ago is almost unimaginable. Make sure to stop outside and look at the beautiful wrought-iron railings around the church. A guide is not required in the church, although you might want one just to hear a bit about the history of the building itself, and frankly, it's hard to avoid the loud drone of tour guides in various languages as they lead their little herd of tourists around the interior of the church. Just tag along on one of those, if you want some help deciphering things. Otherwise, stick to the edges of the church to get the best view of the walls and ceiling and avoid getting trampled!Absolutely recommended--I can't think of any place that compares.

Even more beautiful inside. From the outside the church is so beautiful and ornate I didn't think the inside could be anymore amazing, but dang was I wrong. People complain about the cost (about $10), but once I set foot inside this church it was worth every penny and more. The amount of detail in the mosaics that cover nearly every part of this churches inside are truly breath-taking. It's hard to put into words the artistic achievement of this church, and it's certainly the most gorgeous I've ever seen. A large section of the floor is roped off and that's where the Russian Czar Alexander II was assassinated and to the side is a gated shrine constructed from carved marble in his honor. There's also a display of sad, but interesting pictures showing the damage inflicted upon the church during WWII. Between the amazing mosaics telling/showing the story of Jesus Christ, to the historical importance of this church its bewildering that the communist wanted to destroy it, but I'm glad they didn't cause now its a work of art and significance that all should marval at, at least once. The tour groups/crowds can get a little overwhelming inside, so its strongly recommended that you avoid the busy times. Go early or late, but no later then 6 pm, cause it closes at 7 pm. This is a place you really want to take in, without the noise and confusion of large crowds that also make it hard to maneuver around inside. Also, they might charge you more if you want to video or take detailed pictures, so keep that equipment hidden unless you don't mind the extra cost.

Most Amazing Inside and Out!. Having traveled a lot and see many forms of architecture. Nothing could prepare me for this amazing building. Loved the outside and the interior took my breath away. I think this is the most beautiful building I have ever seen. People complain about tourists. That must have to do with the time of year. There wasn't even a queue for us to join, we bought our ticket and when straight in.Make sure you don't miss it!

Beautiful Structure with Histoical Past of Czar. We got to spend a short time at this site as it was a stop on two tours. The structure is beautiful on a sunny day but it's name/past is from one of the more popular Czars in Russia's history...one can only wonder how Russia's next 100 years would have been if he had lived.In any case. The church is surrounded by souvenir stands but taking pictures is tricky as the street in front of the church is very busy with buses and other traffic.

Beautiful... certainly, but far too many tourists. Something I think many of us picture in our minds when we think of Russia is the ornately decorated churches, the brilliantly coloured domes and huge bell towers. The Church on spilled blood is no exception and the detail of the many millions of mosaic squares that cover the walls and ceiling are nothing short of breath-taking. But after travelling the country and visiting many churches and monasteries, a place where believers come to worship and pray, I couldn't help but feel like this sacred building was being violated by the hundreds of tourists at a time swarming in wearing shorts and thongs and flashing their cameras like paparatzi while tour guides waved their paddles with numbers- signalling their groups to move on the the next section of the church. I found I couldn't stay for very long... but still worth seeing.

Wonderful.... I don't like to reflect on other's comments (each to their own, and all that) but to suggest that $10 to spend time in this church is "over priced" (as others have done), perhaps suggests you shouldn't leave home. Suffice to say, I my humble opinion, worth every cent, and one of several highlights of St PB - a "don't miss" experience in a terrific city.

Amazing. Just awe inspiring, what else can I say. You have to come see this church both in the daylight and at night. The whole church lights up beautifully. The souviner stands out front are reasonably priced and they are willing to make a deal. Watch out for the Catherine and Peter actors who seem to be everywhere. They may try to suck you in to a series of pictures strating with a simple, "100 rubles for one photo", which becomes 500 rubles for five photos....let the buyer beware.

A must see while in St. Petersburg. While we were in St. Petersburg for two days we took a tour that included this beautiful Russian Church, The Cathedral on Spilled Blood. It is just overwhelmingly beautiful. The artisan's workmanship with mosaics I haven't seen anything like it. The history of why, when, and where it was built just adds more to it its Russian history. Unfortunately two days wasn't enough time to see all this city has to offer, but this I am so glad we were able to have seen.

DO NOT MISS - AMAZING!. If you visit St Petersburg, you MUST see the Church of Our Saviour on Spilled Blood. The mosaics are beautiful and breathtaking. Although it might not look it from the outside, this church definitely rivals its cousin, St Basil's in Moscow, on the inside. Of all the dozen or so churches I saw in Europe, this was the best!
spectacular mosaics - do not miss. Add my vote to those of others who found the mosaics breathtaking.

The inside rivals any ornate or mosaic cathedral. I didn't expect to be so impressed with the inside of the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood. The outdoor location is quite photogenic and impressive, the inside atmosphere is just a delight. The colors are so blight, full and rich. We just loved it, definitely a Top 5 in St. Petersburg.

'Priceless' - Do Not Miss...Would you go to Rome and not see St. Peters? China and not see the Wall?. Yes, they charge to go into this treasure...but there is rarely long lines. It isn't as exhausting as the Hermitage, just non-stop beauty. My daughter actually spent little more than 5 minutes...so she could shop across the street...but she got many excellent pictures so she may have more memories than me. (And more trinkets to take home!)Make sure you see this, as often as you can.

A must see in St Petersburg. This ornate church is definitely a must see in St Petersburg. It is fairly young – its construction was completed in 1907, but its design imitates the style of 16th-century Russian churches. The church was built right on the spot where Tsar Alexander II had been assassinated in 1881, and there is the canopy inside the church put up over the pavement on which his royal blood was spilled.Inside, the church looks as stunning as it does outside: Its walls and columns are faced with semi-precious stones and mosaics sketched by renowned 19th-century Russian artists – the total size of the mosaics is 7,000 square meters! The floor and the main iconostasis are made of different-colored Italian marble. As you move around the church, look at the mosaics on the walls which feature different legends from the New Testament, and make sure you don’t miss the two mosaic icons decorating the two side iconostases, the icon of St Alexander (Alexander II’s patron saint) and the temple icon of Resurrection – these are real masterpieces.The church is opened from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. in summer. You can buy entrance tickets inside (the booking office outside is for Russian residents), and will receive a short description of the church in your desired language together with your ticket. The tickets are quite expensive – 320 rubles (about USD 11) but it is still worth a visit. You can also hire an audio guide.The church is not big (it used to be a royal church in old days), and tends to get extremely crowded with groups of visitors towards the middle of the day, so you will enjoy your visit more if you get there in the morning or towards the end of the day (the booking office closes at 6:00 but the church itself closes at 7:00).

Amazing on both the outside and inside. Visited as part of an excursion whilst on a Baltic Cruise - it is interesting in that this is one of the few 'Russian' buildings in what is a very European city. Thought it was so attractive on the outside, but my jaw did actually drop when I saw the breath taking mosaics on the inside. Interesting also to learn about the history of the building during the Soviet period. A must see on any trip to this fascinating city.

Fantastic, contrary to earlier reviews - cost doesn't come into it !. Just completed a trip/cruise including Moscow & St.Petersburg, some fabulous building in both cities - but the Church of the Resurection (crrect name) is fantastic on the outside and fabuolous on the inside - although it is by European standards quite modern, (Obviously to US citizens it will be 'ancient') it is well organised for tourism, central in the city, pleasant outdoor bars/cafes outside towards Nevsky Prospekt and a reasonable collection of 'touristy' souvenir stalls in a small market on the other side. It currenty costs about £8 to go in, cheaper than most English cathedrals etc and certainly more impressive. Closed Wednesdays so it seems.
Overpriced. We see no reason to pay almost as much (over $10) to see this Church which takes about half and hour as we did for the Hermitage which takes a day and then some.
Do NOT Miss This Site. This should be ranked #1. Truly amazing history, art, architecture. Beautiful and spectacular. Pictures cannot capture it adequately!

Breathtaking!. The Church on Spilled Blood is truly amazing!! This is a MUST SEE in St. Petersburg!! The exterior of the church is beautiful and the interior mosaics are stunning! If you are on a tight budget then walk around the exterior, however if you are able to spring it pay the $$ to go inside. The mosaics are really fantastic! You are allowed to take photos inside but without a flash.There is also a great little market full of treasurers across the street from the entrance to the Church.

Wonderful mosaics. This rather "new" cathedral (just above 100 years) is really a museum today, with only occasionally religious services related to the purpose of the church - the death of Tsar Alexander II. The church is totally covered, from rooftop to the floor, in wonderful mosaics. You can see everything in 45 min easily, but in the same time, if you want to look deeper into the works - you probably would need to stay for days. There is different entrance fees for Russian citizens and foreigners. You are allowed to take pictures as long as you don't use flash and/or tripod. In the entrance fee there is a 35 min guided tour included - but only in Russian! There is audio guides to rent for an additional fee. A small souvenir shop is also inside the church/museum.

Wow - amazing mosaics. I agree with all the other reveiwers this church is really worth a visit - it is as impressive inside with it's fabulous mosaics as it is outside with its lovely coloured onion domes.The correct ttile is the Cathedral of the Resurrection although it is known locally as The Chruch of Our Saviour on the Spilled Blood. This name refers, as other revewers say, to the fact that it was built on the spot where Alexander III was mortally wounded in 1881. The Bell tower was built to protrude out over the canal and marks the spot where Allexander II was murdered.Although the church was practically destroyed in the 1930's it has been restored magnificantily and is well worth a visit.

Stunning and a must-see. This is one of those places that you see in photos, and yet no photo can capture the "WOW" factor when you see it. It's only about 100+ years old, and yet it has that permanence and stately quality that makes it feel like it's been around for a long time. The fact that it commemorates the assassination of Alexander II in 1881 is recalled by the name of the church (Church built on Spilled Blood), and by the shrine inside which marks the spot where the second bomb exploded, mortally wounding the tsar. But it is also the Church of the Risen Christ, which explains the exuberence that you feel inside the church, with its vivid (slightly over-the-top) mosaics and icons. Even the floor under the center dome (set off by a cordon) is vivid and colorful. During July 2009, when I was there, it was crowded, but you can still enjoy the church's many delights and its historical connections. Do see it, along with the Cathedral of Peter and Paul and Saint Isaac's Cathedral, among so many other memorable churches in Saint Petersburg.

Even Better on the Inside. I imagine a lot of people walking along Nvskiy Prospekt stop and look at this breathtaking church, perched along the banks of a canal and think that it is quite something. But only if you go inside will you appreciate what a true masterpiece it is. Easily the best church in St. Petersburg in my opinion. The mosaics are fabulous.

Amazing mosaics!. This church is really beautiful. On the outside it looks amazing enough, but inside it is beautiful It is covered with mosaics! Although no longer a practicing church it is really worth the visit to take in the amazing work that craftsmen have done on this church. The colours are bright and cheerful. The whole place is quite dazzling. It was really a fantastic thing to see.

Wow. Our visit to Russia would not have been complete without a visit to a mosaic-filled, onion-domed church. And this was a splendid example. Inside every square inch was filled with brightly colored mosiac tiles and paintings. Outside the multi-colored onion-domed towers soared upward. A truly breathtaking building. A must see in St. Petersburg.

Breathtaking. This church is absolutely breathtaking, both inside and out..........Oh, how I wish I had the knowhow to post some of my photos.......They are some of the best taken in St. Petersburg............Do not miss this!
